TG0F7gV5952RXNnd1dt4PA.text: Another trip to vegas...another stop at oyster bar..another satisfied customer...  We had visited vegas during this past labor day and decided to try oyster bar during dinner instead of lunch like we did last time.. i thought to myself..its monday..its 8:45pm..there's no way there'd be a line right now...and as we walked through the casino..i saw the line of people waiting..good thing we ate a late lunch..there were about 10 people ahead of us at that time..we were seated in about an hour..but didnt actually get our food until probably another good 20min since they are only able to cook 6 orders at a time..but oh it was worth the wait!! Dolores said the line this past weekend actually started at 8am!!  This time, our server was Dolores and chef JJ. They were both extremely friendly, funny, helpful, and a delight to watch as they prepared everyone's food to perfection.    This time we orderd steam clams...bathed in garlic, butter, and seafood broth...my bf liked the broth so much he drank the whole bowl..as for the entree..we ordered... house gumbo spice level 5 with 2 scoops of rice...and lobster pan roast spice level 4 with 2 scoops of rice..OMG..we had so much leftover...i knew we over orderd for only 2 people..but..we both wanted something different....if only i had a fridge and a microwave in the hotel room..i was so sad we had to leave so much food behind...but we wanted something different...both were soo satisfying in different ways...the gumbo was savory, filled with huge chunks of lobster, shrimp, crab, and sausage with okra..the pan roast was like a creamy, rich, sweet tomato and lobster bisque with lots of lobster and crab....MMmmmm...makes me want to go back to vegas again!!  The portions are huge, prices are so reasonable for so much fresh seafood..this place beats any buffet in vegas..    Highly recommend!!!!

u1UeOzQI_j1XFbRgQRjtnA.text: Wish I could eat here everyday! You get what you pay for, quality AND quantity. Can't wait to go back!  Removed a star for waiting an hour to be seated. However, still worth the wait.

NR6C9ZENqj7CnE8_Ok_nYg.text: This place is Heaven! Although the wait was ridiculous (almost 2hours) the combination pan roast was well worth it. I  wish there was an actual restaurant because i feel like a lot of people are discouraged from giving this place a try after they see the line. DO NOT LET THE LINE DISCOURAGE YOU! it'll be well worth it once you get your hands (and mouth) on the food.

toiu451w6GZwg_hqpMEnwg.text: I love this place! This place lives up to its hype. I feel like the prices are reasonable considering that the portions are huge. They service is amazing and everyone is attentive. We did a dozen oysters and my god were they good. Be expected to wait for at least an hour or more. Is it worth the wait? Absolutely. Yeah, you go delirious from hunger and you start babbling like a buffoon, but it's worth it. No one judges you, cause everyone in line is just as crazy from hunger. I shared a palace pot roast with a level 6 spice. It was so good, I almost saw the light!!! Woo! It's open 24 hours too, so if you wake up from night sweats cause your craving for some oysters, you know where to go. Just be advised, it only seats 18 people.

KCsXgdDtfurVieffUDkS4A.text: Just get the pan roast. I ordered the chowder and thought it was incredible. But then I tried my husband's pan roast, and I regretted my chowder. The line is long but worth the wait!

Tgyk-duF9DsmnhIM9Wsx7A.text: FANTASTIC! It's one of those hidden gems that only the locals know about. There are also pretenders, but the one inside Palace Station is the only legit one. This is by far my favorite place to eat in Vegas if I can get someone to get in line with me. I'm happy that they're finally open 24/7. The wait for me usually averages about 1.5 - 2 hours. Anyone who's ever lined up with me though says it's well worth it. That's only because they only have 18 seats. Their oysters are awesome, but my favorite is the SEAFOOD PAN ROAST. Go get it. It's the perfect blend of spicy, sweet, savory and just tummy goodness. It's like a hug for your stomach. I would marry this dish if the state of Nevada allowed me.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Pan Roast

FEU3B81HO1Q8HMIz3sVRzA.text: Great food ...just expect to wait in line ....for a while. This place is 24hrs which is a plus. The bad thing it only has about 10-15 seats and the meals are prepared fresh, so not only do you on. The food you have to wait for the people to finish eati g to be seated. I went at 2:45am & had to wait 2 hrs to sit. But the food especially the pan roast major delish. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New england clam chowder with fresh clams
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast soup...awesome with fresh lobster, &amp; shrimp

SAtXfM3vV2EJVY-kh2dJxw.text: A good friend of mine put me down on this place a few years ago.  Since then, I've been coming back and trying everything I can on the menu.  The jambalaya and etouffee is "crazy hella good".  They're both so addicting that I can't make up my mine, so I get both.  Now, it's a lot of food.  I don't recommend you do that unless you have an appetite like me or you have a tape worm.  Sorry, that's kinda nasty.  But, you get the point.  This place always has a long line.  Make sure your phone is charged so you can preoccupy yourself while waiting.  The chefs/servers are wonderful.  I don't remember my chefs name, but he was witty and had a great sense of humor.  This place gets 4 out fo 5 "Tadows"!

SCryjPYPzCEDR12btg50zQ.text: Not worth all the hype. We didn't wait super long but we went at an ofd time. Glad we checked it out once but Would not make a point to do this again.

axuwnMfRzAo0jP_S4FyIhQ.text: I've been to a few of these steam kettle cooked joints. Ritter's in Costa Mesa, The Boiler in Chino Hills, Texas Star in Texas Station, but Oyster Bar in Palace Station is THE BEST.  The clam chowder is the creamiest, with the most big pieces of clam; the least amount of sand.  The pan roast has the most shrimp, crab and lobster.  The bread is hot and not stale.  Plus if you go at the right time, you get Ricardo (the Filipino chef). He is the BEST. Pro tip: go on New Year's Day morning and for sure you will never encounter a line.  Yes it's pricey (for me) but you can bring leftovers home and add more shrimp in there for another meal.   The minus is 99% of the time there is a huge line, and people don't give a shit they are holding other people up; like they are done but just sit there and gab. It's just the trade off I guess.

o0tEwgHFuPffDyxhkXg38g.text: Oyster Bar has always been on the top of my list of places to try in Vegas. I use to come to Vegas two, three, four times a year growing up and never had gotten the chance to try it up until recently. Reason for that, we NEVER wanted to wait in line. Until I finally came up with an idea; which was recent when I came with a group of friends. We decided that the guys could go wander off in the casino and gamble while the girls waited in line to get seated. We came as soon as they opened so the line wasn't too bad, it took about 30 minutes to get seated and since we had a group of six we had to split up and couldn't sit near each other, it was fine though because everyone was coupled up.   Husband and I shared:  - Palace Pan Roast This was amazing! If only I knew the ingredients that went into this. The flavor was spot on, the texture was creamy, the rice that was topped over gave it extra texture, loved it.  - Dozen Oysters It was fresh, can't go wrong with a dozen  - Shrimp Cocktail Even though they were jumbo sized shrimp, this entree only came with FOUR pieces of shrimp, was kind of sad about it.  I would love to come here again just for their Pan Roast! Totally worth the wait, just depends on how patient one is to wait in line.

eAt_9HolEMo39mBudUKQJA.text: After I found this place on yelp last year, I've been wanting to go. I'm so glad that during my last trip to Vegas, my boyfriend finally wanted to go with me. People weren't kidding when they said it was just a bar that seated 18 people. Good thing there weren't too many people in line waiting and we only had to wait 20 minutes. It took a while for the lady to clear the bar for us to sit down but at least she was very friendly.  My boyfriend and I shared a bowl of New England Clam Chowder, a Combo Pan Roast and I had a dozen oysters as an appetizer. The clam chowder was very good and it tasted better with the oyster crackers. I usually like clam chowder anyways but since my boyfriend actually ate a good amount of it, so I know it's good.  The oysters were quite tasty for being in the middle of the desert!  The combo pan roast was delicious. It was creamy with a hint of spice and some fresh seafood. The shrimp was cooked well, it was not overcooked. I don't really know what else to say about it except take a break from the food on the strip and come here because I really recommend going to this place.

gnKvKqBYfXzAYmdqbAoAww.text: This was well worth the wait, two hours in line for a seat. It gave me time to study the menu and play a little. The cook was wonderful and the waitress was just grand. She helped us figure out what to order, explain that cause we like our food a certain way told us the option we could do. It was overall an experience I loved and will recommend this restaurant to all my friends to go plus the girls was very friendly. Hawaii people this is the BOMB if you want SEAFOOD!!!! Chowder and crab salad, OMGoodness

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceaser salad w/lump crab meat

o2cpDOL8cl_4aSO8Wj7qDg.text: 24-Hr, 16-seat counter, Oyster bar and seafood restaurant within the casino floor of the Palace Station. Prepare for a line, if there's a dozen people in line, you're looking at a wait of 1 to 1.5 hours easily. Generally came here at night, my first time midnight with a group of friends, and we didn't eat until 2am. And if you are sensitive to cigarette smoke, it will be a good idea to take turns with a friend to wait because it gets smokey there and no where to go.   Go for the oyster shooters, round of fresh oysters (may be a bit sandy, but fresh), round of fresh clams (if you never tried it before, try it, 1 out of 5 of us in the group liked it in the end), and definitely go for the pan roast (gumbo style soup with choice of seafood, chicken, sausage, or other meats) and served with bread and rice. 1 pan roast easily feeds 2. Bread is complimentary and so so good, so be sure to ask for more. The pan roast has a coconut milk flavor to it which gives it a great richness as well.   Definitely well worth the wait and always a point of destination each time we are in Vegas.

pit-Th7nPz2xXoCpItNN-A.text: Food was okay. Not how they used to be. Service is slow and wait time can be up to 3 hours.

ABbKJNF0ai-IDyT6KXrlww.text: Went at 2:00 on a Friday to beat the crowds. Warning:  there is no one to Police who comes and goes from the lines. There was a small group of maybe four people in front of us. When it finally came to their turn another five or six people showed up and joined them. It doesn't sound like many, but when there's only 18 seats it will add another half hour to 45 minutes to your wait. Our total wait was over three hours!  If you really want to know how long it may take, it would be a good idea to ask everyone in front of you if they are holding places.    The food was delicious but it was not worth a three hour wait. Would only go back if the line is less than five people.

c1MdpcQSNNEfY3Oipw3wkA.text: Despite the one hour wait, this spot still gets the #1 oyster bar in the valley rating from me!   Everything was fantastic, from the friendly service at the bar to the lovely conversation provided by the cook. It was more like we were sitting in his kitchen, as he handed us samples of just about everything he made.   We ordered the pan roast, as recommended by everyone surrounding us. One word, PERFECTION!! It was a party in my mouth from beginning until end. We also had an appetizer of shrimp cocktail, which was just as fabulous. Not to mention, the shrimp they served were probably the biggest I've seen used for cocktail.   We will definitely be returning here, very soon at that!!

Di5cT41dlSPzCLUJm0M0Hw.text: Outstanding!!  Pan Roast was exceptional. Wait time was short just after the lunch crowd. The service was friendly and attentive.  The food was over the top. The prices were very fair for sea food. I will return repeatedly.  You can believe the other reviews as spot on. I am not a long winded nor word talented reviewer just liked what I experienced.

kxDjLlnilivkEh-devf_iQ.text: Omg the pan roast was amazing!we got the lobster, crab and shrimp. They ran out of crab so we just ordered extra lobster. I will definitely go back to this place. We got lucky there was no line around 3pm on a thursday.

O8VKdZslhDMu7BMn8LTOdg.text: Worth the wait, worth the wait, WORTH THE WAIT!  Get the oysters on the half shell, get the palace pan roast, get it with rice, get it with noodles, get the new england clam chowder, and get yourself a beer.  Share it all, be happy, and go on with your day in Las Vegas!

kf3E0Jl8Dz7X6ypx_Al7YQ.text: Its my 2nd time to eat here and still the same. Food is good and they serve generous amount of shellfish. The pan roast, bouillabaise, and cioppino is creamy and tasty.

av8axZ5rpQJpM6CAAVksZw.text: Food: combo pan roast ~ $23 service: 3.5 stars parking: structure   I've been to Vegas plenty of times and I never heard of this place until recently. I didn't even bother yelping and ate at this place because of a friend...it was quite delicious. The pan roast was so rich in flavor, creamy, and felt like my soul was being uplifted. It was probably even more delicious because the weather was super cold, and we all know that hot food tastes a lot better then...right ? Anyhow, the pan roast itself had plenty of ingredients to chew on and was definitely filling. One thing I didn't like though is the rice portion given: you have a gigantic bowl of soup and one tiny scoop of rice -_- like do they expect me to eat a grain of rice per spoonful of soup ? lol  My recommendation if you come with two people. Sit one and get something else. The flavors are great but because of the richness of the soup it gets a little heavy.   would I come back?  oh definitely. especially if the weather is cold

YvKvuMTBKA_hEGIYKcyeUA.text: I'm so blown away by this place, and it's making me reconsider how many five-star reviews I've given out on Yelp. Seriously, Oyster Bar exceeds this five-star rating!! The 24/7 hours, the exclusivity, the service, the portions, the quality!  Oyster Bar can only seat in about less than 20 people. My party of 7 (including me) must have waited around 2 hours on a Sunday evening, which isn't so bad considering we occupied half the bar during peak hours. The service was incredibly accommodating to our large party, warmly answering our questions despite how busy they were. Even the head chef was cracking a couple jokes with his patrons while shuffling around.  In total, we ordered a dozen oysters and three Combo Pan Roasts for our party. I asked to substitute one bowl of rice for pasta. We ended up receiving two more orders of pasta (free of charge) because the waitress made a mistake. No problem!   I almost didn't believe that a seafood bar could serve fresh oysters 24/7, but I was delightfully proven wrong. Briny, slimy, and fresh! I love ordering chilled oysters to cut into my hot and hearty foods. In this case, the Combo Pan Roast was the perfect tomato stew complement. Juicy shrimp, ribbons of soft crab and lobster--and not overtly salty as well. Instead of rice, I dipped my linguine pasta into the stew. The linguine doesn't absorb the stew the way rice does, so pick your preference on how you want to eat it.  I wish we could have ordered more, but the portions are so generous that we're gonna have to make a second trip here.   I'm not really sure what's the best time to come since Vegas never sleeps. They even have happy hour from 1am-9am, so that might attract a hungry and drunk crowd. Good luck!

mUvemOq0VTLJb2vJX-6olQ.text: This place has the best pan roast in town!!! The wait is kinda long but well worth it

yzVfuPRothiGHePA5ZzqZg.text: Hands down the BEST pan roast I've ever had in my life!! Who cares if I had to wait an hour and a half??? Totally worth it! Very generous portions on the seafood, and I love how friendly & accommodating the staffs were towards a bunch of anticipating hungry customers. Definitely my TOP most favorite spot in Vegas.

2U6lB-EDuApaHN23VnLIbg.text: I've been to the Oyster Bar at the Palace Station a hand full of times (since the early 2000s) and I've never left hungry or disappointed. My favorite has always been the bouillabaisse with a medley of massive seafood deliciousness including crab, jumbo shrimp, lobster, scallops and so much more. This time I ordered the bouill-roast which was a secret item that was revealed due to popularity. The bouill-roast is the bouillabaisse served with a bowl of jasmine rice. Since I am asian and jasmine rice is my lifeline.... I would naturally love the bouill-roast.  We also ordered a dozen (bakers dozen) of oysters. I wouldn't say that they were the best oysters I've ever had. I actually like petite oysters that don't involve to much chewing.   Anyway, this oyster bar will always hold a special place in my heart!

I41yrJzIJ7keFlb2NtzBHg.text: I wish I could rate this place 6 stars. Currently 2nd in line to get seats at a bar that seats about 20. My recommendation is to expect at least a 1-2 hour wait every time. My tip to kill time: order the $10 large 23oz  beer which comes with $5 refills.  Me and my girlfriend make this our first stop every time we come to vegas. We always order the palace pan roast, dozen of oysters and the $10 beer.  For the pan roast, we get a 7 on the spicy level. Is this hot? Definitely, but I would not recommend it for someone who is not used to eating too spicy.  This place is amazing. I cannot say more. Am I hyping this place up too much? If you think so, it's okay not to come so I don't have to wait more than 1 hour.  This is definitely a hidden gem. Not so hidden anymore because I'm sharing with the world.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh my..
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No line right now, hurry and come. 7/15/17 1:18pm

YNJtvfs4gzmIEbTw01Rp6Q.text: 17 seater joint.  With only 7 people ahead of us, it was a 2.5 hr wait.   Was it worth it?   You bet.  The whole experience was enjoyable before I even got my food, because of the people who were behind the counter.  Norayma is amazing as she shucked oysters and clams and Christyna too, they were both funny.  Chef Eze had a smile on his face the whole time as he does his thang.  The staff here are so happy, they seem to love it here and it makes me love it even more too.  I hope this place never becomes a full restaurant because we will lose the experience of seeing our food prepared before us and handed to us right over the counter.  It takes a while because the Chef cooks and then cleans his pots in between every order.  Everything is fresh and scrumptious.     Worth the wait, worth every bite, worth every cent.

RZH92-1mndxZxQ7wSrTG0Q.text: The fish and chips was terrible! The fries had more flavor than the fish. The fish had no flavor at all. When the waitress went on break, the person that was suppose to cover her was rude. We had to hunt him down to order a soda and it took him 15 minutes to bring it to us. After he brought it, he went to the corner with another worker and just stared at us. When my husband took a sip, they started laughing. Who knows what they did. What a disappointment!

2okngOyONhuRRBColYatYg.text: It becomes harder and harder for me to break out of my usual Vegas food rotation of Lotus of Siam, Secret Pizza, Tacos El Gordo, and (time permitting) Shake Shack. I mean, all those options are soooo damn good. But my friend had insisted for nearly a year that I try Oyster Bar. This combo pan roast, it is amazing she said. Well after enough near misses, I finally waltzed my way over here to get this over with.  Pro tip before coming here (and one that I wouldn't have picked up if I hadn't read all these Yelp reviews)...when they say BAR, they actually MEAN a bar. I didn't take a count, but I'm pretty sure there is at most 20 seats here. Which means if you come here at the WRONG time, you gonna be standing in line foreverrrrr and wondering why you're not at the tables killing time. Oh right, because you got no choice since Palace Station is in the middle of nowhere! So come here at the right time, which translates to some odd time that no one will be there like Thursday at 3:30 PM. Nary a wait (until 10 minutes after we got seated...yeah, it fills up THAT fast)!  Anyways, let's get down to business. THAT COMBO PAN ROAST IS FREAKING DELICIOUS. Crab, shrimp, and lobster in a creamy tomato sauce with a side of rice. They cook it right in front of you so it's about as fresh as you can possibly want. I can say without hesitation that I've never eaten anything quite like this before. And I can also say that Oyster Bar has now vaulted on to the Vegas food rotation simply because of this combo pan roast. It is an absolute must have. BTW, their New England clam chowder ain't too bad either.  So now that I've finally made it to Oyster Bar and approve wholeheartedly, now I just gotta figure out the next time I can come here and avoid the stupid line. :P

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New England clam chowder

SOGheNsNvj3t1WOLhzzIFg.text: I came here expecting blow your mind seafood, and I came away a little disappointed.  Wait time:  As everyone warned, the wait time is long and painful.  Since there is such limited seating, even if it doesn't seem like the line is long, it can take a while.  We ended up waiting about 50 minutes when we went there around 9pm on a weekday.  Service:  Prompt, the food is cooked in front of you and the waiter attends to you pretty quickly.  Food:  The main reason for my average rating.  We had raw oysters, house gumbo and combo pan roast.  I'm not a fan of big oysters, and the oysters they had were really large.  It wasn't briny and succulent, just big.   The gumbo was very, very salty.  Not sure if we got the bottom of the stock, but even with the scoop of rice, we could only stomach a couple of bites. The pan roast was excellent, and the reason I still gave 3 stars.  It wasn't salty at all, just rich and flavorful.  We ended up just eating the pan roast and left the gumbo untouched.  I guess if we didn't order the gumbo we would have been impressed overall, but the gumbo just ruined it for us.  I don't mind the wait at restaurants if the food makes up for it.  After all, they can't control how many people are willing to wait.  Now that I've tried this place I'm comfortable knowing I'm not missing anything spectacular... for me, anyways.  tip:  I like spicy food and we ordered level 7, which wasn't that spicy.  I would order at least level 7 if you like your food with a kick.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters were too big for me
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster shooters

bOldKoGKz2Xn2eGcONkzFw.text: When your feet start hurting and you don't want to lose your spot in line, you start questioning whether it was a good decision to begin with. One hour later, you're too far in and can't leave. Two hours later, you're way too committed and definitely can't leave now. Three hours later, you finally score some seats at the bar! Was it worth it? Definitely not! But was it worth introducing this famous spot to some friends visiting Vegas so that they can brag about it, yes!  The oyster bar only seats 18 people (I counted)  with only one or two cooks at any given time. They cook the food right in front of you so don't expect a quick turnover rate at this place. If you see empty chairs, don't rush the waiters since it's pointless if the cooks can't cook fast enough. Let them manage the bar as they know what's best.  Definitely order a dozen fresh oysters and the combination pan roast, two of their signature dishes. The pan roast is full of flavor. Shrimp, crab, chicken and andouille sausage (if you order the palace pan roast) served over a scoop of white rice definitely hits the spot for any occasion whether hungover or just hungry. Vibrant on the eyes with its beautiful orange color and kind of the nose with pleasant smells.   If you want to try the pan roast, consider visiting the other "stations" for a shorter wait time. The original location at palace station is a guaranteed two or three hour wait at peak hours. I visited the sunset station location and waited only ten minutes. The quality was comparable. Save yourself some time unless you have a very picky palate.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House gumbo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh oysters

8IVI9vSnM5mMQCDV_wegTQ.text: I came here in the early morning like 9 am, and there was no wait at all. I recommend waking your butt up, so you don't have to stand in a long line and be hangary. Service was quick. I ordered the palace pan roast at spice level 7.   My boyfriend's friend commented on the chef's Rolex watch, and the chef started talking about how he loves watches. The chef said he can identify any watch that someone has on, which I was skeptical about, but kudos to him. It was entertaining to hear, while waiting for our food to come by.   My pan roast was the right amount of spice. With the a.c. full blast on, the soup warmed me up right away. Everyone in my party enjoyed their food. Nextime, I'll try the gumbo. Just remember to come early in the morning to avoid the crowds.

I_9GXkwmu3NtqdRG5DaHUw.text: Amazing! It is worth the 2 hour long wait. They only have a limited amount of seats but it also adds to the experience that you can sit so close to the magic.  The pan roast is definitely the way to go. I have heard people from out of the state talk about this specific location and how it is amazing and so delicious. Even if you google panroast Las Vegas you will get so many hits on people trying to copy the recipe. How do I know this? I tried. Not the same.  It can get pretty pricy but they give you a hefty amount of food and they don't skimp out on the seafood.

7DezlaPzpngcBb7q4Mfoxw.text: So at dinner times and even 2 or 3am. There is a good 45 to 130 min. Always worth it. Let's go over these dishes.   Keep in mind this are gaint Pho bowl sizes. Easily can share.   Combo pan roast: 9/10 .  Just a great solid melody of flavors  Seafood chowder:8.8/10.  Just a bomb seafood chowder. Never beating Irish tables seafood chowder back in Oregon.    Oysters: 7.7/10. Just great oysters from Louisiana. I usually get them most time with my order.   Sausage Gumbo: 5/10. Probably the only bad thing on the menu. The flavors just didnt get to simmer like a gumbo should. Now the seafood might be good. Never had it. And the chefs are really good here.   Bouillabaisse: 7.5/10: I remember this being really really amazing. When I tried it recently the suace I felt could of been diluted a lil bit more. The tomato flavor over powered it a lil bit. Still it was really delicious.   Chowder: 7.8/10. Solid chowder. Clams a bit chewy. Meaning left in the pot to long or not fresh. I would guess the first. But with the Alaskan Chowder and pan roast as options I'll be skipping the chowder most the time.

bHDjPBmUUK7nslHZrqp2YA.text: We see reviews so we decided to try it. The inline didn't look long but once in it, it moves slowly. This is beyond the servers control. Once seated the servers were super nice. We had the oysters and pan roast. The pan roast was very good. We will definitely be back

JfOckO2k08lEDj-d2klHdQ.text: Steamed clams were great and Manhattan clam chowder ranks up there near the best I've had. Worth the wait.

pyp-PfbACL-CQWA56kkEBQ.text: Waited more than 2 hours for this on Monday, Memorial Day at around noon! We were more than prepared for this wait. Here's a pro-tip, bring those small portable camping chairs, external Battery chargers, .and 99 margaritas! It will make your wait less painful. Albert S. and I had a lot of fun waiting in line... lol   Once we got seated, we ordered the gumbo combo (3.75/5) and the Bull's roast which is a mix of pans roast and boullet roast. I really really liked this.. and give it a 5!!! Yummmmm!   I will definitely be back once im in vegas but I'll probably go at like 4 in the morning or something when there's no wait.. lol

xZ2s4DhgRpVn5zBznPer0w.text: The Oyster Bar is the pearl found inside Palace Station. When you enter thru the front, it's a short walk around the corner and on your right hand side where the Slot Machines are located. If you've gone to the card games, make the next available U-turn.   It's a small bartop with seats for less than 20 guests. So because of the limited seating, it's a minimum 30 minute wait at any given time during the day. However, there's a silver lining: THEY'RE OPEN 24 HOURS.  The wait really isn't bad since you can have one person wait in line while everyone else gambles and loads up on drinks first.  Everything on the menu looks like a fine selection, but today we decided on the full dozen oysters, steamed New Zealand clams, and the Panroast Combo dish.   First order up was the clam soup. It's a great starter with decent sized clams and a light broth. Honestly, it's nothing you can't make it home. Moving on, we had the dozen oysters. We watched as the pre-shucked oysters were opened in front of us by our server. She explained to us that it was from a particular vendor - Gold Band Oysters that preshuck the oysters and then tie a yellow band around the oysters to prevent them from opening and losing flavor. Got to say, great job. The oysters were so fresh, you can wipe the dirt off your fingers after each bite. You can have your oysters anyway you like. We opted for the extra cocktail and horseradish, a spritz of lemon and a couple pumps of the Tabasco. Bon appetit.   Last, but not least, we had the Panroast Combo dish with a spice level of 6/10. Chef Bob is known for adding an extra kick to his batches so we decided to play it safe. That was the right call as the dish was flavorful, but not overwhelmingly spicy. Scoop it on top of your side of white rice and dive in. The flavors just burst out of each bite of shrimp/crab/lobster, but doesn't linger as the rice cleanses your pallet. If it was gonna be compared to another dish, textually, think Thai curry...   Overall, this place is amazing. Great food, fun staff, casual atmosphere. The only downside is the line, but the wait might enhance the experience and make you crave the food that much more.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panroast combo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen oysters and half eaten clam soup

JRpFuZ9UxVXLJuyox8_YYw.text: What can I say that has not already been said? Oyster Bar is an icon in Sin City. You must plan your trip around a visit to the Palace Station to hop in line for one of the coveted 18 seats at the Oyster Bar.  There's always a line but I'll tell you a little secret. The best time to go without a wait is for breakfast. Otherwise, you're looking at a minimum of 1 hour if you're lucky. Average wait time is usually 2 hours depending when you go.  Is it worth the wait? Absolutely. What should order? Their oysters are so fresh and their clam chowder is amazing and of course the PAN ROAST. I've been to New Orleans and did not even see Pan Roast on any menus. I've had Pan Roast at other restaurants in Southern California but its just not the same. There's something about their secret soup base. We'll never know, maybe it's crack. You can only get it here. Always imitated but never duplicated they say.  Please don't knock it until you try it. This place is not over hyped. So grab your fully charged cell phone and comfortable shoes and head on over to Oyster Bar to wait in line  and you will not be disappointed.

OetNY2RLF5PBKZArqa22cw.text: I waited in line for a little over 2 hours and started off at the second row of slot machines by the green atm machines. After being seated it was an additional 30 min. Before recieving my food. We were given bread and there are bowl filled with butter chips for you to use. The food however was well worth the wait!!! We got the linguine and clams with a lobster pan roast. The linguine was probably okay we got a 5 for the heat and it wasn't spicy at all it was a little bland in my opinion. The lobster pan roast however we got a 7 for the heat and i thought it was a little too spicy for me but my boyfriend loved it and icouldnt stop eating it because of how good it was! The staff are all very nice and try to get to you as quickly as possible. -1 star because of the wait however that is expected because its vegas and the slightly bland linguine.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine &amp; clams, lobster pan roast

aGw8vxsNzN0F4PhgM5aM5w.text: We keep finding these great eating establishments on Yelp. The Oyster Bar here and at the Texas Station Hotel and Casino are off the charts. We started with a dozen oysters, then Roxanne had the Bouillabaisse and I had the Seafood Gumbo with crab, lobster and shrimp. Great Service. There are tables...we sat at the bar, not a place for ambiance, unless you like the Casino influence. Soooo good!!! The Palace is an hour or more wait...Texas Station is wide open

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouillabaisse
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gumbo

RFTOdBl9MhqFzP9ByHXqdQ.text: Food was yummy and truly worth the wait!! This is a place we will not miss whenever we visit Las Vegas!

THkhLkLNk1WTzzQM3qt43Q.text: This place is so good! I came at 10 PM and got seated at 12.30. We were planning to taking it to go but they said we have to wait in the same line also so why bother, we just eat there. I got the Palace pan roast and my bf got the gumbo. We love them both! I like mine better and he likes his better. The line didn't look too long, but expect to wait for a long time as they only have 18(?) seats. The food is amazing but not worth the 2.5 hours, maybe an hour. That being said the server and the cook were really nice!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bK5aWngO1wjhgiA5yv7YNg.text: I have been coming here for about 15 years I love this place! The combo pan roast which consists or lobster crab and shrimp in the red spicy sauce that is to die for. It's spicy garlicky and and creamy all cooked together like a nice thick stew served with rice if I lived in Vegas I would eat this every day! The people who work at this restaurant are the best, they are EXTREMELY BUSY so just be patient and wait your turn its well worth the wait. My only complaint it that the casino is so smoky inside I wish this place was located elsewhere. I don't mind waiting well I do but I wouldn't want this place to be any bigger it would take away from it but maybe they can open another one!   No kids its bar seating only, prepare to wait in line, no saving spaces, be nice everyone else has been waiting too. Your food is cooked to order if they did it any differently they would ruin this place.   Combo Pan roast Alaskan Chowder and I'm a happy girl!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No kids its bar seating only

hIISrNyVzGmZFku5dSeQIA.text: one of the must eat place for us while we are in town.   might have to wait over an hour or more to seat, but the foods are so worth it.  (don't be surprise if you see 30 ppl waiting to be seated at 3/4am. seriously)  locals highly recommended this place to us years ago and had been a must eat for us every visit to vegas.   the only question is what to order now that we no longer can eat as much as we used to years ago.   cannot do wrong here.   5 stars all the way.   if confuse, try their combo pan roast and bouillabaisse or jambalaya.   we usually get fresh oysters also when they do not run out. & the new england chowder is a must if you like creamy chowder.   bring your empty stomach for you will need every empty space in there to fill with all the yummy goodnesses here

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AqiaY1ODsqIw76PS1c-iaw.text: Combo Pan Roast is the BOMB! Worth waiting for hours after Casino for ONCE though.. line is way too long for second time.

aJsiLPxe3ldQEH_-RYVCRg.text: Hands down on their gumbo. Despite their long lines during lunch, dinner and late night craves, food is great!  Here's a tip, don't wait until it's lunch time or dinner time when EVERYONE starts running to get in line, go in between those times so you don't have to wait. I would suggest if you are waiting in line with a group of people? Take turns go grab a drink, have a drink in hand or you better be buzzed at least while waiting in line, because it ain't going to be fun when you are sober, and that is when you will probably start complaining. Better drink up buddies!  Ordered the Seafood  bouillabaisse  gumbo (enough to share with two) - wayyy good. Enjoyed watching them make it. Fresh seafood, cooked well and seasoned well. They will ask for how spicy you will like your food, so adjust your taste buds.   Recommend oyster shooters and raw oysters! Always ask what kind they have, because it's always different. Don't forget to grab a beer while at it. You cannot eat seafood without a glass of your favorite beer.   Don't recommend group since it's just a small bar area to eat, may have to wait longer. Do recommend coming here in the middle of the night, their late night specials are awesome! Clubbing late and crave for food and more drinks? This be the place, but beware of long lines. Cannot wait to come back to try the late happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t help it

hoV1_GNUmgcy1pjeZCHfCw.text: Maybe it was because we were super hungry after drinking and dancing all night to Tiesto at Hakkasan but this was the best Pan Roast I've ever had. At 3am on a Thursday night before Veteran's day (I guess technically Friday morning at that point) there was hardly a wait. My theory is that Vegas gets dibs on the best seafood vendors so our Pan Roast was chock full of succulent pieces of shrimp, crab and lobster. Minus one point for the grumpy server who never refilled my water glass. The cook was nice.

DDk1DebwhoJasg_RmQ7s9Q.text: The absolute best Bouillabaisse I've ever had in life!!!! Ate here 3x on a 5day vacation! Worth the wait m!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YP-pBro4wzZgR7eHiin3hA.text: Palace Station isn't exactly the most desirable off-strip casino destination and unless you're a local, you'd probably never ever go there, BUT if you like amazing made-to-order GUMBO, ETOUFFEE, SHRIMP, CLAMS and even warm tender CHICKEN on top of a delicious CEASER SALAD, you NEED to go here. Good is prepared right in front. Small roughly 20 seat bar, but worth any wait you may face. Oh yeah and they have Oysters too : )

RvG4xcdR3fR_qoim_ZSpqQ.text: This place should be called pan roast/gumbo bar instead. Their selection of oysters was kind of disappointing, they only have gold band oysters. I've been here several of times but I feel like it's been disappointing me lately. I like how they're open 24/7 but I forewarn you that there will always be a long line. I suggest getting the pan roast or gumbo here. The oyster shooters, not so much.

w8k-Iic9VrV9MfVcyVwyTQ.text: I'm kind of reviewing all of the Station's oyster bars + 1 more...   The Palace Station is delicious to be sure, and though there are only a few seats, we were just informed that the remodel will include a lot more seating (though not an enlarged restaurant).  The favorite of ours is the Texas Station, espec. because their menu is different than all the others & less expensive.  The seating configuration is great too.  We also like the Sunset Station Oyster Bar & just about anything on the menu.   You also can't go wrong with Briggs Oyster Bar at the Suncoast Casino.  It's the best seafood salad, the best fish & chips, sushi, & terrific Jambalaya.... oh we've had most of it.  We like the seating in-the-round, the happy hour drinks, & terrific employees.

-FDmX6sCL1mUd2lIFNexeg.text: Over priced...service was good...food was 7 out of 10...typical ripoff Vegas hotel restaurant..

Jn13uvMxjs0m6MHlNV95wA.text: Only about 18 people to the bar, must wait in the line before being seated. Lines can be as long 20 minutes to over an hour so hopefully you come at the perfect time. Best way to get straight to the Oyster Bar is to come in from the Casino Valet drop off through the multiple glass doors. It's maybe about 100 ft as you enter. I only come for the Pan Roast. I like mine at level 7 spicy. I like spice as long as it doesn't cause that uncomfortable burn which can end up ruining the dish for me, so hopefully that will help in your selection. To be safe, you can just go with a level 5 and ask for pepper sprinkles to be added for higher intensity after.

OuHKpbBggcKOMna7QGaQpA.text: Wow.  You have to order the "Palace Pan Roast" here.   Sure, it's not near The Strip as it is inside Palace Station. And sure, the line can even be hours long (heard it was cutting down the casino floor). But it is amazing.  Came here with friends who recommended that we do this to start our Vegas weekend off right. There wasn't a line when we got there, but as we dined, the line got longer and longer. I could only imagine how long it would be during lunch or dinner or even late night. The wait is due to this being actual bar seating. There's maybe 15 or so bar seats. Everything is cooked in front of you.  Shared the "Palace Pan Roast" between 3 people. Level 7 spicy. Has a nice spice to it and do expect to sweat a little with the Level 7, but the spices and the brandy just give it that delicious flavor along with the other flavors from the shrimp, crab, chicken and Andouille sausage.  Ordered some rice with it as well and it's a meal. They also give you a piece of bread. Don't eat it as hungry as you might be. It's a nice crusty bread to dip into your pan roast!  Leftovers are even more amazing. Buy some potato chips and enjoy a nice and flavorful pan roast dip with your chips.  Other menu items on the menu as well such as oysters, gumbo, etc. But only came here specifically for the Palace Pan Roast with Level 7 Spicy and white rice on the side.  Definitely a go-to place when in Vegas now.

U-yEAhmacgLcF4EDnjn8yg.text: Tasty food--I love the Lobster Pan Roast the most. But that wait is terrible. No matter when you go, even if there's no line, they just take forever to take your order, make your food, and get your check. The operations of the place drive me crazy! But, they're popular and they don't care. The philosophy of the place is that you just have to wait. But add that to a line and the fact that Oyster Bar only has ~20 seats, and boy, you'll be there for 1.5-2 hours!  I've also tried the clam linguine, which is good, but not as good as the pan roast. They don't have much in terms of vegetables, but they do have a pretty good Caesar salad if you're inclined that way. The servings are HUGE and note that there is a $5 share charge for entrees.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Where they cook the food!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pan roast

CGUCfEHXbPq6eO3AuxYWSg.text: Been here 5-6 times and every time it never disappoints!!   - Servers are always so fun to talk to and kind (At times they can be not as attentive because it gets so busy)  - Pan Roast with any kind of seafood meat is all good - Oysters are some of the freshest !!   Pro Tip: The higher spice level you go the saltier it gets unfortunately! I usually eat really spicy, I've gotten a 9 here but it was terribly salty!   Best times to go: 7AM-10AM (1 person in line usually or no wait at all) Don't come after 10AM - 4AM it's usually 1HR 3mins - 2HRS !!!!!

ctvhH3F5Yis--G5IVj0Fgw.text: Great food, I usually get the house gumbo and oysters. Minus one star for the wait, an easy 2 hours when there's more than 12 waiting in line. Don't be the jerks that sit down and party like you own the place, making a 2 hour wait turn to 3.

eMfsUh1iux0WkI9ybmWVlg.text: The last thing you want to do when driving from LA to Vegas is wait for food... After a 4.5 hour drive, some in traffic, my Vegas sidekick mentioned a local known seafood restaurant located at the Palace Hotel. The hotel is and older hotel and off the strip. With 4.5 yelp stars, it's hard to ignore this place.   The restaurant is a restaurant bar that only seats 18. The line is along a walkway of slot machines. With 18 people deep at 10:00 pm, the wait was about an hour and half.  Standing in line, both tired and hungry, I was questioning our decision to come here as my stomach was growling.    We were finally seated. The two dishes that caught my eye was the bouillabaisse and pan roast. I ordered the bouillabaisse and my sidekick ordered the other. Bouillabaisse came in a mild spice tomato broth with onions, celery, shrimp, crab, lobster, cod, mussels, and clams. Utterly delicious! Honestly could eat this a few times a month. The Pan Roast was delicious as well. It's composed of shrimp, crab, lobster sauteed with brandy, cream, tomato and served with steamed rice. Very good as well but a bit too rich for me. Pan roast could feed two people. Each dish was $23.99. Not bad considering the amount of seafood.   Service here was just okay. Just like most casino restaurants, no sense of urgency. A bit on the slow side. It was about midnight when we left and the line was 15 deep.   Worth a try if you're in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 18 seats only..
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EwlkikZbkMX_SR4t2F26Rg.text: The best seafood,  gumbo, etouf, outside of East coast.   Maybe even just as good.  Our group got Pan roast,  jambalaya and  bouillabaisse

RGKXW64LwZTqShY44Xbusg.text: We had the pan roast and the bouillabaisse and they both were amazing. A quick shout out to the waitress who started a month ago (sorry I couldn't remember her name). Despite busy traffic at the restaurant, she was still one of the most attentive considerate serving staff I've ever encountered. Not only did she offer to box up our left overs, but also labeled each dish and sent us home with some extra rice. Very great food and service!

8enTJ_vu2ZsE2RPf9gmUvA.text: I was a pan-roast virgin prior to coming here and our friends insisted we make the trek from our hotel at 11pm at night.  The line wasn't bad at all, we were 3rd in line but the total wait from beginning until we got our food was probably 2 hours but it was sooo worth it!!! When I took my first spoonful of the house pan-roast with lobster added, it was basically an orgasm in my mouth.  I was in foodie heaven!    And, big shout out to chef Holloman!  The dude is hilarious, clearly loves what he does, and is great entertainment for all of us!  We came back the following night cause we were hooked and he wasn't there and it just wasn't the same.    Anyway, my mouth is watering just thinking of this place.    We tried a similar place afterwards in LA that claims to have stolen the chef from Oyster Bar but it was NOT the same.  This will be an obligatory stop every time we come to Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jambalaya &amp; Palace Pan Roast...heaven in a bowl :)
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holloman is The King of the steam kettle! :)
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh Palace Pan Roast with Lobster, I&#39;ve been dreaming about you since I last had you in January. Get in mah belly!!!

xh1Jp-xRj-IRLLIauS-v0Q.text: There are dozens of places we've tried on the strip but absolutely nothing compares to the food tried at this place. The prices are more than reasonable and we would have waited a lot longer than the 70 minutes we waited for a table.

Roh2D6Vw7_Ue6LEi_CitTQ.text: Expect a long time waiting for seats and for the food to be served since there are only limited seats and two people working usually. With that said, I still went to this spot every time I was at Vegas. Food is very satisfying! I would recommend the pan roast!

9bsGMIecdmxwDBxfKTB3KQ.text: First time at this oyster bar and I can absolutely say it was amazing. Food was freshly cooked right in front of you and the pan roast was the best I've ever had. I definitely would recommend this place to everyone

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YvEzNzCQ4b2qiukGByBApw.text: The oyster bar is one of the most well known and most reviewed places in Las Vegas. If you tell your taxi driver "take me to Palace Station" they will likely ask "going to the oyster bar?".  It's that well known.  To get to the point: The Oyster Bar is a 20-seat bar that serves average oysters and very-good Cajun food. The pan roast is really, really good.  You will wait 60-90 minutes in a line with 25 people in it to get seated. Even if it is midnight on a Sunday.  I'm not sure how the legend of this place persists. It is a good Cajun meal. But, the wait time and the fact the oysters are pretty average will probably keep me from going back.

GaayX4eKybp39ab5lappyg.text: We waited in line for over an hour, but it was definitely worth the wait.  The oysters were Huge, juicy and fresh!   Clam chowder was rather big for a cup.... portions are pretty big, so make sure you work up that hunger in line!

NVw109-HLewZDN4-1K8qHA.text: We came here on Labor Day at 12am and waited for 2 hours. The waitress said it would take 3 hours but we still didn't mind. There were about 10 parties ahead of us. Also, I didn't know this place was actually a BAR. It's surrounded by the slot machines and there are no tables. So everyone is sitting at the bar facing the cook and waitress.  Oyster (half dozen) - $12. So fresh! They shuck the oysters to order and I saw them throw away oysters that aren't Oyster Bar approved. So it's nice to see that they care about the quality of their food. We were debating on getting the dozen since it was only $6 more. I regret not getting the dozen.  Combo Pan Roast - $23. My husband and I shared and it was a perfect portion for us. The cook gave us 2 bowls of rice and didn't charge a split plate fee, which we thought they would. I think they just gave us less rice each. The shrimp was so great. It was not overcooked and just the way I liked it...a bit undercooked. The crab was shredded in the sauce which I don't prefer but it was still good and the lobster were in chunks.  Service - Our waitress was so kind and fast! I forgot her name but she kept moving and serving everyone. I also saw the cook go around the bar to clean the table. I thought that was cool since you don't ever see that! Definitely a team oriented restaurant. The cook also joked around with us that they ran out of oysters.  I'm from southern california and this reminded me of The Boiler in Chino Hills. Oyster Bar is a great find but it didn't amaze me as much as I had hoped.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very few seating and an actual bar.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $12 for half dozen. $18 for dozen.

I-fVJGKIXb5Dbz9z4w_rJg.text: Wow.... I was SO sure I had already written a review on this place....   So, Oyster Bar... what can I say that hasn't already been said?  Probably not much.   FIRST off, get over the fact that its located inside the Palace Station Casino.  That threw me for a loop the first time I went, but I easily got over it after the first spoonful of food.    SECOND, get over the fact that the seating is literally A BAR and very limited.    THIRD, get over the wait.  Ok, wait, let me rephrase.  If its 12-15 people deep, forget it and come back at 8am.  However, if only a handful, wait.  It's SO worth it.    I read the reviews and came here first with my cousin.  She wanted seafood I was game.  Though when I figured out what casino it was I was hesitant.  When I walked into the old casino I was like, oh geez... are we gonna get food poisoning?  However, we waited in line.  After about 40 minutes she and I were starving and ready to give up.  And the girl in front of us turned around and said it was worth the wait.  So.... given we had waited this long already we waited some more.    Pan roast...wtf is a pan roast?   I though it was a roast of beef or something.  Clueless I was!  We shared a combo pan roast, number 5 on spicy scale and a dozen oysters.  Sure... so I thought these massively large oysters were ridiculously altered genetically, but they were fresh and delicious....so I chomped my way through those.   What can I say about the rest of the meal??? Um.. the first time I went here I was dizzy from elation.  I mean it looks like a tomatoey, cream based soup if nothing else.... but it is delectable!  Went back to Vegas for Christmas after that visit and I dragged my unhappy husband there for lunch.  We tried to go the night before but at 1130pm, there was a retardedly long line which I estimated would not be a happy wait.  I was afraid too that our group would give out and end up at Subway around the corner!  So... lunchtime... grumbling husband about how this better be good....   We each got our separate soups (how greedy, huh). I got the combo pan roast, level 5, he got the etoufee, level 6 (Silly boy).  They were both yummy, but because the etoufee was too hot for us, we had to keep switching bowls to let the other person's mouth cool down.  Our group didn't come with us for this lunch...so they insisted on coming the next day.  Fast forward next day... at 830am we get there and voila, NO ONE.  Not one person was there, no line, nothing.  We sat right in the middle and the 4 of us proceeded to order our food.  As we were waiting for our stews to cook, all of the sudden the whole place was full of diners... lol.  So we figure the magic hour is between 8am and 9am.   The place is open 24 hours so you can experiment however you wish.    Hubby came back a month later for a conference.... dragged a couple more of his coworkers to eat here.  He tells me with glee that it was awesome.  OF COURSE IT WAS!  They are consistently good, always!  Bob cooked for us twice when we were in Vegas and I wish we could just package this stuff and take it home with us.  Wish they'd ship across the country.  Even if not exactly like the real thing, I'd even take something that comes close!   Go and try... you won't regret it.

dGu9n5URUtszjCuJM-QyqA.text: Was staying at the highly unglamorous Palace Station for a conference and had heard rave reviews for the Oyster Bar.   // LOCATION // Literally a bar with approximately 15-20 seats all the way around.   // WAIT // 5-10 minutes at 4 pm on a Friday for a party of 5. We lucked out because we barely beat the dinner rush.   // FOOD //       +Oyster Shooters: So fresh and served with the customary lemon wedges and a tangy sauce.      +Combo Pan Roast: Amazingly flavorful with very tender meat and warm fluffy rice      +Pasta Diablo: Guaranteed spicy much to my dismay. The jumbo shrimp served in it were succulent and fresh though.      +Little neck clam steamers: So aromatic and tasty.   I don't know where Oyster Bar managed to find fresh seafood in the middle of the desert, but I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast ($19.99)
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta diablo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Little neck clam steamers ($15.99)

SRx2bhyqdpVuvLao45lmwg.text: If you like oysters, seafood this is a must visit.  Don't let Palace Station fool you. It may look old but it has a gem in this 16+ seat bar. Great variety of seafood boils including gumbo options too. Raw oysters were plump and delicious. We were thankful to meet and visit with a lovely person in line to make the time go fast. This is one of my favorites in Vegas!!

hAEbGtxeDytX67q7PCXbww.text: I love this place the gumbo is a must have every visit to Las Vegas.  Just be ready to wait because you have to sit at the bar to get the gumbo or pan roast.

I0AukP_P2VjKYTFM8KxG2g.text: Well worth the wait, however I walked in and sat right down, though it was 5 AM. I did my work out at 3AM BEING ON Chicago time, and decided to have my breakfast there. Holy cow was that a great call. The help took me under their wings and had me order a pan roast. There was two big chunks of lobster, a boat load of shrimp, chunks of fresh crab meat and sweet scallops. The sauce was a tomato, butter and cream base that melted in mouth as it complimented the rest of the dish. The smell draws you in as the food kicks your pallets butt. Go early, and go hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A slice of Heaven!

6cnbWMywhrYYRHWtEtUznw.text: I can only think of one bad thing about coming here. The wait.  Everything else, I truly enjoyed. Freshness of the food (mmm.. pan roast), entertainment from the servers and chefs (Dolores is hilarious!), and location (right next to the tables!). I'll keep coming back here every time I am in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen oysters. Mmmm..

-oqrB8izsPBNL5oGl_o2Bw.text: You will most likely have a wait here, but it's worth it, so be patient my friends!  Aside from getting good eats from here, you'll also get a unique and very entertaining experience.  I want to say it's like a hole in the wall joint, but it kind of isn't because it's smack down in the middle of the casino - which already adds to the one of a kind experience.  My friend and I ordered oysters, gumbo, and jambalaya.  All were incredibly fresh and absolutely seafood meaty!  I don't think you can go wrong with anything on that menu.  However, with a wait that long on a Tuesday evening, my friend ended up buying cookies from another restaurant in the hotel to hold our hunger during the two hour anticipation.  When we sat at the bar, the chef thought they were donuts and would not stop thinking how silly we were to have a sweet treat before the gourmet meal he'd prepare right in front of us.  It was silly, but it broke the ice for us!  On top of witnessing the skills of our chef and falling into the aroma of the seafood smells, we received a show in True Vegas fashion.  Our chef sang for us, narrated his cooking methods, and even shared personal stories with us!  It was a great evening with food that was nothing short of amazing.  Save some time and patience when you plan on coming here, but definitely come hungry and don't miss out on this Vegas Best Bite!

vH-zLgc11MGY1UnExAD9og.text: Last night wife and I went for dinner but we did not finish eating and went to bathroom and vomit because I saw a big roach in my side of the table told the cook but they did nothing I won't be coming back in here.

g1bGdSOW49_elBeQiJPBsg.text: This is the worse oyster I've ever eaten.Everything was frozen and unfresh.Dont waste your money and your time.Your gonna be disappointed.

lipry3KiNV1WLIBW9fnlbA.text: So we're in the middle of the desert -- you know, Vegas -- and we are craving good seafood. It's our first time in Vegas, so what do we do? Consult Yelp!  The Oyster bar had great reviews and didn't look too expensive, plus it sounded like a great adventure, so we dropped the address in our nav and headed to Palace Station. It was quite a change from the upscale casinos we had visited on the strip, but it was a classic. We found the line and one of us waited while the other made drink runs, and we waited about 40 minutes with 8-10 people ahead of us. No worries, though -- there was great people-watching and we could take turns playing the slots a little bit while we waited.  Really, the wait was worth it. The oysters were really fresh, and watching Holloman make our pan fried was definitely entertaining. Everything is made in the steamer right in front of you and you can watch every step, request your spice level, and add or adjust ingredients as you like. The portions were generous and the company was fun.   The next time we are in Vegas, or even just driving through, we'll stop by the Oyster Bar for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holloman cooking up a storm
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster Bar

KNij_grZ8FtIKXv6KYJF9Q.text: I came here sometime in November last year. Our plan was to eat lunch right when we go into Vegas then play a little bingo! We were lucky that there was only one older couple who were in line before us. Everything here is bar seating. Also, you have to be 21 or older to even sit here. The turn over is pretty quick, I would suggest ordering the pan roast! The dish is flavorful and satisfying!

Rv82wTrWGu0PTtjsprZVvw.text: This is a little hidden gem in Vegas. I just recently moved here and was recommended to come here for great stews right in front of you! It was so delicious and for spicy and seafood lovers this won't disappoint. However you can adjust your spicy level 1-10. It hits the right spot especially in colder months. They give you a warm sourdough roll to start and you can dip it in your stew or chowder. I had the oyster shooters for the first time too which you can have with either vodka or tequila. It was a thrilling experience with an oyster i definitely will try again. It's limited seating and this place stays busy but the wait is worth it!

zfSPsReuE0Sv-WBLA_-RvQ.text: I ordered the lobster grilled cheese, oysters on a half shell, and the chowder.  The chowder and the oysters were excellent but things fell flat when I came to the $27 lobster grilled cheese sandwich.  I was not blown away with the flavor and it was somewhat of a let down.  Just didn't think it was $27 good. Maybe $10 good.  The chips that came with it were pretty damn tasty!  I highly enjoyed them! Much more so than the sandwich.  Overall, this place did just fine.  I'd be interested in trying some of the other plates they have to offer along with those fat, glorious oysters!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster grilled cheese - decent but not $27 good. I came to try it and won&#39;t be getting it again.

paxALfPlebQR5DSWDVFNhg.text: We come to this Oyster bar location inside Palace station because of Chef Ricardo, even when we have to wait for hours to get seated it's all worth it. We've tasted other Chef's same recipe and or other location in the valley but it's not that good as when Chef Ricardo cooked it. We are sad to know that Chef Ricardo don't work there anymore, he always makes us feel welcome and at home. Chef Ricardo never get stress when it's super busy, he just keep on cooking non stop with all his delicious cuisines, he's also funny and makes everyone laugh.  I work on the strip and everyone I talk to I always mention Oyster bar and Chef Ricardo but now I can't  brag about it anymore. So sad

YH_2a_mV9ivt65Q5HpG46A.text: Ambiance: open 24 hours, small bar located inside Palace Station, it only has capacity less than 15 seats, always long waiting line   Service: very friendly and slow, chef cook in front of the bar table for you  Food & Drink: overall great taste   OYSTERS ON THE HALF SHELL - ********** heavenly delicious gold band oyster, as fresh as just come out of the ocean, melting in your mouth, strongly recommend    CLAM CHOWDER NEW ENGLAND - *** white and creamy soup   COMBO PAN ROAST - **** shrimp, crab, lobster, choose to be served with pasta, recommend   SEAFOOD JAMBALAYA - ***** shrimp, crab, lobster, andouille sausage, mussels, clams braised with rice and creole spices, cajun style spicy food, highly recommend   Pepsi - *** average   Price: large portions and reasonable prices, average $35+ per person  (The review #2222 for The Oyster Bar! :P)

tUEKpi_fiFHjEHxq-VYYTQ.text: By far one of the best meals we've had in Vegas. The wait does suck, about 1.5 hours before we got sat. But once we did it was simply amazing. We went with the combo pan roast lobster, shrimp and crab, we went with a #3 on spice and it was perfect for us. Couple next to us picked #5&6 and said it was too much for them. This will be one place we go Everytime we go back hands down !!!

9TJrY9buUm0ZT6jh21tOIw.text: Five Star all day long! The Oyster Bar is amazing. Well worth the long wait. This is my absolutely favorite seafood soup spot! This is unlike any restaurant I've been to. It's in the middle of the Palace Station casino with only 18 seats. They don't have any TV's for sports fans but definitely good and social environment. From all the good reviews. I know personally this place is a MUST!!

jSzdLrYCk8TvAbZs8EPBTg.text: The bouillabaisse is amazing! I will be back for it. Looking forward to trying the jambalaya and the rest of the menu.   This place is ideal for a date or very small group. I do not recommend for a party larger than 4. It is on a bar that seats about 15. I went at a non-peak hour (Tuesday 2:30AM) and it was about a 30 min wait.   The oysters were huge and delicious, but not the highlight of the meal. Just try the bouillabaisse 1 time and you will understand.   I always stay on the strip when I visit Vegas. Palace Station is a $10 Uber ride from The Linq. Definitely worth it. Just make $20 on a slot to cover the round trip.  The limited seating will make for super long waits so anticipate it. Either sacrifice the time or go during dead hours. It's open 24 hrs and they featured $1 oysters 6:00am-10:00am.

MmdNVRxwQqhFUyuEtPaWCQ.text: As always AMAZING!!! I had the Bouill- roast!!! Eze was our chef and the spices and flavors were on point!!! 100% recommended even with the hour wait!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp,lobster,mussels,clams,crab legs,and cod ( which brings an amazing flavor to this dish)

y42UlCJHY3wG4dY8Zr7h0A.text: if ur in Vegas and craving that Gumbo and Jambalaya and Crab boil and ....JUST GO HERE AND CALL IT A DAY!!!!  Im sayin...the food here is stupid AWESOME! The best flavor IMO for what it is and waaaayy better than the fanciest schmaniest seafood joint you can find at any of the resorts!! SERIOUSLY!   also fitting that this restaurant is located where it is away from the strip and at a Ma&Pa Casino Hotel.  it is not your typical sit down eatery tho...its a half circle Bar.  you line up and wait for a seat or seats to open up for you accordingly. LINE UP SOONER THAN LATER because if you lagg on it then you can literally wait UP TO 3 hrs to sit down and enjoi a meal ...but that can be a good thing!!! yes, the food IS that good.

QGF5u5uIImdMdsxB4XZVPg.text: Definitely worth the hype! Waited for 1.5 hours with friends switching out to gamble. I would recommend grabbing a little something to eat as you'll wait in line but leave room because the pan roast is heavy, but amazing! I got the pan roast combo, but would definitely share this and another dish with a friend. It was too much for me - I barely finished the seafood in it!

1ZpHZmz8xI-2AV1vxweXCw.text: Are you going to wait an hour minimum to sit down? Yes!  Will you be constantly frustrated by people who eat too slow or are too drunk to function? Yes!  Is this place still worth it? YES!!!!!  The Palace Station isn't exactly on the strip, or even strip-adjacent, but it's worth a visit. They have oysters (obviously), clam chowder, etc .... but my favorite thing by a mile is the Pan Roast. This.Soup.Is.Amazing!  Make sure you gauge your spicy level ... i get a 7 and it's as high as i'm willing to go (and i'm good with spicy food) ... don't be a hero, enjoy your food with the level that's good for you.   They also give you rice to go with it, which is great after a long night of drinking.   I don't think I've ever seen this place without a line, and that makes sense to me. The workers are nice, the food is great and the prices are reasonable (for Vegas standards).   Overall I would recommend this place to anyone willing to take a trip slightly off strip for a great meal.   Note: This is bar seating and very limited, so not great for groups or people who are very VERY hungry.  Stay Cheerful ;)

OC-kJtSe0zXQRLHVM8c23A.text: Drove all the way from L.A. and will continue to return.   Two hour wait was totally worth it.  From the oysters to the Pan Roast.   A Vegas must!

UzzA3T7TKomy-gZrgtcBTQ.text: With the "Bouill-Roast" at the Palace Station Oyster Bar being the best thing I ate from my last review, it really shouldn't be a surprise for me to come back to have it again with my last recent visit. I came back to The Oyster Bar for another late night session at around 1:30am on a Wednesday night. What was different this time around that I had to wait a while longer to get seated and the prices had gone up just a little. And although I was tempted to try something different like their Jambalaya or Lobster Pan Roast, I really couldn't resist getting another Bouill-Roast. Bouill-Roast -- bit.ly/2lhzz9A Their pan roast and bouillabaisse 'accidentally' combined together with shrimp, crab, lobster, cod, mussels, clams and a hint of Brandy. Granted I was a little skeptical this time thinking that the first time I had it was a fluke. I'm glad to say that it wasn't and I enjoyed it even more this time around. It might have been due to the fact that I waited almost an hour in line to have it again, but all that was forgotten while I enjoyed all the seafood awesomeness that was in the Bouill-Roast. So yeah, after a couple of visits to the Palace Station Oyster Bar and having enjoyed their epic Bouill-Roast twice, PSOB has officially become a 'Must-Visit' for me and is a go-to late night option for me by default. Can't wait for go back again for another late-night Bouill-Roast!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouill-Roast!  Still my favorite!

KIDJ2C7ml7L3GOpZrJdKYw.text: When we originally read the reviews we thought the wait was all hype but there is a wait so plan accordingly. Now we did wait in line for a little over an hour and a half and the closer we got the smell and aroma coming from The Oyster bar kept getting better and better. We knew we were in for a treat and it was worth the wait. They do serve alcohol too, something we wondered while we were in line. So for any other Alchys like myself they do have what you need! Honestly the food lives up to the hype!
