v7KgCMc2dlhoKF3k5ucXEA.text: Wow. There only seemed to be one guy really handling the customers but he does a fantastic job. It's a well oiled machine and the food is absolutely amazing. The seafood is fresh and top notch. It's clean..which is super important to me. I noticed they cleaned the fish pots after every order... and the bar too... after each customer. A lot of little details with this place.. like the way he wrapped my meal to go... double wrapped, no spillage possible. Awesome food! Woke up at 4am and ate my leftovers . My only gripe is that with the line being long, they didn't take parties of one in the middle of the long line... you still had to wait til you were number one in line (as a party of one) even though a seat was available for awhile.

zJ37gcEbT_hm3GXPzmhEAA.text: The overall experience including the 4-hour wait for seats? It gets a 2-star from me. It's certainly not worth the wait. Hardly anything is if the wait is 4 hours long. What I don't get is why they won't take names and call when seat are available. Isn't it better if people get the chance to wait at the blackjack table? That just confuses me... having people in line doesn't make you more money.. Maybe it's an ego thing.... (hey! I got all these fools to stand in line for 4 hours). Oh, and why not put some chairs out?  The food is 3.5 stars. Maybe we have pretty high standards of oysters and gumbos, . Don't get me wrong, the food is decent. But calling yourself "the oyster bar" when offering only 1 kind of oyster (and not a good kind) is sort of like calling your car dealership "the car megastore" when only selling one kind of car in one color... and it is the "Corolla" in beige... Again, not that Corolla is a bad car, but there are just so much more..... Not to mention the sandy oysters?  So, what else did we order? We ordered the Bouill-Roast, the dirty chowder, and the crab gumbo. Out of the three, the Bouill-Roast wins it hands down. It was tasty and the seafood is fresh (read between the lines... the shrimp is frozen out of a bag - yes, we saw them dumping whole bags of them into the bowl). And who knows if the lobster and crabs are also frozen?  When you are in Vegas, you must have better things to do than waiting in line for 4 hours.. in our case, it was 10:30pm and we were broke from the gambling table.. so we were glad we finally tried this place. But, probably never again.

Ep7MXZkVvvgMWsv1bJD03Q.text: The highlight of my Vegas trip! Literally an oyster BAR, there is only a bar strip of seats. It's no wonder there's always a wait. We came at 12am on a weekday. Waited about an hour. You have to physically wait on a line. Wish they had a sign up sheet or buzzers so I could go dunk my money away at a slot machine. Well, I guess it was for my own good.   The oysters are Gold Band oysters, meaning they've been power washed of the grit and "pasteurized." These are also known as pre-shucked oysters. The bands keep them together. I was amazed at how quickly they were shucked, but after further research, I see that the workers are awesome but don't have superpowers (;   The food is made in portion sized pots right at the bar. It's entertaining to watch all of the steps to make the dishes. Level 6 spicy is just right to make the nose start to run.   Really great value for tasty seafood. The portions are generous! The prices are fair.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6oZNXlqJAMGqC5yuGEmHVw.text: Came for the famous Pan Roast, and was not disappointed. It's just great. The broth is just so flavorful. I got lobster. I think I'd try shrimp, or Palace (shrimp, chicken, andouille sausage) if I went again. The broth is so flavorful, it covers the delicate flavor of the lobster a bit. But, the amount of lobster was really impressive, so that's good.   Anyway, it's amazing, you should try it. I'm trying to decide if it's reasonable for me to go two days in a row.   Go at an off hour and/or be preparing wait in line for a bit, as others have said. Totally worth it.

tX4MFzEUtYazCZcj3jHY_g.text: We came here today for dinner at around 6pm and waited only 15mins. It was my first time trying this restaurant and was surprised at how delicious everything was! Kudos to the one Chef that was cooking everything! We had a small conversation as to what he recommended and what the local favorites were.

VmkK1ioVeci9lNlQyL-lpQ.text: Patience, patience, patience, is what you will need when you eat here.  This place is really popular as people will wait in line literally for hours. Call me crazy, but we waited 3 hours a couple of times.  Was it worth it?  Well heck yeah it was worth it. I waited didn't I. With that said, don't come here at peak times, lunch and dinner hungry as you might faint from waiting. Eat a small smack to tie you over until you can be served one of the best meals of your life.   We tried their oysters and we tried them all. You can have it a couple different ways. You can have it the regular way (oysters on a half shell) $11.99 for a 1/2 dozen or $19.99 for a dozen. Or you can get oyster shooters with either tequila or vodka $5 each or three for $12.  I'm not a big an of the shooters but other in my party liked them (probably because they are alcoholics). But I loved the oysters on the half shell.   I love the Pan Roast. It's a creamy tomatoe based soup type dish.  I normally get the combo pan roast which has shrimp, crab, and lobster in it.  $23.99  You can also order it with just shrimp, crab, or lobster. They also have the Palace Station Pan Roast which has crab, shrimp, chicken, and andouille sausage.   I also tried had the House Gumbo $23.99. It has shrimp, crab, Lobster, in a rich Creole base soup.   They also serve wines, beers and other mixed drinks.   Do they have a happy hour???  Yes they have a midnight special from 1am till 9am. Oysters on a half shell 1/2 dozen for $10.  They also have 23oz beer for $10 with half price refills.   To me the best time to come is around 5am to 8am. Then again one never knows. So remember have some patience or a lot of patience. Eat a small snack to hold you over as you will wait either in line, to order, to get your food, and to get your bill.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So excited

Ptt-Rx71VJ1pPeEvtuITDA.text: As a former employee I can say this place is filthy. People were getting sick every week from eating here.

yakxgaJu2Tulvr822MqyWw.text: Ok, where was I, writing reviews for all other places and forgot to write an awesome review for this great restaurant!! I love OYSTER BAR and this is the only place I visit EVERY TIME I come to Vegas. I know theres a restaurant that opened up near my parents house in Alhambra, CA that basically specializes in same food as Oyster Bar and I hear that it is opened by one of the chefs that worked here. Believe it or not, I have yet to try that place so until then, I will just keep coming to Oyster Bar whenever I am visiting Vegas.  So yes, waiting can be ridiculous if you come during lunch, dinner time. If you want to wait less, try coming before noon. Line is definitely shorter and you will not have to wait more than an hour. I tried coming here after midnight, and the line at that time was pretty long too. If you come around 3-4 AM, theres not much waiting so timing is KEY. Theres only 12-14 seats available with only 6 pots to cook and perhaps thats why wait can be forever but I think food is worth it. Once, I waited more than 3 hours and gosh I was so annoyed but food was so good that I forgot about it. Now that I came here so many times, I know when is the best time to visit, hehe.  Once you take your seat, they will bring you a soft, warm dinner roll. You can eat it with butter placed on the table. Its good when its warm. You can ask for as many as you like while you wait for your main dish.  One of their signature dishes is the Pan Roast. They have many variations with lobster, shrimp, crab meat and whatnot but I always get the Palace Pan Roast. I like the andouille sausage and chicken in this pan roast which adds not only flavor but texture as well. Once I ordered Lobster Pan Roast and I didnt like that everything was too soft so it really didnt feel like I was eating any seafood. Ever since then, I find myself ordering Palace Pan Roast all the time. I always get so greedy after waiting in line for so long. I always tell my boyfriend or friends, 'lets get one each!' Well, never again, haha. I can NEVER finish this alone. I feel like even two of us can barely finish one pan roast. Yes, you can order one per person but you probably are taking the leftover home. I hate taking leftover and I never eat them when I do. So I rather enjoy the food while I am here. One pan roast is ENOUGH for 2 people. Trust me!  Though they put a scoop of rice in the pan roast, I prefer eating them on the side. I always tell them I want the rice on the side. Its better I think because rice can soak up all the pan roast and then it gets thick & nasty. They also have pasta noodles (fettuccini) and its good with it also. But I definitely prefer eating them with rice over pasta. Oh, I know they have a sharing fee ($5) if you share one entree but sometimes I see it on my receipt and sometimes not. So I dont know, cross your fingers and hope that they dont charge you? Haha  Another dish I love at this place is their OYSTERS!! Their oysters are so fresh, juicy and big! They arent fishy and I love eating them. I can probably eat 3 dozens myself! Thats how much I love oysters. I asked them where their oysters are from, and on my recent visit, they told me it was from Louisiana. I loved them so much and my boyfriend also loves oysters and we devoured them!!  Servers here are very fast and they are one od the best servers you can find. You never have to tell them anything because they will get you whatever you need before you even ask, like filling my water cups!  They have many chefs here making your pan roasts and other southern dishes like jambalaya, gumbo and etc. Depending on the chef, your spicy level can vary as well. I once went with 7 thinking it wouldnt be too spicy because I had level 7 before with the other chef and guess what? It was way too spicy with the other chef so I couldnt enjoy my food at all. So ask the server about spicy level for the chef working that day. They can definitely help you with that.  Enjoy your pan roast and oysters! After 1 AM (and to 8 AM) they have specials like half dozen oysters for $10 and other drinks at discounted price as well. You wont be disappointed. Trust me.  I'm giving them a 4 star just because the wait can be forever. If it wasnt for that, this place will be a 5 star restaurant in my book!

JI2dIiFF_D0ZFzVt49LmXA.text: We waited about 2 hours, and I was starting to really question if it would be worth the wait. When we finally got seated and served, I could see why there is always a line. I had the combo pan roast (by far the most popular dish) and the BF had the Alaskan chowder. Both were so delicious. Generous portions of seafood in a velvety, well-seasoned sauce. Definitely get a glass of wine or beer too (for all your hard work waiting...) Service was friendly, and the server said the best time to come is at 7:30 A.M. Oh man!!  (For the record, I would wait 45 minutes at most in the future...)

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HBunWgb08FrEY5zhInm_Ug.text: Worth a 2-4 hr wait? Meh, not so much.  But is it tasty? For sure!  Are they the best oysters in town? Not really.   Is there all kinds of different oysters on the menu? Nope. All they offer oyster-wise is one kind of raw oyster. And you don't get little forks, lemon covers, or mignonette sauce. No oysters Rockefeller or other items. I definitely found that a little disappointing. But the raw oysters were most definitely fresh and yum.  They also offer raw clams, cooked clams, cooked mussels, raw shrimp, etc. They also have salads and chowders of various styles, as well as various gumbos and a few other offerings.  The main star here is actually the pan roasts. These are large! Pro-tip: Don't say the word "share". They charge $5 for sharing. Not a split plate charge, but an actual charge for just trying to share a large item. But the pan roasts are unique and yum. We opted for the one that has shrimp, crab, and lobster. It's just lump crab, not actual good crab. But the lobster was good. The flavor was fabulous. You choose the spice-level on a scale of 1-10. I love spicy things and, honestly, couldn't have handled more than a 5. It's rich and full of flavor. Be sure to try one of these.  The seating is super limited. The wait is long. The servers are in no hurry to turnover seats - even in terms of just clearing the plates once someone has left. The cook was fun and friendly. The other folks behind the bar not at all.  So in sum, get a pan roast and some raw oysters. But I wouldn't wait around for hours to eat here again. Perhaps try some time in the middle of the night?

VhydlJubQIfPWU4_XMlhzQ.text: Really good pan roast, oysters were just okay though and pretty flavorless. The wait can get crazy due to the limited amount of seating, but if you come in the morning on off days it's only about a 15 minute wait.

5C4_1P-68jBwAhm2tx3PUA.text: Oyster Bar has been around for over 20 years.  The business is now opened 24 hours.   Oyster Bar is quite popular even though it's a hidden gym in Palace Station.  The restaurant is located in an open area in the casino.  There are about 15 seats at the bar.  The food is made fresh to the order.  So, the lines are usually at least 1-1.5 hour wait.  I would come when it's off hours.    But it just depends on your luck.  I was lucky once and only waited 30 mins.  I also wouldn't come with a large group because it will be hard to all seat together and you won't be able to enjoy an intimate conversation since you're still at the bar.    The food hands down is worth the wait.  Everything on the menu are good size where you can share.  They do give you a scoop of rice for each gumbo or pan roast entrees.  If you want another scoop of rice, it will be another $2.99,  My favorite is the crab salad, combo pan roast, and Alaskan Chower.  The oysters are a $1 a piece too.  All the entrees are super fresh and very rich with flavor.     Combo Pan Roast ($23.99) is a thick and tomato cream base soup.  You can also choose the degree of spiciness in the soup base.  They will cook it right in front of you and it usually takes at least 10 mins.  The combo comes with fresh lobster, shrimp, and crab meat and they give you a lot of seafood too  I usually share this since this entire is very rich and heavy.  I am always craving for this entry and will consider this one of my favorite seafood dish.     The server is very friendly and are fast with their service.  They do accept credit card too.  If you have never been here before, you gotta come and check it out at least once.  It's a hidden gym worth coming for since you will never find another restaurant similar to this.

gGg1SwwbMFgYxCcus83ejA.text: My first time here today, and I'm honestly so disappointed that I've been so discouraged by the wait time. It is sooooo worth it! We got the combo pan roast, half a dozen oysters, and Alaskan chowder. The pan roast was full of flavor and and prepared perfectly to requested spice level. Oysters were very plump and juicy, freshly shucked in front of you. The chowder was the most addicting chowder I have ever eaten. Yummmmmm!!!!

yxjrOsWOPGkUYVcROJ2MRQ.text: What can I say l, wait in long lines to eat here and all I ever get is the pan roast, I really want to try other things on the menu but the pan roast will not let me. Not spicy at all at level 2, oh did sneak by the pan roast grip on me once and ordered a side of clam chowder, it was better than my own,. I hate that I love this place.  Over 21 allowed, they say kids can go to Texas Station for the same treat, I'll have to try that next time just for comparison.

U0W8G4U_MNsTFztJm_8reQ.text: Standing in line for 1.5 hours was absolutely worth it! Try the pan roast! It's amazing.

cTMh1aCTPPga7a9E8KR7Nw.text: The food is to-die for. If you like authentic gumbo come here. It's a must no matter the wait.

YZpTCD3s49rGqpXVplC_iA.text: We waited an hour before we got seated and the couple in front of us waited 2 hours, we got seated at the same time. It's just a matter of timing. BUT, it's worth the wait! Will certainly go back, the portions are huge so we'll have to make several future visits to get through the whole menu.

jxzcy9LSEkg2WlxIhIGSNA.text: This is my favorite place to eat in Vegas. The long wait in line is oh so worth it. I can not to wait to eat there next week.

6YQehHZotIhhwO1Obih5MA.text: Overpriced but good food. I'm sure my family liked it better than me. My daughter and BF really love seafood. They are avid seafood eaters, but we've had better.

OdxcsHSDwz0OJg2DSOvqzQ.text: Combo pan roast was amazing!!  We waited about an hour and a half but it was totally worth it.   I've never had this type of food so it was definitely a nice treat. It was fun sitting at the counter and watching the chef prepare your meal.   We got the mussels to start which was very fresh and and marinated in a white wine/lemon/garlic broth.   We got combo pan roast level 4, which was perfect for me because I have a weak taste bud for spicy foods. It was super delicious. Ask for an extra scoop of rice and it is the perfect amount for sharing. =)  The chef was awesome but the other servers were lacking. He was supposed to be the one refilling our drinks, but it was the chef who was refilling our drinks and cooking the food. So KUDOS to the chef for awesome multitasking while keeping a positive attitude under the pressure. =)  Definitely will make this a usual spot when I visit Vegas.  PS. For southern california residents, they do have a place called the boiler in chino hills, which is not as good but comparable if your having a craving.

OHJNxZhGiQSxmlyN3dsP3g.text: This is a bar with limited seating so the wait can be brutal.  They food is worth the wait so be patient. The clam chowder and pan roast are what I recommend.

2-9t6AwoYNNGwV4s_-ZTPw.text: This place was awesome. We had to wait about 10-15 minutes since all the seats were taken when we arrived around 8pm yesterday. Ordered oysters and split Pan Roast with crab, shrimp and lobster. YUM- oysters were Fanny Bays, a couple of shell pieces but still pretty awesome and a great deal for $18 a dozen. Pan roast with cream, brandy and rich tomatoes along with our shellfish was bomb. served with rice we split it. JJ was cooking it up and we got 7 heat out of 1-10. Not too spicy and was delish! We will be back -this was a great example of yelp reviews that are accurate as always and did find this place at the top of reviews for oysters.  Only 4 stars- service was friendly but it took awhile for them to clear a spot at the bar and had to go get our own drinks.

4q1FeVkBBfEKXmO9scQRZg.text: For someone that doesn't like seafood at all... it a surprise that I enjoy this place.  I've had a couple different things on the menu but the one dish I would recommend to everyone (even non seafood eaters) is the Pan roast.    I'm not sure how to explain the Pan Roast.  It's just a blended creamy soup of goodness.  Usually I would just ask for chicken and sausage but even the seafood Pan Roast isn't fishy at all.  If you don't like spicy food don't go past 5 on a scale of 10... you'll regret it when you're at a strip joint in the wee hours of the night.    This place is located in the not so fabulous Palace station and can only accommodate about 15 to 20 people.  Be prepared to wait.  I would recommend coming right before lunch hours to minimize the wait.  Oh yea if you buy a large beer, you can keep the glass... just a nice little souvenir since you probably won't have any money left to buy anything.  Overall this place is amazing... you can't really find anything like it in Orange county.  It's a perfect hangover food and totally worth the trip.  There are no tigers, cirque shows, naked chicks dancing, etc... Oyster bar in Palace station is the main attraction!

5cyj5F6G9LG3f-djyn-l3Q.text: You can't go to Vegas and not have the gumbo at The Oyster Bar... It's sooooooo freaking GOOD!!!  There is a long wait to get seated since it's just a small bar that can hold up to 12-15 people... and the food does take a while to cook, but once you get to eat your yummy bowl of gumbo, you realize it was worth the wait... At least that's how I feel hehe :D I haven't tried the rest of the menu, cuz I'm too much in luv with the gumbo, but I hear it's all pretty yummy :)

A4xV55-cy7bjsleVMYC55g.text: Looooong line TINY oysters  $5 extra for sharing?? We came here for some late night snack, and didn't wanna pay $5 just for sharing a bow of the entree, so we just ordered oysters. But they were tiny and very watery. We waited in line for 30 plus minutes. not worth it, will not come back.  p.s the free bread they gave tasted weird.

MRc6eEJpc6s7ei9ZqtLIeg.text: For all you donkeys out there that can't count, quit miss informing our fellow yelpers.  There is a total of "18" stools at the Oyster Bar and there are "6" cooking kettles.  This bar is designed to sit "6" people down at a time, but that is not always the case when there are larger parties wanting to sit together or you have your typical slow eaters and chin waggers.  I have been coming here for over 12 years and know this place inside and out.  Not a place to socialize and sit around for drinks after dinner.  The Oyster Bar's motto is; get in line, wait to be seated, order, eat, pay your tab and leave.  Last time I was there the manager had to tell a group of 4 to leave after they had  been sitting at the bar for over 2 hours and were just being social and having wine after dinner.  They were totally oblivious to the 50 hungry people who were waiting in line to be seated.  As they were starting to leave the people waiting in line started cheering and clapping.  I won't get into the colorful language they used as they departed.  So for those of you who have never been here before and for those of you who continue to return for the excellent food, just remember the hungry people waiting in line for your seat.  Just a courtesy reminder.

GCX8pfPNDZQZktWE8RMIew.text: The oysters are huge! Great happy hour prices as well. If there's a line, it might take forever because the bar only seats 18. Good thing they're open 24 hrs. I used to go there after a late night bar tending shift every time i was in the mood for something warm and comforting with a great seafood flavors. The staff is surprisingly warm and energetic despite the amount of work they have to do. They just don't stop because they can't stop cranking out to feed all the hungry people.

q8dK1gbWp5wnzNkkxqOmvQ.text: 4 stars based on the food.  Actually, I have only tried the Seafood Pan Roast. And the dinner rolls are yummy too! There is only about 15-20 seats around this bar and no other seating. Sometimes the waiting line is so long since seating is limited. Definitely not good for large groups, and I personally do not like it when there is a large group ahead of me.  The 2nd time I was there, there was about 3 parties ahead of us and the group right in front of us was a party of 7. But there was only 2 people in line for the 7 people. That made me angry! You can't take a number and leave, you need to wait in the line to be seated. But whatever, for the most part, it was worth the wait. We waited about 1 hour to be seated.  The food does take a little while too, but you see them make it right in front of you. The first time I went, I was BLOWN AWAY by the food. It was about $20-$25 for the entree, but its a big portion. The other items seemed delicious too. Definitely need to go back to try the other items.  The Pan Roast is apparently a very exclusive thing and you can't really find the recipe online. We ended up buying a mock recipe from a guy, doesn't taste the same, but I actually liked our recipe more than the one here. So the 2nd time we went back, not as amazing, but still GREAT!  Service wise, not the best, but it is just a bar. The server isn't super nice or anything, but still efficient. Definitely somewhere everyone should try at least once! I think late lunch/early dinner is best time to go without much of a wait.

Xp8Xxmxa83ugGKUeYaLQLw.text: Great food, great service. Have eaten hear multiple times. Usually have to wait for a table, counter seating is normally available. The pan roast is my favorite. They also have great oysters!  Price is good for great food in Henderson.

8wEvJJxJUJCM0KzMhMxLCQ.text: Everytime I go to Vegas, eating here is a must! I always get the Alaskan chowder, and even though it is $20 per bowl, it is worth every dollar! I highly recommend this place to all my friends when they go to Vegas.

r55Vw6CW9Hf2zRpPoNN7lg.text: I have been here bunches of times, but haven't written anything till now. We ate there on Monday and arrived at 6:30 p.m., we waited in line for 3 long hours before we got seated. By the time we were seated and our food served, we had gobbled up the bread and divided amongst the 4 of us a ceaser's salad. When our crab pan roast arrived, it was love at first bite yet, again and I sort of forgot I waited 3 darn long hours to eat it, yeah right.   Anyway, I refer people visiting here to make this an absolute must stop. Each person raves how wonderful their experience was and make this part of their stops on their future trips to Vegas.  Afterall, you can't gamble the whole time there,everyone needs to stop and eat and this place is unique and different and a delight for any palette. Cost is about $20.00 for a decent sized bowl, served with a generous scoop of rice. Don't forget to tell them how spicy you want it. On a scale of 1 through 10, I chose a 6 and it wasn't too spicy. I think the next time I go, I'll choose an 8 and hopfully it'll have a good kick, but not too much, where I wouldn't be able to enjoy it...............  Oh, and if you love oysters on the half shell, then this is your place. I'm not an oyster lover per say, buy I see a ton of people enjoying themselves.  If you've never been here before, too bad for you.........  They now open 24 hours, so next time we go, we're eating off hours to avoid those dreadful long lines.  Till next time, happy eating!

1glYWZ_YiR1vtaCfzxTpdQ.text: Small ... Waits too long when there are many people.   Food on the other hand is good. Sucks for those kids who aren't 21 and can't sit at this bar lol. They id all those who don't look of age.  Oysters are good and the seafood soups are too.

CimvkmLkbHhS1_OMzIdC0A.text: The best restaurants are really all about the lasting impression that they leave on you weeks, months after you leave. The first time I had the seafood pan roast at Oyster Bar, I thought: Hmm, amazingly well cooked, strong flavors, quite delicious, but too bold and rich for me to return. Little did I know, OB had worked its spell on me. I find myself craving this pan roast in the early mornings..late at night..when I'm dining on other things o.O. Darn you Oyster Bar for making me want mooore.  Since then, I've revisited and had the Jambalaya (abundant) and the Gumbo (prettttyyy good as well). I've also tried the clam chowder (SF does it better) and the oysters (briny, refreshing, but kinda dinky). No doubt, the shining star is the pan roast. I am currently counting down to my next helping..mmm..nommm....  I'm fortunate enough to be a temporary local, so wait times are not too bothersome for me, but coming at odd hours is highly recommended as their bar seats no more than 14. The bar is attached to the Broiler so look for that on all the Palace Station signs as OB isn't even labeled o.O. Waitress and cook are a hoot. Awesome service and amazing food. I can't wait til my next Vegas guests come so that I can drag them here with me.

i4YXVwSb8vujzxqNrRxH6g.text: Always an absolute delight. If the Oyster Bar didn't exist I wouldn't go to Vegas and the Palace Station would've been blown up and 'dozed a long time ago. I slurped up my cold leftover combo pan roast after getting back from clubbing and it was still good.  P.S. Bob is the man. Don't ever change.

ZLJEX18zZa1k0oGO9qEmEA.text: I must agree with the majority and say that this place rocked! After reading a few (okay, TONS of) reviews I was really excited to eat here. I kind of worried that the reviews may have over-hyped it, but nope. I can honestly say that the pan roast is absolutely delicious!  But, I did like the clam chowder a lot more. As someone else mentioned, it wasn't too salty like other clam chowders tend to be - it was extremely flavorful and just perfect. That's right, perfect. My BH had some oysters and said they were tasty as as well. We had beers with our meal and got to keep the beer glass for half price refills in the future.  I know they say the line gets really long, but we lucked out! We went on a Friday at around 3 PM and all the seats were filled (about 18 or so; it's an ACTUAL bar) but we were the first in line and only waited like five minutes. Our server was awesome! Very attentive and just a really friendly person.     Overall, this is just one of those rare gems that you have to experience on your own to really understand its awesomeness (is that a word?)!!  Oh and PS there's a spiciness level of 1 - 10 for the Pan Roast. We got a 7 and it was pretty damn spicy. The man eating next to us got a 6 and was sweating the whole time he was eating so I would say start low and just add some sauce if you want it spicier.

htsUzrqjKcVbJc2yg140bA.text: When visiting Vegas make sure you stop by Palace station and visit the Oyster Bar the best pan roast in town!!!!

jQhlUJt0vIr3cEigtvLcWQ.text: A Five Star for the Vegas gumbo. House Gumbo. Shrimp, Andouille, Chicken, Crab, and Lobster gumbo.   Yes, more than likely you'll have to wait over an hour in line. Go grab a Smithwicks from the Irish Pub across the way, then wait it out for a seat at the altar of New Orleans grub in LV.  It has become a tradition, nay, pilgrimage, to this Mecca of deliciousness that is the ominously titled "Oyster Bar" at the Palace Station. Station Casinos are known to cater to locals, and locals and returning visitors know this spot is dope. I met a professional concierge, not native to U.S., let alone LV,  who recommends this joint to only her highest clientele.  Wait, sit, order, wait, indulge. I also STRONGLY recommend the Bloody Mary Oyster Shooters (3 for $10 or 1 for $4).   SERIOUSLY. This gumbo is UNREAL! And the staff is on point, amiable, and accommodating, given the cramped nature of this small bar in a casino. Would eat for breakfast, lunch, dinner and midnight snack if possible.

6v5AU2IHT2eKPfx8ZFZIyA.text: Very long wait. Rude customers.  Yup on my visit I had 3 different parties being rude to the staff. I got clam showder it was good but had to remind them of my plate they actually lost my order and it was a bit to cold

odqq6ChXRFKOZBcfbXDTaw.text: Sunday 7pm dinner, there's only ONE waitress/host and ONE chef. Waited for 55 min only to move forward 3 meters/6 people. The group in front of the line were still not served food after seated for 35 min. We end up not going. If you have no plans for the night, not wearing heels, not very hungry, I guess you will be able to end up eating at this place. For me, can this place be the best seafood place of my life? Pretty sure no. So why ruin a night in Vegas for this ridiculous wait?

FSDiydn40IhbTj6F5_ZfZA.text: Shitty seating...looong ass line!  If this resturant is your money maker, then get more chairs and hire more cooks!

mBHwrFDUeVA418p9H1I78g.text: Uhh only the best place to eat in Vegas. I'm hesitant to spread the word bc I don't want it to get busy...but oh well.   Small bar. Literally a bar in the middle of the casino. There are only about 18 chairs so if you come anytime after 12:30 pm until like 1 am you'll probably wait awhile. There is only one chef and each dish takes awhile to get it ready.   If you're into spicy, get a 6 or 7. If you are sensitive, definitely get like a 1 or a 2.  Must get a pan roast. If you're not in the mood for that get the boulliabase.   S*** is like CRACK YO!

SJd_BRbFUp4TRxNHpGbxCQ.text: Always busy, taste great and value for money. But go there when you are about to be hungry as the wait is always long. Don't go there when you are very hungry. Open 24/7 best time is after 2am to 7am no wait. Verrrryyyy Fresh oyster. Bouillabaisse was the best.

Dd7cFUNhs7QOVo9JeXZz8Q.text: Since my first visit, I've been back to this place EVERY SINGLE TIME I've been in Vegas.  Just to make sure I come here, I try to go on the first night I'm in Vegas.  Cuz if you say you'll go later, most likely you won't make it out of the strip.  This is how much I love this place, that I'll make it a priority. As mentioned in my previous review, do not come here when it's busy! There are only few seats, so come at odd hours.  (I have waited about an hour for group of 6 at 5 AM).  Just goes to show you how popular this place is.  I'd recommend the Pan Roast, level 3 or 4 spicy.  And definitely recommending sharing this, unless you have a fridge to put the left overs in.  And just add on the extra scoop or two of rice.  Oysters, clams are all fresh and yummy!  And don't go to other Oyster Bar in Vegas if you are going for the Pan Roast.  The other places do not do this.  This is the only location.  Also don't expect stellar service.  It's more like a diner service with food you'll drool over in your sleep.

LDWEEWK271AYT5nulpaAsw.text: Awesome. Just downright awesome.  Apparently there can be a huge line here, but we lucked out. We arrived at 9PM on a Thursday evening, and we sat right down.  This place is a counter where they shuck the oysters right in front of you and cook everything right in front of you with really awesome, high powered steam cookers. The prices are fantastic for Vegas too - $17 for a dozen oysters - NICE!  Starting with the service, Sandra was our waitress, and she was fabulous. She had plenty of suggestions about what to get. We already knew we wanted a dozen oysters, but we weren't sure what to follow that up with. She suggested the combo roast, and we went for it. FREAKING DELICIOUS. In fact, if you're going as a twosome, I think a dozen oysters, a couple beers, and a combo roast is a great meal to share for the two of you.  Apparently this place has been around for 19 years.  Do you really need my review to convince you? There are well over 200 reviews of this place, and the average score is 4.5 stars. I think if we would have waited two hours, my review would have only been four stars, but considering that we had no wait, five stars all the way.  Next time I'm in town, this place is HIGH on my list!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Roast on rice!

B70GSVRqu0Hmp7a7kfdLOQ.text: I finally got to come here and to see what all the hype over the pan roast was all about. I asked the guy waiting in line in front of me if he had been here before and he said that he comes here every time he is in town. He said he always get the pan roast w/crab and lobster. Him and his wife even moved to the other side of the bar so me and my +4 could sit together. Thank you awesome couple from Cali!!  You have to be 21 to eat here and you're limited to 1 pan roast per person and no take-out. The 2 couples each shared 1 and I got 1 all to myself!! The other 2, we had them box it up for my aunt n uncle (the sneaky way to still get take-out, which was suggested by our waitress). We got 4 combo pan roasts (lobster, crab, and shrimp) and 1 palace pan roast (i can't remember what is in it) with our rice on the side. I got mine at level 7 spicy, which was perfect for me.   They have these crazy looking steamers that cook each pan roast right in front of you. I think it cooks for about 10 minutes. It was everything I expected, except that an extra order of rice was $2.49.
