cga41Ypfp2DcFF1m6HK45Q.text: Alaskan clam chowder spicy level 5 Combo panroast spicy level 5   Clam chowder was really good and it comes with a lot alot alot a lot of seafoods. The portion was really big too. My girlfriend and I could not finish both dishes. We barely had panroast which was little salty. I personally do not think their foods were worth the wait. Air in casino was shitty.

OYLJ8_hMphy5A_3eAc6U9A.text: Amazingly Good Food and Very Good Service.  Value for your Money, absolutely !  The Oyster Bar is off the strip, about 2-miles from the Venetian/Palazzo inside the Palace Station Hotel & Casino.   The restaurant only seats about 18-20, we waited about 30-mintues for a place at the bar to open.  My wife and I had 2-dozen oysters, the oysters that day were from "Watch Point - Virginia" right out of the Chesapeake Bay...nice, they were absolutely GREAT !  Priced about $17 per doz.  We also had the Combo Pan Roast (lump crab, shrimp, and lobster) in a creamy tomato sauce.  We only ordered one, we spit the Combo Pan Roast with Rice, it was large enough for the both of us, priced about $20.   The pan roast is really hard to describe, seafood cooked in clam broth (the cook took a ladle of water from a clam pot, and used it to cook the seafood he added garlic, (this is right in front of us). The seafood cooked for several minutes, and then he finished the dish with a couple of ladle's of a tomato cream sauce, there was some brandy or sweet vermouth in that sauce.  If you've had tomato basil soup from La Madeleine, that's what the tomato base looks/taste like, sort of.      You also tell the chef, how spicy you'd like your dish spicy-level, 1-10.   They also serve a nice selection of draft beers, we had 0.5 liter Kirin drafts....and we got to keep the glasses, nice !  0.5 liter/23-oz drafts @ $5....oh, man "is this heaven, no its Las Vegas".  Afterwards, played 5 games of keno before heading back to the Palazzo to grab a beer at the Public House, a great beer place !  The filipino chef was a hoot, very funny guy, having fun with the crowd....sorry I don't remember his name, nor do I remember our server's name, she was also great, very attentive, hard working, and very nice, all and all a fun time.  Lots of great places in Las Vegas off the strip, ya just got to do a little research.

Hb8SazR5QJCxipHfmUIVWw.text: What can I say about this place...it's fabulous. About 20 seats and there's a wait, sometimes two hours but it's worth it. They cook the meal in front of you and serve it right up fresh. I got the raw oysters and the Combo Pan Roast. Highly recommend!

4xYG07I3VIuAu4f0mVDDpA.text: I've been wanting to try the Oyster Bar for a long time after seeing it on Yelp. It was Wednesday evening around 7:00 pm and I lucked out and waited only 10 minutes for the perfect seat. I was seated in the middle of the bar which gave me the perfect view of the chef creating all his southern style entrees. I ordered the combo pan roast which has lobster, crab and shrimp simmered in a thick stew like liquid with a scoop of steamed rice added in. The stew is great for dipping your bread in. I enjoyed the dish but wished the lobster and crab was not cooked to disintegration and left no chunks of lobster or crab although the stew flavor was awesome. The size is very large and went great with a tall imported beer. My neighbor next to me had the jambalaya and that looked yummy and he ate everything. I checked out the trays of oysters on the half shell and they looked very fresh and were pretty large too. When I departed there was a line of about ten people so I advise getting there early. Here is the full menu that you can check out. palacestation.com/dining...

isNi1AGLLGGy1IZ6uWNcog.text: I had a late night with a bunch of my friends so there wasn't a long line. I ordered the Combo Pan Roast and it was very flavorful. It took a long time for the waiter to make the food though. The waiter also gave us a complimentary oyster shooter which was a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

xpuBv4oUzMuCbI9QR_8nqQ.text: Awesome oysters and pan roast. The wait for a table and service at time is what knocks off a star. Sunset station oyster bar is just as good and they have way more seating so don't have to wait so we go there instead.

lVZg8AuvO9BRQkW_Z98log.text: Anything on the menu, you cant go wrong.  From the etouffe to the Panroast, everything is absolutely delicious.  No better place to eat in Vegas, bar none

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Panroast

gNPyyz-SGy4-MG4QTfqGRQ.text: I've had seafood from around the world and this spot ranks right up there!    Only around 20 seats and the line can be really long but it is totally worth it.  The only negative thing I could say about this place is that it's right smack in the middle of the casino where there's a lot of second-hand smoke.  Otherwise, this place is awesome.

z9vwSS4qCLarHLjWvAgNVA.text: All the yelp reviews made me dream of going to this place for a couple weeks.  I went at around 5pm on a Thursday and only waited about 5 minutes to get a couple seats.  I thought the service and setting was neat and with only 1 chef and 1 waitress, I thought they did a pretty good job with the service.  I also loved the draft beer selection.  The food wasn't as mind blowing as the yelp reviews would lead you to believe.  We tried a few different things and here is my rating on each: Oyster Vodka Shooter 2/5 - Lousy bloody mary mix. New Zealand Mussels 2/5 -the liquid was weak and watery but the mussels were fresh and tasty.  The bland liquid ruined it for me. 1/2 Dozen Oysters 5/5 - AWESOME, I will go back just for these.  Huge and fresh. Combo Pan Roast 4/5 - The seafood was cooked perfectly, but the flavor was missing just a little something for me. Shrimp Scampi 2/5 - Shrimp was beautiful but the sauce was unbearably weak.  This may be the worst scampi I have ever had.  I am hoping to go back when there is a different chef and maybe the food will be more flavorful.

qZ99k2W4GCBxL9TqTNtB7w.text: We ate at this place on 11/9.  As mentioned by many other reviewers we had to wait a little over an hour to be seated and then another hour or so to eat.  There were only three workers who were all pleasant and helpful. I ordered the linguine and clams which was very good but my only complaint was that it was a bit soupy.  My wife ordered the Diablo dish which she really liked but it was way too much food. If we had a hotel with a kitchen it would have made a nice meal the next day. I think they would make twice as much money if they expanded but maybe part of the appeal is the coziness of the place? I doubt if they could increase staff because the work area is so small. Anyway, great place but I had to take off a star just because of the long wait.

CSIae64eImMdRYCeY9n3oA.text: I've heard lots of great things about this place, and how it's so popular that sometimes, there is a long wait time (3-4 hrs). My first thought was .. That's f@$&ing ridiculous. I don't even like oysters.   But one of my good friends persuaded me to check this place out, and I'm so glad she took me :) i hear the pan roast is really good.. But I decided to get the gumbo instead. Omg, it's the best gumbo I've ever tasted. Everything is made fresh, and right in front of you. It's an intimate spot, and a great experience.  I totally underestimated this place at first, but now I totally get why this place is so high in demand. I still wouldn't wait 3-4 hours for it. I'd rather go really early to avoid it.  Will definitely be back!

KzOES7SoJo5CeozxIE3cNQ.text: We stop here first thing when we get to Las Vegas and it's the last place when we leave.  Combo seafood pan roast is the best.  Second is the Alaska clam chowder.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo seafood pan roast

ydDfMBzoH3ngR47cE3Gr6g.text: Oyster bar was we killed the bollibasse five stars take your ass down here and eat it's worth the wait! Bomb.com

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UG_bE4qkAUiOAV9QB_LcrA.text: For the money, this place can't be beat.   Pan roast is the most famous thing (kettle steam cooked) and the oysters... the oyster!  They're not my usual favorite but they're awesome for the money - very fresh, well cleaned, great texture and finish.   The wait is pretty long.  Expect at least an hour at the minimum.   I'd come here in odd hours and also stay to play $3 craps.   I still haven't found a place in vegas better for the oyster price/value ratio (still on the lookout).   I heard that some of the sister properties have something similar for pan roast and oysters but haven't gone to validate it yet.

RhnOf3QMcV8T71B7I0ykoQ.text: Pan roast is a little bit on the heavy side but oh so delish. Come with a friend.  Come hungry and leave happy.  I ordered a bowl of clam chowder to split with my friend and even after that we felt that was overkill though the clam chowder was delicious as well.  The wait was about 1 hour during peak dinner time... Which was the worst.  But since it's 24/7,  come during off hours instead  Next time ill try the gumbo or the cioppino!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The joint
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast

SWMeQNeyT1MSzS4S0Yubkw.text: I can't believe I almost didn't try this place.   We had gone to Bacchanal the night before and I had more than gotten my oyster fix.  We were in town to watch the Kings battle the Avalanche at MGM and the game ended up going into a shootout. Needless to say, we were pretty hungry at that point, but didn't want to eat anything we would regret the next morning. I perused my bookmarks and the boyfriend thought Oyster Bar was the most benign choice.   First off, this place is literally a bar. The maximum occupancy is probably right at 12 people. The menu is concise, which helps with the efficiency of the turnover rate. We were the third party in line and waited approximately 45 minutes. Let me tell you that the wait is worthwhile. I've waited over 2 hours to get ciopino in San Francisco, so this was a cake walk.   The bar is really unique. The 2 chefs prepare everything in front of you. There are maybe 6 cooking stations- big metal pots where they cook the dishes to order. And you get to enjoy yummy smells from all the pots.   The boyfriend started off with a half dozen raw oysters, which were shucked by our server. They were huge and fresh, according to him. We decided to split a ciopino. Split charges are $5. The serving size was decent. I could have easily polished it off on my own, but it was late and I didn't want to overstuff myself. We had an option for rice or pasta? which we thought was a little strange. We politely declined both (we also didn't see the $5 split charge on the bill. It may be because we skipped the starch side?) Once the ciopino came out, we understood why pasta was an option. The soup portion was hearty, much like a pasta sauce. It was rich and flavorful and the seafood was cooked to absolute perfection.   I will definitely be back. I'd love to try the raw sampler platter and one of the stews. Those are made with a tomato and cream base and smelled amazing when the chef was cooking it in front of us.

h2DbSqvqqP06ofVh8tm25w.text: This is, by far, the best food in Nevada. We happily stood in line for 2 hours at 11am to take part in the custom deliciousness that is Oyster bar. Save your pennies, we ordered one of everything and ate leftovers for the rest of the weekend. Nothing on the menu is bad, we just ordered the top 5 most popular dishes (recommended by the excellent staff.) Word of advice, don't be butt-hurt about the wait, the staff ain't got time for your complaints. We all waited, we all know it's worth it. Cocktails are very good, the bloodymary is wicket spicy and stiff as all hell.

GSmD1BkNeC9mIHfiUcrv_Q.text: What a little amazing place who can bring so much joy to your tummy!  The Oyster Bar is literally a bar with a kitchen right in front of you. You can watch the chef cook for you in these interesting pots! There's a total of 16 seats at the bar, and it would not be a good idea for big groups. Unless you're willing to split into little groups.  I woke up early enough to go and there was no line. The regulars informed me that the wait is usually 2-3 hours during peak hours, so it's a lengthy wait for lunch and dinner.  Each portion is huge! Keep in mind that you're going to take the leftovers home! They served many different dishes, which I haven't tried it all yet. I ordered the seafood jambalaya for $23.99!  They take card and cash.. and oh, they also serve some alcoholic drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What&#39;s cooking in these pots are the various dishes from other customers
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The kitchen bar!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Instagram worthy photo: Seafood Jambalaya for $23.99!

Q9b_aHy0I158xFXTjYuWSw.text: The food is amazing!  Super pricey and a long wait though. I wouldn't go all the time but I definitely will be dreaming about the alaskan chowder.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Diablo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan chowder

lpxiC9CZ9zOlkGGEh9Rfng.text: Got here on a Sunday at 11pm waited 45 mins.  We had the dozen oysters for appetizer.   We also ordered the combo pan roast (lobster, crab, shrimp) with level spiciness of 8. and the Alaskan clam chowder level spice at 6. Both dishes were amazing!  the dishes came with white jasmine rice however I prefer the sourdough bread. Hope this helps remember to #eatlikethegods thanks

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. combination pan roast level 8 spicy (lobster, crab, shrimp) A MUST!!!!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan clam chowder

JsZSF9EekButbRlIIeNghA.text: Seafood Pan is the best. Went there at 3am and there was still 2 people in line!  Just order Seafood pan roast, cannot go wrong.   I heard the wait gets ridiculous during normal hours. But it was well worth it. I remember it as well as any fancy restaurant in Vegas.

ot61ASLoP6ixfV2s385LmQ.text: Great place for oysters.  The Pan Roast was really good - it's a bisque soup with lobster, shrimp and stuff.  It comes with a scoop of rice.  You can ask for it to be spicy for those that can handle the heat.  There is limited seating, like less than 20 seats, so if you hate waiting in lines it is best to come at off times.  Somewhat pricy, but you are getting seafood.  This place is perpendicular to the craps tables.

bh9-ZlgHiQeXeJg942aUnQ.text: It's good, yes but is it worth 2.5 hours wait?  I'm not so sure.  It's pretty expensive for what you get.  A bowl of soup with some seafood and rice or pasta.  Servers are sassy and sarcastic and you'll find out they're like that because 18%-20% gratuity is included automatically but this may be because we had a party of 7.

9wxxqtk3wxVgXlA3Mimx5w.text: The food and service here at the Oyster bar are incredible!  Authentic Louisiana cuisine!  Prices are about $25 a plate.   The oyster shooters are fabulous.   We waited two hours for a table which is standard.  One friend we took for dinner told us that it's the best place for Oysters in Vegas!   You will not be disappointed!  Just be prepared for a long line.

Yt2e7KtAFRIPtrnzHcM8bw.text: After many years of living here, I've only been to the Palace Station 3 times. THREE! My roomie dragged me here cause he said that they have good oysters. Like freshly good!  I didn't drive so I didn't care where he was taking me.  This is an oyster bar, it has a bar set up, therefore you have to be 21+ years old. The wait line is kinda awkward cause it's by the rewards center and slot machines. The wait was about hour to hour and half. Yup, line was long. I had a couple beers while waiting. Yeah, I got drunk. But hey, at least I remembered what I ordered.  Ordered the shooters which was 3 for $10. If you got vodka, they add a bloody mary mix. Spicy, lemony, oystery, and vodka-y. For main dish, ordered the lobster gumbo with level 7 spiciness. They start cooking your food right in front of you. You will start tearing up because you're so hungry. The bottom line to the dishes is that it was AMAZEBALLS. Spiciness was perfect. Amount of lobster and sausage...yum!  Service was good. You can tell that the chef loves his job. Watching him cook was like watching a T.V. show. There are two other servers and they will get you other things (water, beer, or more oysters).  Will come back again! But I wil have one of my friends to stand in line for me. Must stop for some New England/Southern/Seafood food.

O935iYQoyw_dVvBO8d88Pg.text: 5 stars is not even close to enough. The wait is long but soooo worth it!!! The portions are also huge so it's a great value for the price they don't skip out on the amount of sea food given. The pan roast and house gombo!!!!! A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!!!!!

J1v0lbP-uuHZCn-LtqHqZw.text: I can't give it a fair rating as with such a shortline the wait was still 2 to 2.5 hours!  I don't find it worth waiting in a dumpy hotel that long to eat this food...sorry those who love it maybe if I have a chance to try the actual food I'll give it a higher rating..

3Frj9x7Gk_XGcRGyNa7gbA.text: This place is a must try if your visiting Vegas or a native!  I will make it my duty to come here when in town.  I've only been one time so I don't know when is a good time to come.   I came with family on the weekend around 6pm and had a hour and a half wait.   I was very discouraged,  but once I tasted the food,  it was well worth the wait.   I had the New England claim chowder and the Pan roast.   My brother had the gumbo and it was very tasty.   I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New England claim chowder

JT-uCvB9eoWUv0ektgrEpQ.text: This small, about 12-seat Oyster Bar in an old casino north of the Strip called the Palace Station, definitely lives up to the hype. It is certainly an interesting dining concept in the middle of a sea of slot machines. I had a half dozen oysters and a half dozen clams and my partner had the Alaskan chowder, it was all fresh and delicious. Chowder had huge chunks of seafood, and was probably the best chowder I've ever tasted    We definitely got lucky with the seating, as we went at about 7 a.m. on a Wednesday and we were the only ones there. I only wish we had more time and I could have tried other items on the menu, especially the $70 seafood special for 2, which we didn't notice on the digital display screen until after we ordered. Definitely will go back on our next visit to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half dozen oyster with half dozen clams
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. caught them at exactly the right time, no lines and no long wait
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pure awesomeness!

W6YrNvQU7_wn8VFHXSoFkA.text: This is an absolute MUST when you visit Las Vegas.  It's not a spectacular hotel by any means and the ambiance of this eatery is not the greatest, but the food is out of this world.    There's only about 15-18 seats around this 24-hour bar and so be prepared for a 30 - 90 minute wait no matter what time of day or night.  I love the Pan Roast or Combo Roast there.  Pan Roast includes generous servings of shrimp, crab, lobster, chicken and andullie sausage.  Then they add in a creamy tomato based soup.  They boil this right in front of you in a pot attached to a steam line.  Once it comes to a boil, it is poured over a bowl of rice.....YUM!  Don't eat raw oysters but this is also a popular item.  Calm Chowder looks awesome too and I may have to venture out on my next visit.  Of all the many choices and celebrity chefs, this small little hole in the wall is still in my top five!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ooooooohhh....the anticipation is killing me!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast.....yummmmmm!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Roast, loaded with Shrimp, Crab, and Lobster!!

CuoCdYPr5f5X25wIIjqz-g.text: One of the best soups I have ever had!  This soups here are so delectable and filling, its worth the wait! The wait will probably be about an hour+ so I suggest that you plan accordingly and come when you aren't too hungry (although the wait should help).  I was able to try the soups: Gumbo, Alaskan Clam Chowder, and Pan Roast with my group. The soups were all great to me! Different flavor for each one, but all special in their own way. You will spend about 20 bucks for a big bowl that will absolutely fill you up and get your taste buds going. They are full of the meat of your choice: lobster, shrimp, sausages, chicken, or other seafood combinations (really though, they are very generous with the amount of meat you will get).  They have a special price on beers and oysters past 1am. They oysters are not small and yummy as well!  The service was pleasant despite that their bar only has about 18 seats. They will chuck the oysters in front of you so you know they are fresh. For a business that is open 24 hours, they know how to keep it live.  What's awesome is that you can take the leftover soup home, heat it up the next day, and it's still good!

Z_oxPQz_jppp8wR6LOSShA.text: Oyster Bar is a no doubt a hidden gem in Las Vegas, from what I heard there's an another location in Harrah's but price is higher and probably more crowded since is in the strip.  One thing I really hate is not the restaurant itself but the location. The casino cigarette smell is very strong and almost unbearable.  Our group came here in a weeknight, there is only two group before us but the waiting was over 30 minutes long.  There are maybe around 20 seating at top of that the cooking expect to take another 20 or 30 minutes.  The bar setting is a kitchen like those in a ramen shop except you can see the whole kitchen.  Food was careful prepare and you see they not rushing make your food and really take their time and not to avoid short cuts.  Pan Roast and some other dish there is a charge of $5 extra per person if the food is been shared, and you cannot do takeout either.  However, you can take back the food if can't finish it.  They gave you dining roll, which are warm and soft.  We only order two item, one is the full serving of Oyster and the second one is the Combo Pan Roast.  The oyster was fresh and mouthwatering, juicy and you can really tasted the flavor.  It was day and night quality compare to the oyster found in Bacchanal Buffet. The Pan Roast was delicious and was well balance in term of the soup; it wasn't heavily tomato flavor, the soup come with lobster, crab, and shrimp.  There was little bit of lobster meat, and decent amount of crab, but the shrimp won me over, it was good quality.    The price is far cheaper than the Harrah location but with more limited selection.  What it matter is the quality of food is not compromise here.  So if you are tired of eating of buffet, this would gave you a totally different taste bud.  Just aware expect a wait and the atmosphere is not as pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast (Lobster, Crab, and Shrimp)
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef cook in front of you.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q929vUVB6sN2-p2b5i2UTw.text: Love this resturant great service and food been there so many time and  So fresh if you like seafood I do recommend to every one

-rh4JEG2kUXwqJTIL087ZQ.text: MUST TRY: Combo Roast (cream of tomato w/brandy, crab, shrimp, and lobster) $20 generous portion  The dish is served with a scoop of rice, but I recommend getting a side of pasta because it tastes so much better! The wait can be long and tedious because the bar only has about 15 chairs and those waiting are simply standing in line with nowhere to sit.  The food here was one of the highlights of my trip and I still have cravings for it but Vegas is 4 hours from me so I looked up a local restaurant that serves similar food and found The Boiler in Chino Hills. It'll do for now!  For an oyster bar, their oysters were not that good =/ very small like clams and it was not the tastiest, just regular.

k0TMAg9YeYqRhDMXYahsRw.text: I am so glad this place lived up to all the hype I have heard for years!! I kick myself in my butt for not dragging it here sooner. I always made silly excuses not to venture here from the strip. Yay I finally did and I am sooo happy!! One thing you should expect though is a line. But that is not worthy of decreasing the stars on the review bc it is worth the wait. Not many restaurants are worth a wait but this place is. We got there around 4pm and waiting about 1 hour to sit (2 of us). There are only 18 stools that sit around the bar. You have an awesome view of the cook and can watch him create all the delish dishes. We started with 1/2 dozen oysters (shucked to order) and lump crab cocktail. Next time I will skip the lump crab cocktail-not that great. We split the etoufee with a 4 spice rating. You can pick 1-10 of how spicy you want your dishes. It was SOOOO GOOD!!! I saw some other people order the Pan Roasts which looked amazing too. I can't wait to head back here to try other dishes. The service is not top notch but you're really only coming here for the food not the service or ambiance.

f9YzcPTY1ofEtcGXDmuEsQ.text: As others have pointed out, expect a long wait.  Very limited seating.  Once you get a spot to seat and order, expect more waiting.  When I was there, there were one chef and one working the oysters.  But definitely worth the wait.  I usually let others wait in line and play some slots while waiting.  Pan roast is one of the best in town.  Its not the cheapest but that's to be expected from a place inside a hotel/casino.  One of my usual night meal spot.

RH06igSW_Rk29KeBqURLMw.text: The food here was awesome!  After hearing rave reviews about this place from a fellow co-worker, we headed to this place located inside of Palace Station, on our last trip to Vegas. Despite all the hype that we heard, this place really delivered.   They really weren't kidding when they said it's an oyster bar. It literally is a bar that seats about 20 people total. As a result, you will probably have to wait unless you want to take your food to-go. I think we waited about 40 minutes to get seated (party of 5), on a Saturday afternoon (around 1ish, I believe).   All of us had the Combo Pan Roast (since that's what was recommended to us) with varying levels of spiciness. My co-workers got 3, 5, & 7, while I had an 8 which I thought was perfect (but be warned, I like really spicy foods and my co-workers who had their 7s thought it was a bit too spicy already). The food was great. Our chef, Ricardo cooked the Pan Roasts in little pots in front of us, so you can see how fresh everything was. It's kind of a tease though, because you watch your food cook in front of you and all the wonderful aromas bubble in your face for about 20 minutes while you can't eat it yet. haha... If you like oysters, they shuck them in front of you was well. The lobster was succulent, shrimp was perfectly cooked, and the sauce itself was to die for! Portions are also very generous, although we had to get a couple extra scoops of rice, since 1 is really not enough.   We also got creme brulee for dessert, which was awesome for only $5 and Ricardo was nice enough to get us extra strawberries from the kitchen. We averaged about $30/per person by the end of the meal, which isn't too bad...  I would really recommend this place if you are ever in Vegas. Although it is off the strip, and there was quite a wait, it was definitely worth it. I'm glad we came here and I'm sure I'll be returning again in the near future. You just really need to have patience. By the way, when we left at about 3:30pm there was still a line for this place...

FZvk4uKgdR90SmI4rPHgvw.text: First... if you don't want to wait in line, I would say go eat elsewhere. But if you're willing to wait, it is beyond worth it. We went a little after midnight on a Saturday thinking there wouldn't be a wait a little later, but we were wrong. Maybe because it was a weekend, who knows. We ended up waiting an hour or so. We ordered the clam steamer appetizer, which was good. My boyfriend ordered the bouillabaisse & I had the combo pan roast. Both were delicious. The pan roast is rich & a little heavy, the bouillabaisse is lighter. It depends what you want, but anything you get will be delicious!

yZAvYY1AgKm2feZQ7CbFEw.text: So freaking good! Pan roast, clam chowder, oysters, gumbo. Yum Yum!! Very flavorfull, and they are definitely not stingy with their seafood! I always come after hours and I never have to wait!

aJMOX1Hxr_qxh8czOUSzWA.text: This place is amazing! Pan roast. Gumbo. Lil got rolls.  Chowder.  Come hungry.  Leave stuffed.  Enjoy every single bite!

_3dSr4P_suezG6uMq6pvXg.text: I was waiting in line for 10 mins and then a server came over and told me to get out because I had a baby with me. I feel like this is very unfair. NOT a family friendly restaurant. Plus the attitude was not necessary.

t0YyVum5sdj1ZZrkcual7A.text: One of my MUST for Vegas...and worth the short drive off the Strip.  My dish du jour everytime is the *Pan Roast* (sorry, let me wipe my Pavlovian drool at the thought of this amazing concoction). I love sloopy saucy dishes and this pan roast is packed with so much flavor! Although the restaurant/bar is located out in the open randomly in the middle of the casino floor of the Palace Station Casino, you'll be lost in the ginormous bowl of pan roast. I always have leftovers for another full meal and the servers are nice to pack up extra bread to help slop up the saucy pan roast.

a2iAPz-pRxqrAOzHYSvWPA.text: a bit of a wait, but well worth it!  i love getting the pan roast at spice level 7-8 and my husband loves the Alaskan chowder.    pan roast -  thick, creamy, spicy and salty, but goes well when accompanied with rice on the side.   i crave this every time i go to vegas, and sometimes this is what brings me to vegas (secretly).     the wait is a pain in the butt when its really bad, and i miss having the old chef.  the last chef that was there was very slow and getting the orders out and we could see that he only had one order going while the bar was full and waiting on him to quit schmoozing and start cooking.  by the time the food came out, i was already over it (since it was 4 am) and i just wanted to go to bed

hapwehThYiY7rDGWfC52qg.text: This place is classic.  The Cioppino is my favorite.  Consistently delicious!  Also it is nice to see the food being made right in front of you, the Chef looks like a chemist at work!  And, I like that you can choose how spicy you like it, from 1 - 10.     I've never been displeased eating here.  The one downside, which is why I rank it 4 stars, is that the line / wait can be quite long.  It would be nice if they expanded this place.  I would probably eat here more often, if I knew I wouldn't have to wait for a while!  I rated it 4 stars instead of 5, for that reason.  That said - if your in the mood for seafood and have the time, the wait is well worth it.  The food is awesome! :-)

1O4zyipt45UHRRO66y_QdA.text: This was my first time & was very excited because I had heard great things about this place. The wait was about an hour & a half since there is limited seating & only 2 men working. The Pan Roast is absolutely delicious; I tried it at the spiciness level 6 & it was just right. We also tried the House Gumbo but were disappointed; it was extremely salty. The service is friendly & they move as quickly as they can given their space & capability. I will definitely be visiting this place again.

AWV0nc05Dz4RjKkT7l0aNQ.text: Everyone says that this place is a hidden gem and it really is! First and foremost, the food deserves a 5 but the location and seating is very inconvenient. It's located off the strip, which is a total drag if you don't rent a car ( we all know the cab drivers LOVE to rip people off).   When we arrived, there was a max 15 minute wait but keep in mind there are only about 10 seats available, it's literally a bar. The oysters are good and shared the combo roast. Let's just say, one roast is PLENTY for two. You can either get it with pasta or rice, I highly suggest the rice! If you are with a group of 3 or more, I suggest ordering the clam chowder too!   I am a huge fan and highly suggest that you go there!

Li18SS-JseFGXxvnWrzqUA.text: One of the best kept secrets in Vegas.  I almost didn't want to write a positive review because I don't want the word to get out too much so that this place becomes ridiculously crowded.    Big winners here are the pan roast (I like the combo with shrimp, crab, etc) and the bouillabaise

1h-UUowAQFckIYhdFONLKg.text: This place has been one of our favorites! The smell of cajun food while you walk by just makes you want to stop and look. Besides the 1 hr+ wait, we don't have any complaints about Oyster Bar.  We ordered a dozen of oysters as appetizers which were extremely fresh and clean. Their tartar sauce gave the oyster just the right amount of flavoring. My boyfriend ordered the Boulibase while I got the Lobster Pan Roast. The chef will actually make these spicy for you, giving it even more spice! The Boulibase was filled with large chunks of crab, lobster, shrimp, clams, fish, you name it! The Pan Roast is still my favorite though. It's a perfect combo of Cajun spice, creamy tomato sauce, and a generous portion of lobster chunks. It's a must-try at this place! Make sure to order the rice separate if you are planning to share. One portion or "bowl" is enough to fill up any hungry stomach.  We're excited to come back here again. Now that they're open 24 hours, I can't wait to dodge the lines and get some great food.

OPHkPAHGtyVAPH9hwBGbuQ.text: First, the good - the Pan Roast is amazingly good, and the service is friendly and efficient.  Now the bad - the LONG wait, and the inability and unwillingness of the Palace Station to improve things.  I understand that this is a bar with limited seating, but several things can be done to make the customer experience better.  Do we (or our representatives) really need to stand in a line?  How about investing a few dollars in those electronic devices that buzz when its your turn, or if you don't want to spend the money, how about just writing the name down on a piece of paper?  If I don't have to stand in line, where do you think I'm going to go? Thats right, I'm going to be gambling at those slot machines that surround the bar and likely make the Palace Station some money.  But no, according to a Palace Station staff member, the management likes the lines and has no interest in improving things.  And lastly, some tips: 1. Call ahead to see how long you will have to wait 2. Go during off-peak times, and remember 1 AM is not off-peak in Las Vegas 3. If you get sick and tired of standing in line, like we did, go to the Grand Cafe. 4. Watch out for those pesky representatives - one person in line in front of you could actually be holding a spot for a large group of people.

2UcAXpRO--NTxqsZA-L6iw.text: LOVE this place. I live in LA and sometimes get an intense craving for pan roast but there are no places nearby that serve anything similar! So I always make it a goal to come to Palace Station Oyster Bar every time I'm in Vegas. The wait is always long because it's a small bar with minimal seating but it is superrr worth it. Just make sure you go with people who you don't mind waiting a long time in line with. Also, it is a bar, so make sure you bring your ID because you have to be 21 to sit there! The combo pan roast is by far the best thing on the menu!

PqdbBZHOFZUDJMMYnW1mTA.text: The Oyster Bar at the Palace Station has one of the freshest oysters in town. The gumbo is great too. The only negative is that I can't go there with my family because no kids are allowed near the bar, and most of the time there is a line because of the limited seating at the bar, but it's worth it.

wsNwjBZh4pIGkaU12MU8qg.text: Wow wow wow! Combo Pan Roast! Just do it... Seriously just do it! Amazing! Worth the wait!

noaLriuarrYg0nJMMw4LQA.text: Having raw oysters and seafood pan roast for breakfast may sound crazy but I'm not about to put myself in a 2 hour wait just to eat here. So, I managed to convince my awesome husband to drive me here after our 12 hour graveyard shift to avoid the long lines. Now, to make this review short and simple, the food was outrageously amazingly delicious, fresh, and so worth it! Get the oysters and pan roast combo. You won't regret it

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh and scrumptious! I enjoyed it and I never eat raw oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D3B57NtMejZuWxq1DdH53g.text: All four of my friends go the Pan Roast-- and it was very good! Pan Roast is not a "roast" it literally is like a stew or thick soup. In this case, they mix A TON of seafood in it. There's different combinations that you can choose from. The only thing is they ask how spicy you want it. I told them a 4 out of a 10, 10 being very spicy and my Pan Roast came out VERY spicy. Note that I can tolerate spicy foods fairly okay- I eat Korean spicy food on a regular basis and I love Indian curries. Later, I thought about it and I think the dish naturally has a kick to it, so if you don't really want it to be spicy, you should say "mild" because that might just equal "medium." Also, despite the awesome food, the wait is simply insane. We waited 2.5 hrs in a line that didn't appear that long. One of my friends actually got sick because I think she ended feeling very tired and hungry after such a long day plus the wait. So make sure you take that into account when you're waiting at the Oyster Bar!!

XLVYmXke0QAFyyPGN0wafA.text: It's Monday night, we've been waiting, two people, for 2 hrs and 45 minutes, looks like by the time we get to sit down would be 3 hours, we're so hungry, we can't even think straight,  this is bad management,  should have give people a pager or something

i_uTwps9K9P78cBNNuGVBg.text: I absolutely love this place and I go every time I visit Vegas.  You know it must be good if you're willing to stand in line and wait over two hours to be seated.  I used to get the gumbo every time I went but now the bouillabaisse is my favorite.  The oysters on the half shell are also delicious and very fresh.  This place is a must have anytime you visit. So just wait in the line and it will be well worth it.

FyyPvCSQr8xnalZqDf9uzA.text: Oh man Oh man. The reviews of this place is not a lie. This place is YOU-MUST-TRY spot in Las Vegas.  I enjoy oysters a lot and I must say, their oyster was largest and tasty oysters I've every tried.   If you come between 1am-9am, there is a "happy hour" with 1/2 dozen oysters for $10. Yes, this is awkward time but this is best time to come as line is always ridiculously long...  My personal favorite is Pan Roast here. You cannont go wrong with it. You can also modify spiciness (1-10). I've tried 8 and it wasn't bad at all. I love spicy food so please keep that in mind.   I would definitely visit this place again but during off hours as I do not want to wait 1-2hours smelling these DELICIOUS dishes.... It's a torture....

kFU6Jc483zNmWlhEzdyhgw.text: If you have not eaten here before, you must try it. I was so surprised how good it was. Friends kept telling me that we had to go there and I was so skeptical, yet after eating the food I was hooked.  The Bad was the wait. We went superbowl weekend and our wait was about 2 hours which was crazy. Luckily the bar was right next to our line and it was happy hour. LOL

kj1jprGd9_uZrS4zegNpIA.text: SO GOOD. This is my new favorite place in Vegas!! Our party of 5 got there around 1:30 on a Saturday afternoon, and we waited a good 1.5 hours for seats at the 18-person bar. It was definitely worth it though. Small menu, but everything sounds delicious.  BF and I shared a half dozen oysters, a combo pan roast, and a cup of clam chowder. The oysters were huge, fresh, and clean tasting. The cocktail sauce provided was perfect. The pan roast was soooo comforting and hit the spot, even on a hot day (thank goodness for a/c). The combo comes with lobster, crab, and shrimp, and I had trouble telling what was what, except for the obvious huge shrimp. Next time I'd try the lobster one just so I could enjoy that single flavor. It comes with a scoop of rice (2 if you're sharing - $5 sharing fee) and it just makes it that much heartier. We seriously considered going back the next morning for one more bowl before driving home. Finally, the clam chowder was also delicious - bite-sized pieces of clam and potato (not sure if there was bacon? but it didn't need it, if there wasn't) and perfectly creamy soup without feeling like it's laden with cream and butter. It almost felt light, if that is even possible. Add a dash of Tabasco and you will slurp that up like there's no tomorrow. I also tried a bite of the gumbo and it was super salty -- you definitely need to eat that with rice or add pasta.  I hear there's a similar location (same owner) in Santa Ana, so I'm excited to try that, but I've been warned that it's not as good. But, whenever I'm back in Vegas, I'll make it a point to come here and get some pan roast!

pZQfAzUwiTlutm_UfMKhnA.text: Excellent food, the wait was over an hour but the customer service was great. I had a variety of all seafood (raw oysters, crab, shrimp etc.) and all was really well prepared. i highly recommend!

bTg72EeZHz6ypZOFiNwzOA.text: went back again, twice, on my recent trip to Vegas, House Pan Roast and Etoufe this time.  Pan Roast was as great as ever, Etoufe was like a heartier Alaskan chowder, ie, more crab, shrimp and lobster but short of a Pan Roast.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. etouffe

-lQRoBxGbY6W6TvdWGYxZA.text: If you like seafood, then you need to be here, and be ready to wait an hour because its worth the wait! I had bouillabase and it was excellent, flavor and spice were to my liking. I do wish you could order liquor but considering how busy it is there I understand there's only so much they can do. Oyster shooters are a must! 5 stars because the customer service, flavor, and food were all top notch. I wish it could be bigger, but its a BAR afterall.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouillabase was outta this world!

L_uArPex71aoUbdqP-sc5Q.text: The wait for this place is really long, but I already knew that from the reviews. We went to eat at about 10:45 PM and it took us about 1-1/2 to 2 hours to get seated. I've eaten here before but it was many years ago and I have been wanting to eat the clam linguine from here for a while. When we were finally seated, I ordered the New England clam chowder and the linguine and clams with a 2 heat (spice). Mike had the New England clam chowder and the Palace Pan Roast with a 6 heat (spice). They serve a sourdough bun with your order. I really liked the bun (with butter) and asked for more. The clam chowder was good too. Of course my FAVORITE was the linguine with clams. Mike's Palace Pan Roast was also good, although I would've liked more rice to go with it. Yes, I ate some of his food too :)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace Pan Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine and clams

s6Y8xc-gUb8Jqn4jDvbaHA.text: Seafood spot open 24hours.. It don't get no better.. I love this place.. Everything on the menu is so food.. This is a must if you love seafood

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan clam chowder sigh clams, lobster, and shrimp with a side of noodles. Poppin

KWTHJUD944Rc9lYoWg22Kg.text: This is a hot spot over the lunch afternoon hour, so I suggest going later. Worth the wait in line and the food is  "nom nom nom" Watch your spice levels.

jXXCRhosr3Mfj7SmzXG6fQ.text: Heaven in a bowl!!!! I got the combo pan roast with lobster,crab, and shrimp &  it was absolutely amazing! Definitely worth the hour and a half wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast with lobster, crab, and shrimp!!

QlcOUz7Z2qNuqfUFreF01A.text: This is my third time here and it never fails coming here. Of course the line is always long it's like a 45min wait but it is so worth the wait I would probably wait 2 hours if I had to. The staff is always nice and they always keep your drinks refilled. I always get the Palace Pan roast it comes with chicken, crab,shrimp and sausage I get a level 7 for spice you can never go wrong with the pan roast.  I would recommend this place to any and everyone it reminds me of my moms cooking my mom is creo and from Louisiana and the food here taste just as good

rMwGljyWgjvfSOOhJiV6CQ.text: !!i mean hot food. heard oyster was good, tried, got me sick.....  The shrimp was good, cooked.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 全部都好正啊！就係生蠔唔夠甜，不過係las vegas呢種沙漠地方黎講已經好好了

w1MxOG4-zI209HITKDPBlg.text: OMG I love this place. The pan roast is just out of this world. The only sucky part is the wait!  BUT....The pan roast is WORTH THE WAIT!   It's sooooo good, they prepare it right in front of you, fresh oysters and clams. They must put crack in that stuff because it always has me wanting to come back for more!  ;-)   Seriously, it's probably one of my favorite foods ever!  I'm not sure how everything else is on the menu. Probably just as good, but the PAN ROAST is the best!!!
