2frJ7TloQznEJ7wHQLI9Vw.text: My husband went on Wednesday  night about 8 and heard about how long the waits are but decided to take a chance. We get there and only one couple in line. We decided to stay and we were so glad we did. We got the combination New England chowder and shrimp cocktail. The shrimp were jumbo and so fresh. The chowder was filled with crab, clams, mussels, and shrimp. It was good and so filling. We shared the one bowl and the cocktail because I don't eat much but it is a perfect size for one person without leaving you hungry. Will go again

tt4jfuBRGHOesLto3538tA.text: Open 24hour. Really good. Gotta try the oysters too! Bring snacks while you wait because the wait is Ridiculous!!! It's literally just a bar. If you come in a herd, gonna be hard to get seated. Otherwise, food is good and service is good. (My go-to dish is the pan roast). Enjoy!

I-P4fb3TLSv9AdvtOzFnDw.text: This is a MUST when you visit LV.  Allow lots of time to wait as there are only 18 seats at the bar. Everything is made to order.  My only drawback was the cook coming from the back into prep area visible to all seated at bar, opened and dumped bagged seafood into his stainless steel containers.  At least maintain the illusion of freshness and open the bags in the back where nobody can see.  If you walk by and there is no line, dive in and enjoy.  Alaskan Chowder was AWESOME! They even ask you how spicy you want it on a scale of 1-10.

n-FHj1fWBfVSn6BJGUNVSQ.text: Awesome food, come here every time I need seafood. Everything from the menu delicious and fresh. Prices ok, the worst part it's the wait, they have line all the time so be ready to wait at least 30minutes before sitting. I can bring ur family and friend I will recommend this place to everyone!!!!

qUafQLwngp0qon5DdbwPHw.text: Pan roast is amazing seafood cooked fresh in front of you what a show will visit at least twice on my next trip

7dtoGYrYzhZ-na5Wx4y8mg.text: Waited for about one hour and half during dinner time and it was worth it. We ordered three entrees and half dozen oyster. Oyster very fresh and big! I had Bouillabaisse sooo great. Full of seafood! Spicy level was 5 a little bit too much for me, would try 3 next time. Definitely would come again!

cD2QaHwyfCdTy3cFfUmeSw.text: Did someone say that Oysters makes you STRONG like a BULL? Yes, I said it! The Oyster Bar may just be the best kept secret in Sin City. I have been coming here for over 10 years and the food is AMAZING. When I started coming here there was never a line but now you will have to probably have to wait at least an hour to get seated. So my advice to you all is to get here right when it opens or you'll be waiting for a while especially during the weekend. These New Orleans Chefs are Freaking Hilarious....Bob (noon shift) and JJ (night shift). They will have you rolling the whole time. I always start off with a dozen Oysters. They have the freshest oysters in town and I guarantee that it will melt in your mouth. I have tried everything on the menu. So here are my recommendations:  #1 Bouillabaisse - My all time FAVORITE. This is a classic french dish made with tomato, saffron, wine, garlic, leeks, and seafood including crab, cod, prawns, lobster, mussels, and clams. Since, I am naturally HOT, I get my Bouillabaisse at a spicy level of 7.  #2 Palace Pan Roast is their top selling dish.  #3 House Gumbo - Tasty Creole chowder with seafood, sausage, and okra.  #4 Linguini with Shrimp Scampi - Made to perfection.  The price ranges from $15-$22. You have the option to have rice or linguini (extra charge) with your soup. Also, they will ask you how spicy you want it. So choose your number wisely! If you ordering a frosty beverage make sure to keep the glass. The next time you come back and trust you'll be back... the beer will be 1/2 price.  I have tried all these dishes but I am truly in love with my Bouillabaisse. If this place is good for OJ Simpson then it's good for me. "If your pants splits then you are in BLISS!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 24hrs of Gluttony!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouillabaisse w/ Linguine at a spice level of 8.

7Q14bG_UhpXuaVe9EpWp4w.text: For me personally, 3-stars, but I don't want to be that girl that says, "I don't like seafood, and all they have is seafood, so 3-stars." The place is called Oyster Bar, so what the heck did I expect?   However, for all of you who are less than enthusiastic about seafood, but have a partner, friend, spouse or parental who adores the stuff, be warned: If you try to make their wildest pan roast dreams come True, you will be making a culinary sacrifice. When you sit at the bar, you will be eating seafood and/or salad.   Important note: If you are with a group, and some of your group wants to gamble while you selflessly wait in the long ass line on a Friday night, they can run off and play. When you reach the front of the line, they can come back and join you.   Also note, that everyone in my group who consumed the pan roast looked like they were inhaling something close to ecstasy. They didn't seem bothered by the 40-minute Friday night wait or the $20 price tag.   Personally, I had a Caesar salad and a cup of clam chowder. If you're a dressing lover, you will adore the salad. It is huge and drenched in some tasty dressing. For me, it was a bit rich and overwhelming, but still a generous, well-executed Caesar. As for my clam chowder, the flavor was perfect, but there was sand in the clams. Not so enjoyable.   Still, I am going to stick with the 4-stars because I do believe if you're a seafood lover, you should take a chance with the Oyster Bar at least once.

lXDOQnR829OuKFmiBB2JlA.text: I was in Vegas for a "quick and dirty" weekend trip which involved the Rock 'N Roll racing series. I needed to do a pre-race carb load Saturday night so I pulled into the parking lot of the Palace Hotel (off the strip) to see what all the fuss was about. The Oyster Bar is located smack dab on the casino floor between the slot area and table games. Seating is "bar style" around an open kitchen area. There was a considerable wait on a Saturday night (30-40 mins) and it is a first come first serve basis. If you are looking for a taste of New Orleans off the Vegas strip this is indeed your place! Etoufees, gumbos and jambalayas prepared to your desired degree of spiciness. I went with the Jambalaya to fully capture my craving for all of the seafood options. I definitely recommend and would revisit!

NFkD6aGlNUPUcKpx3eEHqA.text: We have been here numerous times over the years and it never disappoints! Usually get the house gumbo and let me tell you It always exceeds expectations. This is a must visit while in Las Vegas.

4u4AZ5M6A0ik9vla2diP8g.text: Pan Roast Combo, that's all you need to know.  You wait about 35 mins watching the cook make 6 gumbos, pan roast, etc.  Once you get the Pan Roast (crab, lobster, and shrimp) you literally taste the harmony of fresh ingredients and layers of delicious flavors.  Be warned that the portion is huge. I would get one to share.  Incredible bargain @ 20.99

wodv2jhz5tYScO4esFyaVw.text: came here in a large group at an awkward time so seating was not too bad.  we ordered raw oysters, Bloody mary oyster shooters with absolute vodka, Lobster/crab/shrimp/chicken/sausage combo roast, some pasta, and baked clams.  OMG everything was so good.  the raw oysters were fresh.  the bloody mary oyster shooters were delish, the baked clams were baked perfectly, and the combo roast was to die for.  me and one of my friends shared the combo roast and it was more than enough.  it was good with rice, but we ordered pasta to try it and it wasnt bad.  anyone that comes here i highly recommend the combo roast.    overall, this was my favorite oyster bar experience ever.  really really good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bloody mary oyster shooters with absolute
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. baked clams

zrWeQiv556XwN22xn6JIGA.text: When you're on the strip and need a seafood fix... This is it! Walked in around 1130 pm, no wait and received excellent service. The oysters are very fresh and they have several specialty variations. The restaurant is small but joined to a bar who can mix up any drink you fancy, I suggest the mojito.

NU4YYqyM3-hl1Obn4b16HA.text: OMG I'm hooked! Went to eat here because a friend recommended it. It is so good had to go again before I came back to LA. I tried a variety of things on the menu since I went with a few of my friends and tried everyone's dish. Everything is good but the "Combo Pan Roast:" is THE BOMB! By the way if you get above spicy level 6-7 it will literally be the bomb. It gets SUPER SPICY. I think it just depends on your cook. I had 6 Pan Roast with one cook and it was good. Not too spicy. Then I had the exact same thing again with another cook and it was spicy. Tried 7 and was like whoa.. I can't imagine what 10 tastes like... I think I'll always just stick with 6. Anyways, its open 24 hours. It gets quite packed and up to 2 hour wait especially during dinner time. After 2am it seems ok and in the mornings it seemed ok so plan ahead and don't be hungry if you are going during peak time or you will be unhappy waiting. By the way for those of you who are in socal wanting this we have an alternative!!!! I didn't know but my gf found out from the cook that a ex cook partnered up with someone and opened one in Chino Hills called, "The Boiler"! Yay! theboilerskc.com Chino Hills here we come!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f9D8aKdeJOg_ka54amt_aQ.text: You should try the bully bass from here are very good they have such a tremendous taste price is fair as well

vgK4Fr3samAW9JIpYMcU_A.text: I have read many of the reviews and the only thing I can dispute is I believe the cioppino was the best choice. Second day to return to this restaurant. The best cioppino I've ever had and it's my way to rate many restaurants that claim to be seafood specialty restaurants. I would definitely order it again and we arrived on a Saturday at around 3:30 and didn't have a wait.   Love the services well as the menu! Definitely a must try restaurant.

bx7J1KOaYu7HzWG4rC00bg.text: The Alaskan Chowder with white sauce!!! Every bite filled with crab, lobster, and shrimp!! Will definitely come back again!!!

PFNGf0TKoWReTHrfs8EV1A.text: Best place in town for oysters. Always big, fresh and cold. The pan roast is amazing. As long as Ricardo is the chef making it.  I've been there other times when he wasn't there and the food wasn't as good and the atmosphere not as fun. He definitely makes the place.   The wait in line is the only downside.  Sometimes an hour wait on weekend nights.  But with good friends around time goes by fast.

DnpUwlRXq7oK20F8X1ASbQ.text: Worth the wait most of the time lol. Been here 4 or 5 times, average wait is 40 minutes. I call the cafe across the casino floor and ask them how long the line is before I drive down there from Summerlin. Always get the Lobster Pan roast, dozen oysters, cup of chowdah, and a tall beer. Everything is really fresh and they cook the pan roasts right in front of you, it's pretty much a giant lobster bisque with jasmine rice on the side. The service ranges from greatest to surly, and is always pretty fast. It's the only reason I'd ever step foot into Palace Station, that's for sure.

SZYdppsfxMli4hhLMT1I0Q.text: Oh my heavens! This place is such an amazing little gem in Las Vegas!   A ways off the strip in the Palace Station Casino, you'll find this little seafood joint. I highly recommend that you try everything off their menu. I was a little too tipsy to remember the whole meal but from the start my friends and I ordered:  -pan roast ( thick & creamy filled with combination of seafood and a scoop of rice) -Jambalaya (nice hint of spice and filled with mussels) - Gumbo (can't go wrong with this dish either) -Oyster shots (2 tequila & 1 vodka shooter) -Dozen raw oysters   Every dish that we had was delicious! The serving size was enough to feed two people per dish but you'll want to order your own and like most asians, make it family style to share! Prices are not too steep but well worth it for the amount you get. Don't leave vegas til you've tried this joint!

bP-5rkB0XO4w3-DKwOYzyw.text: Food-wise, YUM. 5 out of 5 stars hands down. The wait is the only thing that I believe I'll ever have to complain about for the Oyster Bar. Sometimes that line will just be wrapped around and there are so few seats at the bar, you'd guess you wouldn't be eating until tomorrow. Then, of course, at no fault to the restaurant, there are people dillydallying when there's an entire line of people waiting to sit down after they've finished eating. *Sigh* The things we do for good food. Like I said, the food is phenomenal. I am a huge fan. The oysters are SUPER fresh, surprisingly! But I really only go for the combo/"Palace" pan roast. What is it? I can't quite describe what a pan roast is, but it's a mind-blowing "stew"-type thing that, in the combo/"Palace", you'll have shrimp, lobster, andouille sausage (add for extra $5) and you can make it as spicy as you want. Truly delicious comfort food. I could go for it over and over again. I have yet to try other items on the menu because I can't stray from the pan roast. You've got to try it. Dare I say--WORTH THE WAIT.

SuVTr6XorGX9SlCDkasmfA.text: I come to Vegas about once every 6 weeks.  A lot for someone who's from Los Angeles, but the first thing I do when I fly or drive in, I go straight to Oyster Bar.  After my bags are checked into my hotel (sometimes I go straight there), I know I'm prepared to wait 15-90 minutes for a delicious meal.  +Oysters are fresh and cocktail sauce is money. +Order the Pan Roast with Lobster + Crab and you'll get a  Creamy Cajunish soup with rice --- absolutely perfect. I usually eat it with a spicy level of 7 or 8 out of 10. Everyone I've ever introduced or taken to this restaurant have absolutely love it. I think I've eaten here 8-10x in the last 6 months. Yeah its that good!

1_LODAdUuc0eVUtFmzFqAw.text: only been here once and never came back, not saying that it's not worth it, it's just my meal was average and the food was ok

GS95z0JIyP0PLoR_WTREDA.text: This review is based purely on the service (or lack there of).   We came on a Tuesday night at 9 and the line was 20 deep (ended up being a 90 minute wait). Our friends came the night before around 10PM and it was 6 people deep and they waited 30 minutes. Its really hit of miss in terms of when you go and how long the line is. After we were finally seated after our 90+ minute wait, we quickly ordered and didn't need to see the menu, since we had been studying it for a long time.  We ordered a dozen oysters and the combo pan roast. We knew the pan roast would take time and so the oysters would have to hold us over. Plus the last time we came the wifey was pregnant and she didn't partake in the oysters, so it was a must this time. The oysters never came and we thought it was because they would time it so we didn't get it too early and not to close to the actual pan roast (I guess we gave them too much credit). We finally realized they forgot when others who were seated after us got their oysters (20-30 minutes after we were seated). We quickly commented and the server who forgot was not remorseful at all. She kind of said sorry under her breath and was not genuinely apologetic. We were definitely unhappy about the situation because we had waited in line so long already and now the oysters didn't even come when they were suppose to.  The food was great and the main chef was awesome too.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiting for the oysters..
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So big, got to get the dozen.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast combo!

x5MxKUX5gQV0H2INihssUw.text: Wait time for both the line and the food seemed shorter. We came on a Wednesday at noon and I lucked out and only had to wait about 30 mins in line. It's unfortunate that long times would affect ones experience at the Oyster Bar because the food really does stand out.  Both of us had the combo pan roast and this time everything tasted fresh and it was just as delicious as I remembered it from last year.   The oysters were also super fresh and so delicious.   I thank the Twin all the time for finding this place. Every visit to Vegas will include a stop here for me in the future.

4wxqixeDOgMIFVU-1VAUCQ.text: My grandparents love their soups but cannot climb on those bar stools so I have to order to go. There's a limit on to go orders? Apparently, u can only order 2 soups per person. There goes their 20% easy tip for Togo order. Really good soups but lost stars due to not understandable towards elderly.  Brenda is the best server ever. She is the only one who I am willing to change my previous stars to 5 stars. She's friendly, fast, and has never gotten my orders wrong. The guy Mike there sucks. Not only did he forget that I ordered one of my order to go, he also said it's not his fault that my order is not to go. I didn't even blame anyone. All I said was I did order that togo. Please don't put words into guest's mouth next time. Just apologize and get it done. I'm in the service industry too and you suck. You have an incredible role model in front of you (Brenda), learn from her

E4cZBxbdecVt4LpAipUPkQ.text: A friend who lives in Vegas invites up for lunch to this place which is located in the palace station hotel and casino (off the strip).  It's actually about 12 seat around a bar and because of the limited number of seats and high demand there is a long wait.  The wait can be between 1 Ro 3 hours.  I think it's open 24 hours. The food is very good , cooked at the bar right in front of you.  The cook asks you  how spicy do you want your food between 1 to 10.  I asked for 8 since I love spicy food.  But I recommend 4 or 5.  I could barely eat mine. But it was delicious well worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZekGVck2u2IDlHjPMzC18g.text: The only place in Vegas that we have to go twice every trip. It's so unique and the food is amazing. The best is the combo pan roast. It's creamy, has shrimp, crab and lobster. The lines may seem short, but it's always a long wait because the bar only seats 18. This time we waited 2 hours before getting seated, but it's worth it! Just get a few people in your party and take turns standing in line.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Long lines all the time, but so worth it.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House gumbo

Vjb-rYrzHo0pwkQqJutWTw.text: I took my girl here for the first time and luckily we didn't have a long wait. After ordering the pan roast and the gumbo.....her words were....."This is like SEX for your mouth". Nuff said.

V7hz6nlQEKpJYEfiH8G4aA.text: I am an avid seafood lover and couldn't be more impressed with this place.   Oysters: fresh and not briny. Really juicy   Pan roast lobster vs pan roast crab: both were delicious. You can't just pick one. Try them with noodles instead of rice. The bursting flavors brings a warm comfort to that belly indefinitely.   Chowder: one of theee best! Fresh seafood all around. Definitely didn't disappoint.   Chef is hilarious and always has a good joke on hand. Beware of lines. I came here early at 9am and the wait was about 30 minutes.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Let&#39;s see it in action! Food prepared right in front of your mouthwatering eyes
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab pan roast coming right up
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now whose ready for the lobster pan roast ?

gsG-hQWxxjsiTBYeZyUJ0Q.text: Heather the fastest oyster chuckle in the West and a reptile lover, Victoria the Princess, and Chef EZ brought the heat and flavors. They made my experience very enjoyable. The pan roast and bouiles roast was worth every penny. The dozen Gold Ban oyster were delicious, fresh,and clean. The wait was about 2hr so be prepare to wait, but you won't be sorry. You will get angry, mad, and upset for waiting but once Victoria hands you a roll, you will be happy again.

XBSEd0-EHKPRFqGF9Qd0EQ.text: BEST PAN ROAST EVER. I usual get the house pan roast. The bf usually gets the crab pan roast. They put a lottttttt of crab in there! It's very very very delicious. It's pretty difficult to find pan roast anywhere else. Fortunately for me, I can go to OC and get Ritter's Steam Kettle! Still, Oyster bar is my all time favorite!   The last time I came here I got the cherry clams. Sooooooo good. I think it might even be better than the oysters. But don't get me wrong the oysters are fresh as hell and delicious too! Also during my last visit I found a weird object in my pan roast, they figured out that it was starch from the soup base that didn't get incorporated all the way. It was kinda gross lol but good thing this place has awesome customer service! They took it off the bill, as they should. I've been to place where they mess up and don't comp. the dish. -.- our water glasses were least full. No complaints here. YES, the wait can suck, but the food is so worth it!!   TL; DR-best seafood in Vegas! Long wait, but well worth it! (:

syZhHZkZURrC9_owlZlGnQ.text: Love this place! Oysters are fresh! Their etouffee is amazing!! The atmosphere is great! Must try!!!

fVuXtugx4xDdrEI6j7STyg.text: Pan roast is one of the most amazing meals I've ever had in my entire life. The first time I ordered it I was pregnant and it did not intrigue me. Booooooooooyyyyyy am I glad I gave it another shot!  I fell in love at the second encounter!  I ordered a spicy level 10. It was very spicy but still the bomb!  The last time I went I think I got a level 6.  It was still spicy but still soooo good. I can't wait to go again. I'm going to try a level 4. I tried my sister's last order which was a level 3 and I think I wanted it just a tad bit more spicy.  The fun part is figuring out your number!  The oysters are delicious as well!  The wait kinda sucks though.  All times we waited at least an hour. I'm excited to try their new location since it's so close to home!  The portion is enough for my husband and I to have left overs!  The left overs are sometimes even better!  It's like the flavors soak long enough for perfection.   Plus, the customer service is always phenominal!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yyyyyyyyuuum! Panroast

5B6GTKiPUPY_MSRaq0hBmQ.text: The Alaskan New England Clam Chowder was amazing.  With chunks of lobster, crab and shrimp. The soup was very flavorful and rich.  I don't like my chowder spicy so I got  a 2 which was perfect, I would say 2 is less than mild. The combo pan roast was also very yummy with chunks of seafood in it too. We got ours spicy level 4 which had a little punch but I would still consider it mild.  We had 3 people and it was more than enough food, they charge a $5 split fee.   The wait was long! Almost 2 hours. We got there at 1015 PM on a Saturday and got seated about 1215 AM. You have to stand in line for to-go orders too.  There is no sign in list, you just have to stand and wait. The food is great tho! I've had equally amazing pan roast at the Kettle Bar at the Anaheim Packing House so not sure if I'd do it again. I've never had better Chowder tho. Vegas has so many great food options so I probably wouldn't do the wait again, but I would recommend everyone trying it once, just be prepared for the line.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best New England chowder ever!

S6JE0CNfQnmG_AptR0-oEQ.text: Oysters are really good. Pricey but your in Vegas !!   Seek out happy hour decent discount!

Z_mi_dlRkFbgxiqV3duklQ.text: The first time I came here it was around 8pm and had to wait about 1.5 hrs in line, then another 30min for the food. The 2nd time around, we got there right at 12pm right before the rush came, so it was nice to not have to wait this time.   The combo pan roast and the alaskan chowder is just amazing. Every bite you take has mounds of seafood. The flavor is consistent within the chefs and honestly, the price is worth how much seafood portions you get. The oysters are actually not too bad as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

TJ5MH7wDr2GvaH1RJoGJFA.text: It lived up to the hype. We waited 45 minutes but it was worth the wait. The combo pan roast was fantastic. We also had the fresh oysters. FYI, Really large oysters. I prefer smaller oysters but I just cut them in half. Everything was great.   I don't exactly understand why there is a need to make people wait. This could easily be a sit down restaurant. Maybe it makes it exclusive. No matter what, the food was excellent.

oqAL6mABaC9VXBKgdypI1g.text: I have heard about this legendary place for a year now and I had the opportunity to check it out on my last trip to Las Vegas. I knew that the lines were going to be long so I decided to check this place out for a brunch opportunity after a night of adult beverages. This joint is located in the Palace hotel and is open 24 hours with bar seating only surrounding the kitchen.  I was fortunate enough to show up at a time where there was no wait and I was seated immediately. They serve a variety of pan roasts, gumbos, a variety of chowders and of course oysters. You may react to the pricetag being high but it is well worth it and the portions are herculean. After a bit of perusing, my company and I decided to order a house gumbo and the palace pan roast. They offer a nice bonus in the ability of selecting the level of spiciness which I took full advantage of.   They cook the gumbos and pan roasts right in front of you with such ease. They literally have multiple pots cooking up deliciousness and they are quick to clean them after serving and then making the next batch. The gumbo consisted of shrimp, crab, and lobster served with a side of rice. The Palace pan roast consists of shrimp, crab, chicken, and sausage with a side of rice. It is amazing how these guys manage all the pots but the end outcome is amazing. The real star of the show is the palace pan roast. It is a thick/creamy delicious tomato soup like concoction. They throw generous portions of seafood in there and what amazed me was the depth of flavor to the meal. The gumbo was delicious and totally different from the pan roast. It is a thicker stew filled with spices and okra with seafood delight. Both are a must gets but I personally like the sweetness of the pan roast slightly better. The portions here are enormous so definitely make sure you have some space in your tummy but not too much in case you have to wait for a bit.   I am excited to have finally had the opportunity to eat at this joint and will be making it one of my stops in every trip to vegas because it is JUST THAT GOOD.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View at the counter
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gumbo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace pan roast

6di2bcpyF92YCK1frSx9lg.text: Great food overall. For being in Las Vegas the oysters and clams on the half shell were decent. The pan roast was very very good. Tons of seafood tons of sausage. I was very impressed. The jambalaya had much to be desired. A little lacking in flavor. The cioppino was very good too. Lots of seafood and very flavorful. Excellent restaurant. However, we waited for over an hour but I'm glad I tried it.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters and clams
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cioppino
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast

O-y9nJ7d37YUaKiSkMlBuw.text: Food is five stars for sure. The only reason I give it four is the wait. This place has approx 20 chairs around a bar. It takes about 45 min from sit down, thru dinner. If you get there and there are 20 people in line in front of you, you are looking at 45 to an hour wait. We got there at 4:30, about 25 people in front of us and we waited 90 minutes.  All of that being said, the food is terrific! My wife and I split the Cold Seafood combo and it was great. We both ordered the Combo Pan Roast for an entree, 5 or 6 out of ten on the spicy meter, and it was spectacular! Loved it! Worth the wait, just make sure you're prepared for the wait.

LQ2A32lq8zi7pyJJB3oxdg.text: I am supper sad about this place. I've been coming here for a while and it was a hidden spot I love. My friend and I went a week ago and we both got food poisoning! Will not be returning.

dnfS2Z8veEEJDgnB3U5BLA.text: Seafood Pan Roast was a definite 5 star. BOMB DIGS. LOVED it.  Gumbo--2 star. I didn't like it so much, though my bf would disagree with me.  Oysters-1 star. I'm a huge fan of oysters, but ordered a dozen, and didn't find them tasty. I don't know if they use the low-end type, or maybe it was a bad day.   I'll stick with the  Seafood Pan Roast with rice, but with the 1.5-2 hour wait, in a smokey environment, I'd rather head over to Shucks and get the equally delicious pan roast with no lines, no smoke fumes.   Food is good. Would I go back again? With the wait time that never seems to go below an hour, I'm not sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New England clam chowder. Something was missing in here.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan toast with crab, lobster, and shrimp.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen oysters $20 - not too shabby

wghbkYr5ddp36k_Z7v15yw.text: Finally I got to try Oyster Bar and I really liked it! I disliked the line I have to wait in but the food is worth it. We had a party of 8 and they let us seat 5 first and the last 3 after people left. We got a dozen oysters that were huge! Definitely worth trying here. I also, got the clam chowder and combo pan with a level 8 spicy that I thought was perfect! My friend got 10 and added habanero (he likes spicy) but I think it was too spicy for him to eat haha. Overall the food is good and this is a must when in Vegas. Ask for extra rolls to go with your combo pan!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cup of clam chowder

ci3ZHfPtqMEBDlkaWTPEVQ.text: ** This is on my "MUST-GO" list whenever I am in Vegas! **  PROS: - Best Pan Roast in Las Vegas!  CONS: - Long Lines during peak dining hours  MY EXPERIENCE: If you have read my earlier review on The Buffet at Bellagio, you might have noticed that I stated that it's been a while since I been to an AYCE location in Las Vegas.  And the OYSTER BAR located at PALACE STATION is the reason why I don't go to buffets anymore.  For the same amount of money, I can get something I love and cannot describe myself.  You have to try it out yourself.  My favorite chef at the Oyster Bar is BOB.  Remember... The Oyster Bar only have approximately 16 spots at its counter.  Don't go to the Broiler (the restaurant next to it) because it doesn't serve the same quality of food at the Broiler.  If you go during peak hours, expect to wait in line for 30-60 minutes.  There are plenty of different dishes available at the Oyster Bar, but I always order the following everytime I visit: - 1 dozen of raw Oyster - Combo Pan Roast #7  (shrimp, crab meat, and lobster) - Bloody Mary Oyster Shooters  I have tried their House Gumbo before but think it was a little too salty for me.  The Combo Roast is a tomato based sauce that is sweeter and more to my liking.    OVERALL: I would literally drive to Vegas just to eat this.  I love their Combo Roast!  If I can eat anything as my last meal on earth- This is definitely it!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Roast #7
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters

osdg0aPN-BYm138vwFYVww.text: Pretty sure this is where 90% of all crazy Vegas stories happen.  Ate here a couple times last weekend. Visit 1: Nearly got into a fight with a berzerker Chinese tourist. Visit 2: Watched a large sassy black woman yell at guy for 30 minutes straight about Viagra. I don't even..can't..brain good.  Etoufee wasn't for me. Wayy too salty. Much as I'm ashamed to admit, probably a little too spicy. Learned my lesson. Got a 3/10 on the chowder. Perfection.  It's like all the seafoods combined. -Lobster. -Shrimp. -Clams. -Crab.  Creamy, hot, and filling. You want this. Especially at 3am after a night of raging.  P.S. Don't go at 3am. P.P.S. No seriously. Don't go. Epic line. P.P.P.S. It's not even like it's that many people waiting in line. They small batch it and cook it to order, so it just takes awhile for the food to finish. Minimum 1 hr wait.

lWHt5AhEJe9DcOIMMg2cpA.text: Love this place!   1.) Application to work here as a chef requires you how to cook well and spit jokes at the time. Great experience.   2.) $16 for a dozen oyster (not bad of a price) - I would recommend trying their raw combo, which is half fresh oysters and half  resh clams  3.) Pan roast combo @ level 8 spicy is right on the money! It is kinda pricey though. Looking at $23 for a bowl. If you're going to split it with another person, I recommend paying more for extra meats. The give you two scoops of rice for 2 people, but not the meats (of course!).   Thanks Bob and Delores.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast combo w/ a dozen fresh oysters

r85RoKnyXq4AJafIp25iFA.text: Nothing like this place anywhere.  There are other Oyster Bar's in Vegas but this is the best.  Sometimes lines are long since it only seats about 14.  But trust me...you will know why there is usually a wait.  Always locals in line and that says it all.   The House Gumbo is the greatest meal I have ever had in a restaurant.  My heat level is a 10. But this is not for the faint of heart.  You can go lower as my wife is closer to a level 5.   But I like the pain!!   And the vodka oyster shooters are the perfect appetizer.   Cold beer, spicy gumbo...great people.   Top 2 reasons to go to Vegas.   The Oyster Bar and the shopping.  Don't waste your time with any other Oyster bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vodka Oyster Shooters!!   So fresh and a great appetizer!!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Gumbo heat level #10.   Feel the burn!!

Fjee40FcQ0-1V4y1PlfmYA.text: Waited around 1 hour 15 mins for 3 people.  The worst part about the weight in line is smelling the food being cooked!!! Hints of garlic and spices fill the air!!! What a tease.    I loved the food!!! Got combo pan roast, oysters and a bottle of moscato. DELICIOUS! !! Food changed my life. The spices,  seafood and rice was all pefect and fresh.   If it wasn't for that line id be there once a week.   I suggest going with another person and take turns waiting in line. Switch off to wait in line and gamble. .. hehe.   If you've never tried oyster bar, its a must. Be prepared to wait. Be patient. I think if you go there mentally prepared to weight, its really not bad.   Yum yum yum!!!

7ZsCUSALYpQUmAvuQR-kGQ.text: I have recently planned a road trip to Vegas with my party crew and we changed our departure time from Friday morning to Thursday night just so that we could drive straight to the Oyster Bar at Palace Station to avoid the long line and also to have a pan roast for our first Vegas meal before the calm before the storm becomes uncalm. Yes, it's that good. Do whatever you want in your life, just make sure that if you come here, you order a pan roast and nothing else. Well, you could try other things because variety is the spice of life and all that, but just make sure a pan roast is part of your order. I prefer the combo pan roast.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whoa that combo pan roast though!

vr52fRW6vOAFCYScrEqY5w.text: The wait is super long, but the food is so good I forgot about how long we waited. I had the shrimp gumbo and added chicken DEEEELISH. As we watched the chef prep our food my friend kept mentioning "this food is going to be soooooo good, look he's cooking with love". Well worth the wait! From now on, every time I visit Las Vegas I will be sure to pay the Oyster bar a visit.

ASJsMpI2hreMpx71K57Ffw.text: Who knew about this place and how delicious it would be?!  My bf heard about this place, which is located inside the Palace Station Hotel and Casino, and he really wanted to try it, so we went late one night while in Vegas thinking the wait shouldn't be that bad at around 11pm.  Well, we thought we would be clever and order to go, but you still have to wait in line to do that, so we just opted to eat there if that was the case (kinda lame to have to wait in line for to go though).  The line didn't seem too long (about 3 parties ahead of us) but the place is really small - like diner bar seating only and about 12 seats total.  The wait was about 45 minutes until we finally got seated and we hoped it was worth the wait.  Other people in line were getting antsy and upset about the people sitting there eating and taking their time - dude, chill out!  They probably waited in line just as long as you did if not longer!  Let them enjoy their meal!   Anywho, our server was really nice and friendly despite working for like 12 hours straight.  We ordered the combo pan roast and the new England clam chowder.  We waited awhile to get our food - you see the chef cooking up each dish in their individual pots and it was kinda cool to see.  They give you ample bread rolls and butter to keep you occupied in the meantime.  The pan roast comes with rice that you mix into it and the clam chowder was delicious on it's own or with bread.  Both were really good and well worth the wait!  The bf said the clam chowder was better than Splash Cafe clam chowder!  Gasp!! haha.  It was one of the best new England clam chowders I've had, and the pan roast was different but really good too!  So glad we got to try this place and you know we'll be back next time we're in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the combo pan roast! Yum!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. partial menu
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the really good new England clam chowder!

x7IRZbE6KXTZ-UlIIiFltQ.text: OMG, do yourself a memorable favor and wait for the privilege of eating here.  Once seated, I found the trivia board, watching our food being prepared, and the open view of the casino enough entertainment as we waited for our food.  Their servings are generous so we split a Greek salad and we each had a bowl of the Alaskan Chowder and were able to select the cayenne level seasoning.  Undoubtably, the food was excellent, excellent, and most excellent in taste!  The hunks of crab, large shrimp, lobster were found in each and every bite.  We were able to have some left to take home, too.   I don't want to forget, the staff was punctual, courteous, and friendly.  Whether you're a resident or tourist, if you call yourself a sea food lover, don't miss out on this!

_ewtpDhG8pekpq1oU4428g.text: Is it over rated??? Maybe just a bit but they do have the freshest Oysters!! Located inside Palace Station Casino. A bar that sits about 12-15 people. No one under 21 available. So if you have kids, make sure you send them to the room because along with your wait and time cooking and eating the food, you need minimum 1 1/2 to 2 hrs.   Waiting in line was the worst part! Standing in that line and just walking over to the bar so often to see if people are done with their food yet. :-(  I love their little bar section where you can over sea everything right in front of you! From cooking and cleaning, it's so entertaining!   We ordered a dozen of the fresh oysters along with the clam chowder soup.  If I do comeback on a next visit, I'll either come super early or super late.. late meaning after 1am! Because we were still in that long line at 11pm! grrr.... But they are open 24hrs so take your pick of the time, but be wise about it.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

onD2jWRpApwZlkmwIOU_Rg.text: this place is delicious! Since they only have seats around the bar, the wait can be horrendous at times.  We waited 45-60 min for 4 seats.  But it's worth the wait. The oysters are really good, as are the other dishes they have.

zcsJrL8-rsX9n92uRxyoyw.text: We waited for 1.5 hrs and I was about to give up... then finally 7 seats were vacant and OMG!!!!! Amazing food!!!! I love seafood and this place just changed my perception of panroast forever!!!!!!! Will def come back again..... tomorrow! Ha ha!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Panroast I loveeeee itttt
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing food here!!!!

_gFjhbmj8ervCJ0SODrqTw.text: I love Yelp. How else would we have found this place? It's located inside Palace Station, which is a casino not too far driving distance from most of the Vegas action.  As others have said, it's a bar located inside the casino that is open 24 hours (wow!). Very glad that we tried this place out.  We arrived on a Wed around 10 am and there was NO wait. I think there was one other person there.. Either that or we were the only customers initially.   Ordered a small cup of New England clam chowder, which was tasty. They also offer a Manhattan clam chowder -- I never knew this existed actually, has a tomato based soup.   Then came the combo pan roast that I shared with my husband. It consists of a large bowl of creamy tomato based soup with shrimp, small chunks of crab, and lobster, all cooked in front of us. I did have trouble locating the lobster though, and I wonder if it was because it was shredded? We also received two bowls of white rice. It was delicious and we ate up every last bit, and the portions were more than enough. I will say that since it's creamy, I don't know if I could eat it as an entree every single time, but if they offered a cup/small bowl portion, that would be perfect.  I don't know how I would have felt if I had to wait 1-2 hours, but I think for less than 30-45 min wait --definitely worth it.

yLQzYEQWoIFUSiFEhxRx3Q.text: This place is awesome every time my in-laws come into town we go and wait in line and see who can order the hottest meal. the line sucks but the food is well worth it. the food is prepared right in front of you and the only feed abut 10 people at the bar at a time so depending on how long people take to eat is how the wait time is determined. defiantly a place you should put on your bucket list

N1gUkKELzN23wwYG69C3pw.text: Oh man we love this place! We had to wait over an hour the first time but lucked and only waited 10 minutes our last trip in June. Everything is just delicious, no complaints and kuddos to the chefs and wait staff as they hussle since there is never a break. They are open 24/7 but it only seats about 18 people therefore the long wait sometimes but so worth it!

Z6X8lKCIofJI_O2Fh15Q0w.text: This place is awesome, one of the best place for seafood.  Shrimp cocktail is always loaded with huge shrimp.  We usually get the combo seafood roast spicy #7.  The chef EZE is a super chill guy,  funny sense of humor.  Hospitable and entertaining at the same time.  He's our favorite.  Absolutely love it here!

ei-B0bbcM7dEYVCJKHt3_g.text: The BEST clam chowder I've EVER had!!   This oyster bar is very small and can only seat about 15 people. I arrived there late at night on a weekend (10pm) and got seated at midnight. Waiting for 2 hours wasn't not fun but the food was so delicious that it was worth the wait.

SPhJ_vf8aATX4lZWPYI8GQ.text: AMAZING!!!  The bf and I came here on a Sunday night at 12am. We had to wait about an hour and half. TOTALLY WORTH IT!!  Ordered: - Half a dozen oysters: Big and juicy.  - White clam chowder: possibly one of the best clam chowders I've had. Had chunks of clams with every spoonful. - Combo Pan Roast (level 7): pretty spicy for 7. Came with a scoop of rice. I noticed some people requesting pasta instead of rice. It's a heavy and hearty dish but has really good flavor. Every time I dipped my spoon in crab, lobster, or shrimp was in my spoon. They don't skimp on the seafood here - Bouillabaisse - The very light version of the pan roast. Pan roast it creamy, bouillabaisse is not creamy but has the same deliciousness as pan roast. Comes with rice. It's like a seafood soup almost.  The servers and the chef are very nice and helpful. Since it was our first time the server helped us order.   This place is found inside the Palace Station casino. Parking isn't bad, but we took a cab there.  Will definitely be coming back here everytime we're in town.

2acJKxZpmmPYO8tb6HQP7g.text: The OysterBar!!! I was so fortunate to have my friend take me there.  This is my go to spot for pan roast seafood in Vegas! Who would have known in the Palace Station Casino, right? But don't be fooled as the food is delicious and spicey (when requested).  Also a hint of advice, be prepared to always wait at least 45min.  There may be a line of 8 to 10 people but the line will take a while. Can't wait to go soon!!!

iyjEmdqOTih708HfYQWh4A.text: This is a must-visit every time I am in Vegas - the food is delicious, amidst the long wait. Cannot count on one hand the number of visits I've made here!  The oysters here are ALWAYS freshly shucked and every dish I've tried has been spot on. The mix of flavors just BURSTS in your mouth!! I highly recommend the pan roast. I have never had another dish that tastes like it! This has always been and will always be my Vegas go-to. And, plus, it's always fun to gamble at Palace Station a bit while you wait ;)

VHKPxuy_kw0cugb8oEgPqQ.text: The infamous oyster bar... forewarning: if you don't like waiting, this is not the place for you.   My first experience with oyster bar was back in 2008 and ever time I go back to Vegas, I always stop by (or try to).   Time of day: Saturday at 12:30 pm (weekend of life is Beautiful and I heart)  Wait time: sat down around 1:30-1:45 Party: of 5  Ordered: A dozen oysters: The oysters came out cold and tasted really fresh. It was sweet and didn't taste salty.  Combo pan roast level 4 The pan roast is my favorite here. I've ordered the gumbo my first time here but then noticed everyone ordering this orangey-pink bowl so I had to try it the next time I went. The combo pan roast has shrimp, crab and lobster. If you want chicken and sausage then order the Palace Station Pan roast. You can order the rice on the side if you don't want it in the sauce. 4 was a perfect for me but again I can't  handle the spice.    The service: They were a lot faster today. Usually it's an hour wait then an hour wait again for food. The wait staff was attentive and everything came out fast!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PbZpwhfw8OB7m_Xj4rPucQ.text: While I'm waiting in this line, I should probably start this review. It's 2 AM, there's about 10 people ahead of us and a full bar. Open 24 hours, you must be at least 21 years of age to sit at the bar, incomplete parties will not be seated, and you must be seated to place orders to-go. Since we did not make it to our night festivities, we decided to wait in this line.   We looked over this menu over and over again and still have not decided on what we want because everything looks absolutely amazing. With this wait and over 2000 reviews we must order absolutely everything.    After an hour of waiting, we were finally seated. And of course we already knew what we wanted. We were greeted with bread and our order of drinks. We ordered seafood jambalaya, the palace pan roast, and the seafood combo plate. We asked for our food to be spicy but he suggested that if we wanted to enjoy our food we should change our spice level to a 5 and we did.   The oysters were great. Add lemon, cocktail sauce, and Tabasco and it was the perfect oyster every time. The shrimp were jumbo. And we didn't get to try the clams because they ran out but we were compensated with more oysters. The palace pan roast was exceptionally creamy and the flavor was perfectly spiced and seasoned. The jambalaya was not as creamy because it's jambalaya but it was just as good and perfectly spiced. I mixed it with the pan roast and thought it was great  It literally is a group of organized men. They understand how long we have to wait and made sure our wait while at the bar was not long at all. It was really a great feeling especially being as hungry as we were. What sucked was how although you should never rush eating, but when you're done eating, people should be considerate enough to leave, knowing how long we waited and how long they had to wait to be seated. But the chef was nice, the people are patient, and the food was great. Definitely worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zRkEvvsegpOmPSW-mUPswQ.text: On the plus side, parking at the Palace Station is easy.  The only prerequisite is being is being able to  stand 45 minutes in a smoke filled casino.  Once you're seated the drive and wait will reward you.  The combo pan roast with shrimp, crab and lobster is amazing.  It's hard to describe but to it's a cooked down tomato based broth with the aforementioned and other greatness.  The oysters are also awesome. It's one of my must visit restaurants while in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

Tq97Gnq1R3BB_my2UAmf8A.text: This was my second visit and both times were worth the effort. Based on the reviews, we came here early morning to avoid the lines. (yes, oysters & pan roasts for breakfast  lol) The service is quick & friendly. It's cool to see the food being prepared. The seafood is fresh - tried both oysters and clams on the half shell and they're fantastic. Goldband oysters are only $1 each during certain times. (i believe mon-fri 5am-10am or something. it displays on their screen on the back wall) Also, last time i tried the lobster pan roast and it was out of this world and this time I tried the clam chowder and let me tell you... it was loaded with tons of clams, shrimp & lobster. Definitely worth it, even though it's pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam chowder
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters &amp; Clams In Half Shell

ATjgOmsqGGAmylWMx0EncA.text: Food that's worth the wait. Just like eating in NOLA, but MAYBE more delicious! I've been here a few times since I live down the street. I thought I've reviewed this place already as I've taken photos in the past, but here   Food: Large oysters! You can do a split with clams. They give each guest bread when seated. Food ranges between $6-26, $50 for Seafood Jackpot. One entree is perfect for one, but you can always split it with someone or take half home if ordering other items to feast. My Top 5: 1. Combo Pan Roast 2. Shrimp & Lobster Fra Diavolo. This one starts at 5stars of spice. 3. Cajun BBQ Peel & Eat Shrimp 4. Bouillabaisse 5. House Etoufee.  Spice: I usually get 2-3 stars because that's all I can stomach and I like to taste the food, BUT the Diavolo was 5 stars and was perfect!  About the wait*: The wait being anywhere between 30-minutes (when theres 2-4 people in front of you) to 2.5-hours (when the line goes a little past that first slot/Keno machine) standing. Great to go with someone so that you can switch spots with each other to go fetch drinks or take turn playing slots while you wait. There's always a wait no matter the time of day. I've only been on weekends or weeknights. The only time I didn't see a line was NYE 2017 between 9pm-12:10AM. It was weird.  *Make sure your party is present to be seated and all present to order. You can't order to-go unless you're seated. I THINK they close on Tuesday nights at midnight for a few hours to clean the entire station. I could be wrong. Maybe call ahead if you plan on going at that day or time.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Lobster Fra Diavolo. This one starts at 5stars of spice. So delicious!!!

KBtYBsJCaH-VfEOYwdbqBw.text: Last few times I've been lucky and the wait was no more than 30 to 45 minutes. This is my must do/eat in Vegas. Vegas trip is not complete without a visit here.  Pan roast is a must! I've tried the seafood combo and Chciken and sausage. Love the flavors and the kick. Oysters are so fresh and yummy.   Just wait in line. You must wait in line.

uLD0vTTa-VY_FtT8_bPFUQ.text: It should be fairly obvious that this is THE BEST Oyster Bar in Las Vegas. If you were to search oyster bar in Las Vegas, this place is going to be the first suggestion that pops up. I've been here 3 times in the last two years, and each time the wait was somewhere between 2-4 hours in line. To have so many people continuously willing to wait several hours just to eat here, well it says a lot about how good the food is.   So far I have only tried the Lobster and Shrimp Fra Diablo and the House gumbo. Both are really good. I always ask for it to be as spicy as possible but I feel like they are always too scared to actually give me what I want, but this tends to happen everywhere with me when I ask for spicy food. There are so many dishes here that I want to try, especially the pan roasts. I just wish I could eat here more often.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Gumbo with a side of rice
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine Shrimp Scampi in Red Sauce

stJ7wwpPy1Ss4l-FZJ68Lw.text: I highly recommend anyone that hasn't already to take the time and have a meal at The Oyster Bar the next time you're in Las Vegas. It's located in Palace Station Hotel and Casino but don't let the location fool you. I was bit skeptical when I read so many positive reviews but let me tell you it's hands down one of the best meals I have ever had! Just be advised that the restaurant is just a bar with a handful of seating and the wait averages anywhere from two to three hours. I personally waited approximately three and a half hours in line on a Tuesday afternoon. Everything the menu has to offer will blow away your tastebuds so do yourself the favor and give it a try!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Favorite: Bouill-Roast (10/10)

vZ8tVMAnsFJL2z8UPpvjJw.text: This place never disappoints me I can eat here everyday. Went on Tuesday 6/18 craving oysters and the Lobster Pan Roast and I was a bit nervous because it was a little early around 6ish and I was not sure how long the wait would be but it wasn't bad at all. Took about 30 - 45min to wait in line and get seated but trust me the wait is worth it. The servers and cooks are always friendly and very helpful.

sR2KN9Cy1jnEP8x7OWgjLg.text: Comfort food craving satisfied.   Late dinner with a buddy last Monday.   Average wait of 45 minutes.   this was my fourth visit.   Easy to swap out of line and try to pay for dinner with some slot winnings.   Bar was hopping that night.  We were eight back in line when two groups left at the same time opening up eight seats.  The bar was clean.  Our server was quick to get us drinks and place our order.   the staff was working hard and having fun with the guests.  i got the combo pan roast.  comes with shrimp, crab, and lobster.   Added chicken to it.   that was a ton of protein.  The sauce is a rich red sauce with tons of flavor.   My buddy got the Alaskan Chowder, New England style.   His bowl was not skimpy either!   Both meals were plenty.   probably could have split just one........ which is what my wife and i have done in the past.  The sauces were complex and delicious...... forced myself to put my spoon down!   Important note:   The casino is a little dated and the wait is a bit, get over it.   It's all about the quality of the food and the experience.   Oyster Bar is on my perpetual bucket list.

FQg1x7smfnx9zJvF4ciehg.text: Came here on a Saturday and there were 6 people ahead of us. Keep in mind that although they are open 24 hours that they only have about 15 seats so you can be waiting for a bit. In the line we were speaking with the locals ahead of us and they mentioned that they a) come here every week and b) there's always a line but it's worth it.  We finally got seated and I got the combo pan roast, which the server said was really popular. I like spicy food so I asked for the max level. It ended up not that spicy but the local said ask for the "lava sauce" and I did. You can get it on the side and it's pretty good. It adds a lot of flavor and spice but doesn't kill the dish. I would definitely recommend getting this.  I think one downside is I overheard the chefs arguing because one of them didn't wash their hands.  I would still go there but hopefully they don't have similar problems.

1psK1K0MmXJIWkxjBWTI4g.text: PROS: -One of the most delicious seafood places in Las Vegas that WILL NOT break your wallet =) -Seafood shipped from Lousiana  -OPEN 24 HOURS!!  FOOD 5/5: -OYSTERS (dozen $21.99// half dozen $12.99): These are why they are so famous. The oysters are soooo juicy, and they opened the oysters in front of you which was really cool! -Ahh yes the famous COMBO PAN ROAST ($24.99): This is a creamy stew with shrimp, crab and lobster. And you get to rate the scale of spiciness 1-10. This was HUGE & DELICIOUS! You can share it with 2 people and the seafood was amazing :) -New England clam chowder bowl ($8.99): I loved this; creamy & had chunks of potatoes.  I def want to come back to try their Alaskan clam chowder + pan roast + gumbo :)  CONS: -Long wait...there is only 18 seats at the bar & you have to be 21+ to eat there. -I went there at 11pm on a Tuesday night & still had to wait 1 hour. -The server told me people will wait up to 3.5 hours for their food. (crazy)  TIPS: -The server said to arrive there 6:00 am to 9:00 am if you want to avoid the long wait -Free sour dough bread :) -Happy hour includes: 1/2 dozen oysters for $10 from 1:00 am to 9:00 am

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen juicy oysters. YUMMM
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

pdSqtPh9gdqGMfPpgD_g1w.text: The Pan Roast is worth the 90 min-two hour wait, the only place I'll ever wait in line for! Open 24 hours so if you truly hate lines I heard the slowest time is around 6-8am.  The common subject while waiting in the line is "it's worth the wait" and it's True.   You'll be attracted to other items on the menu, but make sure you first try the famous Combo Pan Roast. A creamy tomato stew cooked with Shrimp, Crab & Lobster and finished with a hint of Brandy. Served with Steamed Rice. I add Okra.  $24.99  Sure there are other Oyster Bars in town, same owner too but it's just not the same as this 20 plus year establishment.  It at least you can get sit down service. Speaking of 20, that's the amount seats they have around the kitchen bar which is why the wait.  I also really love their Clam Chowder. If you ask nicely they will give you a sample.   The only thing I wish they would add is Crystals Hot sauce. I mean this is a Louisiana cuisine right? Thankfully they have all the other hot sauces that satisfy the heat craving. And I like it hot. With that mentioned, I usually get level 5 or medium so I can still taste it but enjoy level 6 also. Any hotter then a 7 and you just can't taste the wonderful flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast $24.99 with Shrimp, Crab &amp; Lobster. I added Okra.

TfOonMtjMqqg5qLSmfKtBA.text: Gumbo -really good flavor. The seafood is all dead and frozen and not cleaned well. The idea is cool and great but the seafood meat quality sucks.   Pan roast  -really rich and creamy. Not a lot of flavors. Really creamy . Really heavy too eat too. Nice pieces of lobster and seafood but they are all dead and frozen quality.   Waited 2 hours. It's a better choice than the buffers.

Y_wxFKL9S4965TzAwvlQPg.text: Finally made it to this place without the looooong line thanks to insomnia. Woke up at 4:30am and drove myself to this place. Walked right up to the counter, no wait, no fuss. I ordered a cup of the New England clam chowder, fresh oysters and clams, the bouillabaisse and a vodka Bloody Mary. Service was friendly and quick. Dan shucked those oysters like a kid popping candy. Everything tasted super fresh and well seasoned. I will definitely come back again line or no line!

sUelY1wTxM7i11GQH-9YlQ.text: I bookmarked this place over 4 years ago when I discovered yelp!  Not sure why it took me so long to finally get here and see what all the hype is about? But glad I did!  The stars aligned for my first visit! My mans boss was in town for CES and suggested this place as he always stops by so we came over at 5pm on a Wednesday. We were seated right away! I was expecting a very long wait after reading a few reviews but if you come here before and after lunch/dinner rushes you'll have a much better chance at not waiting for hours.   I love the fact that they cook your special pot of deliciousness right in front of you and just for you! I ordered the combo pan roast which comes with shrimp, crab, and lobster. So many huge pieces of seafood in it!!! My man ordered the Palace pan roast with shrimp, crab, chicken, and andouille sausage. Both of us wished we ordered them spicier as level 5 wasn't enough. Next time!  We also tried a shrimp cocktail that delivered fresh and juicy shrimp with extra spicy horseradish! Loved everything and understand why this place is so popular.

776SplZxc7O_X7lTHu7TXA.text: Heard this was the place for oysters in Las Vegas. Waited in line for just over an hour and was wondering WTF I am doing because of the lack of bussing the seats at the bar.  Time is money and money flows in various volumes.  The food was excellent! Had the raw oysters that were Huuuge and magnificent.  A must have!  I had the combo cioppino like meal spiced at number four which was perfect!  Server and Chef know what their doing here and their friendliness made the wait worth it; because after all, nobody made me wait. I wanted to try this place and I'm glad I did. You will too. Buss staff made this place a four instead of a five.

Its located off the strip in Palace Station with plenty of parking. We have tried almost all the items here and never been disappointed before. The only con for this place is.... there is always a wait. (even at 3am or 10am)
