78vk0kcvW_WRTJBGopwU9A.text: The food was very good, it is prepared right in front of you.  The only downfall was the line to get a seat which I anticipated.  The wait was only 1 hour and 30 mins and that was surprising considering it was Valentine's Day.  It was well worth the money and the time.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What was the Combo Pan Roast for $400???

nEBAx12d7C3zVMM1gGGiyw.text: This location is 24 hours.  No matter what time you arrive, there's at least an hour wait.  It only seats max of 20 people I believe and only 21+ is allowed at the bar.  I have been here a few times and mostly past 12am.  I usually wait an hour to two and would get seated by 2-3am.  The wait is definitely worth it! Not sure what's in their food, but it is amazing!  The oysters are super plumped and always fresh.  I always order the Lobster Pan Roast and you can choose the spice level from 0-10?  The lobster seriously melts in your mouth, like LITERALLY.  You cannot order this pan roast from any where else that's as good as this location.  When in Vegas, this is a MUST stop no matter what!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pan Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half Dozen Oysters

E9SaXBMneSVyFu9xUZrplw.text: AT LONG LAST.... I made it to The Oyster Bar. I have been to Palace Station many times over the years but only to eat at their 24HR restaurant for some cheap steak & eggs and such. I was missing out this whole time not knowing what this counter of seafood eating had to offer.   We waited a good hour to hour and a half. That was brutal. Not used to waiting that long but there are only 16 chairs so waiting is the only way. Even for take-out... I've been told that the wait is usually longer so I can count myself lucky. You just have to wait and you will be rewarded with some of the tastiest food in Las Vegas.   We started off with a half dozen oyster on a half shell. They are gold band oysters and priced at $11.99. Oysters were a decent size and tasted good. I would just go for the dozen next time. A little lemon, a little salt and a little hot sauce. You're golden... For my entree, I had to have the famous pan roast. It's all people were talking about in line and in the Yelp reviews. I went with the Palace Pan Roast ($23.99) and that comes with shrimp, crab, chicken and andouille sausage. It was delicous. The pan roast is a creamy tomato stew cooked in a steam kettle right in front of you. You choose the ingredients and they cook it right there. It's really quite amazing. The chefs have it down to a science. I've never seen food cooked like that so I was lovin it. The food tasted great. The combination of ingredients in the  creamy tomato stew served with white rice in the middle of it was excellent. I went with mild but you tell them how hot you want or can handle... It was such a good meal. I wish I would have tried it sooner. I've been going to Vegas for decades and have been missing out all this time. Now I know.  Service was great. The chef was a wealth of knowledge. Like a seasoned bartender except he's mastered steam kettle cooking. Our server was super nice and they pack all your leftovers so you can enjoy the rest back in your room. 5 stars... with the wait. Easy. Go to Palace Station. Now... You're welcome.

ERQQlnPl0XhYFd-yNT3D-Q.text: The hype is real and it is totally worth it!  I waited here for over 2 hours after years of having this place bookmarked I finally did it and it was amazing! Their oysters are amazing and their pan roast is amazing.   This oyster bar is a bar that only seats about 15 people located in Palace Station. This is so exclusive that You even have to wait in line to place a to go order. I could be totally making this up but I swear there's like a cult following for THIS oyster bar in particular-even though many of the casinos in Vegas have one.  Oyster Bar serves a handful of soups, stews, pastas, and fresh seafood. They are known for their pan roast, gumbo, and fresh oysters. If you never had a pan roast it is almost like a soup that is finished with cream sauce. They have you pick a spice level and I recommend going medium at least. I have to say I did see the chef using bags of frozen seafood, but my fish was cooked so well I honestly can't even complain.   Me and my buddy had a half dozen oysters on the half shell, a half dozen clams, vodka oyster shooters, and our own pan roasts. TheI had a hard time deciding between one with sausage, chicken, and shrimp or the one with shrimp, lobster, and crab I believe so we each got one. I have to say the sausage one had a depth of flavor the lobster one didn't, but the lobster one had lobster so it's just up to preference.    The food was amazing. The portions are right for the price tag- all the fishes are around $20-$25.  My one regret is not trying their clam chowder.  If you ever have time to kill then Oyster Bar is an experience to be had. Now I want to find out how the sunset station location compares.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast is amazing. I got a level 6 and it was perfect.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast is amazing. I got a level 6 and it was perfect.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clams, oysters, and shrimp.

b-HCoN3XWDgsqDqSAw-vmg.text: Everyone that has ever been to Vegas has told me to stop by Oyster Bar and try it out literally everyone. So on this trip I decided to give it a try. This small pretty much looks like a few tables on a counter and the other people will be waiting in this pretty massive line to get a seat at the table.   It took us two hours to reach and get seated. When we did we literally ordered the entire world. It was just the thought of having to come back and maybe possibly not getting full from our order, that we just decided to order a lot of different items.   First it was the oysters, clams and shrimp platter for starters. That has variety which I thought was a smart decision. Then we ordered two different types of meals one was the pan roast with all the different seafood in it. The other one was called the Alaskan chowder. Everything that was ordered your able to change the spicy level in the broth.   Overall everything tasted so good but sadly we didn't finish either soups. It was so good though each had their boldness and flavors plus texture was so good! I would suggest eating just one of the bowls and adding possibly rice and noodle to your order.   In the end we were so stuffed and for sure it was one of my favorite meals of Vegas. I would say this is a total experience and worth the wait that we had waited in.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan chowder
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters clams and shrimp

6A_XXATTYmQBIXNgwYRztA.text: Worth the wait!! Came here on a Friday late night at 11:40 and got seated an hour later. Everybody that was in line stayed in line because that's just how good their food is worth. When you're seated, you can see exactly what the chef is making right in front of you. We ordered the combo pan roast, palace pan roast and oysters. You also get complimentary bread while waiting for your food to be made! I loved the combo pan roast which consisted of lobster, crab and shrimp. I got it in a spice level 6 which was perfect for my liking. The palace pan roast had shrimp, crab, chichen and sausage which was also very tasty. As for the oysters, they were fresh big and juicy if that's what you like. I personally prefer small oysters packed with flavors so I might probably pass on the oysters next time!   I can't wait to come back to try their gumbo! I heard the line is usually shorter on weekdays around 2-3pm so plan around your schedule if you can!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast

KdZOuTdeySp1QCeLGPCjlQ.text: Had never heard of this place but my friend had.. So you have to stand in line forever(wasn't very happy about the wait) but once I sat at the counter to watch EZ cook man it was delicious.. The home gumbo was really good.. Of course it does not taste as good as my mom's.. I want to go back to try the shrimp cocktail & bbq shrimp.. When in Vegas I will be going back.. My only suggestion is to have it at a regular restaurant instead of at a bar so everyone can sit down..

_nHH7EGAYKiRK0vU5S8VcA.text: Had to go at 3:30 am and there was still a line although it was only 10 minutes. Totally worth it no matter the time or the wait. The seafood was so fresh and the flavor combination was perfect. Huge portions.

tt9aZsv25ao7nsGquAcX5g.text: When I read and heard that this place was small I didn't know it was just a big bar counter basically that sits 15. No wonder there is a wait. That's cool though, we got to chit chat with some local regulars who raved about the place, saying any time they have guests, they want to come here.  Luckily we came on a Monday morning at about 11am and there was a 30 min wait. This is located inside palace station casino btw. Hell, maybe I'll come to gamble here next time while my wife waits in line lol.  She got half a dozen HUGE oysters which she loved, shucked right in front of you. She also got pasta with clams, which was pretty good.  I got the famous combo pan roast but was said when they said they didn't have lobster. So just crab and shrimp. It was delicious with tons of seafood, creamy with some rice. The portions are huge with reasonable prices. The entrees are about $23 and definitely can feed two people. I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cooked in front of you
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really big oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast

0P1vCNpmvAemzTXYWZG82Q.text: My husband and I stopped her after hearing David Chang loved it. It's in the middle of the casino and there's literally a bar that seats 20 people. We had the combo pan roast + 6 oysters.   My husband said the oysters were delicious and they were full and large (if that's a thing with oysters). The pan roast was on point. There was healthy portion of lobster, shrimp, and crab meat in it. It's hard to go wrong with a buttery, creamy gravy/sauce but I appreciated that the flavor was very full of seafood! It almost tasted like a lobster bisque.   The prices are high per dish but the portion is big enough that you could split if you wanted. Apparently there's always a wait but we came at 330p on a Tuesday and we didn't have to wait.   Finally, the service and experience were quite pleasant. The servers were friendly and chill and they cook/prep the food right in front of you so that's fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 dozen oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast

Sf_mVqlW8sqTR1JGdL2-WA.text: I thought with all the hype it would be better. It hit the spot but not as we wanted.  Amazing staff.  Will return

osUiJLXCKwZHlyWORq3QEg.text: If u come before 11:00am on a weekday, there is most likely no waiting time. We came at 11:20 & ended up waiting half an hour    Combo Pan Roast: 5/5. This is the best dish here. It's amazingly good & hearty. Portions are super big. U can't finish this by yourself so I suggest u share & order another diff dish. BIG portions of lobster, shrimp, crab..... u need to mix in the scoop of rice or else it'll be too salty by itself. It's DELISH! For $23.99, there's SO much seafood! No wonder this place does incredibly well.  Combo Gumbo: Again, big pieces of seafood. It also comes with sausage & okra. 4/5. This dish will be great by itself but next to the pan roast, it was only second best. Also $23.99. Totally worth it.  Would I come back? Only if I come before 10:00am & there is no line. I'm honestly getting old & cant stand in line anymore hehe

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zJ0NlAiM3Abr7I-mOMMlRw.text: Amazing!!! Worth the wait so good  I will definitely go back the pan roast is amazing everything is so fresh and flavorful it's really worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vMsAMprvSQ1B5YIdiIsT_w.text: Sure, the wait isn't ideal but have you had their Pan Roast?   Five stars for their food quality and overall flavor. This place is legit for the landlocked state of Nevada. Their seafood tastes super fresh and the oysters we had were plump and meaty. They came in from New Orleans and hot diggity were they delicious - served simply with lemon wedges and cocktail sauce.  The Pan Roast combo was packed with shrimp, lobster, and crab. It's a large serving but I managed to finish the whole bowl. It's served with white rice and comes with a sourdough roll. My roll was a bit chewy like it had been reheated one too many times in the microwave but it was sourdough so the flavor was A-OK. You could easily share the dish but be warned that they charge you a $5 sharing fee if you take up a seat but don't order your own entree. The seating is limited so I don't blame them!   I'm a big fan of this place and my mouth is watering just thinking about going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gold Band Oysters with some horseradish.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gold Band Oysters from New Orleans. So big and full of flavor.

MzXNQBOIl3cEV2ovpYv3cg.text: Gumbo was horrable prices were to high I can make it at home my self and have 4 times as much and the wait staff was rude

URlrpK_CNRF4x7QcM4vW_g.text: The wait is long (the wait to be seated + the wait for your food) but if you have the time and patience, the wait is worth it!  The bouillabaisse was amazing but spicy** (even at a level 3, and we like hot), and the crab pan roast was OMG so good!  We've added this to the "must eat" list for Vegas! **After we left the Oyster Bar, I looked at the receipt and noticed that the bouillabaisse was actually not a level 3, but a level 10!!  Even though we ordered a level 3.  No wonder it was so spicy!  So in our experience, level 10 is very hot and level 4 has very little spice.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouillabaisse. BF LOVED this!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Pan Roast. So good!!!!!

AMhmgie7EdL5NEZZ2EvEGw.text: I have been back to Atlanta for four days and I am still thinking of this place, is that sad?  Oh a whim, my girlfriend and I, another serious seafood lover, decided to make the trek to Oyster Bar with about an hour before we were supposed to arrive at the airport. It was 7am, but the craving was strong, and I am SO GLAD we did it!  Follow the signs to "restaurants" when you arrive and just keep walking and you'll see the distinct Oyster Bar. There were about 8 open seats when we arrived and I'm now a firm believer that if you want to dine here without waiting the 2-3 hours in the evening, it's absolutely the smartest decision to get yourself out of bed to get this incredible seafood for breakfast.  We asked the manager and the chef to rush our meals after we explained our situation and they were incredibly accommodating, even going as far as packaging our food and joking to us with smiles. I ordered a half dozen oysters on their morning special - $10; and we both tried the Combo Pan Roast: SHRIMP, CRAB, AND LOBSTER for $23.99. Like literally ohmygosh, this is so delicious. The pan roasts are the way to go: they are cooked in front of you, the smell is intoxicating, and when it arrives it is hot and steamy. Following the advice of the reviewers, I ordered a spice level 5 and it was perfect -- a bit of a kick but not too spicy.  The service here is fantastic, the food here is fantastic, not sure why it took me so long to try this place but I will definitely come back every trip to Vegas from now on. MUST TRY!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast: so much seafood!!!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half dozen oysters

4GcR2B4YgEvMyIzxVsnepw.text: My cousin took me there for my birthday and OMG what people have told me about how great the food is was so True. I was so happy with the flavor and the portions. I had to bring food home and my husband and I ate it the next day for lunch. It was still just as delicious heated up. This place is definitely worth the wait time. I would recommend that you don't go when you are starving because the wait is long. Our wait was maybe an hour long but we just chatted while we waited and once seated were attended to right away. Definitely worth the wait and will be going again soon.

SIasp9zNun-XTZHcWeu6RQ.text: It lives up to the hype. Come with your phone charged and a good attitude because there is no way around the line. We waited about an hour & a half, but the food was phenomenal!

ogBD22z8sUbfez06JLmZ7Q.text: This is one of the best gems in Vegas! Forget about gambling, drinking  or clubbing. You'll be waiting in line for a while but it's totally worth it. The seafood is so fresh, the clam chowder is to die for. Service is fast, friendly staff. Everyone needs to come here!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WqY7hFoZJvqojM6tONv8cQ.text: I came in mid Monday morning and did not have to wait to get a seat. The service was prompt and friendly.  I got the shrimp pan roast spice level 7. The tomato stew was perfectly creamy and packed with flavor. I like that the flavors were well balanced and didn't have any one part that overpowered the rest. I also like how they added fresh chopped vegetables (onions, bell peppers, tomatoes) to the pan roast for texture. The shrimp were large and very fresh; each was firm and cooked perfectly. The pan roast didn't need any additional seasoning and didn't lack any essential flavors, so I think it was a great standalone dish. I also received some fresh, warm bread that was great dipped in the sauce. The rice could have been better, but it wasn't bad. This was a very solid pan roast.

bQa3dAGvOhSRm-q_WllBgw.text: I love pan roast. Came here on a Saturday around 11  am and got seated within 20 min. Super decent prices for Vegas - under $30 for a plate filled with huge chunks of lobster? The lobster gets kind of rubbery after a while though, so I think I will go with the crab pan roast next time. I also tried the gumbo which was very flavorful and full of yummy okra. The cook and entire staff are also super nice. Someone brought their own chopsticks and the cook just found that so hilarious. I am not particularly a fan of the rice though because I eat jasmine rice practically everyday. I guess that's just personal preference though.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pan roast yum

cbvHupj2iXdntCD0BusZjw.text: So here's the scoop:  1) No matter what time you go (24/7), there will probably ALWAYS be a wait.  (This is an indicator of how AWESOME the food is there) 2) The wait it TOTALLY worth it!  So stay in line! 3) The Pan Roast is so good, it'll make you slap somebody! 4) The portion size is enough to eat twice! (But it's so good, you may try to eat it all at once!) 5) It was one of my BEST meals while in Vegas. 6) Although the pan roast is not advertised as "cajun," if you have them to spice it hot for you, it is some of the most AUTHENTIC cajun food you'll ever have on the west coast!  (and I'm from down south!) 7) The service is great, and the chefs engage in conversation w/you while preparing your food in front of you! 8) This place is on my MUST visit list every time I'm in town!  Bottom line - Don't miss hittin' this place up before you leave!

RgJ38dDotlTLwHuTQqtstQ.text: This place never fails me!!! Even years later, the quality of the pan roast never change. I usually get the Palace Pan Roast level 7/8 with rice in the side. A hot steamy stew is so good after a night of drinking (Extra $5 if you want to share). I usually don't finish and save it for breakfast! The wait at 4am is maybe 30-45 mins long. Happy hours are from 1am - 9am. I love their raw clams and oysters.   Take uber/lyft to and from Palace Station. Waiting for a taxi to come around the AM is forever ... save time, same money take uber or lyft!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. palace pan roast ($23.99)
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. half dozen of clams &amp; half dozen of oysters

G9WF78tI4T8VFMCOReN0pQ.text: My boyfriend and I decided to finally try this place because of their happy hour!   Pros:  - this is the first time I finally enjoyed eating fresh raw oysters! I liked it to the point I kept craving the taste the next day  - chef D was so accommodating because of our long wait. He gave us a free bowl of rice. Overall, the man looked like he loved his job.  - the combination pan roast was mmmm yummy! Definitely can be shared between two people  Cons:  - the place was tiny. I've seen oyster bars before, and this location looked like it was half the size of the past oyster bars I have seen.  - even tho people would leave and pay out, the service of cleaning the table and seating a party was a mess. People would be in line while there are possible 6 open seats on the bar.  - happy hour was not worth it. Our waitress notified us that the happy hour only included a 1/2 doz oysters for $10.. was expecting more.   Gave this place a 3 because service could be very much improved

NEY_zInrIE44oOMjcRKgfQ.text: Have been hearing about this spot for a long time and now that The Palace Station has been remodeled, it was time to check it out on this trip to Vegas.  The 1st tip is to come early, I was there by 9:00 a.m. and there were a few open chairs.  It took a while to be waited on but once my order was in, your drink and bread arrives.  The open spots filled up while awaiting the food.  I ordered the Combo Pan Roast but I wished I had ordered the House CPR because they add sausage.  It took a while for the food to arrive but you get to watch the cook it.  Everything was good until the Big White guy cooking insulted the larger ladies sitting at the bar.  What?  He said: "I was going to say it's Thursday Big Girl Day"... again, What??  Don't the people that work there realize that everyone sitting at that bar are paying their salaries?  Stupid people Everywhere!  Tip to Management; Get rid of the guys there that don't know how to treat your customers.  You've lost one for life!  I will never be back there again due to this ignorant behavior.

KjKNacGmOy0-dtgvUf8__A.text: So freaking good! I was getting a little frustrated because the wait was over an hour. But once I sat down, I just knew it was all worth it. Staff was amazing!! So friendly and fast. And the food!! Omg, the food was sooo good. Oysters were fresh, and the pan combo was to die for. I can't wait to come back and eat again. You guys rock!

zcO9G0lCI7LXnHIzIj27pw.text: So don't go here expecting to eat a meal for like 15 bucks and it being fast. The line is at least an hour long ( usually more) because there are like only 15 seats and  they don't take your order ahead of time so even after you sit it takes a while to actually get the food. Will cost about 30 bucks for a meal. Just get the pan roast, it's really creamy but really good. You don't need to order 3 dishes for two people as the their servings are huge. Also Got the Diablo, nothing special at all...don't get it. Food is 5 stars, but the wait is a real bummer.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast and diablo

WBlhoLyayC5gBZyX5dlzbQ.text: DON'T BE SCARED TO WAIT IN LINE, IT'S WORTH IT!  I admit, I've visited twice, starving, and I just couldn't bare to wait.  But I finally got to try the magnificent Combination Pan Roast and I must say, it's absolutely delicious!  As first timers, our chef, Ricardo, recommended the top 3 things to try- 1. Any Pan Roast - seafood sauteed with brandy, cream, tomatoes, and served with rice  2. House Gumbo - shrimp, crab, and lobster in a creole soup with okra and sausage, served with rice 3. Bouillabaisse - French stew with shrimp, crab, lobster, cod, mussels, and clams.  We ordered the Combination Pan Roast, House Gumbo, and a half dozen oysters.  I waited for about an hour and I wasn't about to miss the opportunity of trying oysters at the Oyster Bar!  Upon receiving the order, we watched the oysters being shucked and they were presented to us as soon as he was done.  The oysters were soo good and fresh!  I could have a dozen of these to myself.  While waiting for our entrees, our chef and oyster shucker were cracking jokes and making conversation with us.  We learned that they only have 6 pots and 18 seats because of health codes, so if they ever expanded, it wouldn't be called the Oyster Bar since they'll have to be cooking in the back.  Booo.  Also while waiting, we had a sample of their clam chowder and it was just like what you would find down at the wharf.  There was plenty of meat and had a nice, fresh, ocean taste to it.   Next comes the good stuff--The Combination Pan Roast was to die for!  This bowl was jam packed with seafood!  The brandy, cream, and tomatoes made a thick and rich soup.  It was just what I needed since I had a cold that day.  My bf said Oyster Bar has ruined gumbo for him because now he can't get it anywhere else, it's THAT GOOD!  They ask how spicy you want it from 1-10.  I got a 5 to be on the safe side, but I think a 7 would have been the perfect amount to clear my sinuses.  For the gumbo, they say their base already packs a level 3 heat so if you order a 5, it's actually an 8.    From 2 people I've talked to while waiting in line, I hear their Shrimp Scampi is delicious, but I can't see myself ordering anything else but the Pan Roast.  I would definitely come back and wait for hours just to have some again.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Gumbo with rice on the side
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination Pan Roast with rice on the side
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam chowder sample

09pVXar_XTsPkaBBQCLz9Q.text: Man, this place is so damn good that on your first bite, it will explode your taste buds out of your mouth hole - exciting right? You bet.   You already know the food here is going to be good, I highly suggest the pan roast, it is the favorite around here.  I had the gumbo and the boullabaise.  The gumbo had delicious sausage pieces and the boullabaise was light, unlike the pan roast and gumbo, the heavy weights.   Why did this place lose a star? The place is way too busy and is just not adequately staffed, further, does not have the seating nor means to serve more more than 8 people at a time. Also, while this is no fault of theirs, some customers like to take TWO HOURS to eat their meal at a BAR. Come on man, don't be this kind of customer when you see a giant line of people trying to get a meal here.  Also, I'm sad they got rid of the 50 oz beer.  I'll definitely be going back but will be dreading that long wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boullabaise on the left, oysters in the middle, and pan roast on the right. Get the pan roast. Did I mention, GET THE PAN ROAST?
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gumbo!

HNBPAPoFwRerHb_yaB6gfw.text: If the review was based off of food alone this would be 5 out of 5. However the service was not. Not sure if the girl who was serving Saturday graveyard was tired or just flat out a grumpy person and didn't like dealing with late night customers.   We had no ill will waiting in line for 2 hours to get our spot at the bar. The aroma and anticipation of the food was overwhelming. As we were escorted in groups of two to take the seats at the bar from right to left, one of the couples in front of us made the mistake and tried to sit at the center of the bar. The girl who was serving rudely approaches this couple in front of us and scolded them for sitting in the wrong seats. The gentleman she was speaking to had no problem moving down the line to the right to sit in the correct seat. She belittled him and was flat out snappy and rude about sitting in the wrong seat. Of course he was a little taken back by her behavior and snapped back at her after waiting in line for 2 hours. After they had completed their meal ahead of us she made a snide comment to others that if he sat there any longer she was going to call security! Seriously calling security over what?  So we sat down and waited  for them to get to us for our order. We ordered an appetizer of shrimp cocktails and each ordered a bowl of soup and an entree.  We were served our soups and then our entrees and started to eat them. They were fabulous! Some of the best linguini diablo I have ever had.  Part way through finishing our entrees, we finally received our shrimp cocktails. No big deal, they were just as good as the entrees.  After finishing the meal the girl brought us a receipt of our tab. I looked it over and everything was correct and patiently waited for her to return to discuss payment.   When she was finally complete with running the other tabs, she looked at me and in a sarcastic tone says I need cash or a card to complete your order. Very politely I stated I am charging my room can I have a pen to fill this out? I then gave her my Id, players card and my room number. She went to the terminal and came back and said you are not listed I cannot charge the room you are asking. I politely asked her to check again to see if she may have looked up the wrong room. As there were over 250 of us there for a reunion and had been staying there for 4 days. Many of us at the reunion have the same name.....(long story).   instead of looking again like I asked she spouted off to me that she wasn't going to look again and that I needed to pay in some other payment. I then asked her to call a manager to look it up as I had been charging to my room the last 3 days and just hours earlier we had been charging at the bar.  Next thing I know I have security tapping me on the shoulder asking me to come with them. Mind you I never raised my voice, never created a scene or spoke to this girl in any hostile way.  After speaking with security for another 45 minutes, the hotel manager came over and apologized for her mix up. The server was looking at the wrong room with the same last name. Every time I tried to tell her this she wanted no part of listening to what I was saying. The hotel manager completed the room charge and we went on our way.  It's truly unfortunate to have been treated that way. Customer service goes a long way in the service industry. I know that some days we have good days and bad days, however it is never appropriate to speak to paying customers the way she treated me and my guest.   It's a shame because the product was really good. But the service was horrible.

nMUhq7tgB_QwYqzjQymTNg.text: I had this dish and it woke my mouth up! This is truly one of those dishes you want everyone you know to eat and enjoy. There is a video of how to re-make this dish at home and it turns out PERFECT! This is great news for fans who are miles aawy from Vegas and need their Oyster Bar fix! youtu.be/lq13M0gGZwY Super easy to make when you get all the ingredients together!

kcc95ZTxNExSZoWBVGHSMQ.text: Extraordinary food! If you like seafood then come here! Best seafood in Las Vegas. Service was very good too! I recommend hot dishes they are bigger. Enjoy the food! But beware that it is very popular and the wait line can be very long.

OZexjDTC-LnHo435U4NjUg.text: Delicious food, but we waited for 2 hours for 3 guests. If you are willing to wait that long, be my guest. Also, we had a new hired cook cook for us, and he did not know what he was doing - messed some people's orders up, gave the wrong food to the wrong people, let food sit out before serving it.

9nUacB8SQoUoq5gF1YT-gA.text: Got there at a good time and only had to wait for less than 1.5 hour! I heard that usually the wait is at least 2 hours.... but the food was totally worth the wait. The chef/staffs were efficient, fast, and friendly. ^_^ Food recommendation: Alaskan chowder and combo pan roast!! Sooo yummy!! So happy!! :D

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The aftermath..... very clean..... Haha!!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast with level 6 spiciness - sooooo good!! Especially with some steamed rice.... ^_^
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan Chowder with level 6 spiciness - sooooo yummy!!!

VG6sBCpYNJDXHoUlhGrbrA.text: Pan roast seafood combo was excellent. Eze is the best! I will definitely come next time.

sKEA0lwqotZJ-Dm6Uo3DBg.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!  WORTH THE WAIT!  Guys listen to me.. This place is absolutely unrivaled in terms of food quality and fun service.  Oyster bar at the palace station is absolutely amazing and if you're visiting Las Vegas this is a big local hot spot.  Yes the wait is long.  We waited about an hour and half but seriously this is worth it.  If you can wait in line at the DMV or for the new iphone you can wait at this place and you won't regret it, i promise you.   Service:  So much fun!!!  I've never had such a great time with the staff and honestly got to the point of tears due to the laughter.  Everyone seated by us joined along in our festivities and jokes and it was truly a memorable dining experience.    Our chef Ricardo was hilarious, knowledgeable and just an all around great guy.   He explained to use that they only have limited seating due to health codes and the pots they use to create the gumbo and pan roast have been used for ages.  The seasoning and flavor is literally embedded into the pot and expanding the restaurant would mean introducing pots that are new and not already fused with the spices of the years of usage.   We got the oysters which were freshly shucked right in front of us and tasted very fresh and plump, very nice.  The spice range is from 1-10 and they tell you that anything above a 5 will leave you sweating.  Personally I think I could've done a 6 or 7 but the 5 was perfect.  Just enough kick without compromising the True flavor.  I got the gumbo and it was to die for! So many blends of spices and served in a giant bowl.  You will end up taking it home which i'm not complaining about, you'll get to carry the experience back home.   Overall: This place is absolutely amazing and i never ever mind waiting in line for it.  This is truly a gem of Las Vegas and if you ever stop by, you definitely need to check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmm oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The gumbo!!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast creamy, tomatoey, yummy

wrv6LGyGwPx7Iu7wtTJrDg.text: Delicious oysters at 3am in the morning? Why, yes please!! This place is open 24 hours. After we arrived to Vegas, we were undoubtedly hungry after the long drive and decided to come here to satisfy our cravings.  We ordered:  1. Fresh oysters on the half shell ($19.99/dozen): the oysters are huge! Since you sit at the bar, you can watch the chef shuck the shells and the oyster meat is very big! Pretty much well worth your money. The oysters tasted fresh and delicious as you slurped them up! (5/5)  2. Palace Pan Roast ($23.99): fresh seafood sauteed with cream, brandy, and tomato. Our huge bowl came with shrimp, crab, chicken, and andouille sausage. It comes with a bowl of steamed rice. An extra bowl of steamed rice is additional $2.99. Overall, it is very delicious!! It is just as good as the House Pan Roast at Ritters Steam Kettle! (5/5)  The service is friendly and you can definitely tell that this place can get pretty busy! The whole bar was full of customers even at 3-4am in the morning! So that pretty much says A LOT! Will definitely come here again =)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen oysters ($20)

LdrB5n1Ya0udgFR8QAgpqw.text: I'm a seafood lover and this place has excellent dishes for all kinds of tastes. I love specialty oysters on the half shell and the clams

IRpn1ZIRbIuBHQBQZ9BlmQ.text: Yes 5 stars for the seafood rice and oyster. They are unbelievably fresh and tasty! And yes, the line is long. I really hope the casino can consider expanding this bar so more tables could be put down.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XyhIEj-4kGYPqjTjBTWziQ.text: I always go and they are so packed. It's very frustrating, but I love their gumbo, food is prepared in front of you, only 18 seats at the bar, no take out but well worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AC_Tc7wnK7wKN9BkVOy7Cg.text: Best of the best food...oysters, clams, pan roast,  bouillabaisse, gumbo, all that good creole food...pan roast is the one...get the pan roast...you will wait 1 to 2 hours, standing in line...and you will inhale a pack of cigarettes from all the smokers....this hotel has the worst ventilation, and you will see some weird ass people in this ghetto azz hotel... but you feel right at home and it is well worth it...but once you eat better go back to your hotel and take a shower to wash that cigarette funk off you...get the pan roast...watch the spicy level or you may feel the burn next morning...awesome experience.

pfObSg8ITgPZZguOaO37Og.text: This is by far the best oyster bar I've been to in my life. I've been to Vegas countless times and I shoulda known about this place sooner. It's going to be a must-have every time I'm in town.  Everyone has said it, yes, you will be in for a long wait. I was here with my friends on a Sunday night, around 7pm and waited 2 hours. Granted it was Labor Day weekend, but if you see the other reviews, it's like this pretty much ALL the time. But remember it's just bar seating, approx 20 seats. And of course, the wait was worth it.  We had the following. It was all AMAZING!: - Oysters on the Half Shell - New England Clam Chowder - Bouillabaisse - Bouill-Roast (originally a secret menu item)  Hats off to the chef who was working endlessly filling these orders.

v1hzqe9ejVCQ4QFgrJUqyg.text: Holy hell. The line was so freaking long. We waited 1.5 hours to eat here. We knew that there would be a wait, but it doesn't make the wait any less painful.   However, we were rewarded with the delicious food and the big portions. I got the pan roast with the combo of lobster and shrimp and it was delicious. They were out of crab which sucked, but the food was awesome so we didn't complain.   Def. recommend eating here, but expect quite a wait.

q-FnFBlSmxfTBI-kpZKf-g.text: Come here in the Morning if you do not want to wait in line.   We had a dozen of oysters and the combo pan roast. It was delicious! Although, it was kind of weird to eat oyster at 9am in the morning but glad we came and tried it out before heading back to Chicago.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oEHqvNfJC43xsbv9BnlW-w.text: Summary: My SO and I like to dine at Ritter's Steam Kettle in Costa Mesa, California (yelp.com/biz/ritters-ste...) and when we found out Oyster Bar was own by the same company we have to give it a try. The wait was long (1 hour 17 minute to be exact) we were behind 5 couples but it was worth it. Food: We had Cold Seafood Combination, New England Clam Chowder, and Combo Pan Roast. It was exquisite, the food tasted phenomenal. I don't know was it because of the long wait or not but at that moment I think it taste better than Ritter's. Service: The Chef was awesome, just watching him prep the pan roast and constantly making sure his patron were satisfied. Nick, the server/host was a tad unprofessional. So the Chef happen to place our dish at the wrong patron, no need to raise your voice at him. The Chef job is to prep and cook not serve. He was doing you a favor, helping you out and when he place my order to the people beside me, you shouldn't have snap at him. It still amaze me how the Chef just stay mellow and apologize to you. Not to mention when you were behind, he even step outside the counter to bust the table and seat the next group. Show some appreciation man. Overall: I always make it a habit to go to Egg & I (yelp.com/biz/egg-and-i-l...) for breakfast every time I visit Vegas and now Oyster Bar is a must also. I'm so glad Oyster Bar isn't located on the strip. Imagine if it was, I'm probably looking at half a day wait time. Then again, it is open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. So that's not bad.

tQbit_WIsz7045yh6NAvAg.text: Yes I was one of those who waited 2 hours, yes I got there on a 11:45am and didn't eat until 2pm, yes this was the Sunday of Labor Day weekend with about 14 people in front of us when we got in line (total of 16 active seats).  It was well worth the wait if you come in a group and some of you can break off to gamble and basically take turns waiting. They do NOT have a reservation system NOR do they have anyone to jot your name down and call you back for your seat, you HAVE to have someone wait there.  Onto the food, they are HUGE portions. Seriously unless you eat 1.5x the average person consistently, you should not get apps. Those bowls they give you (I got Alaskan Clam Chowder) are FULL of seafood, almost a pounds worth. Then the soup is another .5 pounds, or at least it feels that way. So much flavor and people love the chowder, and pan roasts. The roasts don't come with enough rice but I dont think they charge you to get more. Either way all of it is a ton of flavor, lots of different types of soups and all loaded with seafood. The chowder I had I would LIKE to eat as 1.5 meals and I see a lot of people taking a to-go container for the rest but hey I'm in Vegas for vacation, dinner must be had elsewhere. I would recommend this!   Note I have not had the other one at Harrahs, so I can't speak to the quality of it but I would assume the line would be MUCH shorter.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan clam chowder 19$

_bzOGTRxfj2LlEdNKoVrdw.text: Creamy  and mouth watering!!!  The wait was definitely worth it.   I ordered the palace pan roast and my boyfriend the house gumbo.  I love the fact that they cook it  per your spice specifications.  The kick on my Pan roast with a level 4 was enough for me; however my  man ordered  the spice level 8  on his gumbo... oh my goodness!!! ... But He LOVED it!!!     I will definitely  try to come back again... but maybe this time at 4 or 5 in the morning, when hopefully the line won't be that long.  :-)

eUkoziqh4HhvtQmowsaiyQ.text: For a 2+ waiting time, it did not blow me away, considering you get an amazing meal elsewhere for a similar price and no wait.  It is also located in a super dingey hotel casino.    I love trying to find a locals place that is amazing and the 4.5 stars with 1600 reviews would tell you this place would be amazing but its not.   I think the place is good because you come hungry and they have you wait 2 hours, so by the time you actually get eating, you are so hungry that even mediocre food will taste great.

iow3U09cVJWQk3uTDa5W8g.text: If I don't stop by Oyster Bar when I'm in vegas, I leave a little broken hearted.  This is the only "bar" I go to because I'm hungover... LOL. I have given over 2 hours of my precious life just to get a seat here... So ya know my love for Oyster Bar is unconditional.   The pan roast is so good that it's popped up in my hometown in Orange County.. Although he is former chef to Oyster Bar, it's just not as good.  Same people always working every time I visit. The chefs are really nice and easy to talk to... Even at 4 IN THE MORNING! I give props for dealing with all the pan roast fiends at ALL wee hours of the night for years on end!   The oysters at "oyster bar" aren't the freshest though. The clam chowder is good. The steamed clams are good. The bouillabaisse is good. BUT PAN ROAST IS THE BEST!!! I personally get rice on the side & lvl 8/9 spicy but I love my food more caliente!  DON'T EVEN THINK ABOUT SHARING... because leftovers are just as good later when you're drunk.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen oysters mmm
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New bowls!!!!

E8yJqn6XKkXzTQxf2uJvfw.text: First thing: you have to know that you will wait for a very long time. Think of it like a Black Friday type of escapade, only with food and no half off deals. We were super lucky to come in with only 2 couples (4 folks) in front of us. However, we still waited close to 45 minutes. And now that that's out of the way...this place has got to be one of the most legit shellfish/seafood joints in Vegas. Great quality and flavor. Customer service isn't 5 star but you are sitting on bar stools...at a bar and these guys a dripping sweat trying to get the customers in and out so the rest of the people that have been waiting for hours can have a taste. It's okay though because when you are finally seated your olfactory glands will be hypnotized by the aromas of the ingredients used as the chefs prepare everything right in front of you. Aside from the oysters and other platters they have great chowders and pan roasts that will leave you yearning for more. But no worries you will have plenty leftover to take home the portions are huge!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Clams
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace Pan Roast

Aj_ApvL8dRLoo6Mk66kC1Q.text: The only downside is the wait, but when I finally decided to go, it was under an hour. Food really hit the spot, and I will be back to try something else.

hilKKpd2KrxAdYmgQ1_c_Q.text: I've walked past this place on so many visits that it wasn't until visit 10  I decided to give it a try. I mean who doesn't want to stand in a line for hours while time and people pass. Glad I waited those 2 1/2 hours. !  Listen the line is crazy long but it's worth it. Pan roast is so good. I mean damn it's like God himself spits in your mouth. The 1/2 oysters were good but because there are only 6 I found I wanted more.  ( the last time I was here I got the full dozen and it was worth it. ) The clam chowder was really good. If you are sharing it the bowl is fine but too big if your eating alone. I mean after all you have to at least try 2 or 3 things I mean what's the point in waiting for hours. The chef is all business but can be entertaining to watch, I enjoyed seeing him prepare so many different entrees at the same time.   Look it's really simple. Just try it. I also found it nice to get to talk to other people waiting in line with you. Each and every time I've been here everyone was super nice and excited to he waiting. If you're in Vegas you need to try this place.

blH-5h1DVTUN6I0iYKi5ng.text: 4 stars for the food.  -1 Star for the somewhat cringe worthy behavior of the chef.   Advised of a tip to go on a weekday before between 6 am to 10 am arrived at about 9:30 am on a Thursday. There were 4 empty seats at the Oyster Bar which actually is a bar that you seat yourself at. The waitress was curt but prompt and took care of us with efficiency even if it wasn't overly friendly.   The fabled Combo Pan Roast did not dissappoint.   I ordered mine with crab lobster and shrimp at a heat level of 7.  You watch the chef making your food in special steel kettles that prevent scorching of the stew. The flavor was what you would expect from enormous amounts of butter, cream and a bucket of shellfish infused with Cajun spice.  It was rich, delicious and satisfying. In fact one bowl is probably enough for two (they will charge you a fee if you split the bowl however).    From what I understand anyone under 21 cannot be seated there because it is technically a bar.  So you will have to leave the kids at home and bring them takeout.    Great seafood stew. Maybe the best I've ever had.  It is very rich though and not something you can eat frequently. I imagine it would be very good if one was hungover.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast!

G7eB48AasTCOi9LqtpzBgw.text: Mmmmmm 3 star or 4 star ....   Waiting in line 40min Waiting get first drink over 10min Waiting my food ready another 30min..   I was expecting food must b that best of the world ...  Cuz I waited looooooooooong   My combo pan roasted soup was really good.. But think bout over 1hr wait for soup n couple of drink n over $40 bill ...  I can't think this is jus soup huh Wit big robster shrimp and crab huh But for me it's still jus a soup ... !   I've been curious this place long time so I had a good experience ...   But I will come back mayb next year !  Not like next month !

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roasted n clam chowder

Ka1ODyJrmdePqAMMpS2xSQ.text: $@,!:$,8/&2?;&;' goddamn the wait is long! But man it was worth the wait. Here is my review:  Interior: this place is inside palace station, one of the old casinos off the strip. When I saw the casino from the outside, I thought this place is gonna be shady, but unlike the casino, the bar looks nice and neat!  Customer service: my girl and I got there around 915 and got seated after an hour. We had to wait another 45 mins to get our food. They could seriously expand or give people a piece of bread while waiting. I went there hungry and almost died before eating. Another thing that bothered me is the staff. The chef was kinda cold when the ladies next to us were joking and waitress wasn't any better. She was jus spotty.   At this point, you might wonder why I give this place five stars.. The game changer..  Food: the combo pan roast was jus redunk. I never had anything similar before. The soup was creamy and rich. The lobster, crab, and shrimp were harmoniously dancing around in the soup while I was indulging myself.   I was desperate, hungry and miserable while waiting but all is forgiven. I salute you, oyster bar. I'll never forget you!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast: shrimp, lobster, and crabmeat!

3K0p-2pS8zkXEQgixuQsQw.text: My friends and I came here on a Mon night (around 9:30PM), and we still had to wait about 2 hours. Despite all this, I do think it was worth it just to try their famous pan roast!! Bf and I got two orders of the pan roast seafood combo and some raw oysters to share. The oysters were super disappointing-- there was NO oyster flavor whatsoever and it just tasted very bland.  The pan roast was amazing though, super hearty and rich. It's great if you're really hungry like we were, which I'm sure you will be by the time you get seated. I liked watching the chefs cook right in front of us. Would I come here again? I think so... the only reason why I wouldn't give them a 5 is because of the long wait and the mediocre oysters. Otherwise, the pan roast was great! The large portions are good enough for two people to share :)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast and oysters

nFYBYnp_HDWLyrPUSKtP-w.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Las Vegas.  The pan roast is out of this world!  The first time I came was at 11a on a Saturday.  I learned my lesson after what looked like a one hour wait turned into a 3 hour wait (because two people in front of me had large parties that you couldn't tell from the one person representing them).   Now, I try to come early (today,  on a Saturday 8a-I walked right up) when people are still sleeping.  I almost always get mine to go because it is too rich to eat on my own and my underage daughter can't come here (you can only do this if you're seated).   The staff is friendly and if you come at the right time (or if you don't and have lots of patience),  this is one of the best and most affordable places to eat in Vegas. For the quality of the food-I'd pay a lot more but don't tell the management!

iLLl3Jiocr4Ro7beMT1y-A.text: Oyster Bar is bomb!! If you like any sort of seafood or Cajun-style food you MUST try this place out.   The line's usually long during peak hours (hour+ wait anyone??) but it's worth it! The bar is very small, only 18 seats so you have to wait for everyone to finish before you can get seated and that's why the wait is so long. It's open 24/7 so I would suggest coming at random times - like at 2am - if you want to avoid the line LOL. But keep in mind that you need to be 21+ to sit at the bar! There are no tables or other seating so basically, you have to be 21+ to even eat here. Unless you get to-go.  FOOD The fresh raw oysters here are HUGE!! I've never seen oysters that big and they're fresh too! Their pan roasts and gumbo have spiciness levels 1-10. Level 10 will make you sweat balls and it's the only level that includes habaneros. I love spicy foods and level 10 is a bit too much for me. It will definitely set your butthole on fire afterwards, I guarantee that!  Portions are pretty large too, so I always have leftovers to take home. They actually charge you an extra $5 if you choose to share a bowl with another person, so I would just get your own and then take it to-go later.  The prices are a bit high for the amount you get, but the food is so delicious you will have no qualms about spending $30 on a bowl of food! My suggestions:  - shrimp and lobster diablo - palace pan roast - fresh oysters - gumbo  SERVICE Dolores is so funny! She's an awesome server and we tipped 20% (even though we are usually stingy with tips) because of her! The staff are all great and wear many hats. The cooks also clean and the servers also prep food just because there are only a couple people working. They are very personable and love talking to their guests!  OVERALL Love Oyster Bar! The whole process is quite long - from first standing in line to signing our check, it took 2.5 hours. But the food is sooo worth it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and lobster fra diablo - $24
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is how big the bar is

ygXNYnnUte6vWHGo3n46sg.text: I don't post a lot of 5 star reviews, but this place deserves it.  Prepare to stand in line for at least an hour.  Typical wait times are 2+ hours, and they don't take reservations.  Why would people stand in line that long when there's hundreds of other places to eat?  Try it and find out.  One would think that the anticipation of waiting that long would make the ultimate reward less than expectations, but that is not the case here.  Everything we had was top notch, from the caesar salad, to the fresh oysters, to the gumbo and Cioppino.  And when I say top notch, I mean the gumbo was as good as I've had at the best New Orleans restaurants and the Cioppino as good as any I've had including at my favorite, the Tadich Grill in San Francisco.  They make each order from scratch and they custom-spice it for you.  Beware on this.  Take heed.  Unless you really, really can handle spicy hot, keep things at 5 or below (on a 1-10 scale).  The menu has so many different things on it that you could eat there every day for a couple of weeks straight and not get bored.  The servers are friendly, efficient, and it's a great place to strike up a conversation with others at the bar.  So try it next time you're in Vegas, but don't tell anyone else about it.  We don't need those lines to be any longer...:)

bxukH1Vm0VgzltCEkEd35A.text: The food is DELICIOUS. Everything was so great. I highly recommend the PAN ROAST. We surprisingly waited only around an hour - according to other posts, I was expecting longer. I am only giving them four stars because THEY NEED MORE SEATING. If they expanded and opened up a larger restaurant, business would be incredible. I'm telling you - TRY THIS PLACE!!!!!!   The servers were friendly. They make the food right in front of you. Large portions so the price you pay is reasonable as well. Especially in Vegas ;)  I'm going to stress again - LEAVE THE STRIP TO TRY THIS PLACE.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu is on tv screen that keeps changing to the diff pages. **PAN ROAST** they make food in front of u.

1R3CL-iLV5TjQlLz_WrPNw.text: Best oyster bar in Las Vegas hands down!! Mr Eze blessed us with a wonderful meal  Cajun BBQ shrimp (peel) and Pan roast

A_AtGW7t1vgt0MBEa2nJVw.text: The stars and amount of reviews say it all. Pan roast (level 5) and oysters rocked my thanksgiving night. Even though it was midnite, we still waited an hour. It was worth every minute of the wait. Do not come here starving because of the wait. Have a snack beforehand and you will be set for bliss when you get seated. Also if you come between 1am-9am, there's a sweet happy hour on oysters and drinks.  I think the chefs name is Holoman or soloman... Either way- he creates culinary delights!

A9UM1moTnPmkS1hjRKyJbQ.text: If you come to this bar craving a big bowl of Southern comfort food or a plate of oysters and there isn't a big wait, it's definitely worth it. You'll need a car to get here from the strip since it's in the Palace Station casino.  The Pan Roast with rice and Alaskan Clam Chowder each boasted above-average portions of seafood and came swimming in a highly caloric melange of creamy butter, oil, and mysterious pre-made special sauces dispensed from metal canteens.  They plate your food in front of you which is exciting yet agonizing if you're still waiting in line. The bar seats about 15 people. Our party of 7 had to be split up and we ended up waiting over 2 hours for the first 3 of us to be seated. Although there might have been 10-15 people in front of us it still took us this long to get our nom on.. And thus I call it risky to rely on this as your first meal of the day if you're famished and hungover.    Coming from California and having tried seafood in port cities around the globe, I don't think this place was actually that remarkable. The seafood was frozen (remember, Vegas is a desert and nowhere near the ocean) but of acceptable quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan Clam Chowder

0B7SISjVJhjRDy1Ys_qmMA.text: The wait to be seated is about 2 hours for Friday lunch at 12 pm...wait is worth it for first time.  Gumbo was salty. Watch out for the chef, there's only one.  He touched the tips ( cash ) and didn't change gloves while opening the oysters on the half shelf.  Yikes! I guess that's why it's so tasty. Highly recommend the pan roast. Especially the lobster pan roast.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar seating

ozteL03L00D8zdTKNaWVKg.text: This place is so good, but not 3.5 hours of waiting good. Yes, you read right i waited 3.5 hours to indulge in a big bowl of Pan roast and oysters. I also listen to my friend's advice and came at a random time like 2-3 PM but definitely if i  ever want to eat here again  i am going to come at like 4-5 AM for a 30 minute wait time. Haha   I tried the:  The palace pan roast: Super fresh, cheesy, and delicious  The gumbo: delicious as well but prefer the Pan Roast  Oyster: SO DAMN FRESH Clam Chowder: fresh with lots of oysters and not too salty  TIP: portions are huge and shareable so do not try to eat a Pan Roast by yourself, sharing a plate is $5 extra i believe but you get an extra scoop of rice.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super fresh oysters

9kOLNlJUW5oc5rdvgV7VZg.text: Super delicious. Had the jambalaya and so did my boyfriend. We waited almost two hours :(  Which sucked but it was totally worth it . I would wait it all over again. I really enjoyed the atmosphere and the chef who was preparing food right in front of us was very professional and personable. I will return.

DWjyGws21E_x6sXfHImodw.text: This bar has my favorite oysters. Hands down. I used to dislike oysters, but man this place has changed my mind about them; I've never had oysters so fresh and delicious. ($13)  The palace pan roast ($24)- shrimp, crab, lobster, and andouille sausage (and chicken which they don't mention). I usually get my spice level at around 7/8 and damn is it good. The spice adds a kick which already adds on to the yummy goodness that leaves your stomach extremely happy and satisfied. The clam chowder is also yummy, but it's not as special as their pan roast.  The only part that is lacking is their service- a bit slow, and you usually have to flag them down to get their attention and it takes forever for the food. But hey, the food speaks louder than their service.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half dozen of the best oysters ever
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House pan roast mmmm

tZsYjwAMzGy-D63dE-LOeA.text: Well worth the 2 hour wait. We took shifts standing in line, going to the bar and playing def helped make the time go by faster. The staff is friendly and up beat. I ordered the pan roast level 4 and oysters of course! And the jambalaya spicy level 7. Couldn't finish it all and took the rest home.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Had to get the dozen after the wait. 1/2 priced after 10pm!

9l5oB7EOLCkCKVopczfjCg.text: I've been coming here for 12 years and it's always been a great five-star Pan Roast.  Yes there is always a long wait if you plan to eat during the times other regular people of society eat but if you ever find yourself hungry and awake at like 4 AM or if your someone who craves seafood at 9 AM then you'll never have to worry about that line. Lol  Order the combo pan roast or the bouillabaisse. They truly are the best dishes there. I'm not an oyster eater but I've heard nothing but great things from others about the oysters.    I love Palace station oyster bar I only wish it was bigger.

ElRZME_JnSA5qavHPBXYyg.text: Delicious. Gotta get some more here soon. I feel empty without em. The wasabi ones are killer.

IJpAgvqxWlcYBUxb1MfjGQ.text: Waited about an hour..this place only has about a dozen or so seats. If you don't feel like waiting you can always hit up the blackjack or craps tables which are a few steps away.   BUT OHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH MY FUCKING GOD THAT PAN ROAST IS SO WORTH IT.

zGow6y6GNxtpyByTomblzA.text: Never Again. I came to Oyster Bar around 1:00AM, with the reasoning: How bad could it be? Coming back from Hakkasan, we were a little tipsy and a lot a bit hungry, so we reasoned that it'd be a great time to try to beat the line and get some Oyster Bar.  Boy, were we wrong. The line was innocuous enough, only about 6 people ahead of us. Little did we know that at 1:00AM, the bar is basically full of wasted/trashed/smashed patrons who would take hours to finish their food.  With only about a dozen seats available at the bar, it took absoltiutely forever for seats to clear up and parties to be seated, especially if it was a party of 4 or more.   On top of that, it seemed like the bar was never made to accommodate so many people, and although all the pots were constantly cooking up gumbo or some other delicious dinner, the food itself took about 10-15 minutes to get served after ordering.  When we finally got seated, the clock read 3:15AM, and only two out of my three companions stayed awake long enough to enjoy the food.  We got one of everything on the menu, and everything was delicious. I wish I could write more about the quality of the food, but I honestly can't remember much after that wait. Just the taste of food and water finally reaching my mouth, as if I had been lost in the deserts of Nevada for days.  The food was good, but i honestly can't imagine anything worth such a painful and tiring wait.    And for the record, 1AM-5AM are not slow hours for them. I think the secret might be coming in around 6AM-8AM when party goers have finally headed to bed, and no one is willing to get up for breakfast.

sGAXjDEnrota63TJW0bO0g.text: This has become one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. Absolutely delicious and best pan roast I've ever had. The oysters were very plump/juicy and filled with fresh flavor as well. This place is as good as it gets. The wait is a bit long, maybe about an hour, but well worth it.

xA3C7cr6p3qIic7ad79kDQ.text: I was by far very impressed. My dad had been talking about the cooking system for about 7 years now. So he was in Vegas and made me go with him. I was more impressed by the taste of the food than the cooking system lol

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The prices match the taste.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not to pricey
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best. My family is from Louisiana and this was so close to how it taste in the boot.  Eze the chef you did that.

tXZbClD_7lkYxMArMNdl7g.text: Oyster bar is always our go to spot that we absolutely must visit each time my husband and I go to Las Vegas! Oyster bar is located in the palace station (be sure not to get it mixed up with another placed called oyster bar is LV.. It's not the same)  The best time to go is 3am-8am.. We arrived in LV at 6:30am & got to oyster bar at 7:30 on a Sunday morning & for the first time ever... When we got to the bar we were the only customers. The chefs mentioned that there was a rush about 30min-1hr before we got there. Usually when we go to oyster bar we have to wait for an hour or more (but once we get our food, the wait is definitely worth it!)    We always know what we want to order before we even get to oyster bar. Our usual is combination pan roast w/ level 5 spiciness w/ two rice. The combo pan roast includes shrimp, crab, & lobster.. Some times we like to pay extra & add clams. Level 5 spicy is not very spicy.. I don't like too spicy but my husband does, so sometimes he ask the chef to prepare him a spicy sauce on the side. If you aren't too hungry I would suggest sharing, but if you're very hungry... Get your own because it's soooo good! We also order the oysters (if u go during happy hour they're cheaper)   The staff are all very friendly, usually it's the same chefs that are working each time we go. Overall, I definitely recommend going to oyster bar, once you try it once you'll be hooked! Try to avoid going during busy hours such as lunch & dinner time to avoid the long wait.    I rated them 4 stars because of the long wait.. There's only about 12 seats at the bar or so (you have to be 21yrs old or older) but I rate their food (combo pan roast esp) 5+ stars!

lWTFmQY-yfX6yNU6oDR7Mg.text: I love love love this place! Long wait sometimes but totally worth it! They're oysters are always fresh and the food it steaming hot! Best little dive oyster bar ever!! I prefer to go middle of the night since it is less crowded and a great night cap!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oq8V7Fp4vjW2i7PmV_8L7w.text: If I had to choose one dish as my last dish. Its would be the pan roast! This place serves up a mean pan roast, fresh oysters and clams. I haven't had the chance to try everything on there menu. Every time I am in town I always say I will order something different but after waiting in long lines I then realize I came here for the pan roast. I come to vegas about 4 times a year. Which means I get to enjoy pan roast about 8 times a year. Yes, I always try to visit this place twice when I am in town.   Seating is very limited to 18 seats. They are open for 24 hours. Don't bother sharing because they charge for sharing. This place isn't the best for large groups at its a small dining area.

rHAH5Kwx6jtt4QYTV71j9A.text: Ahhhhhmazing!! Every time it is amazing. Be prepared to wait. We waited three hours this time, we got there when we weren't hungry (that's the trick, because by the time you're at the front you are hungry!). We went with four people total and took turns waiting in line. Went by faster than if you were there with just another person.   This place is so amazing, all the chefs are amazing! Our personal favorite is Ricardo. We always get oysters, the combo pan roast and the bouillabaisse.   They are masters at their craft. The seafood in the dishes come cooked perfectly, I mean every time we are here. Add extra lobster to your pan roast, that's my tip!!   Go there and be prepared to wait!

J5pHTq-B6MLsdEgbH0v_Ww.text: I'm still apprehensive about even posting my review, this place was so amazing I want to covet it. I visited L.V for thee weekend and this place was randomly on my list since I love sea food. Let me wipe my tears because I'm remembering again how amazingly wonderfully delicious the pan roast sea food dish was!! It may have been one of the best dishes I have eaten.  The oysters were the freshest!  Even though this spot only fits 15 people and the wait can be long it didn't effect my review because it was well worth it.  The staff was sweet. The cook that has been there for 28 years was chill and made you smile in his own way.  Some say it is better than Louisiana's Cuisine, I wouldn't doubt that. I will forever come here and will crave that pan roast every day!!  Until we met again Oyster Bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yeah, that&#39;s a chunk of lobster!! I know!!!

sKX-99GkbN8Rckvp_alTWA.text: So if you haven't been here.. make sure you try it at least once. The wait is quit long because literally its a bar with maybe 15 chairs and you literally just stand in a line formed at the side.. and stare till someone finishes and leaves. BUT IT IS SOOOO WORTH IT!.. We came here on a Saturday night around 7:00? We weren't seated till 2 hours later plus the time we waited for our food to cook. But honestly, no matter where you go in Vegas, if it's good food.. there will be a wait. So JUST BE PATIENT!   So if you are willing to wait, you MUST try their Pan Roast.. This is my second time having it and it was even better than the first time! We got the Pan Roast combo that came with shrimp, chicken, andouille sausage and crab at a level 6 spicy. It was sooo good...Each bite was hot and creamy.. MMMM.. They cook it right in front of you so you know it's fresh! Also portion is huge! So definitely share or expect to take some home. We also got their Shrimp Scampi linguini cooked in a white sauce.. This was alright... nothing too crazy about it. The shrimps were HUGE though.. but overall taste was kind of bland to me. I would stick to the pan roast! You will not be disappointed. Many locations in OC tried to open their own knock off of the Oyster Bar.. but no where near as good. If you're in Vegas and don't mind a wait.. COME TRY THIS PLACE!!

6Wy5JnSRaUAPlRYwBmf1ww.text: I must say, this is the best place I've ever had pan roast anywhere.   The wait here is ridiculous and we were ignored majority of our meal though. The food took forever and service was non existent.   3 stars solely based on the food.  Eze I think was the chef, slow and sloppy is one word to describe the view. Watching him make the food and work behind the counter ruined my appetite.

sLTVsdCOgtpYbgvGKAsJCQ.text: If you're a seafood fan, then I suggest checking this place out.  It's located in Palace Station Casino and yes, I know it's not the nicest looking hotel/casino, but the food is worth checking out.  I've heard people stand in line for over an hour to two for this place, so maybe it's wise to go here off hours.  This place is open 24 hours.  I came here at 7pm and I only had to wait for 30 minutes, which isn't too bad considering there are ONLY  15-18 seats at a bar.  It's also steam kettle cooked and the food is made to order, so therefore the wait tends to be longer.    I ordered half a dozen of oysters and linguini and clams.  The oysters were really fresh and the linguini clams was delicious and the sauce was so flavorful. My wife ordered cioppino, but they made a mistake and gave her bouillabaisse.  She tried it and fell in love and was glad that they made that mistake.  They're generous with their seafood.  Corey was our chef and he was super friendly and attentive to our needs.   I will definitely come back to try other things on their menu. Their menu is also limited and simple.    Also, they have late night specials from 1am-9am: 16oz Bud Light Draft-$3 wine by the glass-$5 Half a dozen of oysters-$10

Foj919NYg-KS1HHnUVrUIA.text: The hype is real about this place.  The pan roast is truly second to none.  Although the lines can be a problem, do your taste buds a favor and try it at least one time in your life.  The pan roast is buttery, flavorful, and had a lot of ingredients added to it.    Again, the only problem about this place is that this place is way too small.  A max of about 15 people can eat at any given time...leaving hour long waits for patrons.  We got here at around 1am and still had an hour long wait.    4 stars.

8_yCTEMw5gibSQYp8_XF5g.text: This review is about how much you need to wait.  Expect to spend about 3 hours ish even on a non busy day. Lemme break it down: 1hourish for the line, 1 hour ish for everyone ahead of you to get their orders and get your order ready. And about 45 minutes for you to savor your meal.  Party greater than 4 is not recommended.  They only have 12 seats.    Maybe have a friend wait for you while you go gamble. Then switch off.  To make the wait more tolerable.    The service was very friendly and they actually talked to us as they were prepping the oysters and clam shells.  Apparently, a lot of celebs come to eat here.     Food: overall food was good but not impressive enough to blow my mind and def not gonna be coming back to spend 3 hours of my limited vacation time here.

qxXuclw9ZvShKATyGkKWsQ.text: Great food.I always make it a point to eat there, when I'm in town. Lucked out and there wasn't a line.

8ZjnTNcQI9Q6fDN0jqsAzQ.text: The food is outstanding but you have to wait for it. Is it worth it?  The Oyster Bar is inside the Palace Station Casino. The bar only has 18 seats.   We got here at 8:30 pm on a Monday thinking we could avoid the infamous wait. No such luck, eleven people ahead of us in line. The line did not move for 40 minutes. When it finally moved, it went quick. At the one hour mark, we got seated. Yay.  Well not so fast.   After you're seated, you're given a sourdough roll and butter. Thank you, thank you thank you. We were starving and that helped a lot. A few minutes go by and they take our order. We waited so long I memorized what we wanted a half an hour ago lol.   40 minutes later our soup comes out.  An hour & 15 minutes from being seated we got the oysters.  At the two hour mark from being seated we got our entrees.  3 hour 15 minutes from waiting in line to finishing our meal.  Was it worth it?  Here's the rundown: New England Clam Chowder - Delicious. The bowl was full of clams and the soup was just outstanding.   Oyster (a dozen) - was so so good. Cocktail sauce, horseradish and lemon accompanied the oysters. One of the best oysters I've ever had. The chef was having problems with one of the oysters (didn't want to stay in the shell) we were playfully teasing him about it and he was such a sport about it. We all had a good laugh and he put an extra oyster in for us. A bakers dozen, all delicious.   Plaza Pan Roast - it had shrimp, crab, chicken and andouille sausage. It's my first pan roast and it was delicious. The brandy and cream was a good combination. All the proteins were cooked perfectly. I specially liked the andouille sausage, a little hint of spiciness worked well with the broth.  I got a number 7 on the heat scale. It was not spicy for me at all. I could not finish my bowl, it was so rich and I had a lot of oysters. Lol. I will have a good lunch tomorrow for sure.   I was also able to taste the following dishes.  Combo Pan Roast - it had shrimp, crab and lobster. My Mom's choice. Zero on the heat scale. It was as good as mine. Tasted the lobster and that was very good. Good amount of it too. Lol.   Bouillabaisse - was so good. My brother's dish. 7 on the heat scale. It was spicy. Ouch. But it was really good. The broth was clean and very flavorful. It had shrimp, crab, lobster, mussels & clams. Great broth. I would get this next time.   Service was excellent. The chef was friendly and entertaining.   The wait. It didn't bother me at all. It was more entertaining than anything else. I got to talk to other people waiting in line and making fun of the situation we were in. I even got to meet a couple of local Yelpers and she told us about a Korean/Mexican fusion restaurant (Komex). The 3 hours went by really fast.   It's an experience I won't soon forget and isn't that why we go to these places and go through all the hoops. Lol Was it worth it? I say Yes!!  We had great service We had great food.  We had great conversations We had a memorable night.   I'll definitely be back

lROoLE73CO4IZZSDhT8--w.text: I had a thoroughly enjoyable and satisfying meal at the Oyster Bar. It is an intimate venue situated amongst pokie machines at the Palace Station Hotel & Casino with only 20 seats available around the bar. The seafood is fresh and the service is efficient. We arrived at 2:45pm on a Thursday and were seated right away. Glad I was able to experience this while in Las Vegas.

sGGgmRTZivJ9tmnuPBCgZw.text: Food:  My fiancee ordered the pan roast and I ordered the gumbo.  Hands down, pan roast is AWESOME.  This place also serves the best gumbo I had ever tried.  Food rating:  5/5  Service:  Service here is decent and is mostly busy.  Service rating:  4/5  Price:  Expect to pay $20+  Overall:  I must come here every time I'm in Vegas.

W0c3rMxRum4gOOxpG83wNQ.text: Oysters and PAN ROAST, OH MY!   The waiting game:  This part of my dining experience was no joke! I waited for an hour and half to get seated! It was WORTH it!  Food:   Oysters: Fresh and delicious!  The cocktail sauce with horseradish on the side was great at masking the fishy taste of the oysters. My only complaint is that I wished the portions were bigger.   Combo pan roast:  This big bowl of goodness is something that you cannot find anywhere else.  The best way I can describe the dish is that it is a creamy/ cheesy soup with crab, shrimp, and lobster and a side of rice. Delicious yes, but you will definitely have a FOOD COMA for days, so prepare yourself!  Service:  Since this restaurant is literally a bar table with 12 seats, there was only one chef and waitress doing everything.  The chef Bob and I cannot recall the name of the waitress made it a very enjoyable experience when I was there. They kept cracking jokes throughout my whole time there and on top of that, they were fast and efficient with everything. NO COMPLAINTS.      Final Verdict:  I dreaded the wait but loved my experience here , so YES I will be back!
