HzFRTh8AkoIxLKMExjgbqg.text: Hands down the best food I have ever eaten in Las Vegas. Oysters tasted clean and delicious. Pan Roast was delicious also with your choice of heat. I used the yummy sourdough bread they gave to clean the  bowl. The jambalaya was also delicious. This will be a regular stop for us when visiting LV.   It's a small bar with maybe 12-15 seats so timing is everything. We were lucky enough to only have to wait 15mins but it was well worth the wait.

-3yGcHmdieGZaWpLv9ipDw.text: Is anything worth an hour wait? Buffet? Sometimes... High end restaurant? Sometime... Oyster Bar? Yes! I have to admit, even thinking of waiting more than an hour for anything is a tough sell but this one might do it for it.  After waiting for around an hour and 15 minutes of temptation with slots and cheap tables and without reception (beware at&t and T-Mobile customers), I finally got a seat at the bar.  A dozen oysters on the half shell for $20. Freshly shucked by the cook with a side of lemons and cocktail and horseradish sauce. These oysters were really good. Fresh and plump so you are getting a pretty good deal. It's a good appetizer while you wait for the main attraction, the pan roast (around $25). A creamy tomato and cream sauce with a mixture of southern spices with your choice of meats.  The palace pan roast has crab, shrimp, chicken and andouille sausage.  You also get to choose your level of spiciness. I love heat so I chose 9 out of 10. After watching Ricardo (the chef) do his magic for 15 minutes with the pan cooking the meats and the sauce boiling and thickening into a thick concentration of flavor, the pan roast was poured into a bowl and topped with a huge dollop of rice.  After the first bite, you think, it's good but not worth the wait. Then you keep sticking your spoon back in for more and then you realize, this stuff is good. The creaminess and the flavor of the mixtures of spices continue to kick you in the face (in a good way). The chili flavor was good for me but I suggest to go around the 6 or 7 level. I tried my friend's with this level and you get flavors of sweetness. With the 9 and I guess also 10, you are always getting spice.  The meats were not overcooked, mainly the shrimp which was interesting because it wasn't rubbery even though it was cooked for a while. A must get when you are here. The others that looked amazing were the gumbo and bouillabaisse.  As for service, the waitress was very nice and friendly.  She took our orders quickly and was helpful throughout the meal with water refills.  The chef, Ricardo, was the life of the party though. He was sarcastic and entertaining to watch.  Even as he was joking around with the customers, he was serious about the food and made everything, including shucking oysters and clams, very professionally.  So expect to wait. If the line is past the ATM machine, expect a really long wait. Expect great flavor. Expect a filling meal and expect to want to come back again and again. I am a convert and want to come back during every Vegas trip.  The wait is gonna be a struggle but if it is not over an hour and a half, you will see me in line. A solid 5 stars and even though I want to dock a half star for the wait, can't blame a restaurant for having a following and the food pretty much replenishes that star back.

fzwycPTFvrO1ARnZ-byALQ.text: This place is nice and the food is great. But the concept is not for everyone because you will expect to wait for a minimum an 1 hr.

AnJXtAyZs1iWB8msGkHVpA.text: Where have I been?    Oyster Bar gets a ton of great reviews from Yelp, some of my personal friends, and even my own parents.  Just Google Las Vegas Pan Roast and you get sent here to the Oyster Bar.    There's so many Yelp reviews about this place that my review is going to sound like a broken record.  So, I'll keep this one simple with bulletin points.  -Service:  You read it and Yes, there's a wait. This is not because service is lacking.  This is because the Oyster Bar only seats about 15 and the food is as good as it gets.  Service is actually good here.  What takes a long time too is what I call "Linger Eaters".  These are people that take their sweet ol' time to eat.  The gf and I aren't "Linger Eaters" at all. However, if we are going to wait over an hour to eat, then we're going to take our time too.    -Pan Roast:  They're known for their Pan Roast.  My gf got this and allowed me sample it.  My goodness...everything that I read on these reviews were True.  Superb!!  -Seafood Jambalaya:  This is what I got.  I haven't had Jambalaya in years and was in that mood, especially since the outside temps were dropping.  Overall...packed with mussels, clams, crab, lobster, shrimp, and rice.  Your taste buds will be confused with what it's tasting, but won't be confused whether it's good or not.  My taste buds just voted...pretty damn good.    -Clam Chowder:  Just about average, but you don't come here for chowder.    -Hours:  All Day, Everyday  -Prices:  You get what you pay for.  Most dishes are about or over $20.    Okay, I didn't keep this review too simple.  But it's still bulletin pointed. Oyster Bar is one of those places that you have to try at least once.  Yes, the wait is long.  And Yes, it's in a smokey casino.  But if you're into gumbo, jambalaya, and overall good food, then Oyster Bar is your place.   YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE 2013 - (497/500)

NQrz7Xgp5ZMO4JoX1_vF2w.text: The best and must have food destination when you visit Las Vegas. Food is great and the service staff are the best friendliest people in Vegas. When I visit its same routine.. depending on your group it's a dozen oysters to start and the seafood pan roast for the entree which I highly recommend. When you order they ask what spice level you want from 1-10 and 6 is where the money's at, some good heat right there where you can enjoy your food with out sweating bullets. Anything above that is at your own risk..   One highly suggestion on making your visit the best is to go at some off hours so your wait in line is short but when you think 3:30 in the morning is off hours I wouldn't be surprised if you waited an hour to be seated. So when I go to get me oyster bar it's usually to have it for breakfast! For real breakfast! I don't give a damn! Food is totally worth it! Hope you enjoy.

WqD6T5_MsjpW6jMOLfZEKw.text: I will always come back here when I visit Las Vegas and check this place out. The way to get food is a little ridiculous but is well worth it. Try and go early and you don't have to wait as long. The homemade soup that they create is something that dreams are made of. Have a great time in Vegas and definitely stop by here

qMnXt0GIrCOThKsibZtAmw.text: I've heard about this place a couple of years ago, but I was finally able to try it a month ago since I had to be 21 in order to try this place! When I first heard about Oyster Bar, I thought their biggest seller would be their oysters or something, but their biggest sellers are their pan roasts. I did not know what a pan roast was, but since my friend suggested the dish, I decided to try it anyway.  Their pan roast was really delicious and unique compared to other foods that I have tried. A pan roast consists of a creamy zesty sauce paired with seafood, sausage, or both! With the pan roast, you will also get a scoop of rice to eat with the pan roast. The serving size of the pan roast was very large, so it is definitely a good idea to split your pan roast with a friend. However, there is a splitting fee that can be avoided if you just order one pan roast without getting another scoop of rice if you are fine with that.   I definitely recommend coming to Oyster Bar, but be prepared to wait at least 30 minutes due to its popularity and deliciousness! I am looking forward to trying another pan roast and maybe even their other dishes if I decide to come with a larger party!

zkJKJTgzGyOFbHwsYdGUBQ.text: WOW! This place is just an 18 seat bar inside the Palace Station Casino; expect a LONG wait. We got here around 1030pm on a Sunday night and sat down around 1230am. We ordered a cup of New England clam chowder, so chunky and delicious!  For my entree I ordered the Combination Pan Roast, includes crab, shrimp and lobster. I requested level 5 on the spicy scale and it was pretty spicy! The sauce it's cooked in is so rich and flavorful! You get a side of white rice too. Very generous portions! My husband ordered the combination gumbo, also a hit! Your food is prepared in front of you so you can smell how delicious it is before you get it! There was only one chef... but considering the space behind the bar I guess there probably wouldn't be a whole lot of room for another.   The only cons for this place would be the insane wait time and the fact that they automatically include gratuity no matter the size of your party. I mean, the food is already incredible of course I'm going to tip!

t5qU8U5nyz-EfkzhhLqhjw.text: I've heard and seen postings of food of this place and wanted to finally try it out for myself.  The food and service speaks for itself and was very satisfying. My wife ordered the bouillaroast and I had the palace roast. We also had some oysters and shooters to start. This lunch was a memorable one and will definitely be back for sure. Despite there might be a wait, however it's worth the wait.

Dj-8pTw69PWkqkEGjUph0A.text: I love coming here everytime I come down to Vegas. If you're a seafood person, this place is a must!   The first time I've ever had this place was when my aunt and uncle took me here and ever since, I've fallen in love. Even though it's just a little bar within the casino area of Palace Station, you could smell the seafood throughout the whole floor. I guess the only down side to this place is that since it is a little bar and they only have about 15-17 chairs at the bar, the wait time could be a while. On a non busy day, you're looking for about an 1.5 hour wait for two people. But still, honestly it is so worth the wait.  Eze, the main cook is also very entertaining while he's cooking right in front of you! Which is awesome.  What they're mainly known for the their combo pan roast but what I do like to get is their Alaskan Clam Chowder. Though it may sound truly basic, but it is the best chowder everrrrr!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen oysters for $18.99

MfhI1aYTdY1CyZpUr8gH6Q.text: Today I don't understand why this place has not expanded their operation the wait is always long at least 2 hours on average.  I usually order the seafood gumbo great choice But then I had the combo pan roast simply excellent  one of the best items on the menu. Five stars on food  four stars for the wait.

DySFuFr8R08063Wo0ouYeA.text: Let me start off by saying this, if you told me I had to wait in line two hours for food I would tell you to kiss my a** and recommend a different place to eat. HOWEVER, the pan roast at Oyster Bar is SO worth the wait! I've tried it at many different places and no matter what it never compares to this one.  This is how you order it: Combo, add okra, add sausage, level 7 spice.   Also --skip their oysters.

os7YNWp5FJau5f5ngnbTrw.text: My boyfriend and I decided to have lunch here before our drive home on a Sunday. It seemed as though everything that day was in our favor because we beat a rush of people and waited probably just shy of half an hour. While we were waiting, we got the infamous 2$ margarita at Palace Station (you can get it at any bar within the casino). If you're curious about the margarita, it's light and fluffy, a lot fluffier than a regular icee and didn't seem that strong in alcohol percentage. Just something chill to sip on. Oyster Bar itself only had about maybe 18 seats? That I counted. It's nice that the flow of the restaurant is quick, so people go in and out in a jiffy. We enjoyed oysters and clams on the half shell and enjoyed both. The clams were more tasty in my opinion. As for our entree, we shared the combo pan roast and barely managed to finish it between us two. Portion was good. Yes the pan roast was good, but I'm not sure what the hype was about?  I'm not sure if I would wait 2+ hours for this.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half Dozen Clams
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

b93R5VdS09pjcjX8ihlxkQ.text: Honestly if it wasn't for Chef Ricardo & how excellent the food always is, I'd be leaving one star for service & total confusion.  They really need a better system for the line area maybe a bigger bar or a hostess stand.    Servers Jill & Melita were on different pages.  The four people in front of us turned into 13 drunk people.   They told Melita that they had a group of 11.  Finally, they were seated two hours later.  Frank called us over to sit & as we are seated, Jill says the group had two more & we'd have to go back to the line.  Manager Ariana came over & had absolutely no clue what was going on & said 13 people were ahead of us.  I said this is so unnecessary cause they are all seated so she was a day late basically.    After they settled the issue, Jill said they were out of all the libations & 24oz glasses of beer, they only had 16oz.  I asked her what the sweeter tomato sauce soup was that I'd had before & she said we don't have a sweet soup.  To me, the Pan Roast does have a nice sweeter tomato sauce.  I asked the chef he said yes it is & let me taste it.  I almost always get the Lobster Gumbo cause to me it is the BEST I have ever had.  Chef Ricardo said he would make me the Lobster, Sausage & okra Pan Roast if I'd like to try something new.  It was fantastic!   I have been coming here for a decade & all the old people are gone besides Chef Ricardo.  The last waitress really had it together w/ the flow of the line & patrons at the bar moving along smoothly.   Thank you Chef for impressing my friends from Iowa w/ the best lobster gumbo & shrimp scampi ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster gumbo mmm!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster, Sausage &amp; Okra Pan Roast.

SSeQMxacb4fzVn4pW1Jd2g.text: This place is amazing! Went here on a Monday around 4:30pm and we got seats right away. When we were done with our meal the line started to form. Super long lines as always! Totally worth all the hype! Bouli base roast is hands down thee best! And they give you more bread when you ask. You don't feel rushed here even if there's tons of people waiting. The cook and the ladies running the bar are very very nice! Not pushy or stuck up at all like you usually find at fast paced popular eatery's. Not these people! They move fast to get your order out but not for even a second do they lack customer service! Amazing! Will be back often!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouli base roast (combination of pan roast broth and boulibase broth) it&#39;s the best!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast

vttG2mny_hbOJBBYO-L-Wg.text: Came here with a party of 4 on a Thursday around midnight. We waited 2.5 hours to get seated! There's only about 20 seats total at the bar so expect a wait. It is inside a hotel/casino so you can gamble to kill time if someone else stands in line for ya. There's no waitlist or anything where you can put your name on.  Someone brought out complimentary dinner rolls and butter when we sat down. My party and I ordered oysters, clams, linguine shrimp scampi, clam chowder, shrimp pan roast and the house gumbo with steamed rice. They make all the food in front of you. Chef Ricardo asked if we wanted chopped clams in the shrimp linguine and we were like sure why not.   So, the seafood was super fresh! They have a variety of hot sauce options at the bar. Not a huge seafood person but after the long wait, it all tasted good lol. The shrimp linguini was very brothy. I didn't expect it to be so drenched but nonetheless still tasty. The pan roast and house gumbo were flavorful too. We picked 4 or 5 I think for the heat scale so it wasn't crazy spicy. Check it out if you're in the area!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine Shrimp Scampi

tJ_cLAh4FGOHBdwTyqDj0w.text: Omg this is so worth the wait!! We got lucky we arrived around noon on a saturday and only had to wait about 45 minutes! We ordered the combo pan roast which is bomb af! It's very hearty and creamy compared to the the boulibasse which we also ordered I think next time I will order the bouli-roast which is the combo of the two. Oysters on a half shell were freaking huge!! They were so tasty! Highly recommend make sure you come hungry but not too hungry the wait could be long because there's only about 15 seats!

H66SS9KGfsmzQADg4sOK2w.text: Food is awesome and consistently good every time I come back. Staff is nice and friendly. Only down side is the wait. Expect to wait 2 hours each time you go

zkhcYmNmzg2b4ZHAc3GmSg.text: Small counter, you have to wait your turn but the soup is amazing.  They cook soup individually in front of you!  It is just amazingly good!  How hot do you want it from 1 to 10? Took mine a 3 and it had some heat, enough to a little runny nose :-)  I 1000% recommend if you don't mind going to a not so great Casino!

6zNie_DUSKDjyE4qxDaBVw.text: In love with this place every time i go to Vegas I eat here my favorite dish is the lobster pan roast only down side is the wait, other than that it's a go to!!

RJ_cPWpiFM8oDCoj7ee9gQ.text: Yes, YES, YESSSSSSSS! My coworker described the pan roast here as "life changing" so I decided to try this out. Not going to lie, the wait was pretty brutal (maybe because I'm impatient. But i was also hangry). We went on sunday 1030am ish and we waited for an hour. Just standing and waiting in line. No fancy leave your name and they'll call you. Or the fancy getting a text when your table's ready. None of that! But after getting seated, it was allllll worth it. So so worth it! Watching chef bob cook is probably one of the best things in life. So so efficient and fast. Everyone working there is super sweet and busy and efficient. Like, WOW. The kitchen set up is also really interested. Watching him cook is like a show. Its an experience.  We (2x people) started off with the oyster. Honestly, best oysters I've ever had. Just absolutely great. So fresh and juicy. Amazing. Perfecto. And we shared a pan roast. The pan roast mixed with the rice is so great. And the amount of seafood they give you is insane. 2 of us shared a pan roast and honestly, we were full and good to go. And then we also shared the alaskan clam chowder. Also lots of seafood and flavor. I recommend. However, because we were already full from the pan roast, the clam chowder didn't taste as good. BUT! We decided to take it for the road and we had it later in the evening at the airport. And honestly, it was WOWOWOWOWOW! Amazing!!!!!!!!!  So anyway, sorry for the long post but this was my experience. Hope it helps!!! :)

EqS_bJiwsShqX6RVQs8a-Q.text: It's been a while so I figured I should do a re review for this oyster bar seeing as though i was here this a.m and I'm still a frequent customer.  Well, here's what I've come to learn. Get here at the crack of dawn. Maybe it's just me, but I don't just want something and eat it. No, I crave it for days at a time until I break. So knowing I'll want a pan roast tonight, I just get inline around 7am! Oops I mean, what line? Crickets, why? Because usually I'm the only one there!   Don't expect 5pm blood rushing service. The waiters are usually tired and you may have to remind them if you want water or sometimes even let them know your food is  done. Don't take it personal.   The oysters are by no means small! Even when I asked on a whim for the tiny oysters.. I still get heavyweights! If you don't like them too big you may face defeat! ( btw before 9am you get a half dozen for $10)  Last, pan roast is still king! I always take spice level 9 and it never fails to perk up the sinuses! Nonetheless, just as delicious as the first time I tried it!

YbaFEgm6KooqRzhjLCpUuA.text: We have been to the Oyster Bar at Palace Station so many times and we will many more times in the future. It is the best place for gumbo we've found in the LV area. We've tried Southpoint and Sunset as well, but they are just not as good-and I'm not sure why.   Yes, you will wait in line so don't come starving. We tend to go early-before 11:00 and the line has already started to grow for lunch. Waiting is just part of it. You smell the pan roasts and gumbo cooking and see people eating and the anticipation grows. Then, it's your turn to get a seat at the counter.   We have tried a few things. We've had the pan roasts-usually Palace with chicken,  crab, shrimp, andouille sausage-which are very tasty but seem kinda tame. Hubs had the Cioppino and I've had the shrimp scampi which are great too.  But we really go to the Oyster Bar for one thing-the GUMBO!!  First thing you have to know is how hot you like it. They give you a 1-5 with 1 mild and 5 is make-you-cry, remove-paint hot. I like it spicy but still want to taste my food so get a 3. I've tasted a 4 and couldn't feel my mouth for the rest of the day! Hubs gets a 1 because he can't take spicy foods and so he just gets the flavor of the food.  Then you decide which type you want. Hubs gets the House Gumbo that has lobster, shrimp and crab-everything that is good. He loves it and enjoys the flavor it gives to the sauce. I think the sauce hides the wonderful taste of the seafood so I just get the chicken gumbo with chicken and andouille sausage. I love the way the chicken shreds in the sauce and you get lots of andouille sausage which is my favorite part. The rice absorbs the flavors when you scoop it together.   The Oyster Bar is one of our favorite places to eat in LV and we go even though we no longer live there. We do highly recommend it-and may even see you in line!

OeUHHTEXCMw29WYOWVwFqg.text: The combo pan roast (shrimp and crab mix) served with a scoop of white rice was delicious and filling!  I was so full and happy when I finally ate here after all its hype.   The wait was pretty ridiculous; I think we waited about an hour and a half. Was it worth the wait? Yes! ... but only if you have the time and patience. They only seat about 15 people at the bar at a time, so prepare yourselves to wait a little longer if you have a larger group.  Definitely give it a try!

omm51z4L83FJWH2FsLN5hQ.text: We (2 people in our party) got there at 11:25am today (Friday) and there was a 45 minute wait.  We ordered:  1/2 dozen oysters- so fresh, delicious and a great palette cleanser  Bloody Mary- amazing, not too heavy, generous sized shrimp as a garnish   Bouil-Roast (level 5 spiciness) perfect for me because consistency is not too thick and not to watery.. just right balance between pan roast and bouillabaisse. Generous amounts of seafood!   Combo Pan Roast (ordered level 7): it was a little richer, thicker consistency than the bouil-roast, and if that is your preference. Amazingly delicious as well.   Again, we got lucky with just the 45 minute wait. So worth it!!

PnOvJva07pjDpcCGYkKJJg.text: Absolutely do not come here if you do not mind waiting in line for an ungodly amount of time, why they don't have seating for people in line I'm not sure...but after an hour or so of STANDING in line, you finally get to the holy grail, the Oyster Bar, yes, it's good, it might be 5 stars but after they make you wait in line that long nothing can be 5 stars...nothing!  The people working the bar know their stuff, order your food spicier than you normally would, they under spice. You won't have a burnt mouth!  There are only 20 seats, so think about when your going to try to get a seat.  For two of us, a dozen large oysters and our meals, plus two large beers, right at $100.00  The pictures don't do a good job of demonstrating the food, but remember, you've got a line of people behind you wanting your stool, to sit here and take pretty pictures of my food wouldn't be very nice!

T8KzPV4dTAt9DsYY9pkf2w.text: Love love love this Oyster Bar. I look forward to my visits to Las Vegas because I always make a lunch or dinner stop here during my travels. I always get the seafood combo roast #7 hot its delish! You may have to wait to be seated but always worth it, you won't be disappointed believe me!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. By far one of the best seafood combo pan roast I&#39;ve ever had. So worth the wait but come early to avoid too long of a line.

BVi9jbMqJNkbX_IvRU0lkA.text: Went here last night around 11:30 pm I waited in line with my girlfriend. Maybe their was 20 people ahead of us and we only waited a hour to get sat. We of course had oysters very big and juicy. I ordered the peel and eat Cajun bbq shrimp that was in a broth that was soooo delicious and flavorful. It came with a scoop of white rice. I also had a cup of clam chowder, which was kinda big for a cup which I liked. Very creamy and not fishy taste. My friend had the gumbo that had lobster, shrimp and crab. She said she enjoyed it. Dan was our server he was very nice and helpful. Always made sure we were good always, refilled our drinks. He also packed our leftovers to go such a sweet guy. Will be back for sure very soon. Hope very one enjoys.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun Bbq Peel &amp; Eat Shrimp
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster, shrimp and crab gumbo

BjF9JGJ402_H6PR42Yo7ZQ.text: It's always a gamble of when to come for the least amount of wait. But the wait is well worth it! If you're a large group - It'd probably be best to split into 2's and 4's as it's bar seating.  Service is always quick, efficient, and everyone working there is really personable.   We've tried both the Pan Roast, and (not so secret) Bouill-Roast. Although the Bouill-Roast is good, the Pan Roast cannot be beat. It's creamier, hearty, and warms the soul. But if you're a fan of Bouillabaisse then definitely give the combo a try. Either dish is a sure fire win for your tummy. The seafood they put into each dish is plentiful. They are not overcooked, and have a nice snap when you bite into it.   100% always get the Oysters. They shuck them literally in front of you and they aren't some small puny ones. Always large, extremely fresh, and tasty.  We will always wait in line for this place, it's WORTH IT. Try to come early in the morning for the best chance at not waiting, probably before 10am. Before you go, eat a small something (or go get a drink, and gamble while you have one person in your party waiting!) and the time will fly by.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not so secret Boulli-Roast.

cPKvMMpU6Pv-q26MUDgggQ.text: The wait is ridiculous, please do something about it. To enjoy and experience the food is blindsided by the sheer annoyance of standing in line watching other people at the bar done eating and sitting there but chatting. Then you have people fighting over spots in line arguing! What a horrible experience. It's a love/hate situation that can be easily fixed. Time to grow more real-estate and Cooks. Or I'll just make my own seafood tomato bisque (Opps) I mean Pan Roast at home & shuck my own oysters.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Gumbo spice level 8

N7jR3ruPD0HhvAwAyjVcew.text: Anticipation!  It's so worth the wait.  Talk about salivating all the while while waiting in line.  After a night out on the town, a few dirty martinis, and a round on the craps and BJ tables, my fave way to "turn in" is the lobster pan roast!  Yummmm!  Counter seating makes the meal so much more enjoyable as you see smiling, happy faces all savoring their food!  Every trip to LV now, I gotsta have it!  We try to strategize the timing of the line, but it doesn't matter.  It's always long and they're always busy.  For obvious reasons!  -wink-

Ie9_TxC-pZHWhbV4IWRq-A.text: Best restaurant I've been to my entire 6 days of being in Vegas. My high school friend has been bugging us to go to the oyster bar everyday and we finally got to go. It is located in the Palace Hotel & Casino. I had their pan roast, two orders of oysters.. meanwhile everyone else had gumbo!  Their food is amazing and unforgettable. Honestly can't wait to come back to Vegas so I can have myself a nice hot bowl of pot roast... and their delicious oysters!

GWex1RG38yzw7278fbr6Kg.text: We frequent this little 20 or so seat seafood bar as often as we can! Though the wait at times can reach two hours, we don't normally stand in line for more than 45 mins before we get seated. On every occasion that we've eaten here there's the same cook making our food for us (EZE), the man works miracles with those tiny steam kettles that he cooks with right in front of every guest. The consistency and flavor has been on point on every visit! The pan roast is a must if it's your first visit.Keep up the great work Oyster Bar staff!!

gKeYilr2_My2OtjYiM1XnQ.text: Located in Palace hotel, the Oyster Bar has the best pan roast ever!!! Enough said. Get the combo pan roast now!   I've been here twice and both times I waited in no line. When did I go? 9:30am on Saturday. Wink wink. Now that I've posted my secret for a no wait time at Oyster bar, I wonder if it will get crowded now. LoL.    The place is clean and everyone is really nice. Must stop place in Vegas. :)   But don't get the bouillabaisse. It's too salty. Get the pan roast now.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouillabaisse

rgg-NN5sry9VBIJmuFv6NQ.text: Ugh that line doeeee. But I get it...it's that good and it's a bar, so you're stuck with very limited seating and you actually have to wait in that line until someone finishes, which makes this place all that more unique. Luckily, I live here now and can come on a random Monday afternoon :D   I have to say this place comes really close to Ritter's in pan roast and oyster quality/taste, but above all this is what makes this place stand out:  -Big pieces of lobster and seafood that they serve in their combo pan roast  -Being a connoisseur of all things spicy, I asked for level 10 spicy and the cook also made me a special concoction of spices that I can throw into my roast to make it even spicier muahaha -You can ask for a side of pasta instead of rice!   Other things that I had here that were amazing were their oysters, New England clam chowder, and the Palace pan roast, all served with a side of sourdough bread (keep them coming because they're free!). Seriously so delicious, and I walked away from this first-time experience full and 100% satisfied!!! And this place is 24/7?!?! Wow, just bury me already from a food coma of heaven and creamy pan roasts and juicy oysters

buiPYc2XeeIEbppunHhoyg.text: This is a must-go spot. This is where locals truly go to experience good pan roast. Be prepared to wait about 30 - 45 minutes but that's OK, you can drink Coors Light or Modelos while you wait. I recommend everything, it is truly fantastic. I wish they would serve different oysters than from Virginia, I feel the Hard Rock Oyster Bar got the Oysters right but not their pan roast. When you are done drinking and eating delicious pan roast, you can go upstairs and see a fantastic movie at Palace Station's new movie theater.

tm6VCts9jbzf6k-A8hUU1A.text: Best thing I ate in Vegas after a week of being here. The lobster pan roast was really REALLY good! Worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pan Roast

_DrbLe7GkwrTwNf5kRq15A.text: This is now a highly recommended place to my friends that go to Vegas although a little part of me doesn't want too many people to know about it since the Oyster Bar only has a few seats and the lines can get pretty darn long. The Oyster Bar is located inside the Palace Station. I would highly recommend to go during to off meal times (definitely not during lunch or dinner). Seating is super limited for sure!  The staff is super friendly. There is maybe about 18 seats available. You sit at the counter and watch them chuck oysters and make our food.  PAN ROAST IS A MUST!! The creamy tomato stew is great any time of the year!  We have ordered the Combo Pan roast with shrimp, crab and lobster. We have also ordered the Palace Pan Roast with shrimp, crab, chicken, and andouille sausage. The servings are huge and more than enough to share with someone. But if you are sharing, make sure you two can decide on a level of spiciness that you want your meal to be. I can handle spicy but my husband doesn't enjoy it so we usually go for the medium spice (level 5). The Pan Roasts are served with a side of steamed rice. We tried their chowder last time as well. That too was tasty.  This place is consistent and always has some delicious and fresh and  tasting food. Bring a friend and patiently wait in line for a large delicious bowl of amazing pan roast that will totally be worth the wait!!

BexH69YGq3NXmA7psZ3AjA.text: The Oyster Bar is one of my favorite dining spots in Las Vegas. The oysters are fresh and your dish is prepared in front of you with the freshest seafood. Highly recommended. Be prepared to wait for a seat as there are only approximately twenty seats and it can take up to an hour.. DEFINITELY worth the wait.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters on the Half Shell
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cioppino

pmp6SYrefg94WOY6Gh_GEg.text: Love at first sight!  Well, that's my sentiments towards food anyways.  I still can't believe this place is open 24/7!  This place is located far away from the strip and the bar only seats about 15 people, so be prepared for a line. My friends and I got hungry after golfing at Top Golf and what's better at 3am than seafood?! Lol So we hopped in an uber and were on our way here! The uber driver also recommended it!  The oysters are a must! We ordered a dozen on the half shell amongst the three of us to share, mussels in white sauce, chowder, and the pan roast.  My absolute favorite thing was the oysters. It was my first time having raw oysters and it definitely will not be my last. We were just about ready to order another dozen!  Pro tip: save your bread to mop up your soup or chowder  Glad we found this place and I will definitely be back the next time I am in Vegas!  Thanks for reading my reviews! Let me know what I should try next!!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dsirBEFauckcnsmxcyTt0Q.text: I've been coming here for 3 or 4 times a year for the past 7 years. This is my first time having a poor experience with my food. I'm thinking it's because of the new guy cooking behind the counter. I came at 11pm 9-15-19. I got the jambalaya and it was not nearly as tasty or flavorful as it normally is. Plus, you could tell the guy had no pride in his work. He was literally throw things around.

REfBN4QxoeRp5qS-x6RTdw.text: By far my favorite place to grind in Vegas!! Oysters are Big and Fresh!!  And the Combo Pan Roast is my all-time fave!! THIS PLACE ABSOLUTELY CANT GO WRONG!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Joysters!!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast!! Every Stomachs Dream

Mwz1wvjaqvjtm02bujOKdw.text: This place is an absolute must stop for seafood lovers and foodies! I love coming here for their spicy, rich and creamy pan roast!  It's a small oyster bar in the middle of the casino at the Palace Station Hotel. There's about 15-20 seats.   Their oysters on a half shell are delicious. They shuck them right in front of you so you know it's fresh.   The best thing to try is their combo pan roast! It's a creamy rich tomato based stew with seafood served over rice. They give you big portions and it'll definitely bring a smile to your face. It reminds me of the yummy Cajun flavors I had in NOLA.  Also tried their Alaskan Clam Chowder and that was pretty tasty too! If you don't like spicy foods or strong spice flavors, this creamy and seafood chowder will blow your mind. There's big chunks of crab, lobster, clams and shrimp. It's rich and hearty.  There's almost always a line unless you come in the morning or during off peak hours but it's worth the wait! I always stop by here on my Vegas trips and look forward to tasting that rich and flavorful pan roast!

Bp_HVUCMDhtFNuKJJVPxgg.text: This place is AWESOME! Yes, it takes a long time to get seated but it is worth it. I believe the timing is everything when it comes to this place. You can wait longer and might be lucky that you do not have to wait very long. Either way, this place is worth going to. As for the food, everything is great! I highly recommend trying everything. Every time I go here, I go for their bournaise pan roast dish. Check it out and try everything on the menu!!! palacestation.sclv.com/D...

6bRW1fxdjCoh8VdZmd8gfQ.text: As the many previous reviews claim: delicious, savory food. Is it worth the wait, though? Purely subjective, of course, but I didn't think it was worth the two-hour wait - from standing in line to having my food prepared - for this delicious experience. It was certainly delectable, but I think it is a bit over-hyped.   I went by myself to secure seating a bit faster. I selected the seafood combination pot roast upon a friend's recommendation. At first, I received the meal without rice, and then noticed that others were receiving their orders with rice, so I asked for some. Unfortunately, there were only scraps left at the bottom of the rice cooker, and I received some browned, hardened pieces. Not crunchy, just dry and hard. That probably lessened the experience for me as well. But hey, when in Vegas, I gotta check out some of the popular spots.

wI-CzPz5x9Xh_scTwsvJFQ.text: Stopped by today and this establishment has appeared to have cleaned! Clean hood and back counter looks better. I can't vouch for wether it is being done correctly now, but very glad to see they have cleaned and care about their customers enough to make things right.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vent is still caked with grime 7/13/19. This place is filthy.

5kPXHPKs8zxQnO7d1Fwxlw.text: Went for the first las week, the food here is amazing, we had oysters, the pan roast, shrimp cocktails, the chefs/servers were very nice, the wait was long but well worth it, we went around 1am and got in about 2:30am but still you have to try this place at least once.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kMvJQGuxMxxUxNSm8E5gKQ.text: My body was defeated after waiting in line for three hours. Yes, three hour wait for this restaurant. Granted, it was the day after Thanksgiving. Thankfully, it was revived by amazing tastes of seafood medley presented by the Oyster Bar.   We had half dozen oysters to start off our unforgettable experience. Oysters were big, nicely chilled, and fresh to the death.   Gumbo and Alaskan New England style chowder was served next. You can ask spice on the side. I did that since spicy is not my thing. I'd say both dishes were definitely one of the best I've ever tasted. Portions are quite large, so can you take the amazingness home.  Food was good. Service was two thumbs up. The only downside was the waiting time. Three hours is a long time.    However, it was definitely worth it.

E9YlTBH2QydDOPMqXRFq8A.text: no frills, stick to your ribs kind of food that i love. better that they're open 24/7  what i ate: - 1/2 dozen raw oysters: the were good. not the best oysters in the world, but the late night 1/2 dozen were fairly cheap so i shared a plate with my friend - pan roast combo: yes yes yes! seafood goodness, creamy, and full of flavor. this is heavy rich food. i was hungry, but i could barely finish half.  - sourdough bread: the bread rolls were oh so tasty. perfect to dip into the pan roast combo!  pros: - food: the southern food is sooooo soooooo good. seriously, thinking about the pan roast combo and im salivating. even the BREAD is good. if youre sick of all the vegas buffets, please try this place out! - open 24/7. i love vegas! - kirin on tap! with all the heavy thick creamy food, kirin is so tasty  - sitting at the bar you can watch them cook your delicious bowl of food right in front of you. try not to drool everywhere while waiting for your food  cons: - first come first serve! its a small bar that seats about 20(???). so, it's not the place to come at prime times to eat! my friend and i came around midnight on a sunday night, and there was about 1 party ahead of us. we still waited a good 15 mins. ive seen the line wayyyyyyyy longer - price: not the cheapest admittedly, but the food is worth the price. trust me. you dont get any frills of a sit down fancy high end restaurant, but the flavor is THERE - $5 split fee on plates.... luckily our server didnt charge us ;) - good things take a while, so be patient. our food took a while to come out, but my friend and i whetted our appetites with some raw oysters - NOT on the strip! its off the strip and the hotel is ghetto and old and filled to the brim with asian people and other seddy clients, but, go for the food!   tip: come during OFF hours, probably avoid the weekends.   would i come again? YES

L7jny2M3LFOMkmymD1tOng.text: It did not disappoint. I had the Palace Pan Roast. Cooked right at the counter, the piping hot bowl of seafood deliciousness satisfied my palette and my appetite. When ordering, the chef asked me for the spiciness level from 1-10. I can handle fairly spicy foods but decided to give them a humble 4 (I have been burned before by overestimating my spiciness tolerance). I think I could have handled a 6. But with just a hint of spiciness I was able to enjoy the full flavor of the broth and the seafood in it.   Be warned the average wait is between 2-3 hours. The server told me that they are usually not waiting for seats to be vacated but for the kettles used to cook the delicious pan roasts to become available. So if you're waiting in line and see empty seats but they are not seating you, it probably means all the kettles are full. But trust me, the food is worth the wait!

XKfvHlFJv5zn8DlY5zvMug.text: Pan roast very good (enough for two)  out of crab when we went, oysters where good and fresh although I did ask for them to be steamed and they said that they couldn't do it, so weird! But still very good.

D1k6t1KJfxhC9VTXXpV_WA.text: Ok, so I was definitely impatient waiting for this meal. My friends told me this is a MUST in Vegas. Another hole-in-the-wall joint inside an old Vegas casino located off the strip.   First I was a little skeptical, thinking... oh gosh, this is inside an old freakin casino. Boy was I wrong. Oyster Bar is exactly that-- a BAR. You are seated at the bar!! The wait is longggg and it's first come first serve- no resos. Large groups = stay away!!!  So we got a beer, and waited in line for about 1.5 hours. After we were seated, we got our food in nearly another hour. 3 dozen oysters, 2 pan roasts,  New England clam chowder, and a Manhattan clam chowder. Everything was WELL worth it!!!! Soooooo freakin' delicious! Oysters were so big, juicy and fresh- yum! Pan roast contains a mix of seafood and combined with a tomatoey broth perfected with your level of spiciness.  There's only 1 guy running the show... cooking everything all at once. So BE PATIENT!! You WILL (eventually) get your food! Don't let the old casino fool you!

K83VCz9r_TsT60W6wdMwgg.text: My boyfriend and I were visiting for the weekend, and he heard about this place from a friend, so we decided to check it out.  It's located at the Palace Station Hotel off the Strip.  When we got there, I expected a restaurant, but it's counter bar seating ONLY.  We saw a line forming and decided to wait.  We called earlier, and the lady said it was an hour and half wait.  She was not lying.  We waited for two hours.  We heard some hangry people behind us, but we talked to a nice couple in front of us to pass the time, and they said it was their second time eating it that week.  We finally got seated and we ordered the half order of oysters, combo pan roast, and the etouffee.  The portions are huge.  My boyfriend and I watched as the servers shucked those oysters in less than two minutes.  I was impressed, and since my boyfriend does not like oysters, I happily enjoyed those thick oysters to myself.  YUM.  The pan roast and the etouffee are similar, but the pan roast is more creamy from what I tasted.  I preferred the pan roast better, but everything was bomb.  My boyfriend does NOT eat seafood, but he loved it.    The service was fast and friendly, and when we were done, I was actually sad to leave my seat.  The best thing I ate that weekend.  Until next time, I'll dream of pan roast with a few ice cold Coronas.

2BHYZkXVKWHikqbEXGpL9w.text: Linda S. does not wait in long lines for food...except today. Today was about subjecting my family to driving across town to a long wait inside a smoke filled casino which has surely stunted my daughter's growth...all in the name of PAN ROAST. I would have lived the rest of my life ignorant of such a dish, but I became aware of this PAN ROAST in my quest for clam chowder in Las Vegas. The name itself brought images of a sort of pot roast, and of course this is sooo not even close. I've been to Palace Station for conventions and would not have guessed I would be dragging my family here to eat on a Sunday afternoon. Crazy. I was hoping the line wouldn't be too bad, but we ended up waiting 1.50 hours to get our food. About 45 minutes into waiting, I noticed the 21 & over sign, so we inquired about take out since we had our daughter with us. They do offer take out but we would still have to wait. They only have about 18 seats at the bar. 18 seats plus 13 people ahead of us translated into about an hour to be seated. I was especially curious to see how they prepare the pan roast. They use special steam pans and the food is cooked right in front of you. The chef was very jovial and interacted with patrons. Maybe if he just cooked, it would go faster. But the customers seemed to enjoy it and the servers were very nice. I am terrible with remembering chronological order but here is my account anyway. If I missed anything, please feel free to let me know as I would like to attempt this recipe at home :)  First came a scoop of butter, then garlic and chopped veges (looked like onions, celery and red peppers). Then I think he added the fresh seafood, followed by a ladle of clam juice. He let it cook until bubbly. Next came the sprinkle of chili powder to taste (1-10 level) and other seasoning...possibly celery seed. He let it cook some more. Then a splash of brandy and white wine. Finally a healthy ladle of a creamy red stock. Cooks it some more until hot and bubbling. The last step that put a smile on everyone's face was when he tips the pan into the bowl, puts a scoop of white rice and serves it up. The long wait is over :) Nom, nom, nom! Be careful not to burn your mouth as it comes out very hot. PAN ROAST is a delicious and creamy seafood stew full of flavor. The combo pan roast has shrimp, lobster and crabmeat. Not at all fishy and very satisfying. The broth is rich and so flavorful,  you won't believe that you finished the entire thing...I know I didn't. The CLAM CHOWDER  is one of the best I've had. Creamy but not heavy. Tender pieces of clams and small little chunks of potato (not too much). Another winning dish here. I am happy to say that I would venture another trip to the Oyster Bar for the PAN ROAST and Clam Chowder.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8GpFblkCLKH1g0wbu2679g.text: Good god this place needs more seats.  This place is one of those places that ANY item you get is gonna be a good choice.  Even the Cesar salad was good here (yes I got salad here).  I would stick with the pan roasts and the gumbos here.  You can get the crab cocktails and oysters and such, but the big hitters are the soups.  Phenomenal.  I want to go back just to try the gumbo.  They have some noodle dishes I want to try as well.  Damn the smoke in the hotel and that atrocious line.  But what can you do?

W5jvxwB668KAuegUZeki7w.text: The pan roast here is so good! The clam chowder is amazing!  The wait here sucks! But the food is so good that I wait. Last time was at 3am and I still ended up waiting a good hour. There was a party of ten ahead of us. Really who goes to an 18 seat oyster bar with a party of ten? And they insisted on sitting next to eachother. What was the point, you can't talk to everyone, just the person next to you. Them and the overweight super PDA couple in line in front of us, was really super annoying, but I still waited! Bc the food is just that good!  The first time I ate here it was also around 2-3am, but there was no wait at all. That was the perfect time to try it out. Usually there isn't a long wait in the middle of the night, just this time i had bad luck.  Next time I am finally gonna try the oysters. Oh if you order more than one thing, they don't charge you for the $5 for the split charge. They also won't charge you for an extra bowl of rice. I'm pretty sure if you just chat up the chef a bit they do that often.  We haven't ever finished the pan roast in one sitting, so we always get the rest to go, and we always get a hotel room with a kitchen, so leftovers don't get wasted! They also do to go if you don't want to sit next to the drunk or crazy person that they sat you next to!  Can't wait until we go back next month. It's always our first stop!

cKw_jr3k8mZFygP2UVmfjw.text: OMG! This is seriously the best place anywhere. I was In Las Vegas for a week and ate here 3 times. They oysters are superb and everything else on the menu is excellent.  I can only hope they open one near me.

vsXR6rqBaSCVWKOA96FoZQ.text: This place is pretty amazing. The pan roast is a must get. The palace pan roast comes with shrimp, crab, chicken and sausage. The cook makes it in these customized pans right in front of your eyes. So Cool!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5hKOF_mdfPwGp9gB06QYig.text: I've been here several times and tried a good section of the menu. I've seen the line ranges from a 5 min wait to 1.5 hours. :(  Everyone raves about their pan roast but IMHO it's TOO rich. I leave feeling as if I ate a stick of butter. Their gumbo was also ridiculously salty when I had it, and it was only bearable when eaten with a lot of rice.  On the flip side, their chowder is really good! And their oysters are a hit or miss. One time they tasted frozen (perhaps just iced too long) but another time their clams and oysters were on point.  I only keep coming back because my friends love it, but if it were up to me, we'd try somewhere else.

-OcWg5ySF3OiJTblmiIKQA.text: The wait here is ridonkulous, but that's to be expected: they only have 15ish seats so you pretty much watch people eat while you wait miserably in line.  Came here on a MONDAY night at 9pm thinking... the wait can't be that bad. Wrong! Despite this, many people will wait and for good reason: the food is pretty darn GOOOOD.  We were seated after about an hour and it took another hour to finally get our food. They make everything to order and make it right in front of you, so I guess that's pretty cool.  I got the combo pan roast and an order of 6 oysters. Oysters were surprisingly good for being in the desert! Mmmm.... wish I could have some right now.  Combo pan roast had shrimp, lobster and crab. So glad I got the combo with shrimp bc the whole pan roast is really creamy, and just having lobster or crab would have been too mushy! The seafood tastes so fresh. I would say this meal is really heavy though..next time I may just share with someone and enjoy something else on the side.   I got spicy level 5 to be safe but I wish I got 7 or 8. 5 wasn't really spicy at all to me. It did not have the slightest kick. I guess it's my fault for not getting it spicier.  The service was okay. The chef made no effort to conceal his tiredness and apparent annoyance with his job. I also feel like they're so understaffed. When people are done eating and leave, it can take them a while to clean up and seat the next starving party.  You should definitely check this place out if you haven't :)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast (lobster, crab and shrimp) $24 (a lot for one person though)
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters. 6 for ~$13 (somewhere around there)

fSk_tlDkm8AqY0Fsr3BCag.text: This is by far, the best oyster and creole creation in the west coast. The long lines are so worth it, except you have to drool while u watch people eat the most scrumptious meal like it was shipped from the french quarter.

vtmn-uSEwn7gDg93eXSd4Q.text: Avoid the one at Sunset station; horrible service. Food is delicious though. But the chefs are so arrogant. If you ask for extra seasoning or less salt; or even an extra order of something, they give you a mean look. I don't like it there. I rather go to the one at palace station.

DXy_Xj51xsvwLjL5YktLZg.text: A must go to spot now that I have been here!   Funny turn of events but I had won money on the Monopoly machine while waiting in line for a seat at the restaurant and when it was time to eat, printed out the voucher. I unknowingly left the voucher in my pocket so the next day, had to come back to the hotel to cash out and figured I mind as well eat here again because it was that good!  So this review combines both my experiences at Oyster Bar, what a steal!  Day 1:  Dinner time Wed Night - 1 hour wait  Yes, there is limited seating here. They also don't allow you to over order here just so they can keep customers going in and out.  To order: Dozen oysters - good but on the small side (coming back the following day, the patron next to me ordered the same but his oysters were at least twice the size of mine the previous day) Clam chowder - tastes like melted pepperjack cheese, yum Combination pan roast - $5 splitting charge, comes with rice... loaded with seafood and tastes great with the rice... this was the star of the meal hands down Shrimp cocktail - ordered this but the waitress was slammed and by the time we  had brought it to her attention, we were full off other stuff Oyster shooters - filled ours with vodka... very nice  Service was as fast as it could be. All seats were filled so things were a little bit too chaotic for my taste. Even so, not bad given the circumstances.  Day 2:  Lunch time Thurs afternoon - no wait  Ended up ordering completely new items.  To order: Dozen clams - much meatier than oysters, can't say I prefer them over oysters though Shrimp cocktail - pretty standard, not presented very nicely though Gumbo - this one grows on you for sure, not a big fan after the first bite but it got progressively tastier as the meal went on  Service as expected was more attentive (as there were less people). There is a chef here that doesn't seem to enjoy his job so that was a bit off putting.  All in all, the food really takes center stage here. I really felt like I was getting my money's worth by eating here not once, but twice. I'll be back for sure!

jB1jNRVbOF42ADgQUsdhsA.text: We waited an hour and a half to get seated here. This restaurant is literally a bar with maybe 17 seats and there is no seating anywhere else. But I guess that is what makes this restaurant popular since there is always a line no matter what time you come (it's open 24/7). We started off with some oyster shots - surprisingly really good! It tastes like you're eating an oyster with the red sauce and a hint of tequila. Then we had combo pan roast, which they make on the spot in front of you. The cooking took another 20-25 minutes. I enjoyed the food a lot. We got spiciness level 4 - mild. My only complaint would be the waiting time.

H-43DKMilDsgOOwaze6d9w.text: This placed is packed! Just wish the server/ host was a little nicer. I usually only base stars off customer service but the ONLY reason the 4 stars cuz BOB was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bob! The best

I915NwOUAodtOLfSFMFqPg.text: CLOSED for Remodeling - April 6-12, 2014  I had been looking forward to dinner here,and arrived on April 6th to discover the remodel notice and Sheetrock covering the entry and interior windows.   Remodels often don't get completed on schedule, call ahead and make certain the main portion of the Oyster Bar has reopened.

e_hj2KCkEWEUbFgdeIM1Xw.text: I started going to Oyster Bar a few years ago. Every time I eat there I always rave about how OMG amazing it is to friends and family, and I'm sure whoever has also eaten there does the same... so naturally the place has become exponentially as popular as it was a few years ago! But its definitely worth the wait! and now its 24 hrs.  :)  I always get #1. Alaskan Chowder The Alaskan Chowder is the New England clam chowder base and has lobster, crab, shrimp, and clams in shell. Its basically clam chowder on steroids!... and they probably sprinkle some crack in there too. It's so addicting and to die for!  and #2. Pan Roast (Combo) The Combo Pan Roast only has seafood, no chicken or sausage. I think if you get the meats, it changes the flavor of the stew. The consistency is so creamy and rich, and full of flavor. You can select your spicy level 1-10. I don't dare to go past level 4. I think most people get spicy 5, and its pretty spicy already.  I always want to order an extra "to-go" meal, because I just can't get enough of it when I'm in town... but they don't let you. :(   Until next time Oyster Bar... I'll see you in my dreams!

eBJaN_O4-VdiXDG5EzF8Xw.text: Who knew such good food would come from such a tiny little bar in the middle of casino??? Tbh, I should've known, this is Vegas y'all, anything is possible.  But seriously, this is the OG steam kettle cooking place. I've had Ritter's in Costa Mesa and it's pretty good but this place just has that special something. Maybe the atmosphere? The fact  that you're just eating smack dab in the middle of the casino? Who knows. All I know is that the Pan Roast is amazing. Ask for a side of habanero for some extra umph and you're set. Also, the oysters were the FATTEST OYSTERS I'VE EVER HAD. They were so plump and good, they weren't like any other oysters I've had. Just look at my picture. Look.   The only drawback about this place is the wait. Because it's so small, there's almost always a wait but if you're already in Vegas, you might as well. At least you can stand and watch people gamble their life savings away?  I'll definitely come back every time I'm in Vegas. Heck, I'll come to Vegas JUST for Oyster Bar. It's just that good, everyone. It's just. That. Good.

oi2F2dWDGQcaLAMVDbtImw.text: Overpriced, Overrated, and totally not worth it.  How are you going to serve lobster roast and not have lobster in it? The staff gave us some speel about it being "lobster slippers". Googled it. AKA crayfish. When was the last time you saw a lobster the size of your thumb? Absolute crap. Great job fooling the uninformed.  The cooks were rude to other customers, admitted their ingredients were from Walmart, and asked us how we could wait that long for some crappy ass food. I agree. Food tasted like pig's feed. We must have been idiots.   Staff was horribly inefficient. It took them 3 hours to seat and feed us and 30 minutes to process our check. Save yourself time, money, and hours... Yes hours...of your life.   Pass on Oyster Bar. Overrated piece of crap. ZERO stars.

kG3PxhGzDuhwquJPlNa3bg.text: On my way from LA to Zion National Park, I stopped by Vegas JUST to try Oyster Bar and Oh. My. Goodness. Oyster Bar exceeded the outrageously high expectations I had put on it.  Oyster Bar is a 10-12 seat bar open 24/7 that serves super fresh seafood. People wait for hours at a time, so that should be a pretty solid indication that this place is worth starving for.  I came around 11am on Thanksgiving Day and there was no line, just four empty seats. Within the hour, a line had formed, but it only had roughly 10 people. My friends who have come here in the past have had to wait up to three hours at 3am, so I guess I chose a great time to visit this place.  For starters, they serve the largest oysters and mussels I had ever received. Never had I ever thought that a dozen oysters/mussels was worth every penny until I found this place. I saw the cooks cleaning out the oysters one-by-one, which is probably why it tasted so fresh and flavorful.  For our main entrees, we ordered the Jambalaya (2 stars) and Combo Pan Roast (5+ Stars). Oh man, I would rate the Combo Pan Roast a million billion stars if I could. The Jambalaya truly sucked-- bland, ordinary, unappetizing. On the other hand, the Combo Pan Roast was like seafood heaven in every bite. I had to take spoonfuls of the Combo Pan Roast and spread it onto my Jambalaya to give that thing some taste.  Overall, even though the Jambalaya isn't worth more than 2 stars at best, The oysters, mussels, and Combo Pan Roast more than made up for it. If you come to visit, try to come by 6am - 11am, that's usually when lines are the shortest.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels
