8kR2PwVaTgnKLhU5Ydy_Ig.text: I had the pan roast combo and my husband had the gumbo. We really enjoyed both and were in awe of how easy Eze prepared the food. Dinner was great and we will definitely be recommending this place to our friends and family!!!

uiOSMveshGrj3tTccMJXlg.text: Gaaahdammm i love this place. Drove 4 hours from 11-3 am and immediately showed up at this place for dinner! My first time here and it was amazing.   Expect a few people in line and a full house at the bar since it is a hot spot for tourists and LOCALS. Met some people along the way at the bar and they said the food was on point  Oysters were fresh, gumbo and jambalaya were very good and flavorful.. Got to try this donkey pictured hot sauce called the "ass kickin" hot sauced and within a taste of two drops in my jambalaya i felt like i just got out of the steam room!!  Beers were very good, except they had budlight, theres also a special price between midnight to 9am or something i forgot.   Also servers and chefs were nice and talks to customers while working, ive been oysterfied

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love love this place

Ls8oVMuBZvqi-ugdSRxylw.text: Absolutely delicious.  Come see for Yourself.  The Alaskan Chowder was my favorite.  It is delicious.  Open 24/7.  Come early and grab your seat.! Sorry Boston, SF, NY... Las Vegas Oyster Bar has you beat...

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chowder is absolutely amazing. Absolutely the best chowder Ive ever had.  Sorry San Fran, New York, Boston. Las Vegas has taken this one

PPaDxSIz-FTSrbzwIiNe5A.text: 8/24/17 @ 6pm Came here from Los Angeles but found out that our 2year old can not dine with us (havent been here but heard about it). So we decided to order to-go which in order for us to order to-go we must sit. So while my husband babysits my toddler, i sat to order. The lady say maximum of two orders per person and i go my husband is here and cannot sit because i have a two year old. Then she go as long as your husband shows up i can order more than two (i was planning to order 4). So when i was about to order, her co worker BRENDA who seem unfriendly, unhospitable and rude said -- no i cannot order more than two and if husb shows up, need to go on the back of the line! Im like wth, so i just ordered for two. The other customers sitting next to me were shaking their head as if they could not believe it. Im a paying customer who fall in line like everyone did. There was an available chair next to me. Why give a bad service and ruin the name of the restaurant just because of your "rules or policies." If you're the manager or owner of this restaurant, please contact me. I'll be happy to let you know how your employees can improve their service. The other lady (Joana) was nice but Brenda is focused on her task than giving a good service. I believe you have to be able to balance or provide great service than just performing task. I hope you take my criticisms positively. The way she told the lady taking my order was rude, please review the video cameras. I am not trying to abide the law, but asking nicely since i have toddler with us and can not enjoy dining due to that.  PS. So Brenda Aka not happy with her job lol gave me my bill without saying anything nor looking at me, as if she had personal problem with me. Thats how miserable she was with me trying to order more than i should. She converses to customers to my right and to my left, while to me not even smile nor look. Again-- owners and manager please look at the camera. Thank you.   Food: I had this dish in Orange county california. Ritters and Kettlebar does it better

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0BL7e5VzkqU2ewlf5j051w.text: Everything was the bomb!!!! Came in on my birthday really later at night this is Tuesday night about 1am. No LINE!!!!!! I had the Combo Pan Roast my hubby had the gumbo. On Point. No fuss over here. May have to go back before we leave.

J9vajewRf3f3Cl03E8Ithg.text: I've been coming to The Oyster Bar for years. I am a huge fan of the pan roast. This last weekend I brought a friend of mine by for her birthday. We waited in line for about two hours before being seated. While I am accustomed to the wait, our pan roasts were hardly edible. There literally were crab leg shells in every bite we took. I'm used to there being a couple shells in the bowl, but literally every mouthful ended with me picking shells remnants out of my mouth. Our rice was also extremely over cooked, to the point where it was sticking together in a mound. We ate what we could, and threw the rest out. I always preferred the Palace Station location for the food quality (despite the wait), but I doubt I will be back. The Texas Station location has yet to let me down like this.

q5FEuoDogUivjovIrbMVDw.text: Just go. Seriously. Worried about the wait? Bring a buddy to talk to. Don't have a buddy? Download an app on your phone to play. Have a flip phone? Then go suck it up because the hour+ wait is worth it.  The restaurant itself isn't bright and flashy- no neon lights here. In fact, it's pretty understated and easy to overlook. But it's clean and the staff there knows exactly what they are doing.  We had the combo pan roast with rice, and clam chowder dirty style. The dirty clam chowder was perfect because 1. I couldn't decide between red or white and 2. The white ended up just being too thick and creamy for me. The red chowder broke up the richness and gave a nice balance.  We also ordered some raw oysters- I was pleased with how well they were cleaned.  The clam chowder was deliciius but the combo pan roast stole the show. You won't regret it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty style clam chowder. If you want to try the chowder, order it this way
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast

5Sz-ccmRXR9oiY2WJYfSVA.text: Wow! I love this oyster bar. We stopped by mid night so we don't have to wait. First of all they are so friendly and helpful since it's my first time. We order oysters, seafood jambalaya, and the shrimp spaghetti. Everything so fresh and tasted so good. Can't wait to come back to try something else. I wish my oysters chilled enough.

-1ojxlaV_9UgaDLFBjEFLA.text: Solid solid place if you survive the line...  Combo pan roast will forever be a meal remembered.  Bob is the best, just like everyone said!  One for the books!

fQJzlyfYdINbXDbFkWGtfQ.text: We have been coming to the Oyster bar for years. It is consistently delicious food. We weren't able to go for several years because we had children (you have to be 21 yrs or older) after 5 years or more we were able to go back and didn't know if it was going to be as good as we remembered... it was amazing. We always get the House Gumbo with all the meats in it.  I get a level 3 for heat my husband gets a 5.  The only downfall is the wait, but completely worth it! If you get there before 5 p.m. and after 8 p.m it seems to move quickly. Big portions! Hard to eat all by yourself and the sour dough roll is soft and yummy perfect before your meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zHO_l4p0-Z3ll3-Q1LkgZw.text: I absolutely have a wonderful time here all the time! Even when the line is super long, I am still more than happy to wait for their food. That's all on me so don't blame anyone for spending time in the line for food.   I got a half of a dozen oysters right away and they shucked it immediately. I slurped them with lemon and Tabasco and was completely satisfied. I didn't ask which kind of oysters they were and was full aware they weren't of the shigoku or Kumamoto type. But they were cheap during moonlight special and still very fresh. No complaints.  I waited for my level 5 combo pan roast and today was he first time of coming here at least 6 times that I finished! I was so thrilled and enjoyed every bite. The flavor was incredible and hit the spot. There are hard to please customers (whom I've met today during my meal) but chef Brown was incredibly helpful and kind throughout. All the staff was personable even though it was busy.   I would definitely recommend this place and enjoy the experience and food. It's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TuT-Ki-eFQ02zFNtw5ejAQ.text: COMBO PAN ROAST.  Never heard of such a thing before reading about it here on Yelp.  The closest thing I think it relates to is a rich cup of Lobster Bisque.  Except it's got shrimp, crab, lobster & more in a bowl the size of Texas.  Creamy goodness with seafood in every bite.    As others have mentioned, the wait can easily be 1-2+ hours plus as they have a very limited number of seats.  Solution - go on Mon-Thu before 10:30am.    Full-time rotation regular for any trip to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

JT-5fjWjZNfKt8Q90phUcA.text: My boyfriend and I were able to come here during our Vegas trip and it was our favorite meal of the weekend!   We came around 6pm on a Saturday night and there were a couple of parties ahead of us. The line did take awhile and we ended up waiting arounf 40-50 minutes, but it was worth it. Waiting in the middle of a casino isn't a fun experience, so make sure you're with good company.  When you get seated, they start you off with a dinner roll. This was just okay. Save yourself for the good stuff. I regret eating half my dinner roll.  We ordered a dozen oysters ($20) and the combo pan roast ($24) to share. They ended up giving us two bowls of rice and didn't charge us a ($5) splitting fee. Maybe it was because we ordered a dozen oysters and also two 23oz Blue Moons ($10 each). I almost ordered a clam chowder, but good thing I didn't because we were stuffed! The pan roast was delicious with a very generous portion of seafood. There was plenty of crab, shrimp, and lobster. Real lobster. Not crawfish. We got the pan roast spicy level 6 and it was perfect for us. We like our food on the spicier side. It had a great kick. The oysters were HUGE. The biggest oysters I've ever had. They weren't fishy at all, but I did feel like they were a little bland since they were so big. I tried putting a good amount of cocktail sauce on them as well. I know the have HH for the oysters from 1am-9am, but I would just come during non-HH hours and get the dozen oysters for the same deal. I can imagine myself getting super hangry waiting during HH.  The service was great. The lady who helped us was very sweet and had a really positive attitude.   We will definitely come back whenever we have a chance.

8vJpnQLdxibqvFY38AmqqA.text: If you've never tried this place please do so!! This place has so much flavor and tastes so good you want more by the time you get home. Can never finish a dish and always happen to take it home and finishing it all and needing more. All the dishes taste good but tried 5 from a simple menu of less than 15.  V V recommend  Pan Roast- comes with a bowl of rice or substitute for pasta for more (a must get dish every time I come)  Bouillabaisse- when going with another person order this with the pan roast   Oysters on half shell- so fresh and sweet each time   Warning! There are less than 10 seats so you will have to wait a long time since this place is popular.  Shortest wait time: 30 min Longest wait time: 2.5 hours   Prices aren't cheap but can't wait to go back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steamed clams in white sauce
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Bouillabaisse
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast

PEPEpfcZ4MS1DSE9KSEspA.text: Ordered the clam chowder and steamed mussels, I enjoyed it.... not bad for seafood in the desert. The only complaint is the place is really small so either go before the dinner rush or after, because there will be a wait. We waited about 45minutes to an hour to be seated.

BACKAVFLQgcwyNer4D4Yvg.text: Read the reviews on this place. I would say yes this place is totally worth the wait. The only thing that I don't like is the fact it is located inside the Palace hotel casino where everyone is smoking. The wait was not too terrible, although I waited in line around hour and half ish on a Monday night around 7pm. We ordered the dozen clams, diavlo, pan roast (combo), and gumbo all at level 8 spiciness, I think I could have just went for the 10, but I am the type to enjoy eating ghost peppers, so choose according to your level that you are able to handle. Clams are super fresh, but not sure what part of the ocean it is. I would not say it is the best (the best is when I had clams in Chelsea market in New York), but definitely a good substitute. My favorite dish is the diavlo by far, then the pan roast and lastly the gumbo. I was not a huge fan of the gumbo, but I don't like okras so if you don't like okras I suggest not ordering it. Overall, I would come back, if given the opportunity.

CIkfGLzEh5bgEMtoo0_5og.text: WORTH THE WAIT IN LINE!!  We had the peel and eat shrimp, oysters in a half shell, and jambalaya.  Everything was delicious!

XGcf4tZppAcD4B3224Ty7g.text: Don't run off when you see the line or when you have been standing in it for an hour. There is a reason there is a line and it's amazing food and exceptional employees who take pride in the work. You would have thought they owned this restaurant the pride they showed in the quality and reputation of the restaurant. If I could I would give 10 stars.

b_i4yRIkNDk4X2QxQY1YZQ.text: This is another place we always go to at least once every time we are in Vegas.  The sourdough rolls are always warm and go well with butter. The thing to get here is the Pan Roast. They must put crack in it or something, it is addictive.  There are only a few generic wines to choose from, but wine is really not necessary when you can drink the Pan Roast instead.   There are only a limited number of seats to sit at, so sometimes you have to wait a while, but it is worth it, and the service is good because there are only a limited number of seats to sit at.

OBawDnnZOEYeqBWXxNYBzA.text: If you're looking for something a little bit different away from the strip this could be your place. It was highly recommended by a few friends and so we had to check it out. They basically serve up this cajun stews with lots of seafood and a bar at the Palace Station. Of course along with it you can get some fresh oysters, bloody mary oyster shooters and a few other typical things. The pan roast is what they're famous for which is this creamy mixture of spice and seafood.  Just some notes.   1. Its a bar so there isn't much seating 2. There's only 6 cooking stations so only 6 people get served at a time. 3. Watch out for the spice level, because level 7 made me pay the next morning ... twice. 4. Prepare to wait, see above.

9LOakzvjDHJTdfNV-mmhjA.text: wow, seriously!! Who'd of thunk I could get yummy good quality seafood in a small (I mean small) eatery at Palace Station of all places.  This little bar area right by the slots literally seats about like 20 people at one time.  The waiting does suck a little.. because even though there are two empty seats available, if there's a party of three in front of you, those seats will stay empty.  Advice - I heard them say you're allowed to cut the line as long as the people in front of you are ok w/it.  The food's expensive, no getting away from that.. food ranges from $15 - $25.  I should say, it looks expensive when you see where the food's coming from.    Food:    Appetizers:  raw clams or oysters of the half shell, caesar salar w/or w/o shrimp or chicken, alaskan chowder, manhattan or new england clam chowder  Main courses:  different kinds of gumbo, cioppino, steamed little neck clams, different kinds of pan roasts  to name a few.. and then specials everyday.  I shared some oysters w/ my friends.  They were on the small side but definitely NOT lacking in flavor.  They come w/spicy horse radish and lots of different types of hot sauces to pick from - red's, tabasco, all the classics!  I had a cup of their new england clam chowder which was definitely worth it, one of the best I've ever had, so creamy and sweet!  I shared the house gumbo w/my friend which came w/lobster, crab, shrimp, sausage and chicken.  It's a massive bowl of food, great to share.  Here's a good hint:  it's a little on the saucy side, but if you squirt lemon juice in it, it so makes the dish so much better.  The service was good, and fast.  Our waitress was fast, liked to joke around with us, and ifs he wasn't around, the chef who's cooking in front of everyone is more than happy to help you out.  What's cool is the chef cooks everything in these cone like pots.  He's cooking different types of gumbo and soups in each one and once he's done plating, he turns the pot downwards and rinses it w/water n starts again.  A gem in the middle of a hotel/casino that's most likely not on your list of places to visit while you're in Vegas, but I tell you, the wait and the trip here is well worth it!!

ziz0S4ggN2wH7sHzjW9ubQ.text: Decided to give this place a shot after reading so many great reviews.  We got in line around 11pm on a Sat night.  Waited for about 30 mins to get seated and it was totally worth it.  Oysters are shucked fresh as you order.  I went with the pan roast level 5 and it was delish.  Could have probably went a little spicier but didn't want to chance it on my first try.  My buddy went with the alaskan chowder which was tasty as well.

NZpygAOAeLG4lMXyDeRuIA.text: Was not too keen on the wait. But hey, I read good reviews so I decide to wait about 1.5 hours. My husband ordered the gumbo with everything and I had a half-dozen oysters and the New England clam chowder. The chowder was good. Full of clams and good flavor. I ate my freshly shucked oysters with tabasco and they were really good. Kind of reminded me of home (FL). The gumbo had a really good flavor and full of seafood. They definitely don't skimp and you get your money's worth.  The scene was really cool, watching the chef cook your food in front of your eyes, so you know what you are getting.

zwe64t4nZbjoYJqPq2WGGA.text: First off let me say.... I don't eat here for dinner. Line is way to long. This is a breakfast joint 4 me. Best food around.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Diablo

iZSy0ckhgUs0ZSXQ_9atcQ.text: Wow... by far the best oyster bar/seafood restaurant I've been to. Granted, I'm not much of an oyster fan... nor go to a lot of just seafood restaurants but still.   This gem is hidden in a really ghetto casino called Palace Casino off the strip. And this establishment consists of just one bar table like setup. The wait is just ridiculous but definitely worth it. Ordered the Pan Roast... it's a soup and you can get either a side of rice or noodles to put in there. It's so mouth-watering that I'm watering right now as I write this.   It is a little pricey but again... worth it.

RWKfrN_Vr05vW_eCTUhQpg.text: No reservation, first come first serve. I waited over an hour and I have to say it was worth it. I'll wait even longer if I have to, just to get a bite a pan roast, dozen oysters and clams.  One of my favorite place. Gotta try it to know it!

X90ABYmObk93BVKPSEsw0w.text: This place is a definite must every time I'm in Vegas. The wait is long since it really is just a bar that they seat you at so I suggest coming early in the day. Avoid coming at dinner. Or come really late at night. I always get the house combo pan roast and spicy level 7. If you like really spicy stuff you can go higher. I think 6 is mild and 5 is like nothing. Hehe. The staff is very friendly and the service is good.

w_EGLFr2ANPDttQvlfEORw.text: Our party of 5 came here for the first time at around 11am the Monday after Christmas to feast on some pan roast and oysters.  Fortunately, there were 5 seats still open when we got there.  By the time we finished our meal, a line of vultures was already forming to swoop for our prime spots.  I had the Level 5 seafood pan roast and it was perfect for me (Not a huge fan of spicy food, but can tolerate)  Bursting with flavor, the boiling plump seafood was just what the doctor ordered for a cold winter day in Vegas.  The oysters were fresh and quite plump as well, but the star of the show is definitely the pan roast.  A nice stroll afterwards... in the crisp outside winter air... with your new friend warming you up inside...hits the spot perfectly!  Not sure I'd eat this during the scorching summer.  This place deserves 6 stars for the contraption they use to cook the pan roast.  Cook, pour, rinse, repeat...  SO EFFICIENT!

XsSW4bgkpl4fkOdYKNUndA.text: way too salty! huge protion... a bit over prices

iVdSWQz9mBhMcbydrF5Ykw.text: Love this place not necessarily for the oyters but, for the pan roast.  It's a must every time I'm in town and it kills me that there's nothing like it closer to Los Angeles.  I even tried another place in Vegas that was supposed to be the same thing.  Nope, not even close.  Their flavor is unique and delicious.

C_Tjzf5sS0yIjw3d3Z36XQ.text: Thank you Yelpers for helping find this hidden food utopia! I got there around 5:30 on a Sunday evening, just me so I didn't have to wait. Ordered the combo Pan Roast with no spice and it was fantastic! The perfect meal for a weary traveler and I have about 3 days worth of leftovers. Very reasonably priced. Highly recommend for a casual dinner. I wouldn't recommend coming with a group though. It literally is a bar with about 20 seats and it's first come first serve.

Q3_9XFk3FYq1YnJMI8wqUg.text: Don't know why it never crossed my mind to review this awesome place, but it's never too late to give it its well deserved 4 stars.  This oyster bar is my must stop place every time I'm in Vegas.  My bf brought me here 5 years ago and I just loved their combo pan roast w/ rice on the side.  The gumbo is delicious too, but I would go for the pan roast if it's your first time there.  Their portions are huge so you can definitely share a pan roast with someone else and just get extra rice.  The food is consistently good each time I visit.  I've brought many friends along to try it and they all loved it.  I don't eat oysters but my bf loves their oysters and says that they are one of the freshest he's ever had, and I do see how huge their oysters are compared to other places.  There's always a wait here since it's literally just a bar that seats like 10-15 people, so come early to avoid the long line.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KTLT7SUJvkybgQMij77SXg.text: 2nd visit here.  Had to stop in, though I'm pregnant, because of how good it was last time I ate here.  I'm hoping the Rockefellers I had were okay for someone in my "condition" to eat.  Had none of the raw stuff, but even the Rockefellers satisfied a craving!  Servers are so nice and easy going, offered my friend and I a free shot!  Lol, he was very surprised when I showed him my belly (thanx guy!!).  As I was given a free oyster shooter last time I was here also, they seem to me very hospitable!!  Anyway, if you love oysters and all things sea food, you won't be disappointed!

y_NtkvP72XfqYYOZVS54mg.text: I'm from Massachusetts and they have the best New England clam chowder I have ever had outside of the east coast.  Awesome place to eat.  And open 24 hours

kkEdKcn4pBd2bRnN8ZLHZQ.text: Secret gem... Who knows such a good seafood can be found in this casino. I tried few seafood gumbo but always makes me so satisfied.  Only thing is that especially after midnight, the wait is too long and we almost waited 1.5 hrs..  It is worth it but I wish more people could sit at counter.

icJUhAcAd67JQ_zXgObohw.text: This place is delicious! I love the pan roast! I always crave this stuff  but unfortunately they don't have one when I live in San Diego. Hopefully they will open one there one day! Yes, there's usually a wait but it's definitely worth it. Due to the limited seating, Its best to go in groups of 2 or 3. Enjoy!

XpfRMitgSURRKpq0NEbJrg.text: Love this place !! I always plan to take a trip here when im in Vegas. The staff are friendly and sushi is always fresh. However its way off the strip but well worth the trip.

vqN9kkjgSzyBEOErsX91Ow.text: Love this place! Me and my friend ordered Jambalaya and it was amazing!! The portion is definitely big enough for one starving guy (from the long line) or sharing for 2 if you are planning to try bit of everything.   There's a BUT, seating is really really limited and the line was very long but in the end, totally worth the wait.

mpPCJJhfBG0d2XDiuV5AgQ.text: Good things first - delicious lump crab, big oysters, wonderful Alaskan chowder, tasty Combo Pan Roast.  Outstanding meal! Not so good things - very long wait...90 minutes, only 18 seats, only one waitress to clear plates, take orders, and cash out people out.  If you aren't in a rush and you love good seafood, you will love the oyster bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan chowder
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lump crab

ab7Wdnt266Rn4I3vwhrQbw.text: So I been craving this and beg my husband to just drop me off so I can eat alone lol and he did today I had the combo pan roast I got level 7 not spicy at all I remember getting 10 at a different place and it was super spicy so I guess it just depends who makes it. I got here around 12:15pm on a tues no wait plus I was by myself but there were like 6 open seats available. I finish eating and left at 12:55pm and there was now a line of 10 people at least lol just sharing my thoughts because I do not like waiting for anything so my hubby brought me the right time in and out lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast level 7 not spicy at all

Dcds7cdMVMPRbsqRM7yG4w.text: It appears that the Oyster Bar is a hidden gem amongst the Vegas locals. I came here on a bachelor party with friends and the line was well worth it! We arrived around 10pm and the line was still 45 minutes long. There are only a certain amount of stools to sit on. I asked what ocean the fish and shellfish was from and the man had a smart ass answer for me but it's okay. I just prefer not to eat fish full of radiation from the Pacific Ocean.   Everything we ordered was great and I also liked their beer and wine selection. If you are in the mood to wait a while for some grub, this is the spot.

GTQ6Iqkd9FEszSS_hM_D2Q.text: I remember not being able to go the Oyster bar because I wasn't 21 yet and my mom would bring me home some every time she went. As soon as I turned 21 I made my point to become a regular here. My go to meals are combo pan roast and Alaskan  clam chowder. My absolute favorite chef is Ricardo he's fast and the taste is like no other. JJ is really good as well and you know it's gonna be good if he's cooking. Bob is really good too but he's definitely heavy on the spice so go down a few levels when your dining with Bob. I recently tried the etouffee and I must say I was highly impressed and I have now added it to my rotation of meals. There's 18 seats at the table and it's open 24 hours and 99.99% of the time there is definitely a wait. But if you appreciate good food like I do you'll find the time to wait

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan chowder
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Étouffée

qAL6b1dDlWMW_-vQFo_yHQ.text: Its really good, I was doubtful because of its location and because there are so many choices in Las Vegas and wow, this place is amazing.  I know the line is long but its definitely worth the 1 hour-ish wait.  After our first try, we came here three night in a row to have more of the amazing food.  This is definitely nothing fancy as Guy Savoy, but it is definitely authentic Southern style seafood.  I love this type of no frill food joint.  Just good food without the expensive tag.  During our visits, I tried most of the items on the menu.  First off, you get to pick level 1 to 10 for your food's spicyness.  I go for 1 or 0 simply because I dont' like spicy food.  The dinner roll is complimentary, and it is the standard sourdough roll, served warm with butter.  Their Clam Chowder is actually not that good, too powdery taste. I don't know why others liked it, I didn't.  Not enough clam in it too.  I like Boudin's Clam Chowder better when compare to similiar level.  Their Bouillabaisse is good, you can choose between rice or noodle, it is tomato based soup with all of the seafoods (Lobster, Crab, Shrimp, Clams, Mussels, Fish..etc), which is their #2 signature item.  #1 most popular item is their combo roast.  It is thicker in terms of broth, but it goes really well with rice.  You get to pick your favorite toppings but combo roast comes with shrimp, crab, and lobster, which is better in my opinion than the Palace Roast (with chicken).  Its little bit spicy for me but the bold taste of the seafood is one of the best I had for years.  My personal favorite goes to the Shrimp Scampi with Pasta.  Its the clam soup with melted butter and loads of tiger shrimp.  Its so heavenly.  I would order extra noodle next time when I go to satisfy my crave.  Tip: There's no tip as in when the lines will be shorter, its really your luck but the chef really matters alot.  Even the materials/ingredients are all the same, but chef really made the difference.  During our 3 visits, this fat chef whose always happy did the best job.  His shrimp scampi is out of this world yet another chef always seems piss at something...did a very sloppy job, my scampi was dry and soup-less.  Good luck waiting and don't lose too much money on slots while waiting in line!

ia9S4qjE07p7OOWEIYiczQ.text: OMG THIS PLACE IS AMAZING AND DEFINITELY WORTH THE LONG WAIT!!!!!  If you're drunk and with your friends waiting, time will fly by fast. The way the place is laid out is in the casino area of Palace Station, literally looks like a little bar area, and seats no more than 15-20 people, TOPS. My friend, bf and I waited like an hour. LADIES, make sure you switch your heels from the club/dayclub with some comfy flip flops or flats!!!! You will thank me later.   I have this tendency where I order too much food when I'm drunk, but with waiting for an hour, WHO CARES?!!! SO NOW ONTO THE FOOD!!!!  OYSTER SHOOTERS: MMM YUMMY. Super refreshing AND OYSTERS WERE FRESH TO DEATH. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.   COMBO PAN ROAST: My friend and I got one each... and it was sooooo goood. It came with shrimp, lobster and crab and the texture of the orange stewy sauce was soooo succulent and eating it with the scoop of rice they give you on top is just simply amazing.   BOUILLABAISSE: My boyfriend got this, and it had noodles in it and was a little more soupy but still had some stewy texture. He says it's HIGHLY COMPARABLE to bouillabaisse in the EAST COAST and Oyster Bar is the best place for it on the westside.   ALASKAN CLAM CHOWDER:  OMG THIS CHOWDER IS SO GOOD. PROBABLY THE BEST CLAM CHOWDER I'VE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE. It comes with shrimp, crab, lobster, and of course, CLAMS, and the chowder is so RICH in flavor and the PERFECT AMOUNT of saltiness. GET IT MANHATTAN STYLE or New England style.   Be ready to pass out for about an hour or two before you rage some more... this place hits the spot and is definitely amazing COMFORT FOOD. Even the NEXT MORNING we reheated all of the leftovers in our hotel and it still tasted SO AMAZING. I URGE YOU to make time for this place if you're a seafood and stew lover if you're ever in VEGAS.   Hope this helped! ;)

QHN7pLsURD70PzFQi9SAXQ.text: Can't add much here that hasn't already been said.  Authentic fresh seafood, especially the oysters.  A long wait ... Could be 30 min to an hour.  Beloved by locals.  Food is cooked right in front of you.  If you want a pure no frills seafood feast, this is your place.  A good starter meal would be a bunch of fresh oysters followed by the pan roast of your choice.

lPO41s7nLFWPfnIoanmrlA.text: About a 35 minute wait but worth every minute. The food was fantastic. Bob and wait staff very accommodating   On my list for next visit

0iTkwl-qvVLJcDgfS3nI4Q.text: I was craving the oyster bar for quite a while now so I begged and begged my boyfriend to take me and finally we went. We got there around 7:30 pm but were seated around 9:15ish. There were I believe only 2 cooks who alternates and one server. I have so much respect for the server, she was hustlin hard! I got the combo pan roast and it was bomb! We got our food and fifteen minutes into eating our food, we just to-goed it and the next day when I warmed it up it taste just as good. Long wait but worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SW2hcRiwvzmZNGhJNV4Yvg.text: Expect at least a 1-3 hour wait if you're trying to grub during evening hours. Honestly the BEST gumbo in Vegas though. It's a must try place if you have time to spare and want good food.

plu2diVFrYCBuKbOs4KZSw.text: Despite the obstacles in our way (2 children under 5) ... we still went to the Oyster Bar.   We went at 8AM... because the law of the universe states that all children under 5 must wake up before 7AM and be asleep before 10PM.  Sadly, state law means no kids on the casino floor. Happily, each person in line is allowed to order TWO items to go.   Hubby ordered a gumbo and an alaskan chowder to go... and we ate it at the Grand Cafe.  I have never been a fan of gumbo... but it was really very good. The soup mixed with the rice, really changed it into something divine.   The chowder was overflowing with seafood. I didn't find a single bit of potato or other fillers. It was lobster, shrimp, scallop, clam, king crab... I couldn't believe how much seafood that had put into this chowder!  The kids loved it too... I hope they don't become too picky about chowder in the future =)  My 5 year old kept telling me how she LOVED the lobster.

7bw1UZvPeS5EFPZ_CH7urw.text: I should give this a one star to lower there rating. Since I hear there line gets really crazy here. We got lucky and got a table right away. We have a couple places like this in so cal but wow this place taste so much better. I ordered the etouffee and my wife got the gumbo. Both items tasted awesome so we will be coming back whenever we are in Vegas now.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soooo good
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Came early

XcxUIfJ_qM-QwNX0DCH_Mg.text: If five stars means "as good as it gets," then this is as good as it's gonna get. Yeah, it's a long wait sometimes, but it's worth it. I know, I know, you're at the Palace Station, but you'll be ok. You won't get seafood poisoning. Your friends aren't playing a trick on you.  The pan roast is perfect and fills the empty hole in your heart. How can you not be happy eating this? Seafood in a tomato-y bisque. It's like standing in the sun after you've been in a too-cold room for hours. You just soak it up, forgetting all of your discontents.

F5b1PBwvPwvWz68oF6sccw.text: Don't know why this place got such good reviews, 4 1/2 stars! I was staying at Palace Station, so naturally I wanted to try this place because of all the good reviews. I got the combo pan roast like everyone suggested on yelp and there was nothing good to say about it except for the 3 pieces of lobster that was in there and the few shrimp. You could barely see any crab meat in there. The rice that came with it was soggy and clumpy and not enough when comparing the pan roast and rice ratio.   Pros:  -It was just a short walk away since I was staying at the hotel. -the waitress and cook were nice   Cons: based on the combo pan roast that I got.  -rice, way too soggy and clumpy, and not enough for the pan roast. -the combo pan roast was overpriced for what you get. Only 3 pieces of lobster, just a few shrimp, and hardly any crab meat. -long line, long wait (not at all worth it). Save your money for something better or spend a little more for a nice buffet.

cXpRiCm7litmogpa1IetYw.text: I told my fiance we had to try this place on our last trip to vegas, so we came here for breakfast and stood in a very long line to eat here! good thing theyre opened 24 hours :)  We got oysters to start. these things were HUGE. I don't love oysters but my fiance does and these were hard for him to eat...maybe huge oysters are a good thing for some people, but not for us. :(  We ordered the pan roast with lobster, shrimp, and crab. It was good, but I felt the crab got lost in the whole thing. The tomato base was creamy and delicious and because we were sharing, they brought us an extra rice at no charge! The bread that came with the meal was soft and crusty. yum!  Anyway, the pricing was a little steep but its vegas and theyre opened all the time so a premium is understood.  I'll probably be back if im in the mood for pan roast in vegas :)

IChK8kHt98WDQ4U6I9Zguw.text: The best in LV! Highly recommended. Wait time is long but well worth it. If you want to have a good meal check this place out.

-09kDuCt1PsnOAlGrQhJ2A.text: Let me start by saying this place actually deserves 5 stars, but one major flaw made me knock it down one.  That flaw: There are 18 seats. Which translates to a minimum wait time of 1 hour... we waited 2 and a half.  YES, 2 and a half hours standing in line in the middle of a casino to eat at this tiny little bar that serves amazing food. I rarely ever find myself in line for that long for any other reason. I wouldn't even wait that long to get a blowjob from Justin Bieber. That's just a ridiculously long time, and yet... I was still blown away.  The food is Cajun themed and serves a variety of Creole style food. I ordered the Jambalaya(+++), others in my party ordered the Seafood Bake(++), Gumbo, and Cioppino (fish stew+++). Aside from the Gumbo, which was a tad salty, the food was the best damn Creole food I've ever had.  The food is cooked in individual pans that are cooked right in front of you by a single chef. This dude runs around like a maniac, doing all the prepping, seasoning, oyster-shucking, clam-steaming, and rice-cooking. He is a machine and yet still so friendly. He kept working at a furious pace, but would still be able to converse with the seated individuals. He would be the an amazing bartender if he could mix drinks like the way he cooks.  All the ingredients are fresh, and the oysters are individually wrapped to ensure quality every time. After deciding upon a spiciness level (1-10) you get to watch the master work. Side note: I ordered a 4, and am a big fan of spicy food. I figured if it wasn't hot enough, I'll just add more hot-sauce. It was pretty darn perfect. A nice kick, but not too over-powering. My fellow diners ordered a 5 and 6, and the 6 was starting to get pretty intense.  The portions are huge, I finished only 2/3 of my Jambalaya and was shocked 'cause I have been left to starve and wince in hunger for 2 hours prior. The presentation is simple, but due to the quality and quantity of the food, it looked absolutely delicious.  Overall, I would say this is definitely an AMAZING hidden secret in Vegas. But the Palace Station is off-strip and a little annoying to take a cab just for this meal. But if you ever find yourself in the area and are down for some GREAT seafood, this should definitely be an option... just be prepared to wait an ungodly amount of time.

OOOzUfcxd7w3aMnJkHsqzQ.text: I come here at least twice a month and I pray Hollowmon is there every time he's extremely into every dish he cooks and very entertaining.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

twQERum5V5NQEkZWf8nz6g.text: The drive from LA to Vegas is brutal.  Well, not horrible, but sitting in a car for 3.5 - 4 hours deserves some kind of reward.  When planning our Vegas trip, of course one of the first things we do is decide what and where we'll eat during the weekend.  This place was the first one on the list.  It had been on both of our bookmarks for a long while.  It seemed only fitting to treat ourselves to a delicious meal from Oyster Bar after our long drive from LA.  We read the Yelp reviews and knew that we had to hit this place up when we got into town.  We would be arriving at about 1-2am, and according to the reviews, probably the best time to avoid the wait.  After searching the casino, we found this little tiny bar.  Yes people, the reviews are all True.  It's tiny.  It's basically a bar with seats around it (about 18 or so).  Get in line to be seated, and be prepared for a wait.    Of course, by the time we were seated, we knew exactly what we were going to order.  One combo pan roast and 6 oysters.  It was 2am in the morning, and I was struggling with the concept of sleep and enjoying my delicious meal.  But this meal was too amazing to pass up.  The oysters came, and my friend and I had three each.  Paired with the cocktail sauce and horseradish, those oyster were a great prelude to our meal.  The oysters were fresh and at $10 for 6 (midnight special), it was well worth it.  The pan roast.  OMG the pan roast.  If you come here and can't decide what to order, just order the pan roast.  You won't be sorry.  My friend and I shared the plate.  There's a $5 sharing fee, but you get two scoops of rice instead of the one it's usually served with.  Besides, we could not have finished one each anyways.  We ordered a 5 level spicy, and that was good enough for me.  Not too spicy, just enough that you know there's some spice in the dish.  Yes, order the pan roast.  You won't be sorry!!  Great meal for the start of our Vegas trip.

roqYdR4qjLhNoA5FJsaz7Q.text: Heard so much about this place lucky when I get there the line was short. There was 4 ppl in front of us. I had a party of 2. So wait was about 30min. First come first serve. I order half dozen raw oyster (the oyster pretty big) n 1 dozen of raw clam, clam chowder and the clam steamer. Everything was so good. It's located at the palace station casino. I like how the counter sit is. So if u come to Vegas stop by and give it try. Price is cheap too.

sENBoKdOqClhdIM5NL42xg.text: Best oyster bar in town hands down. Been going here for over 10 years. The only downfall is the wait. So i always plan around busy times but it is open 24 hrs.  Everything on menu is awesome and you cannot go wrong.

W727I01U-EyTuSb2W5-idw.text: You don't come off the strip to Palace Station to gamble.. You come here for Oyster Bar.  You wait ever so patiently to sit at a small bar. It is what it is! The food is cooked right there in front of you. This spot is a no frills no nonsense kind of place. Don't line jump either, they will catch you. Our waitress was Sandra and she was a total sweetheart.  I had a dozen oysters and the house gumbo while my friends had various versions of the pan roast. The portions are HUGE, like a large sized bowl of pho. I recommend you share an entree with someone and then order some oysters.  AWESOME FOOD. AMAZING SERVICE.

9DPMS9vkODHvZx56UGgniQ.text: Best seafood pan roast I ever had. However I have to knock off a few stars cause they allow people already eating to put in additional orders to go when other people are waiting in line. There should be a policy that limits the amount of orders a customer can make. I waited in line for 90 minutes to be seated then waited another 30 minutes to get my food cause all these people that were eating ordered more food to go.

0_DV9kGuii9How1ieLBsoA.text: The wait is ridiculous. Granted it was 1pm on a Saturday. If you plan it right, you'll probably not have to wait 3 hours to finish your meal. You begin to share a sense of camaraderie with those in line with you (and a bit of frustration as there are three seats open but a group of four at the head of the line).   I got the Combo Pan Roast, medium. It was delicious and had excellent flavor. The chef behind the counter was obviously overworked and needed a break. His attempts to smile were a bit sad, but the food he produced was great. At one point he threw up his hands, walked out of the small restaurant area, walked across the casino, and disappeared for 5 minutes. This was while my food was still cooking and slowly evaporating away. I was genuinely concerned that I'd never get to eat.  Stop by if you have some time and are willing to travel to Palace Station. Be prepared to wait at meal times and try to keep your group smaller.

HxitQFfdJe9wT-D6Igf4eA.text: The Palace Pan roast was AMAZING!!! The servings were really big, i was actually full from dinner which I am never full. My girlfriend got the Seafood gumbo which was amazing!!! The food is very tasty and made to perfection!   Only downside is that you have to wait a while for your food to be done. Mainly because they make it fresh right there in front of you so thats the only down side but overall the food is amazing!!!   For all those seafood lovers this is the place where you want to get your fill of it. They had chunks in every bite which is great!!  Definitely go and try this place out if yoru in town. I also got the clam chowder which was amazing!   Its really small place so make sure you plan an arriving early for your  dinner or you have to wait a while.

Oa9UK0Ocve7fhifjKbJ9tQ.text: I don't know what all the Yelp hype is about. One star for the effort of the workers there. The only thing these Yelpers were right about was the long ass wait. As far as being worth the wait...that's VERY questionable. We waited about an hour for a party of 2 on a Monday evening. When seated, we ordered the New England clam chowder (I've definitely had better :/ ), the oysters and clams on the half shell (clams were shredded to pieces and not even shucked properly, oysters were just average), and we also ordered the combo pan roast (although there was a decent amount of seafood present, I wouldn't say that it was worth the hour wait!) service was alright, just a little sloppy. This place is definitely not worth the wait for the quality of food served. I would definitely prefer the Oyster Bar at Harrah's any day!

30KmOeVelTfciSNxkqb1lw.text: What to expect to get here...  1. Waiting in line for over an hour. Please be aware of that and be ready and patient when you get there. You can always go grab a beer and drink while you wait.   2. Amazing food  That's why the 5 stars. I usually go during the graveyard specials and its a little chill there during the week. The combo pan roast is my favorite! Their clam chowder is amazing and their oysters always fresh. So grab some beers and strike up a conversation with the people in line with you because its going to be a while before you sit. It is well worth it ...

dBOt7lUWVqpk3JVIK9vyMg.text: You are going to have to wait, but I believe the food is worth it. I have been coming here for a couple of years when I'm in town for business before it was open 24hrs. I brought my wife and now whenever we are in town it's a must stop.  Service has it's good days and bad and each chef has different spice level, I've had a level 10 spice from one and a level 5 from another you might want to ask the waitress.  Items I love to eat here are steamed clams, raw oysters, and Combo Pan Roast. I've tried the Gumbo which is really good and the raw clams which were ok.   It is a bar so no kids have seen may people try and be refused. I have tried other Station properties but none compare.

JzWzCUoGSL6WzNz679IFHA.text: The first thing I would like to comment on is the long wait which was one hour and a half. It was a 16 seater bar. Apart from that everything else was amazing. The servers were very friendly and welcoming upon sitting down. Food orders were taken promptly. Drinks were refilled before I could ask for a refill, And the food was over-the-top amazingly delicious. I had the house gumbo, which was more amazing than I thought it would be. They let you choose the spiciness level for your dish, so I chose a four and it was perfectly spicy. They do not skimp on seafoods. It was rich and shrimp lobster crab and clams, of course sausage too. I don't know what the other ingredients are for gumbo but this was so good. It was served with a small amount of rice. I also had half a dozen oysters. The only thing about the oysters as they were kind of small in size but they were deliciously fresh with the horse radish cocktail sauce and tobasco.

P8h5BACBIlD1slPIaDJTXQ.text: My husband and I ate here 2 days in a row. That's how good it is. We had the seafood chowder and pan roast the first night and two pan roasts the 2nd day.  Oh and of course we had a dozen oysters, caesar salad, and cheesecake.  Everything's excellent except the wait!

UYh_c_cGfZxKbrzBmLeFgw.text: This place is incredible! I've come to Vegas so many times, have tried so many restaurants/buffets and this place is the one I am always craving for! The line is always ridiculously long so I decided to come at 2am on a Thursday night, still waited an hour to get seated, but when I was leaving at 3am there was no wait so I guess that's the time you need to come if you don't want to wait in line. I am never a fan for oyster but people I've come with said their oyster is very good! But gumbo is a must-get if you come here, there is spice level 1-10, people seem to like it spicy but I like my gumbo at spice level 4 just so that my anus wont explode during my trip. This place is open 24 hours btw!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half shell oyster

Tdy7-ebBYNcrdquZzcmUvQ.text: Fantastic! The guys that run this place are the best. Good things are worth the wait. The pan roast is amazing and Chris treated us like kings. If I lived here, it would be my go to, no doubt. Everything we tried was superb. I suggest getting rice and linguini as both made the dishes great in their own way. The warm rolls are a must for mopping up the pan roast!!!

GO8TPzQQjhi1bRZ08CwOqA.text: Hands down the Oyster Bar is a favorite of mine! Clam Chowder is so good and the Combo Pan Roast is a must! I do have to say the wait time is long but it's totally worth it.

KaEqqzJIV2oFxzibMi9vqQ.text: Happy I finally got to try this place out and didn't have to wait in that crazy hour and half line. Ordered oysters on a half shell, combo pan roast, and Alaskan chowder New England style. Both the chowder and combo pan roast were filled with a ton of sea food. Both were also huge portions. Not sure if I would come back just for the oysters as there are other places that are better priced. Would definitely come back for the combo pan roast though. Full of flavor and the sauce was amazing and it also comes with a side of white rice!  limited seating and not the most comfortable seats. Not sure any restaurant is worth an hour and a half wait. Will be coming back to try their cioppino also as that looked extremely yummy.

3WnZ_QIQnnAr2IhlmdQzOg.text: Gotta try the Palace Pan Roast!!! Absolutely delicious. Can't beat this place. Fresh Seafood made to order and awesome flavor. This is always packed and for good reason. Great late night after a night out or mid-day fora spectacular lunch.

VqKdj4PHZgd7LyAN1IshoQ.text: Love love love the food here! Every time my fiance and I are in Vegas, we make an attempt to eat here. I highly recommend the pan roast. I would give them 5 stars but the wait for this place is extremely long.

nUi-Z-GUcNldhzjdYZ5zpw.text: Be prepared for a pretty long wait. Very limited seating.   Amazing pan roast and good seafood. The pan roast is big enough for two people but they charge a $5 plate sharing fee.   Staff is so much fun and very friendly. Makes up for what may be a long wait for your food.

UhEXuBB4SJ07xD9yso4BsA.text: The foods are really good even though we waited for 3hour 15 minutes. It would be better if they move to bigger place

y_Fbk-k2AVv08Sjzs3HgRw.text: I love love love this place. It's a must everything I'm in vegas. The cooks and the service is really great! They're so friendly and funny. I always get the pan roast sometimes combo or sometimes palace. You get to rate your spiciness from 1 to 10. I used to share with my gf and we would get level 6 and pay the 5$ splitting fee. Then we started getting our own bowl (I swear it tastes even better the next day, like how pizza or chipotle does). I started getting a level 10 and it still wasn't spicy to me. The last time I went I asked for a number 15! Haha she said that's called habanero level anything greater than 10. It was more spicy and tastes even better. If you love spicy get habanero level! Mmmm. Craving now.   I ate the oyster here everytime. My gf loves it and says its her favorite place for oysters. I can't really tell the difference between oysters but she recommends it!

V8_8incxAJ4kIvTzIuN04A.text: Best southern food ever! Gotta go early cuz the wait is long!!!!!! But it's open 24/7 so go anytime! Parking is easy. Smells delicious. Be careful some stuff is spicy anything over a 4

8usO1NvpGNYjj-SdTssK1Q.text: Oh my oh my oh my!!!! The wait is soooooooo worth it! With 8 people in front of me, I thought my girlfriend and i would give it a try. Here we are at 1am, don't know if we were tired or buzzed maybe both. The smell of the food tickles you nose the closer you get to the front of the line. Steve cleans up an area and we are called up to our seats!! Mind you I am clueless as to what kind of food this is only that I wanted oysters and the aroma of spices is amazing. Luckily our bar neighbor gives us a quick rundown of how it works with his recommendations on the menu, I ordered the palace combo with seafood and chicken and sausage my love ordered the combo. When we asked for oysters Steve recommended that we pass on these oysters as they were from a secondary supplier and not of grade A like they usually serve. So he recommends the clams. We happily agree. Then right in front of us chef D throws butter a scoop of garlic into one of the pans in front of us!! In go the clams with clam stock and it starts to boil!!! If only there was smell-a-pic. Anyways that's just the beginning I will let your imagination take over as to how amazing the rest of the meal went!!! If you are ever on Vegas this is a MUST DO!!!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu...

FCS6kEdnlMKWOVbRgtoG1Q.text: What can I say this place is a True Vegas hidden gem. One of those place you have to visit if your in the mood for great seafood. I always get the house gumbo spicy 8-10 depending on the chef cooking. It's a small bar with maybe 15 seats so get there early if your going around lunch time or its open 24 hours a day so go when it's less busy. A must try if your in town.

ayc_R-HQX7x3XrLmnJp81A.text: Not that great. The hype was a lie. If you want to pay 30 bucks for tomato soup its ur thing.

C_nSWm7tPKXhsoPQEQZuNw.text: Amazing food, great service. I have been coming here for years, whenever I visit Vegas. One of the best places in Vegas. I know the wait can be long it is only an "oyster bar" after all, but all worth it. So know you have to be prepared to wait. I can't ding them for that,you can only go so fast with limited seating. Go hungry because portions are plentiful! Pan roast, oysters, chowder etc. all good dependent on your mood!

fypa5V94AXmdx6uEDH1_mQ.text: They really need to come up with a better system for patrons waiting in line. Customers are literally standing in line for over an hour to eat at this establishment. My first question is: Why does such a highly reputed business only seat 16 people? Is there room for expansion? Might be a good idea. Secondly: Why are customers waiting in line? I'm comfortable with the notion that a restaurant reserves the right to refuse reservations. However, these days we have many reliable means of communicating with a wait list. For example, when someone comes in person to dine, they could be given a buzzer or sent a text message to let them know when space is available. That would allow patrons their precious time, to gamble or do with it as they wish. I sincerely hope these suggestions can be implemented as soon as possible. There is simply no excuse to alienate your entire customer base with this preposterous infrastructure any further.

WMfZhWSIDcpYJcifa_EqYA.text: The food and service is good, but be prepared to wait a very long time. I waited 1 1/2 hours at midnight on a Tuesday night and apparently that wait is on the quick side of things. Seating is limited, they only have bar seating. There is a constant wait here and no chairs for people waiting, you have to stand the whole time. With so many great places to eat in Vegas, it's just too difficult to rate this place any higher or want to return based on the wait time alone. For me, it's not worth it, sorry.

xs79lI6RahukZnw7UFrUJw.text: Hubby and i went on a tuesday night and theres no line. Got the Boston clam chowder and seafood chowder. It was good but it was not hot anymore when it was served. Service was good.

f23btpup06fEGjpe1l0KMw.text: This place is amazing! possibly my favorite restaurant in Vegas!! it's a bar in the middle of the Palace Station casino, so you have to be 21 to eat there.. they cook the gumbo, chowder or pan roast right in front of you! & there's usually a 30-45 min wait but it doesn't matter when you try the pan roast (my favorite) omg! Heaven in a bowl!! Just thinking about it now make me miss Vegas... :-(

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. oyster bar at palace station

963kkho9kCeeH4VlgUMcVQ.text: 5 stars for the food  2 stars for restaurant operations 4 stars overall  I went with 3 other friends at 11pm on a  Friday night and ended up waiting 2 .5 hours before getting seated.  (On another visit I went with another friend on a Sat. at 2 pm but didn't get seated until 3:30 pm.)  The place seemed chronically understaffed with 2 - 3 visible employees were working very hard to cook the dishes, shell the oysters, serve the drinks and clear the tables seemingly without any breaks.  Turnover was super slow and inefficient with some dirty dishes sitting around up to 15 - 20 minutes before they would be cleared off the counter before another patron could be seated. Once seated, there'd be a lag before they'd come to get our drink orders, then some more lag before they take our food orders, followed by even more lag before the food comes out.  I see the cook and another lady working nonstop so I know they are probably doing the best that they can (on occasion another woman comes out to help clear some dirty dishes).   While in line, I keep pacing the length of the bar to see how many more seats are opening up. I also can't help but tell my friends how I'd run the place if I were the manager/owner and could add employees and expand space dramatically and/or have chain locations just to accommodate all the patrons without excessive waits. I'd also implement policies/procedures to eradicate all the inefficiencies and increase sales and customer satisfaction.   But alas, when the food does come out, it does not disappoint.  We shared the combo pan roast, the jambalaya, the bouillabase and the gumbo and Bloody Mary oyster shooters.  The flavors are bold and strong, even a little on the salty side, but it really hits the spot. The pan roast and the jambalaya were such satiating comfort foods for my famished belly. The seafood tasted so good. The gumbo and the bouillabase were good but not exceptional. The oyster shooters were just normal.  The prices seem a little high at around $20 something per dish, but the portions are hearty and 4 people can easily share 3 dishes and still be full.  Despite the wait, I feel that everyone should try the Oyster Bar at least once. Although I don't like dining by myself, if you don't mind eating by yourself, sometimes they'll let the single diners cut in line and eat first.

yV9BV7jEefllFg1pKb_v5w.text: This hidden gem is outside of the strip.  There like around 12 seating in an old hotel (Palace Station).  Don't be fool by the decor outside the hotel because the food here is so fresh and delicious.  The seafood's is also very fresh and the price is not that expensive either.  I had the Seafood Tower (Oyster, Lobster, Crab Leg and White Crab meat) and Crab Caesar Salad which was amazing.  I wanted to order the Combo Pan Roast (which has Seafood combination),but I was to full. I would recommend this place, but keep in mind that there will be a wait, so be patience because it worth it.  I will go to this place again when I'm in town in Vegas.

4FjqBoHCdajLTHhaZhfdjg.text: 5 star means REALLY REALLY good food. The price and service better be pretty damn good too. It's a big deal giving 5 stars but I want to explain. If you want really good seafood, it's going to cost an arm and a leg, unless you make it yourself. The combo pan roast (shrimp, lobster and crab) is really outstanding. And, even with the $5 sharing charge (who cares people!!!) and the extra $2 for the pasta instead of rice, it is WELL WORTH the money. I can probably make something like this at home, but it wont be this. I've had it before here and it is consistent and delicious. Substituting the pasta instead of rice is THEE way to go. It completely transforms the meal.  The ceasar salad is crisp, cold and very tasty.  The wait. Oh boy. That can be killer. The first time I went, we waited a little over an hour. Despite that, we LOVED the pan roast. Instead of being disappointed with it after such a long wait, it was even better than we thought! Yesterdays' wait = 3 minutes!!! AWESOME! The service is Ok. It's not table service. It's NOT fine dining. NOT AT ALL. But I dont come here for that. It's in the dumpiest dump of a casino, it reeks and the clientele are local drunks and weirdos. But, once you take a bite of the pan roast, you WILL forget where you are. You will savour every bite!

IawI9FVGxiLmt2Kg7YluGg.text: I would rate this place a solid 3.5 stars. Had crab Caesar salad and house gumbo. Salad was fantastic and gumbo was good. The wait times were way too long. If wait was longer than 30 minutes, I wouldn't wait again.

8H3oq8ciDJnboA1E77aCuA.text: After years of hearing myth and lore, finally made the trek to Oyster Bar. Didn't want to wait in line, so we decided to come here before going out (~8pm ish), no line. Spicy food + heavy cream before going out, I know, bad idea. Ordered the combo pan roast, level 8 spiciness, and it was well worth the late night farts in the club (the kind where people look for the source of the stench and you just sulk into the background). One order is plenty of food for two people and I forgot why, but they were having a $1 Bud Light night for some reason. Still hungry, then just load up on the delicious, warm, pillowy sourdough rolls.  No frills, good service, good food.

QRBxk3ld6jNMg9Nbyt_sDA.text: This place is worth the wait... That is if you can handle standing in a ashtray for over a hour.

9hneMuULcJ8wvyXqkxcxiw.text: The one hour is well worth it. Seafood Pan Roast was really good cooked in front of your table. Level 8 spice is just enough heat. This will be my go to place in Las Vegas from now on.

KovB24of1IMB90WRZzIa-g.text: Amazing! Freshest of fresh mussels oysters and salads! The perfect place to go on a hot summer day in Vegas! Ice cold beer and great key line pie! Staff works hard!

bZFE2fo1AqUL4CmLF-SPQw.text: I ate so well, I was embarrassed by myself *burp*  Listen...take the time, wait in line...order the Pan Roast, and the Clam Chowder...it will make you lose your mind!  I did't know Vegas had it like this...I felt like I was back in my me-maw's New Orleans kitchen! *wipes tear*  *drops mike*

0xpZeFma41GY2eqeuSmwiw.text: Not knowing where to go for fresh oysters, clams, and some hot dishes with rice... This is a great choice for late night seafood meal. Yet, get ready for long hours of waiting to be seated coz only 15 seats are available! Still, worth a while of long wait... No regrets!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice and deli raw clams
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh oyster plate

odJCxgvj42CbZNShZ3dSrA.text: Food was AMAZING! Chef and waitress were hilarious! However that wait!!!! The wait time is ridiculous! We waited too long! Service other than the wait time was excellent. I would wait again but there has to be a better way! Also I love Cajun food and I picked a 7 on heat and I could have for sure gone hotter!

QJxS7ke27ao1suKDYvhcOw.text: Ill start my recent vegas trip's reviews from top to bottom.  This was my favorite meal.  We went on a whim and remembering Davy F highly recommending it.  I happen to be on Sahara coming from nearby trader joes.  It was about 3pm and we had dinner reservations at 7p so we were debating on whether to eat or hold off.  My wife is a Casino snob and will not enter a casino off the strip unless i force her too.  She took a look at PS and said WTH are we doing here.  I said lets try the Oyster bar, my friends says its good.  She gave me that evil looking.  But we both glad we did.  It didn't start out good as we found it wasn't a real restaurant but a counter with about 20 seats.  There was also a line about 7 parties deep.  I could see more and more steam coming out of her head.  Since i picked the place, so I told her go play something.  So she went on her way.  About 45-60min later we finally got seated.  By this time she wasn't talking to me, saying we are gonna eat again in a few hours.  So i said let share a dish.  We decided on 1/2 dozen oysters and a cioppino.  The oysters were good and fresh.  They were a good starter.  The cioppino, in my opinion was one of the best i tasted.  The sauce had the perfect consistency, and tasted perfect.  There was an abundance of crab, shrimp, clams, and mussels.  And they give you steamed white rice.....YES!  its amazing the cook and server can handle that countertop alone.  Of course they have the runners doing the behind the scene work, but the two of them cooking and serving in perfect harmony.    This is not a place to sit, eat and talk story.  You eat and run, so if the person glaring at you standing in line because you are taking your sweet ass time, you know why.  This place is great for single diners.  You probably can get a seat in half the time.

aDakRImvPFw8Is8eoBIkrw.text: It's worth the wait!!!  If you get restless, press your luck on the slots ;)  It's a small counter that seats about 20 people.  When we were there I never saw the end of the line.    Oh man, the House Pan Roast is delicious!  It's a huge portion...I couldn't finish it, I didn't complain when I had it for dinner too.  Be careful with getting too confident with the amount of spiciness that you request for.  I got a 6 and it was good, I was able to enjoy my food with a hint of spiciness.   One of the fun things is that you get to watch your food get cooked in front of you.  You can see all the passion that's put into each order.  The staff is friendly and pretty funny, love it when they have a sense of humor.  We also got the Bloody Mary Oyster Shooters, they were yummy too. I'll be heading back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. progression of deliciousness!

3waZjpdmaTXVKNzWGb6Q2A.text: I waited in line here with my coworker for an hour, to be behind 3-4 parties ahead of us. During that one hour, only 1 party was seated. This line would not budge, so we left. :*( But, that stirred up my curiosity and decided to come at an off-time (they're open 24 hours) after some Vegas debauchery. Ordered the combo (crab, lobster, shrimp) pan roast with level 7 spiciness (levels 1-10), which was a pretty mild spicy. I was intrigued by the old fashion boilers in front yelp.com/biz_photos/awI4..., as I saw the chef start off by cooking the fresh seafood medley in the boiler, then added the cajun seasoning, the broth, and finally kept adding the cream sauce base/roux. The pan roast had strong flavor, where I think adding extra rice or noodles ($1.99) is essential. I actually think this soup would make a really delicious pasta sauce. And then there were juicy and generous clumps of seafood, very yum. Service was attentive (you're sitting right in front of them) and the chef kept asking when would be the next time he'll be seeing me, and I assured him for breakfast, lunch, and dinner everyday. (I wish) I definitely will be back to try the infamous gumbo, clam chowder, and (new york) oysters/shooters.

9fed1PzrdJ7laDePWnVf6A.text: PARKING: its free Parking in VEGAS!  PLACE: Located far from Vegas Strip, you definitely need to drive to get here if you are staying  Venetian or near Venetian Hotel.  SERVICE: I came here Saturday around 12:30. the line is about 10 people head of me. it's a long wait there is only 3 people i noticed working in the front  the CHEF , BUSBOY and the WAITRESS.   we waited for an hour to get seated and after you get seated we waited for another less than an hour to get served. basically it tooks us more or less 3 hours before we get our food . when you get seated do not assumed that you get your food right away.  The Chef cooks your food per order , depending how much spice you like . and it takes forever because he is the one who opens the oyster at the bar if you order it.   His cooking is pretty routine , since hes been doing it over and over . and he cleans the pot every meal he served .thumbs up for that !  Waiter is pretty nice and joke around once in a while , but i guess when you waited for long all you want is great food and gimmmmeee my food.  FOOD:  *COMBO PAN ROAST -  spice level 8, seafood with lobster.  its really spicy but i love spicy food . the ingredients he used are all frozen sea food since I saw him refilling all the container with all the frozen seafoods and meat. although he have seasoning. the cream he mixed already pre made of him probably since he took it out from the containe and he does add it at the end after he saute all the ingredients in the butter and added a stocked and reduced it. The flavor is really creamy and alot of seafood in my pot, alot of flavor but i cant say its not  the best one. big portion enough for 2 people  *PALACE PAN ROAST-  this one is with chicken , sausage , shrimp , crab and shrimp except lobster. level 5 , nice heat and spice . bug portion enough for 2 people  *FRESH OYSTER IN HALF SHELL: AVOID! AVOID! AVOID! AVOID! AVOID! This is a complete waste of money . since we are very hungry waited for 2 hours we decided to order oyster while waiting . and we ordered a dozen . the oyster are pretty big, literally big and fatty . so tasteless and it has the taste of a jelly . after 2 piece it makes me gag . no matter how much i put lemon or horse radish to remove the awful taste and texture . this one will completely ruin your appetite. We ordered a dozen and boy this is a complete nasty texture and taste and it doesn't taste fresh at all more of jello fat texture with very bland taste . in short undeniable worst oyster I have ever had.  TIPS: you can share order but you have they will charge extra 5$ for other person , since its big portion maybe you can try to this , its too creamy for me that eating it all alone will make my tummy aches   you can ask them to go for you if you didnt finish it and request for rice . they dont charge you for extra rice . most of the people who eat next to us wasnt able to finish their food and have it to go after.  after few hours if you wanna eat your left over you will realized how thick the food is the cream is just overpowering and oh boy that is a complete meal for at least 3 people. not unless you have a very big appetite.   you can order take out food but you still need to get inline . how did i know ? someone asked and the chef said yes but he still need to get in line .   is it worth the wait, not really but its ok to try ...

SOCqahBPbHPi9wRx7IvDlQ.text: Food is so worth the wait. A couple on the plane ride to Vegas told me about this place. I waited about a hour in line but the food was soooo good. Was told by some locals to come before or after dinner since its opened late to avoid the long wait.  This place is a must each time I'm visiting...sooo good!!!

Xyq6RmwEyoCbwWlyQ23nbA.text: We've been here twice now for the famous pan roast, and the second time I thought my stomach would literally explode.  Let me explain.  This place is #2 on Yelp's Best of Las Vegas restaurant list.  I never even knew what pan roast was until there was a Yelp Talk thread devoted to it.  Pan roast sounded like some kind of pot roast to me where beef or some meat was roasted in a pan, right?  Wrong.  Pan roast is actually like a giant bowl of lobster bisque with crab, lobster, and shrimp, if you order the combo pan roast, which is what I have gotten both times. And, with that giant bowl comes a giant spoon to eat with. Located inside the Palace Station, the Oyster Bar only seats about 16 people at a time because it is indeed a bar.  People line up patiently for their turn to be seated and served, watching their food being prepared in front of them.  The first time we went, we arrived at 3:00pm on a Friday afternoon and waited for 70 minutes.  Really.  The second time, we got there at 2:00pm on a Friday and waited about 30 minutes.  I've heard stories of people waiting for 2 hours or more.  We talked to a couple in line ahead of us who stay at the Palace Station when they visit just so they can eat at the Oyster Bar.  Service is always friendly and it's fun to speak to your fellow diners; everyone is in a good mood there, maybe because they're finally sitting down and getting their fix while other people wait in line behind them.   The bread and butter is good and so is the New England Clam Chowder.  Those are the only other items I've had there, but that's all you need to know, really.  If you've never had the pan roast, you should try it at least once so you can taste what all the fuss is about.  It's so good that you just keep eating it, even though you're full, hence the stomach-about-to-burst feeling.  Just try to go on a weekday in the mid-afternoon or some other odd time; they're open 24 hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast and New England clam chowda.

VYL33lCVJqE2meTi3AcQiw.text: WOW, my boss took me here for dinner one night. I'm not sure if the food was just good because it was FREE or because the food the chef made for us was GREAT!   I didnt have to wait in a long line, but when we sat down, a line started to file and before you knew it all the seats were full and more than 5 people were waiting. The pricing is decent, i had the pan roast spicy #7. I didnt come hungry, but i ate ALL the food in the bowl. All fresh ingredients(you can see everything they put in it since they cook it in front of you) and they steam cook it(also, illegal in CA) so its that much better to eat here!! trust me

vi3ua6s_YAfUPQr9ZoTJOA.text: Just go.   We went for breakfast. I had the seafood pan roast. The base of the dish was so good, I wanted to save the seafood for last. Every ounce of that tomato bisque-like base is delicious. It's just perfect. I took half of it home and finished it later that day.

oG4oQdbJToSTjeYHSa_PsA.text: Now this place at the Palace Station ain't no joke excellent food. We waited 3 hours yep 3 hours but was it worth it yep and I have never waited that long to eat anywhere. The Seafood Gumbo and Jambalaya was it.  Now they have one at the Texas Station and it's good also and the wait isn't long at all. But Palace is it

Wqbvum63E3-rIpMc7L-G3Q.text: ALL THE SEAFOOD IS FROZEN EXCEPT OYSTERS. Which means they are probably pumped full of chemicals (sodium tripolyphosphate) to keep them plump and moist.  And the oysters are not very fresh - uck.  Add to that the wait and I won't be back.

ngkjup_1hYJ6aJdNRhWv6A.text: Bomb.com omg i had thw crab with shirmp pan roaat. Level 4. Its just right. Worth my money and the wait.

_Iu6sLy8hbEbyZOvL2l2Og.text: This is definitely a hole in the wall place. The food in my opinion is as good as what many reviewers said on Yelp.   The oyster bar is essentially a bar setting. Therefore, it only has 15 bar stools at this place. It took an hour and a half to get seated. But if you want to play a slot machine or you are a smoker, this is where you can kill time by doing both while you are waiting.  Even though there was a long wait, it was worth it. I ordered a half dozen oysters and it was fresh and had a sweet taste to it. For entree, I had a combo pan roast seafood. The texture and flavor was delicious.   The chef, Bob, and the waitress made the whole experience well worth it as they are the only two people working during that shift. They cracked jokes as they made you feel like you are at home dining.
