FgVu4K286kpRpnhFa-p3dA.text: I really hate to give this place a three star rating. The Oyster Bar deserves a higher score.  I ordered the "signature" New Orleans Gumbo with shrimp, crab, and lobster.  The taste was very good and there was plenty of shrimp and sausage but I really could not identify any crab or lobster.    I might have given it 5 stars but they need a reminder that no matter how good they are, you must serve honest portions.  I did like it enough to return and give them a second chance and maybe raise them to where they should be.

-bDIXyZqvA-_uB0pcDv2pA.text: Do you know that expression, "good things come to those who wait"? Well it serves as an under simplification. The food is great, having tried their pan roast, and the service is very nice as well. I just wished we didn't wait for 2-3 hours to eat some good seafood.

GSkbLHiutilb3ku1oPWAHQ.text: We tried the combo pan roast (spiciness level: 5), Alaskan chowder (New England style) and the linguine and clams served with white sauce. The best thing is the combo pan roast. It is flavorful and almost worth the long wait. We waited more than an hour even coming here at 12:30 am on a Friday morning. They are definitely understaffed here, so you have to give credit to the one cook who is literally working nonstop even at 12:30 am in the morning and the one waiter/busser who has to clear the dishes, take orders, fill drinks and hand you the check. The one plus to this place is that it seems to be frequented by more of the locals/local gamblers, so you get a very different vibe here, compared to going to a restaurant on the strip.  Primarily, the major difference between the different seafood offerings here is the sauce that accompanies the dish. The sauce is already cooked and put in near the end. The seafood is cooked in steam powered kettles with some seasoning. Once the seafood is nearly done, the appropriate sauce is then ladled into the kettles. Once everything is done, the kettles are rotated so that contents can be transferred to a bowl. Water and some soap is used to clean the same kettle which is then used for the next order. If you are squeamish about seeing your food prepared and dishes washed (favoring the veil of ignorance), then this may not be the place for you.  If you are going to wait more than an hour, then you should get some sort of pan roast. Almost everyone orders the combo pan roast which is served with shrimp, crab and lobster. The sauce is what you are primarily after. It is a tasty creamy tomato based sauce (with a splash of brandy). The level of spiciness is determined by you from 1 to 10. We chose level 5, and it was not spicy at all. This sauce was seasoned well and good by itself, but it also did a good job of accompanying the seafood.  In comparison, the Alaskan chowder (also cooked similarly) was much less flavorful. The sauce used was a New England chowder style sauce, primarily made of cream. While the pan roast might have almost been worth the wait, this definitely was not worth the wait. There are better chowders elsewhere with much less required waiting. Our personal favorite is the New England clam chowder at The Original Fish Company in Los Alamitos, CA. I'm sure you have your own favorite elsewhere.  Finally, the linguine and clams with white sauce was nothing to write home about. There is linguine. There are clams. There is white sauce. That about sums it up. Yes, you could argue that we should not have ordered this coming to this place, and you would be right. So who is arguing? Skip this dish, as you have also had it much better elsewhere.   Come for one thing here, the pan roast. If you are dead set on coming here, try to find out when the off hours are. It definitely was not at 12:30 am on Friday morning in the middle of winter, so I am not sure when the off hours might be. Good luck to you.

jiqigWoTcGOMcsLcuOqOkg.text: I'm addicted. The line is always long and for good reason. There's only 20 seats but it's open 24/7. We ordered the combo pan roast their most popular, shrimp and lobster far diablo, cold seafood combo all was delicious. I ordered shrimp and lobster etouffee to go for my child and it was good but not as good as their pan roast.   Next time I'll try their cioppiono or bouillabaisse. Oh why not, I'll try both. Lol  I have been to every oyster bar in the city and all over the U.S., I have to say this is the best I've had. Fresh plump gold seal oysters and clams. Highly recommend this place, worth the wait.

v1qXmp8p_Ntt70BZrytpuA.text: A fan of oysters? Want to jump on the latest fad that is sweeping across all of your Asian friends who go to Vegas and want to eat and then take 12939021389012839012 photos and post their food pics on Instagram? Well, friends then never fear... OYSTER BAR IS HERE!   Location: Inside the Palace Station hotel. It's not as far as Bachi Burger and relatively cheap and inexpensive if you decide to split a cab.   Wait: Let's just say they don't have a fast pass... The most frustrating thing about this place is the wait. However, I'm gonna break it down for you so you know the best and worst times to go... I highly recommend going at odd hrs. (1-3am post clubbing is not an odd hr in Vegas).... AS in you will be waiting for a few hrs at that time. Trust me. The best time to go for Pan roast is about 9:30am. Otherwise, you'll be waiting for a long ass time....   Seating: Frustrating. They seat you based on available party. If you plan on coming with 10 people to this place forget it. You will never be seated together. I highly recommend not coming with more than 4 people in one party. Essentially, you sit whenever there is a free seat and their seating arrangement is about max 12-15.   Service: Top notch. Waitress and staff are super gregarious and nice.  Food:   Pan Roast: LEGIT.   Spice: You can adjust the spiciness of the Pan roast, however, I recommend not getting anything over a 5-6.. In terms of our waitress, she said "7" and you're dying... I ate with a Korean and a Vietnamese and they were having a hard time. You don't want something to be so spicy you can't enjoy it. 5 had just enough spice and still made it enjoyable.   *While I enjoyed the pan roast and got lucky with the wait, I still feel that Ritter's in the OC's pan roast was better. I'm a sucker for creaminess in my soup and I felt that Ritter's nailed it right on the head. Regardless, this place is amazing however if you have to wait more than 20 mins (Chances are you will) I'd recommend just going to Ritters in the OC. It's almost identical!   Cheers,   J to the Y.

ipQLJAUbESPwQmKMnGdl8w.text: I have never waited this long for any restaurant ever !!!   My boyfriend kept talking about this place EVERY time we came to vegas, so of course we decided to come.   The first time we came, we were lucky only waited about 45 minutes. I ordered the gumbo which was amazing. They ask how spicy 1-10 you want it.  I got 7 and it was spicy. If you can't handle a lot of spice, I would suggest you get 5 or lower. They cook everything right in front of you which is pretty cool. My bf got the panroast which is the most popular. Although it was good, I enjoyed my gumbo more.   Second time I decided to get the jambalaya which was also appetizing. Stepped down my spice from 7 to 5.  Always a generous amount of seafood into your dish and the servers are friendly.  At least there's slot machines around you to kill some time!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jambalaya and panroast

1IjBtHV5y9BdLVGnHYao-Q.text: Love the pan roast and bouille roast! Oysters were fresh and big! Waited for 30min to get a seat when we went Sunday 9am.

Tskaf7mVmrAwW4boo2s0VA.text: Bob Never fails us! The combination pan roast was amazing as usual! I'm always tempted to try something new but I absolutely love the combination an roast and my husband the chicken gumbo! Margie provided great service and was really nice and accommodating! RIP Ms Deloris we love you!

RkMcqqPv3NrcYxy7yClwMQ.text: This place is literallly like a bar in the middle back of the casino.  When I saw people lining up, i was thinking really?  Anyway,  I had the Seafood jambalaya and house gumbo.  Both very good.  I love the way they cook it.  The warm dinner rolls are good too but dont fill your stomachs with that.  Its actually more filling to the stomach than it looks.  I can't wait to come back!  The first time I had this, I tried the spicier one which ended up being spicier than I had anticipated so I wasn't able to finish.  This time, I ordered mild and I was able to grasp all the pieces I wanted.  Theres usually a wait but its well worth it especailly if your hungry.

_G8499lNg4dg_Y1BNpLL9Q.text: A friend of my husband's insisted we come here.  I knew of the place after he described it because often times I would see a line of people waiting to eat here.  We waited I would say an hour and let me just say it was worth it.  Pan Roast!  I crave it just thinking about Las Vegas.  First time we went there we had the crab pan roast which was great.  After that my husband and I tried the other pan roasts, all excellent.  We also had the steamed clams, which again were great.  Time to go is off-peak hours, we did not wait very long at about 2 a.m. and there was no line at all about 2 p.m.

8ca6CoDtyNonubz76FiocQ.text: Really wanted to love this place according to the reviews...  Once we got seated and finally got our food, a total of 2 hours...I was not that pleased.  Ordered Combo Pan Roast and House Gumbo. The flavor was there but both were way too salty!!  Might try again...but wouldn't go out of my way for it.

hLYrOFA3AwcNzYP5KhOVVQ.text: Fkn WOW!!! I would give this place a 5 if it had more than the 14 or so bar stools available to sit. Took me and my party of 3 about an hour to be seated; there were only 6 people in line ahead of us, but it was totally worth it. I've been to Vegas 3 times this summer knowing about this place, but it wasn't until the 3rd time out that I was sober enough to make my merry drunk way from the strip to the Palace Station. The Pan Roast (crab, shrimp, and lobster) was highly recommended so that's what I ordered and it was great. They make everything in front of you so that's cool. I forget what my friends ordered, but it was also very good. Great hangover food.

0rYg5aP3DXWAk4unNKdI9w.text: Really long wait. I came in on a Sunday night around 9:30 pm and didn't get a seat till 10:50 pm, so come prepared with something to do for over an hour.   I had the Palace Pan Roast which was delicious. Creamy and hearty, the bowl came with nice chunks of seafood, crab, shrimp and sausage which really hit the spot. The base of the stew is a just the right combination of tomato and cream, not too much of either. Careful on the level of spiciness though, I ordered 7 on a scale from 1-10, and even that overpowered a lot of flavor.  Don't bother with the caesar salad, it came overdressed; although, it had nice, fat shrimp too.  I did come in once past midnight on a weekday, and was able to take a seat immediately. I had the linguine alla Vongole, which was a lightly flavored pasta with clams. A good pick if you don't want something too seafoody. When it wasn't busy, I found folks working behind the bar polite and attentive.

yAW4SY5M_acHHYGkOS0sBw.text: Oyster Bar is open 24hrs.  I heard lot of good stuff about Oyster Bar.  I had 12 dozen Oyster, House Gumbo.  Wow it was very tasty.  If you ever go to Vegas go try out Oyster Bar at Palace Station Hotel & Casino.

mKs4gF4mytPiU3vyGIEF9w.text: You have to order the Combo Pan Roast.  It is heavenly!  Look for deals from station casino and you can find gift certificates for half price.

xW3dwSS--lBU88vJC7csrQ.text: I love this place.  Actually, i loved it so much that I dined here two nights in a row!  OK so you got to order the Pan ROAST Combo, it comes with shrimps lobsters and crabs.  If you are a seafood lover, you must order this.  I ordered the Pan Roast at level 8, and it has a kick to it, it was not overwhelming at all.   I also ordered a dozen of Oysters on the half shell.  So yummy! Yes there is a long wait, but come on good seafood! good beer and friendly service.  I was fortunate enough to dine during the hours that both Sandra and Ricardo work.  Sandra is the waitress/server where she takes order, she's friendly fast, and accurate.  Ricardo is the chef that makes yummy food.  OMG! he was so nice and friendly and even shook my hand to greet me.  He also did some modification to my pan roast where it took the pan roast yumminess to another level:EPIC.  He added more lobsters and clams.  Sea food lover gone to heaven right? OH gosh!     Btw-if you want to avoid the long wait, come at 1 or 2 am when you are drunk. :) good food. definitely coming back!

IyTQxiKbQQ2sGqPX3Oqlzg.text: Sandra our server is slow. Super slow!!! Avoid her at all cost!! Food is 5 star and worth waiting for. Favor items: Pan Roast and fresh oysters and clams. Clam chowder was a bit of a disappointment. Tasted very generic.

WumviDvMqbsVwqf1rp1HZw.text: The oysters were great, the presentation was nice. I like being in the mix so the location was great for people watching without being totally overwhelmed. We has great calamari, fried oysters, lobster, and a couple of mixed drinks and beer for $95 bucks. It was all tasty, fresh and you got lots for your money.

WaD_zHOXWt9_IF7V9lmQNw.text: I've been here way too many times to count and each time the combo roast is totally amazing. I obviously would have given it 5 stars except that every time you go expect to wait in line between 30 minutes on a good day to 2 hours. I mean what can you expect they have 13 seats and are open 24 hours but the combo roast is amazing you can't go wrong.

nqU1oHmVlxK5aDcvR44HHQ.text: Eze is our cook tonight,  Christopher is our waiter and  Jillzia (?) is the waitress on oysters.  They are all so nice and friendly!    There was an obnoxious couple sitting next to my husband complaining (literally yelling at the staff).  They made it very uncomfortable especially since we didn't see what their problem was and it sounded personal.  They ordered that the food be re-done for all 4 people in their party because none of them should have to eat alone as he stated so loudly before he stormed off to get the Managers.  One was named Cedric I didn't catch the other managers name. Feeling bad for the chef we started talking to him and commended him for his reaction to the customer.  It turns out he's coming to Hawaii next year and wants to eat fresh fruit and things the locals eat so we gave him our phone number and told him to give  us a call-we'll give him mangos that can't be bought at the stores!   The food was great as usual!  I ordered 3 oyster shooters and my husband and son's gf offered to help me so I had to order 3 more!  :)  They were clean, fresh, no shells-just how I love it!  Our pan Roasts and chowder was so good!  We even bought a gumbo to go for a midnight snack that my son and I had to force ourselves to eat later that night.  LOL  Everything there is great.  We return every chance we get and recommend this place to everyone even if the line is long.  It can be a 1 1/2 hr wait so don't go when you're hungry, go before you get hungry.  ;)

lL6Ko6hAhD_4R7JJXhVaBA.text: Best seafood in Vegas that's not on the strip!! Bouillabaisse and lobster roast were awesome!!!!

KfKxbnNtqL7rOU9g7NPdNA.text: I love Vegas and the restaurants it has to offer. This trip I wanted something different and off the beaten path. I found the Oyster Bar via an Internet search and based on the Yelp reviews, I coaxed my fiance into going. Entering the Palace Station, I was a little skeeved out. It smells and the people are a bit of a motley crew. I said 'we are eating and promptly leaving'. We approached the line to wait for chair at the Oyster Bar and waited about 45 minutes to be seated. After reading the menu online, I had a pretty good idea of what I wanted - the Pan Roast. We were starving and ordered the Calamari. My fiance and I chose different Pan Roasts. He ordered the Palace Roast and I the Combo Roast. We sat, happily eating our very tasty Calamari, amused watching oysters being shucked and each Pan Roast being made in the steam pots in front of us. The crowd at the bar was fun, we chatted with those to the left and right of us. The service was attentive and the chef was quite funny as he worked. Finally... two huge bowls were placed in front of us. A bright red, hot bowl of the most fantastic garlicky smell I've encountered. It's like a soup, it's like a bowl of seafood goodness, it is unlike anything I've tried and it was heavenly. Just plain heavenly. It was such a awesome meal. Go to the Palace Station and find the Oyster Bar! I hope your experience was as good as ours because we are huge fans and definitely will be back.

LEkRDCtxfE-a1Kycv3q3rg.text: Oh my god. Arguably, my most FAVORITE dish in all of Vegas:  the Pan Roast  This little gem is located inside Palace Station. My girlfriend and I came here since she is obsessed with oysters. We searched for "oysters" on yelp and sure enough, this took the #1 spot.  Sure their oysters were great and just about as yummy as you'd think and the clam chowder was to-die-for, but enough of that. Let's get to the COMBO PAN ROAST!  This dish is a seafood bouilliabase full of magic and deliciousness you can't find anywhere else. They cook it in specialized steam pots with the freshest seafood you can find in Vegas. We make it a point to come here at least a million times during every visit. (ok maybe 2 or 3, but you get the idea)  You know what? I'd probably make the 3-4 hour drive from LA just for this baby. Seriously. It's that good. You haven't tasted Vegas until you've tried Palace Station's Combo Pan Roast. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.  Go get it. It'll become your new favorite. I promise.  *EDIT: My friend Angelie D. told me that one of the chefs actually left to open his own restaurant in Chino Hills, CA called "The Boiler" ...all the same stuff, including the pan roast :D HELL YES

E1CyHIXse8gE7wNuyz5s3A.text: Food was delicious!  So glad I found this place on yelp.  Just happen to be in Vegas and did not want to do the buffets.  Looked in yelp and read the reviews.  So glad we tried it.

hBH3AKAOslQ8KlOEW7MMEQ.text: SO DELICIOUS WORTH THE WAIT!!!  So don't be alarmed when you show up and you see only 10 spots and they are all full and there's a line through the casino.  It is totally normal.  It is also totally normal to stand and wait for 90 minutes.    Such a unique experience. They cook everything right in front of you. You are greeted with a fresh hot loaf of sourdough bread as you wait for your entrees.    Start off with some fresh raw oysters - their cocktail sauce is really good.  Also if you are into it - you can get 3 oyster shooters for $10.   Their most popular items include the Cioppino - tomato stew with clams, mussels, shrimp and crab.  My favorite was the Combo Roast - Shrimp, Crab, and Lobster sauteed with Brandy, Cream and Tomato!!!  So delish - i licked up every last bite!  Portions are BIG so it is enough to share between two people. If you ask to split they will give each person their own scoop of rice as well. Small splitting fee involved.   Great customer service and it is very entertaining to watch them prepare right in front.  Would come back even with the same wait. Still giving this place 5 stars!  TIP: About a $20 cab ride from the strip.

Slr618CYLrqu3Y_3CpawfQ.text: I come to LAS for business about once a month. I find myself returning to this place every time! I cannot say enough good things about the food! I highly recommend eating at the Palace Station Oyster Bar! The Palace Pan Roast is phenomenal!

7WqldxurRoz6_9GWEbT7TA.text: THANK YOU BOB for making our combo pan roast and getting us addicted!!  My husband the Oyster bar on his guy trip the week before we went together and he kept raving about this combo "pan roast" so this was the 1st thing I had to try at 10:30 AM on a Friday since seating is very limited and the lines can get LONG but it's open 24 HRS!    I ordered 1/2 dozen oysters which were very fresh and yummy.  My husband and I split the combo pan roast which consists of shrimp, lobster, and crab.  The split is you get 2 separate bowls of rice with the pan roast (a thick stew like jambalaya with more soup that comes in a large bowl). One order is plenty for 2 ppl to share.We ordered it a level 7 out of 10 on the spicy level and it was still hot but bearable.  We are definitely going back to the Oyster bar to eat it again! ^^

7RKq_-CKqV5W9PZ-0SrnDQ.text: I am in love with this place! Ever since I turned 21 and go to Vegas I must eat here! I remember when I wasn't of age yet..my dad ate at The Oyster Bar while I sat at Starbucks. I was so upset I wasn't allowed to eat there that may have shed a tear or two.Its that good.  I usually get the house pan roast or gumbo. I tend to favor the gumbo just slightly because I love okra. Spice level 6 is perfect. The raw oysters and clams are delicious as well!  Confession: While my friends are excited to go clubbing, gambling etc in Vegas..I look forward to eating here over doing anything else lol. I wish we could just stay at Palace Station.

0SkPZR83Lwi1Fej3Y7RcTg.text: They have the best seafood pan roast!! Love love love!! The wait was not long at all if you go early am! The calamari soup was also good! My favorite seafood spot!!!!!!

CEalpRgR3DwSXBvKNxNhzA.text: Oysters from out of the world!!! Waited 1.5 hrs and it was totally worth the wait. We got pan roast combo nd the ciopino. Make sure u get spicy level 7!!! Soooooooooo gooooooood

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinopio nd combo panroast. Almost forgot to take pictures
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Noihzl6H31FUu6D-XGib8g.text: I love oysters!!!! This bar was amazing! I really loved everything!  I been here a few times and well I never wrote a review because look at them they have 2000+ lol!! But I'd thought this time I'd do it just so people know that I love this places and how amazing they really are.

YCiiMy8KRhrfGap83IbrvQ.text: Just happened by Oyster Bar when there was only 2 people in line.  I wasn't planning on trying it, nor was I even hungry, but since I've never seen the line less than 12 deep... I had to jump at the opportunity!  Once seated I looked back at the line and it had grown to normal size... so guess I really lucked out!  Wow... all rumors are absolutely True.  The combo pan roast was luscious and rich... very good.  Crab and lobster were sweet, buttery and fresh... excellent... the shrimp was kinda like filler in the combo... but the star of the dish is the creamy broth.  I easily could have stopped halfway through as it's pretty filling, but there's no way I could resist that broth.   Excellent food... not sure if I'd wait in the typically long lines, but if you happen upon an opportunity, take it.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast

a-oGk8LSKQAcka1GQ8NVWA.text: OMG! It's so worth the wait...and you will wait for this absolutely tasteful experience at The Oyster Bar.

3k9eHyqiHWbbiLWcKq5zzw.text: Dont go there hungry! Because u wont know how long u gonna wait.  My experience, from 30 mins (one time only) to 2 hours (easy).  We always grab beers from the bar across, to make the wait easier.   We had a dozen of oysters & clams each, New England clam chowder, gumbo with crab meats, and cioppino.  The oysters are the big ones, it tastes creamy and briny.  The clams were so fatty & succulent, fresh & sweet.  I never see clams so huge!!   New England clam chowder is my fav, chucks of clam meat & seafood, creamy but yet not too thick, just the right amount of potatoes. It was so east to lick the bowl!   The gumbo & cioppino were both on salty side, we couldnt even finish it because it was way too salty, even it came with a scoop of rice, however it wont balance out the saltiness.  We ended up packed it to go, it tasted really good on the next day with a gallon of rice.  lol  Never like their oyster shooters, made me gagged.

UhN8vxFjxOf0trq5ngjLdg.text: Oyster and oysters and oysters ! Check our this fresh oyster bar with lots of ice and cold beers! Freshly shucked and with all the horseradish, lemon, and hot sauce you cab handle! It was good but I prefer other varieties of oysters like kusshi.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jBPJHZNmB2Drt3-AoXpd-w.text: I went into this very skeptical; 2 hour wait for pan roast?! Especially when I've had pan roast before and live literally 5min from the Ritter's in HB!   I was so tired and drained while waiting.. To the point that I wasn't even hungry anymore. When me and my party finally got seated... It still took forever because someone had ordered like 10 dishes to-go! After they finished the to go orders, they switched cooks and mannnn this new guy, Ricardo, was on it! He seriously moved as fast as humanly possible and was funny too! He even gave us free oysters because he overheard us contemplating if we should get some. He jokingly said "don't do it," because it'd be more work for him, but he shucked us some anyways! The oysters were fresh, fat and juicy! The service made my meal. I would've just been like yeah, this is pretty good, but man, the new cook pumped up my mood and made me actually happy to be there and made it much more worth it IMO.   We got the combo pan roast ($24), which comes with lobster, crab and shrimp in a creamy tomato stew. They are not stingy with the seafood! Wow! And the pan roast is soo rich and comforting. I got a level 6 spice but barely felt the heat. The portion is also huge! It fed the bf and I for 2 meals each.   Yes, the prices are a little steep and they charge for splitting plates ($5) but the food is pretty damn good.   The wait takes for frikken ever because it's literally just a bar and it only seats around 18. (You also have to be 21+ to eat here!) Come at an off time to minimize your wait :P

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast $24
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yZPTIi2x4YqTjQQzLeB7sw.text: So good it hurts. If you don't eat here when you are in Vegas you are doing it wrong. If you are lucky, Bob is working the bar. Even if he isn't it's still the best pan roast ever. We've been to quite a few around and have still to find one as flavorful, thick and down right satisfying as this. Go, now, as if your tastebuds depended on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jjJUqhWUA-n_2YOjxfW-yg.text: Came here a few times and it's about time I write about it! Each time I have gone the line has been long. The best time to go, so I have heard, is 3am-7am. I once came here at like 8am and waited 30 minutes, another time came after 8:30am and waited like two hours. This time I  went around 9:30pm at night. The line was not moving at all...   When we got closer to the front... 2.5 hours later... we realize it was because the chef was going slow. I don't want to be mean, but he was literally moving slow, prepping the food slow, washing the pots slow. It explains why the line was hardly moving. He had two servers helping him. It didnt help that the order before us was a to go order and it was like 12 dishes. I thought you could only order one or two per person but I guess not. When we finally sat down it was like 12. At this time a new chef, Ricardo (I believe, was starting and helped finish up the to go order. A new server also started at the same time, Bob. If it wasn't for Bob and Ricardo, I think it would have not been worth the wait. Bob and Ricardo were entertaining, funny, and easy to talk to. We were the first one who ordered but had to wait because of the to go orders.   We sat next to the oysters and made small talk with the chef about how big they were and how juicy they look. We instantly regret not getting any oysters to start. The chef laughed at us and was surprised we waited this long and not get any oysters. I guess he noticed our disappointment because before we knew it, he shucked out 5 big oysters (since we were a party of 5) for us. It was a kind gesture that made all of us remembered and want to come back.   My boyfriend and I ordered the Combo Pan Roast. MUST GET!!!!!!! So delicious! I got a level 4 and it was good, my boyfriend who eats spicier got a 6. I can't even begin to describe the food other than omg. So rich and creamy, and they don't skimp you on the lobster or crab meat. Had to order extra rice because it was so good. They charge you $3.99 for an extra scoop of rice.   Got my bill and realize that they did not charge the people I went with for splitting a dish. I read some yelp reviews that they charge you for splitting. I also ordered two bowls of rice to-go to eat with my left overs and they didn't charge for that or the extra bread! Bob and Ricardo seriously made our night because before that, we were feeling pretty crappy about it - having to wait almost 3 hours in line. It sucks because you cannot even leave the line. All have to take turns.   Long story short, I highly recommend trying this place (actually don't, you'll make the line even longer hahaha). Just be prepare to wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast

dRWHzaB8oZVykWsAMMhLoA.text: Wow!! This place seariosly is authentic. The seating is pretty limited since its set uo at a counter in the middle of the casino. It is so worth the long wait though! My advice is go during off ours so you can just sit down and enjoy some good ole Creole fare. The gumbo at spicy level 8 was superb! I got the house version which was loaded with shrimp, sausage, lobster, and crab!  My wife had the Pan roast with shrimp and it was super creamy with the perfect balance of a light reux as a base. There is a oyster bar in the sunset casino, but it is nowhere near the quality of this one. This you must try if your in Vegas for vacation or a local looking to spice up dinner! Also the portions are large so you will probably get two meals out of one bowl, unless your a glut like me! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The star of the show! House gumbo, you have to get this dish if you come here.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp pan roast, perfectly balanced
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold draft budlight to extinguish the heat!

RtU71olNSiQatOuP7k_ogQ.text: This is my second time having pan roast.  But first time here at the Oyster Bar.  All I kept telling myself while we waited for almost two hours in line was this place better top Ritters in Huntington Beach.  Two hours you say?  Yup.  I was prepared for it arriving at 8pm on a Saturday night.   So bae and I  took turns hitting the slots and sipping on our Cab and Merlot.  Forgot if we did two or three rounds.   So time definitely went by fairly quickly but my tummy was sure hongry once we got seated.  We ordered-  House pan roast.  Level 3. They ran out of  lobster so we doubled on the crab.   All good because this creamy tomato made in heaven was the BOMB! Omg! You need to see our bowl, before and after shot.  The wait was definitely worth it but next time if there is a line,  we will just return in a later time.  Linguini and clams in white wine Level 3 was uhmazing.  Aldente and lots and lots of clams! Fresh and savory made my tummy satisfied!!!  Then we had special ordered the large clams in garlic herb.  Eze was not thrilled to make this treacherous dish because it takes forever but oh man...this was awesome AF! So juicy and packed with flavors we barely took a breath eating it!!!  And fyi Eze,  I will order this again on my return!  Hahaha   He was super sweet tho and I made sure I gave him a nice cute wink on our way out.  #thankful#always #MY#misshimalready

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The second shift.   Looks like bonds and wyatt team
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After shot of the house pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House pan roast. Level 3

46tgl0UyYHVl18nhWn7fpg.text: The line can be super long but the wait is well worth it. Nora is the BEST server they have- always upbeat and super nice to us. Always remembers us and our orders, she gives great customer service and out of all of them I have never seen her get a attitude with customers. She makes it worth our while every time. Palace Station is lucky to have her on their team.

ipUkyU73r-sbdhOeiO0ZrQ.text: GG MY FAVE.  I love how this place is in the middle of nowhere away from the strip and that it is open 24 hours.  Butttt. there is always a wait and always a few people who take their sweet time eating and chitchatting away when there are people waiting at 4AM. Come on have the decency to eat and leave! Especially when there is limited seating.  Anyway, the Combo Pan Roast with a spice level of 7/10 is the way to go. Has big chunks of seafood... omg salivating as I'm writing this. Very hearty and creamy. Perfect after a long night of drinking and clubbing.  On the other hand, my experience with their raw oysters was a miss. They weren't fresh... stick to the pan roast.  A must try! This is honestly the best part about Vegas and there are many places where they try to copy this place but they are no match to the ORIGINAL OYSTER BAR at fhe Palace Station Hotel!!!!!  Next time I want to try the Boulla-roast dish! The mix of the Boullabaise and the Pan Roast!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu 2/2017
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast including fresh lobster, shrimp, and crab! $23.99

eReE-JJ2dVGnr1sz4lhbPg.text: Waited two hours on 12/29/18 as it was our 46th wedding anniversary. We ordered to go and total time was half an hour. We got to sit close enough to see the cook prepare the meals, everything was prepackaged like lobster, shrimp, crab etc. for the Bouillabaisse. Wife ordered the combo pan roast. We were starving so devoured the rolls, wife wanted more. We did take out and there were 4 more rolls included. The pan roast was devoured by the wife and then she wanted some of my Bouillabaisse. The cups of rice were perfect to go with the order. A spoon full of rice dipped into the Bouillabaisse ended up covered with sea food. The lobster was so big I had to cut it as it was HOT and much easier to put into my mouth in a smaller size. I don't normally eat this much rice but I finished it completely and still had Bouillabaisse left over. Had a chilled bottle of Moscato in the hotel room, perfect with the pan roast and Bouillabaisse.  Palace Station Oyster Bar is the best in Las Vegas. I would give it a 9 out of 10 as there must be a Gordon Ramsay or Emeril restaurant out there with better and much more expensive Bouillabaisse. But only $25.99 is GREAT priced.

RM5_xYHL2PXRaFox8D2ApA.text: I am in love with the pan roast! Everything is made right in front of you. The wait can be a hit or miss depending on the time, but it's definitely worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bCx9RymC1LiGTUN7uCohjA.text: Haven't been to the oyster bar in a few years but I really wanted the gumbo with bread...turns out they no longer serve bread with it and if you ask they only have this sourdough bread not the same.

J2Kw5Nj-C2ontuygjsOSwA.text: I believe that there are three Oyster Bars in Las Vegas right now.  This one is located in the Palace Station Casino.  They are notorious for their long wait times because there are only 18 counter seats.  I finally got a chance to dine here with 2 of my 3 sisters and our mom!  We were lucky and got there at an off time between lunch and dinner.  It took about 30 minutes to get a seat for the four of us on a Monday afternoon.   It's very entertaining to watch the chef prepare all of the meals!  I was so happy to go with a group because I got to taste all of their dishes!  My baby sister got the Pan Roast (crab version) which everyone talks about.  We both thought that it was okay.  Mom got the chiopinno; and my other sister got the clam chowder - I liked that the best! I got the steamed clams and half dozen fresh oysters...nom nom!  People question the quality of seafood at a restaurant in the middle of the desert... In my opinion, everything was fine. I appreciated the complimentary bread and butter. .. I was starving as usual!  Hahaha!   I would return if someone wanted to go, but I wouldn't go out of my way.  I'm happy to complete another bookmark and look forward to visiting one of the other Oyster Bar locations.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Only 18 seats!

rJ1hPVogCtpnFaQn7R6CMg.text: My friend recommended that I give this place a try the next time I went to Las Vegas so I decided to try it.  I had a car so I drove there. This place is not on the Strip so if you want to try it, you will either need a car or you will need some means of transportation to get there (Uber, taxi, or maybe public bus service). Using my GPS, the place was easy to find and parking was plentiful and free.  I wasn't sure what to expect when I went there but saw a line to get seated. The place is a bar top with roughly 20 seats around the bar. I waited in line and it took me ~2 hours to finally be seated. There was a family of 4 in front of me and because I was solo, I was seated before them so they waited even longer than I did to be seated. I went there on a Friday evening at roughly 9pm and I wasn't seated until around 11pm.  The person sitting next to me was having half a dozen oysters in a half shell so I asked him if it was any good and he asked me if it was the first time I was there which I said yes and he told me that it was great and whenever he comes in from LA, he always comes to this place at least once. I ordered the half dozen oysters in a half shell and they were great. They were very fresh without any weird/strange odour/taste. Along with the oysters, I had glass of beer and the combo (crab, shrimp, and lobster) pan roast. They ask you for how spicy you want the pan roast on a scale of 1 to 10. Based on some of the reviews I read, I opted for 2 which I found to be spicy. If it was not spicy enough for me, they had plenty of spicy condiments that I could add after.  The oysters were great. The pan roast was great. The beer was good. The only thing that I wasn't thrilled about was the 2 hour wait to get seated (you are generally standing while you wait since casino security generally won't let you sit down at the casino machines unless you're playing).  The fewer people you go with the faster you will be seated. Even though a family of 4 had been waiting ~10 minutes before I lined up, I was seated before them and it wasn't until I was almost finished my meal around 30 minutes after being seated that they were finally seated (so they probably waited between 2 hours thirty minutes and 3 hours to be seated).

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast (which comprised of shrimps, lobster, &amp; crab)
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizer comprised of Half Dozen Oysters in a Half Shell.

LM-88Whn1grNt_dH4Y8FnA.text: I don't even know how many years I waited to try this place, but in the end, it was worth the wait.   My family stopped by Vegas on our way home from Grand Canyon/Antelope Canyon/Horseshoe Bend. We put the kids down at 930pm, and I made my way over to the Palace Station. I waited in line for an hour, and then another 45 minutes after I was seated. I watched the chef masterfully make each Pan Roast to order. By midnight, my wife and I were thoroughly enjoying our Combo Pan Roast and Clam Chowder in the hotel room while the kids slept. And boy, was it delicious. Just the right amount of creaminess, spiciness, and assorted seafood. This definitely lived up to the hype.  The clam chowder was excellent in its own right, and soothed some of the heat from the Pan Roast. These two complemented each other well, but if you're only going to get one thing from The Oyster Bar, it would obviously have to be the Pan Roast.  Whether you eat there or get it to go, just wait in line. It's worth it.

EbpF6O_7zYA3CP6V9uG4yw.text: Definitely worth driving off the strip! Best gumbo ever! Pan roast is the best thing ever!

PFybOKZ6jhQjuzB24OFknQ.text: 2-star experience: Friday, 2pm , 10 people in front of my party of 2.  1hr wait for seats to 17 chair bar 12ft from slot machines. Really not a restaurant, located on the casino floor next to players club. Advice not to have a party more than 4. Really just one cook, 1 waitress, 6 pot cookers so for 17 people even seated there will be a 20 min wait until chow time. No menu during wait. Waiting is in the middle of the casino floor on the carpet. Advise to not be fooled with a short line of 8 people. It will be an hour wait. !!!  Biggest advice   Pan combo was excellent 5-star and the boullibaise tasty, good sauce and flavorful. Salad was large portion and so were the dishes. Would return but really need to carve out 2 hours of your day.   Pluses are they are open 24 hours but does not slow down until 3am. No real specials except 1am-7am $10 oysters and beer  Harrahs oyster bar is a real restaurant , ample space, nice decor and good wait staff.  It's up to the cook who doubles as server to provide good company and service. Palace station would score higher than my favorite Harrahs but the pathetic wait, lack of service (borderline I am too busy) would turn me away 65% of the time if  I craved good seafood. The lack of service is limit by the small seating options and cooking area.  All shifts they only have one cook and best 2 waitresses .    Kids under 21 not allowed at bar reads sign.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lquPS8VaUR2eK0akKVBhOg.text: Is it a bar with oysters? Say whaaaa?!? *confuzzled*  I didn't understand the concept at first, but my boyfriend swore to me that the Southern Cajun dishes at this establishment are superior in quality and taste. I was sold because one of my favorite cuisines is Southern. Think bold, spicy flavors :P I'm also always open in trying new restaurants that specialize in Cajun dishes.  When we arrived, the "bar" was nestled comfortably on the left of the casino. There were a few patrons in line, who didn't seem irritated or flabbergasted at the long wait, even though, I'm quite sure they waited for at least an hour or possibly, even longer. I think the  booze and cigarettes helped their moods :) I should've known this! :P  TIP: This is not a sit-down restaurant where there's a waitress taking down names; it's much more informal -- when there's an empty chair or a chair opens up, the next patron waiting in line takes it. You wait in line until you're next up AND there are enough seats to accommodate your party. So keep in mind-- keep your parties small so that the line can easily keep on moving or you're left waiting for a LONG time (expect 2+ hours) if you have a bigger party.  My boyfriend and I were fortunate that we stood in line with very friendly, cheery, funny, and obnoxious (in a positive way:) patrons that confided in us about the food and their experiences at the bar. It kept us company for a good 45 minutes. After many laughs and loud giggles, two chairs finally opened up for us! I felt like I won the lottery! :) I was that giddy.  We both ordered the combo pan roast and received our orders in 30 minutes? I don't remember the exact wait time for the food because I was chatting it up with the patron next to me and my boyfriend :) Anyway, the chefs make the food in front of you, and sometimes, or maybe because I'm easily entertained, it's quite amusing to watch them. This helps the clock tick a bit faster.   The pan roast with a small scoop of rice was absolutely perfect. Just everything -- its spices, the abundance of seafood in the bowl, and its portion, I felt like it was an experience that I didn't want to end. The food was on point that night. Next time (and my boyfriend promises me that there will be a next time), we will order oysters as the starter and share a combo pan roast. I was so full after the pan roast.  I can't wait to relive this experience... but with drinks of course :)

sWDWqpm1wq4jOC5ge27rwg.text: SMOKE SMOKE SMOKE!!!!! My birthday spent in Vegas and all I wanted was this very expensive bowl of seafood gumbo...I used to smoke too, never smoked around a dining situation.  My wife beat me out of the casino!  This very small bar type arrangement is engulfed in cigarette smoke as it sits in the middle of a very smoke filled casino...no walls, no smoke eaters CLEARLY! Just so you know...I was very disapointed...pictures on line DO NOT SHOW HOW SMOKEY IT IS!!!

6_chdWMcEe00TLYeCHs1lA.text: Got there this morning around 8:00-8:30 am and to my surprise no line it was pick any seat that we wanted....but the wait on a busy to semi busy day could be anywhere from 2 hours and up....the food is difinitly worth it and the cook and hostess are always really nice.....if your in the area be sure to stop by with your appetite they are amazing

9NB4UA5-75xdbYpXSs40og.text: With tons of modern casinos and hotels on the strip, there's really no reason to venture to palace station. But within this outdated casino is a wonderfully delightful seafood "bar", conveniently called oyster bar.  I was told about this quaint little location by my best friend before my recent trip vegas and was even warned about the long lines and waiting time. But I will say this get there as early as possible because the waiting time can be ridiculous. Here's an example, I went on a Monday night at 1AM in the morning and wasn't seated till 2:45AM. Yes for a Monday night that's insane but so worth the wait. The yelp reviews alone gives you a taste of what to expect.  So when my wife and I finally got seated we shared a dozen oysters. They shucked the oysters in front of our eyes and I must say they were fresh and delicious. With just the right amount of horse radish, and hot sauce made it a perfect appetizers. We then order what's clearly the most popular dish, the pan roast. It's a combination of seafood and what appears to be a very tomato bisque type soup, with a definite taste of Parmesan cheese. It's served with a scoop of rice. The presentation reminded me of gumbo. The process alone to make this tasty dish is worth watching. The chef entertains you while cooking multiple dishes in what seems to be a roasting/ stemming pot.   With seating for about 10-12 people there will always be a wait but the staff are pleasant and entertaining. They make you feel at home but definitely don't take shortcuts with their food. Since it's off the strip it's a place you will have to make a detour too but I'm telling g you it's worth it. Despite being in a smoky and outdated hotel, the oyster bar is clearly the shinning jewel of this location. I guarantee I will always make a personal stop there everytime I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Anytime you arrive, you will have to wait. It&#39;s that popular.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monday at 1am and yes there&#39;s a line to eat.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The table top only holds about 12-14 people.

L1LWCWAc9q4tcmBb0uDVVg.text: Definitely worth the wait.  Don't waste any time on the raw oysters (not cleaned very well and you can find better places elsewhere in Vegas)  Stick with what they're famous for:  PAN ROAST  My favorite: combo pan roast  My husband's favorite: palace pan roast   I prefer tasting the lobster, crab, etc; however, my husband loves meat and he likes the hearty flavor of the palace pan roast. It has a distinct taste of the sausage that emanates. For me, I think the sausage taste is overwhelming and Noneifies the lobster and crab taste I'm looking for.  It's personal preference, but either way, you can't go wrong if you order the pan roast.

T88Ewm5VTrGf9XruK8WHxg.text: Ordered the Palace Pan and a cup of clam chowder. Both were delicious and definitely worth the wait in line!

R9ZkxwjcWp8AJnau25qqdQ.text: Not a bad dish at this place! Sometimes you get a good cook and it's good, but when you get a great cook, it's fantastic! Oysters and the combo pan roast are my favorites. This is my go-to place when I visit Vegas. I hate the long wait, but they could make it more bearable by giving you a buzzer, or have the system text you when you're up. There're no seats in the waiting area, and it is just hard to stand for an hour or two when they're very busy (weekends). I don't want to drop a star as the food is really good, but they need to do something about the waiting situation.

kAoRR5_sjswAvVXKKCm-QA.text: Literally a bar. 18 seats. We went on a weekday night around midnight and had to wait about 35 mins.  I didn't care too much for the pan roast. It's like eating bisque with rice. The gumbo however was awesome. Asked for "0" for spice level. It was perfect for someone that doesn't take heat well at all.  Clam chowder was typical and would not order again.  The seafood they use come in packages so it's clearly frozen seafood. For the prices they charge, it's expensive for what it is.

h2eH8HkpV3Pw3SHqZS5Sww.text: This spot brings back memories. First tried their gumbo at home when my mom brought back leftovers and was obsessed. I would come here with my cousins ID before I turned 21 to be able to have the deliciousness served to me...you see you have to be 21 or over to eat at the oyster bar(they will card you). I actually spent my 21st birthday dinner here at midnight because I love it so much. Of course I celebrated with a beer and some oyster shooters. Crazy I know...  The Oyster Bar is now open 24 hours which makes it so easy to try and a great place to go to when I get off of work at 5am. There usually is always a line since there is seating for only 15-18 people...but that doesn't deter people from waiting...their food is THAT GOOD. The chefs are usually always talking to the guests as he's cooking which makes the experience fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1TIPvdwt3h1SVSeWL_5RJA.text: By far the BEST seafood meal I have ever had in Vegas. The pan roast is a MUST! Portions were huge and could easily be shared between 2 people (but why not just enjoy your own bowl of deliciousness?). All orders are cooked right in front of you. The only downside is the wait to get a seat because it is very limited. I hate waiting for food but it was definitely worth the hour wait in line. Will definitely come back each time I am in town!

cwXQFXOfwoBZCv90MPSziQ.text: NOT worth the LOOOOOONG wait. Same set up at Texas Station without the 2 hour wait. (I think the same company?) Insane that they don't add more seating rather than have you wait in a ridiculously long line. Food is good...service spotty at best.

i4p-KlpA1Lr-VC9EbUAbQQ.text: Pan roast.   Clam chowder.   Oysters.   I have heard a lot about this place, but was never able to make it to the Oyster Bar on my previous trips to Vegas.    Off the strip at the Palace Station, this place is a counter which seats about 15 people.   We waited about an hour to get a spot at the counter, but it was well worth the wait.   Definitely will be back.   Now part of the rotation for my Vegas trips!  Edit*  my picture is not the pan roast, but the clam chowder

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast

QmWMJYYkI6G4osCLtQi2Qw.text: Some of the best seafood in Vegas. The serve wine, beer and limited mixed drinks.  Always great selection of fresh oysters, mussels and clams.  My favorite meal is the pan roast with either lobster or crab.  I don't order any hotter than 4 or 5.

HtM-kY7b0_WNI86BqSL31A.text: This place never fails!!! Best hole in the wall spot in Vegas!    Combo Seafood PanRoast Level 10 spicy! I've tried Level 20, which was firing hot, but was abit too much for my taste buds.  Stick to level 10 and you will love it!  Best time to go is 3am to 8am.  Worst time to go is 5pm-10pm and expect long waits as the place seats only 12-16ppl.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Level 10 Spicy! PanRoast seafood Combo!

hCS6jwLXrOIFY0i2_37lXA.text: The BEST!  Worth the wait. ALWAYS worth the wait. It's part of the whole Oyster Bar experience anyway.  Grab a drink, talk to your fellow line-waiters and relish the amazing meal you're about to have.   Locals know about this place. And patiently wait, just like the tourists. 1 hour? That's a SHORT wait. 2 hours? About average some nights. STILL worth it.   Get the Pan Roast. The Caesar salad with jumbo lump crab is awesome. Oysters? Badass.  Clam linguine? Amazing. Gumbo? Off. The. Chain.   Get the drift? Can't go wrong. Food's made in front of you, chef and servers are hilarious and they make a great Bloody Mary. Cheers!

0G4qfx6oHNDO55IFHBCXag.text: Ok sooooo I thought I left a review but I guess not..  Got turned on this place by a buddy and now it's a mandatory stop whenever we r in Vegas   Great service and everything except the chowder is made too order.  Some of the dishes great pan roast , great bouillabaisse and chowder   Haven't had a bad dish here yet..  If JJ is working ask him to make u his signature lava sauce for an extra kick

xWil6zGrHM3KfKL611QiQQ.text: Peak hours are from 6-9, be prepared to wait if you are coming at these times. They are strict on seating if you told them you need seats for 2 and at  the last minute you tell them another number, they'll only give you what you told them the first time around.  The food: delicious ! Maybe because I was waiting in line for almost 3 damn hours and iwas just exhausted . My TIP would be to order Rice on the side because when they give your bowl of whatever you ordered (pan roast, jambalaya etc.) they put the rice right on top. Food was so good, But Nobody should wait 3 HOURS, just to eat a meal.

ruzCdKrd6i1HddQ_fKiO4w.text: Ok let me say that I'm in the industry so thought id give it a try? 1 1/2 hour in it on a Tuesday at about 12:45 or .so!! Witness so menny people leaving a small line? Not good. Right? They have a 13 chairs and the average meal per person is about a 55 min experience! Service not as great as the food!! Such a shame really! Palace station needs to do the right thing and customize this place to please the public that keeps them in business.

JepqmO6W2hpBACf1uxx9vw.text: Do not let the lines intimidate you, it'll be all worth it in the end! The oyster bar is a literal bar located in Palace station. Took us a bit of walking to actually find it amongst the gamblers and machines but once there you can't miss it.  Oysters were fresh, delicious and HUGE. Shrimp cocktail is a classic must. The soups you CANNOT miss out - we got the Alaskan chowder "dirty style" which is a half and half.  You get to choose the level of spice - we got a level 6 which was PERFECT. All in all best food we had our entire stay in Vegas.

uUHOwuTaHFXAVtPYhNum9A.text: Definitely WORTH the wait.   These oysters are HUGE, probably the biggest that I've ever had at a restaurant. The oysters were super fresh, very sweet and didn't taste or smell fishy.   On to the pan roast. The combo (shrimp, crab, and lobster) was so delicious! I would recommend getting rice on the side instead of in your pan roast because the portions are huge. You can definitely share it among 2 people and still be full (but they do charge you to split). It's probably better if you don't split though, because you'll definitely want a to go box to eat more later!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HZPaAsJrNNZiRcWCUMkOcA.text: This place is magical.  Their gulf oysters is amazing! So juicy and plum.  I always get at least a dozen myself.  The pan roast with heat level 6 is what I go for.  The creamy tomato base with seafood is what I describe as heaven.    Although there is usually a wait if 1 -1.5 hrs...but it still worth it!  Highly recommend this place!!  Pro tips: A) ask for rice or pasta on the side so you could control how much pan roast they soak in... B) don't fall for the slot scam while having your friend wait in line

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7Y7nDeNf-SO5aCq8mXLGKA.text: Oyster Bar in Palace Station is legendary for a reason. Just eat here. The pan roast is still every bit as sensational as the last review I wrote, and the combo pan roast with lobster will always be the stuff that your dreams and happiest memories are made of.   However, this time my review is to emotionally prepare you for your experience. I like to show up to Oyster Bar when I'm alone; Americans always have the need to space themselves out from strangers, and more often than not there's an empty solo seat. =Cue my entrance, please=  Here's what to bring if you show up during summer season or anytime (roughly) before 4AM or after 10AM: - Camping chair - A roadie (maybe you can flag a cocktail waitress down) - A few activities like crossword or Sudoku books (or coloring books, but no one under 21 here) - A ton of money to beg everyone else in front of you to let you cut in line  Great, now that we've established that the wait here is rough sometimes, you've finally made it to the front of the line and are about to pounce on the seats that just opened up. Staff will- with restraint- ask you to wait until the area is cleaned off. So hang out by the rope and just wait to be called.   I knocked this place down in stars because I'm tired of putting up with the staff's bullshit here. In the past 1,000 reviews, I've only commented negatively about staff one other time (The Mule in OKC), given that I'm a bartender myself.   The past two times here, the older servers have treated me like a burden and made zero effort to be pleasant at all; no thank you, no smile, no response except an order call back and a refill dumped on the counter. The whole thing straight up makes you feel BAD, and who the hell goes somewhere to eat and leave feeling like that? (If you didn't think it was possible to toss a drink at someone... it's possible.)   To the staff, if you're worn down from the tourist grind, get out of it and make room for someone who wants to be there, especially since money isn't ugly here.   Will it stop me from coming back? Nope. The food is amazing. And I still tip well because the cook ends up being nicer than the server, and the cook is part of the tip pool.   Maybe next time being a little nice to people will be on their menu, too. Or maybe not. Whatever. Pan roast and ignore.

2vzfUlldC5Lhy5U92FCexw.text: Went two times and definitely will be back! First time went on a Friday night around 9pm and waited about an hr and a half, and second a weekday around 1am and waited about 20 min. Both times ordered the Combo pan roast and both times so delicious! Ordered level 5 spice but did notice the second time it was a bit spicier. The combo pan roast is so creamy and so flavorful and pairs perfect with a scoop of white rice. Hubby ordered the gumbo which was delicious too! And half dozen fresh oysters! Only downside is that it's literally bar style with 17 seats! They really need to expand so wait times aren't so harsh but all in all one of my favorite places in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o3iVc_kuQ0iaEw4_nuv15g.text: Man! This place is awesome!  Had a Caesar salad with lump crab and some Manhattan clam chowder with the oysters!  Love love love!  Come here once, you'll be back and will tell your friends   Second visit - half dozen oysters and the combo pan roast and again, WOW! This place is great!

0R7zOTFFt0seRWtRz5DW6Q.text: Living for 12 years in the Bay Area and having access to the beach towns on the Northern California coast such as Monterey, Santa Cruz and Half Moon Bay and the list goes on. I have been fortunate to experience my fair share of wonderfully delicious, fresh seafood. Then came my visit and experience at the Oyster Bar and to think, I thought I would never love another. Fresh seafood in the desert? Especially at this small area which is truly a bar and located in the Palace Station Casino! First off I was expecting a actually restaurant. Instead we walked up and discovered that there was only limited seating and a line of people in front of us. We arrived around 6ish on a Friday evening. Neither did we know we actually picked a good time. Because, by the time we left after our wonderful meal, the line was 4 x longer. Now for all you stone cold seafood fans. Yes! It's worth the wait. That's a sure sign of how good the food is. Our wait was at least a hour and a half.  Now to our meal. My wife ordered the shrimp pan fry all of the stews come with a side of rice. I ordered the Cioppino, excellent! The experience in itself is overwhelming. Why? Because not only are you eating and tasting all of the ingredients of the delicious seafood.  You are seeing other dishes being made right before you! So it's a orgy of you tasting and watching the fresh seafood prepared right in front of you. Staff and service is outstanding! I would say that the Oyster Bar is exquisite. Because the food and the atmosphere is extremely beautiful. However, because of the wait those of you who will visit for your first time. You have to understand that it's delicate. The food is worth having the patience to wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8ZJmNYeN1HCBmp46lvk5vg.text: Don't walk, run to the Oyster Bar! Literally or others will get ahead of you in line lol. My first time here and we went around 10:30pm on a Thursday night and had to wait about an hour. Got their New England Chowder, Palace Pan Roast and Seafood Jambalaya. Everything was exceptionally good but I'd have to say the chowder was my favorite and probably the best I've ever had.   Service was really good and the waiter/waitress were very attentive too.  Tip: If you like your food with a kick, definitely up the spice level. I felt like it enhanced the flavors rather than took anything away.  They also give complimentary sourdough rolls that came out hot and fresh.   Also, portions are fairly large so sharing is caring.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace Pan Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New England Chowder

cRUqSz5oHm78uCBh_nr-Bg.text: OMG!!!  No wonder why the Oyster Bar located at The Palace Station always has a long line.  It's worth the hour wait for the best raw oysters off the strip.  This spot is not a sit down restaurant.  There are about 15 or so seats in a bar setting.    It can be hectic pretty much throughout the day.  When we arrived there were only 2 people waiting in line.  So we thought it was going to be easy breezy.  It was a bad idea.  We hit the casino for about 30 minutes and came back.  By this time the lunch crowd all decided to swarm in.  We got seated within 45-50 minutes.    The chef cooks right in front of you.  It's interesting to see the magic happen in an open kitchen setting.  I didn't get try the Combo Pan Roast with the linguini noodles.  But I was able to try a dozen of the raw oysters.  Very fresh for Vegas standards.  I also had the little neck clams in garlic herb broth.  Flavorful and delicious!  It's a must try when visiting Vegas.  I will be back to try more entrees.  Be patient because the wait is bearable.  Then you'll get to enjoy the seafood.  Not to mention the friendly service even though it's busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Those oysters tho.  Yum!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Little neck clams in garlic herb broth.  Good!

tedDthbOzwtuZ2lcjIEYCg.text: We were so hungry and didn't want a grab and go meal at Planet Hollywood. I really wanted a nice sit down. We passed by the Oyster Bar and it instantly reminded me of Europe sitting and eating on the streets. We had to stop in. We were treated by a kind host who had the menu immediately out for us. I saw all kinds of great seafood and we were all in! We sat on the outside which was great. We got to people watch while eating. It wasn't super busy so it was a nice average noise. Our waiter was great. He came to our table immediately and got our drink and appetizer order. I ordered a mojito! It was a little on the strong side but it was so tasteful!  Enjoyed it a lot. Our appetizer was the mozzarella sticks. We didn't want anything too heavy because we were about to splurge on dinner. These were so so good. Freshly baked and homemade marinara sauce. I've never had such a good mozzarella stick in my life. Now for our dinner choice, I had wanted the Mahi Mahi but it was all out (bummer) so my next best choice was Alaskan King Crabs. So glad I chose this. They are already cut down the middle for you. The garlic butter sauce makes it savory!   My husband ordered the surf and turf & he said it was the best he's had in so long. The only thing that could make this place better is some tropical music! The place is super romantic and I wil definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crabs!!!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loving this lock box decor

DovDRV0SKWgv9j51ArJq9g.text: There is limited seating but the wait is worth it. You can wait for more than 2 hours if it's busy but you have the option to gamble while you wait. Depending on the time of the day you can be lucky and be seated quickly.   I usually order the pan roast, you can't go wrong with that. Portions are huge so we usually share. Seafood tastes delicious and fresh. Everything is cooked to order.  Service is usually good as well. All the staff are very friendly and offer suggestions if needed.

drYslksnhFpWzQnwHQEggg.text: My husband and I visit the Palace Station Oyster Bar every time we go to Vegas. Everything is SO good especially if you're lucky enough to get Chef Eze. He's the best! The shrimp in the pan roast is cooked to perfection, the raw oysters are delicious, and the clam chowder is amazing! The wait is long, but definitely worth it.

E-edijjVbg5Hl5iTM9IgSA.text: 5 stars for the food quality and outstanding service. Came here around midnight on a Wednesday & luckily waited only less than 10 minutes to be seated. If there is a line - I think it's well worth it if the wait is only an hour or less. Standing for more than an hour or two in line when you're very hungry is not worth it. The "combo pan roast" is a must order. I'd describe it as a creamy and rich tomato based soup packed with shrimp , lobster and crab. When choosing spice level (1-10) for your pan roast , if you can handle spicy then definitely go higher. Settled with a level "5" & tried my friend's level "8" and the spicier was so much better. It didn't take away any of the flavors of the pan roast either. Each pan roast comes with choice of rice or noodles so I tried both on the side - noodles were rather interesting and I actually enjoyed it more than the rice with my pan roast :) Can't go wrong with either. Free sourdough bread too. One pan roast is good enough for two people , we even had enough for leftovers. Also tried the shrimp cocktail & oysters and they were fresh and tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp cocktail
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast w/ rice &amp; noodles
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary sourdough bread

98dbeRon1SoqkCit-Qj00Q.text: My wife really wanted to try this place out. Looking at the line, I was skeptical--especially since it was after 2am. After waiting over an hour, I was not disappointed. In fact, it was one of the finest meals I've ever enjoyed. As good as anything we've had in New Orleans. We ordered a half dozen oysters and shared the signature Combo Pan Roast. This place more than lives up to the hype.

3Dm08Fvvlym0EdQWiCrZgw.text: I came to this place almost every time when I'm in Vegas.  We usually go around 3:30 AM-5:00 AM - 30-45 minutes wait. Chef Ricardo was supper nice and funny. His food is always on point.  My friend and I usually order a Combo Pan Roast, Crab Pan Roast, Clams Chowder, and the shrimp cocktails.  They gave the right portion of rice for each dish.   The pan roast flavors for this place is creamy, perfect consistency, not tomatoey but rich in seafood tastes.   Definitely will come back because it worths the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp cocktail
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast

pfAL1QCD9niS7qAgHv5ENg.text: It honestly was whatevers. We waited for about 2 hours and it didn't seem like it was worth the wait like what other yelpers said. We ordered the combo pan roast at level 5 which was a pretty good level if you cant handle spicy and a clam chowder. The portions were pretty big. You could really taste all the chunky lobster, whole shrimps and bits of crab meat. It had like a tomatoey taste to it. It was alright but for the wait I would not come back. Unless I'm drunk lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast level 5
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam chowder

RWK-0BtOuSmc5x8jTnOwMg.text: I'm so glad i read the reviews of this place!! We did have to wait in line but not for a long time.  The best times to come are in between 6am-9am. We got an order of 12oz oysters, which with creamy and delicious and big. You get complimentary sourdough rolls while you wait for your food. My recommendation is the pan roasts. Any of them would be good,  but we got the combo and there was lots of lobster in it in big chunks. We got a level 7 in heat and it was perfectly spiced and seasoned for us. Rich, creamy and satisfying. It comes with a side of steamed rice. I would definitely share a pan roast. We were able to finish a the whole pan roast with 2 people, i would have really struggled to eat that by myself. I really great find in Las Vegas!! I would definitely come back again. The staff is really friendly and they hustle to serve you.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious succulent oysters!!!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

DCB-SRhfME6zzf5YV8rCjQ.text: There is no where better. You are probably going to wait at least an hour in line but it's worth it. One of the most reasonably priced places in Las Vegas. Hot food cooked to order right in front of you

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Combo Pan Roast. My wife&#39;s favorite creamier than the Bouill-Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Bouill-Roast. So good, level 5

T0ubPH8ohNPFed42PYmCRg.text: Seriously, I always think of going to Vegas from the bay just to eat here. This has definitely become my favorite oyster bar! We first came here about 4 years ago when we stair at the palace hotel and we have come to eat her about 4 times total during our Vegas visits. It's a MUST! I get the Combo Pan roast and it is DELICIOUS! It comes with shrimp, crab, and lobster! YUMM! The staff is supper friendly and quick. They make your food right in front of you too!  The wait can be super long but so worth it!  I cannot wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2ud9LvFwYQwhZc4AbPzROA.text: 5 stars all day long!!! This truly is one of the hubbies and I's favorite place to come to in Las Vegas. The clam chowder ohhhhh sooo good!! The Combo Pan Roast is just amazing!!! You can chooses a spice level from 1-10 but we always get a 15-16 which really takes it up a notch. ****( Warning ... Do not try this at home kids) ** Quick service, Long waits but worth it! Enjoy

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cmYZP8bGbxkuWU5lRAu5TQ.text: Wow I waited in line for like 1.5 hours, and I can't wait to come back for more. Am I out of my mind? Yes, yes I am. Because I actually went back and waited 2.5 hours for a second time. Usually I feel like waiting in line for such a long time is stupid, but the excruciating wait makes the pan roast taste just that much better when you get it. Like the feeling you get when hard work pays off.   A boat load of spices and a mountain of seafood is doused in the tomato cream sauce to make the seafood pan roast. Loaded with big chunks of crab and lobster. This is one entree you MUST NOT divert from. You've already waited for such a long time, don't be a fool and not order the pan roast! It's the best pan roast I've ever had thus far.  Heard there wouldn't be as long of a wait if you come during odd hours; This statement is False. You can always potentially hit a rush of some sort of rush and wait 2 hours due to limited seating.  Last time I was here at 3 am. and there was a family that came before us, ended up waiting nearly 2.5 hours. Here's a tip, give yourself ample time to wait in line, wait for your food too cook, time to eat the food, and time to get the check. It's usually just a 3 people crew, and they gotta do everything. So don't come here in a rush. You can thank me later.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the best meals you can get in Vegas
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect bite
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast

mKhab4MykJ2BsQuzXYWWkg.text: Definitely delicious!   We were lucky that there was no wait when we went on a Tuesday afternoon. My only regret was not getting any oysters. They looked fresh and very plump.  It's hard to ration out stomach space while in Las Vegas.   The pan roasts were bomb. The portion size is very filling. Piping hot, creamy, and luscious with each spoonful filled with seafood. You can order it with a spice level from 1-10 and I found that anywhere from 5-7 to be the perfect amount of spice. We liked how we saw how it was cooked right in front of us at the counter.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast

ISERURnwN0a0gGmN2ZOZPQ.text: Their combo pan roast is soooo good! Ive had it the last few times I was in Vegas and I will never leave Vegas again without it. It was nothing like anything I've had before. Their oysters are a little too fatty for me, I prefer smaller oysters but I'm still dreaming about their pan roast after a year. The only downside is having to wait in line for this place. It's 24hrs so the best time to go is probably at like 2am. But don't get me wrong, you'll still be standing in line, just a shorter one. And the portions are huge!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3XDBhavEMNB15w4MSXe9Tw.text: I have been hearing about this place for years.  Finally got a chance to stand in line for this 18 seater bar and it was the bomb!  We waited about an hour and we were in Oyster Heaven!  My wife and I ordered a dozen of half shell oysters, pan roast seafood combo (medium), and lava sauce on the side.  Thanks yelpers for the tip on the lava sauce since my wife can't handle hot.  We absolutely loved our meal and my wife encouraged me to figure out how we can reproduce this awesome dish at home.  I tried to get the cook to give up the secret, however, he just kept saying, sit back in your chair and keep eating and enjoying it!  Shucks, no help here!  We even got extra rice to soak up all the beautiful and wonderful sauce that this dish provides.  I'm gonna remember this for a long time and hopefully try to create this at home.  Wish me luck!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lava sauce
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen Oysters

mghsUah5k8l7ctAWRusAXw.text: *****come at 4am on a Friday if you don't want to wait!!!  This place has always been on my list of places I'd love to try in Vegas!   Thankfully, it is 24/7.. No one wanted to COME AT 4am on a Friday! I was seated right away by Steve and Ricardo who took great care of us!  We ordered:  -pan roast (tastes great!!! Yummy!!) -bouillabaisse (a little water down, but loved the seafood) -clam chowder (delicious!!! Nothing like those pour made canned clam chowder) -dozen oysters(delicious!!)  Total came out to $85 but definitely worth trying. Portions are HUGE so don't forget to share, share, share!  Service was fantastic! Ricardo entertained us and took care of my girls and I! Thanks for the fantastic experience at 4am :)   When on a vacation, time is precious! I would not wait long hours!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These two provided excellent service at 4am!! Thank you :)
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam chowder!! Must try
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bouillabaisse! It was ok

BYR9H374msPX5V5sZq8PMw.text: Came here on a Friday night around 10 PM, and the line was super long. Ended up waiting about an hour and 45 minutes, the wait probably would've been a lot shorter, literally everyone in front of us had 4 or more people in their party, how unlucky of us :(. Anyways, we already knew what we wanted, so we ordered right when we got seated.  Oysters: I don't like oysters but my bf enjoyed it, I only like oysters from EMC because they're really small and doesn't really have that seafood-y smell.   New England clam chowder: I really wanted to order the alaskan chowder, but I ordered the new england one instead, it was really good! One of the best clam chowders I've ever had, there was a lot clams in it, which I loved. The soup was pretty filling for us already, we were half way full when we finished it.  Combo Pan Roast: We ordered level 8 spiciness, it was actually pretty spicy, will definitely get a 6 or 7 next time. I've had ritters before in Orange County, and it is pretty similar. The lobster and shrimp pieces were huge, they were not stingy at all with the seafood. The pan roast was really good and creamy, will definitely order this everytime I eat here.
