Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast level 8 spiciness

R9eYk53ne_6INTX-TGCyNg.text: Love this place, had the shrimp pan roast with a side rice  my better half had the combination pan roast with noodles and 6 fresh oysters. It's always a long wait BUT well word it. Ricardo the chef is awesome!

XhKJ5kF7tF4yQw_lRk2cQg.text: This place is outstandingly incredible! Pan Roast is insanely delicious worth the 1 hour wait on a Monday afternoon.  The shrimp appetizer was huge and fresh.  Oyster Bar is definitely a place to eat when in Vegas.  I will have cravings for the Pan Roast.

kd9DpMuWY5c_wofk4yb56Q.text: Ordered the combo pan (lobster, shrimp, and crab) and it was delicious!! 24.99, plus a 10$ bloody Mary and of course a damn good oyster shooter!! Will definitely try again. The 25 minute wait sucked - but good food is well worth the time!

ybqHFYh1Vj3u3vwEwyGdZQ.text: This review is for 4.5 stars.  Let me just get the negatives out of the way.  There is very minimal seating and turnover is very slow considering the meal comes out so quickly.  The wait is incredibly long.  During most times you will wait a good hour and a half; I came at 11:30pm on a Monday night (presumably a slow time) and still waited 30 minutes.  And finally, they do take out, but you have to have a seat at the bar to order which is incredibly poor judgement as they're missing out on plenty of sales to gain an even bigger customer base.  On to the good stuff now.  The food is incredibly tasty and the spice level is on point.  I ordered a 9 and it destroyed my stomach.  That's not a negative.  I love it when a restaurant lives up to their spice levels.  I ordered a combination pan roast and was served in about 10 minutes with a large bowl of awesomeness with a few chunks of lobster, crab, and shrimp (could have used more seafood but fresh nonetheless).  The service was great once seated.  Waiter comes around quickly to get your order and refills and fresh bread available upon request.  The main chef at the 24 hour spot even comes out and talks it up with the customers to ask how the meal is going.    Oyster Bar lives up to the hype in taste but I'm not sure if that's the greatness of the food or the psychological effect of waiting in line and eating.  Either way, it's worth a venture if you have time or are out and about at weird hours and are hankering for a great gumbo, chowder, pan raost, or other great seafood/Louisiana delicacies.

W7rUHLV-PUyDyChJBiGFqA.text: I went at 3 AM on a weekday so there wasn't much of a wait. All the seats were full and our group of 4 only waited about 5 min. I had high expectations seeing as how normal wait times can be up to 3-4 hours.   Pan Roast Combo: Very delicious! I would definitely get it again. I got a level 5 and my friend got a 7. However I think the dishes may have been switched (though she claims otherwise). You could taste the various flavors of the dish and the spices which blended together well into a bowl of pure deliciousness. It is possible to share one dish with two people with small/average appetites. I did find it weird and disappointing that they charge $4 for extra rice but it's Vegas so I suppose it is to be expected.   House Gumbo: I do not recommend this dish. The food was extremely salty! The dish was left untouched for the most part due to this. I've had Gumbo in various places and the best one was in New Orleans. This dish was just atrocious. No taste other than salt!   Raw Oysters: pretty normal/average. It tasted fresh and there are no complaints. I do find it amusing that the place is called Oyster bar but there aren't more oyster dish options such as cooked or fried Oysters but that is irrelevant.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast Combo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raw Oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Gumbo

5CJTY3nogko-mXXUb50hrA.text: I waited two hours for THIS?! WHAT IS WRONG WITH YOU PEOPLE? My friend told me about this spot and said their pan roast was soooo delicious. So delicious in fact that the wait was exponentially longer because of its popularity as the original location and limited amount of seats. 2 hours later I'm excited because everyone has been suffering as I have and it's finally our turn! We order a Caesar salad, pan roast, and gumbo.   Guys.  EVERYTHING IS JUST MEDIOCRE.   If flavor had a color, this would be beige. Crestfallen is a word I seldom get to use; that is exactly how I felt. Nothing spectacular, just blah. And what's the deal with the jasmine rice? It made me feel like I was at an Asian restaurant.  Also maybe to turn the seats and speed up the line, portion sizes could be decreased. Everyone looked like they were struggling at the end slipping in and out of food comas.   I guess this is one of those Vegas experiences...

LIWfenDy4IWaoXO2gjGhqA.text: I hate that despite the rave reviews on the seafood at Oyster Bar, the biggest talking point seems to be the hours-long wait. I've shown up many times, ready to eat, only to be frustrated by the long wait and leaving myself. Well, here's a local tip that I recently discovered. If you work night shifts like myself, go to the bar after work at 6 am, and you will be guaranteed a spot at the counter. I know it sounds extreme, but the pan roast is well worth it, even for breakfast.   If you haven't been here yet, the combo pan roast is the one to try if you love seafood. It has shrimp, crab, and lobster. If you're more of a surf and turf type of person, the house pan roast is more for you. For some reason, the scoop of rice is the perfect addition to this seafood stew. If you don't like it too spicy, don't get anything above 5. The highest level of 10 was actually tolerable in a good way, but you definitely won't be scarfing it down. Pass on the bread roll as the level of staleness is something that even the pan roast can't cover.  Other reasons to come during off hours include a half dozen oysters for $10 and $3 beer until 9 am. If you want to enjoy these benefits and no wait, you'll have to arrive before 8 am. By the time we finished our meal, there was already a line forming behind the velvet ropes.

gXQziFbdgGlrhtM6_BrIcQ.text: The best pan roast ever! Even though I am hundreds of miles away, the thought of their pan roast makes my mouth water.   I highly recommend the combo pan roast. Big chunks of lobster, crab and shrimp awaits you in a perfectly crafted bowl of tastiness. They are generous in their portions and the same goes for their clam chowder too, which is scrumptious. I would skip on their oysters though, even though it is called the Oyster bar. They use a type of oyster called Gold band that is pasteurized and lacks flavor.   The wait is always long; be prepared to wait a while (we waited 2-3 hours each time we visited) but once you sit down and eat, it will be worth it!  A must try in Vegas!

6pwtW5Mc2MMfmK6bCNf9jA.text: First time trying this place and it was amazing. Great atmosphere, you get to meet new people from all around the world. The head chef was so personable and made us feel at home. I recommend the pan roast combo over the seafood jambalaya but they were all so good! The oysters were so fresh and big. I cannot wait to go back again!

CZVQYCHMGdLelwyJ82SdOQ.text: Every time I'm in Las Vegas, I take an Uber to the Palace Station Oyster Bar.  Stand in line patiently for a seat for a always delicious meal, shot of Tequila and a Corna.  There is no other.  The smoke smell is intense until you sit down at the bar.  Beware of imitators, get pass the hotel itself and enjoy!  You'll be glad you came.

9jWPg-pIQjqLusDnodABbA.text: I'm only going back to Vegas for the pan roast here. Lawd hammercy! It's worth the long line. My bf even loved it and he's rarely impressed by restaurant food! The oysters were good. Staff is friendly and funny! I would give you tips about how/when to avoid the line but I won't for selfish reasons  lol

CLOT4Y7AQ-3PYGrpo6J40w.text: Excellent, we'll worth the wait. The pan roasts are very unique that you won't find anywhere else and is a must!

yU0zUcTAGwFP3laQ7J0Q3g.text: Can't beat their dozen oysters for $20.  Pan roast is big enough to share with another person, which is what we did. Ask for extra bowl of rice since one scoop is not enough to go with their pan roast.  Best time to go is off hours.  We arrived at 10 am on sunday and there were 5 groups in front of us, which was a 30 minute wait, the shortest time i ever waited here. It's typically a 1-2 hour wait.  Only negative is that you'll be dining while the people waiting in line are staring straight at you, so you feel kind of rushed especially when there are 20 people in line maddogging you.  They're thinking hurry up and finish eating!  Just like what i was thinking while waiting in line.   Best advice is to tag team while waiting.  You hit the bj table while wifey waits in line, then come back in line while wifey hits the slots. Repeat one or two times!

JUv7WqIx2CwWR67TJagmWQ.text: Omg if you every come to Vegas you must!!! Like MUST come here to eat! There's a lot of other oyster bar but you have to come here to the palace station hotel. It's off the strips but soooo worth it. The food is so delicious!!!! It's made fresh right in front of you and you get to interact with the chef that is cooking your food. So it's a really cool experience!!! But let me tell you, this is like a bar style food place, they probably take about I wanna say 15 people at a time at the bar. So you wanna come early or have someone come wait in line cause it's about a 2 hour wait every time and the line is long. This place is super popular and it's open 24 hours. Which really surprise me because for a place that opens 24 hours the food is amazing!!! Their known for their pan roast which is what everyone orders and it does takes while for the pan roast to cook. So definitely order some appetizer while you wait for the main dish. The pan roast is like a creamy thick seafood( shrimps, lobster, crabs, bell pepper and sausage )stew sever with rice.   I highly recommend coming here if you're visiting Vegas or if you live here. Just writing this got my mouth all watery.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HiNPFARz47QiIM2Rn8Z3rQ.text: I will just say this AAAAHHHHMAZING !  My husband and I had just came back from New Orleans and were craving oysters and some more New Orleans style food . This place delivered.   Here's the deal it's seated at a bar, there only about 17 seats , so your going to have to wait. BIG DEAL! ITs worth it!   Ever hear good things come to those who wait !!?? Well delicious things come to those who wait .  Atmosphere and great food. Wether it's a date , meeting friends , or just for no reason at all lol this place really is a great place to go!   Highly recommend !

FDPKgovBYLv9fubpchV2lg.text: This place was great! The line food was amazing but was it worth an hour and half wait in a line? Probably not I would go to one of the other locations the next time I want oysters because guess what people they order from the same vendor! Anyway great service great food

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UHdcMW2vRymnMXQfN5ZqKQ.text: Will be visiting whenever I go to Vegas.  Combo pan roast, spice level 6: Creamy heavenly goodness. Mix in the rice, instead of eating it separately. Spice level 6 is perfect if you want a good kick. For those who can't take spice, 6 will be too much. For those who like fire and burn, 6 won't be enough. I went back and forth between eating the pan roast and bouillabaisse, and it was wonderful. If I had the pan roast by itself, I miiiiiight have felt it was too rich to finish the bowl - plus the portion is huge. Nevertheless, I will be having this dish whenever I go to Vegas.  Bouillabaisse, spice level 6: Flavorful is an understatement. It is a tomato based soup with huge pieces of seafood. It is truly a flavor explosion. I prefer the combo pan roast, but the two complement each other very well. Please see above for spice level review.   Oysters: Freakishly huge. Fresh. Loved.   The Oyster Bar is a small bar with only a handful of stools. We went Friday afternoon and waited about 2 hours. Tip: Do not go in large groups over 3 (2 is ideal). If 4 or more, please be mindful of others and break up into small groups, otherwise the seats will remain empty until the entire party can sit. You may not be able to survive the death stares and chatters of the other hungry patrons in line. Plus it's just rude.   Once again, THIS PLACE IS NOT FOR LARGE GROUPS.

PDbj2ky0z3eDNwIxEFdZtg.text: Order the Combo Seafood Pan Roast, it's delicious! Oysters were horrible when I went.

hvxQtSOe_15HzFrasIy96Q.text: Yyyaaaasssss!!!!!  Delicious fresh oysters!!! I'm not a big raw oysters kind of person but I ate them here!! Sooo good!   Pan roast: full flavored seafood with chunks of the seafood of your choice. Next time I'll ask for the rice on the side. ***this is the winner***  Boulli-roast: Mild seafood flavor with tomato base and large chunks of mixed seafood. Rice is served on the side.   Gumbo: too salty for me and I'm not sure what it's suppose to taste like. Rice served in the dish.

KVMFc90j7L0DwsMaD8XtHg.text: Great cuisine and service! We sat at the bar and enjoyed the lobster bisque soup, bacon-wrapped shrimp & scallops appetizer, and 1/2 lb. warm king crab legs entree accompanied by fresh and delicious asparagus and spring mixed greens. The bisque had lots of yummy lobster pieces and the crab legs were meaty and almost had a grilled flavor; seriously some of the best king crab legs I've had. My hubby really enjoyed the bacon-wrapped shrimp & scallops. Our water glasses were filled frequently which we greatly appreciated after imbibing in several free drinks while gambling. We will definitely return next time at Harrah's on the Las Vegas strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ryAFsJY-qKShW66DQdaG7g.text: Off the strip, you have to taxi to get there! Open 24/7 inside Palace Station Casino. I recommend coming at odd hours so the wait is shorter. They have a "moonlight special" which is happy hour from 1am-9am. $3-beer $5-wine $10-1/2 dozen oysters on the half shell.   So we got there at 11:55pm on a Wednesday and of course all the seats were filled. Luckily we were second in line behind a group of two girls. There's only 20 seats available, bar style. It took about 10 minutes to get seated. We also came there on our last day..we woke up at 7am just to go before our flight at 10:45am. YES, it's that good! Luckily there was no line and a few open bar seats.  Everyone knows that after you wait for so long, once you reach the bar, you'll take your sweet time enjoying your meal. -another factor as to why it can be a reallllly long wait!   Good thing about this place is that IT IS located inside a casino (even though it's old and comparable to Reno casinos). If you have more than one person in your party, one person can stay in line while others get to gamble! :p   So far we've tried..  Combo Pan Roast $23.99 -very fresh shrimp! Comes with crab and lobster too, scoop of white rice.   Lobster Pan Roast $21.99 -my favorite, the lobster is so tender! Never had lobster so fresh. Comes with a scoop of white rice.   No joke, it smells AMAZING once you sit down at the bar. I smell fresh seafood and creamy goodness from the kettles of pan roast being cooked.   They give you a warm sourdough bread roll to snack on while you wait, along with a bowl full of butta! There's also a whole tray of different hot sauces to pick from.  You can choose your level of spiciness on a scale of 1-10. I've tried level 8 and 10. Both had a kick, but not too spicy. I think they only add more red pepper flakes. Add dashes of Tabasco into your pan roast, it makes it even more amazing!   It takes awhile for the cook to make the pan roasts..they come out fresh, boiling hot..which contributes to why it takes soo long for everyone to finish up too. You have to eat slowly otherwise you end up burning your mouth!  There's a $5 split fee for ordering one dish and sharing but my BF and I split a pan roast the last day we were there and they didn't charge us. The cook actually gave us an extra scoop of rice too. lol ..oh and you can order pan roast togo as well but it's limited to 2 orders per person.   I really love it there. Wish they had more seating so the wait would be shorter..

c6PInEga4ZFzOKZDOV-9oQ.text: First let me talk about the staff...  absolutely positively fabulous so friendly so funny so accommodating and so knowledgeable! Now for the food:  I loved the vodka shooters the oysters are so fresh super yummy We also had oysters on the half shell which were fabulous I could have had 2 dozen My husband and I shared the food and it was so yummy the broth was fantastic We did not have a long wait but I wouldn't care if I waited an hour it would be worth it

mZcO7jQBM7HlOQmUT6l6SA.text: EVERYTHING IS UNBELIEVABLY DELICIOUS!!  Located inside Palace Station.  Limited seating (maybe 12 seats at the counter). Long, long, long lines but worth every minute because anything you order will be amazing.  Gumbo! Clear Salad! Pan Roast! ... to name a few of my favorite dishes.  We have eaten gumbo in many cities and the chef at Oyster Bar makes the best gumbo we've had thus far. [you're shocked at that statement, I'm sure but it's True] Many times we've stood in line and my husband didn't want to wait, but once we get to the counter he was so happy that we stayed. We are never disappointed. You absolutely forget how long you waited once you're in that seat and start watching them make the many delicious dishes they will be serving up. To kill time, we alternate gambling at nearby slot machines.   This restaurant is the first stop we make when we land in Las Vegas and YOU HAVE TO GO!  Dishes are priced at around $15.99 and up.

PWmBIXpKrdEcdMv_dXnZyg.text: PLEASE bring Ricardo back!  He is one of the most genuine people that I have met in Las Vegas and your best chef, hands down!

VlOKQUwMB_iJFG3wiPDxmw.text: Pan roast vs. etouffe = PAN ROAST, if that was your decision. Not that it's not good, but I like the tangier, creamier, pan roast. We liked the combo one, with lobster, shrimp, and crab. Expect the 2-3 hr wait on a Saturday afternoon, for some very good Cajun seafood. I've never had etouffe, but I but it reminds me of gumbo--there's a very distinct file taste that I think I personally prefer less and less. But if that's your thing, by all means.   Don't let the name "pan roast" fool you, it's not a pot roast or anything. It's a tomato sauce, cream, and butter base stew. Comfort food. Be smart, take turns with your group standing in line so y'all can gamble and drink in between. There's only 20 chairs open, and 6 pots cooking at once, hence the long wait. The staff is super nice and accommodating, they called security on a super drunk guy who was invading our friend's personal space.   I agree with a previous reviewer, that a spiciness of 5/10 is enough kick, with still being able to taste your food.   I said 4 stars, only because our 2:45 wait was a big chunk of our weekend trip, to wait for this place. I could've settled for less. All in all, we're all leaving super stuffed and happy. Thank you Chef, Chrystina, and Mike, you all were great! Now to get our cute lil' bellies into our cute lil' Vegas dresses, lol...

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m7txoX8w2O3DN1ZY_WqLKQ.text: Have never been been a big fan of oysters until I came to this place. I always felt like I was eating a slug or something. The flavor of the oysters is superb, the usual fishy smell somehow has been properly controlled through the cooking methods. No worries of biting into grits of sand, the perfect spot to bring the right date, and a potential aphrodisiac. I strongly recommend for all of you out there who are connisuires or not.

rbNikJlvQH-BkT3HLGPyug.text: At all times of the day and night, The Oyster bar is good! No! Great even!!! Personally I'm a huge fan of their Pan Roasts. The creamy tomato base with tons of meats and seafood slays me every time! The Oyster bar is a must for my wife and I. Its a small place though, with only 18 bar like seats, you can easily wait over an hour to eat here. I've actually heard of hour long waits at 2am! It seems like the best times to go are at around 4-8am and... Well... That's really it... I've been here a lot and only once have I ever come and been able to be seated within 10mins(4am!)   If you've never eaten at a Base Bar before, you'll love this. At Base bars they make their soups/bases right in front of you, and serve you the Bases usually with a scoop of rice in the middle and just like the name implies, the Oyster bar actually has good oysters! I'd recommend them for sure.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2d9rWB-S-8n70o7_DoPJ1g.text: Is it really worth all the effort? Do you really want to wait 2+ hours for some freaking expensive & slightly above average Cajun food?  No seriously, I would not recommend anyone to come here with an empty stomach at 12 AM because you will probably die from starvation while waiting in line. Okay it's an exaggeration but even tortoises move faster than this late night waiting line. Sure this Oyster Bar stay open 24/7, but the bar can only hold approximate 18 customers at a time. I left after 30 minutes of waiting because I figured that I will just come back here again in the morning. There's a "Moonlight Specials" from 1 AM to 9 AM and you pay $10 (reg $13.99) for 1/2 dozen of raw oysters.  zzzzz (sleeping time)  So after a good night sleep, I came back to Palace Station Casino at 9 AM and guess what - no line at all! Unfortunately, there was only one server taking everyone's orders and my food took more than 45 minutes to arrive. I noticed that almost everyone ordered pan roast and I was the only person ordered gumbo ...   ***  Cold Seafood Combination (shrimp cocktail, clams, oysters - $19.99): Good oysters, but I didn't like red oysters that much. High quality shrimps & cocktail sauce contained horseradish [3.75/5]   House Gumbo (creole soup made with a variety of seafood, okra, and andouille sausage served w/ steamed rice, shrimp + crab + lobster $23.99): I got level 5 spiciness level and it was just right. Good broth, but not worth the trouble & wait for 1+ hour. [3.75/5]  ***  3-star mainly due to lack of staff, long wait, and high price point. My recommendation?  1) Come here in the morning to avoid the dreadful waiting line. 2) Consider getting pan roast instead of gumbo.  P.S. - $5 fee if you want to share a plate   P.P.S. - There's another Oyster Bar at Harrah's Hotel and Casino, but it is not open 24/7.  P.P.P.S - Pike Place Chowder was ranked 80th on the Yelp's Top 100 Places to Eat for 2016.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Gumbo (creole soup made with a variety of seafood, okra, and andouille sausage served w/ steamed rice, shrimp + crab + lobster $23.99)
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold Seafood Combination (shrimp cocktail, clams, oysters - $19.99)

0n7lBJxwiAVZL875KxgXtg.text: I had pan roast for breakfast!  Outstanding meal, got crab pan roast spice level 3. Could have done 4 or 5   I walked past 8:45 am no waiting. I stayed there 4 days this first time without a line.  Would have been worth the wait!  Base is yummy tomato seafood broth added to trinity. They cook it 5 minutes before adding spice and crab. Plus more broth and love. Color is all pinkish. Looks like Campbell tomato soup made with cream. I got white rice on the side. Add a couple boring but warm dinner rolls. The suggestion I have is to do better bread. Maybe San Francisco sourdough. Great for sopping up the soup.  Sure it's not cheap. But this soup is concocted in front of your eyes.  People all around me were eating raw oysters. Half dozen for $10 in morning. I'm not into raw oysters. But everything was great. I'll go back wherever I'm staying.

_nle7jaeTsvVvmbNSavAFA.text: Always good service and great food the lobster pan roast,and the oysters. Best in town.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome

3mWKAPFEiXzhQnJgiBudNA.text: This is my favorite place to unwind and get stuff. The best gumbo in Vegas cooked rite in front of you in a matter of minutes. And because I'm such a value guest here they have given me my personal beer mug

m3BgFBn_1yDvi578ZPvDxQ.text: This place is great. The oysters are always fresh The shooters are really good. I never have to wait for a table more than 15 minutes. Service is usually very good.

nvGJuWM_drtJV4ZdDVkIfQ.text: The best food I've had since I moved to Las Vegas.  OMG, this is our goto place on our date nights.  I've had most of the things on the menu and still love it like it was my first time.

gtEyVTcQdM8jXBhedYsI6g.text: The line for a seat here is long.  Always.  Deal with it.  Oh, and get the pan roast - combo, of course...  You're welcome.

9qJPCwBbGGMC96Rcs-16QA.text: We rolled up Around 1am after waking up from a day club nap. Of course the wait was up to 2 hrs and that's no surprise, we came expecting for the wait. We got the pan roast of course and as always it was on point, steamy/creamy/flavorful. A bowl full of heaven.   Since we came in later in the night, they have a moonlight special: half an order of raw oysters $10.   The service as always is always so nice and friendly, even with the crazy wait and constant flow of customers.   We took the leftovers and had some for dinner the next day and it was just as good. I had the crab pan roast, which consisted of 3 full scoops of crabs, the crab kinda absorbed majority of the liquid but it was still so amazing.    WORTH THE WAIT.

8VxjfZ722wbM0CWq6XePcA.text: Wow this is the best thing I have ever eaten in a loooong time!  My 2 girlfriends and I waited about an hour dying of starvation to eat here  as our first meal of the day at 3pm LOL but like everyone else has said, it was definitely WORTH THE WAIT. Here are the items we ordered and enjoyed:  Half shell oysters were really good and tasted even better with Tobasco, horseradish and pepper. Anything tasted really good at that point in our stomachs lol  The combination pan roast was thick and tasty with enough spiciness to carry out really good flavor over rice. The portions are huge here so I recommend sharing it among 2-3 hungry people.  The clam linguine in red sauce was also impressive too, which had a variety of spices to it. My friends and I also split this too.  The place is really small because they can only seat about 16 customers but goddamn, it is worth the wait and it's actually pretty cool to see how the chefs cook in front of you at the oyster bar with their turning and rotating kitchenware. The service was OK but regardless, I would wait an hour again :)

mCz1pBDX7Hg4CCtdkfuScw.text: Best Louisiana seafood & price (about $2-5 less than other places).  Everyone having a good time and enjoying the food.  The bad, only 12 bar seats directly inside the casino floor (it's really 10 feet from a slot machine).  The worst: only 1 cook & 1 waitress.  Small place can't take more workers.  Service is slooooowwww even at 5PM Friday.  The line of 8 people infront of us took an hour.  It's worth it but at least have an area for the wait line to form.  Don't go after 6PM or with more than 3 people.

rkwAlc5oKY2hoyZHXW0q_g.text: Horrible customer service, rude chief and waited 1 hour for a water. They then called security on me when I asked about the water and how we get seated. I will never go there again, I waited another 30 min for over priced and dry seafood

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That was the rude chief.

duROidpiJA8z-HjgGgIYAg.text: Amazing find. Had the bouillabaisse and it was full of buttery, delicious shellfish. Staff is fun, lighthearted and attentive. Chef Ricardo kept us laughing. Couldn't ask for a better experience.

DPNb4WxHJ_fcSCakPb1Dnw.text: We were @ this restaurant last night. At least we tried to be. This is a 1st come 1st serve establishment. Which is not bad. But what is bad you must stand in line on your feet waiting until a chair at the bar is available. They don't care whether or not this is un comfortable, or not compliant with the needs of the Handicap public. This is disgusting. Arrogance is not funny

NIYnfKm-jwUTcDon15kK5g.text: Waited about an hour in line but it was worth it. Staff very nice and you get to watch them make your food! It was soooooo good!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JYKwvd9URXQuUIBtz6nRPw.text: Great flavors that provide for a unique dining experience. The place is nestled in a little grotto, and water falls down from it. It's awesome. The food always tastes amazing, and if you look over your shoulder, you can actually see them making it! More seating would be ideal, but would give away the VIP feel.

BIj-xQ6rVzSnjQNFITgcfw.text: just be prepared to wait in line, I thought it's well worth it! Been going to this place years ago, back then they're not even 24-7  took my friends there and rarely anyone dislike it

wtMeNh1h5teJEDasom9--w.text: Sad so say goodbye to one of my favorite local spots but the service tonight has ruin this place for me completely. We planned to come here later in the night because there is always a long wait (food is usually worth it) and we had a friend visiting from Japan so we wanted her to experience the great food without a super long wait. . But we still waited an hour and a half for a group of five only to be greeted with the worst human beings who hate their job/lives to be working that late. They stamped us all out to be drunk people when we sat down because we were all excited to sit down and enjoy some good food.  We were talking amongst ourselves on what to order and what everyone is getting and the server interrupts us and says she can't here her other customers (which we three drunk guys who sat themselves) because my Japanese friend is yelling gibberish.... (Japanese not gibberish and she was only talking to me who was sitting right next to her) they continue to ignore her and I have to order her food for her. Though-out the meal both two women servers give dirty looks to us and my Japanese friend. She felt so uncomfortable that I had to flag one of them down for the check which I was met with an eye roll from the neck tattooed waitress. Really regretting tipping them at all. Only reason I did was because we are all industry Vegas locals and I get we have bad days sometimes But the black waitress and the neck tattoo waitress has ruined palace station for me for good. Never going to this casino again.  Don't go when these two waitresses are working. Food is good but horrible service.

u551KWElJbcKmrUAComvuw.text: My friends and I went to town at this place.  We had to wait approximately 45 minutes due to the limited seating here (14 seats?) and due to arriving at a busy time.  There's only 1 chef and 1 helper at this place so don't expect your food to arrive like a fast food joint.  What's cool about the Oyster bar is that you can watch the chef add all the ingredients to the 6 cauldrons and 2 gigantic pots.  The 6 cauldrons are used to make the soup while 1 of the big pots is filled with fish stock and the other is for boiling the shellfish.  Here's what I ordered (all were excellent by the way):  * 1 dozen raw half-shell oysters: The chef schucked the oysters in front of us.  Looks easy when he does it.  I prefer squeezing the lemon and drizzle some cocktail sauce over them.  Taste great. * 1/2 dozen raw half-shell clams: Similar to the oysters but with a different texture.  I prefer the oysters though. * Palace Pan Roast: Combination of shrimp, lobster, crab, clams.  Tomato paste base with white rice.  Can feed 1 or 2 hungry souls.  Did I mention it's loaded with flavor. * Oyster Shooters with Vodka: With the cocktail sauce, you won't taste the alcohol or the sea-taste from the oyster.  Order 3 for a better deal.

-wrgU1CCo3caFmE-UwBqFw.text: If I could give more than 5 stars I would.  This place is AWESOME.  I recommend the Pan Roast, Etouffee, Boulibasse, and Alaskan Chowder.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy

fR9iEXBtMhYOVp5EOHZXpQ.text: I've made my way over to the Palace Station the last couple times I've been in Vegas to indulge at Oyster Bar. The combo pan roast is phenomenal and comes with a scoop of rice, which creates a perfect harmony with the roast. Think creamy seafood bisque. They ask you for a spice rating of 1-10 and I've gone with 4 as I like my roast on the milder side. There are only 18 seats at the bar, so I've heard that the wait can get pretty ridiculous (~2-3 hours), but if you head over at off meal times, it's not too bad (~30 mins). Again, I don't think the servers or cooks are rushing to get seats turned over, so that can add to the wait time. You can pay $5 (sharing fee) to split a pan roast with a friend if you don't think you can handle the serving portion.   Overall, a unique experience highlighted by the chefs preparing the pan roasts/gumbo in front of you at the bar.

lJfpjkyfTb_AEntLAWdyEw.text: Absolutely delightful experience!! The chef was a rockstar and you can tell that he has been doing this for some time. The line is a pain but totally worth the wait. I went with two friends - one had the house pan roast, the other had the etouffee and I had the cioppino. We also split a dozen oysters, which were simply awesome! The entrees were perfectly seasoned, piping hot and just plain delicious! The portions are huge so we ended up taking plenty of left overs for the next day. Apparently their slowest time is around 9am, otherwise expect a wait. Honestly, I'll wait in that line every time I come to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cioppino

F6eqIfUwoBZ9D3vz7mdbtw.text: Diasappointed. Not sure why all the hype. The food was mediocore.  We had the combo pan roast and the flavor was just ok. Not as flavorful as I expected.    A huge let down was it only serves 21 yrs and older. We weren't able to eat our food there so we had to order it togo and ate it at Johnnys Rocket in the same hotel.  Dont come here if you have kids.  It will ruin your whole experience. For sure we wont be back here.  We enjoyed food at The Broiler way better.

-sExQu9WbwV0iqrbWxZ9kg.text: There were six people in front of me in line at 1am on a Thursday morning. I waited two hours to get a seat, and another hour to get my food.  The Pan Roast was amazing! So much flavor with every bite.  Is it worth the wait? Kinda... I don't think its worth a three hour wait. But, I would wait a hour for it.

4uvumRmYkPhgfj2fYKdjCg.text: What a fun and unique experience! I've been coming to Las Vegas for YEARS and this was my first time here. I love new finds in Sin City. Thanks, Yelp!  We went on a Tuesday night, 7:30 PM. Parking was easy and free in the lot outside. There were only 4 people ahead of us in line. We waited about 45 minutes. Once seated, you wait another 30-45 minutes (because there are only 6 special cooking pan thing-a-ma-bobs). The pan roasts are what you need to try/order. The name is deceiving because I don't think they're really "roasts". They are more like stews. There is one cook who does it all and one guy who is the server (takes your order, serves drinks). The pan roasts are essentially garlic, butter, your protein (lobster, crab, shrimp, chicken) and a creamy, tomato soup/base. The smell is divine. You get rice on the side but you can also choose linguini noodles.   No Coke products....only Pepsi. Boo...

3Ue68141MwdG6YU8bMiREg.text: Who knew this place existed? I was a bit skeptical at first, and I really didn't expect much from this random little oyster hut in an off-strip casino... some friends recommended it, and raved about the pan roast, so I had to try it for myself. Now I'm the one recommending this place!  I was confused when we got there and weren't greeted or seated; I definitely stood there for about 5 minutes.  After that, my boyfriend and I just decided to go ahead and seat ourselves.  Whatta ya know?! It was like the invisible wall was broken down and we were now visible.  So I guess if there isn't a line and you see empty seats, help yourself!   I'm not a fan of seafood, so I ordered the chicken gumbo.  It was such a big bowl of gumbo! I definitely had leftovers.  I liked that it had a lot of chicken and okra and wasn't too salty.  I really enjoyed it.  My boyfriend ordered the shrimp pan roast .  Omg.. Now, I said I wasn't one for seafood, but wow. This stuff tasted amazing! It definitely stole the show! I loved it with rice, but i found myself dipping my bread into it throughout the meal. For some reason, it reminded me of cheesy pasta sauce and it was glorious.   We've gone back and ordered the combo pan roast, but it was a bit of a seafood overload.  We read that the lines can get pretty long, so we went mid-afternoon (like we did the first time) and there wasn't much of a wait. There's also a fee for sharing! The portion easily feeds two people, though.  And you can ask for another dinner roll if you want to soak up every last drop of deliciousness!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pan roast!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster shooter! 3 for $10 or one for $4
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp pan roast :)

nIZFCyMJ7iyze9YVuq5TOw.text: Hands down one of the places you have to try in Las Vegas. The pan roast is rich, savory and delicious and you just can get it anywhere else. Don't forget to order an order of oysters on the shell. The wait can be long as there are only 15 bar seats.   Be warned though you must be 21 to sit there or security might ask you to leave.

sucywCPx5rXnRVNoYfIVjA.text: I've been hearing about this place, I finally decided to go check it out. I was looking for this restaurant in the casino ... Walking back and forth and I just couldn't find it. Then I realize omg, it's not a full type restaurant.. It's like a small little bar area in the middle if the casino! There's limited seats ( maybe like 15?), hence the long waiting wait.   I have tried their raw oysters (nothing too special) and their Pan Roast. And wow the pan roast is so yum!! Its like a big plate of delicious sauce and meats paired with rice. It's big enough to share with my bf!   And the fun part about this place, you're  like sitting at a bar waiting for your food and u get to watch the chef make everyone's food in front of u! He's super friendly and talks to everyone while cooking away. Pretty cool place.   It's a bit pricey but I'm for sure coming back, definitely worth the stop and wait!  Can't wait to try their Gumbo and Clam Chowder next time!  Did I mention, this place is 24 hrs? Yup,u can come check out this place super late at night after partying it up in Vegas or come here super early while you're taking a gambling break or pretty much anytime u want! I say that's pretty awesome!

VEp5Sy5u-cNk-kkHE9NuHA.text: best restaurant in las vegas. will eat here any day. any time. so good i had to make this review in all caps. would pick this as my last meal. ricardo is the best.

DbylIv2eSIqJ-xlkXd6yjg.text: Pan roasts, gumbo, and oysters, oh my! Lots to choose from at the Oyster Bar! We ate the Combo pan roast and the Alaskan chowder. Great flavor in both, loaded with seafood. We could not finish these dishes as they were too big! One star off for the wait- one and a half hours we waited. This little bar is getting all the attention and the steak house restaurant next door was empty. Maybe they need to move the oyster bar into that!

P100awvlLau1TsFlm7XK-A.text: KICK ASS SHELLFISH...pinot noir was dry...which was good when taking oyster shots....i forget what else i had cus i was pretty drunk when i got there but from what i can remember it was some kind of stew that came with rice and the spice meter was set on 11?!?..but that didnt matter cus it TASTED SO GOOD and it was my first time ever going to vegas which made it the very first time i ate here with my friend and his dad which was pretty funny cus he passed out drunk at the bar....oh, the oyster bar is literally a bar in the casino so if you really despise the odor of cigarette smoke with your food then try eating somewhere else.....and casual small talk with strangers is encouraged when you eat here....so dont be some anti-social nut case...

Hj9012bMdLBY3ISD3MS2kw.text: my sister mentioned this place to me a few years back and said it is one of the top places to eat in vegas. although i can't say it is in my top 10 (vegas has so many good restaurants), i will definitely come back. i went there for dinner on a wed night, i was afraid the line would be ridiculously long like the reviews say, but our group (party of 2) was second in line. we waited for about 10 minutes and skipped the group of 4 in front of us. TIP:go with a small group since there is only bar seating.  the staff was friendly, there was only 2 people working so service was real slow. we ordered dozen oysters, combo pan roast, and linguine with clams. the oysters were ok, i thought it would be really good since its named "oyster bar", linguine and clams was above average (you can't really go wrong with linguine clams). i think the best and most popular one was the combo pan roast, it was so tasty you have to try it.  the food took about 20 minutes to come out but we were entertained by them cooking in front of us, we ate all our food in about 30 minutes and then it took another 30 minutes for them to get our check and give us boxes for leftovers. this seems like a fast place to eat but it can take a while, when we left there was a line with a 45-60 min wait.  i give this place 4 stars because of the good food and friendly staff, minus 1 star for slow service and being at palace station casino (away from strip)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

prH9kLngJiJwhggVetXuqA.text: This place may be in a "ghetto" hotel and look cheap at first sight but this place serves some of the best seafood in Vegas.  If you blink you might walk right by this place.  It looks like a standard casino bar with people sitting at the counter.  Upon closer inspection you'll see the steam cookers cooking away directly behind the counter.  These steam cookers cook by steam, not by flame or heating element and they cook fast.  The seafood pan roast is excellent but beware what spice level you choose.    I've seen a level 5 (out of 10) prove to spicy for many spice lovers.  The oysters here are fresh and out of this world.  Not fishy and the perfect size, not too small and not too fat.  They are the sweetest oysters I've tasted anywhere.  I sometimes think there's a conspiracy where they put sugar on them.  If you're a seafood lover check this place out!  Even though it's a hidden gem I'm not afraid to share.

NDerd1Sf20NKFVpYF2g9GQ.text: It literally is an Oyster bar... there are at most 20 seats in the place. The chef is a man of few words, but boy... he can cook amazing seafood. I had fresh oysters and Jambalaya. The oysters are fresh, sweet and quite meaty. The Jambalaya has a lot of seafood in it. I went with a 7 on spice... I will try a 5 next time. It was making me a bit teary eyed, but it was so good. As I was finishing my mean, I saw him cook a "pan roast", even though their portions are huge and I was stuffed. I got hungry again. Whatever they add on that pan roast smells so good. If you sit in the center seats of the bar, the food is being cooked no more then 4 feet in front of you. You will want to eat everything. I would highly recommend coming with several people, ordering several dishes and sharing them family style. There is a $5 split charge if you share a dish between two people... and the dishes are large enough to share between two people. If you order oysters, they seem to wave the split charge... so it may just be one dish per person to avoid the split charge... in any case. You get to see the chef cook your meal right in front of you.

J-cLuuPF42ofum_tQ0jRaA.text: waited an hour and a half, and that's considered a shorter line. well worth the wait, though (limited seating area is why the line is normally long). be nice to the chef(s) & server(s), because your experience will only benefit from it (and it's not like they don't deserve it; most of them are really good at what they do, while being more than personable).

MvisqgFbLRWYnbVciNPYyQ.text: Just a little FYI for all you So Cal folks that go here.... One of the original chefs from this place opened up a place out in Chino Hills called The Boiler: yelp.com/biz/the-boiler-... Not sure about the oysters, but if you guys are looking for the same jambalaya and the gumbo, this is the spot.

l64ENZK_Xy7ySBgPMMGVkw.text: Yeah... What they are saying for the line is True. We went there on a Sunday night around 7pm and still stood an hour in line. But the food is absolutely delicious. Pan roast is great, so as the Alaskan clam chowder soup.

m8eRgjN3B8EUGru1X_hBLQ.text: Went here awhile back with some guys i met at a club the night before.  I normally don't eat raw oysters but one of the guys encouraged me to do so and i did.  Surprisingly, i LOVED IT!  I only eat the smaller ones cuz then the bigger ones are very creamy...yuck.  Had mine with tabasco and lemon...pretty damn good.  I had some of the clam chowder and it was full of clams, not like most places.  The only thing was, i got a few pieces of sand in mine...

ygKS3O1fcdQbEee9BL0lww.text: "Excellent food, cook ricardo was amazing. The server, however was very slow with no initiative. If it wasen't for ricardo we would have walked out. He deserves some type of recognitio, and a raise."

AFTZo0dvNn2gemhBSqJfXw.text: This place is a must if you are visiting Vegas. This place serves healthy portions of authentic gumbo and jambalaya. My favorite is the house gumbo. Cooked right in front of you the chef adds a combination of spices, shrimp, sausage, real crab meat, their secret special soup base, and a scoop of rice. Sooooooooooo goooooooooooooddddddd. Just imagine the bowls they use for an xtra large bowl of Vietnamese noodles, Pho, filled to the rim with mouth watering gumbo.   Be warned, the oyster bar only seats about 15 at a time. So sometimes depending on party size wait time can be pretty long but well worth the wait. Also they will not allow you to order anything to go.

8Njq8lABNdoUA1d4VOwuZA.text: Still really good food. There seems to be more people now going here because the other station Oyster bar is closed for renovation. Still worth the wait. JJ the Master Chef worked his magic and made an exceptional Combo Pan Roast. As always ate it to the last drop. You know a place is good when most of the people you sit next to are locals.

otQ0Yg2gITO1mo-Qn6LKpQ.text: Once past the creepy people and the smell of smoke you get to Oyster Bar. The food though is very good the wait sometimes can be a pain though

PKtCNB8VDJY4P_z5IR92Mg.text: The wife mentioned that she wanted to have some gumbo, so I googled, "best gumbo in las vegas". Oyster Bar at Palace Station came up as the top result. Got there about 9:30pm, but didn't get seated until after 10:30pm. This place is small, (I think it only seats about 15 or so people). Long wait, old smokey casino - what better way to spend your time after a long day at work ;) After finally getting seated, I ordered the Etouffee with a spicy level of 8. Wife got the gumbo. They cook everything in front of you, (by the way, the Filipino cook kinda resembled Deuce Bigalow).  I'm glad I waited because that stuff was off the hook! It was a huge bowl, with a scoop of rice. I managed to inhale the whole thing in about 15 minutes. It was at that time that my wife noticed me eying her gumbo and immediately pulled her bowl away from me - i wanted to finish that one off too! The servers are nice and friendly. The only thing I regret not doing is getting another order to go. My wife couldn't finish hers and took it to go. Unfortunately for her, she woke up late the next morning, and the gumbo was calling my name! I think I'll be going here at least once a month. For those of you who want your kids to experience the food here - too bad, gotta be at least 21 to sit at the bar. Get 'em an order to go.

aJnrWp-1mlVj5ISt4PPafQ.text: Oyster Bar is known for their steam kettle cooking and FRESH seafood. Their menu ranges from raw oysters on the half shell to bouillabaisse to jambalaya to clam chowder and gumbo. So while the boyfriend and I were on one of our Vegas trips, we decided to trek off the strip to Palace Station so I can try this famous steam kettle cooking.  Oyster Bar is a very small restaurant. It is literally a bar counter with roughly 10-12 seats. So coming during lunch or dinner hour is probably not a good idea - expect to wait at least 1.5 hours. But being that it is 24 hours and opened 7 days a week, come when everyone else is passed out in their rooms. We went pretty early on weekday, so we got seats right away. Having our mind set on the famous pan roast, we decided to also get the steamed New Zealand mussels as an appetizer. You can't really go wrong with steamed fresh mussels, drenched in a light butter broth that you can literally drink like water. Although I would definitely not mind ordering this again, there are a few other items on their menu that I would like to try.  After devouring the mussels, our pan roast finally came. And man was it worth the 30 minute wait. Pan Roast is fresh seafood sauteed with brandy, cream and tomato. At Oyster Bar, you can order it with shrimp, crab, lobster, or all three. You also pick your spice level, anywhere between 1-10, 10 being the spiciest. We got the combo pan roast at level 7. Served with a huge scoop of rice in the middle of the bowl, your first bite will keep you coming back for more and more. The sweetness from the tomato mixed in with the savory spices creates an ultimate foodgasm in your mouth. It's ridiculous. You get this vibrant flavor, on top of fresh pieces of crab, lobster, and shrimp. The texture and the taste combination that comes in a single bite is amazing. I'm salivating just talking about this meal!  Although a bit on the pricier side, the portions are pretty big. My boyfriend and I ordered the mussels and the pan roast and were pretty stuff. But I wanted more! I had to say no because I knew there are not that many bathroom stops on the 5-hour drive home. Service was good - nothing I can really complain about. The wait is just long, because you have one chef cooking 12 orders in about 6 kettles so it's torture. I think I would drive out to Vegas for a day or two just so I can eat here. It is that good, but gas is too pricey and the sportsbook likes to steal my money, so I'll just have to wait a few months until I am reunited with Mr. Oyster Bar :) There are SO many places to eat in Sin City, but I HIGHLY RECOMMEND you come to Oyster Bar @ Palace Station.

2p2Iam0btVSuNRuKLramrA.text: I love, love, love this place! The restaurant is located in the old Palace Station. The name said it all for this place. It's just a bar with about 10 seats. I've read a lot of reviews that said the wait was long. Luckily for my boyfriend and I, we did not have to wait and were seated right away. The restaurant is very casual and the service is casual as well. I don't mind it since the food was extremely delicious. We ordered a dozen oysters and the Pan Roast. The oyster were really fresh and the dipping sauce was delicious too. The Pan Roast, on the other hand, was so delicious. It was one of the highlight point of the entire trip there. Writing this review makes me feel hungry for the Pan Roast. It's that good! I will definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas!

4DD6lZXp1fF--REDDmkR_A.text: The best combo pan roast, ever!  Delicious oysters, great clam chowder, and the chefs are all great.  Worth the hour or more wait, try to avoid going at 5pm when the chefs are switching out, the wait can get longer.  There are oysters bars in the other Station Casinos but this tiny barstool venue is the place I go to when I crave the spicy, creamy goodness that is the pan roast.

NGcocK3Ig7wtVJdhsA54NA.text: This place is as good as it gets. Yes my darling hubby and I waited for about 45min in line, yes, the waitress Dolores, is a nutty buddy lol, yes they see everyone in the line and have no remorse, lol, and yes no body who knows better ever dare, show a sign of annoyance or discontentment at the arrangements, why?! Because it's soup Nazi like on Seinfeld!! The food is so remarkably ridiculously good, you must listen to the rules and be happy with the delicious food your are consuming. Bouillabaisse, gumbo, fresh oysters, amazing bread rolls even! This place is heaven and I mean it. I mean heaven for sure!!! It's worth all the wait time, and every dime. You will love it!!! Just respect the arrangement, say nothing, and you will get food that surpasses the word, " FOOD!" oh and gigantic portions.

shdD8kyeFFlxcwyMiR-5HQ.text: gumbo and seafood with a lil southern twist...its the bomb  one night late night or even every night... youll taste it and want more.  24 hrs and great for all occasions ... even the dreaded first date  yaeh its a must stop when in sin city

RmLIhnBgocF-5qQl4U_h6Q.text: This is one of my all time favorite place to eat.  Oysters and Bouillabaisse with noodle on the side is one of the best meal I ever had.  All the dishes here are fantastic. I don't have anything negative to say about this place beside it is usually an hour or longer wait to be seated.

wuzrZOMhx9qnj9b8zfIydw.text: I've lived in Vegas most of my life, and I don't even know why I've only been here once. I tried it for the first time about a week ago after a  night of drinking. Man, it effing hit the spot.   Like most of the other reviews say, there was a bit of a wait. We arrived about 230 or 3 ish, and still had to wait to sit - and then about another half hour wait to get our food. Worth it? Definitely. I probably wouldn't try and go during 'normal' hours, because I can't even imagine waiting that long. Going so late was perfect for us.  Get the pan roast, for sure. We got the palace pan roast and the combo roast. I preferred the combo which had lobster, shrimp, and crab - as opposed to the palace which had chicken in addition to the other things listed - as well as some other stuff, I think ! It's pretty cool, because you can watch them cook your food. Kind of bad I guess, you start drooling over all the deliciousness. And sometimes you get really hopeful that the food they are cooking is yours - but sadly, it isn't. Be patient - super worth it.   Service was great too. Hollowman single-handedly made the experience. He was so friendly. You can tell he cares about what he's cooking. I would go back just for him.   Great, great, great. I regret not having ever been there before. Definitely will be a regular at this place.

4eiybD1HBjXDiUwmzqYtZA.text: Long SLOW moving line (45 minute to an hour +) but hell, at least you can drink, socialize, and make new friends in line. And yes, Awesome chow (pan roast and on the half shell recommend) once seated. Patience is key here, but once served you can look at the damn long line and finally feel special;)

NIQvpdK7U78qN2dx9noNIA.text: Only get the pan roast.  This was my second time here and I tried the gumbo which was okay but not even close to the pan roast.  Service was friendly and very nice.  Worth the wait. Will try the clam chowder next time I go.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pz2R8WwlVZDY5CRFN7V-IQ.text: I ate here with my husband on a super hot night, so maybe I just did not find soupy hot red broth exciting.  The Chef was amazing and offered us a cool new view on how to prepare soup.  Otherwise, there was nothing exciting about our dinner.  It was a hot bowl of tomato soup with seafood and quite underseasoned if you ask me.    Sorry Yelp but I just did not get this place nor the high reviews.   Maybe I missed something.

kmqsjrpIhSOsMNP939rPqQ.text: Yes, all of the above and below reviews say it all - this place is mind-blowing! For you savory and spicy seafood seekers here is your haven.    The Food- Choose from fresh oysters on a half shell that are so fresh and briny that you might just need to check yourself and step out of the Palace Station looking for the ocean.  Start with these then definitely choose from the pan roast or jambalaya. You can indicate your heat level from 1-10 so go for it.  If you don't like slimy okra you might want to ask them to remove it but it does add a bit of an earthy flavor.  I also recommend you ask for the rice on the side so it doesn't get lost in the thick delicious tomato-cream base of the pan roast or the thick Cajun creole spiced base.   The Ambiance - casual and unpretentious. If you get the Maya Rudolph look-a-like server you be sure to be entertained (tip graciously she has baby #4 on the way). Despite what others have said about showing up on off-hours to grab a seat, this is all False. There is no optimal time. Come on people in 20 years this place has had almost every seat filled 24 hours round the clock so it's basically luck if you don't have to wait an hour or two. Be prepared and have a small meal a few hours in advance so you can truly enjoy your experience.  M

2DrY00yJhUPMskSJ4KRZGA.text: Hands down the BEST OYSTER BAR IN LAS VEGAS. If this place is the first oyster bar you try in Vegas I feel like other oyster bars were very disappointing.. That's how good this oyster bar is. Yeah, intense right?  The only thing that is really unfortunate is the waiting.. But it makes you want it more! I definitely do not recommend going with a large group. I say four people the most. The wait is sooooo worth it at the end I can guarantee that.  I crave their food every time I think about their delicious pan roast, oysters, and clam chowder. (Like I am right now) I've tried other things but those items that I just listed are my absolute favorite. With the pan roast I ask for the rice on the side.   Customer service is good.

jkqLue4hpKMlsCikHceKmw.text: :( I wish this place is bigger...I have to go there in odd hours to get a seat....The concept is not for everyone because you will expect to wait for a minimum an 1 hr. If you are patient, it will be a one of the best things that happens during your Vegas trip

LEoG6pyOLfIBpYPfK7K4Qw.text: There's only about 18 seats at the Oyster Bar, so come early unless you want to wait for a seat to open up.  Not that waiting is an issue with Oyster Bar...waiting is just a necessary prelude for a dynamic finale, namely the food.  Any wait time for good food is excusable.  It's better to wait for good food for an hour or two then to eat at an establishment that serves mediocrity.  My brother found this place on Yelp.  I really want to thank my brother and all the Yelpers that submitted honest reviews of this place to make us come here.  The food is simply...amazing!  Thanks everybody!  I really want to keep this place hush hush but seems like I'm too late, the word has already spread around Yelp that Oyster Bar is the real deal.  Surprise, surprise, we sat next to some Yelpers and people who came because of the Yelp reviews of Oyster Bar, today, during lunch.  It's a small world after all...  First off, do yourself a favor and order the reasonably priced Fanny Bay oysters for $16.99.  It's hard to see that price for Fanny Bay anywhere else.  Secondly, as you're waiting for whatever delicious entree you ordered, munch on that awesome bread they gave you.  Ask for more bread for later to dip on your Palace Pan Roast ($22.99).  They offer you a heat level of 1 through 10.  Don't go showing off now!  A 7 is pretty hot already.  The cook and waiter told us stories of many people who couldn't handle a 10.  Don't be that guy!  We also had the Seafood Jambalaya ($23.99) at a level 6.  Just enough heat without losing the overall flavor.  In a nutshell, the food here is awesome, especially the Palace Pan Roast.  Most people usually lose when going to Las Vegas, don't you lose out by not coming to Oyster Bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Oyster Bar
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ah! Shucks!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace Pan Roast

eu4I0ileuvKjf4HBP4ccNg.text: Best Pan Roast Ever!!! I can stress enough how Awsome this place is, Thanks to my bro & his friends that kept telling me about this place if I ever visit Vegas. I now find myself telling my peeps about this place! I ALWAYS stop here before I head back home to Cali. This Is THE place to eat if you ever have a hangover, cold or simply just craving seafood and with a nice tall glass of beer?! It's the best! And Yes, the place only sits about 16 people so expect to wait awhile if you plan to eat here. Cause one time I got there around 9am Sunday and luckily my husband and I sat right a way, but not even 15 minutes after there was a line forming of at least 20+ peeps already waiting. I love spicy food so remember they scale in how spicy you want your food. I always get a 6, but I'm gonna try the 7 next time.

2Go50HlfGWNplww_3MiyGg.text: Easily one of my favorite meals to have anywhere.. Oysters, and a Pan Roast(spicy) with a few beers. Only negative is the wait but for the quality of food, totally understood and expected.

JFyRETlJ0zgUlVr5CkgOHg.text: This meal changed my life. I have never had so many different flavors and textures on my tongue at once entertaining all of my taste buds making me blush with excitement. This dish is sexy. Definitely not just a Wham Bam sexy either. She's smooth, bold and hot!!!   I ordered the Combo Pan Roast at a Level 10 for spice and the heat from the Habanero complimented the richness of the bisque. I savored each and every bite while trying to detect the ingredients that make it so incredibly flavorful. Is it Brandy or White Wine in the sauce? Who cares, I am so sold and chalking this down in my list for Top 5 Favorite Meals of All Time.   Yes, there was a wait and yes, I will wait again! The service and the dish were on point. I was left feeling completely satisfied and yet, the memory lingers in my mind......... Oh yes, we will meet again.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

s83y2Nh5NtT5qh_HjWZI9Q.text: Worthy of the hype! The Pan Roast was wonderful and filled me up! It was filled to the brim with nice hearty chunks of seafood as well. It was good to see that they don't skimp on their portions. Also, the chef and server that manned the bar were super cool! Despite the fact that both of them were obviously working hard and constantly moving every single minute they were still having wonderful, pleasant conversation with the patrons of the bar. They would make jokes with one another and everything. They seem to remember quite a few people as well, they would constantly wave at multiple patrons passing by and some would come by and shoot the breeze with them. Some would joke around and they'd heckle one another. Seeing this kind of stuff is refreshing to me, as this world seems to be getting more and more impersonal by each passing day. These people clearly make an effort to remember their clientele.   Basically, once you're in the bar, things are absolutely amazing. It's the getting to the bar part that's the issue. This place isn't like other Oyster Bars; where you have the option of either sitting on the bar or one of multiple tables inside a mini-restaurant. The Oyster Bar at Palace Station is LITERALLY JUST A BAR. They could probably sit 18-25 people max. Remember, this place has AMAZING food and EXEMPLARY service, you combine that with the very small occupancy, and you get LONG ASS WAITS. I went there at 11:45 PM on a lazy, uneventful Sunday evening. I wasn't seated until 1:00 AM. I don't want to know how long the wait is on an 6:00 PM on a Friday. To top things off, the cell phone coverage sucks on the area where the line is, so I couldn't even goof around on the Internet on my phone. Also, with the very limited seating; it becomes more and more cumbersome when you're coming in with multiple friends. You'll probably want to come in with just one or two extra friends. Anymore than that, your wait will become more excruciating, as you'll be waiting for more seats to open up.   I will say that The Oyster Bat being so small adds a nice layer of intimacy to the experience, but ultimately it does more harm than good. Coming here means you have to devote a chunk of your day to simply waiting in line. And forget about bringing multiple people with you too. If your group becomes too large I'm sure they'll have to put in smaller groups of people who came in after you just so the lines not being completely help up.   WONDERFUL FOOD WITH A WONDERFUL STAFF otherwise. That wait in line is a hindrance though, and is the one thing that keeps this place from being absolutely perfect.

Du10edGCvdtXF-hTFepGpA.text: Can't go wrong with either the Palace Pan roast or Combo Pan Roast. Food is of the highest quality and worth your time and money. Must eat here if your in the Vegas area!

WxaRbCzpP2p7J29yxdvQew.text: Over all good place to eat. Luckily we didn't have to wait in line but we still waited 40 minutes for our food so I couldn't give 5 stars  Oysters were very good but too big. So made me full.   I ordered crab pan roast was very good. Great portions lots of meat.   Jambalaya was good lots of meat and great portion.   I would come again but not if there is a long line.

TA-ohXAtO51sMMctdbDYeQ.text: Good food, friendly banter - what's not to like?  The place is tiny and sometimes the wait could be long, but it's one of the few restaurants in Vegas that would survive in other cities.    You sit at the bar with like 20 seats total.  The food is freshly prepared before your eyes.  The crowd is a pretty interesting, I saw one women take a nap in the middle of her meal.    I tried the lobster pan roast, house gumbo, oysters, and clams.  Everything was pretty darn good and portions are very generous - so be careful not to over order like we did ! .

o_AAGdsLd8R9iuxQ_Jv60Q.text: Wow! First time trying their pan roast!! I am sure of it that this will be a hot spot every time we are in town!! You can choose your spice level! Rice or no rice... In the bowl or on the side!! Yum yum yum! Clam chowder was great and the cesar salad was good too! Must return!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NlO9tnclaObQEWfyG-1zog.text: I've been to Oyster Bar for many years now. Everytime we are in Vegas, this is a must go. Although the line is really long, it's worth the wait.  My favorites:  Bouillabaisse and Gumbo =)

R8DPBEvQUR5WXWNphfzslg.text: This place is solid!! I've been to many Oyster bars around town and none of them come close to the Palace Stations oyster bar. It's definitely worth the wait. I would highly recommend the combination pan roast if it's your first time. Also, they have the gold band oyster which are really big and always fresh. Be sure to check this place out!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gold band oysters

zsb2lbCHgf2MRHtll4LFRQ.text: Delish!! wait is long but worth, Everything is so good.  I love it

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So delish...

qqZu5ydVzoLGaeOMdeZUDA.text: This is probably my best gumbo joint. But be aware there is long wait for seat. That's the only down side. I have waited two hours to get a seat. But the food was good. Go early !!

7y7uMjg0vE9Pcclb_8wuow.text: We tried this place a couple of times before. It's been more than 4 years and we haven't been back since, though not for lack of trying. The food is very good even if somewhat overpriced. The problem is the waiting in line, and there always seems to be a long line no matter when we go. Recent reviews show that things haven't changed. Don't feel like standing in line in the middle of a smoke filled casino floor while waiting for food. I don't know, maybe they can implement a buzzer system so people can wander off while waiting? On a day like today when I'm feeling some clam chowder, it sure would be nice to have the Oyster Bar as an option, but once again, we are discourgaed by a potential long wait in line.

oiUHjmaEwX60ix62tLYlyA.text: A local who lived in the area had told me of a magical place off the strip. From the freeway, you can see the large neon sign glowing in the distance. As you chug forward, you are greeted at the entrance of the palace station. Trains adorn the facade of the building, giving off a rustic old casino feel.  As you make your way through the smoke and haze, you find a little bar that radiates with happiness and glows like a diamond in the rough. The delicious scents of pan roast fill the air, and you can almost taste it...  But then you see the dreary line... You can see the  impatience and hunger, building and growing the farther you go down the queue. It's unfortunate that the bar can only seat about 16 people at a time, but human are resilient beings, and they are willing to wait for hours to have a taste of that silky tomato based pan roast!  It's a seafood lovers dream, the base is thick, but smooth. You can set the level in which you want to feel the spicy burn inflict your tongue from one to ten. The flavors are rich and full, they are quite generous in the portions, and require a $5 plate fee if you are considering sharing the dish.  The wait staff and cook all have a very nonchalant attitude, to give the customers a little punch in the face. Then you forgive them for their crassness because the food was so good.  You must try The Oyster Bar, when you are in the area, I just hope that you won't have to wait for more than an hour!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All the servers are cray!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They cook right in front of you!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters!

05-cY0w-iFy0TQMrUXIzgQ.text: I finally decided to try this place. Out. I went on a Sunday night at 11:30pm. We waited about  an hour an a half for 4 people. While waiting you can see and smell the food which was driving me crazy! I though it was insane to wait so long to eat some seafood but it was all worth it!! The chef and the ladies working there are really nice and friendly. I order the pan roast combo my husband ordered the  bouill roast.  Spicy level- I got a 3 and it was perfect. My husband got a 7 and he said it was fine for him but I was not able to eat it, too spicy for me.  You get to see the chef prepare the food right there at the bar.  Oh my god! My food was delicious! A bowl of happiness!! Shrimp, lobster, crab in an amazing sauce with rice on the side.  My husband loves his as well! He drank some of the soup and can't stop saying how good it taste. His had clams, mussel, shrimp, crab and fish in a soup with a side of rice. I think it had more stuff in it but I can't remember what else.  Anyways you must try this place out!! It is worth the wait.  No one under 21 is allowed so don't bring your kids.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rouille roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast combo

PdDc85V7MxzI6lwEVUVIPA.text: We came down around 4 am to this amazing gem. It's open 24 hours which is really cool! It's right off the strip so if you're visiting, it's easy to get to! It's located in the Palace Station!   We sat ourselves and were greeted by Derek and Steve. Both are so welcoming and nice! They're both fun to talk to and you can tell they love their jobs! They made the experience even better!   We got our drinks and ordered the New England clam chowder bowl for $8.99. They have a cup which is 5.99! They were nice enough to put them in small bowls so the man and I could evenly split it. Of course with those crackers that make the chowder so good! It was so good! Perfectly seasoned as well. We got one plate of the panroast. We got one since we knew that we couldn't finish all of it last time. Huge portioning sizes! The panroast is the thing we come here for. I refuse to get it any where else. It's so delicious! It's a $20 plate but worth every bit of it! Best part is you get to watch Derek make his magic! We don't like rice too much so always get it with linguine instead. It's not extra for it either! You get to pick the spice level as well.   There's one in most (if not all) station casinos, but this is my favorite location! I highly recommend coming here!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panroast is my favorite thing here!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New England clam chowder!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp panroast!

MKz3TOAAxHdiprzBttl6_w.text: The pan roast is amazing! They can accommodate to spice level as well on a 1-10 scale

qlM9tdqwrsRwO1xO39KsQg.text: So this oyster bar is super popular during the holidays. Waited for 2.5 hrs to be seated for 4 people. When we finally got seated the waiter Steve was super nice! He joked with my family and I and gave us really good service.   We ordered a dozen oysters for starters. I saw Steve prepare the oysters and he was so fast in shucking them. So after about 5 mins we got our oysters. They tasted so fresh and good! For a dozen is cost $20. But it's so worth it! If you go between 1am - 9am it's like $10 for half dozen which is pretty good too because regular half dozen price is $13.99. The oysters were so fresh and believe me when I say that because once you eat the first one you can tell how fresh they are.   We had also ordered the claim chowder soups. OMGosh! They add so much claims in it! It's like the best! You can get a big (and I mean BIG) bowl for $8.99. Such a great deal with lots of claims. Tasted so good and not salty.   For the entrees, we orders the cioppino, gumbo, seafood jambalaya, and the etouffee. I thought it was so neat and interesting how they used the steamers on the counter to cook our food! It was so fun to watch it. I ate the house gumbo and it was so yummy~~ it was A LOT for the price of 23.99. So worth it because I couldn't even finish it! I love how this place gives big portions. My dad thought for the price and wait, this place wasn't that worth it but I think it's good. Maybe this weekend they didn't make it as great as they usually would have because of so much people waiting. The line got longer even after we sat down. But overall experience I thought it was worth it. It's better to share instead of ordering for yourself because the portions are big. My main point of coming here was for the oysters and they were GREAT ^_^

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A great try!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 18 seats only at the oyster bar

8fgpvTc0KnjXT15rPwJTNQ.text: The food was incredible.  Had the shrimp pan roast,  1/2 dozen oysters and clam chowder.  Next time I will get a 3 in heat spice. Nora and Bob are great, funny and attentive.  Their wine pours are great by the way.

y4LQpx_JABvA0gJfAvovOw.text: Soooo I checked this place out for the first time yesterday. We waited in line about 2 hours due to very limited seating (its actually a bar). The food was good but I wouldn't wait in line 2 hours again to eat here. Not sure what the hype is about. I had the Veasar sald and Claim closer as an appetizer and the Jambalaya as my entree. I actually enjoyed the soup and salad more than the Jambalaya. I would eat here again but I would not wait in a line for 2 hours again.;With that being said if I happen to be at Palace Station and the line here isn't long I may stop and eat but would never wait in a 2 hour line again wasn't worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jambalaya (spice level 2) it was ok Great flavor, love the presentation

tIDSAfMNC0hAxWyiwpvuQg.text: This little gem of a spot is located inside of the Palace Station Casino.  They take care & attention to the quality of their Creole cuisine.  There are only about 20 seats at the bar for eating so plan accordingly as the wait in line is consistent.   I had the House Gumbo (Crab, Lobster & Shrimp) and it was great.  I have eaten at the Sunset Station Casino location before but this was my first time at this one.  I like them both and will be back sooner than later.  Rio

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Gumbo was on the money...of course I had it spicy...9 out of 10 being the hottest.  Crab, Lobster &amp; Shrimp were the perfect trifecta.

zyiq0VcscjPYAsBtULIoIA.text: Ok so I'm pretty impatient.. And the thought of waiting, standing, in a line to try a new meal was NOT appealing. I am glad I didn't let my impatience get the better of me.  This place is great. The pan roasts are fricking  K I L L E R!! The oysters were fresh and huge and the etouffee was perfection.  The only reason this place didn't get a full five starts was due to the hour + wait time standing up . Hopefully it's just the time of night I went because I have to have more of this!
