7q5tNq5SdwPhNI-trzj6CA.text: The only spot I go to every time I am in Las Vegas - the very best of the best - open 24/7 - really does not get any better than that.

X2jJ35bBMze9yoAsjjBqcQ.text: 5/26/17 for lunch... about 1 hour wait at 1130am.. doz oysters, doz cherrystone clams were so fresh... cioppino spice level 8 waa really spicey but so good.. Chef and servers are so good as its one of the busiest place to get fresh oysters with limited seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2nd order
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cioppino spice level 8
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1st order cherrystone and oysters

LjPuvBjXFGeibpa09cUfSQ.text: When people are willing to wait for upwards of 1 1/2 hours to eat a bowl of seafood, you know this place has something good going on.   I wish people didn't like this place as much and would stop spreading the word, but I have nothing better to do as I stand and wait myself...so here goes my rant:  1. Food is amazing 2. Yes, it is worth it. 3. Do not send one person to wait in line for a party of ten because all the people behind your big party will give you the eye as you eat and make you feel incredibly uncomfortable...as they should. It is not smart, it is RUDE!!!!!...to create the illusion that the line is shorter than it actually is.  If your friends/fam don't want to wait in line, they don't deserve to eat.  PERIOD.  4. Do not sit in your seat for 30 minutes after you have finished eating your meal.  There's only 10 seats.  Get up and chit chat somewhere else so all the hungry monsters who have been waiting for over an hour can eat. It's called COURTESY. Seriously.  Everyone still waiting in line hates you. 5.  The food is amazing. 6.  Yes, it is worth it.  You will leave fulfilled, but angry at the world that people are rude and lack common courtesy. That is my public service announcement. Enjoy some damn good pan roast - the best you will EVER have.

OzypOulbGb75OBAvI7LSJQ.text: Hard to say much that hasn't already been said about this place. As a native Floridian I'm very picky about seafood and wondered if they were a little overrated. Not to worry, their combination (shrimp, crab, and lobster) pan roast was one of the best seafood meals I've ever had. They use a cream/tomato base with some cooking wine and a spice level you pick from 1-10. I went 5 and it had a little kick without overpowering the flavor. The serving is massive and comes with some rice, it's pretty rich and two could easily share a bowl. The gumbo is just as excellent too if you'd rather try that. The meals are about $20-25 each and worth every cent.   I came around 11:30 pm on a Wednesday night and somehow only waited about 25 minutes for a seat. When you wait here you actually stand in line, no putting your name on a list. You could always bring a beach chair maybe if the wait is for hours? The service is really friendly and they cook everything right in front of you so you can watch for the 30 minutes or so it takes them to cook your meal.   This place is about a $20 cab ride from the strip is totally worth checking out.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination Gumbo with shrimp, crab, and lobster
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination Pan Roast with shrimp, crab, and lobster
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sourdough Roll

ZOIolbK1Emvvk_NNDYOg7w.text: Got here at like 3pm on a Friday. 2 hour wait in line, then another 30 min wait for our food.  Jack got the pan roast with lobster and I got the gumbo with crab. Pan roast was delicious. Level 7 was hot for me, level 3 gumbo didn't taste spicy at all. I wasn't a fan of the gumbo. I don't think the gumbo was worth the 2.5 he wait. But I can see how the pan roast is.   Their oysters are also really good. So while you're waiting for your food to be cooked, order some oysters! They have a midnight special on Oysters, like $10 for a dozen between 1am-5am (but don't quote me on that). I guess you have to choose a good time to go!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gumbo with crab

qly6HfaZNiVc0eK5haPl3w.text: Went there this morning to see what all the fuss was about and to me it was ok i don't think i would stand 2 hours to wait for a seat tho.I don't eat raw oysters so i got the combo pan roast which had good flavor but a bit to soupy for me..if i was drunk i probably would've thought it was really good but i wasn't so it was eh...would i go back probably not but it was worth the try..

m-x2iRQrBHI5gcIWNygOGw.text: This has to be the most unorganized restaurant that I've been to in a very long time. Very slow and way understaffed. Only one cook and two waitresses that clearly don't know how to multitask. The food is good but I won't be coming back here for a long time if at all. You can see that the staff doesn't care one way or the other. They definitely have no customer service skills. Very sad

K2bUNEaS3W0x-CY1zpn6Gw.text: I probably go more 3.5 stars. We got here close to 1a.m. and had to wait over an hour.   I got the Palace Pan Roast and got level 4. Whoo.......had quite a bit of kick to it still. Next time....I think a 3 will do. I wasn't blown away by it, but it was good. I think I need more rice next time.  My sister and friend came here before and thought it was better last time. I always thinking your first time is better (in food at least....).  The guys were very nice and friendly though.   I may be back next time, but I think sharing is the way to go.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

cO1xuB5i2Vi4Nue7kGtZxQ.text: Out of the many times I've been to Vegas, I'm so glad I finally made it out here to try their infamous pan roast. We got here around 12:30pm on a Friday and there was only one couple ahead of us; we ended up waiting in line for maybe 15 minutes, tops.   Once we sat down, the food did take awhile as well but the cook will entertain you as they make all the dishes in front of you. I think we ended up being there for a good two hours?   We had the gumbo and combo pan roast - both at a Level 7 spice. It was delicious but next time, we both agreed to get Level 5 spice so we can taste the flavors a bit more. Can't wait to come back!

8vH4-ZBAOG9-NOBL9rjuFQ.text: Oh i wish the distance from OC to Vegas is 30 minutes so that  I can eat here every other day.... Why why why can't we have a place like this somewhere in OC???

0nsOs4_Ky0TvvUPINqsm2Q.text: Yay! no wait! came here on a wednesday during a random trip to Vegas and luckily there were 2 spot open just for us!  The bf was kinda weirded out by the ghetto location (palace station hotel), but he was happy after we got our food! We ordered the combo pan roast (level 5 spiciness) and a bowl of clam chowder. Both were delicious and we were so full! THey give you bread and butter with your meal and it was fun to watch the chef cook our meal right in front of us! One star off because i felt like there wasn't enough seafood in the roast, but plenty of creamy tomato sauce.

HVwoZLjeCrJSW8cZKIjsmQ.text: got to say a buddy of mine talked about this place so its across the street were i live so i decided to check it out ...there was aline when i got there but were very fast about cleaning tables n getting people sat so that was cool...small menu but i have to say the new england clam chowder was the best ive EVER had had a cadillac margarita n was very good service was good and food was AMAZING!!and they cook everything fresh there!! so i deff recomend this place!!!!!

vf5qP92VP_kRrgopsh9wdQ.text: Went to Vegas 9/7-9/10. Didn't go to the buffet ONCE, but I did go to the Palace Stations Oyster Bar TWICE. Best time to go is when they first open because there's no line. The 2nd time we went was around  1pm on a Sunday and we waited approximately 1 hour & 47 minutes! HOWEVER, well worth the wait! Dolores was taking orders and Bob was cooking. What a great duo these 2 are! So funny and engaging! I had the palace pan roast (spicy level 8) on my 1st visit and that was really good, but tried the boullabaise on my 2nd visit and i have to say that was my favorite. So flavorful! I know the pan roast is a fan favorite, but if u get to go to the oyster bar a 2nd time, i highly recommend the boullabaise. Forget the buffets and just hit the oyster bar! Next time i visit i am going to try the oyster rockefeller. Now that looks deelish!

bj9cDf2r2iwVFWF29j5nCg.text: First of all, OMG. I can't believe I've never heard of this place. On my last day in Vegas with the birthday girl, Krizia, she suggested we try this place out. Once I heard oyster I was all for it. I didn't think it would be anything crazy though. We waited in line for maybe 30 minutes on a Sunday. After going over the menu, I still didn't know what I was getting myself into. Sitting at the bar was a lot of fun, the chef and our server were very friendly and funny. I ordered the jumbalaya and my friend ordered the panroast combo so that we can share the two dishes. We also ordered oysters which were also really yummy and were cracked and brought to use very fast. Nothing compares to that feeling you get when your food comes out and it's all prepared and cooked in front of you so it is almost like a little tease. I wish I was a better writer so that I could properly described how amazing the panroast was. It's this creamy, buttery sauce with crab, lobster, shrimp, and a scoop of rice. I might've forgotten to include something, but my goodness I can't stop thinking about it! In others' reviews I've read, they compare it to The Boiler in Chino Hills which I also heard is the same owner of this place. I am so happy that I can satisfy my endless craving closer to home. I miss you Oyster Bar. See you soon

Uo-iCTlnoYaKEWou5C5cOQ.text: What can I say the combo pan roast was just excellent. It is shrimp, crab & lobster cooked in a tomato based cream soup. The New England clam chowder was also excellent. Beware you will be sitting in a bar which probably only sits about 16-18 people. On a busy night it will be along wait, at least an hour. i think we ate an hour and a half after standing in line but well worth it especially with a tall glass of cold beer.

lck0h8-6fftERNhdUcQzzA.text: this place is amazing! i came here through the recommendation of a friend while staying at the palace station this weekend and let me tell you the wait (yes there's always a wait) is SO WELL WORTH IT. everything was seasoned to perfection the oysters were fresh, and the staff was incredible and hilarious. so sad i didn't have a fridge in my room to keep my leftovers but i'll be returning again for sure!

qvuNELxChJPP_Fo-KpehJA.text: WOW, we waited almost 2 hours to be seated. We went around 8:15pm and got seated at around 10:10pm. And we knew exactly what we wanted when we got to our seat since we had been staring at the menu the whole time we were waiting in the line. So we ordered right when got seated, but it took about 45 minutes for us to receive our food because their pan roast takes a while to cook and they were already behind with the orders because they were so packed with people. So this is where they get the minus 1 star. With the food, wow! their oysters are awesome! Their pan roast - even better! I got the combo gumbo and combo pan roast for my husband. We both liked the pan roast better. I got it at 7 because I like it spicy - but honestly, it wasn't spicy enough for me. Clam chowder was good - decent flavor with lots and lots of clams. If you want to eat here, come at a really awkward time... like 3pm or 2am... because we left the bar at around midnight and there were still people waiting in line.

Ky2tL5b34Q694B3-5r8Dlg.text: Okay. So I really wanted to love the food from this place because of all of the wonderful, raving reviews, but just didn't. Waited in line  for approximately an hour before being seated at the bar, but really wasn't bothered by the wait because the majority of reviews said that the food was worth it. Ordered a half dozen of oysters on the half shell, and thought they were just mediocre- yes, they were very meaty, but I missed the saltiness/brine of traditional east coast oysters. Ordered the combo pan roast with shrimp, crab, and lobster, and it was just mediocre too.  While I found the food to be just, meh, the staff was lovely and worked very hard to please their customers. Would I come back to this oyster bar again on a return visit to vegas, no, but I'm glad I tried it because I would have always wondered if I was missing out otherwise. Now I know that I will not be missing out. Save your time and money for something else.

MVz-4H6rpo8m1r7k1C6uxg.text: so i wasn't too hot on going to the palace station since that place is a little on the 'ghetto' side... i know, i know, i'm a casino/hotel snob!!! but my bf's sister and mom wanted to go to the 'oyster bar' there for both their bday dinners so i agreed to hang out at the station! :)  to my surprise this so called oyster bar place was pretty cool!! the food was very very delicious and the chef cooked the entrees right in front of the bar in a metal like pot! it was great to see the food being prepared. i ordered my typical "clams and linguine" and it wasn't bad! :) i heard this place gets packed and there is usually a line. i suggest you go on a off night around 8pm. (they close at 11pm) there is only about 18-20 stools to sit on, so be prepared that there are no tables available!

LdxY7q7AXuVR5zZK3qTjWQ.text: If you're a seafood lover like me, you'll love this place. You can't go wrong with the house pan roast! The consistency is rich and creamy, like a bisque, with huge chunks of seafood, cooked to perfection. I always get it with pasta but I end up eating it as a soup. As far as the spice level goes, I can't handle spicy foods so I usually go with a 4 but I've had a 7, which was a little overwhelming for me but still enjoyable. Don't forget to get the oysters which are always so fresh and so tasty (I mean, hello, it is a oyster bar)! Just put a splash of lemon with a dash of horseradish and cocktail sauce and I'm sure that will brighten anyone's day. Seating is very limited but I've only gone in the wee hours of the morning so I've never had to wait for a table. If you're lucky and you have the pleasure of having Ricardo as your chef, you'll be in for a treat. He's so friendly and makes the best pan roast ever! He's so awesome to the point where I'll be visiting him every time I'm in Vegas. In fact, I've appointed him my new Vegas BFF. Everyone go visit this place, you won't be disappointed!

mimMl2rS69OmeeptYr2R1w.text: Holy crap.  Two of us ordered, to share, a dozen oysters and a #8 spicy house gumbo.  We were full and delicious, as was the food.  Back it up though.  This place actually is a bar -- under 21, no deal -- and there's not much room so I'm guessing you have to wait if you go at a normal eating time.  We didn't.  It's at Palace Station Casino, and they've got a shuttle to/from Fashion Show mall which is way cool.  Shuttle is free (but tip the guy, will ya?)  Oysters were freaking huge and delicious.  So big points for the first dish.  #8 spiciness was a bold move, and I'll admit that my lips were burning, but I stand by it.  We needed some extra sourdough rolls to dull the pain, but damn damn damn that gumbo was good.  Crammed with shrimp cooked just right and tasty okra (and geeze, I don't even like okra! but I ate every bit) plus various other fishiness, I can't even describe how this masterpiece tasted.  Full of flavor, and the spice was not heat for the sake of heat -- this was delicious, full-bodied, kick you in the face in a nice way gumbo.

Gm0owX-_SPNPOJkO7nuidQ.text: like everyone has said, the pan roast here is heavenly.  24 hr and can have a wait due to limited seating at the bar, but worth it.  made in front of you, the sauce is killer with a spice system rated 1-10  (6 is sorta mild), but the complexity and creaminess is perfection with the soft various seafood (crab, lobster, shrimp) and yummy chorizo pieces.  rice to soak up the goodness.  must be a lot of butter, sweet and creamy tomato soup base.

31Ls4CO-Uo_C7nlb2ny1vg.text: If you like this kind of food you will love this place. Had the pan roast combo and it was great. Cannot wait to go back.

r2suMJLu35ZpFZbBFZSDFA.text: Oh the lovely but obscured oyster bar inside of Palace Station, such an amazing place it's too ridiculous.  I first ate at the oyster bar about 12 years ago when I was ten.  Back then security guards always asked for my ID while I waited in line with my parents at the casino.  At last, I'm over 21 and I make Oyster Bar my number one stop every time I go to Las Vegas, and every time I get the seafood gumbo.  This gumbo is so decadent in taste, so flavorful, so amazingly good that my mouth is watering up as I'm writing this.  Now, I lOve spicy food, and I order the seafood gumbo with a 9, and it's pretty damn spicy.  My advice is to get a 6 if you can't handle spicy well but loves a kick to your gumbo.

VsUkmXxrQrxaGxaxu3qmqA.text: Three weeks after our "Las Vegas Food Tour" we find ourselves back in Sin City. We were back for a friend's birthday and we arrived a day early. So for the few that came early, we decided to get something good before slurping down gallons and gallons of fat tuesdays and liquor that would eventually result in stuffing our faces with some trash fast food. This was a grapevine recommendation so I was a little reluctant but I'm no snob, I'll eat it if you say its good.   Keep in mind, this place seats about 14-18 people. Soo... depending on how large your party is the line can take quite a long time. For a group of four the wait was about 45 mins. It was tough especially because we were starving. But it is definitely worth the wait!   We ordered a dozen clams and half a dozen oysters as appetizers. This was more than enough for 4 people. The clams were ginormous, this was the first time that I ever had clams uncooked, but top them with some horseradish, cocktail sauce and your choice of hot sauce and you've got a ridiculous combination of flavors in your mouth. The clams and oysters were VERY fresh but not the best I've ever had. That award goes to Swan Oyster Depot in SF. They do have the best and only Pan Roast I have ever tasted on the other hand. We all got the combination Pan Roast that consists of shrimp, crab, and lobster. They also give you a choice of how spicy you want it with a rating of 0-10. I ordered a 4 and I though it was the perfect amount of heat. It tasted like a huge bowl of lobster bisque and I definitely wasn't complaining. The best thing to do IMO is to order one Pan Roast and get an extra order of rice for two people. Trust me... its plenty. We also topped it off with a $20 bottle of wine which is a steal for Vegas. This place is a definite hidden gem in the long lost Palace Station. I will definitely be back!

2TYayrekG0Mcs31ty0lVwA.text: Was recommended by a friend on my latest trip to Vegas. All she said was get the Combo Pan Roast with rice. I did just that with a half dozen of their fresh oysters. The Pan Roast was pretty rich and reminded me of a cream of tomato base loaded with tons of seafood. I can't lie that everyone else around us was ordering the Gumbo and I wished I had room to order that as well, but there was no way. I'll have to leave that for my future trip to Vegas. The only cons I thought there were was that there was a long line for tables since the seating area is just the bar area. Had to wait at least 45 minutes even at 9:00pm. Good comfort food and it's definitely entertaining watching them cook your dishes in front of you. Check it out.

bH_EYIbHhlwAVKm4-URapw.text: My favorite restaurant in vegas, if not the west coast. i have frequented this restaurant every time i happen to be in town (which is around 10 times a year). what can you say about this place, its got the freshest seafood in town. i know what your thinking, las vegas = fresh seafood??? that's why we got fedex. you need to start off with oysters here. at least a dozen of them. then go for the pan roast or the gumbo. i like it spicy so i order usually an 8 or 9 (1 being the lowest heat and 10 the highest). a pan roast is a seafood stew (i usually get the oyster pan roast) with cream, tomatoes, seafood stock, and cajun spices. this dish is hearty, smooth, soothing, and downright soul satisfying. and the gumbo is the best gumbo on the west coast. once i visit new orleans, i may change my opinion but, this is the best gumbo i have ever eaten. i don't even frequent the gumbo pot in LA anymore just because it doesn't come close to the gumbo at the oyster bar. try not to mind the smoke because it is located in the middle of the casino. you have to be 21 to eat here. and be prepared for a line because there are only 15 seats.   i usually go at 2-3pm to avoid the lines.

-OZhHgv4RcQwU3hmYTOTtg.text: I've been coming here for years (also heard people come here for years whenever they visit LV) and introduced my husband to this place. This location is very small (the seating is around a dozen stools and the chefs prepare and cook everything right there in front of you), so get there early if you want to avoid the crowd. I love love love love the House Gumbo (the deluxe version of Gumbo with sausage, chicken, and seafood). Although I have tried other menu specialities, I keep getting the House Gumbo. I've found that how great your meal is, really depends on the cook (I like my gumbo spicy). The portions have gotten slightly smaller over the years, but I still eat half, and save half for later. Meals (gumbo or pan roast dishes) come with crackle bread (generous serving), a hard roll, and a scoop of rice. Also, this location does not serve Jambalaya anymore. So, we go to the Sunset Station's Oyster Bar, because my husband really likes the Jambalaya. I've given this place five stars because I have never been disappointed, the service is really good, and even on a busy day, you can get a really good meal here- it's still worth the wait, anyway. If you want gumbo, this is the place for you. (The pan roast is more creamy and I am not a creamy sauce person.)

tfGoF0qLRi7fjF3GTMJBjw.text: One spoon in my mouth and I'M HOOK FOR LIFE!!! Everytime I go to Vegas this is the place I visit before I leave...Total satisfaction everytime!!! My trip will not be complete if I don't get some pan roast, raw oyster, jumbalaya in my tummY!  People are starting to discover  this hidden treasure which is awesome but not good for me because I waited two hours in line the last time but totally worth every minute...hopefully they expand

c4HEF6YVTnDzfT1OJXeWow.text: WARNING!!! May have to wait in a line up to 3 hours. Besides Disneyland and DMV this is the only place I will wait that long for a meal. Seafood lovers that like a kick(New Orleans style) will be in love with this place. Chowders, Shooters, Shrimp Cocktail, and of course Oysters to start with. Favorite dishes in order the Pan Roast, the etouffee, & the Bouillabaisse! They also pack these dishes full of lobster, shrimp, clams, and much more! Don't ever let the line scare you as the aroma you smell as you wait anxiously is only a teaser until you get that first steaming hot bite! ps. Save the bread for the main course so you can dip in broth!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Back left étouffée, front left pan roast, and the bottom right bouillabaisse

FmtnZF2hxrWzp00k-t-12A.text: No words needed!  This place speaks for itself!  The best!  Phenomenal!  We are considered out-of-town regulars!  Bouillabaisse was ok though.  Pan roasts, etouffee, chowders, gumbo, jambalaya will be THE BEST you have EVER had!!!  Huge whole pieces of seafood---ridiculousness!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace Pan Roast and étouffée!!!!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Go here, the memory of the long wait in the long line will dissipate after your first taste.  Lol
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouillabaisse level 5 heat, should have gotten a 3

UlwF4kWswsYqiOzZsf3abA.text: The service is friendly and nice and the Pan Roast is worth the wait. Although there are times when the wait can be up to two hours, you'll be so happy that you waited! It's a must stop every time my husband and I visit Las Vegas.   If you like to eat oysters and or clams try them on the half shell!!!

dHLiXExQCpecQUQC-0KZKw.text: And I'm back!  The food is still great! But the wait is still long. But i guess that is how you know it is still good. :)  I had two dozen of oysters! Boy, it was delicious! So fresh!  The gumbo is a bit salty, but I think that's why you eat it with rice.   I cannot wait to be back again. -------------------------------------------------------- yes, i will def go back!  great oysters great service great alaskan chowder  need to pick a good time to go, because the wait is pretty long.   the food makes it worth it tho.

unRIXb4MuH7P4k5IB_7UGA.text: Bomb AF! Worth the wait if you're wondering why there's only ten seats and there's always a line! Because it's reallllly good!

GNGIjjrqcqXWyq_BOWfSjA.text: OMG, I love oyster bar! The only reason why I took one star away is because of the ridiculous line that you always have to wait in, but people are always willing to wait cause it's so good! If you're not from Las Vegas just wait the ridiculous line because it's worth it.   There's only a few seats that's why it always takes like a hour before you sit. Also, this is a 21 and up bar so no one under 21 can eat at the bar.  This oyster bar is always open for 24 hours 7 days a week, so you are able to get this after the club. But be warned there is always a line. Unless you are like a magical unicorn and get really lucky and there's no wait!   I usually get the Combo Pan Roast! I swear the chefs are like super magicians because it always tastes amazing! I've never tasted pan roast like this before! I like to get either the rice or noddles on the side because if you put it together I feel like the noddles and rice would get too soggy! The food portion is really huge so if you eat only a little it's all good because this pan roast is still good the next day. It still tastes amazing! This meal can defiantly be shared with two people and still take a little home!   I also get oysters and they are so huge and fresh that you would be surprised!   But seriously this place is amazing! Try it once and you'll be hooked and want to go all the time when your in Las Vegas!

AYJCg_4k-JMaxYPe1oQ2GQ.text: One of my favorite places to eat in Vegas. The wait sucks but the food makes it worth it. The palace pan roast is my absolute fav - shrimp, crab, chicken, and andouille sausage in a creamy tomato sauce with a scoop of rice. I'm drooling as I type! Lol large portions too. Def enough for two people

DPo3HtRrqXl-qVfOsucwWA.text: Waiting in line for about 40 mins on a Friday during lunch time.  We got: a dozen oysters (16.99) Bowl of New England clam chowder(8.99) Combo pan roast-level 5 spicy  (23.99)  You get served a sourdough roll. It's pretty good. Everything we ordered was delicious! Although we could probably do without the clam chowder but I was craving it ahaha.  It wasn't too spicy for me and it was very filling.  Oysters were really fresh, a bit gritty, but still good.  Bob was our cook and he did a fantastic job serving everyone on a timely manner.  Margie was our waitress and she was also efficient with getting us everything and making sure our waters were filled.  Thanks oyster bar!

RtRYcU-H62FqlERexJ7U3g.text: Being from San Francisco, I'm pretty picky about seafood. With that said, this place is INCREDIBLE. Who would have thought that you could find such amazing seafood in the middle of the desert? I was recently in Las Vegas for a conference, and my boyfriend and I came here two nights in a row. The first was a Saturday night/Sunday morning around 5 a.m, and we probably waited about an hour for a spot at the 18-seat bar. There was no wait at around the same time the next night. My boyfriend is super impatient and hates to wait for anything, but even he declared that the food was totally worth it.   The two servers were super efficient and personable. I didn't catch their names; one just told me to call him "baby" and the other looks like Walter White from Breaking Bad, albeit a million times less grumpy.   For starters, we had a dozen oysters on the half shell ($17.99 from 1-9 a.m.) and the New England clam chowder ($7.99 a bowl). The oysters were fresh and perfectly briney, and the cocktail sauce had a nice horseradish kick to it. The clam chowder was way better than the over-hyped Boudin, in my opinion, with big chunks of meaty clams. The sourdough rolls they served with the meal went perfectly with the chowder.  For our entrees, we split the combo pan roast ($21.99) and the bouillabaisse ($23.99). Boyf really enjoyed the bouillabaisse; a "classic French stew with onions, celery, shrimp, crab, lobster, cod, mussels and clams." He's a huge carnivore, and this dish was packed with seafood in a light spicy broth. For me, the pan roast stole the show; a rich, almost creamy sauce with huge chunks of jumbo shrimp, clams, and lobster. While not as meat-heavy as the bouillabaisse, the sauce was simply amazing with the heaping scoop of rice that accompanied each portion. Another tip - when they ask how hot you want it, maybe err on the more mild side. I love spicy food and I put Sriracha pretty much on everything, but I'm definitely not a champ. We ordered a spice level 6/10 the first day and my face was flushed and sweaty within 2 bites. The flavors were so good though, that I had to keep trucking even through the burn.   Bottom line: come on a weeknight or early morning for the best experience. And even if you have to wait, totally worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmm oysters!

znqJ4VoTjg3ffvPktVSvhg.text: Literally, the best Alaskan Chowder! Like wayyyy better than SF! My boyfriend and I ordered the Combo Pan Roast and Alaskan Chowder both freaken Amazing ! Level 3 for us, just the right amount of heat considering we're not spicy daredevils lol. We couldn't stop eating and saying how great it was. Staff was friendly and fun to watch prepare our food can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan Chowder!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

ezgQNIXo36CieuPjakskbw.text: Food is nom-nom! I loved the New England clam chowder and seared tuna salad. I would definitely go back just for those two items. Negatives: Seating is limited and staff is short, resulting in slow service. Be prepared to wait

3C9QrzHvuz2rW9VjS2RLJQ.text: Still great after all these years! Now even better that they are open 24/7. Menu has not changed a lot, but there was no need.  The Pan Roast is still my favorite, but you can't find fresher oyster in the desert than here!  The cook and the waitress are always friendly, so tip them well, they work non-stop!

8hBqfY1P7XMkMhvXuyxaSQ.text: A tiny oyster bar located inside The Palace Station hotel off the strip. There are only 18 seats available so be prepared for a long wait. I've heard great things about this place so it was a must try when in Vegas. I arrived around 10:00 on a Saturday night and wasn't seated till midnight. The 2 hour wait wasn't that bad since I was running back and forth to the Irish pub across the way for drinks.   I opted for the Palace Pan Roast with shrimp, crab, chicken and andouille sausage level 8 spicy. HOLY MOLY, this dish was super delicious!! Every bite was pure creamy heaven with succulent shrimps and the flavorful andouille sausage just made it that much better. I licked my bowl clean. It was that good and totally worth the 2 hour wait.

dtW68e3JDXSbAE28FU0zpQ.text: I'm from Las Vegas, NV. and i gotta go at least once even twice a month to the place just for the Palace Pan Roast combination! Best dish in Las Vegas most people don't even know about.

X_Wu5SqtSjcQh4Ox7p88gg.text: Im sure there are already enough reviews for this place, but yes go to stop in Vegas and the only reason I would ever go to Palace station.  If you had Ritters, kettle Bar, and all the other wanna be pan roast places...well this is better. Their pan roast is creamier and has more lobster, shrimp, and etc.  I try to not go during peak times because wait can be ridiculous here.

SizD4gICyO4bnJWe1zQXdQ.text: Went here at a referral from a buddy of mine.  Food was excellent!  I had the Pan Roast.  I would write more, but all I can say is, I probably won't go back.  We waited an hour and 15 minutes to get seated.  For me, thats too long and I just don't have it in me to wait like that anymore, for anything.  Everyone loved their food, but all agreed, it wasn't the place for people in our age range to have to wait around.

oLK8HGeNHv99iU9rotjDmQ.text: Our 1st time here. I cannot Believe we've been missing this the whole time we been going to Vegas. The first thing I did when I got home @cali was Thank my friend for telling us about The Oyster bar). It's only been a day since we got back home. I was craving for it for some more. And planning to go back with our kids to vegas for the summer vacation. And really hoping to take the kids to try it, when my wife told me. It's 21 and over. I guess we are ordering 3 To Go pan roast next time. 1 for my kids, 2 for me LOL. We went @12pm: as much i would like to finish the whole pan roast, but ended getting a to go bags. Mind you I was eating the rest for 2 days. We even went to look for a rice (thanks for a thai restaurant open till 4am). Ordered rice only to go (LOL) so I can finish eating the pan roast. Still did not finish it. I Finish the pan roast on the road while driving to cali (wife was feeding me, Not eating by my self and driving at the same time). We would have comeback if wife don't have an appointment with someone (so really did not have time to go back). To the people who have NOT TRIED IT: You must try it, the wait & price is worth it. Combo Pan Roast rice on the side: (My Favorite). Bouillabaisse (wife ordered this) it was good too, lots of really fresh (really, really fresh seafood). And did I mentioned really fresh seafood enough. Hangover food (your in vegas, definitely you will have a hangover in the morning. Oysters on the Half Shell: I have eaten a ton of oysters... THIS IS THE BEST OYSTER THAT I HAVE EATEN IN MY LIFE... My Big Tip (Order a dozen). Now my picture says. Oyster Bar was top 6 in America by Jaunted.com. I know it not fair to the other 5 oyster bar since I have not eaten at their establishment. BUT SINCE I HAVE NOT EATEN AT YOUR ESTABLISHMENT!!! THE OYSTER BAR @PALACE STATION IS THE #1 OYSTER BAR IN AMERICA, PERIOD!!!!! please do not argue this one with me, your are not going to win with me. LOL. I have not even touch base with the people who work there. They have made the experience better too. Filipino cook (friendly, funny): the lady behind us at the line started getting worried since the filipino cook left the station. She ask the host/waiter/server where he go. She said he just took a break. The lady said, you better make sure he is the one cooking for us when we get seated cuz I am not waiting for this long if he not the one cooking our food. She was talking to my wife, she said they been going @Oyster bar for 20 years and always eaten there before they head back home. Host/waiter/server friendly and funny too. 2 guys in front of us on the line (who also told us they been going here for 12 year) called her to tell her theres already 2 open seat. Took her apron tell them, don't tell her what to do (with a smile)... Clean the tables. And comeback to them I'm sorry sir but were already closing. Lol. Guys was just laughing the whole time. Ever heard the saying, IF PEOPLE LINE UP FOR HOUR ON THE RESTAURANT YOU KNOW THERE FOOD IS REALLY GOOD..... This is it. People line up & wait for it.Even if they know they have the drive for 4/5/6 hours after to go home. People waiting tells you they have been going in the place for years and years. People are a regular. (Guy next to me is in a first name basis with the host/server). A guy like me who usually don't write a book for a review, but since I really have a damn good time, great experience at this place that I cannot resist. The Food, The Place, The Worker, The Customer = I have never eaten in a place where people all were talking about how good were the food is and all talking interacting to everyone. We eat at fine dinning restaurant, we always love to eat out when were at Vegas (just this last trip we eat at: Nove@palms (I give them the view), The Grand Lux Cafe. But THE OYSTER BAR @Palace station TRULY made our last trip a wonderful experience. Oyster Bar @Palace Station you have a new Regulars in us for as long as you be cooking for us...

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #1 OYSTER BAR IN AMERICA in my Book!!!

c37TyNFpTraewow6LxQ_vg.text: Fat and happy! Disappointed they were out of crab but they made up for it with shrimp

tMhW5mARWHWG1Lue7yuWJw.text: The food itself was a 5, but the service made me give it a 4 instead. The wait that we are all reading about is very real due to all food being made from scratch with maybe only 6 pots at a time and very limited seating available. We arrived at 12PM. There were 6 people ahead of us yet we had to wait for maybe 45 minutes before being seated. When we arrived, there were a few empty seats with dirty dishes that needed to be cleaned, yet the waitress was nowhere to be seen. She didn't arrive to clear the dishes and seat the next customers until maybe 15-20 minutes later.   We had the Pan Roast Combo and a Combo Boullabaise. Both spice level #7. Both were very very delicious. The pan roast definitely does deserve the praise. It is very rich but balanced out perfectly with all the spices. There were large chunks of seafood in both dishes.   TIP--Oyster Bar is not kidding with its spice level. I normally eat very very spicy stuff, but the bouillabaisse #7 was a bit too much for me. I would probably recommend a 5 to really enjoy the dish thoroughly if you want something spicy but enjoyable. Also, I would probably share the Pan Roast Combo and pay the $5 plate sharing fee instead of ordering two entrees. We were beyond stuffed after going through 3/4 of the entree.

cPQye28f6UuP-ifg2SHeBA.text: Anyone who's anyone comes here to eat.  It's a no brainer. The real question is are you a fan enough to wait in line and devour the delicious goodness this place has to offer?  Combo Pan Roast ($23.99) is obviously their specialty that everyone comes back for.  Throw in the half dozen oysters for $10 and you got me sold!  This is my 2nd time here in a very long time.  You have to try this place out if you haven't

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh sinful goodness Combo Pan Roast you are worth the wait
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 of the half dozen lol

89iFvI1L6zP5EpsGoAZ1QA.text: I was very lucky with the waiting time - only 30 minutes. Arrived at 12:15pm on a Friday. I had half dozen oysters and combo pan roast. The oysters were extremely fresh but I am not fan of oysters from The Mexican Golf as they are big, too fatty, and have bland taste compared to oysters from the Atlantic or Pacific Ocean which are delicate and very tasty. The combo pan roast had a wonderful taste. I had spice level 6 which was fine for me. Overall the food was fine but it is not worth 2-3 hours wait. Service was not that great. The waitress seemed stressed and was not smiling or friendly.

KH8bhMKC5LPw5Z6XUX0azQ.text: Came here for the first time last night and I would have to say this the best place for gumbo and oysters. Their oysters were very fresh and their gumbo was the best I have ever tasted. They cook everything in front of you so you can see exactly what they are doing. The only downfall is that there is only 18 seats for the whole restaurant. So be prepared to wait.

0qm-wYQS14ggB2CLeuKFgA.text: No matter how long the wait is I would wait for a seafood combo even if my husband is allergic to it! It's the best n u just have to try it for urself to know why! The wait is worth it! Although I never had True Louisiana good my husBand has n he loves it n he's allergic to shell fish so that says a lot! Make ur way oyster bar n they won't disappoint u with the seafood pan roast selection!

2cul_NZ5i3RlwrQ-Die20A.text: So damn good! Etouffee and Alaskan clam chowder was stupid good! Oysters were super fresh and delicious! Showed up at 4:30am and waited about 30 minutes to get a seat. Worth the wait!

-80BQIPap7852RrrjruB4A.text: This is one of those places that is a must before leaving Vegas. The palace pan roast appears to be the most popular and is the only item I get whenever I get a chance to dine here. Maybe next time I'll be brave and try something new. It's just an open bartop with bar stools that only seats enough for about 12 people. So for the rest of the people...ya gotta wait in line! That's the worst part when you're already hungry you not only have to wait in line, but you get watch others before you feast upon all that delicious goodness! Their clam chowder is also very tasty and is a great starter before your meal. But definitely get the palace pan roast!! Don't leave Vegas without it!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VqLiCMf4X6xQ005c_DWISg.text: We loved it so much we ate there two days in a row.  Tried the raw oysters, little neck clams, Alaskan chowder, pan roast, and bouillaroast (a combo of bouillabaisse and pan roast). The bouillaroast was our favorite. Full of seafood too! Definitely a wait in line but not a deal breaker, service dependent upon who you had. Super impressed by one cook who was working so hard. He was busy busy busy and still smiling.  Will return no doubt. Sooo yummy!

hz6McurIfSMEQjcbomIiOg.text: Food was good but nothing special. The clams on the 1/2 shell were nice and fresh but the size was more in the Cherrystone to Top Neck range so keep the larger size in mind if you order them.  The oyster were a big disappointment which is a shame because it's an "oyster bar". The only oysters offered are standard "Gold Band", pre-shucked oysters. It was also disappointing to watch the shucker cut the gold band, haphazardly pop the lid and allow the very limited briny liquor to go down the drain as the oysters were then served on the top shell and not the "cup". They were fresh and nicely sized but I wouldn't recommend them because without that liquor, most of the flavor is lost.  The pan roast was tasty and they give you a generous portion. They ask how spicy you want it on a 1-10 scale. I went with a 6 and it was tolerable but in hindsight I probably should of gone with a 4. The service was friendly and once you're seated, it's a nice experience but I doubt I'd return anytime soon because of the wait. It is hard to justify waiting in line for 2 hours in a dark, very smoky and rundown casino because there are just so many other great places in town to eat without the hassle.

Ux8voRl54FAW_-4BSf7PEg.text: We went there for an early brunch -- okay, it was 10:00am on a Tuesday -- and didn't have to wait, although all of the seats were full by the time we left.   My friend had been there a couple of times before and I was impressed that the server remembered him.  Everyone was friendly and helpful, and it's fun to watch them prepare the food.  We all had the combo panroast, which was absolute incredible. Tons of crab, lobster, and shrimp in a brandy/cream tomato sauce.  I had "medium" spicy which had a slight bite to it. It was super rich and delicious. It's now 5:15 pm and I'm still not hungry yet...  Definitely a must go to place...go early or be prepared to wait, but definitely worth it!

WcvvOuVto4uouzS6H-51Aw.text: One of a kind experience. The pan roasts are out of this world! the casino is divey, but worth a stop to eat.

pbJ3czRFta15_sccYOmgrA.text: I went there last weekend, after not going for a few weeks. It's often too long a wait, and it's a little too close to the strip for me to drive to on a Saturday. Anyway, since I was alone, I got lucky and they sat me right away. The oysters were very large, larger than I had remembered them, but still very good. And the jambalaya was excellent, as I remembered. The price was high (also as I remembered), but if you like Creole cuisine, I can't think of a better place in Las Vegas than this one. They're open 24 hrs., so their chefs vary, but they are all quite competent. There was a line for parties of 2, 3, and 4, because the bar only has about 20-25 seats, but if you are a patient person, it's worth the wait. I'm a big fan.

365DXPujCKOjWZH7EZJlQA.text: The lowdown: So, if you can roll with the punches, you aren't too hungry, you're not in a hurry, and you love seafood with a kick, this is a delicious place to eat. I would readily go again with who wanted to, but I'm not comfortable giving it a strong recommendation generally.  The food at Oyster Bar is *easily* five stars. The service knocks it down two just as surely. Be aware that this is a time commitment: we went for supper on a Tuesday night - we got in line shortly before six, and it was nearly ten when we left.  I don't mind waiting for good food - and the food is worth the wait! - but after about an hour and a quarter in line, when we sat down the service was terrible. It was twenty minutes after we were seated before anyone spoke to us (only to tell me that we couldn't order anything yet) and well over half an hour before we were served drinks. This wasn't all the server's fault - she seemed expected to do way more than she was capable of. She would disappear for long periods of time, making it very difficult to order if you needed something - and we did. One more staff member to bring drinks to the line, prepare salad and appetizers, and bus dishes could have made a big difference. That said, she didn't manage the situation well - it's great to keep a good disposition, but razzing customers who are unhappy is no good. I felt badly for having recommended the place.   We ordered a dozen oysters to share and a pan roast each. The oysters are huge and delicious, but we watched her pour the liquor out when she shucked them - what a waste! My only complaint about the food.   The pan roast, though - *so* good. Easily the best thing I ate in Vegas. All of the soups and sauces are prepared in this neat contraption with six small soup vats, so you can watch the whole process from your spot at the bar. The cooks are friendly and will answer questions and chat with you (but not assist the server). The combo pan roast was outstanding, and you can order it with a kick. There's lots of perfectly cooked seafood, not just a couple of shrimp like there can be some places, and the portions are extremely generous. Despite all the downsides of our experience, I'm thinking back fondly on the food. I wish we'd been able to bring home leftovers!

64N80fqt4AHdH7TbD5satw.text: The bar (literally) is off the strip located at the Palace Station Casino. We came on a Tuesday late afternoon. The wait was about 30 minutes (this was a short wait since it was slow for them).  I had the bouillabaisse. Wonderful. Very flavorful. Also ordered the oysters. Not my favorite but still good. Staff was friendly. The chef has 6 pots to cook in so your wait time also can be determined by when your ordered was place and how many people are ahead of you as the chef can only cook 6 orders at a time. Worth the wait. Average wait from what I hear is 90 minutes. One customer I spoke with there was on New Year's Eve and they waited 3 hours.

qEYrB5drk1SMZBxs6l2BGg.text: My goodness the line.  Came at 2am n it's crazy.  A few seat, small batches of soup made at a time. Hungry drunk ppl.  2 hr wait...makes things taste better lol.  Anyways it's good but very heavy.  A lot of ppl I see couldn't finish their food.  They asked for leftover to go.  Ordered their famous soup with lobster, good amount of chunky lobster a big plus.  Also got 12 dozen oyster n the clam soup with clam shells.  Anyways they were all good.  Be warn though it's very heavy n creamy...you will burp soup taste at nigh lol.  Worth a one time experience but horrendous wait wise, nah...I don't wait long hrs for food.  Just not my thang.

HIszoOQ9zNDj-LuP2uYCfw.text: The best seafood in Las Vegas.  I had the oysters  and the pan roast with lobster.  The oysters were fresh and delicious.  The pan roast had lobster the size of my fists.  It was really good.  I went with spicy number four and it was just spot on.  Definitely will be back.

c-xRxFdIPMtowWMhBb5S5A.text: Believe the hype. Oyster Bar inside old, smoky Palace Station, really is delicious. The line wasn't too bad, we waited around 30-40mins. The food is fantastic! We ordered:  -dozen oysters -Linguine fra diablo -Pan Roast (Combo)  The oysters were fresh, the linguine was spicy with plenty of shrimp and lobster meat, and the pan roast was unlike anything I have tasted before. The broth is very unique. Service was very busy but Sergio was awesome.   Oyster Bar is open 24 hours so anytime is a good time to fulfill your craving for southern cajun-style food. I will definitely be back for round two.

Wk5KZS2xJeUFHxm71OIqyw.text: Lack of seating and no reservations. Death sentence or so you would think!  The wait is worth it. Not in the best location in Vegas but really some of the best food I have eaten in the 20 Years I've lived here.   Ive been here in total 15 times. Cant really say this any better than to say it worth the wait but make sure to prepare that you will be waiting awhile.

zfQUtOI7uKsxCha97X_dXw.text: I would never know Palace Station Casino if i didn't go to Oyster bar. Who would know inside the old casino, there is an amazing restaurant? Heard it always gets crowded, we went there around 9:00 am and ordered pan roast and house gumbo. What a heavy breakfast but it was so good. We finished everything and barely could walk out of Palace Station. Next time i wanna try oysters and Bloody Mary Oyster shooters.

KnM-8C5tG7_y7hYDCuV8sQ.text: I absoluty never ever come to Vegas without coming to get me a bowl of chicken gumbo. Never... The gumbo is soooo delicious and you get sooo much.  The only part that sucks is there are only about 15 stools to eat and order at. So often times we go, the wait is 1-2 hours standing in line salivating watching everyone eat. Lol.   But hands down the wait is more than worth it!!  4 stars only because of the wait time.

CebNyiDs6P49ze_Xnfv6pw.text: Loooooooooooooonnnggg Lines!  Be ready to wait a looong time. But totally worth it.

AvjoXzgpgMDRm-4jocXfHw.text: This place is legit! I been to Vegas so many times but this is the first time I heard of this place. I got the combo plan roast and is delicious. Portions are huge and is super fresh

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast

b97Pd0U-bAWpZBccYcr_WA.text: If you enjoy seafood, you must try the pan roast at The Oyster Bar inside Palace Station Casino.  The restaurant is open 24/7, but seating is extremely limited and always in high demand.  I once got in line at 3:00 am and waited two hours.  Like every time I have gone to The Oyster Bar, it was worth the wait!  The pan roast is the best seafood dish I have eaten.  It is reasonably priced for the amount of seafood you get ($24).  It is a large, rich, creamy, tomato-based dish full of seafood.  The serving size is generous.  I leave extremely full if I finish it myself.  The shooters, gumbo, and cioppino are all worth the wait, as well.  But, the line is primarily for the pan roast.  ALL-STAR DISH: combo pan roast.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

PMw7W5AVWKhmfjY5TQGuGA.text: My friend and I came here on a Friday night around 11:30pm.  We waited for about 1 hr 30 mins. It has a very limited amount of seating, so the wait can be really long depending on when you go.   [FOOD]  1/2 dozen OYSTERS on the half shell ($12.99): It was good, but nothing out of the ordinary.    1/2 dozen CLAMS in half shell ($11.99): I was not a fan of their raw clams.  It was my first time trying raw clams and some of them had a bitter taste.   COMBO PAN ROAST ($24.99): A creamy tomato stew cooked with shrimp, crab, and lobster and finished with some brandy.  It was really GOOOOOD!  My favorite pan roast place is Ritter's Steam Kettle Cooking in CA.  This place is definitely comparable!   BOUILLABAISSE ($25.99): A seafood stew with shrimp, crab, lobser, cod, mussels, and clams.  It was my first time trying this dish and I fell in love.  It was also a really good dish!   The portions are big, so we ended up having leftovers which still tasted really good the next day.  MUST GET: COMBO PAN ROAST & BOUILLABAISSE!!!

K8xKztkcMw5l88mq6JoEcQ.text: This place is a must try for locals and tourists! So this place is located inside the casino and the wait sometimes takes a while so I suggest coming here a bit earlier before your hunger strikes. Before they use to just have a made up line on the side of the bar but now there's actually velvet ropes to line up in. The place is a small bar-like structure that curves around the cooking area and the prep area.   What I always get when I come here is the seafood mix pan roast! It has crab chunks, shrimp, and lobster for $24.99. Sounds kinda pricey for pan roast right? But the size of the pan roast is pretty big! So pan roast is more like a creamy bisque that is made of heaven and some tomatoes and other stuff. But nonetheless creamy dreamy heavenly bisque filled with large servings of seafood!!! When you order, you get a roll of bread, a decent size helping of rice and the glorious sized pan roast. I'd compare  the size of the bowl to a small mixing bowl. It's enough for my sister and I to share the bowl and still be full.   I always see a lot of people order their own bowls but end up not finishing it or taking it home. I'm not sure how it is to reheat it later, but sharing it for us is always enough. All in all, whenever I have an itch for pan roast, this place is the place to go!!! Painful wait sometimes but so worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T5Liz7MKuFK9OSp4OvncZw.text: Always remember, "the more butter, the better!" SO WORTH THE 2-3 HOUR WAIT. Groups of 2 are better cause it's easier to fit into their seating than a group of 4. Seating is very limited (only bar) only about maybe 20 seats in the whole little area. Everything is made fresh in front of you in the 6 little pots by the chef. Steve was the cutest and was also our server, but really everyone takes turns helping customers out with whatever they need. Plates here are HUGE. So either come VERY hungry or if you're okay with only trying 1 thing, then order 1 plate and an extra side of rice to share. 1 plate can feed at least 2 people comfortably! The sauce was everything and was sooooo savory, buttery, and delicious. I had the lobster pan fry and I did not regret it! The hugest chunks, all of which were plentiful (they don't skim out!). For $25 a single plate they better not be! Will definitely be back to have again!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan fry
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pan fry

lSrdlq38gtcnZr26INWVjg.text: I reviewed this place years ago and never really felt the need to update it... until now. This past trip to Vegas, we came here as usual. But I did something different this time. I ordered the not so secret menu item, the Bouilla-roast. It is a game changer. If I could give the dish more than 5 stars, I would!  The Bouilla-roast is essentially the bouillabaisse and the house pan roast in one dish. When they make it, they add less of the tomato cream sauce and use more seafood broth. You get the seafood selection from the bouillabaisse. This includes crab legs with the shell on, which actually affects the whole dish. The shells give the broth more flavor and I could really taste that difference (my husband for the house pan roast as usual and I used it for comparison). There's tender pieces of white fish from the bouillabaisse as well. I could never finish my food here... until I had the Bouilla-roast. I wanted to lick my bowl!  Prepare for a long wait. Remember that there's probably more people in line than you thing because only a couple people from a larger party are actually physically in line.  I do think the casino could benefit from making a waitlist, either paper or electronic, so that people don't have to physically wait in line. If there was ana electronic wait list with a phone number, people could roam the casino and gamble, hence making the casino more money... that's just my recommendation!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouilla-roast. Not so secret menu item. Game changer.

aTjPyplsf8kDXhMUP_KBaQ.text: Went down for a quick late night snack, and ended up spending 2 hours here. They weren't lying when they said there's gonna be a wait. Umif you're lucky there might not be. Got the pan roast. And it was good, but I saw other people having the boulle roast, and should've had that instead. It looked much more appetizing to be with all that seafood. The pan roast definitely had a good amount of seafood and with the rice, it blends well together. The pan roast is tomato based bisque, so skip if ur not into tomatoes, and a strong taste of cream. Very basic bisque, didn't know what I was expecting. But the food was good. Will come back and try the other things. The oysters and clams were also fresh.

MDSKeXeltzY35LseQUiR9g.text: Oh my god, I think I died and went straight to heaven!   The oysters are AMAZING. They're the biggest oysters I've ever had and reasonably priced. Only downside is that I wish they were naturally sweeter. You get a very clean and fresh ocean taste.   The Manhattan Chowder at level 4 spicy had the perfect kick. The bowl was enough to share between three people and we were incredibly satisfied. There was just sooo much flavor.   Overall, everything is freshly made to order and served piping hot. I love that. Only downside is long wait times! I suggest coming after you've been out partying. There was a 30 min wait at 3AM. There's also $1 oysters for happy hour 5-10 AM!

95yr2kso1yjr0a8HqaiQnw.text: Still 5 star.    Took my wife for Fat Tuesday lunch. We got there at 1145am. We had 2 minute wait- weird. But the line got longer while we were eating.    Service is great and attentive- they refill you drinks without asking.   We started with clam chowder- excellent.   We got the pan roast combo and jambalaya- both were delicious.   Did find out that kids are not allowed in the bar.  Good to know.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HCnrFg6nbf00lM9HTZMAPg.text: The Oyster Bar is located inside the Palace Station casino and it is exactly what the name implies--a bar with a few seats around it! There is a velvet rope line to wait across from it in the midst of gaming machines.  While the Oyster Bar is open 24/7, it is constantly busy and everyone is expected to wait in queue.  About 45 minutes later, I was seated (and was informed that it was a "short" wait!) Again, seating was at a bar, which means mobility devices such as scooters and wheelchairs may not be accessible.  We were quickly handed menus and shown the specials of the day. I ordered a cold seafood platter as an appetizer and the combo pan roast as a main course. You are allowed to choose the spiciness level of your pan roast from 1-10 and I selected 8 since I do prefer my food on the hot side.  The appetizer came with some boiled shrimp, steamed clams, raw oysters, and condiments consisting of cocktail sauce, horseradish, and lemons. The food was fresh, served over a bed of ice, and delicious.  The pan roast combo came with a side of jasmine rice and a dinner roll. Overall, it was delicious: the texture creamy, it contained good sized chunks of seafood, and came out steaming hot. The spiciness level I ordered was enough for me to break out a sweat, but YMMV on that.  Despite being constantly busy, the service was excellent and the staff remained cheerful. Waiting in line at the Oyster Bar is part of the schtick so if you need to burn time before having a wonderful meal, I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The *entire* eatery.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold Seafood Combo

ffsaGds3YqTYcHlYcew83g.text: Yelp 100 Challenge 2018 (43/100)  I have a hate-love relationship with this place. LOL. I absolutely love the food here but I really hate how long the wait is. That's why I'm giving it 4 stars.  The Oyster Bar is literally just a bar. Located smack dab in the casino area of Palace Station, there are only about 15 seats, and it's first-come first-serve seating. You wait in line, and they seat you as a spot opens up. I've always had to wait at least 30 minutes, usually more, to get seated. But I always keep coming back because I love the food so much!  My favorite dishes to get are the Alaskan Chowder and the Pan Roast. The Alaskan Chowder is similar to your classic clam chowder, only better! It has shrimp, crab, and lobster! Plus you get to decide the spice level for it. The added kick definitely makes it taste better. The Pan Roast is a creamy tomato based dish with seafood and served with rice. Super yummy as well! The portions are pretty big, so I usually share with someone, or if I get my own, I'll definitely have yummy leftovers for later.  Since this place is open 24 hours, I suggest going at really odd hours to have the shortest wait time. I mean, there's still bound to be a wait because it's Vegas and people are always out & about at all times throughout the day. I've gone around 2am and 4pm, and still had to wait, but less than an hour. I definitely don't recommend going at normal meal times or you'll be waiting forever.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan Chowder

axVJtzvmcABqLY76CGyI2g.text: PAN ROAST. GOTTA HAVE THE PAN ROAST.  If you're like me and hate tomatoes, still get the pan roast. The pan roast taste like no other and it definitely is very filling. Eat every bite with rice and you are all set to go!  I also was able to try a half pound of shrimp and their shrimp are huge!!! I would definitely come back here when visiting Vegas.  Definitely a bonus to know they're open 24/7 but expect long lines even at 1AM. There's a reason why there's always a long line, it's really that good!

lkNfEErzydOtQwkuKlWJuw.text: Love this place! Every time I come to Vegas I brave the line to visit this place. While there are other locations that are still delicious, the atmosphere here really adds to the experience.  First of all: you will probably wait in line. It's worth it.   I've rarely waited less than an hour so grab a drink and tag each other out of the line to have a wander while waiting.  The food: you really can't go wrong. Everything is so flavorful that I've never left without feeling stupidly full. "Why did I do this to myself again?" I ask as I waddle away from the bar. Because you must.   The staff is always friendly and willing to have a quick chat if the crowds permit. It's like you've been welcomed into someone's kitchen.  Anyway, do yourself a favor and come to this place but let's coordinate first so you don't make my wait time longer!

zPoyedws92pICe0Qk-R68A.text: How have I never been to The Oyster Bar until now?!?! This place is so good, especially on a cold winter's day!  But really, any day or time is Oyster Bar time!!  An employee was telling us lines can be up to an hour.  We came around 1pm on a Saturday and the line was fairly short (lucky for us).  The line starts across from the bar so look for the line and don't mistakenly try to sit at the bar if you see an open seat....you will get glares from the salivating people in line.  You have been warned!  An employee will clear the bar and let you know when it is your turn to be seated.  You can see the chef cooking everything at the bar and the smells!!!!! You get tantalizing, mouth drooling smells of spices, garlic, and butter!  There is a slew of different hot sauces at the bar too. My fave was the garlic hot sauce!  It is a fun atmosphere!  Everyone is seated around the bar so you naturally have conversations with the people around you! The chef asked everyone how their meal was. He could of course tell by how everyone was devouring their plates with runny noses :)  The jambalaya and combo pan roast were so delicious! The spice level for dishes is 1-10, and a 5 is just right if you want a little spice but not have it be overpowering. The pan roast had huge shrimps, clumps of crab, and big chunks of lobster!!!  Ohhhh just writing about it makes me drool!!  Seriously, the pan roast is the way to go for first-timers to The Oyster Bar.  Shout-out to the employee who packed our leftovers.  She wrapped everything in saran wrap so no leaks on the way home!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast combo!  It was so good, I forgot to take pics of the huge lobster pieces!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jambalaya~~~
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from bar seats.  You can see the chef cook everything :)

MGGVFKE0vYykbVT8WdEOYA.text: First let me say the food is amazing, the best you can eat in Vegas hands down.   Now let me explain how it works. It's a bar, hence the name. There is limited seating and always a line, complaining the whole time you're in said line won't change that. Station Casinos is very aware of how successful and popular this restaurant is, if they wanted to expand it they would, they just put millions of dollars into a remodel, they pay several people to run numbers and decide what should be upgraded, you complaining the whole time you're in line won't make them expand it. There are a limited number of cooking kettles and employees that fit behind the bar, even if there's seats open that doesn't mean there are kettles open. From my experience they tend to wait till kettles are open before seating people or wait till a few groups are done to walk around to clean seats. Everyone is working super hard back there and complaining the whole time you're in line that they could clean one spot and seat one person won't make that happen.   Be patient, the food is worth it and try to enjoy the experience and if you can't at least don't stand in line and complain the whole time so you ruin everyone else experience.

m0pVzqN8xumoP-PbeYngSg.text: This is a ouster bar in the palace station. When I visit certain destinations, I look for high reviewed places to visit. Our wait was about an hour to be seated. The only reason I did not give 5 stars, was feeling rushed. However, I can understand because the line pretty much watches you to see if you're leaving the bar, in hopes of getting seated quickly. You're basically waiting amongst the slot machines.   The food! We ordered 2 plates for the 3 of us. We even had left over. It was everything. We actually just asked for their best reviewed items and went with it. I can't remember the names, so see the photos. We also ordered additional rice.  We brought home what was left and continued eating.

IOz2pBg25YIvzAfiKWqnKw.text: EZE IS AN AMAZING CHEF! He made sure each of our orders were correct and took extra care to make my best friends dish as spicy as she likes it, giving it the perfect attention to detail. He was personable, funny, and amazing at his job. The food itself was amazing but we will come back specifically for EZE.  Thank you!!

scfCcfrWKbfWi9Ur-Grrvg.text: The pan roast is just butter and vodka sauce.   Change my mind.   For those of you who aren't familiar with internet memes I'm basically trying to disagree with everyone who said the pan roast is amazing. It's just tomato cream sauce mounted with butter with seafood tossed in. Wasn't worth the 45 minute smoke-filled wait in the casino. I've waited over an hour for oysters and lobster in Boston but probably wouldn't return here for the oysters. I'm awarding this place four stars for the freshness and cleanliness of their oysters. I wasn't told where the oysters were from that day but they were medium in size with a shallow cup and creamy.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6HBOS0C5aRXS-1rw-125mw.text: So at first look it appears to be just a little counter like all the other little bar areas, but once you get a whiff of panroast combo smell, its much more intriguing.  I went for the first time about 10 years ago and I was warned by a co-worker that the line may take hours.  My friend and I took turns standing in line while the other stretched out and wandered the casino.   This time we decided to try to arrive late 11ish on a weekday.  It worked great, only 20 minute wait with two people in line.  That's my secret tip if you handle eating that late at night.  I also learned that you can order to go as well.  I figured my dad would like to try it, but would never wait in line that long or eat that late.   The staff are all friendly with fun personalities and seem to enjoy the work.  I think many of the workers there were the same ones as the first time I ate there.  They have since renovated the bar to include 20 seats.  The seats are nice and comfy.  Everything is as clean as one would expect for a high traffic oyster bar.    Finally it's all about the food.  I personally didn't eat any oysters, but other seemed to enjoy it.   The two times I've been there, I ordered the Panroast Combo.  It's so buttery, creamy and delicious.  It's like a lobster bisque gumbo with crab, shrimp and lobster.  It comes with rice, and bun on the side.  At least at this point in my life, it's top five best foods I've ever tasted!  It's that good for my taste buds. Just don't wear clothes that are too tight or the seams will bust when you're done.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The newest menu Dec 2018
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Anytime you come it&#39;s likely crowded, line seems shorter late at night on weekdays.

iabNl5SH4_6NO7VbHnFrTw.text: You might need to look for the line if its your first time, but regardless, there'll be a wait at most hours. The question is how long? Is it 10 minutes or 2 hours?   If you think it'll be faster to order to-go, unfortunately you'll have to still wait in line as there's no separate line.  Why does it take so long you might ask? Well, everything is made to order and it's done in these cooking stations right in front of the patrons. There are only 6 stations.   After a week of being under fed / under nourished, we ordered a dozen oysters, the pan roast, bouillabaisse, and jambalaya. It seemed aggressive as the people next to us were like, it's like 2 servings per dish... and for 2 people to order 3 dishes and oysters... well.   Its very no frills - there's no need to rush. They serve you in the order you were seated. Be patient. Order, wait, eat, chill, have a beer.  Anyway, all the food was super on point. The gold band oysters are REALLY BIG. For all the dishes, I wish I ordered it just a little bit more spicy, but the flavour is really good regardless.  Highly recommended and will definitely return.

eN73DV8kqMEiDUHE3f6iHA.text: The wait is worth it! Located in a casino (cause duh, of course it's LOST WAGES, and everything is in a casino) we were seated and sat there waiting to order. Our server was nice and friendly. I ordered the linguine with clams and white sauce. It was very creamy and hearty! The pasta noodles were thick and very filling! I was definitely full by the end of our dinner. The prices are ok, usually going to pay more for surf and turf. I would come back to this place for sure.

LnbS97c3oncQoeNmqiGItg.text: Saw the reviews so we had to stop by and try it. Located at the palace station is a little bar called the ouster bar.  The chef holding it down for the whole spot is D. Brown and man is he phenomenal. He cooks the food for every person that stops by to eat. That is impressive because we waited an hour to get a seat and people would wait no matter how long the line is for the chef D. Brown.  We ordered 3 dozen oysters on the half shell and the house gumbo that has lobster crab and shrimp. Wow was it amazing and the chef really puts his heart into his food which why they are 4 1/2 stars on yelp with all the reviews.   Truly impressive so don't blink an eye or you might miss it. We will definitely be back every time we come to Las Vegas.  Thank you once again chef D. Brown and fantastic job.

_ZZzvd2Tfn6pUTk-8FADWg.text: One of my favorite go to's!!!   There's always a line but worth the wait! It's sooo good! The food is always on point and consistent! The staff is always calm and awesome! I don't know why it took me so long to write this review! But I definitely love this spot and highly recommend it to anyone that loves seafood!! The Crab Pan Roast is my favorite and my boyfriends is the Shrimp Gumbo!   Our last visit we had our usual and they were closing early for their monthly deep cleaning. I took notice that the staff always works so well together! They really have a great team! Steve and Victoria were great! Both welcoming and attentive. Eze is always a great chef! And loved that Blake helps all that he can with his team without even asking!   Great place and great people!

TCtXCVVWLEk4hl5vP2-OZw.text: Oyster Bar is one of those places that is "worth the wait"!    I have been there a couple of times now... and the first visit was met with almost two-hour wait.  I am so glad that I stuck it out because the Combo Pan Roast was what dreams are made of!    I have also tried the oysters and I think everyone should at least try them at some point... as they are very good.  BUT... the restaurant should probably be named "Pan Roast Bar".  Or even "Bouillabaisse Bar."  Of course, neither of those names have quite the same ring to them as Oyster Bar.  And since the name is probably not going to change anytime soon, let's just go with it.  Anyway, I digress... the Combo Pan Roast is creamy, delicious, and packed with lobster, crab, and shrimp!  All for about $24!    On my second visit, I learned the best tip from a local who had been there "around 100 times"... he suggested getting the Lobster Pan Roast AND adding crab to it.  This ends up costing a few extra dollars, but the combo pan roast is packed with A LOT of shrimp.  And let's face it, when ordering a dish with lobster, crab, and shrimp, the shrimp is the seafood that you want the least of.  This local's pan roast was PACKED with lobster and crab!   A thing of beauty that satisfies all of the senses!  *****FIVE STARS*****
