KpxY8Mne0BOrsvVct0Tlhw.text: This is probably my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas, yes you're going to wait two hours but make joy of it. Me and my friends love to drink in line and have a good time before we eat.

RdaSfiYEvSly_Y_Mq1r2WQ.text: Loooooooove it!! The must go place every time I visit Vegas! Pan roast is the MUST!! We went on a Monday and the wait was only 30mins! Lucky us!!

eZlk5-KTHfto9sj84n8Pdg.text: The best ever!! A must when you come to Vegas.  They are located in Palace Station - a little past the table games. It's a bar top little restaurant that fits 10-15 people at a time. As you walk up to Oyster Bar, there's a waiting area to the right - a set of slot machines and a roped area.  WARNING: depending on the length of the line and people eating at the counter, the wait time can be a few hours. Also, 21 and over only.  Believe me when I say it is worth the wait. This is the ONLY place I will wait in line for hours. The longest I had to wait was 1.5 hours. My mind wanted Oyster Bar and I was going to get it no matter how long I had to wait.  The staff includes 2 chefs (one was in training), 1 server, and back of the house employees. The server is always on top of his/her game - clearing and wiping the counter tops, refilling drinks, recording orders, going out to the line and asking people how many in the party, organize chairs accordingly, give bread and utensils, and conversing with the customers. I mean - WOW! This person does all this and then some. The chefs on this day were working hard and pushing out orders quickly - not too much conversation. My previous visit I had Chef Bob. He's so funny and great to talk to. This is a man who clearly loves his job.  Okay, to my entree - I had the seafood pot roast. Absolutely DELICIOUS. You are given a large bowl of stew with different types of garnishes, seasonings, and seafood with a scoop of rice. This entree can be easily split between two people. I advise you to be careful with the spicy level - it's no joke. I got a level 5 and that brought just enough heat to my liking.  Like any other downtown casino, it was a bit smokey but the people are very friendly and easy to talk to. The waiting area - well, there's not a good place to put it and I think they have a great system.  Please go here and have a great time!!

aN773W0vLaPgG5VhFRRAcw.text: The food and the service was excellent. The wait time sucked because of the limited seating at the bar area. I would have to say it was well worth the wait. I ordered the Alaskan clam chowder. It was out of this world.

lwuYW3fz4ZVg6UlV--iA-Q.text: Here's the reason for one star. (Long story short, sort to the main pint.) Someone battery assisted me right at the bar. I ended up on the ground. I blacked out for a few minutes. I was told the people that worked there, only concerned about the bills was paid when those guys ran off because one if the guy physically sock me in my face. The worker there at the restaurant did t come around to make sure I was ok, or my friend too. We both were assaulted. Other customers was the one who made sure I was ok.

I-shGs5jouDmbvSS-p5pnw.text: Come this place a lot but last night was totally diff experience. Ordered My usual boull-roast. Was so excited and hungry. But this time the taste was unlike before. And how RIC use to make it. The bowl was half filled with soup. The taste was blunt. I guess this chef is not having a good day at his ofc. Thats how it tasted. Go some other time of the day but nit graveyard PLEASE.

NYhXyEN06sHvwO7vqb430Q.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas!   Rule #1:  Do not go here if you are famished!  The wait will have you hangry... The line was ridiculously long this time.  I always get the pan roast, and I'm never disappointed.  Eze, the chef is a hoot, very personable and his hot sauce is amazing!  They need to bottle it up and sell it.  Even though I'm giving 5 stars, they should be ashamed for serving pre   made, refrigerated on the plate ready to serve nasty caesar salads!  But after waiting in line for 2 hours I complained to my friends and ate it anyways. lol

l6RtjEgHgMyV6mQRhQF2lA.text: Finally got a chance to visit this place and man are the reviews correct! This place is awesome and it truly does depend on when you show up when it comes to seating and wait times. Girlfriend and I showed up around 12:45am and only had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated. The service here was outstanding, the staff truly stays on top of everyone sitting along the 18-20 seat bar area. Half priced oysters after midnight is also a great deal, but not our style so we passed this time. Since we are locals, I cannot wait to come back and get some more of that shrimp linguine/ Cesar salad combo!

Oreagmq1em5lb71uar56rw.text: Waited 30 minutes to be seated. Oysters are fresh and tasty. Staff not the friendliest and slow to clean up between seatings (probably a reason for long wait times).Pan roast is excellent and worth returning for.

aLYQG2a62oy2Wot1ZKAURw.text: Simply wonderful. Even though we had to wait about an hour, the food was delicious. We had the  pan roast combo and it was a real treat. For our taste, we would get the spice level as a one or two to preserve the sea food taste. We also had a dozen oysters on the half shell and they were tasty as well.

x_tBIx2dtzuz7XQgJqaj7A.text: Throughout the entire weekend in Vegas, my friend was raving about how this place has her favorite pan roast (and she's tried many). So of course, on our very last day in Vegas, we had to make a stop here before heading back to SD.   This Oyster Bar is on the first floor in the middle of Palace Station. There's only about 18-20ish seats available, so it can take a really long time if you have a larger group. We ended up waiting about 45 minutes to an hour. I'm not going to lie... ya girl got pretty hangry by the end of the hour and I'm sure I was giving the death stare at the people who we were waiting on to finish. I enjoyed the fact that there were screens with fun facts and little tidbits about the meaning behind gumbo or why lobster/crab meat is pink as it provides a bit of entertainment while you're just standing around.   I recommend looking at the menu and figuring out what you want to pick before you're seated so you can be considerate for the people who are going to be eating after you! You don't want to be wasting their time just like you wouldn't want to your time to be wasted.   We ordered the New England Clam Chowder in a cup ($5.99) which was actually still a very generous portion, and was easily shareable amongst two people. The soup was wonderfully creamy and thick, and the clams pink and chunky. We also ordered the Combo Pan Roast ($24.99) containing shrimp, crab, and lobster. This was really fun to watch the chefs prepare as they cook the food (mostly just the pan roasts) right in front of you! My friend and I ordered it at a level 5 spiciness which had a nice amount of heat comparable to that of a jalapeno... actually.. maybe a little spicier than that. But the pan roast was decadent. The stew I wish I could have literally slurped it up with a straw, oh my goodness it was that delicious. The lobster was cut up into chunks and the shrimp was already peeled. My only qualm was that the crab pieces were small and shredded and you couldn't really tell it was in there as it seemed to have melted into the stew. It's a very small qualm and not one to have taken away from the experience.  I definitely recommend getting it with the rice, as the rice soaks up all the delicious tangy flavor while the pasta just seems to continue to cook in the stew making it too soft for my liking.   Truly I loved my experience here even though I had to wait an extremely long time but I find it worth it. I'm excited to come back and try even more!

YNiCsNj_3Ss-3N0l1avEcA.text: OMG the best food I have ever tasted! I wasn't sure at first but I now tell all my friends and family about this place! Great atmosphere and great chefs!!!! I have been truly blessed by knowing this place exists!!!!!

v4VvCXWtJfcord9u0xx27w.text: Located inside Palace Casino on Sahara.   Expect to wait in line, however ever now and then you get to be seated right away.  I recommend after two am on a weekday. Usually less cowards.   Definitely worth the super long wait, do not give up.   Usually do the calm chowder and a salad.  Work up to the Pan Roast with everything.  Oh my goodness, heaven in your mouth.  So much flavor. Creamy and spicy (pick your own heat level) with extra yummy.  I loVe it with white rice, however some individuals enjoy crackers. They provide you with a sour dough roll with every meal as well.   The alcohol selection is limited so get your drink on before you go over to oyster bar.  Mainly wine and possibly beer. Didn't notice drinks much was in awe of the chief.   The oysters are also good.  I just love the soups.

nJWJmD6up4fWVQ12Mrnngg.text: I don't give a shit what all the hype is about. I don't think it's worth it to go to this restaurant.   My boyfriend ordered the oysters during happy hour but we both thought it wasn't worth the price still. You can can get better oysters somewhere else at a way better price.   Only plus side of our visit to this establishment were that the drinks were good and the Bouillbaisse was decent.   The service for this place was one of the worst.. The chef would roughly throw his cooking tools around and the hot water that was pouring from the sink almost hit me but I reacted and backed up.   The two servers were extremely rude. I asked for a to go box for my food about 20 minutes ago and she forgot. And she continued to ignore us. So I asked the other server and she ignored me and took someone else's order.   It really annoyed me how they didn't have a sign of what their happy hour for oysters was. And how they don't have a sign for customers to tell them to wait at the line until they are to be seated. I saw a lot of annoyed customers coming up to the table and one of the servers stated yo no, there's a line there, go back to it. They would have less issues if there was organization involved. But they clearly aren't.   The servers spoke to customers in a rude and rough manner. There was one customer that wanted an oyster shooter. But the server with glasses told him no, you only get water. The customer asked again why not. She replied, do I have to spell it out for you?   The customer got frustrated and didn't understand. She threaten the customer by saying "Listen Honey, if you going to keep asking, I'm going to have to call security.. I didn't see a reason for her to be a bitch and beat around the bush. If she was just straight forward and told him how she believed he drank too much alcohol then he wouldn't have gotten aggressive. And there was no reason to treat him like he was stupid.   Overall, my experience was pretty shitty. It annoys me to have the servers here to be very rude to my boyfriend and I, and to the other customers. The food isn't worth the price in my opinion if the service was this terrible.   All the individuals in this establishment need to relearn how to do actual customer service. I also noticed one worker had music earbuds in while working. Great job guys, keep up the good work....

gsd73IftYbitzpwm9cqp5w.text: i can say that no matter which oyster bar i go to, i always enjoy the food and the hospitality of excellent customer service. they employees treat you like they care about your experience in their establishment. two thumbs up always for the oyster bar! keep up the awesome service..

ew7Bu-FB5Vg8YEXcXTrgPA.text: I was super shocked of how good this place is , friends recommended it so I had to try it ,super fresh sea food ,amazing pan roasts . Long wait but defiantly worth it

phWA_OQJbRTHgBPMdt5Mxg.text: BEST RAW OYSTERS EVER. After coming here, any other oysters aren't up to par. Thanks Oyster Bar for raising my standards and expectations. The wait? So worth it. I waited for about 2 hours and I was not disappointed. After I ate at this place, I went through a raw oyster addiction phase (my blood was 20% Tabasco sauce for a good month or two). I tried everywhere to find oysters that would match the oysters that I ate here with no success.   Hands down the best oysters I have ever had for such reasonable prices. I'm making it my duty to come back and visit this place every time I go to Vegas.

iHIus_3cg-zoK_SMDBHYnQ.text: I love this place!! A little pricey but well worth it!! When the in-laws come into town  we always order the oysters in a half shell and the New England clam chowder. Never disappoint!

YyP_JRk1ttO6FIb4hgCxqg.text: Allow me to preface by saying that this place is worth the wait. Hands down one of THE BEST meals I've had in my entire life. This is not an understatement. The dishes are too die for. I kid you not, I nearly cried/orgasmed with the sensation of joy of the fresh oysters, clams, and their hearty stewy dishes like the Boullabaise, the Gumbo, and the Pan Roast. OH the Pan Roast!  It's a small little bar, so the wait can get lenghtly. Food doesn't come out quick either so add that to the equation and you got yourself a hefty line. Thank goodness it's 24/7!   We started with the seafood combo of 3 large raw oysters, 3 large raw clams, and 3 shrimp cocktails. EACH was phenomenally delicious. Juicy of the sea, yet not fishy. Clearly, I was extremely impressed with this place. I loved the raw clams so much, I had to order a dozen more, and slurp them up with sauce, and fresh lemon squeezes. Heavenly.  The Seafood Pan Roast was lovely. If you're like me and love a kick, level 6 is a good one. Huge crab, lobster, and shrimp meat - with a tomato spice flavor, it was inexplicably sooooo delicious. I do recommend requesting the white rice on the side.  It's quite affordable for the luscious flavors and sinfully delicious experience you're gonna get. I already miss it. Take me with you!

xgWvEmYLXCOiixGgpFZgkw.text: As someone who was born and raised in Las Vegas, but has spent the better half of the last decade in New York, truly epitomizes what True Las Vegas dining is all about.   In my opinion, Las Vegas dining is a little different from New York dining because you have all the choices you want -- cuisines from A to Z, $ to $$$$ -- but the experience is different because the people and the culture are different. I think Vegas, being a service industry-driven city, showcases True hospitality in itsdining, which is incredibly unique to the city. Basically, the people generally seem to care more about what you think and about what your experience was overall.   Now to Oyster Bar. According to Eater, when this place was established in Palace Station 20+ years ago, it was inspired by New York City's Grand Central Station Oyster Bar. I've been to that Oyster Bar, and let me tell you -- the inspired Las Vegas version is a million times better.   I've been here twice with Amelinda L. and the food is incredible. No doubt about it. The pan roast gods have always smiled upon us because the wait to get seated can be up to 3-4 hours. The two times we went were around 10-11am after the Christmas holiday before New Year's, and we were able to get in within 30 minutes or less.   The bouillabaisse is incredible and so is the pan roast options (any, really). The dishes are rich, although the bouillabaisse is on the lighter side if the two were compared. The broths are incredibly flavorful and rich.   Recently, they made a secret menu item public -- the bouill-roast. As the name tells ya, it contains the ingredients of a bouillabaisse, but with the pan-roast sauce. I sampled Amelinda's today, and it marries the two dishes lovingly. Two thumbs up.   The only downside I can give is attributed by the fact that this place is so small. It only has 18 seats, and so it makes 1) waiting a bitch and 2) the arrangement of parties larger than 2 slightly more complicated. The staff does a decent job managing that though. And the chefs put a lot of care and finesse into what they do. It's truly a treat to watch their work in action and how they churn out delicious meals.   My water glass was constantly full, and it was incredible watching the staff dance around a tiny space, seat people, interact with people, and with each other. You can tell that there's a lot of pride here, and it shows with the way they treat people.   This place is a must for locals and visitors alike.

_ZnXEE-z2Nnm3yc188fkIw.text: Wow this place blew me away. Don't be fooled by the fact that it's not a full restaurant. This was one of my best food experiences of Vegas. Forget the overpriced buffets. The waitresses were so fun and very cool. They smiled the whole time and were fast, clean, professional. We were impressed not only by the service but the way they can handle large crowds. The lineup was long for 12-2am and we waited for about 1hr, but it was worth it. We even took some to go and had it on the plane on the way back (security was almost going to make us throw it out because its considered a liquid). We didnt know what to get so we looked around and asked what everybody was eating and the favourites seemed to be the pan roast and gumbo. I'm sure the other items on the menu are good too. This will be my new spot to come first when I come back to Vegas!

TkO69IrJ6ME4tvQGA8kD3Q.text: 4.5 stars   1hour we waited in line to eat here. Was it worth it? Hell yeah. This place is on fiyaahh. Well not literally but their pan roasts are. It's all about the pan roasts.   It's a small bar in the Palace Station that seats about 20 people or a little less. There were two people working their butts off nonstop, so be patient. From what they said, there's always a line no matter what time of day and we watched some diners being rude because of the wait which was definitely uncalled for. But the people took it in stride.   We waited an hour at around 11:30pm which I feel like was peak time since everyone was out and about and gambling. I was hungry and tired. Also a bit annoyed since people were sitting there talking story after they were done paying their bill. You could clearly see people were waiting in line. Just plain rude.   They have specials from 1am-9am:  oysters on the half shell $10 wine glass $5 bud light draft 16oz $3  By the time we sat, we qualified for the specials. The oysters were simple and huge!   So this place has what I like to call comfort food all made from scratch. They have various types of gumbo, pan roasts, pastas, etouffe, bouillabaisse, cioppino and steamed seafood like clams and mussels. But of all things, really you need to try the pan roast.   The pan roast is fresh seafood served with brandy, cream and tomato. It comes with a scoop of rice and they're made in individual pots right before your eyes. They work so fast and make so many at one time, it's amazing.   I got a combo pan roast with shrimp, lobster and crab. I'm glad that there were no shells. You can tell them how spicy you want it. I can't handle spice so I said mild and no spice (like a 1 or 2 on a scale of 10). Well, just to let you know, it was spicy and I needed another scoop of rice and beer to help me. It wasn't unbearable but the spice was there. But I knew it needed to be for the flavor. My boyfriend got the Palace pan roast which had shrimp, crab, chicken and andouille sausage. He got it at like a 7 and he loved it.   The portion is a pretty good size and two people could share if you're not super hungry. But there's a $5 charge on shared entrees. The combo pan roast was $23.99 which was worth every penny to me. They were so nice that they boxed it up for me to go since I was so full of beer and rice. They boxed it so well and saran wrapped it so it didn't leak. Next time I'll try the bouillabaisse or jambalaya mild. I'm sure it's freaking amazing as well!

pcXvOHRAeucpur74X3DS6g.text: I had the Bouillabaisse which was outstanding!  The best tasting seafood stew I've ever had, period. I had spice level six and it was prefect  (I like spice). I would have given this a 5-star review, but my husband's crab gumbo was too salty, which I've read is a complaint by some other reviewers. We also had half a dozen oysters, and they were fresh and delicious. The only other critique (besides the ridiculous wait- 45mins at noon)  is that I was surprised that the oysters weren't disconnected from their shell.  usually when you're paying a premium for seafood, you expect the oysters to be de-shelled. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone, and I will go back ( during off-peak hours).

Qd1dd4Jhrv3TBbSuEqWOCA.text: I didn't want to like this place.  Especially one hour into our two-hour wait, I was getting hangry (hungry angry), and I figured this would be like watching Avatar - unable to match the hype. But, I have to say the food is really good and props for the waitresses for keeping a smile.  Pros:  1) Food quality. Despite the hype, the food is good. We got the Alaskan Chowder and the Combo Pan Roast. There are huge chunks of tender lobster, lots of large shrimp, and tender pieces of real clam. Unlike many places where it is mostly soup with a few shreds of seafood, this is chock full of the good stuff. The Alaskan entree is way better than the regular soup items, and the best chowder I've ever had. I also feel that it is the best deal on the menu. The combo pan roast is also good, but costs a few bucks more for similar ingredients. They are also stingy with the rice; now I understand why many people get one pan roast, pay the $5 splitting fee, and get two plates of rice to better match one dish of pan roast sauce.  2) Service.  There's only 1 cook and 2 waitresses. They're working hard and nonstop. They're probably frustrated too. But they found a way to smile and instead of kicking the dog; they were really nice to all customers... enough so that I noticed and was pleasantly surprised. Soda refills were frequent and without needing to ask.   Cons:  1) Obviously the 2-3 hour wait.  Even if you go before you're hungry, the time goes slowly and you get impatient quickly. They seriously need to open a bigger restaurant or additional locations. It's worse in the casino because you're stuck inhaling all the smoke and getting lung cancer just to get your dinner.   2) Small kitchen. There are only 18 seats. Worse, there are only 6 steam pot thingies to cook the food. That means that it takes 3x as long to get through a round of people, which causes the 2-3 hour wait. Note that in between cooking, each pot must be cleaned - which takes as long as cooking.  3) Some of the customers. Things are slow enough, but some people are really inconsiderate which makes the long wait worse. - You had 2 hours in line to decide what you want. Don't look at the menu for the first time after you get seated, making the rest of us hungry for an extra 15 minutes. - This is not a bar. Don't sit there sipping a wine for 30 minutes before you even order your food. Eat and get out so the rest of the hungry people can have a turn. This is Vegas and you can get alcohol anywhere else. - This is not good for big parties. No better way to get mad than to see an empty seat or two (out of only 18) sit there unused for 30-40 minutes because they are trying to seat five people together, or four people done but waiting for the one slow eater in their group. Sit separately or find a friend who eats faster.  I'm glad I went once, but will not go again unless the wait is less than 30 minutes (which is only at 7am I'm told).

I called my credit card company and they just credit me back $3 so they didn't have to do the paperwork. I specifically wrote down the tip and total so I know what they are doing is fraud. I hope they read this and stop doing this.  5 star for the food. 0 for this problem.

2ASLhRaWqw5z5Uur-BfRag.text: I wish I could give 6 stars.  I've heard all the hype about Oyster Bar from my friends and family. I told them that they shouldn't put it on such a pedestal because once I get it, it won't be as good as they say. Let me just say that they didn't hype it up enough. Oyster Bar is for real. The hype is real. You HAVE to go when you're in Vegas.  Pan Roast I have never had such a bomb tasting Pan Roast. On top of thay, I've never had such a BIG Pan Roast. I couldn't even finish it. I forced as much as I could just on pure awesomeness of taste.  Clam Chowder Wow wow wow. I should have just gotten a cup instead of a bowl because I couldn't even finish the Pan Roast. Don't forget to add the crackers. Recommended but not required. So good.  Oyster Bar will be on my list each and every time I come to Vegas. 6 stars.

7u0tbs39w35QnX2AdPlhWQ.text: Some people come to Las Vegas to get cheap eats and some come to eat at the all you can eat buffets! For me I came to LV like a crazed hit man to knock off my Yelp bookmarks one by one. So here I am at The Palace Station Hotel & Casino to try the Oyster Bar. Having been to the Sunset Stations Oyster Bar so I knew that I was in for a treat again and I did not walk away disappointed from Palace Stations Oyster Bar. The dish ordered this time around was the Bouillabaisse Spicy with rice and a glass of Chardonnay. The spicy soup base and the fresh seafood was everything I expected from a great Bouillabaisse. yelp.com/biz_photos/oyst... I love watch the chef making my dish while sipping one the cool glass of wine. yelp.com/biz_photos/oyst... The Oyster Bar is always one of my must go to places when in town. Friendly Helpful Service. My LV Trip Bookmark #6

Kl9pGiXQShYFf_8XToQpug.text: Let me preface this by saying I LOVE LOVE LOVE oysters. I can easily have 3 dozen and still want more, so of course I had to eat at the Oyster Bar.   My friends and I were only going to be in Vegas for one night and all I wanted to do was eat here since it had been bookmarked for so long. Knowing that the lines are notoriously long, we woke up early to have breakfast here. There was no wait!! Yes!!!   My two girlfriends and I ordered: 1.5 dozen oysters, New England clam chowder, Manhattan clam chowder, and a combo pan roast.   Oysters-- remember how much I love oysters? I couldn't eat more than 6 of these. They were seriously the blandest oysters I've ever had. Lemon juice and Tabasco did nothing to the flavor. I've been to plenty of happy hour oyster spots where the oysters were just as cheap but the quality was so much better. I was so disappointed by these oysters :(  Clam chowder-- pretty good. Not the best I've had but definitely tasty. There was plenty of clams so that's always a plus.   Manhattan clam chowder-- my friend ordered this and when it first came out we weren't even sure it was her chowder. It was thicker than a typical Manhattan chowder. Still tasty but definitely not what she was expecting.   Pan roast-- definitely the star of our meal. There's plenty of seafood and the flavor was great!   Overall, the meal was just ok. We all agreed we wouldn't wait in line for this. Everything (aside from the oysters) was good but we've had better elsewhere. And if you're gonna call yourself "Oyster Bar" shouldn't your oysters be better than just sub par??

P_CLZRahQ272TTsfncmASw.text: The dishes are freshly prepared right in front of you. Most meals are cooked in these little pots. There are about 8 pots for 18 seats...so the wait time for your meal is pretty long unless you are only ordering oysters. One thing everyone noted is the long wait time which is about 70 minutes at the minimum. The total wait time for a meal at this place is at least 1.5 hours. The food is good, but in my opinion it is not worth such a long wait in a smoky retirement home casino.   I give this place a 4 stars because of the food is good. Definitely try this place If you happen to be in this depressing casino and the line is short....but I would not make a special trip out there. If you are staying on the strip, you will have to take a cab to get there.  Btw, there won't be a cab waiting outside for your return. You will have to get their outside staff to call one out for you.

JllhVOxdMRDIr4HVrbO6Rw.text: Food takes a while to cook, there's only 18 seats at the bar. Even though you could be the first person in line, if your timing's off and they just seated a round of people, you could easily wait 45 mins being the first person in line.   Now onto the food. DELICIOUS!!! I ordered the Combo Pan Roast at a level 6. It's got just a lil bit of a kick that tickled. Crab crab crab everywhere in the dish! If anything, I needed more rice to match the sauce. I didn't really know what kinda seafood Oyster Bar was going to be since my friend just suggested it without knowing himself. Now that we've eaten there, I would say this is a Cajun joint.

q11hyUO62ABtpHDCjBLjwQ.text: Every time I come here I try to give myself a pep talk that I'll order something other than a Pan Roast. If I'm unlucky enough to have to wait in line, I stare at the digital menu and commit to trying the gumbo, the lobster tail, the etouffee. But once I plop down at the seat, the inevitable happens: Pan Roast it is.   But that's because they're bomb as fuck.  It doesn't matter which one you get--Shrimp, Lobster, Crab or Combo (all 3), they're all absolutely fantastic. I usually get spice level 7 or 8, but that's because I require hot ass food. Spice it how you like, but the FLAVOR is there regardless.  Try your best not to stare at the meager countenances of the hungry, salivating customers in line as you eat who stare back at you with their arms folded, hoping you don't sit there savoring every bite for hours and just eat and get the fuck out already. Similarly, try not to walk around patrons looking them up and down with dirty looks as a "subtle" way to rush them.  I find that Sunday mornings I never have to wait. And I like the cook who's usually there. Any other time I go, there's a wait. Longest I've ever waited was an hour.    I say all this to say I will give up my 1st born for a Pan Roast at my disposal. Okay, not the 1st born. But maybe my pet. Okay, my neighbor's pet. It appears to be depressed anyway.

_Fxc4qGbiJTSfqDBjLcmkg.text: I LOVE this place! There is not restaurant in los angeles, ca that can compare to this place. I have been to a place called the broiler and it doesn't not come close to how good this place.  Food: The lobster pan roast is my favorite. It is a cajun broth type with spices, decent size lobster pieces, red/green peppers. I usually get it at about level 7 for spiciness and comes with a sourdough roll and a scope of rice. It is  a big portion, however, they do charge if you decide to split with someone else. I would recommend just getting your own portion because you will definitely want to take some home and eat it for later, it is just as good if you microwave it for a later meal. I've also had the claim steamers and that is decent.  I've tried the house pan roast but  I don't like crab meat.  Serivce: The line can sometimes get long but this place is now 24/7 so it really depends on when you go. Even if there is 2 people in line ahead of you, it can take about 1hr because it is a bar seating (good thing it is in a casino, so you can wonder around and let someone else wait in line or switch off). The people that work there are funny and entertaining.   You have got to try this place!!!!

yiTxBSTvHbA64naoNbEEzw.text: My Auntie persuaded me to eat here at 1230 in the morning.. it did no disappoint! The Pan Roast with Shrimp hit the spot,and satisfied my taste buds more than I ever thought! Rich, flavorful, fresh, satisfying.. superb! I am going back for dinner again b fore I leave LV! Oh, and the staff was very serviceable...

aS7FK3HBziPJtKfHZsqnmA.text: Took Yelp community's advice and ordered a combo pan roast, and was absolutely satisfied. I often think about the pan roast, and yearn for it. I'm actually beginning to salivate a bit as I write this review.  Expect a wait. Limited bar seating only, and it is popular. My wife and I waited about 30-40 minutes when we went around 11:30 pm on a weeknight. Worth the wait if you're not already starving.  Be vigilante though... The Palace Station's sports book was robbed at gun point more than twice.

AOzoQfXL0SVOomK5M3Y7eQ.text: The wait at the Oyster Bar is insane! But definitely worth the wait. I love the House Pan Roast, it is bursting with flavor in every bite. It is extremely rich, which makes it difficult to finish the whole thing. You can also choose how spicy you would like it, I might have gone overboard with the amount of spice I ordered but it was delicious!

yTHwDiXmN2RdULwOpWC3lA.text: My favorite spot that's 24 hours !! Ask for the opera sauce or the jowder not chowder jowder it's only on chef Holloman shift Tuesday thru Thursday grave yard shift so yummy !!! :)

F32EWf6znv8EzL7VCAqrQw.text: We went for lunch but after the 3 hour wait we ended up having an early dinner ! I never wait that long for anything ! It was worth it though, already thinking about what I want to order next time. Lol. Yes it's that good. The prices are great for the amount of seafood they put for you. If the wait was shorter I would rate it 5 stars for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XBZz1y4WyLOoIH-437kc_Q.text: I was excited to eat here, but now I have no idea how this place has such great reviews. The some food was good but definitely not worth the price. I don't understand the long ass wait for this food. It was way understaffed. Combine that with the fact that there are only about 15 seats, and the fact that people eat and sit there just doing nothing after they finish eating means it takes a few hours just to sit. Maybe if it's 30% cheaper and no wait it'd be worth it to go here. The cioppino, oysters, and little neck clams were so subpar and overpriced; I felt robbed. The gumbo was decent and the combo pan roast was delicious, but overall the food for the price and wait will never be worth it.

yLdU0wOofm5kgfV86xrJUw.text: Always a wait, but sooo worth it. I came here once with my parents and brother and fell in love. My parents eat here all the time and bring home leftovers. So. Good. The wait was roughly about two hours but so so so worth it. I'd come here all the time if I had the patience to wait.

tMnb_VB0E4tD3LkKowbuRg.text: Call ahead or stop by and ask for Chef EZ.... He is the best oyster bar Chef ever. SERIOUSLY .. The food this gentlemen prepares is absolutely delicious... Ask for his BBq shrimp and sausage ...

JxalwhE7a37LUuGAYJ_nTg.text: Oyster Bar is heaven. It's the reason I last came to Vegas with the bf. Yes, we went to Vegas primarily to eat at Oyster Bar. There just isn't anything around LA that's comparable.   I LOVE the Shrimp and Lobster Fra Diablo. It's the best. Last time I was a little adventurous and tried the Etoufee, but just wasn't feeling it. It wasn't bad; I just think the Fra Diablo is a tad better. Maybe it's the pasta.   Spiciness level I get is 4. I've had the 6 before and it was a bit too much for my tongue.   Don't go with a big party. It'll be almost impossible to fit more than a party at 4 when the bar only seats like 16-20 at most. Plus, you'll get dirty looks from the other people in line. Seriously. Especially if you're waiting in line and 4 of your buddies join you. (That's what happened with the big party in front of us). People were making comments such as: "Oh hell no!" and "Did they just cut"?   It was funny.   The longest I've waited would be probably an hour and a half for lunch. I would say go earlier like at 10a or 11a to beat the crowd.  You MIGHT get lucky. Might.

0rgZDhkL4X0XouvcYoFz6Q.text: Asked the waiter his recommendation, he replied combo pan roast.  WOW it was flavor packed. Large chunks of crab, shrimp, lobster. Wait time late Sunday afternoon was one hour, well worth it.

WeRGg7n4DMiwXSqapkKH_w.text: Famous long waiting line in this place.  I've been dine twice in this small bar counter restaurant.   This time I had a half dozen Oyster and pan roasted seafood (level 4 spicy).   I have to say this time, the pan roast was very salty and I needed to have a sour bread to dilute the taste in my mouth on top of a cup of rice.  A gentleman next to me ordered gumbo but same issue I had despite different dish.  He had to stop eating because too salty.    The chef was funny but with a twist.  Sarcastic jokes to customers, sometimes offensive.  It was midnight and he must be tired but that I don't count as an excuse.   As long as he talk to customer can't I expect some pleasant comments? Oyster was good but very pricy.   If you wanna try, ask less salt because you can always add it to your taste.   I'm sure they can make it again but only if you would wait for another 15min for sure.

YkBY0ke7x9fxt5nu2scWHw.text: Combo pan roast is da bomb...also got their bouillabaisse and that was a.m.a.z.i.n.g. I loved the amount of crab in that dish.  The oysters on the half shell were just ok though...surprisingly, I thought they'd be better. Waited about an hour at 1am on a late Wednesday/Thursday morning...and it just so happened they were going to close at 3am due to repairs on the main water line of the hotel so the water would be shut off for about an hour.  Last seating was at 2am...I thought we weren't going to make it in but luckily we did. I also thought there might be a Gangs of New York style riot every time they had to turn someone away while we were eating.  I guess that's how good this place is. Definitely want to come back and try their gumbo. That looked and smelled REALLY good.

GnwxSgcGSEayGoreZKqRdQ.text: Like the Steak House in Circus Circus, this great place is hiding inside a not so glamours casino.   The food is excellent, chef is very accommodating on this super busy joint, the price is a bargain. You have to forget about whatever diet you are on, live for the moment.   But every good things in life come with a price, there's an average two hour wait on almost any giving day.  We paid for his dinner to have someone got in the line for us 90 minutes before we arrived.  Totally worth it.

flA73Kq9eaU8M2vKSIIP3g.text: PAN ROAST!  Waited a little under 2 hours starting at 2pm on a Saturday. The tricky thing with the seating is that they wont seat a large party separately. So even though there are open seats, they won't move anyone to accommodate a larger group (5+). We probably could've been seated sooner, but had to wait around until 5 rows consistent seats became available. Ordered the Cioppino and Combo Pan Roast and it was DELICIOUS. Portions were large so we ended up taking it to go and had it as a midnight snack (which might have been better). Only sucky thing is that I asked for an extra scoop of rice for my to-go bag and they charged me $2.99. Boo...

F9ehp33949EPv6pyyPpnZQ.text: Food here is amazing! Especially the the pan roast. It's their specialty and thats all I'll order. They do have other great dishes, but to me nothing beats the pan roast.   Siting is limited so the wait is looooong, depends on the time of course. 1 to 2 hours waiting time is usual but if you have couple hours to burn, then it's worth the wait.

0AViUPw0qc241G5EFDpdMA.text: God Dammit Oyster Bar, everyone comes here for the god damn pan roast and for me the clam chowder was better. It's more like 3.5, but I'll round it up to 4 just because your oysters was that damn good.   Literally; its an oyster bar, but everyone raves about your damn pan roast. Is it worth the 2 times both at 2 hour long wait at 3-4am after a long night of clubbing? No! Luckily, I think the chef opened up Ritters in Los Angeles where I can avoid driving 4 hours and waiting 2 hours for the pan roast.   The Pan roast is basically a FATTY ass version of a Manhattan Clam Chowder and add seafood. I'm not a fan of Manhattan clam chowder but I love Clam Chowder and I got to say that Oyster bar has gotten their cream ratio on point. (Literally if you watch the chef cook the pan roast you notice he drops a giant slab of heavy cream into the pot) Which is why people love the Pan Roast so much, because its half fat and people love fat!  What did I like besides their CREAMY ASS clam chowder (Cheaper than pan roast and more flavorful in my opinion) I mean the Clam Chowder is 8.99 and Pan Roast is 23.99.   DUN DUN DUN, THEIR OYSTERS, its a oyster bar and this has to be the best god damn oysters I have had. They are fatty Illinois oysters.   TL:DR YOUVE BEEN WARNED, ITS LIKE A 2 HOUR WAIT.

yqF96AfOjAshwXRFUkt7DQ.text: This place is phenomenal! We had the combo pan roast oysters and the steamed shrimp. Some of the best seafood I've ever had.  Unfortunately there isn't much seating and the wait can take a long time. Not really a place for a big group since it's really just bar type seating.

Y21Ltt1msPFnbMXFi_isJg.text: On a recent visit to Vegas my boyfriend insisted we give this place a try. I'm not a huge seafood fan but agreed to go for him. I was a skeptic but I have to admit that I was completely blown away! I've eaten at lots of seafood places with him but have never had anything as good as this place. I can't even describe how good the food was!  I had the house Etouffee and it was absolutely incredible! Lots of giant shrimp, crab and lobster. My boyfriend had the pan roast and we split a shrimp cocktail. I'm telling you, this place is so good I can see why people wait in line for two hours just to eat there.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Only 14 seats but so worth the wait!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H9LGbFcLGpOoOXAycp0QMw.text: Always our first stop in Vegas! It's so good that once we made a stop here driving from LA to Zion National Park.   We find our selves braving the 1.5-2 hour wait over and over again because it's just that good! Expect there to be a wait, regardless of the time you come. We've come at 6 am on a weekday morning and still waited 1.5 hours, 2 am on a weekend and still waited 2 hours. Don't be discouraged by the wait though. It's so worth it!  We usually get the Palace Pan Roast, which has shrimp, crab, chicken and andouille sausage. The spice level ranges from 1-10. They also have 23 oz draft beers for $10 that comes with half-price refills.   Can't wait to come back for the pan roast!!!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen oysters for $19.99

FSPtXHoOU-Vz5-ToLXGG6w.text: This is one of the best seafood spots in Vegas, hands down!!! If you don't want to wait in the long lines, you can go to the other ones.  You can visit The Oyster Bar at other casinos and they have more seating room.  Trust me it's worth the drive.  By the time you wait in line, you could have driven, eaton and driven back to you hotel.  Love this spot!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jVAOnBjgWRE8uvKHlAgQlw.text: I've always heard great things about The Oyster Bar but never knew what to expect. So let me tell you.   First of all it's an actual bar that seats about 20-25 people at a time. When we arrived around noon on a Monday there were a few people in line....maybe 3-5 groups of 2 no more than 4 people per group were ahead of us. We literally waited a little over an hour to be seated. That's right because you are waiting for people to order, eat, pay, and leave. Everyone who passed by the line all said the line is terrible but it's worth the wait. Okay...so we stayed encouraged. Don't quit.   What a wonderful feeling it is to be at the front of the line. We are next. Things are moving quickly. And 3 seats for us are finally available!!  As soon as we are seated they put one warm dinner roll in front of you with some butter and take ur drink order. The roll is good but we almost asked for another. So glad we didn't. We ordered 2 of the House Gumbo, a chicken gumbo, half dozen oysters, and a shrimp and crab Caesar salad. When I say the portions are HUGE!!!! They are HUGE!!! Like I needed someone else's appetite to help me finish this. We should've shared EVERYTHING.   So the salad was so good and cold and full of shrimp and crab. Definitely would stand in line for that again. The oysters were so fresh and yummy!!! The gumbo. Sadly I wasn't impressed with the gumbo. I've had better. And I think my whole reason for coming was FOR the gumbo.  But again...the portions are ginormous. You definitely get your money's worth (and time too).   I gave them 4 stars because they need to be able to prepare orders to go for people who don't need to sit at the bar. At this time the only way you can get an order to go is by waiting in line to sit at the bar and order and well if you do all that you might as well sit at the bar and enjoy. Or they could open up more tables somewhere that's associated with their establishment.   Also, again the gumbo wasn't that great for me. But I have friends who love it so maybe just an off day or different chef.   Finally the wait staff was very nice as accommodating.   I'll definitely be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n7RmmpaMXONFlTz-lktXFA.text: Hidden within Palace Station, their usual long line is worth the wait. One of the better oysters I've eaten and their Combo Pan Roast hits the spot anytime of the day!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jOWKKJYwhiVsXSG_DLJYpA.text: Who would have thought Palace Station would house such a food gem!  Oyster Bar is a 16 seat bar/restaurant inside Palace Station Casino. If you read reviews, you should know, they wait can be crazy. Especially if you have a big party. Be ready for the line to move slow also, they cook to order right in front of you and this is not food you can just scarf down right away.   I got really lucky and came at 10:30 am on a Saturday and it was empty!!!  Service was friendly. They split our groups bill per couple. They do charge a 18% gratuity for large parties.  Combo Pan Roast - $23.99 - Seafood heaven in a bowl. Probably the best seafood dish I have ever had. The tomato cream sauce was one of the most flavorful sauces I have had. Thick and creamy with the taste of the sea from the seafood that it's cooked with. The combo comes with fresh lobster, shrimp, and crab. And you get a ton of seafood too. When you drench the rice with the sauce, it was like biting into heaven. I could not stop my self from eating all of it. The portion is pretty heavy, I was full and sleepy all day.   Alaskan Chowder - $18.99 - Another best for me, best clam chowder I ever had. Thick and rich creamy chowder packed full of shrimp, crab, and lobster. They do not use much potato filler in this chowder. You get a ton of seafood with each bite. Worth every penny.  Rice - $2.99 - They keep asking if we wanted more rice and of course we did. It would have been nice if they told us it costs 3 bucks extra. My only complaint.   Sourdough Bread - Complementary - Dry and stale. I tried to use it to mop up my pan roast sauce but it was not good.  Spice Tip, anything over 5 they just dump more chili flakes into it, so get 5 and just add more flakes if needed.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast - $23.99
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan Chowder - $18.99
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cooked to order

1wr3C8Wqur96puKEBxGMYQ.text: Great food! It was an hour and a half wait and I was really skeptical at first but it was worth it. All the food was fresh and amazing. The oysters were shelled right. The Cajun style shrimp was some of the best I have had. Just note we only got a 3 on the heat and that was plenty! Definitely going to go back!

_hzXqAXsw5XhO6ZR9ngvOQ.text: Pan Roast!!! So good, so pricey!  Love the food here, its always worth the price.  I don't think I have found anywhere in the world that compares to their pan roast.  The problem is... there are only like 16-18 spots at the counter.  Some days you get lucky, sometimes not.  You also need to be over 21 to eat there (sorry kids!).

92VFmDnA4Jsga_QHGGrFhw.text: Well the first time I ate here I wasn't pleased  So I gave it another shot and wow! Awesome will def be coming back

1lTrfljv5-v7QwkFbBbURg.text: Luck of the draw, we walked up to the bar with two seats open just for us. Of course, this was early evening on a weekday. Almost immediately after we sat down, the waiting line started growing and growing. This wasn't just a meal, it was a whole show. Our team for the night was Chris and Eze, who seemed to make the bar work like a well oiled machine. It's mesmerizing watching them prepare the food. Of course, they were super funny too so that adds a star to my experience. Our service was good, but it did take a while for them to prepare the food. Watching the whole process, I can definitely understand why it took a while for our food to be ready.  I also have to note that we co-incidentally sat next to three guys who just got in from Hawaii. We at and talked story the whole time. After my dining partner gave me to them for the evening, they all shared their food with me so I could taste more items on the menu that what we ordered. That's True aloha spirit, which went well with our discussions about our family on the island and how much things have changed in Honolulu over the years.  Okay - back to the food. We ordered the pan roast (heat 7) and clam linguine (heat 7). Sooooooooo good! I only wish we got the dishes more spicy. The depth of flavor was immense. Watching all the ingredients that went into the dish definitely added to my tasting experience. Loaded with seafood (shrimp, crab and lobster), the combo pan roast was rich and creamy. This is definitely not something you could eat all the time, but worth a splurge on your diet. The linguine was a solid dish. I never had it spicy before, but spicy definitely added to the taste experience. I am glad we didn't order  appetizer or salad, because the dishes we  did order were huge servings.  My new friends let me try the oysters - large sized oysters that were not gritty at all. Great with horseradish and tabasco. The alaskan chowder was tasty and loaded with seafood. This dish wasn't spicy, but the addition of shrimp, crab and lobster added more depth of flavor. I could really taste the seafood.   All in all, it was a great experience. I can't wait to go back.... and I hope there isn't a long line next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast - level 9 this time (still could have been hotter)
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gumbo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The mixin&#39;s of a pan roast

pLNF9DMrVT79n6797K8ikg.text: To start, I loved the combo pan roast. We chose a level 5 spice level but wished it was spicier. Level 5 was not spicy at all so I wish we got a level 8 or higher. The raw oysters and clams were good, but I've had better. The staff was very friendly. Overall, the place was good but I don't think it's worth the long wait. Some people wait more than an hour. We came at 8:50pm and got seated around 9:30pm.

hkFu38YSPPqrScd7yWjRSQ.text: Where do I start?  My husband and I was told to go to the Oyster Bar by so many people that we encountered. Everyone kept suggesting the Pan Roast (we each ordered the combo). We waited about 45 mins to be seated....WELL WORTH THE WAIT!!! Eze  the chef was absolutely amazing and entertaining. If and when you are in Vegas...leave the strip and get a savory taste of some good ole creole!

4YoJe4wGNsQ2i1kTN0rhrg.text: Amazing food! So worth the wait. Steamed oysters and seafood pan roast were excellent. Save your roll for dipping!

l_XcOz1x2V6SpKJdwLfCtQ.text: A definite must visit spot when I'm in Vegas. Pan Roast, Gumbo, Cioppino...it's all GREAT!!!  A cozy oyster bar with maybe 20 seats so be prepared for a wait.  I've been a few times between 3am - 9am and was able to be seated right away.  It's a little weird to eat this for breakfast, but you get over it real quick.  I love gumbo so that's what I typically get with a spice level between 5 and 8.  Three's not much  else to say that hasn't been said.  If you are a fan of seafood, you MUST try Oyster bar.  The oyster platter is a good deal and they tasted fresh.  Helpful Tip: Especially if you have a large group, they let one person stand in line.  It makes everyone else behind you a bit upset so be prepared for a few evil eyes.

4Vo7SkudGbIo4xaoP_4pCw.text: 4 Star only for the wait (about an hour) and amount of seats available (about 18) and the inefficiency to let parties of one sit in single seats available.  I guess they are big on customers not cutting, even if parties ahead of them say its ok.  Now onto the food.  Got half a dozen oysters, Alaskan clam chowder and the Palace Pan Roast.  Oysters weren't the greatest I ever had (especially for being called Oyster Bar) but they were huge and weren't bad by any means.  Clam chowder was great, lots of crab with a hearty taste.  Palace Pan Roast was the best by far.  Had shrimp, crab, sausage, chicken- with plenty of it.  It wasnt too creamy or too liquidy.  All of this was split between myself and a friend, definitely way too much food for the two us.  The portions are huge!  Definitely would recommend coming in small parties (3-4 max).

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half a duzzz

HR7SLlftIx-Yv6aCtwl8hg.text: Just wanted to play slots at Palace but hubby saw there was only one person in line so he jumped in. Said I HAD to try it as it was an institution. Had oysters and a combo pan roast! The broth was creamy, hearty, and so hood! I dunked my bread in it and wish I had more! If you are in the casino and the line isn't too long, go for it

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamy pan roast loaded with shrimp, lobster and crab!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters raw!

gGXtVYxmnL_9Ba_AVyk52Q.text: I'm definitely a fan, but I don't think it's good as it gets. After waiting over an hour at 1 am (yes, at 1 am), we were seated at the 18 seat bar. The bar is next to a variety of slot machines to increase the overall price of your Oyster Bar experience. After we were seated, it was another 10 minutes before someone took our order. We ordered the a dozen oysters, Pan Roast, and Etouffee. After 15 minutes, our food was served.   Thankfully we were able to take advantage of the midnight special where (June 2016) 1/2 dozen oysters are $10. Not bad. We devoured those oysters on the shell in minutes. Tasted fresh, meaty, and no fishy taste whatsoever. So for you oyster snobs, the oysters most likely lived above water. Regardless, very tasty, especially for the price.  The Pan Roast and  Etouffee both tasted similar to me. We ordered level 7 spicy, but unfortunately, the cook forgot to add the chili oil. We were too tired to complain, but still both of those dishes tasted hearty with plenty of seafood essence. Someone seated next to us noticed that we were griping about the lack of spiciness and offered us to try her Etouffee. She ordered level 6. Were we about to taste a complete stranger's food? Of course, it's Vegas. It tasted really good with that extra heat. I recommend ordering the Pan Roast or Etouffee with at least a level 6.  The complementary sourdough bread was dry. You'll need to drench it in butter or dip it in the Pan Roast for it to be edible.  Glad I tried Oyster Bar and it's a must try on your next visit to LV.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Etouffee and Pan Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!

YQG4iWCHcLe9OTtbAhGeZA.text: Let's start with the only reason I didn't give them a 5 Star and that's the wait time. This is only a bar so there are no tables to be seated. The bar had about 15 seats so expect a wait time to be seated. I've heard the lines can be as long as 2hrs so plan ahead. Usually it starts getting long after 10pm. Note: 21 and over only to be seated at the bar. No kids are allowed   Food here is awesome! They make all the food when you order! I personal enjoy food made to order and don't mind waiting.  We had the oyster appetizer and boy was that fresh! It tasted so good! For my main course I had the Palace Pan Roast! I highly recommend any of their Pan Roast you won't be disappointed! If you like it spicy bump it up to about a level 4. You can go higher than 10 if needed.   The service was great since it's so small they are able to always refill my drinks and check on me. The staff is very friendly and they had no problem chatting with us while we wait for our food.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NUoBRg_sMOrPCicofOauhA.text: The food here is one of the best and sometimes hidden secret of vegas, who would have thought a run down casino in vegas has such great food , only maybe 15-20 seats only at a bar ! And the wait can be up to 2-3 hrs at its peak but boy even if I had to wait just to get a taste of this heaven In a bowl ...trust ....I WILLLLL. But luckily today we get so damn lucky and only had to wait 15min! Unreal! Lucky I know. I usually get the pan roast , but they have a new hybrid dish with half bouillabaisse and half pan roast so we get that and gumbo , plus seafood platter which had shrimp , oysters and clam on the half shell.the oyster n clam was so so , my friend liked it but I'm picky about my oysters . The shrimp tho ! GET THE SHRIMP, so big and good.  Gumbo was soooo good, and so was the hydrid it was so good I drank the whole sauce,,,, lol like soup .  Second item that was surprisingly good was their Bloody Mary !! I don't even like tomato juice lol, but I have fallen in love with their Bloody Mary lol

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gumbo was soooo ono

KS8j4hzZao0tIWOTD5Ompw.text: I've heard about this place so many times and I finally got to try it. It's located in the Palace Station by the Rewards Center. The Oyster Bar is open 24 hours and 7 days a week. I believe there are only 18 seats. We waited about an hour to get seated. You can see the Chef prepare and cook your food. ::Food:: First, we got a warm and fresh sourdough bread with butter. My favorite pasta is Linguine with Clams, I wanted to order it so bad but I decided to try their famous Pan Roast that everyone raves about. I got the Combo Pan Roast which came with shrimp, crab, and lobster. For spicy level, I choose mild; the spicy level option is from 1 to 10. The portion was more than enough for me. It also came with a side of white rice. It was thick, flavored well, and creamy. The shrimp, lobster, and crab tasted fresh. My friend got the Bouillabaisse. It had celery, shrimp, crab, lobster, cod, mussels, and clams. Both of the dishes were delicious! I prefer the Bouillabaisse because it's lighter and less filling; I was so full. (yelp.com/user_local_phot...) (yelp.com/user_local_phot...) ::Customer Service:: Cleaning the table is a little slow. Steve who took our order was very friendly. ::M's Notes: -I had bad reception but search for the free WiFi. -$5 Shared Plate Charge on Entrees -Wine by glass $5 -50oz Beer $15 -23 oz Beer $10 -16oz Bud Light Draft $3 -Oyster Shooters (Tequila, Vodka, Beer, Virgin) $4 or 3 for $10 -Oysters on the half Shell (1/2 Dozen) $10 -Open 24/7

Joo6buqRIgZu6ZfNCjt3Pg.text: Waited about an hour, which is a short wait from what I've heard. There is ONLY bar seating at this little place in the middle of the Palace Station. No tables. So you just wait for people to clear the bar. Had the oysters (great!) and the clams (Pretty good, but lots of oregano so if that's not your thing...) and the special pan roast which was AMAZING! Worth the wait!

NHS_iFEwsGq9QYhFg7a9wA.text: The best oyster bar in town!! If you ever come to vegas, you have time visit this place. First come first serve. The line is usually 2-3 hours wait. But if you go before 11am then the line is not too bad. I loved everything I tried their but the best is the pan roast. My husband likes the Alaskan chowder. But pretty much everything is good and super fresh there!

X1HDw_LAcUybw8NwJKopSA.text: Arrived 11 AM on Friday Waited 30 minutes in line Waited an hour for the food  The Combo Pan Roast was so BOMB. I got the level 5 spicy. I plan to get maybe 7 or 8 next time. It had a good kick, but I could tolerate more. The combination of shrimp, crab, and lobster was amazing. I think it was totally worth the wait and the cost. Lots of flavor and the soup was hot and creamy. Definitely big enough to share, but I wanted my own for the higher spiciness level :P

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast... sooo goooood

m0XP-7wIjI8QOxhE1cTmWQ.text: Slave girl has been dreaming about oyster bar for awhile. We finally left home early enough to get to Vegas in a decent time to eat here.  The parking was no problem, the problem was the wait time. We got there around 2:30pm on a Saturday thinking everyone should be full already from lunch, especially when I only saw about 20 people ahead of us. Ooooh my farting God and their 18 seats only restaurant.... It was 4:30 when we finally got seated. Thank goodness we found 99 cents frozen margarita and free WiFi, but if you were in line by yourself... You better make friends with the people behind you and offer those 99 cents margarita if you want some while waiting.  What we got: combo pan roast, Alaskan chowder, and a dozen of oysters (well, oyster bar, hello?). Pan roast was awesome! Not so sweet and packed with goodies. Oysters tasted OK but lacked the fresh oyster flavor. All I could taste was fresh water and sauces were required for flavoring. A little disappointed. The chowder was the worst of the 3. It was very salty and not editable for us.  When I asked chef Ricardo about the saltiness, he took a taste of the unprocessed chowder base and told me it tasted OK to him. Well, if he had tasted mine, the one that has been concentrated and cooked in a pot, by him, he would have agreed with me. (that means he doesn't taste his food) Then, he told me the chowder base was not made by him so he couldn't speak for the taste... Hmmmm. When I asked him if he could do anything to make my chowder less salty, he said there was nothing he could do. I am no chef, but I know you can probably add water/milk/cream/rice/bread to make the food editable again. Hmmmm...  Would I come back again? Yes, because I like the pan roast a lot, and I still wanted to try their gumbo. But my first time experience here was na na na.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That&#39;s Ricardo.

pvU46PKsGFddKhrTXpKlhQ.text: Worth the wait, even though it was a two hour wait and I was on the tail end of losing from hunger lol it was definitely worth the wait. I ordered the half dozen gold band oysters. I wasn't sure about farm raised oysters but let me tell you, they were delicious, meaty, no brine, and uniform. I also ordered the combo pan roast which has the shrimp, crab, and lobster which was amazing. All priced just right. While we had an oyster bar at hard rock where I was staying the go to place is out at the palace station, worth the drive and the wait.

D2I0QsxyOJ6qVGqub2wRfw.text: THE CLAM CHOWDER... THE GUMBO... AND THE OYSTERS!!!!  the food was so good!!! Oysters were fresh. Gumbo had a lot of meats and seafood (house). The clam chowder was so rich and creamy!! Worth the wait

fiHx2FYFz1JEaOdJTQNu_Q.text: Came here with a friend at 2 o'clock on a Friday. Short line in front of us so we patiently waited. This place is a small little bar in an open casino so you'll have to deal with all the smoke and noise. Line is standing only. No sitting... And you can't leave or else someone will take your spot. For two people we waited an hour and a half to get seated!!  I felt like people lingered there forever. But I was starving and was not willing to give up.   Once I was seated I thought... Hallelujah...I'm going to eat!!!  Finally!!!!... I wolfed the bread and butter down, which they serve you immediately. We ordered right away and I looked hungrily at the pots of steaming broth. I waited and waited and waited.. And an hour later my food was ready!  They reason it took so long was because they only have 8 pots to cook with. So even if you're seated you still have to wait for other orders to be cooked before yours.   We ordered the pan roast and the etouffee. Portions were large and it came with a scoop of rice.  The pan roast was delicious!!  It tasted like creamy rich garlicky tomato soup with seafood in it. I loved it!  It has a sweet aftertaste that I really like. The etouffee was very salty!  I had to drink a lot of water and eat a lot of rice with it. My friend and I had to trade because the monotone salty flavor, although good, was really overwhelming after three bites.   Overall I enjoyed my experience. I got to watch the chef cook... Which was really scoop things into the pot, and people watched. The pan roast was sooo good!  Etouffee was ehh... Would not order it again. If you come be prepared to wait. The chef said there is ALWAYS a wait...

kVswSxqE1EzHbxlwlwh3Xw.text: MY GOODNESS!! I had to wait until my birthday to go because it was the only way I could get my Husband and crew to wait in line for over in hour for food.  BOY OH BOY WAS IT WORTH IT!  Everything we had was Excellent!!  everything.

tQojflo_tppsCGo8iAjPGg.text: The food here is fantastic.  There is a lengthy line at times, but it's worth it.  I took my time enjoying my food too once I was seated!  I always get the Gumbo with crab, lobster, and shrimp.  It is so good!

af7omonwhMDOUKut5Wz-Lw.text: I love seafood. Every time we go to Vegas we must go to the oyster bar. The wait is very long but worth it. If you in the morning the wait is less. The portions are huge, they charge $5 to split a meal. They always give a complementary piece of bread. Be careful what heat/spicy level you choose, they are very spicy lol I got a 7 and I could barely eat my food and I love spicy. They also have hot sauces available to use so I would suggest not going higher than a 6 on your meal. They have the best oysters I've ever had, so fresh and delicious. My favorite meals are the cioppino and the pan roast. They have great staff and service.

OrAU3P4LHLWtxrQzRGI7mw.text: My sister in law recommended this place. She said they have the best gumbo and pan roasts in Las Vegas! She warned us about the wait time. We got there around 1:30 AM and didn't get seated until 3 AM. I ordered the combination pam roasts and absolutely love it. It's creamy and tasty with generous amount of lobster meats and shrimp. Once seated service was fast and great. Would come back!

SPyJ5rkFC5d1QWn0xqVUbQ.text: 5 stars for food, -1 star for restaurant ambiance/wait times.  The original Pan Roast restaurant which started all the ones in OC.  The food is really good here but the wait times are atrocious.  Would I do it again?  Probably not.  We arrived around 1AM and easily had an hour wait.   Jambalaya - Solid 4/5 -Jambalaya was really good.  I liked it, but I'd go w/ the Pan Roast every time.  Combination Pan Roast - Solid 4/5 - $28 -The Pan Roast was delicious.  It really felt like comfort food and you can eat it anytime.  I went w/ spicy level 10 and it had a very nice kick.  Order this dish.  PROS: -Food is solid, 4/5 stars easily.  I've eaten Pan Roast at lots of places in OC and this is easily 10x better.  CONS: -Super tiny venue, seats only 15 people. -You can't queue for a table, and have to wait in line.  Expect a good 1-2 hour wait.  TIPS; -Located in Palace Station Casino

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast $25

avTiyhQSbM5OZUI9_6_SAQ.text: My hubby and I stumbled upon the Oyster Bar with the help of Yelp. We were in Palace Station for bingo but realized it was getting late so hubby suggested we find a place to eat at Palace Station.   So I do what any faithful Yelper would do, I open my application to see what good places are in this place. Low and behold, I see the reviews for the Oyster Bar and look up and realize we're standing in front of it.   It's an unassuming bar inside the casino, out in the open. Or should I say it looks like a bar but is actually a full service restaurant where they cook the entrees in front of you. I didn't initially notice the line of people waiting patiently. So, of course we had to try this place. We waited for close to an hour or more before we eventually got seated.   The reviews don't lie. This place was all types of amazing. We got the combo pan roast, the cocktail shrimp, some drinks. It was all simply amazing.   I asked one of the workers if he thought I could get on the plane in the morning with my leftovers because there was no way I could finish it (portions are huge) and no way I could leave it. He said some people freeze it but for the most part, you can't get through airport security with it.   So I ended up mixing mine with the rice. And sure enough my bag got pulled at security, but they took it out, took a brief look and the TSA agent was like "man I'm hungry now". Lol So yes, the rice made it thicker so it wasn't like a soup any longer. But you better believe it was still amazing even when I got it home.   This place was so amazing that when I returned to Vegas a couple of weeks later, I had to take my bestie.   Now the second trip to Oyster Bar there was a little drama involved because they're open 24x7 and of course me and my bestie end up there on the one day in the month when they close for 8 hours to do a deep clean. Now the sign said they closed at 1am but they were kicking folks out of the line at 12am. I had an issue with this, #1 because we were some of the folks they kicked out the line and #2 because I knew I wasn't paying to take the ride back out to that side of Vegas.   Sooo to make a long story short, I contacted mgmt and they were accommodating and seated us, as there was still a load of folks still being served. And yes, it was still amazing. I highly recommend them. I would give this place a 5+ stars if I could.

7Y9vASEQRM4x2ZftZz3ynA.text: This is a great place to eat a nice hot seefood meal.  You will be waiting a long time to get seated. But its worth it. The chef and staff are great interactive and make it enjoyable. The prices are decent if your in a budget.

gloZVmh_G8fYsA1CWv2AQg.text: Struggling to write a review for this place as part of me wish this place is hidden and less people will line up for hours just to taste the crown and jewel it has to offer. However with heavy heart I must say this place is too good that I and along with many others feels that they (Oyster Bar) should expand seating area to allow for more seating and reduce wait time during peak hours.

VN5tIRkuPJr33K7Qj9HhDw.text: 2nd time here and I will continue to go back, I literally want to go back to Vegas simply to eat here again. Extra rice will also be requested. Wait times I hear are crazy so I try to go at odd hours and both times the longest I've had to wait for max of 45 minutes, be warned they do move slow, given the lack of space, so be prepared to wait, SOOOOOO worth it though.

q380hS0pCGesnhrjsCj5wA.text: MUST GO!! MUST MUST MUST! During holiday or peak weekends, the line is ridiculous, so come during weird  hours (3-5AM). My fav is the combo pan roast. It's amazing and can feed 2 people.

syOJZf_YdR2lA2OuvgExNg.text: Even though I had to wait almost 3 hours, it was well worth it! This place is amazing!  I got here about 2:00am and got seated close to 5:00am. This was on a Friday night so I was expecting the worse. I did however get to meet some very cool people and most were first timers just as I was. I ordered the combo pan roast with a spice level of 7 and all I can say is WOW! The flavor is so unique and original. I've never had anything like this before so I now consider myself a pan roast fanatic lol. The staff was great and they were very kind, interactive and told us the best time to come and avoid a long wait (Between 5am-8am). A person I met in line was even kind enough to offer some of their gumbo to me since they were a regular. It was just as good as the pan roast but with a bolder flavor. I totally recommend this to anyone. Now that I am a resident of Las Vegas this will definitely be apart of my life regularly.

vzR8VgTw87v0ZvjCywVvBA.text: LOVEEEE this place, HAATEEEE the wait.  Oh Oyster bar, why do you have to be located in such a shitty location and only offer 18 seats ?! Oyster Bar is definitely the ONLY reason I would ever venture out to Palace Station again.  Soo is it good enough to look past the two hour long wait, second hand smoke, and horrible reception?? Yes...yes it is.  The service is friendly and the portions are huge and delicious.  After starving in line, you really do start ordering with your eyes.  We ordered two dozen oysters, clam chowder, and the combo pan roast. Everything tasted so fresh and filling!  The oysters were soo fat, clam chowder was creamy, and the combo pan roast was very flavorful.  There is not a huge selection on their menu, but what they do have is all they need.  I will definitely be back here!  OYSTER BAR- PLEASE EXPAND ... OR EVEN BETTER, MAKE YOUR WAY OVER TO LA!! :D
