Many thanx to Sandra the waitress, Bob the chef and one other chef (Asian guy) but I didn't get his name. If the owner is reading this, we dined around 3:30pm on September 7th, 2012. Sandra is a sweet heart. She knew we had a large party and did her best to seat us all together and made sure we were happy and taken care off. Bob has a very sarcastic sense of humor and bantered with us the whole time and so did the other Asian chef when they had the shift change. We all believe Bob overheard us saying  that level 5 spicy wasn't that spicy and took offense. When all of my friends ordered level 7, I think he gave it something extra because it was SPICY. Luckily for me, he didn't cook my dish until last so I was able to taste my friend's level 7. Immediately after sampling level 7, I barked at Bob to make mine a level 6. He looked at me, laughed and called me a name that rhymed with wussie. Everyone at the counter busted out laughing. It was the most enjoyable part of my vacation. All of us definitely will be back.  By the way, the dish that I ordered the second time was cioppino. I loved it, thought it was better than pan roast and etouffee.  I plan to keep ordering cioppino until I get sick of it.  The only complaint is that the dining area is quite small. Only 6 steam cooking devices and approx  18 seats. I wish they expand to hold more people. Luckily, they open 24 hours but still, I am sure most of the time, there is a wait. We waited 2 hours for our seats.  The very next weekend, I tried a place near my home in Southern California called the Broiler located in Chino Hills. The cooking method is the same but the taste is not. Ingredients didn't taste the same either. Maybe because Oyster Bar is backed by a casino so the result is that they can afford better quality items.   Looks like I will be planning more trips to Vegas in the near future.

ijyl5Iw7j-ccByerUMqRSQ.text: I LOVE the Pan Roast!!  Almost everyone I bring here LOVES the Pan Roast!  I consider myself a foodie and this is my favorite place to eat in Vegas...really.  I've been to several fine dining restaurants in Vegas (Delmonico's, Charlie Palmer, Michael Mina to name a few) and this is my favorite place to go because it's a local favorite.  There's usually a line almost every time I come, except if it's right after opening or right before closing.  This time, we got there around 11 am and there was only 1 other person at the bar!  I have NEVER seen that.  It must be a sign of the times.    On to the food....my go-to order is the crab and lobster pan roast, number 6 for spiciness  with 2 scoops of rice.  I've had the combo pan roast with shrimp and oysters,  the linguine vongole and the etouffe but the crab and lobster pan roast is my favorite.  There are large chunks of super-tender  fresh lobster that literally melts in your mouth and a sizable scoop of fresh lump crab.  I always make sure to watch the expression on my newbie friend's faces when they take that first spoonful of pan roast....the initial look of shock at how good it tastes and then the sheer joy afterwards knowing there is a giant bowl of it left to devour.   Most dishes are cooked on these heavy-duty metal steamers (see pictures for the visual) that emit steam to cook the dish.  First the veggies are thrown in (tomatoes, celery, onion and peppers maybe) then the fresh seafood is next to cook.  Then the creamy, tomato based roux is added to simmer down and mix together with everything.  Then this heavenly goodness is poured into a large bowl with a sprinkle of chives and a scoop or two of white rice.    It's killing me to write this review from hundreds of miles away.  I usually eat about 3/4 of the pan roast and I always wish I had a larger stomach so I can finish it all.  I keep telling myself I would try the gumbo next time, but I have to have my crab and lobster pan roast first.    We usually get the tall chef with the baseball cap who chats with you like he's been your neighbor for years and the waitresses are supernice and quick with the refills and will wrap up your leftovers in a flash.    Don't judge the book by its cover....I know you'll be skeptical of this bar area when you first arrive but there's a reason why this place is one of the local favorites...it's a hidden gem.  Don't bother trying the pan roast at the other Station locations or even the restaurant that is right next door, they just can't duplicate the original pan roast here at the Oyster Bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab and lobster pan roast with 2 scoops of rice.  Soooo Gooood!!!

Q39CnjuJI00fO9qEN_8LlQ.text: Best Gumbo period, and I'm not even a big gumbo fan.  I need to come back and try the pan roast.  Only like 15 seats so expect to wait.

_IwHBp-VMrOeJwPiEgcnDg.text: This is always my first stop once I get into Vegas.  I usually get the Combo Pan Roast, or the Palace Pan Roast and add lobster.  We had raw oysters today too, they came from Louisiana.  They were fat, juicy, milky, salty and sweet. A big tip is to go during the day so that Bob is working.  He's their best chef.  Enjoy!

p7-NpvJft70m8JBJIlvukw.text: Gumbo and other savory dishes were good. It was fascinating to watch the food being prepared. The raw oysters and clams were not very good when I went. They were too big and were hard to enjoy. So if you're looking for a warm, filling meal or really big raw seafood then come here. And, of course, be prepared to wait in line.

kJNOemX8T1B1KZy8rRXFjg.text: Omg!!! The best had the seafood pan roast and today I'm going back for the gumbo the most amazing Cajun food soooooooo good!!!!

KlJO9e4bnKeYMMM-HpG8UQ.text: Flavorful soup, perfection!  Went here on Monday at 4 am to avoid the line, 4 am and it was decently busy still! That's a good sign =D  Had happy hour oyster, clam steamer, and etoffe, sadly they were out of bullion base. Level 5 spicy was perfect, where spice didn't over-whelm the soup.   Soup was cooking inside the pot for a while making all the juices from seafood come out.... portion is HUGEEE and generous amount of seafood items.   I didn't like the clam steamer flavor,  they had some kind of Italian seasoning on top, like oregano? maybe.... not my thing but still, everything was amazing especially for hang overs

_yRHP14GnQCynmS94Rk4aQ.text: How long will you wait for perfect food?  The food is perfect but the score needs to be a cumulative score reflective of other problems with this establishment. Hour, hour and half, 2 hours? 2 hours total time from the time in line to prepping of the food before we got to eat. It was a similiar waiting game two years ago, yesterday and today when this review was written. This waiting thing really needs to be addressed by upper management.  It's time to expand and invest in a hot commodity that's sure to bring in returns and finally solve the waiting game of attrition.

EUW4XXZr4Fo7es6FRh_i_Q.text: What a hidden gem! Stumbled upon it hungry at late night. Bubbling gas cauldrons of amazing seafood made to order in front of your face. Great prices, good company, and if you have to wait, wait! It's worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three bowls of Bouillabaisse bubbling in the cauldrons!

KbrTm0-Swp_ZJVFUKtyEkw.text: Here's the rundown:  - Unique, small, just a bar location inside Palace Station casino - Waited 15 minutes for two seats at 6:15pm on a Tuesday evening - Wait looked to be 45 minutes when we left - Didn't count the seats, but less than 20, all around the bar - Good personalities in chef, waitstaff - Watch your food be prepared, including cooking in unique steam pots - Oysters, Clams, and Shrimp appetizer was very good. - Enjoyed the Pan Roast ... had no idea what a pan roast was until eating here - loved it.  I had the "combo pan roast". - Asked how spicy I wanted it, from 1-10.  Asked for 5, but should have said 6-7.  Conclusion: I'd go back and enjoy another pan roast and the fun setting and service!

fUrv2PjwqV7bksswaqVo7A.text: The Oyster Bar is open 24/7 but there always seems to be a line. However, this place is worth the wait. We started off with a dozen of oysters and I'm generally very picky with oysters but these we're perfect- didn't taste too fishy and were also pretty big. We also tried the steamed mussels, which came with a large amount and were soaked in a delicious broth that we eventually used to dip with bread. The Alaskan clam chowder was also amazing with generous amounts of seafood within. LAST BUT NOT LEAST, the pan roast. Oh, the pan roast. It has me hungry when I'm full. I got the combo roast and added the andouille sausage (recommended if you're like me and prefer lobster over chicken). I got mine spicy and added lemon, creating the perfect ratio of creamy, cajun, lemony tomato sauce. If I had to choose one dish next time, it'd be the pan roast. To top it off, relatively cheap beer AND great service! The only downside is the wait. I will definitely be back and recommend to all!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan toast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan clam chowder and steamed mussels

tyC_sDZCC-8BviRchl4rkA.text: Craving some delicious seafood soup after a long night of partying/gambling/sinning while in vegas? Oyster bar is the place to go! The Pan Roast Combo is a lovely and happy mix of lobster, shrimp, and shrimp in a lobster bisque type of soup. Also recommend the Alaskan Chowder which is the same mix of seafood goodness but done up clam chowder style. Both soups are very rich and flavorful. Both soups are very filling so be prepared for left overs. You'll be transformed (via stomach) from hungry-hungover to happy-ready-for-bed!   Why only 4 stars then if its so good? The wait. Unfortunately, there are only about 15 or so seats and there are only 6 stations for them to cook at so you may be waiting in line for 2 hours before you can eat. Avoid coming at noon or dinner time if you want to avoid the line.   Good friendly service. Definitely a gem in the dirt of an old beat up hotel I wouldn't step in to for any other reason. Its a must stop when I'm in town. So to answer that crazy question you encounter every once in awhile in vegas, "What would drive a man to leave the comfort of his on the strip mega hotel at 5am and go to an old crappy looking beat up hotel on the outskirts of the main crawl?"  Oyster Bar my silly friend. Oyster bar.

IQCfxfQj24kB3PYDHtArtQ.text: A place I can always count on!  I love gambling at Palace station.  Best of all, Oyster bar has the best Alaskan chowder.  Lots of chunky seafood.  The only thing I don't like is the very long wait time to get seated.  Even after seated, it takes an extra 45 minutes for the food to arrive.  Expect and average 2 hour wait at any hour of the  day.  Even so, it's well worth the trip every time to go to vegas.

RsdREZ0U73U_VCIanHqZKQ.text: Great oysters. The beers went great with the chowders and gumbo. The ambience is a zero but the food is good.

SiJSmbzuFz0pAA0JARxhqQ.text: Yes, it is every bit the 5 star place that Yelpers are giving it. If this is not 5 star, then you don't give a 5 star, end of story.  Forget about how long the wait might be, or how long it may take to get food.  None of that matters.  It is the best sea-food dishes you will ever eat and there is nothing left to say.  Try it.  I think going during (non-holiday) the week around 3-3:30pm is the ticket to avoid long lines.  It just does not get any better folks.

vjMSkCi1f7KisBGOi3HXZg.text: Let me start by saying I grew up in Alabama, grew up making fresh gumbo from scratch, and still do..it is always nice to try someone elses..I was not impressed, especially after standing in line for over an hour.  The Caesar salad was better than the gumbo..They do give you a good portion and I suppose if you have never eaten True southern gumbo filled with with fresh shrimp, fresh okra, sausage, crab legs, chicken wings and just the right amount of spice...you might like this, and pay way to  much for it.

NnDv73eD45gOtuWEr_6mkQ.text: Excellent food every time but bad location.  My boyfriend and I have gone here before and I loved the food then.  The menu is basic but just enough variety.  We both ordered the pan roast with shrimp and lobster and it was excellent but you can also choose from gumbo, etouffee and others. I've had the gumbo in the past and it was excellent as well.  I would give this place a five if I didn't have to wait one hour and 15 minutes to be seated due to its very limited seating. was it worth the wait? YES...it really is the best little secret in town.

rlgfsJJn2OeZmIb6_BDl9w.text: Combo Pan Roast was amaaazing. I will be sure to stop by whenever I'm in Vegas. Came here around 11am and there was no wait at all. They make all the food right in front of.

KAADVnluYpWEmSIzcU7Gsw.text: Food was good, a little heavy handed on the cream aspect of the soups as well as the salt levels. Wait was long, but worth it.

ULnqkBGWi-2mSz2klKutaQ.text: Yes the wait is pretty outrageous but so well worth it at the end. Waited about an hour to be seated but during the wait decided to grab a few drinks with the bf to "kill" time. I ordered the combo pan roast and the bf and brother both had the lobster pan roast. Food  came out AMAZING! The taste of each bite had me keep going and going. Brother and bf were both surprised of how much I ate since I normally don't eat so much. I couldn't stop myself...which I paid the the price for later lol! Don't let the wait time discourage you! well worth every minute. I still don't understand why they don't increase staff? One cook and one hostess/busser/server?? Hmmm doesn't quite add up with the number of customers coming in.

NNqg9EuJGDo8F2BcrRclew.text: This place is a MUST when in Vegas!! Their pan roast is BOMB!!! Be prepared for a long wait. There's limited seating in this wrap around bar. Although the line only had maybe 10-12 people ahead of us it took an hour and half for our group to be seated. I know they were renovating the last time we were in Vegas, so maybe that has changed! We've tried pan roast other places, but oyster bar in the palace station is hands down the best!!!

NIiKkS6fqh-c9ZnF842FuA.text: Wow combo pan roast was incredible. Line is long but worth the wait. The sourdough bread and butter was a match made in heaven. Menu seems to have changed didn't see calamari as app. They also have $3 dollar draft and wine special after 1am.

DWzGv3GXyW_lpaP0MyBthw.text: Pan roast and oysters are good, locals come here.  There is a wait and it takes awhile.  Sometimes the line is very long.  Only so many seats, approx 18 seats.  Also, they have a $5.00 share charge.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kitchen, bar, 17 seats total at this place.

UnWHiaqNXbkuA6TQonyIdw.text: I never met a bowl of gumbo so good before from a place that was not my Aunts House.    This small restaurant at Palace Station more than get the stamp of approval from me when it comes to serving up delicious cuisine such as gumbo, even though my stamp of approval doesnt matter.    The moral of the story is: Its Good, and if you so happen to be in Vegas when you have  a gumbo craving, bring ya ass down to the Oyster bar.

j_3ewQOfsBigzKaAjuCI7A.text: That sh*t CRAY....Worth the wait!!!...My fiance forced me to come here and yes, we waited for over an hour just to try this place.   We ordered the Pan Roast and Seafood Jambalaya (spicyness = 7/10), and a dozen Oysters with the souvenir 23oz glass. The food was very tasty and they give you a lot.  What you see in the pictures is what you get!!! You will sit at a bar, order food, watch it be made in front of you, drink, eat...REPEAT.

0CPIqYyCnRAYPZF1YlZMDA.text: Holloman is so amazing! Best chef ever, great spirit and even better food.   Wait is super long but totally worth it.

lNH35E9Ps5O42i0OOcQlYQ.text: Hotel is old, smelly & ghetto.   Restaurant was in an open area; it was weird I was expecting it to be in a normal restaurant setting, but I guess not.   Clam chowder was so yummy 10 pts  Combo pan roast is to die for!! 11pts  FYI, if you split the dishes, they charge you an extra $5.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

7srRPQ3S2rmqn7pjetureA.text: 5 stars in my book for the amazing food and EXCELLENT customer service.   The wait can honestly suck (we got there pretty early with a line of ~10-15 people. The wait was still an estimated 1.5-2 hrs. Good thing there are slot machines around so I can gamble. But one of my favorite things was waiting in line and getting to meet the nicest people in the world who are in the same boat as you. Everyone gave our group amazing suggestions as well as the chef and waitress too.   New England Clam Chowder was awesome! Good amount of creaminess and clams. I would totally order that next time all to myself. We also ordered half oysters on the half shell which were fresh and good, but similar to other places I've eaten. Combo Pan Roast hit the spot! I ordered mines level 4 spicy and it still made me sweat a little. My friends did level 8 (option is 1-10 I believe).   Highly recommended! This place has been on my bookmark for ages, I just got lost the first time I attempt to look (I went to Imperial Palace not knowing there was a Palace Station Hotel haha). Have a cocktail and make some new friends and get ready for a yummy experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good! Clam chowder
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OfeJxS9UPJaNL3hSx0Qi0Q.text: This review is one of the rare instances where the food is 4/5 stars but the wait time, unfriendly server, Christopher,  and virtually everything else ruined the experience.  1) yes, there are 18 seats and they refuse to make any sort of alternative compromise like a carry out. Let's just put it this way: the waiting time was so long, that I could have driven back to Los Angeles or take a plane from la to my hometown of northbrook Illinois! We are talking well over three hours from start to finish. Good thing I had my book!  2) To add insult to my injury and to also burdensome to customers, you have to stand throughout the duration of this wait. If you don't do this, you risk losing your spot! I waited from 7:20 and did not leave until well over 10:30! I should have brought my godfather part 2 movie to watch!  3) management is unbelievably amateur and unprofessional and they don't care because there will always be a line. There were two seats unoccupied for 20 minutes before the next party were sat. When another customer complained, I witnessed Christopher be extremely rude to her. It also took Christopher many minutes to clean each seat as there was a lack of urgency on his behalf! With 18 seats there should always be a sense of urgency to reduce wait time!  3) the owners make no concessions on the price as well! 25 dollars for the three hour wait is not kind!  4) I got the combo and it was pretty good. They were somewhat stingy on the seafood. I also ordered it 8 out of ten on the spice scale; it was more like a four.  5) caught the chef sneezing twice and did not wash his hands. The bar has a panoramic view of the lone chef, but I guess he does not care.  6) I did not order oysters, but the name oyster bar does not withstand if they run out! The customer sitting next to me was heartbroken when Christopher told her we're out! Imagine that? if your name is the oyster bar, and you are out of oysters, we have a huge problem!  Conclusion: will not be coming back here with the beyond unreasonable wait time. This is the longest I've ever waited in my life for food, and I regret wasting my time here.  No more angry! Word to the wise: don't buy in to the hype!

DGcJaOJz8jWMsckJUA_llA.text: Hoooooly crappola yes. It's the tiniest little bar-counter thing, so do expect to wait 1-2 hours, no matter what time you go! Yes, even at 5:30am. Or 6:30. Or 7am. ALL HOURS!! Though I do love that it never closes. But you know what? It just might be worth it!!!  The pan roasts are all full of flavor, loaded with goodies, and absolutely amazing, and you can actually see the chefs at work right in front of you! The steamed mussels are also delish--I really wish I got the try the oysters, as oyster bar IS the name, but raw oysters on a drunken 5:30 morning didn't seen too appealing.   As with all Vegas joints, the prices are fairly steep (compared to say, Kettlebar in Anaheim), BUT like I said, it's in Vegas and its 24 hours...you really can't complain. Do come give it a try--you won't regret it!

Qi72WIxhEq1RBMSNtk6xcw.text: Came here for a late night grub session. This place is packed and for good reason. The food is amazing. If you are a die hard seafood fan, this is the place for you and yes it is worth the wait. They cook the food right in front of you while you wait. They have a line but it goes smoothly depending on how long people are sitting around hanging out after they're done eating. We only waited 30 minutes or less. Ricardo, the cook is seriously  a beast! He preps and gets everyone's food going. He manages 6 different cooking pots at once !! Will be back for sure !

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pan roast

1W7ICwrs8fr8VScl1rnrtQ.text: I came to this place on a Wednesday at 330pm. I was very shocked that there was no line!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cOtXuYSrZoU55D2qYKlQ5Q.text: Maybe we were expecting too much from this place when we came...(especially since yelp reviews indicate 4.5 stars!)...but we were a bit underwhelmed.  Our wait was only 25 minutes, which was great compared to what others experience (we arrived at 2:05 pm or so on Friday afternoon)  Our chef was a bit grumpy; never smiled, never really talked to anyone that was eating, and we kept hearing him sighing. haha...maybe he just needed to go on break or something.  We ordered: (1) Combo Pan Roast - shrimp crab lobster; fresh seafood sauteed with Brandy, Cream, and Tomato, served with steamed rice), $21.99 I had high hopes for my pan roast, but it was OK overall. Flavors were great, and soupy. Felt like the amount of lobster/shrimp we got was very minimal though - so was disappointed by that. Maybe that's how it is with the Pan Roast? The seafood content in the gumbo + diablo was more than that of the pan roast, not sure why. We also ordered a spice level of 8 and it was way too hot, lol. I was sweating bullets, although my husband enjoyed that  spice-level. Since we shared this entree, they gave us 2 scoops of rice separately (in 2 separate bowls). I was telling my husband that next time (if I come again & the wait is not that long), I would order an entree w/ more seafood content, such as the shrimp & lobster diablo! haha :)  (2) Oysters on half shell - dozen, $18.99 - fresh and a good size, but not the most amazingly fresh oysters I've had. They shuck the oysters right there and then, after you place the order. It comes with slices of lemon, cocktail sauce and horseradish paste. This is served to you before your entrees come out. From a price perspective, it's more worth it to buy the dozen for $18.99 instead of half dozen for $12.99.  Service was very limited, there was just one chef (who was cooking everyone's meal), and a waitress who had to take orders and bus the bowls, plates, pour everyone's drinks, etc. There are only 18 seats along the bar, too.  Overall, it was fun to sit at the bar and see how the cooking is done; but we would probably only rate this place a 3.5-3.75 stars. I'm thinking if I tried the "shrimp & lobster diablo" next time, I may change my mind and upgrade the stars. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen oysters on half shell &amp; Combo Pan Roast w/ shrimp crab lobster!

hKvFbCyiyFHqj51_yA4ZJA.text: WORTH EVERY MINUTE IN LINE.. Undoubtedly, this has got to be the Ramen Dojo of oyster bars!  Very limited seating around a semi-circle bar, leaving only 18 seats available to the most oyster driven consumer.  One can be left frustrated, but don't relinquish your place in line, as it will be worth the wait.  Give up immediately if you are under 21, as patrons must be 21 years and over to partake in the festivities.  Some encouraging words from my husband as we stood agonizing in line were, "This is the best Oyster Bar in Vegas.  It's worth the wait."  Okay, with that said, all I could do was smile...  The afternoon started off with 14 people ahead of us in line; after an hour and twenty minutes, we were next to be called.  We took our seats on the most comfy bar seats ever to caress my derriere.  For you ladies, look under the counter for purse hooks.  Today, there was only one cook and one server.  They were working swiftly and without pause.  I've never seen a two-man show move so quickly and efficiently, holding up the "nautical sails" of this oyster bar so effortlessly.  Without hesitation and for the numbing effects of our long wait, I ordered a 23-oz Shock Top on tap.  In the rush of things, our server accidentally poured two 23-oz. Shock Tops.  Immediately upon realizing this, she just pushed both beers our way.  Hoorah!  Cheers and smiles flooded our faces, as well as that of our fellow diners; wishing that it had happened to them, they could only be happy for us in return.  The fun is at the bar!  Welcome to the "sensory seat"!  Visualize two people gliding across the kitchen "stage" in perfect unison (no collisions today), food prepping, pots clanging, water running, steam rising, stations warming, ladles scooping, plates gliding, beer sliding...and then you can get a glimpse of this oyster bar chasm, cut from a small section in the Palace Station Hotel and Casino.    My hubby has been visiting this establishment for over 20 years!  Needless to say, I left the ordering to him.  We were famished.  Here's our tummy bursting feast.  NOTE:  their potions are fairly large...  *Oysters on the half shell ~ These were quite the mouthful.  If you prefer tiny ones, I would suggest not ordering these.  They were sizably squishy and yummy, and accompanied by a cocktail sauce with horseradish.  *Combo Pan Roast ~ This is one of the dishes for which they are known.  The Combo includes a generous amount of shrimp, crab and lobster.  First boiled in water, then a special mix of sauces and seasonings are added to the seafood pot.  It only teases and entices as one sees it cooking right before their eyes.  The boiled seafood broth is richly savory.  It is accompanied by white rice.  State whether you would like it on top of your pan roast or on the side; I prefer it on the side.    *New England Clam Chowder ~ smooth and rich with pieces of decadent clams.  One more note about the BEER.  The 23 oz. glass is yours to KEEP!  Refills are half price.  Refill it before you leave the bar, as you can carry it with you as you head out to gamble.  Enjoy the feeling of the moment.  In California, we just don't carry out our unfinished drinks.  It just doesn't happen!  Cheers!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cooking pots

9XU_gk6NsndaRFLNyQHZDg.text: There aren't words to describe oyster bar. You kinda just have to go. The wait is always long but sooo worth it.

18pF0BS1K81wxk2-SfsFzA.text: The sea food at the Oyster Bar is always fresh and the selection is really good, full menu of items to choose from.  I really like the Pan Roasted Combo, I had Shrimp, Crab and Lobster and the spicy butter sauce was amazing....   when your sitting there and the smells   and the aromas of the garlic and all the fresh sea food is mouth watering......  This a fine sea food restaurant and one of the Station Casino's best......

2t4SOmBKO5LVSjA3pzi-vg.text: This is the best of the best , excellent Louisiana style with a comfort flavor , if you don't gamble, please come to Vegas for this!!

6ptQzRbbKPBltZd5aIj--w.text: I came here at 11:30PM (hoping to avoid long lines), and waited for 2 hours because of the rave reviews. This place IS a bar inside a hotel, with very limited seating (18-20 people?). I told my husband, "this place better be worth it."  I can only review on the dishes I tried:  1) $10 for 6 raw oysters - I've had really good oysters before, so I would say these are pretty mediocre...grimy, creamy, and lukewarm...knowing how easily oysters can go bad, why were they not stored in colder temperature? 2) Clam chowder - it's New England style, which I don't have a problem with. It's just, again, mediocre. My husband, who grew up in east coast, was not impressed. 3) Pan Roast with extra Lobster - they do give you a large portion of lobster. I found the dish just OK. Too buttery, fatty, and much of the same taste. (You can share this dish between two people... it's huge). You can also add spiciness - 1-10. A group next to us ordered 12. Whoa.  I think I understand why people do like this place: If you are a seafood fan, the restaurant gives you large portions of crabs, lobsters, shrimps, oysters, and clams for budget-friendly price. I also realize the taste caters more to people who indulge in very rich, buttery foods. I wished I tried their jambalaya or any of the chef's specials - those do look better. I am a seafood fan, and I do not mind 1-2 hour lines if the food is worth it. For now, I am unsure if I would go here again - it's a very long wait for OK food.

uDPOoMC2vwAM2ij2WaPNFA.text: The best meal I've ever had in my life. I would drive to Vegas just to have it again (and now have, many times). The Oysters are always fresh, plump and tasty but it's the Pan Roast that I die for. Treat yourself.

FO5z-rt_y68-S3mcWvKjEA.text: Heard so much about this place, so decided to give it a chance to check out on my own. I def got to say that this is without a question one of the best restraunts here in Vegas. Hands down mainly because the friendly die hard customer service. From the second on arrival til the very end, every single worker there was just outstanding in every way possible. Food was great! What can go wrong with fresh fresh fresh oysters?!?

XQsW6qeVpbaXH9sXuYO48Q.text: Maybe best meal I have had in Vegas.. nothing  fancy but really  fresh and delicious.

ECif6GVoiConDgY9tIDr1g.text: Line gets longer when night gets darker. Gumbo is delicious, especially tasty after crazy drinking in Vegas. Oyster is huge but a bit lack of flavor,  not those creamy types I like. Service is good.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ah50ulqfrJP0AxfUm3cjPA.text: I have been here twice with my husband; first time we had better experience because the wait wasn't too bad and the food we ordered were good.  Hence, we came back for the second time and we deeply regretted; we were not impressed with their seafood strew this time. For some reason the soup base was way too salty, we could not even finish the 30% of the stew; we just picked out the seafood, washed with water to eat and left the stew alone. Not to mention we waited 3.5hrs for this salty meal.  Service was slow; we waited 26min for our strews and for our oysters/clams plate, it was ready right in front of us, but it was sitting on their counter for 16min before the server took that to us. It would be easier if the person who opened the shells to deliver that plate to us when he's done; literately just had to lift his hands with the plate 12 inches higher.  However, the raw clams were really fresh, sweet and tasty; the oysters were huge like rocks but it was pretty fresh. Hence, I'm leaving them two stars.   I know tons of people love this place and perhaps it was only that one bad night; but we don't plan to come back.

c9pJE_aCPo3Xcef0sy8AUA.text: There is a reason the Palace Station Oyster Bar shows up as #1 it is hands down the best Oyster Bar in these United States. Chef Bob is the best and we just love Marge. Favorite dishes for me are the Cioppino, the Gumbo and the Shrimp Scampi yummmy!!!

qyXYAD-aa4PQZRxxdqiD1Q.text: Always a line but so worth it!! Food is amazing best oyster bar in town. Chef Robert makes the gumbo to perfection!!

_z-AnMR8A_ClCynGPGNhCg.text: The shellfish here is great, but the pan roast is the real reason to come here.  We discovered EVERY station casino has an oyster bar... but this one stands above the rest. The pan roast is flavorful is a must have.   The bad? There is usually a wait here regardless.of the time of day or night. It's worth the wait though!

Z-SGDZyTnJwjaFzYKNLrFA.text: We have passed this place every time we visit palace station. Finally I said, let's go ahead and see what the fuss is about. We waited in line about 2 hours and man it was worth it! I ordered the house gumbo. Made to order and great service. There is one server and one cook. Despite the chef being busy he still came over and asked if we enjoyed our food. The bowls are all about $23-30 each but it can definitely be shared.   I would definitely wait in line again.

v4fgZ6pqWEy69Aw4XhqMzQ.text: Pros:  Fresh seafood, cooked well Huge oysters on the half shell Friendly service Great atmosphere, it truly is a "bar" with 18 seats.  Cons: Be prepared to wait well over an hour to be seated. They have six kettles to cook the food, so you may end up waiting awhile for your entrees. After waiting 2 hours to be seated, we then waited an hour between our oyster appetizer and our main courses.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hlTKEZ1X6hIpWRtrT5Kw8Q.text: I had heard a lot about the oyster bar. It's legendary for long lines and people who are willing to wait 2 hours to get a seat. I got there around 5:45pm and got seated around 6:45pm. Even tho the line was not long. Usually one person waits and that person waiting may have 6 or more in the party.   Now let's get to the food. I got the pan roast which is what they're famous for. They ask you what spicy level form 1-10 . I chose 3 and it was perfect for me a tinge of spicy hot. Next time I'm gonna try level 4. the guy told me the spicy level all depends on the chef on duty, when I went he told me the chef is right on the money. The pan roast had crab, shrimp and lobster. honestly the flavor remind me of chicken tiki Marsala almost except with sea food. It was very good and worth the wait. Next time I'll try something else. My friend also got half dozen oysters, he said it was good and regretted not getting a dozen. Everything is cooked right in front of you. As soon as you sit down they give you a warm dinner roll with bread. The service was excellent and  refilled your drinks without even asking. Definitely a place I would recommend when in Vegas.  The long wait does suck and why a place that is busy 24/7 doesn't expand doesn't make sense.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of big shrimp
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fra Diablo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ya looks like I didn&#39;t like  the pan roast eh?

b0l7eZ7mx5EbzA9iLyV46w.text: Delicious food! Definitely worth the wait! I've waited in line several times for about 2 hours each time I come and visit the Oyster Bar. Food is always on point each and every time! The combo roast and the bouillabaisse are my favorites although you can't go wrong with anything you order on the menu. Everything is amazing and Btw Oysters are fresh !!

Nx4kZzAVfIwBJbqM0waz4Q.text: 4.5 stars...just cuz waiting an hour at 1am after a long day of driving from LA, buzzing it and tired doesn't help. It also took a total of almost 3 hours from the time we waited in line till we finished our meals and paid.   We all have to say it was well worth the wait only if my buddies and I didn't have to wake up at 630am for a tee time at the TPC the next morning. The food was great! Good to kill the hunger, good enough to absorb up all the alcohol and good enough for a hefty late night meal/early morning meal at 3am! We were able to try the New England Chowdah and 3 orders of the Pan Roast. It took the chef a little longer just because each Pan Roast took a long time to cook up. There were only 6 steamer also.  Don't pass up the Oyster Bar. Be patient cuz you'll be waiting at least an hour and enjoy your Pan Roast or Gumbo. I'll be back the next time i'm in Vegas.   OPEN 24 HOURS.

nSJ4YjMkCg1RAid3kj1dXw.text: The seafood Pan Roast with extra crab is the best! We come here every time we are in Vegas! We have had the pan Roast in Kettlebar in Anaheim and this place is way better.  We highly recommend despite the long wait.

n519WyVzSX-sr0fGhmFHTw.text: This place was absolutely amazing! I have never had such good food at an oyster bar before. Price isn't t bad at all considering the high quality of the food. Every meal my group got was cooked to perfection. My one word of advice is ask for extra shrimp because I have never had it cooked so perfectly in my life.

jaJ-c9B4b6RZyMuB5t7JHw.text: Very good food and the best service pricess are very good you can't go wrong with this place it's truly the best in town

S3HCzx5uLqDUGLcCykfVjg.text: This is my favorite favorite place to eat!!!! Food is amazing here!!! The pan roast is a must everytime we visit and the oysters are sooooo plump and yummy!!!! I can't find any other place close to the way this place makes their good!!! Everyone I've told and have tried it loves it too!!!!

6KQdRkKBFiY46qbPyppmFg.text: Mm...mm...mm! My Oyster Bar experience was wonderful! Let me start from the beginning but make this long story short. My God-sister told me this place was awesome. So we went to dine there and the line was as long the Rapunzel's hair...lol...the wait was 3/4 hours. I instantly thought "NOT GONNA BE ABLE TO DO IT!" I said aloud (in the words of my nephew), "NOT TODAAAAAY!" So, we decide we'd go back later on in the week. And sure-nuff, (don't act like y'all don't know Ebonics...lol) you heard me, sure-nuff, the line had 8 people in it and the wait was only 35/40 minutes. We weren't going to miss this opportunity. And got in line...lol...We sat down and saw that the food was prepared right in front of you, yes fresh. I ordered the Caesar Salad, Pan Roast (at my spice level. I felt special) and tasted my god-sister's Gumbo. I loved it all. Great presentation, clean, flavor was on point. And most important, I was full...lol. Yes, try this place when you're in LV. Steve, Robert and Brenda were great hosts...God-sister, GREAT RECOMMENDATION!

zZJmeE-Ske9pGP1Sx1Hbeg.text: Oyster baaar! One of my fav restaurant in Vegas great food with reasonable price in Vegas! I love this place but I just wish they have more seats...!!! Yeah but It's really nice place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite

N_0f7bPeVUIFCQX5p1IzvA.text: Get here early, like breakfast early to avoid the lines...almost don't want to give away that secret but you'll save yourself at least 2 hours of your time.    Get the Pan Roast.  Soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo good!  Creamy, spicy, with lots of seafood and full of flavor! I like it spicy so I get the spicy level at 7 or 8.  The spice level is no joke so if you can't handle it, make sure you get the spice level 5 or below.    Come here when Chef Bob is working...I've been lucky and always happened to eat here when he was cooking.  I was eavesdropping on the convo some regulars were having with the waitress.  Apparently the other chef just doesn't make the Pan Roast taste as good as Bob.  Chef Bob reminds me of Ray Romano in case you need a visual on what he looks like.    Trust me...come here and get the Pan Roast!  Open 24/7 so no reason to not try it!

-jHCz3FU-LfK8XiYLcjycg.text: This is another spot we checked out due to high yelp ratings... We started out some Chowda and Fanny Bay Rocks which was tasty.  Next, we shared the combination pan roast almost everyone raves about... what you need to know before you order is they'll tack on a $5 sharing charge which is totally wack. It was a good glorified seafood bisque, but definitely not worth $20...Loaded is an understatement, there were pieces of seafood, but definitely not loaded.  I'm glad we came though because now that I've seen Joe prepare it step by step and the ingredients that go in it, I can duplicate it my way, with no skimping on seafood and no sharing charge...ALOHA!!!

6I_OaWcSICM84mnb93ltrA.text: Good food. Often a small wait (because it's so good)! A small bar like setting inside a casino off the strip. Can order to go if needed. Prepped and made in front of you. Known for the oysters, but all the seafood is excellent.

NzvufYJf3TK7hBgWaY2iJQ.text: Who knew? Located on the floor of off the Strip casino, this place lacks any sort of the glamour of Vegas. A dozen or so seats around a bar with the food made in front of you. An hour long wait in a line snaking through shoddy slot machines. Even the $1 margaritas nearby aren't worth it.  But the food is great. The combo pan roast is a must. Thick, filling, creamy and delectable. This could be the best deal in the city.  The beer selection is good too.

dVBxed1WuEfAfRZENs_zwQ.text: I'm still dreaming about the lobster pan roast I had here two weeks ago. UH MAY ZINGGGGGG!

jFx881eWjBLJKPnta_LSgA.text: I heard of this place through my SIL, then a friend, then a coworker and so it was definitely on a bucket list that we wanted to try. We trekked our way onto the other side of the freeway away from the strip to a run down looking casino called palace station. I would NEVER come here if it weren't for trying out the oyster bar, and I dont think a lot of other people would either but apparently word got out because the line was long. And clearly everyone waiting in line heard of this place through a friend or yelp because amongst the old white people gambling at palace station, the people standing in line for the oyster bar were young asians.. such a vast different crowd within the same hotel.  We had 15 people ahead of us at 3pm on a saturday and waited about an hour before we were seated. Man, the chef works hard, he works non stop cooking those dishes in front of you, shucking the oysters, cleaning the pots.. wash, rinse, repeat. We ordered the 1/2 dozen oysters, beer, pan roast combo, and the alaskan chowder. The pan roast was just the right amount of creamy and was rich in flavor. It was so frieken good..  the oysters not so much, it didn't have the brineyness to it that i love. The alaskan chowder had thick chunks of lobster and shrimp, they certainly dont skimp on seafood.   This place is open 24/7 but apparently, there is always a line no matter what time you come. You can always make your hubby wait in line while you play a little at the casino.. always works for me :D

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan chowder
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan chowder- look at the shrimp lobster chunks!!

xy9LgNuB_9k_xiCTvXBGQQ.text: I always make it a point to stop here when I come to Vegas. Unfortunately, the seafood seems to be lacking in proportions compared to past years. You could barely tell that there was any lobster in my Panroast. In the past, there were chunky pieces of seafood in it but not this time. I also ordered half dozen oysters and they tasted like kerosene. It might have been a bad batch. The oyster guy said that it's from the south. BP oil spill tainted??? Anyways, it's the first time in my life that I left raw oysters uneaten.

9G2TLan810N_C0eNTPHnsg.text: Oh this is AMAZING!!  and I do mean amazing. I had the shrimp scampi which was heaven and my husband had the jambalaya. We were both so impressed with the flavour. And the servings are huge!! So be warned. We didn't have any appies and it's a good thing! We lucked out and walked right up and sat down.  But we were told there is often a two hour wait. Yummmmmmmy!

BOzhGfC36WoeAtZ5U5t_jA.text: Came on Sunday at 11 AM and luckily there was no line.   Got the seafood combo pan roast- chunks of seafood in a tomato-bisque-like soup- soooo delicious!! It's the kind of sauce you would wanna dip everything in! And the seafood jambalaya is good with pieces of lobster, clam, shrimp, and mussels. I don't even like raw oysters and I tried one and they tasted so fresh! I already wanna go back to try the cioppino and gumbo   Service was good and the chef is very funny and provided great customer service!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef and the waitress taking a selfie with my phone lol
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood jambalaya

Uh_jZxRNCwftldLnYglkDw.text: TIP: Go during the week before 5pm.   I got there Friday at 4pm and had to wait for about 40 mins. The food is definitely worth the wait, especially if it's your first time trying this type of cuisine. I ordered the House Special and ate every single bite with glee.

wTstfRUo3UwZQ0Jq7xkI0Q.text: HANDS DOWN MY FAVORITE SEAFOOD PLACE TO EAT IN LAS VEGAS!   I kid you not when I tell you that my entire family & I schedule out a time to go every single time we go to Vegas. Which is quite often I might add (at least once a month. Asians love to gamble lol)   We always try to go when Ricardo is working! He makes the best food & the style when he cooks is added entertainment. There is usually an average wait time of about 1-2 hours (TOTALLY WORTH THE WAIT, DON'T SKIP OUT!!!!) The aroma of the food being cooked alone will draw you in it's captivating!   It's open 24 hours though, you might be lucky & can catch a slow/dead time middle of the day/night on a weekday maybe. I always say if it's all these people are waiting & they're ALWAYS BUSY it must be good right?!?!? (circumstantial) lol  I don't know what took me so long to get around to writing the review (let's be real I'm lazy) but I get the same thing every time because I'm afraid of change. lol no kidding but I know it's good. The Pan roast -  you can add a side of rice or fettuccine noodles. I'm a pasta lover so go figure for the fettucine. Dozen juicy oysters shucked fresh. Absolute perfection. If I'm there during oyster shooter happy hour 3 for $10 I get 3 with some tequilaaaa (when in vegas am I right or am I right?!?!) If my entire family is there we also get clams to share!  You'll leave so happy & satisfied I promise you won't regret it. Unless you don't like seafood then I'm sorry we can't be friends.

cUaopqqM4iBy4lfoZljEhA.text: I love this place so much.  Girls night.  Cocktails and oysters! I will be back for sure!

jIxP2ucJKNvXP9w9VL80dQ.text: Holy mother of pearl - people were not kidding about that combo pan roast.   Just the right about of savory goodness with the perfect balance of seafood. I will admit that I was a bit disappointed when the chef was refilling his station with frozen items, but I'll still give it 5 stars.  I think the "Oyster Bar" is a bit of a misnomer as the oysters were nothing to write home about.   The chef is heavy handed with the spices, so be wary when choosing your level of spice from 1 - 10.   The wait made me want to punch someone in the face, but I do have to admit that experiencing the pan roast was well worth it.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lump Crab
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

Nxq7Vs5g-5GS_PqGCVzkGA.text: Three hours of wait at 9pm! We were so happy when we finally got seated. I would say this place merits its high rating. The oysters were so plump and juicy, the pan roast a concoction of fresh seafood and spice. The service was impeccable as well, as they made sure you were happy with the meal. I would skip the cioppino next time, it was too salty. The line management can also use some improvement, some folks tried to cut in line and security had to be called. Otherwise, a perfect meal and the station in Harrah's cannot even compare (a dozen oysters cost $10 more at Harrah's).

wPjm18UI_z6qORwyraW39Q.text: The Palace Station Oyster bar is consistent and amazing every time.  There is a constant line to get in and certainly worth the wait.  The Chef "EZE" has mad skills and is very entertaining. EZE seems to put love into what he does and it shows in the delicious meals he creates. Thanks again! Can't wait to come back!

IeXHbbGJmz_DZy0gnYFTjw.text: Really upsetting. Ubered here for late night food only to find that they have 15ish seats. So silly. Super long line even at 3am since seating is so scarce. If you go here be prepared to wait FOREVER. Make sure you're wearing comfortable shoes to stand.

IVyAhnmeBn9-APq5uZ7hdQ.text: I'm very impatient and wait times could be as long as an hour or LONGER! It is insanely irritable.. BUT the food definitely makes up for it all! Service is a hit or miss. The times we've gone are usually between 1am to 3am the latest..  There's always ONE waiter, ONE cook, 5-6 kettles, and seating only about 12 people at a time!  A couple of my favorites : *My go-to CRAB PAN ROAST - creamy, tomatoey, chunks of crab goodness served with steamed rice. *ALASKAN CHOWDER - New England Style with shrimp, crab and lobster. *OYSTERS are about $20 a dozen.  This place is definitely a must try at least once in your life! And if you like it.. You'll be like me.. Finding yourself craving this type of seafood comfort food all the time!

lWhsvMQIYiDIMIyZGVodgg.text: Love love love their gumbo and their service.  Had their oysters as an appetitive and it was delicious.   I've been here on several occasions and they are most accommodating .  The chef was super nice too and the rest of the staff .

nDdwRP5HZj6Ufm6UMPXnug.text: 1700+ reviews and maintaining a 4.5 star!? I just had to check out what the fuss is about. So this past weekend I got to visit Vegas for my birthday, and decided to pay oyster bar a visit. I knew the line was gonna be long so I specifically chose to come here early on Monday morning, I'm talking about 4 am type of early! I walked in expecting to get seated right away and boy was I in for a surprise..... there was a line! Mind you it was 4am on a Monday, so I was completely in shock; ended up waiting for almost an hour to get seated! Not gonna lie I was getting pretty frustrated with the wait so I had high expectations when it came to the food. I decided to order the combo pan roast with a spice level of 7 out of 10 and the three shooter special with vodka ($12). The shooters had quite a bit of vodka and nice chunk of oyster as well and the pan roast definitely lived up to the hype. The only problem I had with the pan roast was their use of previously frozen seafood but the flavor definitely makes up for this minor issue.  Overall verdict, oyster bar is definitely worth the wait. I just hope they can expand the place in the near future or hire another staff to offset the wait time a bit.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast. $23.99 spice level 7

yPyun2wthmzUPln7ZQlnfg.text: Everything you've heard is True.  Just go.  I went at 6:00 a.m. on a Wednesday and there were only a few people there.  The people working there are among the nicest I've met in Las Vegas.  Bravo, Oyster Bar.

PMLlVqkAxVXVSbRs4M7Uow.text: The line for this place is SO long. Even if it looks short, the restaurant only seats around 18 at a time and it's bar style seating so you have to wait for seats next to each other to open up.  When I first got seated, I immediately ordered a 50oz beer ($15) and I got to keep the cup as a souvenir!  Other than that, I shared the following. The portions are huge, there's no way I can finish an entree on my own.  - Dozen Oysters: I was actually quite disappointed, being an oyster bar at all. Some oysters were really yummy but others were just abnormally fat, chewy and sandy. However, I normally prefer smaller oysters. These oysters are so huge that they look unnatural. I actually prefer the oysters at the Oyster Bar in Harrah's.  - New England Clam Chowder: This was super yummy! The soup was so creamy and buttery..I was very surprised since not a lot of people ordered the soup. But probably one of my favorite clam chowders!  - Combo Pan Roast: I didn't know what a pan roast was but it's essentially a bunch of seafood and vegetables tossed in a special tomato based soup. This was my favorite entree for the night! It was super flavorful and fresh. I really love tomato based soups so I may be slightly biased. But this is a must try!  - House Gumbo: This was yummy too but I liked the Pan Roast more. I thought the gumbo was spicier and saltier so we had a harder time finishing this. But I liked the sausages and the seafood was still fresh.  Overall, I don't know if I'd want to wait 1.5 hours again but the food is definitely yummy. The portions are also big and the prices are for fresh seafood so you can't really complain.

wgeKSUG6QLwmrCLPud_ptA.text: This place is pretty amazing. A 10-12 seat dining bar opened 24 hours. 5 of us were here at 5am and there was a line. Craziness!  They have Moonlight Specials from 1am-9am. Half dozen oysters for $10? Yes please!  Also the pan roast is a must-get. The Palace pan roast comes with shrimp, crab, chicken and sausage. The cook makes it in these customized pans right in front of your eyes. So cool! The portion is huge!  Waiting to be seated takes a while. So does the food since it's made fresh. But all worth it.

hFu03-_27Et2caCiPKIOGA.text: This is a small place in palace station. It is literally a bar so they only have about 15 seats at a time. The wait can be quite a long time. I had the Atlantic chowder which was delicious and I would have given it 5 stars based on that but the combination pan roast that we had was only okay. The 4.5 stars was a bit overrated but I think 3.5 stars is more fair. Overall, if you are a local then I think it would be a good place to frequent but if you are out of town and coming to Vegas for some yummy food then I would try something else.

BiXL_76vUbRS9tww2x8DFQ.text: We waited in a long line for over an hour. Cigarette smoke was all around us, patrons of the hotel were skimming between the line to a counter where they picked free $5 bottles of champagne... wielding them off with one hand like they had won the lottery. $5 minimum blackjack tables were around us, a sign touted $15 rooms for the night.... just in case this meal was so good we wanted to ditch our comfortable hotel in favor of slumming it and eating at the oyster bar everyday. A crazy idea at the time...  But a rational thought afterwards.  We carefully planned our Vegas trip around hitting the best restaurants in town. We had extravagant meals paired with great drinks in fancy places..... but what was the best meal I had?   The Combo Pan Roast at Palace Station.  My girlfriend was adamant about coming here for the pan roast. And so we went. After waiting in the line for over an hour I have to say that I was growing impatient, and even frustrated. There was no way this meal would be worth that kind of wait. Oh, but it was.  We ordered oysters and the pan roast. Don't even bother with the oysters. Go all in on the pan roast. That's what you came for. And, like the experts who sat next to me, order one to go as well. That was a good move.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast.

xYzH0w-l78x9BxcsoO7_PA.text: I had to wait 2 hours during lunch The food is a little salty. Especially, it was not so delicious as to wait 2 hours and eat it.

YL-vqbDTE6rV2TVfNaNKHQ.text: Pros: Good food and very filling   Cons: Long wait time because of limited seating  Overall: Good food that is worth the wait. You'll definitely leave feeling full & satisfied

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace Station Pan Roast (shrimp, crab, chicken &amp; andouille sausage)

7I8RniBJcJTv9FN2IN482Q.text: 3.5 - I still wish we are able to give half stars. The food is a solid 4, the location off the strip and the long wait brings it down a notch.  I hate leaving the strip. I only leave when others suggest it and this happened to be the case. I was told Oyster bar is a MUST and as a big time foodie i had to check it out for myself.  YES, the food is good. Is it worth the 2.5 hour wait, NO!!!  My friend told me she waited 45 min even at 3am so this place seems to always have a wait. We went on a Friday at 8pm and by the time I had food in front of me, it was past 11pm - I was dying of hunger...I was hangry by the time we ate and it threw off my whole night.  If you are from LA/NY or any town with great food on the daily, there is really no reason to go off the strip and wait in a long line as they have such limited seating, it's a bit of a pain.  The pan roast is good...I didn't love the chicken in mine but the seafood portion made up for it. The sauce is very heavy and buttery. Clam chowder was also tasty and fresh oyster shooters were awesome. The pan roast can be shared. I suggest you get the pan roast and something else a bit lighter if you are ok sharing.   Service is slow which added to my frustration. As a few other reviewers mentioned, there is no sense of urgency, I guess since they are open 24 hours and there is limited seating they take their time. But after waiting such a long time, I wanted a "quick" dinner and it was very slow. I guess it doesn't help that there are 4 or so kettle things to cook in and the staff is just gossiping.   TIPS: -Do not go during regular eating hours. This place is open 24 hours a day so go "off-hours". ----There is only 18 seats in a bar setting,  don't go in a group - 2 should be max. I made the mistake of going with 4 people.  -Eat a snack in advance...don't go there hungry. Go at least 1.5 hrs before you "think" you want to eat. -If either you or your friend is not a fan of seafood, don't bother, there are plenty of great restaurants that take reservations you can go to that cater to both parties.

m6Jp-K_YAecnOx72bgtNOw.text: Love this place. We always end up here for date night and family dinners. Awesome oysters and mains. Servers are fab as are cocktails.

YWd_NHCDykXupEkJm-ZFgg.text: I'm sure by now you're aware that this place is known for their pan roast, right? It really is all that!  Each dish is made to order and they only have about 16 bar seats I believe, so don't come here hungry. You'll get hungry while you wait in line.   I ordered the combo pan roast and my goodness it was enough for two people to share! It's so creamy and delicious, you've probably never had anything like it before. At least that's how I felt, and I literally wanted to swim in it. IT WAS THAT GOOD! You can add extra seafood, chicken or andouille sausage and make it as spicy as you want from 1 to 10.  A trip to Vegas is not complete without setting aside 3-4 hours to enjoy a bowl of pan roast.

BAwYuIo42QAD3O0uvBY5kw.text: I'm standing in line as I'm writing this review! Absolutely love this place, and the one at Sunset Station is just as good!  The downside to this location is the bar seating; but, boy, the food is worth the waiting.   If you are a seafood lover you can't really go wrong with anything on the menu.  Our favorite is definitely the Pan Roast! The sauce is soo addicting and compliments the seafood well.  Portions are large, so you can usually get 2 meals out of it... unless the line builds up your appetite for the whole things.  The crab caesars salad and New England clam chowder are also worth a try for a nice lunch.  Oysters are always fresh  and plump too. This is a True hidden gem!

_-eroLNgTN-Si78gZV4IBg.text: Just go for the oysters, they were fresh and maaaasive. They did not disappoint in anyway. Servers and cooks were really out going and friendly. Ordered 2 dozen of their finest oysters and the Palace station pan roast (crab, shrimp, sausage).  Hard to describe how good it was, it was just really damn good.   Some reviews said they waited forever but I got there around 230pm on a Thursday and was seated 10 minutes later. Pretty quick or I was just lucky people ate fast.   I'm coming back just for the oysters. 24/7 my god this is a blessing

CnY1jE94VbxVF_0hpL8aDA.text: 4.5 stars, will return in the future to try more dishes before deciding whether to bump up the rating to the full 5 stars.  Finally tried Oyster Bar after being recommended by multiple people. My senior resident and I decided we would go on Friday morning after a long week of night shifts, and we finally made it over! It was a strategic decision as well since at 7AM on a Friday morning, there is very minimal wait time.  This (original) location is inside Palace Station casino, and it is literally a bar with just a handful of seats. Right when we sat down, we were given glasses of ice water and a warm sourdough roll. Service throughout was prompt and attentive. One of the cooks kept joking with us (they like to tease newbies/Oyster Bar virgins like me).   My senior resident (who has been multiple times) insisted that I had to try the combo pan roast, so I did. They have a really nifty cooking vessel for preparing dishes and while our dishes were not prepared right in front of us, we got to see other orders prepared in front of us.  The combo pan roast is this really rich, flavorful dish of shrimp, crab, and lobster in a brandy, tomato, and cream sauce. You pick a spice level from 1 to 10, and I picked 4, which had good heat without feeling too spicy (I can't imagine what 10 is like though). The dishes costs over $20, but there is a good amount of fresh seafood and is a fairly large bowl. It is served with a bowl of steamed white rice and you are given a gigantic spoon to eat with. I loved that this dish came out piping hot, and quickly devoured it all. Amazing flavors and good texture of the seafood. Wasn't wowed enough to give five stars, but there are so many other tasty things on the menu that I will have to come back, especially to try an actual oyster!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jambalaya.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Nuifgw4sVsGgMjzf9VcQ9A.text: The pan roast has always been my favorite and the service always friendly.  Always a line but it moves fast.  Just this past Friday three of us went for lunch we found that the price the same but only 5 shrimps, 2 small lobsters tail and scant shreds of crab., even celery was hardly noticeable.  The sauce was not as tasty as before.....some what disappointing!  Will not be returning!

LOTzhOWp58CAS-vZ7US--Q.text: We came at 7 50 am to beat the crowd. It was good coz only four ppl in front of us and there were open seats to be seated. But it took us 2 hrs to eat here, even though the line only took us 10 mins. Now you should know how the long line came.   After we got seated, everything is super slow. I understand the food is freshly cooked. But there's much more the chef can do to shorten the wait. This chef I'm talking is in some pictures. He is super slow to put things in order. I'm saying that coz we saw another Asian chef came after him was doing things much more quicker.   In terms of the food, it is creative for them to cook everything in those six pots. But is it necessary? The base is pre cooked. The only use for pots is mixing frozen seafood with the base. Yeah, everything they use is frozen. It's okay to use. But is it worthy to spend three hours to have it?   One star is for the creativity.

KMx2RYp9MCiUAFyov3NcWQ.text: Who wouda thunk?!!!  LOL!  This lil gem is located in the Palace Station Hotel in Vegas...the Palace where in Vegas.  Right?!!!!!!  No one really knows about this divey hotel and casino because it's off the strip...and quite honestly it was very unmemorable to me until now.  I apologize for not taking notice to you Palace Station but you should thank your lucky stars that you are the home of the Oyster Bar.  In one of our many girls weekend getaways to Vegas, a friend introduced us to the Combo Pan Roast...what is a Combo Pan Roast you ask?  Well...you can compare it to a seafood stew filled with lobster, shrimp, and crab in beautiful sauce that you can determine how spicy you want it 1-10, of course 10 being the hottest!  My first visit I did a 6 and that was not spicy enough for me, so the second time I did an 8 and it kicked my arse...but it was still delicious!!!  Other must try dishes are the Seafood Jambalaya, House Gumbo and their Alaskan Clam Chowder (not your typical clam chowder because they add lobster to it also...AMAZINGLY GOOD!)  Most dishes are served with the choice of either white rice or pasta.  It's in the center of the casino and considered a bar, so no one under 21 is allowed to even eat there.  There is no formal dining area...there's about 12 bar stools that overlook their little kitchen area.  They make their dishes right in front of you too and everything is from scratch.  There's no stove, but a really cool cooking apparatus the allows the chef to make up to 6 dishes at a time if I recall, that is why it may take up to 30 to 45 minutes just to get your food.  They do give you warm sourdough rolls to start that are to die for also, but make sure you make room for all the deliciousness they serve up.  Prices are standard for seafood dishes between $18 - $25.  Beer and wine only I believe, but beer is available on tap.  The best time to come if you dare to eat this late or early, depending on how you look at it is around 1:30 in the morning.  Yes, they are open 24 hours!!!  No wait and stools are readily available for you.  The worst time to come is lunch time, dinner time and every hour in between.  You literally have to stand in line and trust me, your wait time can be as long as an hour to an hour and a half depending on the size of your party.  But don't worry, it's definitely all worth it!!!!!!!!!  Make it a priority to try this place on your next visit to Sin City.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. combo pan roast and jambalaya...spicy level 8

zZAx2vzmNk8Flnqgs6k3mA.text: So worth it! I got tell combo gumbo and it was so good. The waiter and cook was very friendly. It's kinda long wait but definitely worth it.

_goQGHIOBjMOe-RTBFS_eA.text: What you yelpers said!  What a cool experience! After reading about the rush here and wait for seats and finding ourselves looking for lunch late afternoon on a Tuesday we thought, this is our chance! Good plan.  I didn't quite understand from the other yelpers the whole "cooked in front of you" concept. Maybe on my mobile app I didn't read enough. But while we sat down and helped ourselves to a couple of Wedmier hefeweizen and had a dozen oyster shucked to order and started on those, we watched the magic occur.   There are 6 'pots', all plumbed directly for steam. They place your selected seafood into the pots with some wonderfully seasoned broth to start the cooking. Midway in the cooking, then they add the necessary differentiators for the different orders. Gumbo gets a roux, "pan roast" gets a cream brandy sauce (not following how that is a roast, but I digress), etc... Heat is adjusted to your liking, and the 7 out of 10 was really perfect for people who like spicy but still want to taste their seafood.  Major kudos to yelpers who let me know going in that the plate split was wise. No way we should have gotten 2 entrees. A dozen oysters and one pan roast washed down with beer was perfect for the two of us.
