Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pan roast

PWbPGBU_6ftdd3KLoTpj5A.text: This place was absolutely what my expectations would be. My first time at palace station oyster bar...let me tell you ill be coming back for sure. The oysters taste like they came staight from a fishing boat from the freshesh part of the pacific ocean. The chefs we extremely funny and friendly. We were quickly services. Overall great experience!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo seafood pam roast. Omg
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aftermath
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Killed it

1huGwho5GH_EO3iSbaoSHQ.text: I am so glad I live in Vegas and don't have to travel from L.A. anymore to get great seafood - it's the best I've had in decades.  The scallops are my personal favorite, cooked to perfection with a crispy Japanese bread crumb coating over the largest jumbo scallops ever.  Because of my love for scallops I opt to have the Scallop Shrimp combo made without shrimp, just scallops, which the chefs have always been happy to do for me. This is THE place to take a friend or family member from out of town for the best seafood experience at very reasonable prices!   Open for lunch through midnight most nights.

yIbE6tCMTmRZzFhR1vzh_A.text: Absolutely amazing. This will be a must for me every time I'm in Vegas. The only down side about this place is the wait time. We got in line at 7:30 pm and didn't get seated until 9:00 pm. And this isn't even the worst time I've heard. There are longer wait times depending what day of the week and what time of day you go.   I had the Combo Pan Roast. It was delicious. It made the wait time well worth while.   I would definitely recommend this place to anyone along with a warning about how long the wait can be.

n3C4O-8tq70GneTdmJj2Ug.text: Definitely worth the wait.  Worth the smoke smell that your hair and clothes will carry after said wait, debateable.  But you're in Vegas and that does come with the territory.  Oysters on the half shell were good, not stupendous.  Primarily due to the varying sizes and not quite being properly shucked (having the bivalve disconnected from the bottom shell is pretty standard where I grew up) and the gumbo is again, good but not great.  I think that the roux would need to be darker to garner more flavor from it and to deepen the overall taste of the gumbo.  But again, you're in LV, not NOLA.  The pan roast is everything people rave about.  Seriously, not even something small to pick at here.  I loved it, as did my husband (his second trip.)  Go to experience it at least once.  Return to bathe yourself in the cream sauce that is the pan roast.

vchZTfj2P5MEbReo-1Gn-g.text: Rule #1, dont let the long line intimidate you.... the food is WELL worth the wait!! Best gumbo, oysters, and bread!! You will leaving there with a happy stomach and some leftovers!

wSWPvwruhHoXIgK_cGjJUg.text: This is my 2nd time here of course the wait is long  but it's usually well worth it this time not so much we waited over an hour I got a drink tastes like straight water!!!!!  We ordered a cup of clam chowder we NEVER got it smh!!!! The waiter never came back and asked if I wanted another drink!!! Service sucks the cook super nice and wonderful give him a raise

b0fULLfr4NQM2OI8EEECpA.text: This place is pretty awesome. There is only two bad things that is bad about here. First, the wait is ridiculous because there is only like 16 seating or something like that. There was only 6 people in front of me and I waited an hour and half. A lot of time people are ordering take-out and would sit at the seating area as they wait...which I don't understand. If you're just waiting, step aside and let those who are going to be dining in to sit and eat! Second, the service here... umm it's random. It can suck, and it can be really great. But doesn't matter because here at the Oyster Bar, it's all about the food. Get the Pan Roast. Done!

BCYJtZ_ysCml3GODF47xKw.text: This place fails on so many levels. The largest issue is that no one seems to be in charge here. They have a cook and 2 waitresses.  They lack adequate seating which leaves a long line of hungry people waiting at least an hour to be seated.  I attempted to eat here on a couple of occasions but didn't because of the line.  When I saw a short line on my last night I decided to try it. The waitresses leave dirty dishes in front of empty seats for 10 minutes + only extending the wait for everyone.   Once I was finally seated a waitress dropped a roll in front of me after a few minutes.  I wasn't actually greeted for another 10 minutes. The waitress who spoke to me asked what I wanted to order and at that point I had to request a menu because she didn't notice I sat there with nothing. I did order something because of the amount of time I had invested. I got a Caesar salad with shrimp to get something quick. The waitress was rude. 'That's all you want?' Followed by a sigh & smacking her mouth.   The salad had 3 shrimp on it, powdered cheese that 5 year olds eat on spaghetti,  a limp romaine lettuce.   Save your money & TIME.  Go anywhere else!

JWUpu2SHPsrXfB1i1k_R0w.text: First of all, I am very impatient when it comes to food and if you tell me I'm going to have to wait an hour for a chair, then *at least*  another 30 minutes for my order then it better be FANTASTIC.   Chef Ricardo and Sandra were on shift that  Friday night and dude, I seriously felt bad for them. The place was packed and there were at least 20 people in line waiting, but both of them still provided great service. I guess my hour and a half wait was not too bad at all. There was a group of 6 older folks from LA who told us they've been waiting for 2+ hrs but always come here when in LV. They assured me that it's "very well worth the wait"  Hubby got the etouffee spicy level 8 and I had the Pan roast with oysters, shrimp and crab spicy level 7. When we finally got our orders and had my first bite, I TOTALLY GOT IT. It felt like it was a dish customized for my discerning palate, perfect in every way. They were not stringent on the seafood either, as I devoured the chunks of sweet lobster in my soup. Hubby loved his etouffee as well. We knew at that point we are going to be frequent customers (writing this makes me want to go NOW). It will also be a go-to restaurant when family/friends come visit.   I love spicy foods and seafood, and I can't think of any other place that can rival the Oyster Bar. This place tops my short list of must-try-eats in Las Vegas.   ***Note: Pleasantly surprised that they also give 25% military discount! So don't forget to show your ID card when you're there to save some serious $$$.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast with crab, shrimp, &amp; lobster spicy level 7. Heaven in a bowl!

SdNKWaSmdM3p71Zh15Ec3Q.text: Yummy Pan Roast! I came here after a late night of hitting the Vegas Clubs. And boy there was a wait. Ending up waiting an hour here but it was worth it. You sit the bar area and order your food. Honestly, the Pan Roast is all you need. The sauce was perfect.

TEuw73IbCunHZ_lGX_WOZg.text: On 10/07/16 my wife and I had lunch here.  We were courteously seated and waited on by Christyna.  She was GREAT.  We ordered 1 shrimp cocktail, 6 oysters on the half shell, and a combo roast - level 5, to split.  DEE-LISH.  This was a good combo roast, but again, NOT as good as Ocean Trail in Scottsdale.  Still our leader of the pack and all time favorite.  This was good.  At level 5 it wasn't that spicy.  I had to pour on the hot sauce.  But it was good and we will return.  The oysters were meaty and large.  The shrimp cocktail was good as well, although the cocktail sauce was weak and seemed commercially prepared.  Not the best, but certainly edible.  Total tab with 1 beer: $56.75.

gGbN6ebNIiWWMoiDT_MDCA.text: The best thing at Palace Station.  Expect a line to sit almost every moment of the day and night.  The food is well worth it. Best Gumbo, fresh oysters and anything on the menu.  It's hands down the best I have ever eaten.

yqigfqXMEMWLlVPei1VzLQ.text: Very Seldom do I give 5 stars butt this place is on fire.. If you like Cajun style food, you're gonna love this hidden jewel. We had the Palace Pan Roast. A wine, tomatoe, cream based rough FULL shrimp, chicken,  sausage and lump crab meat.  Scrumptious. One warning, it's a bar restaurant and only serves 18 people at a time so be prepared for a 1 to 3 hour wait. It's open 24 hours a day and really only slows down from 5-7 a.m., that should tell you how bomb it is. It's inside the Palace station hotel and worth the drive off the strip.,

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ok, very rarely do I give 5 stars but this place deserves all 5! Scrumptious

WYLKBMCINNWf-dR5K16bXg.text: 1.5 hours in line and 1 hour to get my food.  And I would do it all over again. Though maybe at like 4 am on a Tuesday LOL....  Ya'll, it was that good. That night, Heaven was a hot piping bowl of seafood, flavored in a creamy tomato and brandy sauce.

8IvhjZtkCGAQS8y7oZTm2g.text: After hearing from friends (and just about everyone I talk to) about how great this place was, we were a little nervous to check it out, fearing it'd been overhyped.  But boy did they come through.  Ordered a dozen oysters, the mixed pan roast and manhatten clam chowder.  The oysters were AMAZING - simply put, the best that either my wife or I have every had.  The pan roast was good and filling - I realy like how you can choose the spiciness on a scale of 1-10.  I chose 4 since I was sharing, and i could have probably handled a 6.  The clam chowder was okay, but much better once we threw a little hot sauce in it.  Overall, this is definitely a place we'll be back to.  Not sure if I'd wait in line for 1-2 hours like some yelpers, but we were able to walk right up and eat at noon on a Wednesday.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters!

Z1z-q2d65iKuUaOtAt83sw.text: Usually I would question the seafood in Las Vegas because its so far from the ocean...but Oyster Bar never disappoints with its freshness! I must mention I lied when I said Bacchanal was the only place in Vegas I would wait in a line for; Oyster Bar inside Palace Station is the only other place I won't complain waiting in line for. Although, I do wish they'd buy up more space on the floor and put in a couple extra tables..   Everything they offer here is ahhmazing -both for the taste and view ;) As in their name, oysters, here are superb and a definite must order when eating here.  I highly suggest the combo pan roast which consists of shrimp, lobster, and crab. And (not or! lol) the gumbo. Just do it. You will not regret it my loves.   They charge an extra $5 if you share entrees but its totally worth it because the portions are very generous. There are no take out orders -which although can be frustrating, I do appreciate it because that means your food is as fresh as possible. And for those of you who like to fill up on soft, buttery bread, they offer that while you wait :)  Another thing I really enjoy is that you can watch the whole process of your delicious foods being prepared, cooked, plated/bowled right in front of you! The chefs are all so nice too. Makes the whole experience that much more enjoyable. Last, for those of you who are going with another person who can't quite handle the heat like you, you're always welcomed to adjust the level of spice in your dishes. But I'd suggest nudging the ones who can't handle the spice, to the plate ;P seafood is always more yummy when its spicy!

3hTWnlbhUws8un98Ypun7g.text: open 24/7... come here on the off hours... so you don't wait in a que. I come here after work in the wee early mornings and there's no line. On my last visit last week... I had to wait almost an hr for my pan roast! How crazy is that?!  It wasn't bus either... I'm not to sure what the deal was... but I was hungry and tired... not a good time to wait that long for food! That's my reason for the minus one star... always kinda pricey... but you're eating seafood! Otherwise... this is a hidden gem inside of the PS.  PAN ROAST... I LOVE YOU!!! mmm... comfort food at its best!

f0KIWPce4pi75zfvGbpVIA.text: 5 girls, 7:30pm on a Saturday night with 13 people ahead of us in line = 1 hour wait. Seated in the middle for a perfect view! The chef was hilarious and makes small talk with everyone (keep in mind this is really a BAR in the middle of the hotel, not a restaurant. Seats only about 15).  Was it worth it? YES! We had our 99cents margaritas from Palace Station in hand while waiting in line. (The best and worst idea). Margaritas filled us up a little. Our group of 5 girls shared 3 combo pan roasts (shrimp, LOBSTER, crab). We finished total a little over 1 bowl .. woops. To-go'd the rest of them. There is a $5 charge to share bowls. The pan roast was so creamy and delicious - my favorite part: CHUNKS OF LOBSTER. Ohhhh yeah =) You can only eat so much at a time though since its so thick and creamy so you'll always end up wanting more .. beware!  Our bill came out to be about $100 w/ tax and tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. combo !!!

bEEeNg_DiELBWlCDgps4iw.text: Hands down the best pan roast soup place Ever! This place make the soup right in front of you and makes your mouth water while your stomach is just jumping with anticipation of all the goodness it's about to enjoy.  The only thing is they only have 18 bar counter seats and the lines and wait times is crazy.  Usually an hour or longer till you get seated to taste anything but if you're only here once in a while then it's still worth the wait. I'll be back every time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yes there&#39;s only 18 seats...
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This line of 10 people is at least an hour half or longer wait...but worth it!

ZuKtz-nQJ8y9HRkMpVi9Og.text: Waited for an hr and 45mins! was a Bittersweet waiting game. But the pan roast combination. Amazingly Yummy! Seriously!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast combination.

5jjfHnjZilFUCUsjCga5kA.text: Simply put. Waited over an hour and well worth it! Every cowboy from Mt, ND, SD knows about the place. What a blast and the food was awesome!

H6gd4mZazWjNDANEV89dVQ.text: Can't beat the price, can't beat the hours, and best of all, quality is pretty good considering its vegas and there is no ocean in sight. I would come back.

XBpaqGxe59_fevqWyPyoKw.text: I always try to come here when I visit Vegas. This is probably one of the best places to get pan roast. This place is very busy and has limited seating because it's bar seating only. DO NOT Come here with a big group and expect to eat all at the same time. I would suggest only coming here with a group of 3 or less. I've waited for 1hr-3hrs to eat here but it is worth the wait. If you can try to get takeout but I think you also need to wait in line as if you were dining in. This was the first place I've tried a pan roast and every place after could never live up to this place.

DYEGDAgHCBw3fR8QUc9mEQ.text: This is the only place that I can wait 2+hours. I waited almost three hours and it's always worth it. Best Pan roast and raw oyster ever!

aFhoAwPUn3glm7IhRO4YQQ.text: Highly recommend the Bouilla roast.  Combo pan roast and bouillabaisse.  With extra lobster.  Boom.    Filled with very generous portions King Crab (yes the good chit), jumbo shrimp, clams, mussels, lobster, and fish.  In a creamy delicious stew.     Did I say lobster?  Crap ton of lobster in this thing.  They kinda look like huge shrimps but you'll know the difference when you bite into one.  Trust me.   I love spicy food and only got a 5 on the heat scale,  I'll prob go 7 or 8 next time cause I didn't really taste the heat.   Sourdough roll is good, and 1/2 dozen clams on the half shell for an app.  Middleneck clams per the chef (who had a deadpan sense of humor and was fun to talk to - even though he's a Bronco fan)  Voodoo Bloody Mary was pretty good - had a huge jumbo shrimp and horseradish in it.  The wait on a Thursday around 2pm was  about 30 minutes.     Just go already.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HkNGsSDRaskOnulR0T4xKg.text: I finally got to try Oyster Bar after being bookmarked for almost 2 years. I don't like to wait in lines to eat and I refuse to wait in a line when I'm hungry! So finally, I'm in Vegas, not super hungry and it's pretty early for dinner so I'm up for the challenge. There are only 16 seats at the counter so that explains why there is almost always a line of people waiting, though they are open 24 hours!  Our wait was only 20 minutes on a Wednesday at 6:30pm. Everything smelled divine. We ordered oysters on the half shell which were super fresh and yummy. We also had the Seafood Pan Roast (spice level 6) and the Bouillabaisse (spice level 5). Both were delicious! The Pan Roast is very rich and decadent...with all the cream and butter in it, really tempered the spice. In fact, I thought the Bouillabaisse tasted spicier than the Pan Roast. We made our own combination of the two since the Pan Roast was so rich, we added some of the Bouillabaisse broth to it and it was superb. I enjoyed all the assorted seafood and the rice that came with our dishes. I would definitely make it a point to come back if it's not a killer line. It's probably a good thing that I live in CA otherwise I would either go broke or gain 100# eating here.  I am jelly that my DH is back in Vegas 2 weeks later without me, enjoying the Cioppino this time. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. I wonder if he'll bring home some Pan Roast take-out...hmmm.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boullabaisse $23.99

TT45dFYxGPFEEq5H8XDg3A.text: My husband and I arrived around 3am, there were about three parties ahead of us. We waited about 1.5 hr before seated. By the time we got there and finish our food it was 5:45am. Corey is a champion holding down the fork with  being the only cook. The Hostess was amazing to, sorry I forgot her name.   We ordered one dozen oyster, one dozen clams, Alaskan Chowder (#5 for spices), and Combo Pan Roast (shrimp, crab, clam and lobster with #5 spices) with rice on the side. The food was amazing! The wait was worth it.   We can taste all the shrimp, crab and lobster in the Alaskan Chowder, especially love the kick of spices. My husband was falling sleep so we have to pack the Pan Roast to good. We have one bite before we passed out and I have to said, it was amazing. Will definitely come back here and try the bouillabaisse - look amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan Chowder
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1dozen oyster
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1 dozen Clams

UghvdFmg3qC4BRfnUzJLeA.text: What a find! A small little place in the Palace Station. Some people get turned off by the wait time but it is definitely worth the wait. We had the jambalaya and the lobster pan roast. Both were amazing and I cannot wait to go back!

oqz6mKMgMyqw9NGPyPxCHQ.text: This little bar is tucked in the center of the casino. Its easy to miss and then when you find it, your first impression is "is this it?". It literally is a bar that seats only 18 people. There's usually always a line and you can end up waiting for hours. Tip: go on a weekday. There's usually one server and one cook. Despite how busy they get, they seem to always have a smile. The chef cooks everything in front of you. They have a wide variety of gumbos, pan roast, pasta and etc all made to order in front of you.  We ordered: a dozen of oysters on the half shells. I was skeptical about oysters here cause come on now, we are in a desert.  It to my surprise it was fresh and tasty.  Alaskan clam chowder. Delicious, creamy, fattening but oh so yummy. Filled with lobster, shrimp, muscles, clams. Every bite was worth the calories.  Shrimp scampi. buttery goodness in every bite with the shrimp and pasta cooked to perfection in texture and broth very sweet from its natural seafood broth...and butter.   Seafood jambalaya. I liked this dish but only thing was it had way to much rice in it.   You get to choose a spice level from 0-10.  Now enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KkRKpMLPpTB6yifZ149tRQ.text: I almost didn't want to write a review for this place because I don't want more people to know about it but I couldn't help myself. The first time I went here was with my boyfriend and I was very skeptical to where he was taking me. When we got to the bar, there were a handful of people in front of us. I didn't think much of it but 1.5 hours later, we finally sat down. At this point you can imagine that I was a little annoyed with my boyfriend for making me wait that long and I was starving but he assured me that it was worth the wait.  I don't say this often, but he was right (just kidding, kinda)! We started off with a dozen oysters and after telling the chef how long we waited (he probably hears that a lot) he even threw in a couple extra oysters for us! The oysters were huge! One was half the size of my hand. They tasted very fresh -- no fishy taste.  My boyfriend and I shared the combo pan roast with two sides of rice. It was love at first bite. It was my first time trying pan roast so I didn't have anything to compare it to but in terms of just best dishes I've ever had, it was pretty up there. It comes with generous amounts of seafood. And unless you want to take some home for later or you have a big appetite, I think this dish is great for sharing between two people. There's supposedly an extra charge for sharing, but I think since we order oysters, we never see a sharing fee show up on the bill.  This last time we went was on a Sunday around 2:30 p.m. and there was well over a 2 hour wait so we decided to eat somewhere else. It's worth a wait but not when you're starving. We went back the next day around 11 a.m. and only waited about 30 minutes. I noticed we also had the same chef as the first time I went and he hooked us up again! At the end of our meal, he made us these oyster sandwich crackers, which were yummy. This place wins in food & service!  I highly recommend going to this place next time you're in Vegas and want to get away from all the fancy restaurants on the strip. Warning: you must be at least 21 to sit at the bar, don't come in large groups, and be prepared to wait in a line no matter what time of day. Once you're at the bar though you can order to-go for those who couldn't make it with you -- although, like anything else, it's best when it's fresh. I love you, Oyster Bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast with the rice on the side
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half Dozen Oysters with an extra one ;D

MXXVtGXxgX2slih1EORjaA.text: "I think I found the promised land." Lol.  Folks... I've been all over to almost every dang place in the u.s. looking for the best chowder. Not kidding. Talking about places like Boston, San Francisco, New York, Seattle, Los Angeles. And then there is this place. Omg. This place. Lol.  Not going to lie...I waited almost 2 hours before getting a seat... Then add another hour for cooking, then another hour and half for eating. Lol.  But was the experience worth it you ask? Hell yes.  Thank you "Corey the chef" for making such amazing, fresh off the steamer hot chowder and gumbo dishes. Simply Amazing. And Christopher our server. Super cool guy.  But "its just chowder" you say. I'm never going to wait that long for just chowder. Suit yourself... That'll mean shorter wait times and more chowder for me. :D  I'll be back oyster bar. You haven't seen the last of me yet. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House gumbo... Spice level 8
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Absolutely amazing. The Alaskan clam chowder
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up of combo pan roast

YyaCRWE4nKafPMY7xJycvw.text: We waited for 2 hours to get a seat at this place and we were not disappointed with the food.  What I didn't like was the amount of waste I saw with the water.  The chef had the water running full blast the entire hour we were there, sometimes running 3 faucets at the same time.  He was cleaning out his pots but let then run overflowing for the entire time we were there.  I just do not like to see that kind of waste.  The servers were not super friendly but they were efficient.  If you can handle the wait, the food is amazing.  Try the oysters!  Fantastic and so fresh!

etTSyVPjQ8Gd8VZiai4nJA.text: Delicious!!!!  located in the palace casino a little off the strips.  its literally a random "bar" in the middle of the casino.  probably has 12 seats around the bar with 1 cook and 1 server.  it is opened 24/7 so make use of it or else wait in line.  service can be quite slow since only 2 people working.   food wise-they have a lot of seafood options from pan roasts to cioppino to gumbo.  pan roast is seafood in a tomato bandy cream sauce served with a scoop of rice.  make sure to soak up all the delicious sauce with the rice or sourdough bread they give you.  portions are huge but you will devour it all because it is that yummy and warming. they have apps like oysters or clams on the shell. $5 charge for sharing.

9MFnsDO_at8Yyd4WmN3hdg.text: This was the result of a 2 hour research project on where to dine. I saw it as a tremendous risk; after all, it's in the Palace Station for crying out loud, where I could have gotten a room for a few days for the price of my meal. I don't even think I've been in there before. Not to sound snobby, but there are LOTS of choices around here.  Anyway, the bottom line is that The Oyster Bar may as well be the New Orleans Embassy. Of course I had to have the Combo Pan Roast, and a half dozen on the half shell, to keep me occupied during the wait. I don't feel like typing all night, just count on all the positive reviews being True.  I got there at 4, and snagged THE open seat. When I left after 5, the line snaked through half the casino. And it's not fast food, so just chill and enjoy yourself.

__BNJ51h5WKI4Ht1VkqP2Q.text: Love the pan roast combo!this is worth for waiting in a long line every time I came to this place!

wcR4jKwwwA5aJkx3PAO-LQ.text: I wish they're located closer to me! Every time I make a trip to Vegas now, I HAVE to eat here at least once!! The first time I came, I had to wait 2 hours before we were seated. Additional hour for the food to arrive and for us to eat. This past weekend, we came around lunch time and the wait was merely 20 minutes!! SCOREEEEEE! The bouillabaisse and alaskan chowder were my go to. As well as a dozen of oysters. Can't beat the quality of the seafood and price! The chowder tasted just as good the next day when I had the left over for lunch!

fN791SLP3LI3OfZBXxTE-w.text: The food at this oyster bar is great! I always get the combo pan roast which is a combination of crab, shrimp and lobster mixed in creamy tomato based soup with a scoop of rice, and an order of oysters. The oysters are big and a good size, not those little ones from other places. The lines are usually really long but it wasn't so bad around 2pm. Only reason why they didn't get the 5th star was because of the usual long wait times. Food makes up for the wait.

ADPyfXz1trA2LqQHbsQ9CA.text: This is my new favorite place to eat. The Oyster Bar has amazing food. My husband and I were not so sure about the wait, but OMG it was well worth it. Chef D. Brown was amazing and our food was so delicious. It was hands down the best food I ever had. We had New England Clam Chowder, Pan Roast and Seafood Jambalaya. We got them made at a 3 in spice. I will eat here every single time I am in Vegas.

9x1-2e_M5LY7mX0k2MmjuA.text: Pros: 1. Absolutely Delicious 2. Good price  Cons: 1. Always a wait -- even 5-7am 2. Slow service

wMsUYLdsDzw5LA_iGRd03Q.text: Long Wait, But Will be Worth it!  This place is legit, Yelp did not fail me on this one. The food is absolutely delicious. My wife and I tried the Clam Chowder and shared the House Pan roast along with some ice cold beers. Both dishes were very flavorful. Clam chowder was chunky and creamy with plenty of clams inside not watered down at all, huge serving we shared the smaller serving. The House Pan Roast I ordered was at spice level 6 perfect for me maybe couldve pushed 7, cause I love spicy hot. It was super hot, just like I enjoy my soups and there was plenty of meat inside, they do not skimp here at all. So many flavors hitting you at once, making me crave some right now thinking about it. I will definitely be back. Word of advice dont eat here if you plan to go out partying because after this meal I was so stuffed I went back to my hotel passed out and didnt wake up for the Club. Also, come early we got here at 0530 Friday night for dinner waited about an hour and a half and were done by 8pm. The wait is sooooooo loooooooong due to limited seating, be courteous if you eat here, once your done with the meal kick rocks were waiting people!!! Finally prices were very reasonable considering this is Vegas and you are getting huge portions here with quality food.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Long line limited seating grrrr!!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef cooking up some good food in front of u
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast soooo delicious

VUpGsaSNGobVY26p6MahfQ.text: Always a wait but sooooo worth it. This time around we waited 1 hour. They really should do pagers so folks can go play while waiting for a spot. Get the Pan Roast and oysters. They fly them fresh in daily.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

1D8y9TOoQPR6sqKqlwixFw.text: 5 STARS!! Read my full review on my blog: bit.ly/2c9PPZV --------------------------------------- Been here several times and everytime it is perfect. There will be a long line but it is so worth it so you should plan your day around this meal. The oysters are double the size of California oysters so that right there is a bonus. The Pan Roast is so perfect with the ridiculous amoun of crab in my order. Coming back next time like I always do and you should too!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Bouillabaisse is just the right amount of fresh seafood in a tomato soup.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These oysters are double the size of California oysters. So meaty and fresh!

nnHuBbKPHHzYdTPMc-mueA.text: Wait time sucks, but its even worse when after waiting for almost two hours, the server skips your order and serves another group that got there later than you. The pan roast takes time to cook and skipping your turn means a good 20min + delay when you already starved yourself while waiting in line. We got our food by the time that group finished their food. Sure, you can say I'm being too tough on them but youll be pissed to when youre as hungry as i was. I was just wondering why people tend to go to the one inside the palace but the food is no different from the other Oyster bars. I guess people tend to come here for their 24/7 open hours? The food was similarly good as the other oyster bars but I rather go to the one inside Harrah's (on the strip) for little or no waiting in lines and multiple dining tables rather than 10 seated bar. The waitress was slow as hell and they dont even bother giving you a refill. They seemed occupied by talking to one another. I will never go here again and I recommend anyone smart enough to do the same.

Op_s7eDBjj-M9mMCbr__jg.text: To be completely honest I did not have a good experience, BUT the pan roast was delicious and that is why my rating is 4 stars. The service on the other hand....  It started off with the boyfriend and I deciding at 2AM to get some late dinner. He was excited to bring me to this place because he claimed the wait was worth it. Horrible idea to go to this place when your stomach is already starved.... Major downside is there is no place to sit while waiting in line for hours. We waited the average amount of two hours to be seated. At this point I am cranky/hangry. Only because the server was extremely slow (I'm going to say maybe it was because he was exhausted). Instead of cleaning tables and seating people as quickly as possible, he let 10 seats empty (people left at different times) until he finally cleaned up and seated people. This place seats a total of 18......  Finally seated and excited to get some food. We ordered the combo pan roast and combo gumbo, both five stars. Let me say we were second to place our food order as the people next to us ordered first (they were seated first, we were seated second).  The food is now coming out, but the confused server decides to give our pan roast to another couple and bags up the gumbo thinking it was an error....... The worst part was that the couple pointed in our direction I'm assuming they were saying we placed our order first... But they still ate the given pan roast. My boyfriend speaks up and the server is apologetic and can see I am extremely agitated from hunger. He says he is sorry and gives us a bowl of clam chowder to tide us over a little. He promises that to apologize for the wait and error we will only be charged for one entree.  Finally! We got our food. The pan roast was extremely delicious. The gumbo was not our cup of tea. We got 5 star heat but the heat felt more like an 8 or 9.. We're not sure if that was another error made by the server/chef.   Meanwhile, there was a party of four ladies that got seated the same time as us. The server messed up three of the ladies orders...... I personally do not think that the food is worth the (2+ hour) wait and slow service.

L2csiIoiSkmB-UkaTlAGbg.text: Must get the combo pan fried! Soooo amazing.  Friends told us the gumbo was to die for,  so we came here and waited in the line.  But I thought the gumbo was alright, but i guess my palette doesn't know gumbo well.  But the combo pan fried was amazing! Oyster appetizer was really fresh, too.  Just fyi, the restaurant is literally a bar that only seats maybe 20 people at max,  first come first served.  We came at 8pm in a Wed night with 2 families of 4-5 before us,  and we waited 1.5 hrs. Still worth the wait. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original house gumbo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan fried

VMJmpfXWJ8-Q9LKu3J-46w.text: Oh Baby Jesus Where have you been all my life. This lovely Gem hidden inside of Palace Station makes me think about the first time you got some. Regardless of what time it is you'll wake up and go to do it because it's that good!!!! That's what the Oyster Bar is to me.   Parking: Your at a casino, take a taxi and save yourself some time.   Service: Ok folks as noted the wait here can be ridiculous. I came at 3:30 AM and there was still a 1 hr 30min wait. Don't expect magic, they got only bar seating for 18, so you might not even sit next the people you came with. But who cares when the food taste like this.   Food:  Oysters: Hot diggity they got an oyster special from 1am-9am. 1/2 dozen for $10. You know that's the way to go. They did a great job cleaning the oysters and they tasted extremely fresh!!!! On top of that they give you exactly what you need: Lemons, Horse Radish, and Cocktail sauce. Ha even a little splash of Tabasco and papa bear was happy.   Pan Roast:   Mannnnnnnnn, that thing is how you wish you could cook seafood. Right flavors and lovely large pieces of fish. No joke the serving size is huge. I even popped that big girl open in the morning for a little recovery snack!!! In all seriousness the best best (soup, stew, gumbo) however it's categorized in my life. On top of that you get to pick your spicy level which is super important to me. I love a dish that comes out not needing any additional love or flavor. It's by far the best thing I've had in Vegas EVER!  Suck it up and wait in line "That's what she said"  "If you're going to do something tonight that you'll be sorry for tomorrow morning, sleep late."

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu Back
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu Pg2
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu Pg 1

-VZlDAeEa0XTWYjZu4pRWg.text: When in Vegas, you must visit the oyster bar!  The lines are usually long, but I guarantee you that the gumbo and pan roast make it worth the wait. The trick is to grab a few drinks from the bar. That way, when it's your turn to be seated, you'll forget all about the wait and devour on the awaited dishes.  The gumbo is absolutely good. As soon as it hits your tongue, it awakens all your taste buds. There's no better place in the West Coast to get gumbo but here. The pan roast is outstanding. The creaminess and spices mixed with seafood makes your mouth wanting more. Just thinking about the pan roast is making my mouth salivate! We also love their fresh oysters, clams, and shrimp. There's no other place in the desert that serves fresh seafood for reasonable prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WALwF_IOteQcfP-rPhMmdw.text: Worth the 3 hour wait! COMBO PAN ROAST exceeded my expectation!  Everything about this dish is heaven in your mouth!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SEAFOOD JAMBALAYA  Shrimp, Crab, Lobster, Andouille Sausage, Mussels &amp; Clams.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waited 3hrs for this goodness!  COMBO PAN ROAST-  Shrimp, Crab and Lobster sautéed with Brandy, Cream and Tomato.

18Rkpp6y9xdNuqUGI7zTjg.text: This is a must every time we come to Vegas! Order the pan roast! You will not regret it. The only downside is the wait time due to the limited amount of high top chairs at the bar... but I promise the wait is worth it. Waiter Chris is awesome! He's always so welcoming and friendly.

FaDUIVHgrkxVTovVbVh5iA.text: Apparently this little oyster bar inside Palace Station (about 15 minutes from Venetian) is always packed with a 2 hour wait, but we went at 1am on a Friday early morning and no line! Though we had to wait for ten minutes or so because the seats we were destined for were still occupied. We got seated and immediately I loved the vibe of the servers. Super friendly and welcoming, even at 1am in the morning! I wasn't feeling super hungry, so I shared the pan roast with a dozen oysters between me and another friend. The chef was fun to chat with during the meal and they cook it all right in front of you! The pan roasts were very interestingly cooked - I can't really explain it but you can see in my photos or try it out for yourself! The oysters were alright - still a bit sandy and fishy tasting, but with the hot sauce and lemon, it helped! The pan roast is a very generous portion for around $20. The dish even has spice levels! My friends opted in for 3 and 4 levels out of 10. 4 was the perfect kick for me, since I'm not much of a spicy person, but 3 was perfect for those that don't do spicy at all. There were a lot of shrimps in the pan roast, but the rice that came with it pairs perfectly with the flavor. I definitely want to return! I will be back Oyster Bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp pan roast $21
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast in the making
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. How the pan roast is made

wpp7Gc_QQbN4SS6Qselo1g.text: So we waited a minimum of an hour like everyone else but it was definitely worth it. Service was good, food was delicious and they don't rush you. Everyone is so busy behind the 16 seating bar that one can understand that everyone had to wait as long (or longer than you) so once you get seated, you want to take your time on savoring every bite of your made to order plates. We got half a dozen oysters, (they were almost as big as my palm) and we opted for a bowl of clam chowder to start. A very generous portion for the price! We also ordered the combo pan roast and Etouffe... we couldn't finish half so asked for it to go. They are very considerate, the put it spoons which came in handy as our suite with kitchenette did not have dinnerware. I obviously snacked on the leftovers luckily with the spoon given! Highly recommended! I don't understand why they don't expand, but then again, why fix it if it ain't broken? Go there and wait in line when you're about to get hungry. Once you smell the aromas and see the anticipation on people's faces, you'll be anxious and excited to be seated! Bon appetite!

uMhgeOG3EURkpajpGlakrQ.text: I will always prefer a spot like Oyster Bar over one of those fancy award-winning spots on the Strip. I actually find 5-star table service uncomfortable and I don't like to dress up, lol. So Palace Station is right up my alley!  I feel like the wait time has just expanded immensely over the years, but I will make a note to come for early lunch or early dinner (and def not anytime after midnight).  The wait time will vary from 1 hour to 3 and sometimes you think it is short, but the people up front are actually saving spots. Wear your 'I am patient' hat and get ready for some quality eating.   Their pan roasts are the best with their bold, creamy sauce and spicy flavors mixed together into a giant bowl.   I literally drool thinking about their food.  I like their combo one (seafood) an the palace one (which has sausage).The last time I was here I was hungry when I stood in line, then about to faint from hunger when we sat down two hours later!  Luckily, a beer and some time later, Bob saved me with the palace pan roast.   SO GOOD.

8srkyInXmkKPY_PtHswJDQ.text: We came here 2 times.  The first time we came around 1and  the line was long we decided skip out.  The second time we came around 10:50 and had to wait about hour.  The food is great, but when I sat down and took a closer look at the menu, I realized that this isn't so much an oyster bar but  more of a restaurant.   We ordered the half dozen oysters, in which you get what they have.  No selection to choose from.  We then ordered the the gumbos, in which everyone at the bar seemed to be ordering.  The gumbo was great and are able to choose how spicy you want it from 1-10.  I did a 3 and it was perfect for me as I am not to fond on spicy foods.  Depending on what you order the gumbo comes with plenty of seafood protein.  By the time we finished our gumbo, we were stuffed for days, and "food coma" brought new meaning to me.    Pros: Great seafood, everything was delicious. They make the gumbo right in front of you. There is a lot of variety to choose from, but seems like people come here for the gumbo.  Cons: Its opened 24 hours, but if you go near a prime time expect to wait a long time as the bar only seats about 16 people. Its not really a True oyster bar.  If your looking for variety of oysters do not come here because you will be stuck with one type.   I am not sure if its best to cook gumbo with frozen seafood or what, but I wasn't impressed when I saw the chef opening up a bag of frozen shrimp and restocking the line.    Overall: I highly recommend coming here.  The food is great, and very filling but I am not sure if its worth the wait.  So probably best to come at an off hour.

LptREwbV_jFhKmkkuRHnfg.text: Probably the best Oyster bar we've ever been to.  Now I understand why people wait on average 2-3 hours to be seated.   The Combo Pan Roast is to die for!  We were told about this place years ago, but the wife and I just never got around to going despite living in Vegas for over 13 years.  Now that we have, we'll be regulars.  Try to go when Ricardo (chef) is there... he's a blast!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen oysters are the way to go for apps!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea Food Gumbo!

o_LsxLHuh1jSXigqcEDCmw.text: 4.5  Let me start off by saying this place is LITERALLY a bar - 18 seats total, and MAYBE one more if they're feeling generous. So basically, if you're coming with a group of 5+ I'm judging you (just kidding... but seriously).   Despite the size, wait, and being off the strip the food is AMAZING and makes up for all the little nuisances.   We ordered the clam chowder, raw oysters, and the combo pan roast (lobster, shrimp and crab). The clam chowder was hearty and did not skimp out on the clams or potatoes at all. Raw oysters were good and definitely tasted fresh. The real winner, however, was the PAN ROAST. Sooo filling and hearty! A cup of rice is included with the pan roast but personally, I think it tastes even better with the complimentary bread they provide. It's a bit pricey and they charge you if you're sharing (unless you buy ~$18 worth of appetizers), but there were two of us and we even took it to go so I believe it's worth the price. You can also adjust the spice level (1-10) and even ask for peppers on the side.    Tip: It's open 24 hours and I heard the best time to go with minimal wait is around 8-9 a.m. I went around 6:30-7 p.m. and the wait was about 1.5 hours.  If you're tired of all the buffets on the strip this is definitely a tasty alternative!

Px-7g9K2y7RDtTpPEczSkw.text: Been wanting to go here for a very long time.  Even though we live here, just never made it.  Well, very mixed feelings about a place that has such a sterling reputation.  The wife and I arrived mid afternoon and maybe a 15 minute wait.  Employees were very nice and appeared to be focusing on their jobs.  We ordered two drafts, a dozen "gold band oysters", I ordered the Bouill-Roast, and the wife ordered the Bouillabaisse.  First off both the Bouill-Roast and Bouillabaisse were outstanding.  My big complaint is that they boldly advertise "gold band oysters".  They are oysters from Louisiana that are pressure washed clean and the process also makes the oysters open to shed their meat.  The washing process is suppose to clear all dirt, bacteria etc. and make for easy serving as they recluse the oysters and put a gold band around them to keep them fresh and closed.  Well, I watched these people pull out some of the smallest oysters I have ever seen, that were dirty and they had to be hand shucked.  They were not, I repeat not Gold Band Oysters.  O top of that, more than half of them were not cut from the shell, and they were loaded with broken shell.  Worst of all is that four of the oysters were not much bigger than a nickel.  That is extremely small.  Felt very ripped off.  People sitting next to me expressed the same mediocre feeling about the oysters but said they were from the Midwest and use to being served inferior seafood.   Never again

51MlGM_eMDMIHKHd_j0_rg.text: My experience with the oyster bar is not pleasant. I understand it's first come first serve but, it felt like my business was not wanted. Now the food was absolutely great, but the service was definitely not. As far as opposite as you can get is how my experience was with this oyster bar, which there are plenty of in Las Vegas apparently.   First we waited in line, okay. I don't recall reading anything like that when looking up reviews, but we all have to wait at some time or another in our life. I understand it's a challenge if there's 1 seat open and 3 people waiting. Not a big deal. So for those of you whining about that, that's not what made up my review rating, but disclosure so you know when you visit. We did wait for 45 minutes on a Monday evening. FYI.  Once we actually sat down, it took about 5 minutes to get the attention of the several different employees floating around to get bread and our drinks. Then we ordered appetizers, I did have a 12 piece of the oysters with a sprite, boyfriend had a shrimp cocktail. The waiter, again one of many, asked if we'd like to order our entrees then. We said no, we'd like to eat and then if we're still hungry order more food (which isn't an illogical statement). I realize now that the waiter could've been more truthful and said "it'd be better to order now so you're not waiting later". And boy, did we wait.  We waited 20 minutes after finishing our food. No conversation. We came in to eat, it was incredibly frustrating. Even people sitting next to us were waiting as well. Meanwhile, a group of 8 comes up to the bar and their orders are being taken before ours! Now not only have we been waiting, but even if I had ordered, mine would be stuck behind these people. No offense to them, the blame is on the servers. The cook and a woman with glasses and long dark hair, both of them were busting their asses but there's only 2 of them while another bald gentleman with glasses seemed to be floating around while there was clear need of customer service.   Woman with the glasses comes over to us, at that point we were DONE. We asked for the check, and when asked so kindly by her why we were leaving we told her. She removed two drinks from the tab-a soda and an iced tea-and offered her sincerest apologies, as did the cook, which was greatly appreciated and was a hell of a lot more than what any other employee there made to make us less mad.   I won't be coming back at all and I suggest anyone reading this to take their business elsewhere.

1YPFzYbrEZ7ZMNJGDesRjA.text: Finally got a chance to try this place! There's always a line so it's a luck when there's a short line. Gotta have the seafood pan Roast! It's legit worth the wait! So Creamy and delicious! Big Chunks of lobster too! Oysters are so Creamy and fresh! For sure gonna come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RzNZ5BcVoyw_fSF5EEJKMA.text: Okay seriously when in Vegas, you must try this specific location for OYSTERS! Other places out here try to copy their style but the size and prize can't ever compete. The oysters are freaking huge and so fresh here compared to any place I've ever been to. The clam chowder was good too. I honestly believe everything here is delicious. The wait is worth it. Came here at like 6am and there was 2 people in front of me so that wasn't bad, but there was a lot of people at the bar. They open the oyster shells right in front of you. The happy hour here is a great deal! Definitely coming back here for the oysters and gonna try out the whole menu if I can lol
