Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

afgboGMh2s-7l7v0KQbcuQ.text: Food - 4 stars Service - 3 stars Wait - 1 star WARNING - ONLY SEATINGS AVAILABLE ARE AT THE "BAR".  ANYONE UNDER 21 IS NOT ALLOWED.  EVEN IF YOU ARE NOT REQUESTING ALCHOL.  We waited 1 1/2 at 9:30 pm on a Sunday night.  The place opens 24 hours and in between 1am - 9am oysters are $10 for 1/2 dozen. Ordered 1/2 dozen of oysters for $12.99.  Clam chowder $4.99, Seafood gumbo. $24.99.  You determine the level of spiciness in the gumbo ranging  between 1-10.  The oysters are freshly opened upon order, We watched her open at least 3 dozens within 15 minutes.  They were super fresh, and chunky,  clam chowder was creamy, but not overly buttery.  filled with clams.  The seafood gumbo had the enough amount of heat, level 5, it did not compromise the freshness of the seafood and the herby spice of the Cajun taste in the gumbo.  The okra was not slimy with a crunch.  It was a show stopper watching the chef prepares the food right in front of your eyes.  The only draw back was the extensive wait.

ciN8K_sTPzjPQ_q610MLZw.text: The wait here is ridiculous.  I think we waited here for 2 hours.  But you know what.  It was actually worth it because this is by far the best spot for pan roast I've had.  The chef here is a master at his craft.  With that being said, he takes his time to perfect each dish and it can take a while.  Understandable and I wasn't too tripping.  The pan roast is to die for.  It just has this something that makes it taste amazing.  The texture, the taste the aroma.  It was euphoria for me.  I definitely don't recommend large groups.  Its just tough because the only seats are at a bar.  They are limited so be prepared.  If you're lucky enough to finally get a seat.  Be prepared for some delicious tasting food coming your way.  Next time you're in Vegas be sure to stop on by.  I believe there is another Oyster Bar in Vegas but you gotta go to this location.  Way better.

QUqz605ZUzHY5UpaAQZAkQ.text: I've been going to Vegas fairly regularly for over a decade and have never heard about the Oyster Bar until recently. I was intrigued by the sheer number and quality of the reviews of this place so I figured I had to try it. I wish I had done my research ahead of time because I was definitely NOT expecting to wait for almost 2 hours on a Sunday at 2pm. I had no idea that the Oyster Bar is actually just that.. a BAR with maybe 18 seats total. Don't be fooled by how short the line may look, it takes forever to move!  When I finally sat down at the bar, I was so hungry I wanted to order one of everything on the menu. My dining partner and I settled on 3 oyster shooters with vodka, a bowl of clam chowder, the famous pan roast, and gumbo. Everything was delicious but my favorite dish by far was the pan roast. SO DELISH! I might be persuaded to return to the Oyster Bar on another visit to Vegas but you can believe I will do my research to ensure I wait no longer than 30 minutes to 1 hour maximum. Anything more than that is just a waste of time, in my opinion.

0Xo6L2phqplEOFc8pbSf9Q.text: Finally. I have tried Oyster Bar's famous Pan Roast!!   I've just recently heard a lot about Oyster Bar, and it was on my list to go to on my 24 hour Vegas trip. Got here on a Thursday around 11:45 AM, and was seated by 12:30 PM! Not bad!   I read reviews that their namesake, oysters, were good. They were from Louisiana and probably the biggest I've seen. They were NOT good at all. They were also poorly shucked as I had to scrape it off the shell with my fork. For $12 for half a dozen, it's cheap, but I would skip it.  Service is a bit scattered, although there's only 16 of us at the bar, the wait staff seem to forget simple items asked like lemons, napkins, forks. Really nice and accommodating though. The fresh and warm rolls are really yummy too. You keep nibbling at it while smelling the yummy food cooking in front of you.  I thought the pan roast would be in a flatter bowl judging from the photos, but it is deep. OMG. So much food. The first bite was literally a taste of heaven. The creaminess, richness, and all that yumminess that comes together, WOW. Tons of crab (I kept getting shell which was not fun), lobster meat, chopped veggies, and a whole lot of shrimp. I ate two, and counted 10! With the rice, wow, it was just so so so worth the trip.   I definitely think the pan roast is worth sharing because it really is a heavy dish and a LOT of food. If I was not going to be out and about the strip for 10 hours and flying which wouldn't allow me to travel with more than 3 ounces of liquid, I so would've carried the leftovers back with me. But, that's too much trouble for me and had to set a limit.  Just writing about the pan roast is making me salivate at the mouth. Yes, you have to wait in line the entire time and have everyone present. But it's so worth it if you can wait less than an hour. Do it.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouill-roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bowl is way deeper than I imagined from the photos. My leftovers, wish I could&#39;ve brought it back with me!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast

QLgPrknJ_DjfzJWjKbx0tg.text: I usually order the dozen oysters on half shell, the seafood jambalaya and shrimp/lobster fra diavolo. Their oysters are really the best in Las Vegas. The freshness and taste has been the same for the last 5 years. I try other places and their oysters but it doesn't have the same pop or flavor, they must have a really good supplier of oysters. Their seafood jambalaya is also exceptional, they blend the seafood and rice really well. Their fra diavolo was all right, nothing completely stands out. The oyster bars food is top notch; locals and tourists should try, because Palace Station just got remodeled! Let's look at the other things besides the food. Because of the limited seating capacity, you can expect a wait time between 1-2 hours which is normal. Because it is a bar seating area you may have to squeeze in places. Other than that, I would return it's just that I need to make sure I have 2-3 hours for 1 meal.

6oSm7Ei-GMnh1PUn0CYK7Q.text: Is the wait realllllly worth it?  I guess it depends on how long of a wait you're talking about here.  I went here during the Christmas week so it took us a little over two hours to get seated.  But should I really knock off a star to a place that has amazing food?  This review is just based on how nice the chef was to us and the overall quality of the food.  Their special here is the pan roast.  Very similar to the cioppino you can get in San Fran but this is a lot creamier.  At first it doesn't look like much but it's filling and very flavorful.  I also ordered the combo seafood appetizer but that was mostly for the lady.  I don't eat enjoy raw food that much but she said it was great.  I ate all the shrimp cocktail from it.  If you're wondering whether or not this place is worth a try then my answer is yes, try the damn place.  The reviews speak for itself but if you justify great food for a long wait then have someone wait in line while you drink and gamble.  Then pay for their dinner.  Win-win situation.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold Seafood Combo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

cxjLXVcbIzdegTr8n4G3uw.text: It's a must when visiting Las Vegas. Located in the Palace Station the place is open 24/7. Depending on the time you show up the line is either super long or you just got really lucky. LOL. The way that the set up is made is that its a bar. So limited seating is available if you are in a big group you have to wait a while for all the seats to open up to accommodate your entire group. (I recommend to show up at an off hour so you don't have to wait as long)  When I go with my boyfriend I always get the Combo Pan Roast, plate of oysters and clam chowder. It's just absolutely amazing. I can't really express how good it is. Just trust me...go. Usually the place operates off of 3 people. BE NICE! One is the waiter handling all the seats. The chef who is making all the dishes and the bus boy who helps clear all the seats.   Go when you have the time to sit, relax, chat, and enjoy some really good food. You will not be disappointed at all.   Good "off hours": 7am, 9am, 9pm, 3am :)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace Pan Palace Pan Roast

JiYob-xHnd3rXa0hWft_bA.text: I love this place. Best seafood ever! I had the Bouill-Roast level 6 and will definitely order again. We make our way here every time we are in Vegas. Margie and Bob are the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6Vx8ujNVqhmHgvhilo15xw.text: I felt like this place was okay.  I had really high hopes. Limited seating and they cook the food right in front of you.  My wife had chowder and said it was a bit bland and I had the cioppino and it was like a tomato soup with seafood.  Oysters were the saving grace, they were massive.

3W9sxmRd1G_irWzjQZn3pg.text: Well worth the wait I was told that  my wait at  45 minutes was on a good night it can be a three hour wait for this oyster bar that's open 24 hours and it has so much flavor the chef is nice the rest the staff was nice the food is great

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

theD63qV2JbgkJeyG5KeNQ.text: This place is OUTSTANDING!!! We waited about an hour and a half around noon on a Wednesday. It is so worth it. They keep the bar area clean and the food is prepared right in front of you. Melody and the chef are amazing. The food is delicious and I will be back!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

hEPUZaNQuY8dRteznAKTDg.text: My friend told me about this place and warned me that there is ALWAYS a line.  Open 24/7, hubs and I arrived at 1:30 am after a drive in from Phoenix.  I was determined to try this place and figured the time should not be that bad.  We waited about 1 hour 20 minutes before were seated in the 18-seat only bar.  It's situated right out in the middle of the casino at Palace Station.  I ordered the Seafood Pan Roast and the hubs ordered the Bouill-Roast.  We both really enjoyed both dishes, but the seafood pan roast would be my favorite.  So fun to watch the chef cook everything from scratch.  I now will have to make this a place we have to eat at every time we visit Las Vegas.  So worth the wait.

TrjeV1TjbGNnBQAeFUaecA.text: Service was amazing.  You guys are definitely efficient.  This is not to knock the chef.  I've been wanting to try this place for awhile and was so excited to finally stop by.  I ordered the shrimp cocktail, half a dozen oysters, lobster gumbo, and jambalaya.   Again I just wanted to try something new.  This style of food is one I have never tried before.  The chef is awesome.  Made me respect him a lot for the amount of orders he had and the traffic.  The only reason why I'm giving them 3 stars is because the last 2 dishes were slightly saltier than I was use too, but that's my fault.  I really wanted to order off of the pan roast section after looking at the gentleman next to me, but I didn't ask.  I don't think I'll try it again though, but it was a fun experience.

Qi5xQNF6o689cr966nl14Q.text: I can here based on several people telling me it's a must go to place in Vegas, that includes the locals.  It did not disappoint. We went at an off peak time at 2:30pm (they're open 24/7) so there were only 4 people in line in front of us. We were seated within 15 minutes and had the oysters, pan roast combo and Cioppino. Everything we had was delicious. Highly recommend getting those three things and sharing so everyone gets a taste.  I do wish they had more oyster options as they are an oyster bar but I'm not complaining. They were still fresh and scrumptious.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ajwqDpBatyNWAn3hlx0YTg.text: Still the best in town!  Thought we could cut the wait and go to another Station Casino Oyster Bar and get the same thing.... NOPE!  Not even close.  Get any Pan Roast... you will not be disappointed.

fAtBWzZvO19Ad7wgk8lyOQ.text: The infamous oyster bar I finally got to try! Got here at 2AM and waited just about 2hrs to get seated. I would say there is no good time to come here to avoid the rush because it is simply consistently busy. Hopefully you just get lucky because it was definitely worth the wait! Location is odd and with all the traffic they get you would think they would increase their seating! Service was good and they were interactive even though they were busy.  -Oyster in half shell-half a dozen was plenty for us 2.  Served with a little horse radish and their oyster cocktail sauce. No out of the ordinary special topping but oysters were fresh! -New England Clam Chowder-delicious and the we ordered the bowl size. I would recommend a cup if you are ordering pan roast. The portion was large and could be a meal itself. -Combo Pan Roast-shared this as well and it was more than enough. Highly recommend! I mean this is their signature dish and it's obvious why! Mouth is salivating now as I think about the shrimp, crab, and lobster in a spicy level 6 over the rice. Filling and satisfying! -Oyster shooters-I would not recommend getting it with tequila. It was hard to finish this drink!  This place is a must try when in Vegas but only if you are awake enough to endure the wait and not starving to the max because expect to eat two hours from arrival!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster in half shell
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New England clam chowder
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster shooter with tequila

XC00yM5H2SAyhVIkEkRJqw.text: I hate everything about the Palace Station except the Oyster Bar.  Loved the pan roast.  It was rich, tasty and spicy.  It was chocked full of tender fresh seafood.  Just like Louisiana!!!  Loved the calamari also. Could not even finish 1/4 of the huge serving.  This place just seats just 20 people, so prepare for a long wait if you do not show up at an off time (like 4PM on a weekday).  Its a great place for couples, but a trio or more might have a struggle finding a place to sit together.  Everyone is really social at the Oyster Bar, which added to my experience.  Will definately be back

xmnFAeT8Zcd-CXYJGGabXA.text: ok... i understand why people would rave about this place, but it didn't particularly blow me away.   my dad and i ordered a dozen oysters, combo pan-roast and crab-meat pan-roast.   the raw oysters were very fresh. the pan-roasts were very good-tasting...at least for the first 20 bites. after that, you start to worry about how in the world you will get to the bottom of your bowl. it is a very flavorful dish with generous amounts of seafood. however, it was a bit too cheesy and creamy for my taste. maybe we should have ordered the tomato-based cioppino instead.   overall, it is worth a try, but if you're not feeling too ravenous, i suggest sharing just one pan-roast with a friend.

qNyS7YauEVeUQYrOPY_JuQ.text: Sigh...I'm craving for the Combo Roast right about now.. I'm sure one day I'll find my way to Vegas just to eat the Combo Roast.  This time I'm not sharing either!! The portions are big enough for 2 people to share but next time I'm getting my own bowl.

HKgSVvlAARSIfecXHBPrYg.text: Bob is the man. Always makes the pan roast just right! It's a must to get there early or on off hours because its great food but it's not worth waiting an hour for IMO, as the lines can get long. You can't go wrong with any of the variety of the Pan Roast they have to offer. Their Clam Chowder is also pretty damn good. I haven't tried their Bouillabaisse but I hear that's a winner too, maybe next time!

9JbrVeiK6J3-7lpxz-IEjQ.text: my sister wanted me to try this place out and i was skeptical beacuse she said she waited 2 hours the first time. the food was the best i had in vegas and shows you not to judge a book by its cover(the casino isnt fancy nor is the location of restaraunt) i had the etoufee and i will def be back the next time i am in vegas

YIHsergILNAr01BFKD-PCw.text: Come here every time I go to Vegas but this will be the last time. Since they went 24hrs its seems like the staff is exhausted. They used to have two cooks (plus assistants) running the place and now there is just one cook with one assistant. This means much longer wait times for the same food. This last experience took 3.5hrs (on a Monday) which involved about 15min of eating. No fault of the staff, there's just not enough of them. Who ever is running this place has decided to focus on profits instead of customer satisfaction. This place should have expanded a long time ago and the staff should have increased not decreased. Food is still the same but now that one of the former cooks opened his own place (more seating and lots of staff) I'll be going there instead of waiting here.

rfpiYFVrZh0Ndw1M0Sox2g.text: The oysters were big, fresh and very tasty. Ordered the combination gumbo and it was good. Spicy with plenty of seafood. The pan roast looked good, gonna have to try that next time. The only drawback to this place is the lack of seating.

xUqGdQLCVZxhfhf5SF5fbg.text: After a long convention, my husband and I went to the Oyster Bar since they received such great reviews form Yelp. We got there around 1:30 pm. The line was short but the wait was long...one hour and 40 minutes. By the time we sat down, I was hungry and ready to be mad if they didn't deliver!  I had really high expectations. We shared a crab and lobster combo pan roast along with one dozen oysters on the half shell. We loved them both!  I didn't even know what pan roast was before we went there and I became a huge fan. Since I came back to LA, I have been frantically looking for a pan roast place near here, but so far no luck. I guess I just have to wait for our next Las Vegas convention, ha ha.

hLxwGHuxZq6-p5MNYJan6A.text: This might be my favorite joint in Vegas.  Been coming here for years now and I've tried much of the menu.  They have the best pan roast I've ever had.  I love the sweetness of the pan roast.  The gumbo is also awesome!  Its kind of a more bitter flavor but I love the okra and the sausage in the roux.  The boulliabase is also really good, more tomato flavor than the pan roast but not rich and creamy like the pan roast.  One of my favorites is the clam chowder.  Go here and you will not be disappointed.  Warning though, there is almost always a wait.

lFmf1Zgs4wqbUpU2zaDF1w.text: Best pan roast on the west coast. Long lines though..

s0EzHaxna5dg6y-RulwubQ.text: I LOVE the Oyster Bar here! I try my hardest to stop by here every time I'm in Vegas. It only gets a 4 star due to the lack of seating and wait time. I definitely recommend this place!

vnKwDuVE0YF0zlvMYPsqKw.text: By far my favorite place to dine in Vegas. Seating is limited and you have to wait but the pan roast makes it well worth it... I can't remember the last Vegas trip without having the pan roast at least once....

QSaAmfU9RJuHvNoMdgI_pw.text: Simply the best.  Read the reviews no need to be redundant.  Stick to the oysters and the Pan Roasts.  Would happily pay 5 times what they charge for each, would still be the best meal in Vegas.  Why this isnt duplicated in every major city is beyond me......, maybe I'll do just that.  Happy roasting my friends, violent cravings writing this

jtJZ5hOwXgfehezabviEsw.text: Hole in the wall of Palace station but soo good, must try the pan roast and its worth the wait and smokey clothes after.

LN-VehD6QCrxKP1ExZaE9g.text: First off, I got to thank my Dad for introducing me to this little place of goodness.  Okay, if your like me and can only handle one buffet per Vegas trip, than make sure to put this place on your eating agenda. The wait is a little long because it's only bar seating, however, IT IS WORTH THE WAIT. I've brought so many of my friends here and heard them complain the whole time but when we were done eating, I always hear, "It was worth the wait."   Food: Combo Pan Roast (MMMMmmm GOOD!!), Oysters and Clam Chowder.  * Don't forget to ask for your rice on the side. You'll thank me later!

HQ4GfLu0W6tTumN6OsnQXw.text: This place is hidden in a casino called Palace station. You might never even heard about this casino but oh MG, the food is just the BEST. I always order Bouillabaisse with spicy level 7. It was just mouth watering...Just LOVE this place

v7ESw-4WsLWH_i6vnTBzPw.text: amazing food with a great local, divey vibe...worth the wait

Tpc2ICMtcGn0i0GFxBHxzA.text: I don't get to this side of town, since I prefer the casino's along the strip.  My friend who is a local suggested the Oyster Bar @ the Palace Station.  I ordered the Crab Meat Pan Roast, it was GREAT!!!  Surprisingly I enjoyed the food and the casino isn't as crowded as the ones on the strip.  Great Crab Pan Roast!!!!

DKcFxkXl5lqwDJpTYEeCVA.text: This place is awesome!  I like them to put habanero in my pan roasts.  I haven't been able to make it there the last few times I've been to Vegas, which is a bummer.  The main reason I'm writing this review is to try to see if any yelpers out there know of similar restaurants in LA.  If not, someone please open one!

i6nBlahaHzd1gBRjwxGBmQ.text: The oysters bar has become our "must-go-to" place in Vegas. We came across this place by accident on our last trip and decided to go back. The oysters are fresh and it goes perfectly with a nice cold beer. The clams and shrimps are also delish here. Oh and the clam chowder and the pasta haha. We've been happy with this place on both visits. What's not to like, $20 for a dozen oysters. $8 for steamed manila clams, $5 for 2x beer. Can't beat that.....

-Nw82sea4XraRGGQtJnCvA.text: I had no idea this place existed until my last couple of months of me living in Las Vegas. I was only able to experience the Oyster Bar one time- but Oh boy! So delicious.  Me and my friend decided to go there after a night at the club. She had raved about this place so many times (she's lived in Las Vegas her whole life) so one night we decided to go. It was a week day, and I think we got there around 4 am.  One would think this place wouldn't be busy so late (or so early in the morning) but we waited almost 2 hours to sit down.  I kept telling my girlfriend. " this place better be good, to wait 2 hours" and after we sat down, and got our entrees- if was definitely worth the wait and was phenomenal!. We ordered the crab pan roast- and I even had enough left over to take home!  This place is fabulous, fresh and a Vegas favorite!

6TvUYBE4QfLkBRNa4WFDzg.text: No offense to Palace Station, but the only reason a tourist should venture there is for cheap gambling or Oyster Bar.  Actually, I take that back.  Oyster Bar is the only reason to go to Palace Station.  It's a True Yelp gem and I find myself craving it whenever I'm in Vegas and even when I'm not.  Seriously, the COMBO PAN ROAST is delicious!  The pictures don't really do it justice.  Under the sea of brown soup and rice, it's loaded with lobster, shrimp and crab.  It's a seafood orgy.  There's heavy cream in it, so if you are lactose intolerant, you might consider trying the gumbo.  But if not, the roast is the way to go.  I hear the Bouillabaisse is good too.  Everything at Oyster Bar is prepared fresh to order which is great, however, wait times can be really rough.  There are maybe 14 seats at the bar and only 6 steam kettles to cook the roasts.  This means they can only cook 6 roasts at a time and each roast takes 15-20 minutes to make.  Plus, I hear the wait to be seated at dinner can be as long as 2 hours so you do the math.  It also doesn't help that there is only 1 cook and 1 waiter.  Just go early to be safe.    Open 24 hours!  I've come at 3am once to no wait.  4.5 stars rounded up!

UqZsloBqJYhcgGM8w8LRjw.text: 4.5 Stars  I had the House Pan Roast w/ a scoop of white rice, level 2 spicy out of 10. It was amazingly delicious!!! The house pan roast is very rich in flavor & calories. It had Lobster, Shrimp and Crab and they did not skimp on those goodies. The meal is large enough that you can share (but there is a shared plate fee, so take it home and it will still be amazingly delicious a day or 2 later). All the food is made to order so after getting seated, you will have to wait about 20 mins.   The reason for the .5 star deduction is the wait time. The wait time is just horrible!!  But than again, it's "Bar" type seating.   I would most definitely come back but at odd times of the day to try to avoid the long wait.

TXFi1HEcogcHocHc8dHs6w.text: I absolutely love coming here for the oysters and combo pan roast. They also have a Moonlight Special from between 2am-9pm when there are drink specials and you can get a half a dozen Oysters for $10. The entrees are definitely worth getting as well as they do not skimp out on the seafood in your dish. Also tried the Shrimp and Lobster Fra Diablo which was very tasty as well. If you go for breakfast, there usually isn't a line otherwise expect to wait around an hour for other parts of the day. They only have so many seats and so many steam kettles to cook in.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raw oysters and clams
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan clam chowder New England style

TW_5WuKnFZzoU2QennQgEw.text: after checking out we came here for lunch before catching our flight  ordered: -chilled oysters -combo (shrimp, crab, lobster) pan roast -boulli-roast: half bouillabase stew and half pan roast  both dishes were amazing and i'll def come back again

IKUbzezz1ruMLIAUwqrAYQ.text: I think this review is going to be the same exact review as all the other ones.   BUT BEST PAN ROAST EVER. MUST GO HERE IF YOU ARE IN VEGAS. I wish I lived in Vegas so i can come here all the time.

TdjS7u8qApx06eNfRiJk-A.text: Great service even better food! I had the pan roast and my wife had a combo shrimp, oyster and clam dish. I've heard about this place Many times and  I have to say now I know why. The food is so good! Now, the only reason that this is getting 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the wait you have to go through to get it, not to mention a bit expensive. I want to try the newer oyster bar in Santa fe to see how or if as good as its predecessor. I would definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uvLA5z7RvNBTKAyhT6C0Hg.text: Everything said about this oyster bar is True. I've desperately wanted to try this place out because everyone said it was one of the best joints in town. I even decided to stay at the hotel for one night just to eat here.   I had a party of four and arrived about 2 am. The bar was full and I had about 4 people ahead of me. As everyone said, the wait can be long and getting your food takes awhile. We weren't finished until 4am!  Even though there's only two people working, they somehow are able to work efficiently and smoothly. Watching them work was so hypotonic.   The pan roast was so creamy and delicious, sort of like a cross between coconut Thai curry and some type of seafood tomato base. It's a big bowl, so I would def share it with someone else (they do charge you $5 for sharing). The oysters tasted fresh and are great appetizers before  your hearty meal.   Staff was friendly and talkative. But one tip is make sure your order is right and check your pan roast for the right ingredients. I ordered the palace pan roast and we even got charged for it  but received the lobster roast, which happens to be cheaper.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YLc9X03f62w-iJQRwrkDYw.text: After many failed attempt to make it to a buffet. We came here on a Monday night after EDC.  I'm glad we did. The line wasn't insanely long but it still took us a little over two hours to get a seating for 3. All I have to say is that it was worth "the wait". Hands down, you must get the fresh oysters and pan roast! The oysters were huge! A lot bigger than expected which explains why we ordered two dozens and couldn't even finish. They are very generous with their portions so order wisely. The drinks were good too. My dirty martini was made right and my friend's Bloody Mary had a perfect amount of spice. The oyster shooter was good even though it took more than one gulp to shoot it down due to the size of the oysters. In conclusion, we would come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge fresh oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast *amazing

5s0hvBS_f0dwV9xYp443Og.text: It has been almost a year and a half since I've been back here. It was so gratifying and delicious to finally eat the oysters on a half shell once more!   First of all, this place is small. It's bar seating only that seats roughly 18-20 people. You have to wait in line to get seated. My first time here, we came on a weekend around midnight and waited over an hour! (But it was so worth the wait.) This time, we came on a Wed late afternoon and waited about 5 min.   On to the food: I highly recommend the oysters on the half shell. Super fresh and for the most part pretty big and fat in size. Comes on a bed of ice with lemons, cocktail sauce, and fresh horse radish. And OMG, their horse radish is divine. It's hot, but pairs well with the oysters. As for entrees, I recommend the pan roast, cioppino, and bouillabaisse. You can choose 1-10 for spicy-ness. The 8 has a kick.   The chefs cook the food and shuck oysters in front of you. They are very friendly. Service is good. They may get busy at times, but they do the best with the hands they have.   If you love oysters and seafood, you have to try this place. I recommend avoiding this place on weekends due to the crowds. Best to come between 1 AM and 8 AM or on a weekday during mid-morning or mid-afternoon to avoid the crowds and long waits. I will have to visit here again before we leave Vegas!

0YQrf4Jj8TCLcTZXYqGBbA.text: We felt like seafood so my BILs and i headed out to this place based on yelp's review. We went at around 2:30pm in hoped of beating the rush...to no avail, we were about 12 people back. Since this was our first time, we didnt know what to expect. I counted 18 bar seats and 1 cook (not a great combo). We took turns waiting i line while the others went to gamble. After 1.5 hours, we were seated (party of 3). A regular said that the wait time is very sporadic. Sometimes there are no lines, other time it can be very long. I suggest looking at menu ahead of time and ordering right away.  We started with the seafood combo (shrimp, oysters, and clams). The shrimp was nice and large. The clams were also good. I thought the oysters were just ok. They were large and meaty. I prefer small sweet ones (ie kushi or komomotos).  No mignonette to go with it. We chose the white alaskan chowder, combo pan roast, and bouillabaisse. The chowder and pan roast were amazing. The chowder was creamy and full of chunks of meat. The pan roast was nicely seasoned (kinda like a curry/indian seasoning). Very rich and hearty. Lots of meat as well. Both were large in size. The bouillabaisse was the weakest of the three. Good but not great.  We also ordered the 50oz beer for $15. That tipped us over the edge.  All in all, a fabulous meal. But not sure if I would wait 1.5hrs again.

7VhJibWR4BOMo6_I_11H3A.text: A friend dragged me to this place on Friday at 3 in the morning. That's literally what it took to get me there because he promised there will be pan roast. Pan roast, what's a pan roast and why are people going crazy over it? After waiting for 30 minutes to finally plant my butt on one of the 18 lucrative seats at the bar (the only seats, mind you), it took an additional 30 minutes before our food was prepared. Every dish is prepared to order, and the chef cooks up a storm right in front of you. I ordered the seafood pan roast (shrimp, crab, and lobster), and everything about it was worth the wait. Pan roast consists of tomato, creme, and brandy (at least that's what the menu says), whatever protein option you select, and your option of spice level between 1-10. I got the 5, which was perfect and not too spicy but with just enough kick.   Get the pan roast, you won't regret. The sister ordered the New England clam chowder, and as good as it may be, it paled in comparison to the glorious pan roast.

AuQRrazv5HME9NL6XBEeRg.text: Combo Pan Roast is seriously one of the best things I've ever tasted. I get it with Level 7 spiciness. Just get it. Don't question it. Just do it! No no, don't get 1 to share with ur BFF, or BF, or Boothang, or Baby, or whatever. Get your own, because trust me you're gonna regret sharing it!   Oh and yes, please take advice from your fellow yelpers. Come during weird hours, or else be prepared to wait!!!  I would love to move to Vegas just so I can eat there everyday for the rest of my life!!   I need to go back! Now!!

vYWzdg5Fw3hQ0JAbS_3NEA.text: This is the OG oyster bar. It is bewildering why they don't expand this bar from the 12 or so seats there are for all the people in line.   Two chefs/servers cook in front of you. My god the panroast is heavenly. The jambalaya looks amazing too.   Come early in the wee hours. We came a bit late like around 6am. Waited about 45m. Better than 2hrs if you come in the afternoon.

s7_b2FU_wlzY5z-P4XFUdQ.text: + Food is AWESOME  - Wait sucks, but worth it depending on what you order  Came here to try something different off the strip and I'm glad we did. The only real downfall about this place is the wait. It can go anywhere from 30 to 45 minutes. The struggle is real! They only have a few seats and 1 big group can make your wait time grow really quick. You can't lean on the slot machines, so you're left only to either stand or sit. I opted to sit. :)  Once called to sit, the chef/cooks are really friendly..and it's awesome to watch all the things that go into making your dish. I had their spiciest dish, and yes..I paid for it later. The price isn't too bad either. You get a big portion for what you pay, and the food tastes incredibly awesome.  If you're in Vegas as a tourist/guest and you're down for a bit of a drive, do come here and check it out!

mAUT5ulK21ic9PVZY-4urw.text: Great food , waiting for so long but totally worth it !  The Hispanic chef know how to make the best experience with lots of flavors! Great job  If you don't mind to wait 2-3 hours go for it this is your place  Another great dinner Robert is amazing !!!

tppl-2gW3Qu0GL0i9sbGRg.text: We were there about 4:30. The line wasn't so crazy. Luckily all the people left at the same time, so we just waited for 10 minutes.  Right after we sat down, the line got longer and longer. The Oysters were so fresh. We added another dozen after we finished the first dozen in a minute. Palace Pan Roast is a must try! Alaskan Chowder was tasty too. Will definitely go back again. But timing is most important, otherwise you might wait for 2hrs. I warn you. No kidding.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Open kitchen. Feel sorry for the chef need to work alone for all the dishes, no break all night longthe food is so tasty!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cioppino
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty Alaskan Chowder.

ry1ps8HKccR84mfA-z9ZLQ.text: 2am and there I was waiting 30 mins for a spot at the bar to get my pan roast fix accompanied by a dozen oysters. Yes, the wait is long to get seated, to get your order, to get your food, refills and bill. BUT in this situation it's understandable because there's only 2 employees working and each dish takes about 10-15 mins to cook with only 4-5 ketels. BUT in the end...was it all worth it? YES! You need to understand what you're getting yourself into. It's not for the patient. Try this place atleast once and see for yourself if it's worth the wait for another visit. To me it is. After all, where can you get seafood like this 24/7?

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3GtMgSgsm4tFJ_eApeb23A.text: PAN ROAST. Just order it. With combo seafood.....You're welcome.  (Spice level to your liking)  Also, if you come between 1am-9am, there is a "happy hour" with 1/2 dozen oysters for $10.   Open 24 hrs, but the best time to come if you don't want to wait is probably....5am-10am :)

gofoA82uWHWCHvwfJFDuNQ.text: The wait here always sucks but it's always worth it. The combo pan roast is great. The clams are a good dish as well. Definitely plan on waiting a bit no matter what time of day or night.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Finished product!!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast cooking!

Ew9aoeaz7xjSFwSH8-vepw.text: Tried this place for the first time last year and I've been hooked since. In my honest opinion I've tried the other oyster bars like at Sunset Station (close to my home) and Hard Rock Casino and none of those places can compare to the one at Palace Station.   I always get a combo pan roast level 4 spice and if we're feeling boujie we order half dozen of oysters! The pan roast is what they're known for, it just creamy tomato based heaven! It also comes with a side of rice and a roll! My boyfriend likes to get the bouli-roast (sp?) which I believe is a mixed of 2 different kinds tomato based. If you like it less creamy this is the option to go for!   If you go on the weekend expect to be waiting in line for quite some time, but it is all worth it!

6ttZ4nDKovoBPQRlLZZ7Vw.text: Holy buckets, this place is EVERYTHING! I did NOT expect to love their pan roast and bouilla-roast SO MUCH. Literally mind blown after the first bite.  I got the bouilla-roast which is part pan roast and part bouillabaisse. I absolutely loved because it wasn't as earthy/umami as their regular pan roast which is what my boyfriend got. Both were seriously, amazing but big portions! Definitely come hungry!   Located off the strip in the Palace Station casino. It's a small little bar near the center of the casino when you walk in. Could probably seat 20 people max and its bar seating ONLY so def not good for large parties. There's usually an insane wait but fortunately we went on a weekday on off hours so we got to sit right away.   This was by far my favorite meal of my week long stay in Vegas and I will definitely be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouill-Roast

KP_Vg9CbhwnRvCgPHixC9w.text: If you haven't been here, you are missing out! Chef Rick is so entertaining and makes the best pan roast you'll ever taste. Came back for a pan roast as usual, but today He encourages me to try something new.   Got the bouill-roast and it was pretty good. It has 3/4 sauce of the pan roast and 1/4 bouillabaisse sauce. So more of a tomato base in my opinion. Pretty good. Not much different than the pan roast. The seafood in this dish includes broken up king crab legs, crab, huge shrimp, lobster and mussels.  Always served with bread while you wait for your food and a bowl of rice.  Don't forget it's 21 & over here. Went for breakfast with my coworker and there was no wait (around 0745) love it when there's no line. Peak hours you could wait between 1-2 or even 3 hours!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AGmKxH4pXJqoCajyZl9Cig.text: Went here on a Tuesday at 11:00 am. Got seated immediately.   I got the bouillabaisse and wife got steamed clams. I thought bouillabaisse had a clear broth. This one didn't but tasted great. I'm thinking the bowl got smaller because I could finish it. A couple of years ago, they had a bigger bowl because I couldn't finish it.    The steamed clams were great as usual. The broth was light and delicious.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouillabaisse

-DzhX78ZgTNWHB7tR1TQNg.text: Went around 10 am had to wait an hr which was not too bad. Oysters extremely fresh and flavor in dishes were amazing. Highly recommend and will be back again.

I0XMJsZ0kK9qguP9qUL7wg.text: I waited in line for two hours, the hotel doesn't monitor the line and people cut increasing the wait time. I'll try again.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Line situation

WjuookHaFlbIs6Xx1MXuxQ.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE. When I first turned 21 and started going to Vegas, my friend introduced me to Oyster Bar as THE place to go if the club got boring and you wanted to bounce and have one of the most amazing meals of your life.   There are only 18 seats at the bar so there is usually a wait (1-2 hours) but I think the wait is worth it.   Everything is prepared in front of you. So you know you are getting everything fresh! I would visit Vegas over and over just to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan Chowder (dirty style) in the back and Combo Pan Roast in the front!

u-8uF2G3VIs8oa6J71ixTQ.text: Oh my gosh. Why can't they open a legit restaurant?!  We got here around 2:30 on a friday afternoon and waited maybe about 30 minutes. I could see why people wait so long- it's literally a bar that seats maybe 15-18 people?  We got half a dozen of the oysters, dirty chowder and the pan roast.  The pan roast is somethin else! It's got so much flavor that just soothes you and it comes with rice- RICE! My husband literally gulped down the pan roast.. i only got to try a little bit of it with rice.  The chowder was soooo creamy and delicious.  I noticed that all the other parties were to go-ing their leftovers and ordering more to take out.. I could see why!  The oysters were good too but I didn't really care for them. They cut open the oysters right in front of you so that was pretty cool.  I will be back for more pan roast! Don't get it too spicy though so you can enjoy the taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam Chowder New England or Manhattan
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters on the Half Shell

STdIdv1oQixlb8vRCpJY3Q.text: Long wait usually equates to GOOD food!  My sister and I came here after the Celine concert, around 10:30.  There's a line and we waited about an hour.  While we were in line, we totally struck up conversations with other parties in line talking about food and Yelp, so it made the wait more bearable.  I was very skeptical to see how good a pan roast could be... boy, I was not disappointed.  Chucky chucks of crab meat was in the pan with an impeccable stew.  Gotta be sure to have a little heat , choose spice level 4!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Pan Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clams In Half Shell
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters on the Half Shell

Lo5tl1ysiCUxDgzPdR6z9g.text: Nothing could prepare me for the first bite of the pan roast at this Oyster Bar at Palace Station. It was like that near final scene in Ratatouille, and I was that restaurant critic. You know the movie with the French rat, Remy, who is a talented sous chef? And then Remy has his own restaurant (but hides in the back kitchen because after all, he is a rat, and a lot of people would have a problem with that?) And the final test for him is this super important but super critical French food reviewer, Anton Ego (voiced by Peter O'Toole), who comes to test the restaurant, and, who usually ends up panning every restaurant chef, but takes a bite of the rat's Ratatouille and immediately he is transported to a little French chalet in the countryside where his sweet mama, the last person on Earth who ever cared about him, presents him, a school boy in shorts and long socks, with a hot pot of soup which warms his belly and his soul. It is a surprisingly heartwarming scene of an animated film. (And if you've never seen it, here: youtube.com/watch?v=Ih6j... ) But this experience is all about the food. The first bite of this succulent, mouth-watering, mind-bending combination of crab, shrimp, lobster, and whatever other sea creature that makes it into this delicate and tender melange of stew, with a tomato base, and a lot of wondrous goodness, is one of the best food moments I have had in a long time. And that says a lot for a "foodie." It is rare that in taking a bite of something you have to stop and just adjust your frame of mind. But this is like that. There are not enough superlatives to tell you how much I enjoyed this pan roast combo. It was perfect. It is the kind of exceptionalism that America stands for. I don't know if it needed the rice that comes with, but it does complement the dish very well. The only downside is that adding rice makes it more difficult for you to finish partaking of this work of art. And not finishing it was not an option for me. It is the Mona Lisa of pan roasts. I do not think a photo does it justice. I can see some people thinking of the Mona Lisa as "meh," just a portrait of a plain lady done a long time ago. And I think I was in that camp until I went to Paris before moving to Las Vegas one summer, and went to the Louvre and stood in the long line to get in, and took the winding paths to see "La Jaconde" (what they call the "Mona Lisa" over there), and then when I finally got close to it, it was like a mystery unveiled. It was just weird how this painting seemed so vivid and lifelike and chilling. I couldn't stop looking at it. And then a gruff French security guard charged with keeping order around the masterpiece gives you the glance that says it's time to move on. And you break your trance and you leave, but fuller, and maybe wiser. Probably not everyone has that feeling in front of the Mona Lisa, and perhaps not everyone will have that feeling when diving into the pan roast at Palace Station Oyster Bar the first time. But if you do, you will understand what I mean. Some down to earth notes: You will wait. I was fortunate that I came around 5pm on a weekday so my wait was only 30 minutes. Most spend longer than that. You will not have anything like 5-star service, but good folks who are perfunctory and workmanlike, and that is appropriate since you are seated at a bar, after all. You must be 21 years old to sit there. You will be asked about the heat (spice) level of the pan roast: I chose a 4-5, out of 8, I believe. My colleague chose a 0. I think a little spicier is better. (He also inhaled it, though). Don't waste your time with anything other than the pan roast, or perhaps the gumbo, which also has high marks and is made in a similar way. The actual oysters, ironically, are fairly flavorless. Don't get them! Don't get oysters at the Oyster Bar, people! LOL. Get the pan roast. As fellow Yelper Sammy M says, "Holy buckets, this place is EVERYTHING! Literally mind blown after the first bite." Or, as Anton Ego put it in his fictional review in "Ratatouille": "There are times when a critic truly risks something, and that is in the discovery and defense of the new. Last night, I experienced something new, an extraordinary meal from a singularly unexpected source. To say that both the meal and its maker have challenged my preconceptions is a gross understatement. They have rocked me to my core...It is difficult to imagine more humble origins than those of the genius now cooking at [Oyster Bar], who is, in this critic's opinion, nothing less than the finest chef in France. I will be returning to [Oyster Bar] soon, hungry for more." Indeed.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast (combo)
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters

D1xsdrqOdYuR_Oy4tEP75A.text: We visit Oyster Bar everytime we are in La Vegas, we usually go here from 11pm to 2am and always leave with a great satisfaction... it all changed during todays visit. I always order Bouill-Roast because I like the unique buttery taste to it , but this time we were all frustrated. The taste was different and the serving was reduced.   We talked and complained to the server...we found out that there's been lots of complain about the particular cook.   Maybe re-train that cook or bring back Ricardo ( whom we found out that he got fired).   We have yet to try the other 2 cooks...but if we go and see the same cook on our next visit...we are not wasting our time and money. Sorry.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half filled soup... taste is very plain. Ricardo&#39;s cooking was waaaaay better!

tml8JbjfAE3VWipF2x-lpg.text: We came here today for lunch at around 11:30am and waited only 15mins. It was my first time trying this restaurant and was surprised at how delicious everything was! Kudos to the one Chef that was cooking everything! We had a small conversation as to what he recommended and what the local favorites were.   We ordered the Pan Roasted Combination that came with Crab, Shrimp and Lobster, Cajun Peeled Shrimp, and Raw Clams! Everything was perfectly cooked and tasted superb! The seafoods were so fresh!   The service was also on par with everything. Very friendly and helpful staff.   I would totally recommend this restaurant!

zFnXxh7eAhsjdykbQ7hKIw.text: This place is amazing! All the years we had been wanting to try but it seemed too busy , long lines and just never did. Then we decided to try it.  This place is the bomb!!! Amazing food. Very good! The seafood is awesome., tastes so fresh.  We enjoyed it a few times before we moved and if we go back to Vegas to visit this is a must go place its so good. The clam chowder was good as well as the main dishes. The chefs and waitresses have been there a long time and you can see a lot of people are repeat customers that know them. Don't hesitate to try this place. Get there early and get in line because you won't regret it!!! Definitely  worth trying!!

vNbTpE4taldlJFbJpTrSKA.text: No idea how this place gets such high reviews.  The seafood was overcooked and Victoria the server was a horrible human being.    We stood in line for 2.5 hours for this at 4am, since everyone said we HAD to eat here when in Vegas.    Our group had 6 people.  They were able to seat 4 of us first and said when the seats next to us cleared, they can serve the other 2.    So the other 2 were standing w/ us and Victoria said they couldn't stand with us.  Ok, so they moved back to the line and waited there.  The 2 next to us finished and left and our 2 friends came to stand in that spot.  Victoria said "what the hell is wrong with you guys.  why the heck are you so antsy.  I shouldn't even serve you".  WTH?  How do you talk to customers that way?  After they waited 2.5 hours to try your food.    Disgusting human being, over cooked seafood, dry hard rice.  $55 for one gumbo and one pan roast.  NO THANK YOU.    I'm staying in the good side of town and not going to these craphole casinos anymore.

w2q1kp1kVORNZLYOXbe2CQ.text: First things first . . . This joint is literally a bar.  Yes, a bar with oysters, killer gumbo, clam chowder and jambalaya.  There is usually a wait.  However, I have to admit that it's worth it - and I'm not a patient man PERIOD.  But, if you come in the early morning (5am - 10am), there is no line whatsoever so I'm told.  I don't know who might be interested in oysters at that time . . .   I had the gumbo and this was the best I have had since I visited New Orleans in the early 90s.  It had tons of crab, lobster, shrimp and Cajun spice.  EXCELLENT!!!  $24.99 for a large bowl of gumbo . . . hmmmmmmm . . . YES, get it.  The only thing that I disliked was the damned line, but it did seem to move quickly.  The service was pleasant and efficient, but not exceptional.  I would visit again, but this time I would like my wife to come with me - I know she'd LOVE it.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster/raw
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

awg8o8ehOHh0Ftef3tAJ3g.text: Wow. Pan roast. The line to this place does not lie.. their food is awesome and super fresh. Seeing the pictures of food on this place didn't excite me and the last time I was in Vegas I decided to skip it but this time around since we had time, we decided to chance it even though the line might be long.   We came around 130pm and we still waited about 45 minutes which actually didn't seem as long as it sounded.   I don't know why they don't just expand the place. The food is so good and it's obviously very popular.   I got the palace pan roast (crab,sausage,chicken) and it is so big! Definitely would not be able to finish it by myself. I think next time I'll get the combo pan roast with lobster. I felt the chicken was a waste of stomach space since their seafood tastes so fresh and amazing. We also go the jambalaya which was good but definitely not necessary as the pan roast comes with side of white rice.   I highly recommend coming here. This is probably one of my favorite places I've tried in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jambalaya. So good!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So so bomb. Palace pan roast

vNdCGe2KxhqyeQqHJExGpA.text: The long line is well worth the wait!  It's open 24 hours but there is normally a wait whenever you go. The food is delicious and it's all made to order. A must have when you're in the area!!

r7vr2VKfcuZcNYacun7FqA.text: This was my first time here. Hands down the best oysters I ever had. Then the oyster shooters were amazing. I had two with tequila and the other with vodka. The Vodka was hands down the best. My wife had the chowder and she loved it. Will always come back. Seat are limited so be ready to wait.

JjMau3AiR7JOIX8URaIkFQ.text: Been going here for over 15 years and it never disappoints. Be prepared to wait in line to sit down, it's a small seating area. The food is cooked right in front of you in small steam boiling pots. My #1 choice is the Combo Pan Roast. It's a tomato cream base w/ crab, lobster and shrimp in it. I usually get between a hotness level of 4-7 depending on who's making it. Oysters are always fresh and good on the half shell. You can get the large beer and get refills for half off. The gumbo is pretty good here too, but I'm bias because I make my own. My BF thinks this place is F'ing Amazing. Note: the one in PALACE Station is the best one to go to

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Back menu
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiting in line, but so worth it

sFqkgfhJtGnjJwMJe19z9A.text: I've been wanting to try Oyster Bar for god knows how long!! I've tried Ritter's in Irvine but it left me wanting in flavor. Oyster Bar is located smack dab in the middle of Palace Station's casino and while having a constant waft of cigarette smoke during your meal isn't the most ideal scenario, the food makes up for what the environment lacks.  We got really lucky. Dropped by around 2pm and waited maybe 20 minutes for a seat. Seating is suuuper limited with what I believe is less than 20 seats. Once we were seated, we were quick to order a half dozen oysters and a combo pan roast.  No lie, these oysters were the best I've ever had. Sizable succulent morsels that were perfectly sweet and salty. I could've eaten a dozen of those alone! Luckily my boyfriend doesn't eat oysters so I had them all to myself.  The pan roast was also perfect. Perfectly spiced, perfect amount of seafood (generous portion of lobster meat), and perfect service size too. It satisfied every tastebud that Ritter's couldn't.  Worth the wait! Counting down the days until I can come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YASgr6d6-4DjY-bK7YdGHg.text: Delicious!  It was worth the wait.  We ordered the combo pan roast (heat level 2), New England clam chowder, seafood boulinaise and cold seafood combo.  My favorite is the combo pan roast and New England clam chowder.  Every bite on both had meat in eat and the flavors was just amazing.  The place is in the middle of Palace Casino.  It's a bar that salt about no more than 30 people.  The wait can take about 1.5 hours or more.  The taste is worth the wait.  I definitely will come back.  The staff were pleasant.

dHJtWBHiM7lBay-ZoO5KZQ.text: The wait is worth every second.. I had a huge fight with my boyfriend in line but we made up the very second we got our food. It's that good!! The oysters are fresh, huge, and affordable. It doesnt smell fishy at all. Try their pan roast with spicy level 7 if you like heat. It's so bomb. Consider yourself lucky if you get any form of service though.

Kx0vMQ8KaMSInruNykFZEg.text: I first came here many a year ago, and I remember the New England Clam Chowder being absolutely amazing. It wasn't so much this time. It was very flat, but my friend's etouffee was pretty great.   This was our third attempt at going, as other times, we just didn't have time to wait in the line (which I never dealt with back in the day, but I guess word got out).  It's still really good though.

sDvLtVy6XWhl-5tBq6aM_Q.text: The Pan Roast lobster, crab and shrimp is worth all the hype its like crack wish I could click my heels and be there from Cali back to Vegas just to get me a bowl of yumminess.  We went in around 4am so luckily there was no wait.  But please be patience its cooked right in front of you so it takes at least 30 minutes but its so worth it.  We got the happy hour oysters they were ok but nothing to rave about.  Also the hot bread is so good dipped in your pan roast but they seem to be skimpy about giving us seconds.  Make sure you tip them good theres a lot of love that goes into their pan roasts!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best thing I ever ate in Las Vegas Pan roast with only lobster crab and shrimp

r0lqjnc-CnT6uJvvMFdDpw.text: Okay... so the first time I ate here I was suuuuuuper hungover. Go figure in Vegas, right?   It was my last night there and my genius friend suggested we eat something SPICY. No bueno on a tummy full of leftover alcohol. NEVER. EVER. This left my last memory of this place a little tainted to say the least.   I didn't return for a while, but finally made the effort when I saw they changed to being open 24 hours. Nothing like a big pot of goodness anytime of the day (or night)!  Came here after clubbing and even though it was 5AM, there was a wait! Seats are first come, first serve and after that you wait in line until one of the 20 seats are free. My party of 3 ended up waiting about 30 - 40 minutes.  Two words of advice: COME. HUNGRY.   Their portions are so large, they're almost 3 meals in one! And there's a fee if you share with someone. I'm not really down for that, but once you try one bite, you might want the whole bowl to yourself!  Definitely come here and get the pan roast! There is nothing else you should order! All kinds of fresh seafood sauteed with brandy, cream and tomato and served with rice. SO. FREAKING. DELICIOUS. And they don't skimp on the seafood at all! You can see the cook dump in the goodness in your pot and cook it right in front of you! You can even pick what level of spiciness you want. You can pick anywhere from 1 to 10. Level 3 is good for a light kick, but you can still taste the flavor of the sauce.   I know there's a lot of options for 24 hour late night eats in Vegas, but this is one of the better ones out there. I mean, any place with a wait at almost every hour of the day is definitely good eats!

6V6rbMNKwN2fR2LkHoBbwQ.text: This place serves my favorite clam chowder in the whole wide world.  And because it's open 24 HRS, there are times I have seriously considered jumping in my car in the middle of the night and driving all the way to Vegas (I'm in the OC, a 4 hr drive away) to indulge in their Alaskan chowder.  I haven't done it yet, but just wait, one of these days, I definitely will.  Only downside is how dinky this place is (a counter with only 15 seats or so) and there is always a wait and the line moves so slowly.  But it's definitely worth it, even though it's torture to see all the diners tucking in to their dishes right in front of you.  Pan roast is pretty good here but I'm not a big fan of jasmine rice, I wish they served it with either Uncle Ben's or a short grain (yes, I know I am very picky when it comes to rice).  I have yet to try the gumbo, will have to give it a whirl the next time I'm in town.

WFuKi8m12gozrgqbFGe80w.text: Of course the Pan Roast and Fanny Bay oysters is a star meal, but the BF and I have gone a few times and have branched out to try other things.   Very glad we have.   We decided based on our usual server Steve's recommendation of bouillabaise ($21.99) It had a good soup base and plenty of seafood including crab, lobster, shrimp, mussels, clams and cod. Pretty solid as far as bouillabaise goes.  We got our usual oysters to go and it was past midnight and they were doing $3.50 Bloody Marys so I got one. Pretty solid and spicy how I like!   Next time we ended up with   Little neck clam steamers ($15.99)- good, but standard. Broth butter was good though  Alaskan Chower ($17.99) New England style with crab, lobster, and shrimp. It is very thick so we poured a little of our clam broth in it and that made a more preferred consistency for me. If you don't want it as gloopy as for some of the seafood broth into it and I think the garlic, parsley, butter enhanced it. Definitely one of my favorites.   We normally go around the same time at night so it's been always Steve and Ricardo who take care of us and it's been good service every time. The BF and I somehow have magical timing as the last 3 times we haven't had to wait at all for a chair!!   Still one of my favorite places and we're planning to try down all that's on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Mary
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boullabaise
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Little Neck Clams

VUi6sAX2SQoQisKk376W-g.text: The level of spiciness seems to depend on the chef. We went in the afternoon one time, ordered spicy level 6 and it was nice and spicy this time! I went with a combo pan roast with pasta this time and I loved it (:

xffMFHkMf8AqhkzMQVJc0A.text: I'm officially a believer!  After missing out on oyster bar on our vegas trip last year, we made it a point to come here on our trip this year.    My friend was telling us this was a must-have in vegas and we were a little skeptical because of the location...   Anyways, after some drinking and gambling at the $5 tables at palace station, we waited a little and sat down at the oyster bar around 3am.    I'll cut to the chase, the combo pan roast was SOOO BOMB!!  Fresh oysters were pretty good too.  Only downside was the wait for the food.  We waited almost 1 hour after we sat down and ordered to get our food.  One buddy who was pretty drunk made it up until about 5 minutes before the food came, then he disappeared to the bathroom for the rest of the night.  Really sucked for him because the food was amazing!  Fast forward to the next night.  After drinking/gambling on the strip, we found ourselves at the oyster bar again, this time around 6am.  No wait to sit down and a little less of a wait to get our food.  Again, combo pan roast was $$$$$$$$!  I'm definitely coming back here every time I'm in vegas!  Just gotta remember to bring some tums for the heartburn lol...

0Robys9b0Nn28bbV5ay-4Q.text: As noted by all of the other reviews,  there WILL BE a wait as this place has only 18 seats and a limited number of cooking kettles, but your tastebuds will be so delighted that the wait will be well worth it! Upon approaching the Oyster Bar inside the Palace Station Casino you could smell the cajun spices and heat in the air.. just follow your nose! Fortunately there were only 3 people in front of us at 4pm on a Wed, so we only waited approx 15-20 mind for seats. Upon sitting down you can see the authentic kettles and masses of incredible seafood being prepared deftly by one chef. Lobster, crab, mussels, clam, brandy, garlic - ever delicious Cajun ingredient being expertly boiled, simmered, seasoned and prepared to perfection. I have only had seafood as flavorful as this on my one trip to New Orleans. Though we didn't have the oysters, they were being shucked right in front of us and they looked SO incredible! Huge and plump and looking so fresh, we will definitely be ordering a dozen to share next time!  I had the combo pan roast level 6 of spiciness and JJ, the chef that prepared our food, cooked and spiced it to perfection.  It definitely had a kick and every piece of seafood was cooked perfectly - lobster, shrimp and crab. My girlfriend had the shrimp and lobster fra diavolo and it was spicy, brothy, and delicious. The pasta seemed very fresh and drank in the smoky, spicy broth amazingly.  The portions were huge and we left with enough food to eat for at least a meal or two later.  If you aren't grumpy hungry and are willing to wait a little while for genuine flavors and quality this is the place to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast lv6 on the left and the seafood fra diavolo (also lv6) on the right! Both amazingly delicious!

imLLRolSM46CI6IWSXjKRw.text: Awesome little gem hidden in the Palace Station.  Limited seating and no reservations so you should plan on waiting a bit to be seated; I like to grab a beer from the casino bar to make the wait more enjoyable!  I always get the "jackpot" seafood tower... best seafood value around!

OaCMXVDUu6f0xEWmabYsSg.text: Just as good as everyone says it is!    The only downside is the wait!  There are maybe... 12-16 seats only, bar seating only.  So you can imagine the waits.  We waited about 30 minutes for 4 people, but they mentioned at night it gets super crazy.  Probably all the drunks hungry people come in.  The server we had was really nice and was working her ass off and did her very best to refill our drinks.  I got the pan roast like everyone recommends, and it did not disappoint.  Large chunks of seafood inside.  Its like a cajun safood bisque if I had to call it something and they include a scoop of rice.  I heard they charge you more for extra rice, some of my other friends went and got a bunch of scoops for free.  The 1 plate alone of pan roast is very filling and they ask you the spice level on a 1-10 scale.  I got a 2 since i'm weak sauce but my friends got 5.  They are convinced they were all the same spice level since the guy makes the food in front of you and it look like he used the same amt in all of our dishes.  I think they all tasted very similar as well.  There are also oysters there which I did not try, but looked good.  Seems the pan roast was by far more popular than getting oysters on the half shell.   Loved the food, will make this a new must go to place every time I go to vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast

v_DbXaiCnHmKCDPA2LtVTQ.text: Love this place!!!combo pan is beyond delicious it explodes in you're mouth, I get it at 9 spicy

RdEDqYBdld8ZgW_oUBF2Aw.text: I'm so glad this place is open 24/7. My husband and I went at 7:30 am today (Sunday) and there were plenty of open seats, no wait. The host recommended the Palace Pan Roast and Bouillabaisse. We love seafood and were already planning on the pan roast because of the reviews. Coming here was the best food decision we made during this trip - both were beyond amazing. We don't like things too spicy so we each got a level 2 which turned out great...a 3 probably would've been fine too. Flavor is phenomenal, especially the pan roast. How we had never come to Oyster Bar on any of our countless previous Vegas trips, I don't know. But coming here for the pan roast at least once is going to be a must for every Vegas trip from now on!

BJQH7zvdSb3ucleU5GwUDA.text: Seriously? One chef and maybe a little more than a dozen seats. Some couples were so desperate that they were willing to share stool space. (read 1 butt cheek per stool)  I feel like this inefficient system was designed to increase the hype.  Maybe I'm not a big enough glutton, but I don't think ANY food is worth waiting hours for.  This is also why I'd never care to eat a cronut.  Didn't get a chance to try their "magical" pan roast and, frankly, I don't care if I ever do. You kind of wonder if all the rave reviews are actually due to delusions which are a result of hunger. Why anyone would subject themselves to the abuse of hours-long waits and slow, sub-par service for food is beyond me.

eOxQw2SrTQV-IzDGndRqkQ.text: Expect to stand in a long line, even during the wee hours of the morning on a weekday. The quality of the food is worth the wait! I can see why Oyster Bar is a favorite among locals. I recommend the Alaskan clam chowder "dirty" style and of course, the raw oysters!

-vtWxgZLkGAFYEMi511iaw.text: Great place to go for AMAZING SEAFOOD 24 hours a day! I go here after I go clubbing ever time. The lines can get long because it's literally a bar and can seat only a handful of people but SOOOOO worth the wait!

e67aef9RUg7zLUxAKF5gdg.text: OMG Batman get in here NOW! So I love pan roast, I mean I love it! The pan Roast I had here was amazing! I took the fire level up to a 5 (1-10) and it was very good, next time I will go a 2 or 3. First time I have had this served with rice, interesting, but very good! The oysters on the half shell? I almost fell out of my seat! They were large and super fresh and yummy! This was a second attempt to eat here. The first time we had 5 in our group, this time just 2. So the bummer is, it really is just a bar, a small bar, maybe 20 seats in a half round. I love watching the chef prepare food, it is just cool. The waitress was super nice and attentive, the food was amazing! I'm from S.F so sea food is my thing and this place rocks. Yes the casino is old and smokey, don't care, the food trumps it. Parking was easy peesy (I did mention it is in a casino).. No reservations, might have to wait in a line, looking on and feeling growing stomach pains. I wish this were a tad bit bigger, not the best for a group (if you all want to eat at the same time) a single or 2 ppl is your best bet.. I will be back!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast!

sAnWrgj5c59Yau4u5auwEQ.text: This place has to be the best oyster bar in Vegas. Seafood is fresh and the atmosphere is chill and relaxing. I highly recommend anyone local or visiting to come check it out. Our server Christinya is amazing!!!! Thanks!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen oysters! Fresh fresh fresh

pfoX7_hA468H-IrKWzUvyg.text: After returning 2 more times after I wrote my original review, I decided to update. Both times I have eaten here, I've arrived at about 2 am on a weekday and only had a 30 minute maximum wait, not as bad as I expected. I ordered the Dozen Oysters and Shrimp Linguini, to die FOR! I'm a chicken when it comes to spicy, so I ordered my pasta with a 0 Spice level, haha, I loved the funny look the cook gave me when I did. The sauce in the pasta was the best I've ever had, creamy and rich. So glad I gave this place a second (and 3rd) chance, will be returning again and again!  Original Review, 2/15/2015, 1 star: Came here under the impression that this establishment was open 24/7, since that is what they claim. Arrived at around 2am, and after waiting for over 10 minutes and getting ignored by the chef and hostess, I made my way to sit at the bar. The chef then very rudely informs us that they were closed and just waiting for the people that were eating to leave! Why couldn't they say that when they saw me standing there, instead of ignoring me.

PloVqXLQUzy5snSAkyWFBw.text: "Good things come to those who wait"  I feel like that is the underlying theme of this location. Luckily I had read countless reviews, so I was prepared for a wait, hoping that it would indeed be worth the wait.  I got in line at 5:40 PM on a Sunday evening, and I was seated at 6:27 PM, so the wait was actually not near as bad as I was planning for. I could see how this would be a bigger issue for large groups. My suggestion would be to seat everyone solo or in small groups and move closer together once other guests leave.  Once seated, I started with a half dozen oysters, which came out promptly. They were easily the biggest oysters I've ever had before in my life! This was good and bad for me - in that I'm not used to having a mouthful when eating oysters and it was a little much for me. Not sure I'd order again, but I was glad I tried them.  From there, I went with the House Gumbo and the Combo Pan Roast, as they seemed to be the popular choices and you can only order 2 entrees (to be fair to those waiting in line).  I started with the gumbo first and was blown away! I haven't had gumbo that good since I was in New Orleans! It was incredible! As good as the gumbo was, I think the pan roast may have been even better! If I could only pick one (or didn't want to spend $50 to get both) then I would go with the pan roast - assuming that I  wasn't there to satisfy a gumbo craving ;)  Ok, now to address the heat of the food! I typically like really spicy food, but the reviews made it sound like anything over 6 was suicide! I originally went with a 7, but after talking with a regular sitting next to me, went down to a 6 to be safe. At a 6, I barely noticed it was spicy, so I think I would have been fine going with a 7 or higher. If you are the type that can handle hot/Indian heat at an Indian/Thai restaurant, or can handle the hottest wings at BWW, then you will be just fine. I know I have a fairly high tolerance to heat, but I think even my wife would have been fine with a 6, and she typically goes much more mild than I do.  So all in all, I completely agree with the other reviews in the fact that the food and service definitely warrant the wait! Think of it this way - how many of us have waited over an hour in a theme park for a 2 minute ride?!? At least the end of this line is SO much more rewarding after the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House gumbo and combo pan roast - like deciding which child you like best!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Might have been a little too big for my taste...but not sure if that&#39;s a bad thing??

ok9Hk648Kk8CVZL5a9zWew.text: Sat 2pm arrived, 3.10pm seated, 4pm food arrived. Only 16 seats at bar counter, only 6 bowls cooking at a time, so even food is a wait.   Pan roast combo, spicy 6, is excellent large bowl of good thick tomato broth of yummy seafood. Alaskan clam chowder, spicy 5, is hearty huge portion, with mix of fresh shrimps and not-so fresh lobsters. Food is good, though not sure if worth 2-3hr wait. 4* for food, minus 1 on long wait.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

izSOMhCAkVbCq1Onnkb-gw.text: I've heard about this place from friends and after a month, I decided to make it to give it a try on my regular trips to Vegas and I am glad I did.  So the wait is about as horrible as everyone says.  If you go during the busy times, which is anything around regular meal times, expect the wait to be at least 2 hours.  I heard the light times are only around 3am or so.  One time I went at 3pm and it was only 1.5 hours wait.  Yeah, that is considered short during regular times.  Ever since I tried this place, I make sure I go there whenever I am in town.  Onto the main part of the review, the food!  Gumbo - Definitely order the seafood and get extra crab and lobster and sausage, even though the regular portions are generous enough, but I like more food in my gumbo than usual.  I only go for the level 2 or 3 spicy because I have heard some horror stories about how spicy it can get once you go to 4 and beyond.  I think 9 and 10 might just be inedible to most mortals.  It goes very well with the scoop of rice you get, but it can get very filling.  I don't think I have ever finished a whole bowl and I have always had to take home half.  Jambalaya - It's not a soup/stew but rather, a dry rice cooked in Cajun spices and served heaping with seafood.  It's less salty and filling than the gumbo but that doesn't mean I can finish a whole bowl either.  Raw Oysters - Definitely get it.  Their yellow band oysters are some of the biggest I have ever seen.  The oysters are juicy and plump and delicious.  Raw Mussels - While the flavors are saltier and sharper than an oyster, it also has a crunchier texture.  I didn't like it as much as the oysters and I can go either way on this, but I think I would just get more raw oysters instead.  They give you a fresh baked sourdough roll and butter.  I don't even bother eating it because I want to save room for the food.  However, when I did eat it, it was perfectly baked with the crunchy exterior coupled with a soft and warm interior.  I like their wine selection as well, even if it's not that extensive, but you don't need a big complicated wine list when what they have is picked to work with their food anyway.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at the lumps of crab in that gumbo!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A happy chef is a good chef!

iJ1X6wdHD7p45IQFYnEhAw.text: Oh man you have got to try this place out.  When we found this on yelp we were wondering why it had such high ratings. From the photos it looks like it's just a small bar next to slot machines--it looked ghetto. And when we got there, it was True, the place Really IS next to slot machines on the main floor of a casino. But it's also True that the food here is worth 5-stars  The price is actually pretty high--almost all items are $20+ and up, so be aware. The quality of the food is well worth it though--extreme comfort food, perfect for after long nights of gambling or other crazy shit you did in Vegas.  Word of caution--the spiciness rating here is insane. You choose spiciness from 1-10, and being a guy that eats spicy stuff everywhere I choose 7. Man was it hot. I think my max for this place is at most a 5.  Basically, whatever you think your spicy rating is, just minus 2 or more from it.  The seafood stew quality was amazing, with HUGE chunks of lobster, fish, clams etc Everything tasted fresh, with seawater freshness inside the flesh even though it's covered in broth. After I ate this meal I was full for the entire 8 hour drive back home. Definitely a bit meal with large portions.  Definitely a place to come back to again and again and again.
