EQv7RwlsZrFJc5016uvu5Q.text: This is a fun date spot! We sat at the bar, you get to see all the cooking action. I had heard how good the pan roast was so I tried the crab one. It was good, however it was a little too heavy for me. I also had a white wine with dinner. I think next time I'll have a beer and try one of the pasta dishes, when you sit at the bar it can get a little warm from the heat of them cooking, so you really need a ice cold drink.

xy_kIwVIfoH-Y2s77dLa0A.text: favorite place for late night food. Theres almost always a wait but once you try the food you understand why.

R4HPaaXudl9wFVbD_3OBdQ.text: Got here around 5pm and waited a little over an hour on a Saturday.  Honestly.... the pan roast was OK.  I don't know if this opinion is a result of my friends raving and having major foodgasms over this stuff but I wasn't impressed. To be fair, I'm not a fan of creamy food, soups, etc. The seafood portions (I got the combo roast) were hefty and the shrimp and lobster were cooked just right. But the soup was just too creamy and I couldn't eat much of it. Anyway, when I told my friends that it was whatever, they gasped and looked at me like I was spewing heresy. So to each his own I guess!  The experience was cool though. All these hungry pan roast loving people staring at people eating pan roast watching the chef making pan roast in the middle of the casino. It's worth a try!

S4YAYR8wuoLxBAlSZSheAw.text: Very Good place to eat, not to many seafood places to choose from i recommend the Oyster bar personally...worth every penny

KLMWD8Z-yu4s-1dSA6yp9Q.text: After hearing about how bombdizzle Oyster Bar is from numerous friends, I hauled my ass over the first chance that I got. And whooo wheee, it's FANTASTIC.   The chefs prepare everything to order and better yet, they prepare it in front of you so you can watch the magic happen!!   For a first timer like me, I went the safe and easy route and ordered a half dozen oysters and the ever popular Combo Pan Roast to share.   Oysters - superbly fresh. Comes with all your usual fixings--chunky horseradish, lemons, marinara sauce, and tobasco sauce (upon request). Prepare to your heart's desire and slurp on up!  Combo Pan Roast - wow, this stuff is like crack. Even when my stomach was telling me, "No more, I'm stuffed!", my mouth would keep commanding, "More!". The best part of the meal isn't the plethora of seafood (a whole lobster tail, 4 halved crab legs, and a shit ton of shrimp) that crowds the dish, the best part is... wait for it......the broth!! The broth consists of a sweet creamy tomato broth mixed with various savory spices and brandy that will leave your tastebuds feeling a bit perplexed (but in a good way!) from the flavor complexity. My friend and I enjoyed this dish much like you would a curry dish rather than a soup, so we ordered an extra side of rice for it. The dish was large enough to overstuff the both of us.   It's a pricey place overall, but well wort the price imo (and the portions are large so many of the dishes can be split between two people).  And here's the kicker.... all this awesomeness is available 24hrs a day!! So if you're wandering around the strip drunk at 5 am, and you want to get your fancy on.... I suggest you stumble on over to Oyster Bar at the Palace Station for their Pan Roast!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wibxyHM9pbnQdP9__Z6Twg.text: This place is crazy good! They make the food in front of you in these kettles that are built into the bar. Sometimes Im not sure which one is mine since there is literally no-stop business here.  The place is literally a bar with very limited seating and there is ALWAYS a line. I went at 2am and had to wait 45 minutes to sit down. It is definitely worth the wait though.  I ordered the pan roast and it is some of the best food I have ever had. The pan roast reminds me of curry and is delicious. Its so good that I am now on a mission to find something similar to it in my hometown (ive been told it will never be as good as the one at Palace Station tho).  Highly recommend everyone tries this place out. Food is good, food is fresh and the line is justified.

RSUtxUyjG3XT_au9hiY-tA.text: Pros: The seafood pan roast is delicious! Great customer service. Hard workers! They do there best to serve their customers in a timely manner.   Con: The restaurant is very small, only 18 seats. It seems to stay busy Since it is a very popular place with good food. A lot of local and visitors frequent this place.    Be prepared to wait in line for a while, especially during the weekends.

b9xp7pbCU8VFMrR7Rwk5OA.text: I have been coming to Oyster bar for almost 3 years and the pan roasts are insanely great!!! The reason it gets 4 stars is bc like everyone else says that line sucks big time! If your hungry it really sucks so if you have time i would 100% give it a try here in Vegas :)

pqO-_8Q1S3CV-sfg7XAiRg.text: If you like shellfish, eating here is a must. The Combo Pan Roast is my favorite. Food is awesome. This is usually our first stop when arriving in Vegas, however the wait for a seat can take over 2 hours during peak times. They are open 24/7.

T0vPYcwLMzpDvOdY6M91hA.text: Love this place. Last time I came I sprinted to cut in front of anybody else. Have had the pan roast, bouillabaisse, gumbo and etouffee. My fav is still the pan roast. All the chefs have a different range in their spiciness levels and Bob def makes it spicy! Can't go above a level 6 with him! Just a note, this is NOT a full scale restaurant. It's more like a bar with about 16 bar seats. So if you have even 5 people ahead of you, the wait can still be pretty ridiculous. Palace Station needs to just change it's name to Oyster Bar and expand the sitting area!   Btw, I never finish the pan roast and I would NEVER recommend sharing it with anybody because my favorite thing to do is reheating that bad boy later on that day. The spices and flavors deepen so it tastes that much better. Plus you'll regret sharing it when you go home and you're craving it. Last time I was there some guy was taking 7 to go....to check in on an airplane. Now that's love.

e8HueSeWrms6cFPYW-ccAQ.text: The soups were delicious. My husband and I ordered a dozen oysters, the new england style alaskan chowder and the combo pan roast. They were all amazing, oysters were very fresh and the soups were thick, creamy and loaded with seafood! Even though it was almost an hour wait for us, it was definitely worth it!

YMCqnGLtaRYtJ9hO8V_bag.text: I've been to this place several times when living in Vegas. This was my mine and my husbands favorite place. The seating is very limited and you must be 21 to eat there being that it's at a bar. I would recommend going during the week around lunch to avoid the long line and wait.

jqWzObdMpiYN7CZIi_PtlA.text: The Oyster Bar could easily be one of my favorite places to eat at. With oysters being back in season, this was my place of choice to go to on a Saturday night. We got there around 830 pm figuring we would beat the dinner rush. We ended up waiting for a whole hour when there was only about 7 people ahead of us! The good thing was that they were pretty quick about getting us our dozen oysters and food. The oysters were delicious, but had a couple pieces of shells stuck to the oyster itself from the shucking.   We ordered our favorite, the Combo Pan Roast...yum! Sharing between the two of us is always more than enough and always always get an extra side of rice. The lady didn't charge us a sharing fee which was extremely nice of her considering that I was getting cranky from the long wait. Overall, if I was starving I don't think I would wait the hour at 8:30 otherwise come really early or really late so that way the wait is cut in half. There is always a wait no matter what, but this just means that this place is that GOOD!

FnymoWdV_ulqqaZHuShhyQ.text: 4.5*  Goodness gracious, is there always a line here? We waited 2+ hours on a Monday evening, off-peak, and non-holiday weekend. Ate dinner at 10 PM =( You have been forewarned! Limited seating (~16 seats), and only 12 people in line when we first got there.  This being my first time here, I just followed suit. We all got the combo pan roasts (in varying degrees of spiciness), which is one of their most popular dishes. I wanted to try the gumbo, but my friend said it wasn't as good as the pan roast - oh well, next time. Verdict? Excellent! 1 shared between two girls was perfect. We were full and satisfied, and we're big eaters too! The guys, who each had their own pan roast, were in pain for an hour afterwards because they didn't share yet had to eat every last drop because we're Asian. Mwahahaha.  Oysters on the half shell were large and juicy, but not as creamy as I like. The best oysters are still found in the NW, sigh. I didn't care much for the bread but it made for good dipping.  TIP: Ask for the rice on the side if you don't plan to eat it all, otherwise they automatically add it to the roast and because of all the cream sauce, it's hard to differentiate if the leftovers are unnecessary carbs from rice or a tasty piece of seafood you accidentally left behind.

4XhJd-weT4aUHW7-1mTYFA.text: We had no wait line because it was early morning normal wait line for dinner can be a hour to two hours. The oysters are very big and fresh so good. We also had the house gumbo pretty damn good my wife had the pan roast and she loved it. I would say bob is the best chef.

LaNZk-c39QjuKWDPLtOSFA.text: Amazing tasty and would do again only if the line was not long and would not wait...if you have time and like sitting at a bar style...then this is the place for you.

LCqUScycMIWQBMrik5Hgbw.text: I guess I'm biased or maybe I just don't like seafood, but my experience here was just average. I ordered the shrimp scampi and the combo pan roast. My shrimp scampi was just typical but I didn't know it would be so soupy. It really threw me off and it wasn't as flavorful. The pan roast was a lot better but it wasn't something that I would give five stars. It was flavorful but nothing amazing. I arrived at a really good time. We got there around 11:30am and there wasn't much of a line so we were able to order right away. Even though the food was mediocre, the quality of seafood would be a five star rating. They aren't stingy with the seafood and fill up the entrees which is a nice plus as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi

lUFC8FF5wdRPVY6cYmIXFQ.text: Suuuuchhhhh a long wait... But it's worth it if it's only for an hr or less. The pan roast with sausages chicken and shrimp was amazing! Got it with rice but next time I'll try noodles and see how it is. One pan roast is good enough for two! It's quite a big bowl. Didn't have the chance to try the oysters because I do get a bit sketched out about oysters in the desert.. But maybe next time I'll give it a try since a lot of people rave about it. I did have the clam chowder and that was okay. Nothing amazing about it but it wasn't bad either. They were nice enough to split one bowl into two for us. Overall, I'd recommend this place if wait is less than an hr. Otherwise, forget it. Standing in line for more than an hr when you're hungry is not worth it.

UXTycl1MP99v6sHyYl2sGg.text: I came here with super high expectations. Maybe it was too hyped for me that when I ate it I thought to myself "oh? this is it?" I did enjoy watching the chefs throw the seafood, seasoning and cream into the kettle and cook it.   I ordered the palace pan roast which has crab, shrimp and lobster. Mmm I loved the bits of seafood in the creamy tomato broth and ate it with rice. Delicious! But is it worth the 1-2 hr wait? Not really.   Tips *Limited seating (18 seats) so you may have to wait awhile during lunch/dinner hrs *There is a $5 splitting charge if you decide to split a pan roast or something & they give you an extra scoop of rice

IsRtPQIK55O_lv-RqzaYzQ.text: Everyone rated it 5 stars because of the taste, but the overall experience is 2 stars at best. If you are willing to wait this is a great tasty place. Wait can be between one to three hours. If your lucky and off peak maybe 1 hour. They don't take reservations, they don't have seating for the people waiting they don't reserve your spot.  So great jumbo and oyster. Kinda dissatisfied with managements failure to expand it and or make it a better over all experience.

70xMXNhh4zZtLTWOXDilEw.text: This place doesn't even need my review. Food here is life changing. I pretty much consider myself a local since I'm in Vegas several times a year and each trip we MUST make a stop at Oyster Bar.   I always get the combo pan roast, which is a thick, creamy, almost tomato/lobster bisque like with huge chunks of crab, lobster and shrimp (you can choose different protein pan roasts). They put a big scoop of rice in it and OMG I'm in heaven. We also like the cold seafood platter which are 3 raw oysters, 3 raw clams, and 3 huge shrimp cocktails. YUM.   We've never not waited in line (last night we waited 2 hours and we got here at 3:30pm) but I'm not even mad about it. There is no where or no one else in this world I would wait that long for. Enough said.

FaMJcS_ubtnCZLh1XX9i2Q.text: I really really REALLY miss you.  As I type this review, all I can think about is how delicious you were and WHEN I might next feel your lusciousness against my tongue.  Pan Roast, you are absolutely the most delicious creamy bowl of seafood I have EVER had. EVER. You were worth the long wait in line when I was over 8 months pregnant and ready to pop..... and you are worth making a road trip to Las Vegas now. I especially love how I can decide just how spicy I want you to be. (9, kthx please)  Like a pining ex-lover, I have literally talked extensively about you 6x in the past 3 months with 4 different people. WHY haven't you opened a branch in California yet? WHY?  Have I told you lately that I missed you?

zMQXIF2alVzrTtWImt3nNg.text: Great food, though super rich... But! The wait is a deal killer. We - literally - waited for nearly THREE  HOURS to sit down. In this old-school casino, that was, frankly, near-torture. The smoke and meandering crowds were *very nearly* not worth the wait.   The oysters were very good, but simply not up to the regular experiences we had in N. CA in the myriad small places right on the water. The pan roast was excellent, though. We did meet several people waiting with us, and they - to the last one - said they love the place, hate the wait, and would recommend coming in the early mornings(!), and decide to take out (you cannot order ahead, though, and you MUST wait, no matter what).  Unless you're in for a less-than-satisfying adventure, or can yank your butt our of bed at 6A to stand in a (shorter) line, just remember: it's only food.

jEc6Dz_86TrNswD9ZxdSkA.text: Warning: this is really just a random bar inside palace station. The seating is a little surprising because even bars usually have other places to sit. Just come here before 5, if possible. I've never actually had to wait that long like other reviews say. I try to avoid the rush hours   Food: the combination pan roast is amazing. The first time I tried this, it felt like it wasn't living up the the hype everyone claims, but the second time I realized I was very wrong. This is definitely my favorite dish.  Service: it takes awhile for the food, but they're very friendly. I always enjoy when people cook in front of the customers, definitely adds to the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They cook in front of you!

1LN0PdDrKol9uxlpx_PXuA.text: 1 star for the server and  oysters (old, fat, and full of dirt)   The only thing I would get here is the pan roast, but the chef is pretty stingy with the seafood portion.   This place is just terrible. Honest to God.

xoFP0T1awp8YUBgNAYkpUQ.text: I was staying at the Palace Station and my friend recommended the Oyster Bar. Now I'm an oyster lover and could live on eating seafood everyday but I had never had a pan roast before! Embarrassing right?! And I have the nerve to call myself a foodie and a Yelp Elite...  I started with the raw oysters, seafood cocktail, and raw clams. Other places usually display these items on a bed of ice as part of the ambiance but instead... they literally just took the frozen shrimp out of a bag that looked like it had been purchased at Costco and then peeled it. The oysters came out of a brown cardboard box before it was shucked and served. Frozen then served... It tasted good though! lol  They have a digital menu on the wall and hand you paper menu's although there is only one thing that you should order here. PAN ROAST!! I knew according to Yelp that I was going to order the combination pan roast but just for kicks, my eyes glanced over the menu and my eyes stopped at the familiar dishes I'd had before, such as gumbo, bouillabaisse, etc. and I ordered a gumbo as well just in case the pan roast was a disappointment.  NO DISAPPOINTMENT!!!!    Even with the frozen seafood, deelish!!!!!  They cook it in front of you and the pan roast was unlike anything I had ever tasted before. It;s like someone had taken all my favorites and put them in a blender to make the base. The sauce was rich, buttery, creamy, flavorful, zesty, delicious. I googled the recipe and will try to make it but if  you had never had it before and want to know what it tastes like, let's put it this way... If I had to describe it and make it with only 3 ingredients, I would use the crab fat of a dungeness crab, the buttery middle of a raw oyster and a tomato. Sounds delish right?  Rich, creamy, buttery delicious goodness.   Ate there 3 days in a row.... No line, no wait, lucky me.   Love love love this place. Only downside is that there is always a line and a wait (except for when I go).   Things to note, average dish is $20+pp which might be pricey for some in a casino bar however portions are huge so you can split it with someone or eat it later that day like I did. I spent about $75 each time I came.   There are only about 6 burners to cook on at one time and about 15 seats or so, so be prepared to spend about an hour there but it's worth it. The end.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VQyBUPDP8GNYIyDbXw-S3A.text: We come to Vegas about 3-4 times a year. We make our first stop the Oyster Bar 100% of these trips. Although there is always a line about lunchtime, you can buy the $0.99 margarita and bide your time talking about what you're going to order. Then you get a seat and order the combo pan roast. Watch Bob do his magic. The Station casinos all have an oyster bar, but this is the smallest and the best. Even the employees come here on their days off! We order double meat and split it. The rice is excellent, and we're rice snobs. The lump crab is terrific as are clams on the half shell (when they have them). I'm a tiny oyster person, so I'm not a fan of the big ones they get here. Don't eat the roll. Save room for your pan roast or gumbo. Another fave is the linguini with clams. Pure and not disguised by cream.

CUCUxNT3OWCa-krsHy5y5g.text: I've never been to Vegas before. I expected a range of great food options with high price tags. I was surprised to find the Oyster Bar at the Palace. The hotel/casino is off the strip and is run down in that old Vegas way. We didn't know what to expect of the restaurant (in face we expected a restaurant) however Oyster Bar is actually a bar in the middle of the casino floor. It's open 24 hours a day. We waited for a little bit (made longer by the people in front of us having a party of 5) then were seated at the bar. There are only approximately 20-25 stools but they turn over fast.   We ordered a dozen raw oysters and a combo pan roast. I'll admit, eating raw shellfish in the middle of a smoky casino may have had me fantasizing about my head firmly lodged in the toilet later in the evening but I decided to live large. At the very least, food poisoning will help my bikini body for later.  However, nothing could have been further from the truth! The oysters were epic in size and freshness. The pan roast seafood we cooked in pots right in front of us. The smell alone had me salivating like a Pavlovian experiment! All in all: AWESOME. And the price? We spent $47 for both of us!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A pan roast in progress.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A dozen raw oysters!

YdIxsz1neTu5kdOxbVF_fw.text: Worth the wait!  The hubby and I stood in line for almost 2 hours on a busy Friday night to try this Oyster Bar out. As a long time fan of oysters, we were not disappointed. We started off with 2 dozen and moved on from there. I couldn't believe how fresh they were. They were on the tiny size as well, which we love. I hate chewing on a huge oyster forever. These were simply perfection. They came with all the fixings as well. Siracha, horseradish, lemon, cocktail sauce, and lime.  We also tried the gumbo. We ordered the Seafood Gumbo and loved it so much we ordered 2 to take home to have "second dinner" I mean, seafood isnt fattening right? RIGHT!? This place is phenom. The staff was extremely polite and made it very fun to dine here. The small bar fits about 15 people. The only problem I had with the Oyster Bar was they need to expand and put one in Summerlin! This place is a must try.

fMCShXd61srMLdnW6totXQ.text: Yes you may have to wait during the rush, but it is well worth the wait.  I've never had a bad meal here. Hubby and I like to come during the off hours, (2am) because there usually is no line.  The pan roasts are excellent and the service is great. It's fun watching 2-3 people create yummy seafood greatness in such a small area. It is like watching a well choreographed dance at times.  The late night oyster specials are a good deal too!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp etouffe
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Late night Oyster special

WuhBUvLL-DeEm95ukFypdw.text: Absolutely flavorful!!!!!  This place serves one of the best combo pan roast I've ever tried!  There is a lot to say about steam cooking their dishes that retains the natural texture and taste of the ingredients.

ypcLyKvURjPwiLn7NELMpQ.text: How did I just find out about this place???   OMG it is so good and such a hidden gem. We went on a Sunday afternoon around 1. The oyster bar only has about 16 seats so like all the other reviews point out, expect to wait. We had a party of 7 and we told them we were okay if we had to split up but we got lucky and after only an hour and a half we got seated all together!  Most of us ordered the combo pan roast which was filled with seafood. They definitely don't skimp on the good stuff! It's all made to order and not just one pot that they scoop out of a pan which is the reason for the wait but totally worth it!   I also tried the gumbo which was just okay. I'd stick to the pan roast and might try the chowder next time too.   The raw clams were sooo tasty too!   Portions are huge and prices are a little steep but you have to remember what you're getting, SEAFOOD! It's unfortunate that I could only eat half and had to waste the rest. But I will definitely be back with more friends and family.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XICY9ajF483YK4XlbyvPQw.text: This place has amazing seafood particularly fresh raw oysters and clam chowder. We felt the pan roast version was absolutely delicious. I also really loved the clam chowder. However, the wait can be unbearable since it's a tiny restaurant. Happy hour is available 1:00 am to 9:00 am.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o8lOma1QGN66BqJkaCgqUg.text: This place is totally worth the wait! But if you're not into waiting, come in the morning from 7-10 AM. The wait is pretty darn short. It is really fun watching the chef do his thing with the kettle pots. It is strictly 21+ (it's literally a bar) so don't even think about bringing your kids or younger siblings here.   Oysters are super fresh and delicious. The chef shucks them right in front of you. Pan roast is AMAZING. I've had the combo and palace pan roast. I prefer the palace pan roast because you get both seafood and chicken/sausage! I always say that I will share one because it is a huge serving, but end up being a fatty and ordering one for myself, which then turns into awesome leftovers. If you're thinking of coming here for the first time, it's definitely worth trying!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. best oysters ever

fRJgmYBVFIycTlW85I43aQ.text: Went there Tuesday around 1pm.  Only 4ppl in front of our group of 5.   About 20 min to seat.  Oysters are the best (10/10) !!   Bouillabaisse is a bit salty and you definitely need rice or bread to compensate (8/10).   Will definitely go back for the oysters.

u0Vd4qaQnGQEEUjPe4GrnQ.text: This has been our go to place every time we've been to Vegas for the last 6 years.  We have to have the pan roast. I always recommend it to new people in line waiting to try this oyster bar. I love eating it with the shrimp, lobster & extra crab. This is so flavorful & creamy. Just watch out when you pick your spice level. A level 7 had us sweating like crazy. I prefer a level 3-4 that had just a hint of heat to it. My daughter recently had the bouillabaisse and loved it. It has great flavor if you don't mind taking the seafood out of the shell when you eat. I've also had the Alaskan clam chowder that was also good. I still prefer the pan roast.  Gotta love that they are open 24/7. The only downside is that there aren't very many seats so there's always a line to wait in. At least if you go in a group, you can alternate who has to stand in line. It's definitely worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast

sVsrz6XzOMOkgPgnKfT7-A.text: KNOWN FOR THEIR WAIT LIST!  Experienced this little TREASURE in the wall for the first time!! Been hearing about the crazy goodness for a couple of years & now I finally had the time to get here. Luckily I did not have to wait in line because my friends from out of town who insisted on eating this place did the waiting for me. Ahahhaa  They waiting for about an hour & half since we were eating at an awkward time between lunch & dinner on a weekday.  We ordered a DOZEN OYSTERS... SEAFOOD PAN ROAST... ALASKAN CLAM CHOWDER... DIABLO SHRIMP PASTA... JAMBALAYA... & bouillabaise! Reminder that all of these items could be given a spice level and i chose 7 which honestly wasn't that spicy for me.   The OYSTER came with some cocktail sauce & the most delicious HORSERADISH I have i ever tasted. It really had a fresh kick to it as if it was ground right infront of us. The CLAM CHOWDER was another amazement that had lots if clam in every single bite which reminded me of the chowder bowls from the fisherman's warf  in san Francisco.  The server/bartender was quick & she was even nice enough to help the chef makes some oyster shooters once she was done taking care of all the guest. Our chef was extremely funny & interactive with the us. And honestly better than most entertainment places that I have experienced while being served. (Forgot his name but I think he was phillipino or Hawaiian)  All in all i would wait the line again... portions are big for the price & the entertainment of just being able to watch ur food being created front row seat is just AWESOME!! Plus they have Pepsi products ahahha love my mountain dew

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Diablo shrimp pasta
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jambalaya

d8h4SF_bUR7oKtGoQ2HHYA.text: Im in between 3/4 stars. Let me explain why.   The wait is kind of ridiculous....BC, the bar seats like less than 20 ppl, AND everything is made or order so it takes timeeeeeeeeeee!   When we got there Monday AM at 10:20am, there were exactly 6 ppl infront of us, with 7 open seats at the bar (Im just a party of 2). The 7 open seats needed to be cleaned. Im thinking....we're the 7th ppl in line, we should be seated fairly quickly, right?!!  They surely cleaned the table, like 5min each for the seat, NO JOKE! I was timing. Someone didnt feel like working monday morning.... I get it. =( So, we waited over 30min to get seated. Im still HAPPY bc i hear the wait is like 1 to 2hrs long. We get seated around 11am and the lady is going around taking orders. She was so friendly and chatty with her customers, but hello?!!! can you please take our order and then resume with the morning news?!  Still waiting...to...order. Finally, after her local news, she takes our order. YAY! ........................................................................................ 1 dozens of Oysters and Pan Roast, please.  Oysters were really fatty and yea, i like them smaller. These oysters were big-if you like big ones, these are your winning plate.  Pan Roast...so, we ordered and it takes abount 20min for the food to cook. It looked amazing when they are making my bowl....but its not for me. Its for other 5 ppl who ordered it, with different spice level.   We got level 8. Its not that spicy. The pan roast was DELICIOUS; however, i can't eat more than 1/3 because its so rich and buttery and creamy and fatty. I'm lactose-intolerant and I was prepared for this pain and suffering. As soon as i ate 1/3 of it, i died.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VdM-duB_PxOvqA4FkPGyNQ.text: Oysters and Pan Roast.... "A Seafood Peanut Butter and Jelly...." The food is worth the long line...TRUST ME.... Located at Palace Hotel...an ehhh Hotel..., it's amazing how this oyster bar is the talk of the sin city. The oysters are huge and worth every dime.  The main star however is the Pan Roast.  Order to Made, you can see exactly the ingredients the chef put in each other.  The secret base, well that is the main star since it has so much flavor, it marries well with the other ingredients.  An explosion of flavors in your mouth, and beware.... Indicate your spice level before even ordering from this place.  The level of spicy depends on each individuals.  Food: 5 Service: 5 Ambiance: 4 Price: 5  Overall: 4.75

1W9fn-G0qvvacOoNtVmc0A.text: Had oysters and palace pan roast.  They are excellent.  The only bad part is the waiting, but it was worth it.

eFdOcGUz2Kwn6-kVATU-gw.text: Love this place! Never disappointed. Great food and service. Wish they expanded their seating, so I wouldn't have to stand in line and watch others eat. But then again the food is worth the wait. Can't wait to visit them again.

kI__rSO4s2_MzkLdNjRChw.text: A holy cacophony of flavors bursts with every spoon full.  I'm not big on their New England clam chowder but the etouffee, pan roast, and bouillabaisse gets 5 stars.  Wait sux but worth the experience.  Make sure you order extra to go. :-) The place needs a bigger seating/serving area.

AXjHSnp7_2SOhzAqaXLuCw.text: The best pan roast in Vegas. Make sure to go during during the week when Bob is the chef. He does an excellent job preparing your meal!l

UdUWMUq0BXY04NaYJtf90w.text: So we didnt have to wait too long which was cool...maybe 15 minutes.   The chef, Holloman, was workin HARD, never saw him stop moving! It was intersting that the food was made right in front of us  We got no drink refill, (had to ask twice for my drink in the first place) from the waitress/cashier... the chef actually got us some refills! The chef was really the only reason they get 2 stars intead of 1.  Service is super important in Vegas... I guess they are so popular and have such limited seating... that philosophy goes out the window  Note to those with kids (or to over 18 kids) ..not allowed...it's a BAR..gotta be over 21 to be seated  Combo pan roat was tasty. Crab cakes were just ok. Ceasar salad overpriced and no cheese (at least on mine but I thought I saw another patron with cheese on their salad, again a bad service thing)  Then we waited for the check for over 20 minutes.... that really sucked...not being able to wait anymore, i estimated what the bill would be, added 10% (chef and waitress/cashier share tips) and left

Fy8b8Hw2HYZnAnjnd5qs0w.text: The Best kept secret for great food... and there are still lines! but oh so worth it.  Sometimes you luck out and no line, but don't count on it.   The gumbo is as good if not better than my mom.  (don't tell her).  What can I say.  The food is awesome.

Hd5eDHo-x6xF2rkOjd64sQ.text: Located in the Palace Station just off the Las Vegas Strip. They serve Gumbo, and Jambalaya made to order.  It is literally smack in the middle of the casino. You order you dish on a heat scale of 1 to 10. I asked the guy behind the bar who was going to prepare mine what level he usually got, he replied, 25. I had an 8 and that was right on the edge for me. I will have to build up to the 25 (we all have to have some aspiration in life). A must try. Live it up, you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

66m26CfFnN0wrd6P9dy38w.text: This place is amazing from the food to the service.   We waited in line for two hours and I would do it again.  The long line is due to the limited amount of seats at the bar which only seats 18.  The limited capacity allows for friendly banter with the chef and the rest of the crew much like you would have with a bartender at a bar.  Our waitress was super friendly we even scored a sample of the clam chowder .   It was pretty cool being able to see your meal cooked in front of you.  I ordered the combination pan roast which contains shrimp, lobster and crab.  You can adjust your spice level (1-10) I went with 6 and my friends who ordered 7 and 8 seemed to think that 6 would have been a good level.  We also got the shrimp scampi which was also very good.  Overall I had a great experience with my delicious meal and fun staff.  Hopefully I can return to this place another time at some odd hour when the demand isn't as high.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi, combination pan roast and bar

22tDchZO16CrlSo_jALNfQ.text: I've been here one other time. There's no doubt-this place offers a delicious pan roast. But I'm knocking off a few stars based on service. Honestly, it's clear there's a high demand for food, and though it's open 24/7, they haven't figured out a way to speed up the service. One chef for 18 guests just isn't enough. Hire more workers for a quicker turnaround. Ive been waiting since 3am and it's been over 2 hours. Huge resentment and so frustrated I'm not sure I can enjoy my food at this point.

c4hwS0lVa4l1UhenXbI6hw.text: First stop when I come to Vegas! Bouillabaisse is incredible! And they'll make it as spicy as you want! The best!

QcTuRtEcMfOzmRq1JtQoeQ.text: Delicious if you can stand a ghetto casino.  Pros:  -Pan roast is amazing. This is a MUST get. -Pan roast is cooked in front of you in a pressure cooker -If you choose the large beer option, you get it in a humongous souvenir cup. Cheesy, but I dig it.  Cons:  -LONG wait if you come during prime times: lunch, dinner, post club. -Cigarette smoke from casino is prevalent, it is an open bar -Because of the cream in the pan roast, can be too rich after a while -Oysters were fresh but not tasty. Gritty.  Verdict:  -Get the pan roast only. It's also safe for work lunch, my boss loves this place.

kst-gt7JqDUdtZ7iE9mM_A.text: We came here after a fulfilling Vegas trip with 10 people. hahahah we were thinking it was going to be a restaurant. Nope! it was a literal bar. My girlfriend and I really wanted oysters so we waited. The rest of our friends went to eat pho. Man did they miss out.  We waited about 15 min and were seated. We saw soups being made and cooked right in front of us. They looked tasty. When we are asked how spicy we wanted our soup from a 1 to 10 my girlfriend said 8! The chef then said, " Are you suurrre!". I'm glad he stopped us. We ended up getting a 6 and it was still nice and spicy.  Of course we got our oysters which were very fresh and clean. It is kind of pricey but you have to take into account they are in the middle of the desert selling seafood. lol This was a cool hidden place and a must try if you are a foodie in Vegas.

6h5XDe_q1yGXGf7f3plazA.text: Everything they say is True. Amazing and worth the wait. We had the pan roast. Made the mistake of sharing it with my husband. We will be back ordering one each next time. The steamed muscles were fresh and tasty in a butter/wine/garlic broth. Thinking of driving out to Vegas from San Diego just for that.

07gvwJHvAONYRHF_1Ne8bA.text: Great cure for the hangover, any of the gumbos, roast, soups, etc. Worth the wait. Can also order to go.

jh1j3HcQlRkIs_T6XIhzUw.text: It was very fresh, very tasty. But not sure that the 2 hr wait is worth.  I've been to better oyster restaurants with less wait.

CN8Wi5hUcd7SWbfilQ8tPg.text: Came here for lunch. We were first of the line. This is our 2nd time here. Once we were seated. Our waitress that took our order rushed us.  We barely sat down and she has already ask us if we were ready to order. We ordered dozen oysters and dozen clams and the combo pan roast. While waiting for out appetizers. We can hear the waitress making faces about how busy she was. Not even a smile. She looked like she hated it there. Anyway on to our food. Our oysters were bland. Nothing special. No taste. Our clams were ok. Again. Nothing special. Our pan roast was Delish! Except our rice wasn't finished cooking. It was really hard.  Prices were average. But next time I will avoid getting the oysters and clams.

u1VblR1bBrp2UdeQ7oEQ6Q.text: This "hidden gem" isn't as hidden as it used to be.  The only time I consider going to Oyster Bar is for a really late lunch..maybe 3pm or so, and even at that time there will usually be a wait.  The experience is quite fun, the chefs and waitresses are cool have different mojo.  The food is pretty gargantuan.  I usually order my own bowl, but honestly, half a portion would be the perfect size for all the major items.  Maybe next time I'll share, but at 3pm for lunch, I'm usually starving and think I can eat the whole thing.  I've had the gumbo, etouffee and pan roasts and all have been good.  My companions have had the fra diablo & bouillabaisse and gave thumbs up.  Haven't actually tried the oysters yet, but they're pretty popular too.

HuQB-OlVRrz8XZqYW5XZew.text: Seafood is very fresh and the customer service is spot on. The wait was a bit long, 1.5 hours. Reasonably priced. I definitely would be back, if the wait time was shorter.

xXFvtb3BBvw9XOQ2EuUDCg.text: This place is a real gem.  It's way out there and a small trek off the strip inside Palace Station.  Who would think there's an amazing restaurant inside there?  I'm glad my friend brought us out here to try it for late night food.  It's a really small joint...maybe 10-15 seats total.  We came at 3am on a Friday night and waited about 45 minutes to sit down, and then another hour or so for our combo pan roast.  It was delicious.  Really filling/rich though because of all the BUTTER.  We also tried the oysters which were really huge.  I want to come back and try everything else, but I fear the line now.

8SyCKkiNiUUkoXdUglDQrw.text: The line is worth it for the food. I'd give it 5 stars but the looooooooong line killed it.

iXvKchlCHy27R8oambcwAg.text: We needed hang over food after a long NYE. Lucky for us, most people were still hung over in bed, because we arrived at 11:00 am on New Years Day and we were seated immediately-score!  The server and chef were funny and friendly. Loved that the food is made hot and fresh right before your eyes. We were given dinner rolls to munch on, but I was told to save it to dip in my food. We ordered the Palace Pan Roast and Gumbo. My favorite of the two was the pan roast; it was packed with shrimp, chicken, andouille sausage, and crab. The gumbo was good, but not as good as my mama's:)   This place definitely hit the spot. I'll definitely return to try the etouffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gumbo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Palace Pan Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fVykVSCrFFUlqHUhRvXUag.text: We waited over an hour to eat. There were only 6 people ahead of us.  We ordered the combo pan roast, clam chowder and a half dozen oysters.  The pan roast was amazing! Really delicious and flavorful. But the portion is huge! So my boyfriend and I ended up sharing one and we still had left overs.  The oysters we ordered were the worst oysters I've had. They were big and juicy looking. But When I bit into them it had no taste. Normally oysters will have a burst of ocean flavor.  But these oysters literally tasted like they had been frozen or had lost all their flavor.  Don't let the looks deceive you.   All in all, the experience was ok. The pan roast is a def try. But everything else was mediocre.  Also! The chef is a beast. He single handedly cooks all the pan roasts. He works nonstop and super hard!  Good work!!

2B21SrlmT5WIrujE0zUrag.text: Before taking us to Oyster Bar, my friend warned us that there's usually a long line for Oyster Bar. And boy, was there a line! We got there around 3pm (totally not peak hour) and still had to wait an hour. There's only a long wait because the restaurant is bar-like and only has around 17-20 seats. Not only that, the chefs cook your pan roast right in front of you!  We ordered a dozen oysters ($19) and they weren't anything special. I actually prefer oysters elsewhere. The pan roast ($22) comes out in a HUGE bowl. You can definitely share with a friend, but they charge you ~$5 if share. You can order your rice on the side if you don't want it all mixed together. The pan roast is thick, flavorful, and filled with lots of seafood!  I wish we had a seafood place like this in the Bay Area - I love seafood and I love the concept!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef cooking
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters

bVq0yo0-gH2m5_1fG0v0EA.text: We waited 3 hours for this place. To be honest with you, if I knew the wait would be that long, I probably wouldn't have done it. But IT WAS WORTH IT!!!  The bar only have about 20 seats, and the lady who worked there told us it's about 3 hour wait no matter when you go... They cook every single dishes individually and everything was full of seafood!! I have never seen that many seafood in one bowl of clam chowder, its nuts... The pan roast was really good as well. Their serving was pretty large, even for an average man.  If you have never been to this place, you should! I recommend going there with a friend or two so people can take turns waiting in the line... Or you might pass out before it's your turn lol

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The tiny oyster bar, be aware of the LONG LINE!!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The long line... We have been here for 2.5 hours and there are still about 10 people before us!!!

OxQhTkMjHdhxpPh8hbj3Dw.text: There's always a line for this place but it's worth the wait.  The Alaskan Chowder is my favorite.  We also ordered the Cioppino and the Combination Pan Roast which did not disappoint.   There's only one chef cooking for the whole bar which seats approximately 18-20 people at a time.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan Chowder!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cioppino

wz4FvajCLR_IKFH_O7iydg.text: We had the lobster pan roast here and it was dead on best hang over food after a long night of partying

r_FGrTYdULMbLhDjDhxuMQ.text: It was my 1st time trying raw oysters and it was amazing at this place since I tried others after eating here. The experience itself was awesome and they have very good service.

qDftP9xjcykFXwxKz_oPmQ.text: I was very irritated with the wait, but when I saw the process of how everything goes here I understood it. The food is definitely on point and worth the wait! Customer service is better here then any 5start "high class" restaurant you can think of. I highly recommend eating here and enduring the wait!

KZBtPBJamg50zQRGWGX50g.text: My bf took me here and we waited almost 2 hours. He insisted that we wait for Chef Bob. We ordered the seafood jambalaya and house gumbo. There's plenty of seafood used in these dishes and the portions are huge which makes the price worth it. So much flavor although i'm not to familiar with either dish. It also comes with a ciabatta like bread that is perfect for soaking up all that leftover sauce. I don't know the difference between chef Bob or the others but I do know this place lives up to the hype

jM2urn-6QImrMEUEkRxfpA.text: Just and incredible place. It is very small but the food is ridiculous !!!!!!  Oysters are great  Gumbo is great  Pan roast is really what I love here.  They have great wine specials some times I would definitely recommend this place to the whole world

ipOQoFCq4tZbHsSVtBVxhw.text: What to say about a place with 2000+ reviews??  First off...I've been 5 times in the last 6 months (I might have a Vegas problem..). I've only eaten here 3 times during those 5 visits. Yes, the lines are long, hence why I've only got a 60% completion rate. But 60% of the time, it's amazing, every time. So, so amazing.  So let's skip to the food...the combo pan roast is worthy of the praise. Seafood bisque with a serious attitude. Huge bowl of goodness. I like the spicy level 7 or 8 and it can get warm but nothing too horrible. Adjust accordingly. Have also enjoyed the oysters...huge and delish.  Truly amazing production team behind the counter. Basically 2 folks. Maybe 3. That's bussing tables, getting drinks. Getting apps. Then one guy cooking for 20 with a few stations all going full boil at all times. How they keep track of everything and keep it straight is beyond me. Never a down moment of time.  Only thing I'd change (which some have mentioned) is the line system. I have no problem waiting for a seat. So that you don't get duped into waiting longer than expected, all parties should be in line. However that's not my call and my only suggestion to make this hallmark even better. Go try this and be patient. It's amazing.

kI9MClMl_kF-JRxEBCBWjw.text: Thank you fellow yelpers. Because of all your reviews and high ratings I was able to find this "DIAMOND in the rough " located inside PALACE STATION Casino.   SET UP:  20 seats at the bar. Not good for big parties.  1 chef and 2 waiters.  They are all very friendly, attentive and work FAST.    TID BITS:  -open 24 hours -must be 21 y/o -we waited about 40 minutes @ 5pm.  Wait time varies (obviously). Heard their slow time (if any) was about 3-4pm.   -you can SAMPLE TAP beer before ordering.   ***************THE FOOD GIST*********************  OYSTERS on the half shell: Oysters in the middle of the desert?  How fresh can these babies be?  Well, I can say from my experience they are fresh and BIG.  We saw the waiter cracking these suckers open right in front of us (wearing gloves of course).  He throws out the questionable ones, which was reassuring. AND he threw in a freebie for us.  Very nice.  With cocktail sauce, some lemon and a hint of tabasco.....BAM, you've got yourself a winner!  COMBO PAN ROAST:  $21.99 w/ a $5 split fee ( I think this is waived if you get other dishes...cuz we didn't get charged).   Large portion size; enough to share for 2.  ---HOLY MACARONI. This is one the best dishes have EVER had to date. Tomato cream based creole dish (spice level 5) with lobster, shrimp and crab floating around. Seafood is fresh!!  We got PASTA in the bowl and steamed rice on the side, both went perfectly with the dish.  PLUS, if you want more fun - you can dunk in some bread into the  broth. So, delicious.  ***Spice level 5 is equivalent to medium at Boiling Crab (for us).  It had just the right KICK for us.  Runny nose and all.   FRIED CALAMARI: all variations of the calamari: tentacles & rings.  Good batter w/ a nice crisp.  The marinara sauce was hearty and complemented very well.   *BUMMER Alert:  portion size for pan roast is good for 2 people. It would be nice if they offered a smaller portion, so we can try other dishes (since everything is VERY good).   My new GO TO place in VEGAS.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I_6ymdicLyNcyhGUoF75tQ.text: Cream of the crop. Have to stop by this place every time we visit Las Vegas regardless the lines.

pInILGkA4xyERSQRA5dKLg.text: Oyster Bar is located not too far off strip in the Palace Station Hotel. Let me tell you when they say bar they really mean BAR. There is about 18 counter seats at this tiny tiny tiny "restaurant." (Is is still considered a restaurant if it's literally served on a bar counter??) The nice thing about this setting is that you get to see the chef cook everything in front of you and interact with them as they prepare your meal.   But heed my warning boys and girls, if you have any plans within 4 hours DO NOT EAT HERE. The line is deceptively long.. I came on a Sunday at 6pm (really our mistake for not reading the reviews thoroughly) but we waited in line for nearly 3 hours. And don't get me wrong, this girl is willing to wait 3 hours for delicious food, only this place was ALL HYPE! THE HYPE WAS NOT REAL AT ALL GUYS!   Let me break down our order...  1. Cold Seafood Combo- The best thing in this seafood combo was the shrimp cocktail. The shrimp were huge! The fresh clams were okay, quite difficult to eat but still tasty. But then it came time for the oysters... I can say I am a girl who loves her oysters so I was quite excited to try these oysters and considering this place is called Oyster Bar one would think they served some bomb ass oysters.. but no. These oysters were DISGUSTING. This dish came with 3 oysters and my friend and I could not stomach to finish the last one. They tasted like nothing, but had this really nasty texture to it. UGH I don't even want to think about it.  2. Linguine and clams- This is one of my favorite pasta dishes that is fairly hard to go wrong in my opinion. However, this linguine and clams was over seasoned with basil so the entire dish just tasted like basil.  3. Combo Pan Roast- Despite all the other dishes, I was mainly going to judge this place on the pan roast. It was the most popular item on the menu so I was excited to try it. I would say this might've been the best thing out of everything we ordered but it was still just okay in my opinion. I had a bite of the lobster and it didn't even soak up any of the stew, it just tasted like water..   All in all I would not go back to Oyster Bar because I was quite disappointed. It was a ridiculous wait for mediocre food. Perhaps I went on a bad day. But with 4.5 stars, I don't think a bad day would be this bad..

qJCcaGtj-HXJv3c7fqEPhQ.text: First, be prepared to wait on a long line or plan to go at an off-peak time.  It's open 24-7 so that not too difficult.    If you like thick bisque-like soup, order the combination seafood pan roast, which comes with a big scoop of rice.  It's the best thing on the menu. You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef EZ preparing our seafood pan roasts.

MrK9Cnfh7pKoMEIaHpXd3A.text: Sign says incomplete parties will not be seated. I've been in line and three incomplete parties have been seated. Including this guy...

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gc-CtY0Kcw8zZirUJxT1BQ.text: This place definitely lives up to the hype and is WELL WORTH the wait! Lines at night are usually a 1-2 hour wait, but if you go at around 9-10 there's no line.   Pan roast: SOOOO GOOD! Not too creamy and rich like other places which is good. They're not skimpy on toppings either and everything is so big! (Shrimp and crawfish). I prefer getting it with linguini instead of rice because I feel the rice makes it too porridge-y. The spice level is from 1-10 and if you're into spicy, I suggest getting an 8 because I almost cried eating it, but it was still really good.   Oysters: so darn fresh and JUICY!!! You see the chef cut them fresh open right in front of your eyes. Half a dozen for $10! Best oysters I've ever had.  Oyster bar is a definite must when visiting Vegas. Although the wait might be long, I promise you it's well worth. After eating this, places like Ritters doesn't compare!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super fresh oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination pan roast

WEgA7KLs_7ajgIbt8UYp8g.text: A Vegas legend, I didn't enjoy the 1.5 hour wait or the food. The pan toast looked very heavy so I tried the fish stew. Nicely spiced but the fish was meh. Didn't finish it because of an off taste

F05megy4unoizzNlcp-FBg.text: One of the best I have tried!  I usually order the Gumbo, Etouffee and Manhattan Clam Chowder but everything is good there. The line speaks for itself! Good thing that its open 24-7 but expect to wait at least an hr or more during prime time. We usually go around 10am for lunch and 4pm for dinner to cut wait time. Depend if you would see this as a good thing or not, everyone can alternate waiting in line while the rest donates money to the machines and when your done eating and don't want to wait for the slow eater, go donate some more.  Service: Is wonderful 4/5 times which is understandable as these guys work their butts off. Regardless, they always try to put on a smile and still have a sense of humor with good spirit.   Atmosphere: Since its a bar setting (well, obviously)  you know what your eating and how clean it is because they cook everything right in front of you.

WzZuIuFE1sCHWGX4zt3fDw.text: Once our taxi driver knew where we were headed, he said "I'm jealous." That's how high my expectations were for this place. And Oyster Bar met and exceeded every one of them! All of the reviews about this place are True! My friend hates to wait for food but as soon as he started eating he forgot about how long we had to wait (an hour and a half) and happily ate his food. I got the combo pan roast and I shared the Alaskan chowder (New England style) with my 3 friends. We didn't even have big eyes because best believe we finished every last drop. Even though my stomach was bursting I could not, in good conscience, leave any of that delicious food left for the trash.   I can't wait to go back!

gG1QwGEnXBCQ_9zgXuGkrA.text: Be prepared for the best seafood pan roast you will have! Located in off strip palace station, this is a place I come every time I am in Vegas! The line up can gets long if you come on weekends or rush hour since they only have bar seatings.   They cook the pan roast in front of your eyes, serviced with rice and bread. The portion of their seafood is huge for the price you pay. I tried remaking this but failed a few times!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PQSYojeSffW2Tq84YoaLrA.text: This continues to be the place to go for pan roast seafood in Las Vegas.  I like it spicy, so opted for a "10" spice level and it was outstanding.  The servers are prompt and moving people along.  If you don't want a long wait, come at off hours (9 AM maybe), otherwise expect  an hour or more.  They dropped Bud Light on tap, which disappointed my brother, but he'll live.  Excellent spot to visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outstanding oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast

XUy-59ywmtwLr8Ho4g2QRA.text: I can't imagine that I'd contribute anything new considering The Oyster Bar has 2321 reviews and 4878 photos under its belt, so I will go ahead and keep this straightforward as possible!  The wait times can be extremely brutal, especially if you've been drinking and partying all night, expect a wait time of anywhere from 1-2 hours, maybe more. Believe me when I say it's worth it. I don't play the waiting game anymore, but the fact that I'd fight off my drunken fatigue and drowsiness just to get a bowl of pan roast from Oyster Bar speaks volumes. My girlfriend and I have had it a handful of times now, which is why we don't wait anymore. Still, it pains me to leave Vegas when I don't stop by here.  However, during our most recent trip there wasn't a wait for once! Before this trip, I hadn't had Oyster Bar in probably 2 years. I'll have you know that the food hasn't changed one bit. The taste, quality, freshness, and portions have stayed consistent throughout the years.  My go to is their Palace Pan Roast and add lobster for $8. Sure, it sounds a little pricey, but they give you a good amount of lobster for $8 so it's absolutely worth it.  My girlfriend likes to get the Alaskan Chowder with a side of rice. It's absolutely amazing. Get half New England and half Manhattan. It's the best of both worlds.  I know, I know. I said I would try to keep this review as straightforward as possible, but when the food is this amazing, it's really hard not to get into details. I also said I wouldn't wait anymore, but after our most recent trip, it reminded me of how good it was. I also have yet to explore their other dishes, so I just might tough it out next time to get my fix when I'm back.

rzKgWB0NcCYWnbrbPYD85Q.text: Pan roast comboooohhhhhhhhh!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Open 24 hours!!!!  Steve and the crew take such good care of hungry guests. The bloody Mary is brilliant with a large shrimp dangling off the spicy salted edge like a Cirque preformer. They will ask you how spicy you want your dish from 1-10, I go with a 5-7 depending what I get (pan roast combo always) What's not to love about shrimp, crab, and lobster. I only wish they had scallops too. $1 oysters from 5am to 10am. They serve you Fresh hot sour dough rolls, complete with bowls of butter from the moment you are seated. The cooking show is beautifully done while watching chef juggling 10 jackpots of boiling seafood times to perfection. He pulls a slot machine handle down as the creamy concoction drains into a giant bowl and tops it with a nutty steaming scoop of hot rice. Each chef makes it differently and Eze is my favorite because he sings while cheffing. Ask for the lava sauce for a super hot addition to your bowl of hot LOVE!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast combohhhhhhh

ea8HAtSxFYBJI9bm_ux1pw.text: I Love This Bar Highly recommended inside of Palace Station Hotel and Casino the chef that prepares it at night is more of an Italian guy I want to say his name is James but I'm not too sure I forgot but he is hilarious and I will be back to bring a lot more people there with me

FYvLQrRL_TEc5H54-mstrQ.text: For the life of me this place could be so much better with one more employee behind the bar. The reason this place is so inefficient has to be on purpose. They have the cook and server doing everything no wonder it takes 3 hours to get seated . Shame on manager . Which I never saw

eqk66Vm2BrHSq2P-fBiqXw.text: I would go eat here at least once a week but the line is too long to wait for sitting. For the seafood rating, no better place in Las Vegas.

QhZXBcqItBtEh75isIYW0g.text: Walk in with my wife and son. And we did not know it was counter seats only and you have to be 21. The guy who work there yell at us saying you can't come here cause he isn't 21. Very rude and I did not understand why there wasn't seating. I'm new to this restaurant and casino. He could of handle it better. It's ok I will take my business else where.

xERYBNVddB35fGsI56UbPQ.text: Yo! I love gumbo and I'm not a fan of everyones, but especially from a restaurant my expectations were looooowwww and I was clowned lol. The gumbo is made in front of you in a bar like seating area so you get to watch the chef do his magic while also reading some cool facts on the origination of creole and cajun food. The gumbo is served over rice and a side of bread, the rue is thicker and it's so flavorful. The staff are really hospitable and entertaining the food and service make it worth every penny (about 2,500 pennies).

29PoN4YxL_PiOgzDd9Pp3A.text: The name says it all. It's a must.  Oysters, Combo Pan Roast, anything and everything you will not be disappointed. Fresh always and exquisite taste, the Oyster Bar at The Palace Station is the place to eat seafood. The Staff is simply amazing. Too long of a line? WAIT!! It's worth it...

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sensational
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Never can go wrong with these bad boys
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thursday night and no line.

KakkmIWAMDICE7T3KGOH7g.text: Four stars cause the wait is a killer. Got here at 3 AM and waited until 4 before we got seated.   Ordered the oysters which are half a dozen for $10! The girl shucking them did an OK job, maybe she had an off night.   We got the combo pan roast (of course) and my sister got the clam chowder. I thought it was delicious and prefer this location over their other one !   Way better than kettlebar and other places. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nT6PbRFq4N9y0djXlsiSnA.text: WHAT. WHAT. Cannot even stand how good this place was and a total, super surprise. It's off the strip in the plaza casino, I was not expecting fresh oysters and amazing seafood dishes. Awesome service too, very quick turnaround times. Only about 20 bar seats so you'll wait in a long long line, but so worth it.

7xc0BoaYRaFu7XXP9GrAEA.text: Finally got to try this place after hearing about it for at least a year. I see why it's popular!  I got the gumbo with all the seafood level 3 spice and it was amazing! Will definitely return ! Portion is nice is big. Wasn't that big a fan of the bread, but customer service, food and quality was all worth it.

Dwk74xOQWtb7430U9Dzrtg.text: This is probably my favorite spot in Las Vegas. It's a must-stop. I can't leave Vegas without stopping by here. The lines can be long and the wait time can take maybe an hour but it so worth the wait. I usually tell my fiance to go gamble and I will call him when I'm seated. The trick to killing time.  Seriously the food is amazing and fresh. I always get the combination pan roast and I highly recommend it. The pan roast is so mouthwatering just thinking about the spices and the creaminess of the dish. It's just perfect. Makes me crave it more and more. I also get the oyster shooters and it's a good starter. Also the Alaskan clam chowder is amazingly fresh and super delicious. Probably the best I've had so far.  Can't wait to go back to Vegas just to come back here. Highly highly recommend this place if you are ever in town. Trust me!! You will not be disappointed. Don't let the long lines scare you away because it is definitely worth the wait. So stop reading the reviews and try it out for yourself. I absolutely know you will love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan chowder dirty style
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tequila oyster shooters

q0YFE7HSjCeIV_2yb9ujAA.text: Waited 35 minutes,  Bob the chef was great.  Fast and efficient,  and considered my seafood allergies.   Had the oysters, combo pan roast, and a mix of Boston and Manhattan  chowder, delish.   The seafood combo came a little short of seafood,  but everything else good.  Get there early, cause ur gonna have a wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boston/Manhattan soup mix
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast

BBV7gmDEfi5QYD8vetC8bQ.text: MUST TRY!! whenever I'm in Vegas I always make it a point to come here! Which is saying a lot because it's off the strip inside palace station. Once I even stayed in palace station just to be close to the oyster bar (sad I know) but it's so GOOD. Bloody Mary's and oysters on the half shell but even if you don't like either of those the Alaskan chowder and the palace pan roast are always my go tos. Every time spot on! Trust me you gotta try this place.  There is only one down fall... there is very limited seating so the wait can get VERY long but hang in there it's worth the wait!   Pro tip. Have one person wait while the other gets drinks/gambles and switch

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mb_r2ts3OAKwD3k9YVVwfw.text: Expect to be waiting at least 1.5-3 hours to eat here. This would probably be my only complaint, especially when you have to stand in line the entire time. My boyfriend and I got there before 2pm and we would take turns to go gamble because we had to wait over 2.5 hours before we got seated.  The food however was delicious. We ordered the muscles, half dozen oysters, oyster shots, and the combo pan roast. Everything was very delicious, though the oyster shots were a little hard to swallow.  I would come back to eat this delicious food but I wish they would open up a bigger location with how many people wait to eat this food.

PREWUR5tS6E1PD7hN56yfg.text: I don't want to give this place a good review because I don't want to share this gem with anyone else. It is an 18 seat bar and we waited for 1 hour and 45 minutes at 2:30 in the afternoon on a Sunday. It was so worth it. IT'S AMAZING! We had the combination pan roast. It's heavenly. The seafood is so tender and the sauce is so rich. I can't wait to go back!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just some of the amazing offerings

kZwnUgNcsdEDivDmtyByLg.text: Love their pan roast! I've tried other dishes but pan roast is the best (there are different kinds of pan roast depending on what you want in it, what type of seafood, meat, etc) I would recommend trying the combo pan roast or palace pan roast. Pan roast are also served with rice.   Also if you go from 1am-9am, their 1/2 shell half dozen oysters are $10! And their oysters are so good! Do not miss out and make sure you order this deal!   Service, everyone is super friendly and efficient.   Seating is very limited, roughly 15 seats and lines can be long so will the wait time. I've been lucky my past few visits and waited less than 20 minutes each time. However today (holiday) I decided to come here at 12:30am... And didn't get seated until 1:50am... Yes lines were long BUT also..... A couple in front of me suddenly have four friends join them in front of the line when they reached the front. I understand they all don't want to be waiting, but wow really FOUR more people after everyone has waited for over an hour behind them? I totally understand one person saving a spot for ONE/TWO people, but FOUR? Wow I was upset. Please have common courtesy and not do that, because people who actually waited will be upset especially when there's only 15 or less seats.   Other than that, AMAZING place to eat! I would recommend this place to anyone visiting Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love their happy hour 1/2 dozen oysters! 1am-9am
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan clam chowder

B99RGuVX9Fo6m1f6Xv0GMQ.text: So. This is a must stop whenever I'm in Vegas. There's only about 12 seats and If you are in line, the wait will be long.  Each order is made per person so it does take time, which adds to the wait. Good thing is that it's open 24/7, so I usually go during breakfast before the lunch crowd. Is it weird to eat seafood for breakfast? Maybe. But it's deliciously good and no wait, so I don't care if it's weird to eat this for breakfast.   I usually order combo pan toast, creamy good w a touch of tomato. Husband always order Cioppino.  He said best he ever had. This time I saw there was a boulli- roast, which is a secret menu item before. It's half combo pan base and have boulli base. Creamy and with seafood flavored! Best thing I've had!! I usually can't finish my order, but it was so good, I had to! I've tried many similar restaurants, but this is always the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boulli roast. Half boulli base. Half combo roast base. Soooo good.

kNCPye3WRXWBnZM_GmJ0nA.text: TLDR: 24 hours; no reservations; rarely not a line; 21+ only  Oyster bar is one of those hidden treasures that always sounds delicious and the wait is always worth it. They are open 24 hours and although they sell oysters, you go there for the creamy, brandy-infused pan roasts, bouillabaisses, and gumbos. There's something for everyone as long as you're at least 21 years of age.   I've never seen not a line: whether mid-day, midnight, or at 2am. You'll have to wait in line. Plan at least an hour wait or beg someone to wait in line for you while you buy them drinks. They never take reservations, but once you've been sat it'll be delicious.   You start with a roll and butter. I recommend the combo pan roast the first time around. You won't regret it. After trying that, feel free to experiment with the "bouill-roast" or house etouffee.

dxqK6wMOAxjqrZT_-7UhzA.text: SEATING IS LIMITED.    **Best to go in smaller groups if possible.    **The line doesn't quite equate wait time.  Most parties are on the floor gambling while one-two in their party will wait in line.    **One hour wait.  The wait time can vary but expect to wait one hour or more.  The counter space is limited and the seats don't always turn quick.    With all that being said, the food was phenomenal.  Oysters shucked to order with a simple cocktail sauce.   Lemon for each oyster.    The prawns were jumbo size with a healthy crunch with every bite.    Bouillabaisse was my favorite.  So many different flavors that complimented all the tasty morsels of seafood.     Full to the brim so I just couldn't muster dessert.  More items on the menu I have to try!  There will be a next time for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters on the Half Shell
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouillabaisse
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This guy taking charge, handling 20+ guests, multiple hot dishes on the line.  #champ #bossinit

fMkYkhdESk-qldjWsgL1Rg.text: OK I came here because I had read so much about the Oyster Bar. I got there around 9:15 a.m. on a Sunday and I was probably is 7th person in line and it took 45 minutes to get sat at the bar. Be prepared because a lot of people are saving place in the line, and so you may see only 1 or 2 people ahead of you but they prepared they might have 3 or 4 people with them hanging out somewhere.   After being sat, I order the Combo Pan Roast which had the lobster and shrimp in it. I also ordered, because I'm bringing it back to my room, the Shrimp & Lobster Fra Daviola. In my pictures, you can see I ordered a side of extra lava sauce, if you really like it with some spice or kick to it, I'd order a side that way you can decide whether how much to add or not, make it just right for you.   The combo Pan roast was very good, I think like some other reviewer said there is lobster in it, it was being broken up. Don't expect huge chunks of lobster, it's like a stew.  Of course the shrimp waa good because that is all-in-one piece and it didn't separate.    I thought both dishes were really good, I did like the Shrimp & Lobster Daviola better than the Pan roast. It's because I'm not really a stew kind of person but I wanted to give it a try. I would say it's was not bad,  I would says probably a 4 and a 1/2 but again, I really like my pasta dish better when I brought the home.  They also give you sourdough roles that are round but for some reason and I found I didn't like the taste of the sourdough when dipping into the stew either.   OK the bottom line is , if you really enjoy the Pan roasts, please try this place out. Just remember, there's only 16 seats seated around the bar, so it'll be a wait. You even have to wait if you're ordering take out in the line. Once you get up there you can order your food and walk away and give the seat up to next happy person.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Fra Daviola - yummy!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extra Side of Lava Sauce to make your dish spicier
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

YJoi32bes7dwkhAA8ei5eA.text: Patience... If you want good food, you must wait. If you have more than one in your party you can leave one or two people in line while the rest of your party can go gamble to make the time go faster. There's no phone in orders or to go orders so don't try to cheat the system. If you want the food, you shall wait like everyone else. Once you get seated, you can dine in or order to go. Either way, you wait, you get seated, order, enjoy your food anyway you like- no special treatments. Love it!  The first pan roast on the menu is the one to get. You get a bit of everything. The first bite makes you wanting more. Perfect amount of heat, saltiness and thickness of the sauce. The shrimps are huge and the portions are friendly to one's appetite. My friends and I couldn't finish our pan roast so we got it to go which makes a great midnight snack. They packaged it nice and tight with Saran Wrap to prevent any spills so you get every last drop of that goodness.   My friends got the oysters which left them with nothing but smiles. Definitely worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You&#39;ll get your $ worth!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast assembly
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters!

RSoylO57GT2ORunen9pHJQ.text: What's better than the Pan Roast and oysters from the Oyster Bar? The Pan Roast and oysters for Happy Hour!! $1 Oysters M - F from 5am-10am is something I'll never say no to. Even if you don't consider yourself the oyster consuming type, this would be a great place to put your pallet to the test. I started off with 1/2 a dozen and quickly turned that into a dozen once I tasted how fresh they come.   The service is great , especially when you're arriving at 8am like we did. We sat down at the empty bar (we heard its never that empty) and were quickly given recommendations. We went with the Combo Pan Roast that comes with shrimp, crab and lobster. I have to say, it is a very rich and thick consistency with large pieces of lobster. The shrimp and crab have for the most part disintegrated into the soup which isn't bad at all because those flavors are all still there. If you're looking for more solid pieces, I would recommend the Bouill-roast. There's a lot of food there and it comes with a side of rice, so you'll leave very full. The flavors reminded me of a creamy seafood tomato soup thickened with heavy cream.   Everything was so yummy and delicious, we wanted to come back a second time but the two hour wait was just a little too long for us in starving conditions. It will definitely be one of my go to Vegas stops.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast!!! Must have!!!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour M-Oysters on the Half Shell

8hU8CAAeheM2Wp7xiTaVFQ.text: After trying the Oyster bar at palace station I can honestly say I will never eat pan roast anywhere else or even bother.  I never usually say this either but ITS WORTH THE WAIT. It also helps if you come at non busy hours which usually is from 3am-8am. its open 24 hours.  very small bar with about 14/15 seats.  -I usually order lump crab/ shrimp cocktail. nice and fresh with delicious cocktail sauce.   -Oysters are shucked fresh right in front of you and its delicious, can be a bit sweeter but not sure where they are getting them.   -Alaskan clam chowder has the perfect thickness and the flavor is delicious! with lots of seafood   -My favorite thing is the boulli-roast which is basically half and half of both stews. best balance of flavors and of course I order everything extra spicy. my mouth waters just thinking about it. has all types of seafood.  -Seafood gumbo is excellent with a side order of okra.   I can never come to Las Vegas and stop by to eat here.
