Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lump crab
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Marys

uN5KfxqyAMjlOHY9N2vraQ.text: Always an excellent! Long line is worth to wait. You still have to wait in line even for the take out. 18% tip automatically applied on 6 or more orders.   Pan- roast : very rich and creamy, hint of sweet and tangy   Bouillabaisse : featuring clam juice so it's lighter than pan roasted   Bouil - roast : MY FAV! It's a mix of pan roast and bouillabaisse so it's rich like the roast but not too rich because of more clam juice less cream in it.   Gumbo : if you don't like creamy more tomatoes sauce not cream. It's full flavor without sweetness nor tangy.

bMJnVaAdkVDRxopW64Jjpw.text: Located in Place Station just right by some slot machines! Seating is only bar area and it's first come first serve. My party and I were lucky enough to grab a seat quickly at 10am on a Sunday. However, an hour later the bar area was full and a long line started to form so I suggest getting there as early as possible since it's open 24/7!   C O M B O  P A N  R O A S T   Hands down one of the BEST pan roast I've had! Compared to other locations the flavors were really well balanced and filled with a lot of seafood goodness! Seafood included in this dish are shrimp, lobster, and crab. They aren't stingy about the seafood and filled with big hardy pieces of shrimp inside, YUM. This dish is definitely something you should share, I was struggling to finish the entire bowl myself but it was too good not to finish. When you order you'll be given a scale of 0 - 10 spice level. I ordered a level 2 spice level as I literally cannot handle heat that well and it was perfect. I'm still dreaming about this dish!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun Bbq Peel &amp; Eat Shrimp
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu as of July 2019

NtQ2XOaXSltCDatG4BPKRw.text: This is probably the #1 question being asked: IS IT WORTH THE WAIT?  The answer is YES. Pro tip: don't come starving. You will be waiting for a while (unless you wanna try to come at 8 or 9am in the morning on a weekday). I came on a weekday around 3pm and there was maybe about 8 parties ahead of us. We stood in line for about an hour and 10 mins before we got seated. Then it was another 10-15 mins until our combo pan roasts came out.   Ahhh, the pan roast! I've never had anything like it. It's rich, creamy, spicy and so amazing with rice and bread. The portion is quite large so I think sharing is a good idea. I ended up only finishing the seafood inside with quite some broth left.   I will definitely make this a regular spot whenever I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast $24.99

SxSlhXCi2DqnMvweNBk9Fg.text: Husband and I came here last night for a late dinner. I can't complain much about the food especially the cioppino as it was delightful! Service though left a lot be desired unfortunately.   First off, expect a wait as there's always going to be a line. This place is so small and right in the middle of the casino so expect a lot noise and smoke as well. They were so slow seating people down even if there's empty seats around.   We ordered drinks but never got any refills as the guy was basically by himself, busing, hosting, taking orders and processing payments for customers. It was such a madhouse!   Hubby ordered a dozen oysters and was offered only the gold band. I was totally expecting different other options for an oyster bar. But I was blown away by the cioppino! Probably the best I've had by far!   Well as the hubby says, at least we tried it but we would rather stick to that one over by South Point Hotel which I just found out was a sister company of this one. It's just service over there was a far cry from this one.

N7ZKVFLsXKsNvP7MaO1IBg.text: Bouill-roast is all GMonkey will ever need here!  Combination of bouillabaisse & pan roast broth is magnificent!  Even if just broth and rice- dat Flavor is terrific.   Can choose your desired Heat:  1-3 Mild, 4-7 Impressive, 8-10 Fire. So when man go shi shi and lady orders one "mild 6" fo her and one 7 fo him... Monkey couldn't wait to see dis... Number 5 on my right was coughing, wheezing and chugging water.  Even the server say:  "Go low!  Always go low and you can add more heat, but cannot take it away..." Best sellers, Bouill-Roast & Combo Pan Roast are $26 and $25. Get your spice low and add if desire moa. Dis too Ono to waste!  Dumb girl and lucky guy could not eat.   Open 24/7 and always a line. If your wait is less than one hour, then it good. Best to come single or in pairs. Seating is limited, thus one line. Best seats are those first available. Lucky if right in front of pans and just smell what cookin!  We waited in line just under one hour and left around 2am on Wed night.   See you tomorrow...!

AppRcAD9O-m2p98bI2hUjA.text: One of the highlights on this trip was getting to eat at The Oyster Bar. It was unexpectedly so amazing!  One of our girlfriends recommended it and we were not disappointed in the food.  We ordered many things but hands down the Pan Roast is the way to go. They have a variation of different seafoods you can order with your Pan Roast from crab, lobster, or combination.   We ordered 2x orders of the Pan Roast combo. (YUM, YUM, YUM)  We also ordered a dozen and a half their raw oysters. Their $1 oysters are from 5am-10am. If you have the energy in your being you should definitely go their during that block of time to get your bang for the buck.   We went at 3pm and we had to wait 45min -1 hour to sit.   Their happy hour special is perfect because there is essentially no line at that time, hence why they offer their best steal at those hours.   We also got an order of their seafood Jambalaya, clam chowder, Manhattan clam chowder, and a few of their Bloody Marys. All very good.  Plus, if you mention that it's your birthday they give you a free birthday shot.   The best part was getting to sit right in the front line in this bar style seating arrangement to see how they concoct the delicious meals right in front of you. Super delicious.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jambalaya
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast with shrimp, crab, &amp; lobster

B3sicZyBTUP698Mpex_9xQ.text: Between trips for work and getaways with friends, it'd be fair to say I've been to Vegas a fair amount. Very fair over the last few years, which is kind of crazy considering how I once went quite a few years in between trips. Sadly, it's even crazier that it took my so long to make my way to the famed Oyster Bar. And not just any "Oyster Bar", mind you...I mean THE Oyster Bar. As in, the O.G. inside the Palace Station casino - not the knock offs you'll find sprinkled up and down The Strip! While the Oyster Bar I visited at Harrah's was nowhere near as good as this one, the two are also different in nearly every way. That one is a typical sort of restaurant; this one is like an actual bar with twenty-ish counter seats lining the prep/cooking space where you can watch the crew at work (yelp.com/biz_photos/the-...). Like their size, the menu here isn't nearly as extensive, but it's far more interesting. Granted, it could've been my excitement, but literally EVERYTHING looked terrific - oysters, pan roasts, seafood platters, soups, chowders, gumbos, jambalaya, etouffe...the list goes on! -- OYSTER SHOOTER with Espolon Blanco Tequila...$5 (yelp.com/biz_photos/the-...) After watching them shuck/prep one for the girl next to me, I couldn't help but get one too! The oyster itself was meaty, the pour of tequila was generous, and the shot as a whole had a spicy bite to it. Pretty good! -- COMBO PAN ROAST with Shrimp, Crab, and Lobster in a Creamy Tomato Stew with a Hint of Brandy and Rice...$24.99 (yelp.com/biz_photos/the-...) Despite their name, Oyster Bar's pan roasts are what they're best known for. Easy to see why - it had a good amount of fresh seafood and the soup/broth was creamy and flavorful (you also choose how spicy you want it). I'm not always a fan of tomato-based stuff, but this was solid. -- ALASKAN CHOWDER (served New England, Manhattan, or Dirty Style) with Shrimp, Crab, and Lobster...$24.99 (yelp.com/biz_photos/the-...) Shout out to my friend for splitting dishes with me - I knew I had to try their pan roast, but this was what I truly wanted! i generally prefer New England style over Manhattan, but the chowder was truly impressive - more than being rich, this was just straight up delicious! As so many have already noted before me, the biggest knock on The Oyster Bar is how long the way for seats can be. Whether it's for brunch, lunch, dinner, mid-day snack, or a late night bite (they're open 24/7), you can count on some sort of wait. Your best bet? Get here by 10:00am (on a weekday, if possible), as per my friend who comes here often. We got in line at around 10:30 on a Thursday and still had to wait about an hour (might have been less if there wasn't four of us). The other knock, though to a lesser degree, are the prices - chowder for $25? Kind of hefty... In the ridiculously likely event that you're going to have to wait, have no fear - the wait will be worth it in the end. Even though I can't speak for the vast majority of what they have, everything we saw them make looked delicious What's more, service is great - one server was kind of "ehh", but the other guy, as well as the cook/chef, were awesome. Given the wait and prices though, I'm not 100% sure The Oyster Bar is a five star spot just yet. I don't know if they're a must visit every time I'm in town, but every other would be almost just as good considering I'm already heading back soon. FOUR AND A HALF STARS rounded down for now...at least until I get an Alaskan Chowder of my own!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan Chowder (New England Style) with Shrimp, Crab, and Lobster
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast with Shrimp, Crab, and Lobster in a Creamy Tomato Stew with a Hint of Brandy and Rice
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster Shoot with Espolon Blanco Tequila

ZUkaLYmnhH2luXmr8k7ciQ.text: Oh, Oyster Bar, we meet again after all these years. By far, the largest oysters I have seen and at $21.99 per dozen, a great deal! Better yet, if you come on weekdays from 5-10AM, the oysters are $1.  My only complaint is the wait. The Oyster Bar seats eighteen people. There were about ten people in front of us and it took two hours for us to be seated. Since there was a group of six people in front of us, we had to wait for six seats to open up adjacent to each other in order to accommodate the group. I just wonder if there's a more efficient way to seat people. We ended up waiting for two hours before being seated. The slow turnover could also be due to the fact that they only have one server who's taking orders, seating people, busing the bar counter, etc.  When we were finally seated, we ordered a dozen of their gold band oysters and the combo pan roast. The oysters were fresh and satisfying, but I did feel like they needed the lemon and cocktail sauce to give it more flavor. On the other hand, the combo pan roast was outstanding! A creamy tomato stew that is so flavorful, comforting, mildly spicy, and with generous bits of shrimp, crab, and lobster.   If you're a big seafood/oyster lover like myself, I highly recommend making the trip over to The Palace Station and indulging yourself in some succulent oysters. My advice would be to go during non-peak hours to avoid the wait and get the best deal, but the food - especially that combo pan roast - is worth the wait any time of day. Every time I go to Vegas, this place is always on my mind. Already looking forward to next time.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6hHJqy3Mjh95esAR1Ql_tw.text: Waited an hour & 20 min in line last week b/c the seating is so limited. No reservations or list to sign. You literally stand in line for your spot.   Service is a hit and miss. When we sat down, the waiter neglected to clear the dishes in front of us or ask us what we wanted b/c he was too busy gabbing w/ the couple next to us.   The food made it worth it though. It was so goood!! Ordered the Bouillabaisse, oysters, house gumbo, and alaskan chowder. I wanted to try everything but the dishes are pretty filling.   Would definitely come again. Just wish they expanded their location.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouillabaisse &amp; House Gumbo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. oysters

GUejvsm8wkyv7P94MFijRQ.text: Vegas trip isn't complete if Pan Roast is not involved. They opened 24 hours and if you are like me, choose to go is around 4am when there isn't a line. However, I opted to go around 1pm on a Saturday last weekend because it was too hot for a Beach Club at Encore. Why bake in heat when you can grub on a dozen Oysters and Crab Pan Roast lever 8!   I always get the Combo Pan Roast that comes with Lobster, Shrimp, and Crab with a side of rice, but chose Crab Pan Roast this time and was amazed at how much crab is in this order. You can taste the smokey flavor of the chili that made my mouth salivate even as I'm writing this. Always ask for rice separately since the portion is pretty big, this way, I can take it to-go and eat it later in the hotel.

NkMjO55_sjtz3WCSnkgyPw.text: If you walk by and you don't see a line please run over there! Every single time I go there is at least an hour wait. However, the wait is definitely worth it. I'm 100% you will not regret unless you're super "hangry". There other Oyster Bar locations, but this location is the best.  Food: You can't go to the a seafood bar, without trying fresh oysters. They were plump and full of freshness. I always get the pan roast when I am here and by far my favorite is combo pan roast which comes with crab, lobster, and shrimp.  If you're not super hungry you can share this with someone else. Please keep in mind, you must order one item per person.  Since the sitting style is bar style, you are able to see the chefs cook and prepare the food in front of you.

OYCf-3HebV5mMRqDAAUYOg.text: I love this place- my go to - first stop once my plane lands on Vegas. I just wished they had more people to help out clean the table so you can get your seat faster.

Tr7dR8Sq8rXwWOCK0MjZIA.text: The only reason why I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 is because I think they can improve on their waiting system.   This bar is inside the Palace Station Casino located on the other side of the freeway from the strip. There's about 20 seats and the wait is approximately 1.5 -2 hours. The line runs right in the middle of some of the slot machines but all you can do is watch other people play because you have to hold your place in line. They should hand out pagers and page people when the table is ready. The casino might gain a little by folks playing while waiting. Just have a disclaimer that if they don't show within 5 minutes, their slot is gone.  We went on a Thursday Night around 630pm and was seated around 8-830pm.  What did I eat...  1 dozen of oysters ($21.99) ... big, succulent, and fresh. They were good and if you don't care about the size, these are probably perfect. As for me, I prefer the smaller kind like kumamotos.  1 dozen of clams ($18.99)... must try, super sweet   1/2 dozen Cajun bbq shrimp ($12.99)... this was the best shrimp dish that I have ever had anywhere. The juice that it was cooked and marinated in was bowl licking clean delicious! The shrimp was super fresh and cooked perfectly.   Shrimp cocktail ($12.99) ... honestly, after the clams and Cajun bbq shrimp, the shrimp cocktail was a little boring. For paying the same price, go for the Cajun bbq!  Combo Pan Roast ($24.99) ... it's like a thick seafood stew, tomato base, with shrimp, crab and lobster.  Bouillabaisse ($25.99) shellfish stew with shrimp, crab, lobster, cod, mussels and clams.   The difference between the pan roast and the bouillabaisse is that the roast has all the seafood mixed into the stew whereas the seafood in the bouillabaisse were in big pieces... the clams where still in their shells.   Alaskan Chowder ($24.99), we got it Manhattan style (you can also get it New England or Dirty Style), this was the best chowder ever...seriously!!! In fact, I liked it so much, I order one to go and we had it the next day and it was still the best chowder that I have ever had!   They have four people working and each knew and completed their task well: a gal that served drinks, shuck oysters and clams, and prepares all the cold dishes, a guy that takes the order and cleans the area, another guy that cleaned all the pots and dishes and then you have the Chef that cooked all the hot dishes. Everything is cooked by one man and in front of all the guests. Hats off to the Chef because he would cook 8 dishes at one time and not once did he get anyone's order wrong and everything was cooked perfectly!   Is it worth 2 hours of waiting time... the jury is still out on that one because the food there is really good and I'm so going back to try other things on the menu. How long will I wait ... well, I'm going to try my best to go when it should not be so busy, but most of the regulars there told us it's pretty much a hit-and-miss.
