Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters

FKibFCeE4LeEqYY-ALOjWw.text: Pan roast Addiction!!!!! A must goto restaurant when I visit Vegas!!! Be aware of the long line tho... Try going after or before lunch and dinner hours...Seatings are limited=(

qN7ssIsBqYqofqCbuXg1Tg.text: Hands down one of the best restaurants in Vegas!  People are always surprised when we take them here because it's inside a casino off the strip in Palace Station. I would say it is a hidden gem if the wait weren't so long every single time.  Must-Have Foods: In general, the portions are huge, so I would recommend sharing unless you are really hungry. -Cioppino: Bursting with flavor tomato stew with prawns and lots of spices. Absolutely delicious! -Pan Roast: The house special. Lobster, shrimp, & crab in a rich cream based broth. It is very filling but so worth the stomach space. -Steamed Clams: I could drink the white wine and herb broth it is so good. -Oysters on the Half Shell: Fresh oysters served with cocktail sauce. Simple & fresh.    Wait: The wait is at least 30 minutes on a good day so get there early. Even if you have to wait over an hour, it's totally worth it. If the wait is really long, the Mexican restaurant next door sells huge yummy margaritas that always makes the wait seem shorter. ;)    Atmosphere: Once you're seated, you can chat with the chefs and watch them cook. They call it "live action cooking" - yes, Vegas terminology. Since you're sitting next to strangers, you're bound to chat it up with other loyal customers. Overall, it's a casual, fun and friendly place.  Service: The service could be better. There is usually 1-2 waiters for the entire bar that serves 25-30 guests and they take their sweet time. The food is so though good that the service is forgiveable.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cioppino

nrJhoVpyzSwRUNo88dFe7A.text: The Oyster Bar is really a bar with about 15 seats, handled by the one cook and one server. Prepare to wait a minimal hour before you are seated and served. The place is located South of The Strip and very much a ghetto area. If you can't handle the wait or crowd, then order to-go!  I wasn't a fan of the oysters but I highly recommend any of their entree; it's absolutely worth every penny! You can pay extra for splitting your dish with someone, but I'd rather have leftovers. The ingredients are fresh and it's cooked right in front of you. The spices and sauce will leave you mesmerized.

MQjRMEyUiJ2_i8tP0E3wHA.text: As long as there is an empty seat no waiting at the bar,great food,I had the combo pan roast it was very good and filling,service was really goodI can't wait to return to try something else.

oODZw36Jv2IxTEPR9FxUmQ.text: There's always a wait but the food is amazing. The oyster shooters are fresh and highly recommended

XeMeP7ytUnoeGaz77bE5Nw.text: Wow, I was very pleasantly surprised how good the food was here!!  One morning in Vegas, before our departure, one of my friends suggested we go eat here.  The way she described it didn't sound very appealing, and against my will I came here.  Once we got there I found there were only 10-12 seats, its only counter seating, no tables.  We had a group of 4, so it was kinda hard to wait for 4 adjacent spots to be available.  Eventually we sat, ordered, and once the food came... WOW!!  I must say it was absolutely delicious!!  We each ordered our own, but the portions were large enough to share for 2.  Ended up taking the left overs home, they packed it very well, and it was just as good many hours later.  The chef has a dry sense of humor, but overall a nice guy.  The service was top notch for what you would expect at a counter-top seated "restaurant" in the casino... Needless to say, I've been dying to go back!

n8Us-ZDXUZx7vzLGATJFIQ.text: Came here on a late Friday night (technically Saturday morning) around 2:30 AM and had to wait about an hour to an hour thirty. Let me start by saying the wait was worth it. We had some guy in line that kept hyping this place up by saying, "it's the best" and "worth the wait" which was hilarious because there was probably 10 or so people behind us and they waited as long as us. It's crazy to think that a line of 10 people would take over an hour to wait for, but we finally realized the reasoning behind it. The food is made right on the spot with one main chef and one waiter who handles all the operations and helps with the occasional shucking. Anyways, once seated, I decided on getting the combination pan roast (4/10 spice) and splitting a dozen oysters. After that's taken care of, they start you off with some warm bread which was pretty good, nothing special. Then we get to see our chef (Ricardo) begin shucking the oysters and clams. When he was popping open the oysters, man I could not believe my eyes at how big and fresh they were. Hands down, the best raw oysters I have ever eaten in my life. Ricardo then began schooling us on how the pan roast is made and the other things he was making for customers. One of the pots he was working on, a customer ordered a 10/10 spicy level and boy did it look like fire compared to ours. The first bite of the pan roast was breath taking. The guy in line that kept saying it's worth the wait, looked over at us and was like, "what'd I say". He was right, the best thing ever. The pan roast is so huge, I would recommend sharing so that you do not waste this heavenly goodness. Ricardo also made us a clam chowder that was really good. Didn't have that fishy taste to it at all. The type of chowder that you had to eat while hot because if it gets cold, it's ruined/done. This is the best experience I have ever had in Las Vegas and I would come again. Shout out the the chef Ricardo, handling all that food.

etazU5d3tYlNkIVAXuO6rw.text: Service: that lady and the chef is amazing  Food: Pan Roast (combo), so yummy that I need to eat 2 bowls of rice (usually I eat 1/2 bowl).  Wait: 1.5 hour for Friday night and 45 mins for Sunday night, better go there before 5:30pm to avoid crowd, you will still have to wait but the queue will be shorter.  **I went there twice in my 3 day trip, as the food is SO GOOD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

r_vC58xUOT8E6EuMKQajng.text: I would give this place 5 stars because the food is soooo amazing! But the wait is horrible, they need to expand this place. Just to eat the my pan roast we have to wait for up to 1-2 1/2 hours! But it is worth is the food is amazing, and the staff is also funny. FYI this place is 24HOURS! so if your ever out here in Vegas try this place out for breakfast or after a night of partying!

JLfgHr1C3HWLYwtATTqqtQ.text: Definitely a gem in Las Vegas! Especially considering it's off the strip and in an old hotel/casino like Palace Station.   There is literally about 20-25 seats so if you do not want to wait, I recommend coming at odd times (non-lunch/dinner hours). I came around 10:30AM and sat down immediately. My friends came at 5PM and sat down immediately as well. If you come during busy hours (lunch/dinner times), you can expect to wait about 1-2 hours.  Definitely get the fresh oysters! It is sooo delicious and they literally shuck 'em in front of ya- so it's definitely fresh. They toss all the bad ones and they're pretty experienced with that.  The pan roast and bouillabaise are extremely delicious. The pan roast has a more creamy sauce with seafood, whereas the bouillabaise has more of a tomato broth with seafood. I must say, it does come with a lot of seafood, I thought it was worth it for the price.   This place is very comparable to The Broiler in Chino Hills (CA), which I really like as well.   For most of the entrees, you can order spiciness from 1-10 (10 being most spicy), and it does get very hot. Usually above a 5 makes it difficult for you to enjoy the meal, but if you have the stomach of steel, by all means, do it! haha  The chef and worker have quite a personality, they can be jokesters and quite entertaining. However, the waittress I had was a little rude... maybe I just caught her on a bad day (which explains why I did not give it a 5 star rating).

zl7bWhCcA79Er0slSpNk7Q.text: Food: *****5*****   Service: **2** Hygiene: ***3*** Price: ***3***     MUST EAT - Shrimp Scampi, Pan Roast GOOD - TASTY! BAD - Slow Service, Long Wait

_d50Tu1V-o9hXTYZqXSXEQ.text: I came here on a Thursday night around 11pm, there was a wait but it was totally worth it! There are only 18 seats that wraps around the oyster bar and there was about 10 people ahead of me that night, which took about 45 mins to an hour before me and my cousin got seated.  We ordered the combo pan roast and a dozen raw oysters and it was heaven in my mouth!!! It was my first time ever trying pan roast, and absolutely the best.  The pan roast was very rich and creamy with plenty of seafood and the raw oysters were nicely shucked and cleaned, plump and a good size.  The wait for the pan roast was quite long, (15-20 mins) for they do make it right there and then and comes with a side of rice, which you should really eat the pan roast with because it really balances out the flavors and tones down the creaminess and saltiness.  The service was quick and fast but not impeccable but I was starving so I didn't pay close attention to it because I was so excited when we were finally being seated lol. Definitely a must visit if you're in Vegas and have plenty of time to spare for the wait is a pain and if you have never tried pan roast before, let this place take your pan roast cherry!

KPmDoe9lphrmhE_xjohMkA.text: Uh yeah, amazing. I came on a Tuesday around noon and didn't have to wait at all.  If I had any control at all I'd say split the combo with a friend as it's a lot of food, but I wouldn't recommend it. I'm mostly writing this review so I remember to come back when I next visit Vegas.

qe6kAer3ZE6tlQ3sFrTt2w.text: This may have been over-hyped for me. I was expecting a mouth orgasm while eating this. I didn't. But it wasn't bad. Got the seafood pan roast and the oysters (more about that later).  The pan roast was good. Sort of reminded everyone of a lobster bisque. Although you ate this with rice. We got a spicy level of 4. It's always a gamble with spiciness level. No different here. Couldn't taste any spice with 4 so added some more. Also, more rice. Mmm, yum. Could have used more lobster though.  Now on to the oysters. They were hand cut in front of us although when we got it, there was a worm in one of them. Some sort of parasite. Luckily Grace C. caught it before it went on to live in one of our stomachs for a few years. I think it was the lemon she squirted on the oyster that made the worm react.  When we told the waitress about it, she was really cool saying she wouldn't charge us for them and we wouldn't have to eat them.  If you're ever in Vegas, you should try this place at least once. It really is just a bar so that's part of the reason the lines are so long.

Azy2nV-2XCaP7SYioIvCMw.text: I first went here when my good friend had his 30th birthday in Vegas and made it a point to have one of his meals here. I am so glad he did!  Then I went again when my graduate program was celebrating in Vegas after finishing our comp exam.   The first time, I split a dozen oysters, had the large beer and ordered the combination pan roast (spice level 3; I'm super sensitive to spicy and would sweat up a storm if I went higher than that). The pan roast is seriously one of the best meals I have ever had...and I don't like to overuse hyperbole! Oh and the bread is fantastic as well.  The 2nd time I went with a couple of friends and I was hyping this place up the entire time. I ordered the bouillabaisse and my friends split a combo pan roast. We shared family style. The bouillabaisse was great, but nothing beats the pan roast (see previous paragraph). One of my friends also wanted to try the clam chowder so we ordered that after eating the other things. If you have the room, you HAVE to order the clam chowder. I'm not a chowder connoisseur, but I'm from Norcal and have eaten plenty of chowder in my day (in SF among other places). The chowder here is among the best I've had as well which just cements this place to one of my favorites of all time.   Read on for additional experience/logistical/personal details:  The first time, there were about 8 of us and let me tell you...that is quite a feat to get seated with that large a group here. Luckily we went during lunch and it was relatively not busy. Plus you can get drinks and play some slots while waiting. This casino is definitely not for people looking for the glitz and glamour Vegas has to offer.   Bob, our cook (they cook it right in front of you so you get to interact the entire time) had a straight-forward crude sense of humor, which I appreciate and the waitresses are so friendly and personable. Some of the sweetest ladies work here!  When I first saw this place, I was surprised because the seating was so limited. We all ordered beers from the bar nearby, so waiting wasn't an issue for us. I would definitely recommend going the weekday at an off-peak time (if possible) if you just want to try this place.   Another thing to note is that when you leave this place you have that feeling that 'you're in the know' in Vegas even if you're not a local. I could be way off and sound like a total tourist to actual locals, but that's the perception and feeling (described above) I get when i leave this place. This place is a must visit every time I'm in Vegas.

vNYKt98QzDlgUL9NahJ8-A.text: I drool just thinking about this place. I went here with family waited about an hour and I would wait two if I had to. I had the pan roast and it was the best thing I have ever eaten. Well worth the wait and $20. Not the mention the portion was HUGE. I was basically rolling out of my chair. The staff was friendly, the area was clean, and best if all your food is prepared right in from of you.  Amazing place. If you love seafood, this is a must in Vegas!

R80LYX3AmE29iHBM-bU0Ow.text: Thank you for living up to the raving reviews!! Absolute great experience. I will be eating here as much as I can while i'm in town!!

c05t5YeOXyR21valWkSKaw.text: What can I say.  This place will leave you wanting more and thinking of when will be the next time you will come back to this place.  Everything looks great and you better believe it, taste great. It's a must try if you're in Vegas the unfortunate part is that it only seats 16 so the wait might be long but sooooooo worth it.

2g6B6FZEaWjjT9VjLSIyNA.text: We stopped in on Friday based on Yelp reviews. Got here around 5:30pm & our wait was approx 1 hr 30min.  We ordered the Combo Roast with a level 6 spice. Very rich and not much seafood in the dish but was a decent flavor. Also had the clam steamers, bland flavor. Overall based on the wait and taste and price in my opinion I wouldn't recommend or try again.

2aEpVbhSsFZVj61_bxTq4A.text: Attempting to be adventurous, my gf and I wondered off the strip to try this "restaurant' recommended by so many yelpers.  We took a cab that cost about $25.00 to the Palace Station Casino, where this little shingle is located.  Skepticism soon crept in as I observed that the "bar" sat no more than twenty people at any one time, and the casino interior appear outdated.  Still, we tried the combo pan roast to see what all the fuss was about, after standing on line for about an hour.  Both my gf and I were blown away by the taste of the pan roast.  Even at "mild", the food was full of herbs and spices set off a cascade of pleasure pumping neuro chemicals in our brains. Afterwards, we stuck around to play pai gow and two deck blackjack tables with $5.00 minimums.  The card play was extremely fun and definitely changed my view about the Palace Station Casino.

Q_JAjhu5jKK_2nZ3hjwCrg.text: Absolutely incredible. Great Cajun/Louisiana sea food cooked right in front of you. The only down side is the number of seats, so you have probably have to wait. But the food is well worth any wait. The oysters are great, and the etouffee or pan roasts are to die for. All of the reviews have said it all. If you're in Las Vegas, drop on by the Palace Station and have a great meal.

QvCjvbMkx2QqRI0K1UDVbw.text: My boyfriend raved about this spot for the longest. I finally got the chance to try it for myself. Omg the first spoon full of my house gumbo was AWESOME!! We were so greedy we ordered double crab, shrimp, chicken and lobster! The gumbo was seasoned to perfection. I ordered mine at a #7 which was a little too spicy for me. I haven't stop talking about this spot since I left Vegas. This will be my "go to" spot every time I go to Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House gumbo double EVERYTHING!!

u3zNsJHrL3aya-n-VAoPqQ.text: Everyone raves about this place...and yes it's True. Waited a little over an hour on a Thursday night around 11PM, friends say I'm lucky to have barely waited haha! Tried the gumbo and it was pretty good, not great. But.....the Pan Roast....yup, twas HEAVEN! I personally think the sauce is a mix between lobster bisque, tomato cream soup and creamy pontchartrain sauce. Very heavy but oh so good. Big portions so share or come with an empty stomach. The oysters were super fresh...like...I taste the ocean...in my mouth...type of way. =)   5 Stars for the Pan Roast because I can't seem to find an adequate recipe for it online. Think its a top secret recipe. shrugs. Not to sure if I want to pay random strangers online for the recipe....but I'm tempted. haha

V-Dr23T6TmzDDYn6_iG3Wg.text: Combo pan roast and oysters on the half shell ARE AWESOME!!!!  Be prepared to wait at least an hour.  Small but WORTH THE WAIT!!!

REnMu343akGUq2s5Oxi8-g.text: This place is as good as just about everyone claims. Portions are huge, so it's a good idea to share in order to save money and calories. My husband and I split an order of oysters, New England clam chowder, and  the combo roast pot. The clam chowder was good. The cocktail sauce served with the oysters had an excellent kick. The roast pot was the star of the show. I was tempted to lick my bowl when I was finished.  Service was very friendly, but a bit slow. Due to the bar's small size, there is really only room for a single server, and she was doing it all.   I read a lot of complaints about long waits before going, so I was worried. Thankfully we only waited 10 minutes or so to be seated. We went around Noon today (Monday), just FYI.

9HadvNl6b0dIIqbRDNQ2zQ.text: Wow the Pan Roast was incredible

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YoRwYcUKYdzExJygB80o9Q.text: Got here at 9am on a Monday and what do ya know??? Only two people there besides me!!! It's the MAGIC HOUR!!! Woohoo! Ordered the Alaskan Chowder and a tequila oyster shooter! Great chef, Thanks EZ...Great Waitress and good company next to me! By 945 it was only one seat open!!! I'll be back Palace Station!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The breakfast of champs...Vegas Style
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan Chowder made by EZ

uhtRiMctUO5lSqPpN3Hcyw.text: Came at 3:15 AM and didn't have to wait. The bar was nicely set up as an open kitchen. The chefs and waiters were funny and friendly.   1/2 dozen oysters at happy hour rate: threw in a couple of little ones on the house  Order of Littleneck Clams: the soup was delightful too   Bouillabaisse Medium spice: most delicious seafood dish ever had, period. We live in LA and thought we were privileged but wrong!! This was the most amazing thing that can happen in your mouth! :)   Very impressive! Would be back every time in town.

VvO77AGRTQ-NjLJHTpGmRQ.text: THIS. IS. DRUNK FOOD MECCA!  When you pass by during the day, you'll see just about every stool occupied and even a line of people waiting during the normal meal times. But even at even at 3, 4 or even 5 in the morning, Oyster Bar still has a steady flow of loyal customers that make a pit stop just before going to bed.   On my first night at the Oyster Bar, my boyfriend and I shared the combo pan roast. As I was just about to succumb to sleep, the delectable aroma of the pan roast woke me and the beast inside my belly.  Fresh shrimp, crab and lobster all simmering in a creamy tomato broth... how can that not wake you up?  It was just bite after bite of creamy goodness.  And Steve & Ricardo, who work the night shift, don't skimp out on the meat.  The portions here are huge, even after sharing, we still had leftovers.   On my second night... yes, it was that good that I had to come another night... I had the cup of clam chowder for only $4.99.  The clams were so fresh and had the nice chewy texture that I love. Mhm mhm good!  This is a must try place if you step into Palace Station. It's open 24 hours so there's no excuse for not trying it out! The staff is so funny and friendly. There's a $5 shared plate charge and Steve didn't charge us the $5 for the combo pan roast on the first night.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9jQuqNuyIXn0lQdY0CJVNw.text: Food = 3.5 (used to be 5) Waiting Time = -5 Service = 3 Price = 3 Lame rules = -5 Atmosphere = 1 Overall = 0  I found this place years back when I stayed at this hotel and felt sick from a cold and wanted some soup.  That how I found out about this oyster bar with its used-to-be amazing clam chowder.  After that, whenever I had the chance to visit Las Vegas, I always made an effort to stop by this place to eat their clam chowder.  I also discovered some other dishes that were also very good.  I didn't know that this place has gotten so popular and the wait time increases triple the time I used to know about it.  However, after my most recent visit here, I have to say, I have seen all I needed to see.  I won't stop here next time I come to Las Vegas because it's not worth it to me anymore.    So the seats around the bar, that is all the seats there are...approximately 10 seats or so.  There's a line, in which you get to stand on your sorry feet for a few hours until one of those few seats become available.  There is a security guard standing somewhere nearby to make sure that you are over 21 years old in order to be waiting in line.  Anyone who does not look 21 or over get asked to leave.  I was with my husband and my two years old.  We were told that my two years old son cannot be there and that we all must leave because we have a kid.  I asked why and I was told that it's because it is a bar, so nobody under 21 is allowed in there, whether you are in there just for the food, or the alcohol, they DO NOT care.  It appears that the hotel doesn't need to make money on food.  It also appears that the hotel wants you to wait long in lines, so you would get bored from waiting and play their slot machines instead.  Then the service, you finally get seated, and given a menu, then place your order and wait some more, then eat, and then pay and leave.  You get to see the chef making your food in front of your eyes.  How cool right? NOT really.  I don't really care.  I just want my food fast!!! Anyway, chefs here have this rude obnoxious looks on their faces and it's pretty annoying seating here and waiting for the food while having to endure the unpleasant atmosphere...The waitress are all annoying as well.  Prices are in the $20s each dish which is not bad.  Quality of food has gotten worse.  I tried my clam chowder again and this time it was all watery and tasted 80% WORSE than before. I guess they don't care about making GREAT food like they used to.  Decent food seems to suffice given the mass amount of customers that come here.  They seem to not care about customers.  The hotel appears to not care about the money from the food, only the money from the slot machines..  So next time in Vegas, I will NOT stop here.  It's just NOT worth it.

R0JPtI_8YIIYuMN8uu7U4Q.text: Went there tonight..........Long, Long wait almost 2 hours. The Soup (pan roast) was Great. The bread was terrible and the oysters were just OK. So would come back for the Pan Roast and maybe try other things next time.

zP56z9c67X2ElAKabM7yqQ.text: This was totally a yelp find and based on the reviews we were encouraged to wander off the strip.  In short - excellent food (Combo Pan Roast!) and the staff behind the bar are great!  What you need to know about waiting in line - there are only about 20 seats at the bar.  A single person standing in the line could potentially be holding seats for a total of 6 people - this is what we experienced...  We had maybe 5 people a head of us, which I saw as a reasonable wait...  then the dude infront of us turns into 6 - five people casually walk up and step into the line.  Im not going to sugar coat it... I questioned what they thought they were doing and then generally lost my shit...  our dinner got completely bamboozled by some discourteous dicks and Palace Station allowed it to happen.  We ultimately all sat down at the same time  (because I raised hell), but we had to wait for every one of those clowns to be served before we got anything - dinner took forever...  Manager explained that it is Palace Station policy to let people hold space in line for a total of 6 folks.  I understand for a larger restaurant, but the Oyster Bar has 20 freaking seats... I call bullshit!

emO293e3AcgTU2RaXdePhQ.text: THE BEST HIDDEN SECRET IN VEGAS!!!!  Makes me want to make the 4-5 hour drive to Vegas just thinking about it!!!!  Drove to Vegas with my sister and she said I don't care what we do but we have to eat here.  I said sure, so it was the first place we went.  It was literally a bar with about 8 people in line ahead of us.  By the time we were seated there were at least 20 people waiting.  The food isn't fast food.  It's made from scratch in front of you so the wait can be long.  It was well worth the wait.  It is pricey but worth every penny!  You get a ginormous seafood gumbo roast that you can't finish no matter how hard you try.  They definitely don't skimp.  You can make it as spicy as you want, or not.  One of the chefs even gave me a free oyster since I was making a funny face watching him open them since I had never had one. It wasn't bad.  I will never leave Vegas again without going here.  You shouldn't either.

DzH13ehoDJOcHu7GKjgjAg.text: Me and my lady went yesterday morning at 930am to get a dozen oysters to start and then the gumbo and boulle roast. Everything was delicious and the portions were large we couldn't finish. This should have been a 5 star rating,  but we both ended up getting FOOD POISONING.  I don't want to get into those details but I'm still in bed trying to recover. Hopefully nobody else got it.

f0gfM3z1I3yO-eVndQtmag.text: SIMPLY INCREDIBLE! Worth the wait. Great staff very personal. My wife & I started with a dozen steamed clams, which were delicious.  Then we had a dozen raw oysters.MMMMmmm. Then I had the bouillabaisse & my wife had the Ciopinno.  All prepared right before our eyes.  This was easily, one of the best meals I have had in some time.  From now on when I'm in Vegas, this is a must to visit Oyster Bar.

qkxjwtqXH3xbXxlNGtDTqg.text: I treat myself to this place every year on my birthday.  I get the House Gumbo with extra okra spicy #7.  The pan roast is also delicious and the oysters shucked right in front of you.  Draft beer is a pretty good deal too considering this place is right in the middle of a casino.  There is limited seating, so there is usually a wait, especially on a Friday or Saturday night.  It's well worth the wait, but since they're open 24 hours a day, I usually go around 6 or 7 in the morning when there are few patrons and get two orders to go.  My intention is usually to wait for dinner time, but I rarely resist the temptation.

_A8TprSJAiwc9emsIO4gxw.text: We came here around 1:30am and the wait was still a little over an hour, BUTT it was worth the wait!!! The oysters were bomb and we got the Palace Pan Roast. It has seafood and sausage in it. We asked for it to be spicy (8 out 10 spicy). It was so delicious!!! If anyone's been to Ritter's Pan Roast, this place is WAY BETTER!!! It's a MUST TRY if you are willing to wait :)   If the wait wasn't so long, I'd give them a 5 star!! But the wait kind of kills you haha.

5s9IIHZSaZD_Gqb5EJIFBQ.text: I've been here maybe 3 or 4 times and I've never waited less than 3 hours, but it's worth it! The pan roast, chowder, and oysters are the best I've had. 5 stars for food and service, but 4 stars due to the wait. Would I wait again? Maybe...okay ya.

o5C0zKXeQR3q_XJk0kHDlQ.text: The best combo pan roast EVER. Okay fine, better than Kettle Bar (Anaheim) and Ritters (Santa Ana). Large and tender shrimp and lobster! (They throw out anything that's not big or fresh enough.) The sauce, brandy, etc. are delicious. Try it. You won't regret it. In fact, we'll bring ice packs and a cooler bag so we can take some home.   The oysters were okay. Alaskan chowder was good... but just shut up and get the combo pan roast!  Tip: go during off-peak early hours (e.g. 5-7am) during the weekday. Otherwise be prepared to wait in line (no seats, no pagers, no call/texting or reservations) for at least an hour or two. Even getting there at 2am is not going to be a short wait. They can only seat about 16 people at a time. Must be 21 or older.

jFuY6LlawW47leDEP0D5tg.text: Tried this place last night for the first time after hearing amazing things about it. We were a group of four and the wait was just over an hour. The line forms on the casino floor just steps away from the actual oyster bar. The bar as about 15-20 seats only. At any time this restaurant can only serve this amount of customers. We waited and finally four seats open up in a row. (Thank god) we were all a little on edge after having to stand up and wait for an hour, which literally felt like waiting for a Disneyland ride. (Perhaps seats while guests wait would be appropriate). Although the food was definitely worth the wait! Immediately we were served fresh baked rolls and placed our drink order. I recommend a nice white wine to pair with the seafood. My fiance and I ordered fresh oysters and Alaskan chowder to share. The couple we were with had the pan roast. All of which were amazing! Definitely worth the wait!! 4 stars only for having to stand for over an hour. This place doesn't take reservations. Even if the line looks short you will be waiting awhile!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saturday night line
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After a 3 hour line and we are first and it still takes 10 minutes to bus it

ZEFf5QN5tuPkkLoPhNuIww.text: Good food but a long wait. The only seats here are around the bar. We had a party of 4 and waited around 90min. I split a crab and lobster panroast (they charge extra to split btw), and it was delicious. I had never had panroast before, but now I'm a fan. The cooks are friendly and you get to watch them prepare your food right in front of you. We also got some fresh oysters here and I am not a fan, but that's because I apparently don't like raw oysters (I had never had them before). Tempted to give this place 4 stars because of the wait, but I enjoyed the food too much to only give it a 4. Too bad they don't have a to-go option.

aXLIch9Yq2s4FAyY3KXiVg.text: First off, expect a long wait unless you're coming at weird times like the extremely early morning times. This is a 24 hour joint. There's only about 15 spots for patrons at the bar. During normal hours, expect about a 2 hour wait. Also, this place is definitely not good for large parties, so look elsewhere if you are thinking about that.  The item to get here is most definitely the pan roast. It's a tomato based stew that is cooked right in front of you, as all the soups are, in individual portions and topped over white rice. The stew is hearty and full of flavor. This really hit the spot.  I also had oysters here, as it is the namesake of the bar. I thought they were just okay. Good for Vegas since it's so far from the ocean, but the quality of the oysters is far below those of cities near the sea, such as those I've had in Boston, SF, and Seattle.   Again, get the PAN ROAST!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam chowder
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast

-D1OjGbS6kGzpK2NNJXsQQ.text: This is literally a counter that seats 12.  Walk up, sit down, and order.  (Or if you come during prime hours, walk up, wait for two hours, sit down, order)    I am not a fan of oysters, but they looked so plump and fresh (shucked in front of your face!).  Everyone eating them looked like they were in heaven.  We ordered the Combo Roast (lobster, shrimp, crab).  I wasn't sure what to expect when the bowl was placed in front of me but. Holy. Stinkin. Moly. Partyyyyyy in my mouth!!! EXPLOSION of flavor.    The seafood is prepared to perfection in front of you via pan roasting technique and the final stew/soup/bisque (that you patiently wait 20 minutes for as it simmers) is quite possibly one of the most delicious things I've ever tasted.  It's been three days and I'm still thinking about it...Can't wait to go back to Vegas so I can eat this again :P*  Cue ALL delicious food related words! Nomsssss.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Roast, so freaking delicious!

8-saNkb9fjchVXXJCzMU9Q.text: Delicious! Been here over 5 times and no less than a 2 hrs wait in line. Then you have to wait another 20-30min to get your food. But service is awesome & the wait is worth it. You can also get noodles instead of the rice that is standard for the pan dishes ( their signature)

NA-CJ4pLRe8Qi0ot3F5W9g.text: Combo pan roast. Giant spoons. $5 split fee if you're sharing 1 pan roast. Open 24 hours! It gets kinda nipply sitting at the bar so don't come in your Vegas uniform, ladies, if you know what I mean~   The pan roast kinda tastes like lobster bisque. The soup base is creamy tomatoey with a little kick.  Yes, I am weaksauce for ordering a measly 4 out of 10 spicy levels but my body can only endure so much abuse in Vegas with the alcohol consumption, sleep deprivation, laying out by the pool, and dancing in heels all night. I've gotten pretty lucky with short or no lines in all of my visits.    I will be forever grateful to my coworker, Memo who said this place is a Vegas MUST!    There are $5 tables and penny slots galore if you are waiting in a long line. The raw oysters and bloody mary oyster shooters are also pretty good. Clams are also worth tasting - they have a tougher more rubbery texture compared to oysters though. Bob was The Man behind the magic 4 out of my 5 visits to the Oyster Bar. I have sometimes gone twice in one Vegas trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miss you, Bob
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

udH8cflO8bZkgbmH9YbL8g.text: This is one of Vegas' hidden gems! I totally love this place!!   Open 24 hours, we came here at 2am and waited in line for about 40mins to get seated. This is a bar inside the casino which could accomodate about 20 people max at a time. There's only two people working here, Chef EZ cooking and Steve serving, so expect to wait for your food to be ready. They have the steam kettles in front of you on the bar so you can watch how your food is prepared. Both these guys are so cool! They engage in conversation with you no matter how busy they are and it really makes for a more personal experience.   Food here is AMAZING!! Probably the best oysters I've had, EVER! It's sooooo fresh, chunky, and succulent. I can still taste it in my mouth. Hmmmmmm... For half a dozen, it's normally $11.99 but from 1am-9am, you can get it for $8.99. Score!!  PAN ROAST..what can I say? I'm still dreaming about this dish. I'm already planning my next trip to Vegas for more! Got the Combo Pan Roast which comes with lobster, shrimp, and crab. They're all sauteed with brandy, cream, and tomato then served with rice. You can opt to get the noodles for $1.99 extra which I did. I personally think it's a better match but you can taste and decide for yourself because they serve the rice with it on the side no matter what. It's a bit on the pricey side but you get what you pay for. Serving is big and you'll really see the actual seafood mixed in there. There were about 3 whole lobsters, 7 whole shrimps, and crab meat everywhere on my bowl! I shared this dish and we still had some leftovers.   The Alaskan chowder smelled and looked so delicious!! I"ll have to try that on my next visit. Can't wait!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Finally open seats! Shot taken at 3:45am
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast options and pricing
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moonlight specials

ny8XpzfQqgetQ8tpfvMJZg.text: The food is good .... but the service you shouldn't believe it .... the servers are too slow and kind a lazy .... two female servers are so bad .... they take so much time to clean the table to let people seated and of course they will tell their own reason .... I know they won't improve but if you guys don't mind just eat first before you come here and saw the truth of service ...

-iTb8uoKAPKe53cVwVcfdQ.text: Oysters are the only thing that I can say were good. Shellfish boil and bouillabaisse were both very bland. King crab legs are split for you, but we're very dry. Our server, Alan O., needs lessons in service or a different job. He just didn't want to wait on us. We had to flag him down to order, to pay even. Don't have to go back. And $6 to add rice . A domestic beer is cheaper than a craft beer? And a beer at $6.01? Yes, a penny, what's that about. Travel a lot and don't have to eat here again when in Vegas next year.

m03Orfyv24TNhW177Q1pzQ.text: This joint got the freshest biggest oysters I've had in Vegas.  Get the oysters. Everything else on the menu tastes okay.   Please, Yelp, these people don't need to know more beyond the two sentences I've provided. It's an oyster bar ffs what else would people expect

9dQhfWG8yIxPaUOtXA3apw.text: This is a must when visiting Vegas! The place is small and has about 16 seatings so be prepare for a wait! The food will make it worth it though. We usually go around 4am after we leave the clubs, but even then we sometimes have to wait around 20 minutes.  The server/waitress and chef are always friendly and attentive. I especially like how the chef is able to make all the food in front of us while still carrying fun conversations with everyone at the bar! They seem to remember their regulars as well.  Their pan roast is a must get. It is a creamy blend of different seafood flavors. If you can handle spicy, get a level of 5 or more. I didn't taste any with 5 so next time I will up it! Their clam chowder is also amazing. What stood out the most for me are their oysters!!! They are big, fresh, and so juicy!! I have to come here at least once every time I make a trip to Vegas.

B-nEavltEKlqxeAMrbvsXw.text: If you are in Vegas and any where near the Palace Station Hotel and Casino, go to the oyster bar.  I have been going here for years and this is the best oyster bar of any. Every thing is good but I suggest the combo pan roast, but the cioppino and the bouillabaisse are excellent. Add an oyster shooter and you are good to go.

eCFbgSMizblVSk-mXt7xQA.text: This my favorite oyster bar in town.  Good food and service.  You just have to be patience because there's usually an 45-60 min wait

Nd7O83C2Wz_cEEVxpK4pfQ.text: We got in line around 1:30am on a week night with about 16 people in front of us and we did not get seated until 3am. The bouliroast and prawn cocktails were very flavorful and the seafood was high quality. I would definitely skip the "gold band" oysters. It was not sweet, not briney, not creamy, kinda watery, just really lacking in both flavor and texture.  Service was very friendly and attentive. Good food overall but not sure if it is worth the wait.

m5VUmCGQEjxIu4EsRJWn7w.text: It was awesome! Prices match the sizes :)  House Gumbo - seasoned so well!  Seafood Jambalaya- The best! Oyster shots - DOIN IT AGAIN! 1 dozen half shell oysters - AGAIN & AGAIN & AGAIN!  Shrimp Scampi - if you like red sauce pasta, do it!   Overall, this spot is on point. The only dietary issue is they are pretty heavy on the salt. Obviously, its in the casino, which bothered me b/c Im sensitive to 2nd hand smoke.

cKl5MRQCy9ubQwtxrAK_LA.text: We were so excited to finally dine at the oyster bar.  We kept hearing great things so we figured it was ok to stand in the 2 hour plus line.  The staff and chefs were great but unfortunately,  we had bad oysters and were up all night vomittimg,  followed by montezuma's revenge!  We had the palace pan roast and seafood jambalaya which were good but the oysters have pretty much ruined our new years eve weekend. My suggestion... Skip the oysters.  We should've known,  seeing as there's no ocean anywhere near here.

c_oW-aJGA_mRUIdHbOBryw.text: The first piece of advice about the Oyster Bar? Prepare for a wait nearly anytime you come.  (At around 3:30PM though, it wasn't as bad as what I heard around 2AM where my friend waited for 3 hours).  And when you arrive there, you'll see why.  It's a tiny little area with seating only for about 20 people around a literal bar.    Indeed it's open for 24 hours but don't let that fool you either.  The food here is good and everything has spunk/personality.  Some cool notices - the food is prepped right in front of you.  The 'cooks' have a lot of personality.  And it's a great area to people watch such as seeing the regulars come on by.  Finally, they have a lot of late night deals.  Heads-up.  Drinks-wise, they have beer and wine available for around $5-$15 with a decent variety.  They also have oyster shooters in beer/tequila/vodka variants (3 for $10) and they taste delicious of course.  We had the tequila versions.  They also have raw oysters available as well as soups   Along with this comes a number of entrees. They have a number of dishes like jambalaya and some pasta all based on southern dishes.  The real things to focus on, in my opinion is the pan roast and gumbo.  I personally got the palace pan roast which comes with meat and shrimp while my friend got the combo which is basically seafood.  Another friend got house gumbo which came with seafood.  (PS: There is a split charge so just either try to get your individual dish and share if you want to taste or if you really have to - split it.)  The pan roasts were absolutely terrific.  We had them at a spice level of 7 and 8 for both pan roasts and 8 was still doable for those used to spices.  I personally was a bigger fan of the combo as well with the seafood really shining through and having a great taste.  You can also ask for the rice in it to be on the side.  The gumbo wasn't too bad although I personally preferred the creamier pan roast more.  And in the end, the meal was about $70-80 which was a great price for 3 people and a number of drinks/appetizers/main courses.    The wait may not always be worth it; the location far off the strip and the small seating arrangement kind of 'eh' but the meal is one of the better ones in terms of price and taste in Vegas and at least worth one look-see.

YwPnxeGnKWqpK52X6F5bgw.text: Expect on standing in line 1-2 hours, there is only 18 seats, only six dishes can be cooked at one time, it's in an old casino(Palace Station) and off the strip. Plan on having large portions, friendly service and your tastebuds tickled with FANTASTIC FOOD!!!!!  Worth the wait.

YAJsGKyr9q04PUJPhmDPoA.text: This is one of the best places to eat omg it's fantastic hands down ... If you haven't tried this place you really should two thumbs up

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EOIfYYWFbu8BLuLKrc2gZg.text: I read on yelp that this place has great food so I thought I'd stop by since I was in Vegas. First off there isn't much seating at all, I think it's less than 20 seats. Anyway I went on a cold day so there was a line and I waited an hour half but it was worth it.  My friend and I ordered the fresh dozen oysters and you get to watch them crack it open for you. Then comes the long wait for the good stuff, the seafood gumbo. I gotta say that this was one of my highlights of my trip (and I won $$$ gambling). I haven't tried much gumbo before but I gotta say that this was worth the hype. The sauce is great for the seafood and I know my gf will like this because she doesn't want her seafood tasting too much like "seafood". The sauce is a little spicy and they ask how spicy you want it from a scale of 1 to 10, I ordered mine a 4 yet it was still spicy so keep that in mind.  Overall I'm impressed by how one dish makes this place popular. The seafood gumbo is now a "must have" whenever I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Best Seafood Gumbo. I&#39;m gonna stare at this for a min.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Oysters!

SMkdoHxa56F7fdms1ZQlTg.text: This is A MUST when visiting Vegas.  I always try to have at least one meal here when I go to Vegas.  It's off the strip but well worth the drive or taxi.    I almost always order the Pan Roast with sausage.  It's the best!  It has seafood for seafood lovers and also for those that don't like seafood, you can get chicken and or sausage.  The sauce is creamy and buttery.  I'm not sure how much cream or butter they put in it, but they make each bowl fresh.  It's cooked in the steam kettle that takes about 20-30 mins to make.  It's worth the long wait, even 2 hours when I go at peak time.  I think there are only 11 seats so I wouldn't recommend for a large group.    Go at odd times to eliminate the long wait and small groups are recommended.    I usually like the smaller oysters but theirs were pretty large but were very fresh.  If you're not a huge fan of large raw oysters, don't get them, save your stomach for the pan roast.   Their portions are pretty big so sharing is a good option or left overs for the next day is always good. They will happily pack it up for you and even give you another bowl of rice.    Service is pretty good so I'll always return for my pan roast.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast at a different angle.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast.

a_wC0VWgMoCzuyRG65_jmA.text: I never would have ventured to Palace station, let alone Oyster bar had my school not set me up to stay the weekend here for a school/work thing. But my fate was in good hands. Our first night at Palace station we wandered the hotel to see what goodies it had to offer. I noticed the small, but crowded Oyster bar and the corresponding line. Checked it out on Yelp, and decided I would have a meal here before the weekend was over.   On my last day, the bf and I had the pleasure of dining here. We shared a combo pan roast and had a half dozen oysters. Oysters were shucked in front of our very eyes and were delicious, fresh, and succulent. There is a decent wait for the pan roast which explains the constant line here. Each order is individually cooked (or should I say roasted) in this contraption thingy. I don't have a better explanation for what that thing is so you'll just have to come and see it for yourself! It is a very entertaining process to watch. The pan roast had a mix of seafood and has a tomato-bisque-like taste, but think more creamy, more melt-in-your-mouth goodness. One bowl was more than enough for sharing. Although I may have been seen licking my bowl at the end, and that's only because I couldn't get enough.   Our waitress was delightful and pretty comical. She suggested an extra scoop of rice since we were sharing the pan roast, an excellent suggestion on her part. I'll have to remember to come here again the next time I'm in Vegas since it is a bit off the beaten path. I really just wanted to use that phrase. Well really this is a good 10-15 minutes west of the strip, definitely a cab ride or short drive away from an excellent meal!

j4g3U3qbkL7yvEIyFAxWSw.text: The only downside is the wait! We waited for 2 hours with about 12 people in-front of us, but the crab pan roast was very very delicious! We also ordered the gumbo at spic level 4....heads up, that was pretty spicy!!! Very good though! Next time I want to try the clam chowder, I heard it's worth the wait!

FJeevAtGKnbZB_Dry7uoqw.text: So impressed of the food and service here! It is a casual, friendly environment, with a good selection of soul food. My sister and I had the Pan Roast Combo and the bouillabaisse with sides of rice and noodles. Both dishes were loaded with seafood, and very tasty. A little bit on the salty side, but a good overall experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sizzling
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast Combo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch

ANR1ZuP0zOZNSGzwxbJD-A.text: I have no idea what the hype is about this place. They only have 18 seats around the counter. The wait time is horrendous. We waited for an hour and a half to be seated. Then, we waited for another half an hour for the food to come out after ordering. As I was waiting in line to be seated, I saw that they do takeout. I went up to the counter to order takeout, and was told that I still needed to wait in the same line as the seating line to do takeout. If that's the case, what's the sense in doing takeout, you're waiting the same amount of time.  Almost everyone I know loves their pan roast. It was mediocre at best for me. I ordered the Lobster Pan Roast.  You get to pick the spiciness level from 1 to 10. I chose level four and it wasn't spicy at all. It came in a creamy tomato broth, which was really tasty. However, the seafood is not fresh as stated. I could tell from the texture of the lobster that it was frozen before being prepared. On top of that, I only got a few pieces of lobster, not worth the $21.99 I paid for it. It was interesting to see them prepare the food in front of you. They have these metal pots that they cook the food in. First, they cook the seafood. Then, they pour in the cooking wine. Last, they put in the sauce.  My husband doesn't like seafood, so he ordered the Caesar salad. It was a large plate and the greens were fresh. I really liked the salad.   The workers here were really nice. They didn't have a sense of urgency, though. They knew the line was long, and took their sweet time bussing the dishes and seating the people. They didn't really care if people left.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. then they add in the cooking wine
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. first they cook the seafood
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad

_9xVC9xLYqIkly7TSl_CZg.text: Ahh waited for 2.5 hours to get seated for 6 people the day after christmas. Arrived around 10pm and didn't get seated until 12:15, but it was definitely worth it.  We ordered the 2 dozens of raw oysters, combo pan roast with lobster, crab, & shrimp, seafood jambalaya, shrimp linguine, and their clam chowder. The raw oysters were good and it tasted really fresh. Their pain roast is AMAZING. (HIGHLY RECOMMENDED)   Note: - There's only 18 seating per time and it's at the bar. - The bar right next door sells super cheap drinks so you can kill time. - Try a bit of everything if you're planning to go with a group of 4+ so you can taste a bit of everything. (That's what I did)

RqqBnsjx6_wMyBXdvWeqxA.text: I found this place because it's highly recommended by a friend, I knew the line is long, but it's longer than what I imagined. My husband and I waited 4hr to be seated (for 2 people), but the food was just ok. The sauce and the soup is way too heavy, I can barely taste the seafood. Consider the price and the wait time, there is so many other choices in Vegas. NOT WORTH 4 hour.

p4IlBIXhFI5p7tTe8K9mAg.text: Great taste, fresh oysters. Although we waited over 1.5 hr, it's absolutely worthy. All dishes were served in a timely manner. The price was fair. We would suggest all our friends to come here and enjoy these amazing seafood. If more seats are available in the future to make the waiting time shorter, it should be more attractive

ZYE8PIBLWy-sb-Xwtv2qxQ.text: Oyster bar is located in Palace Station and tucked away in the casino. There's only about 16 or so bar seats with a sectioned off area for the line near some slot machines. Standing in a line behind 14 people took just a bit over 1.5 hours at around 11am on a Saturday. Note: its open 24/7.   Service was decent and semi-quick in bussing the bar to ensure patrons get seated as quickly as possible. I noticed one cook, one busser/server, another coming to the bar here and there from the back.  I decided on a dozen oysters $20 and combo pan roast $23.99. A bread roll is also served upon seating.  Pan Roast with white rice- creamy tomato stew with shrimp crab and lobster. This was shared between two people and we got 2 servings of rice at no extra charge. Ordered at a level 7 spice, and it had a kick, but not overwhelmingly spicy. At first bite, you get so much flavor. Creamy, buttery, at times chunky. Good amount of seafood added. Overall absolutely delicious. Oysters - big, firm, slippery. Good for the price and as a starter.  Hot sauce tray available in between every couple of seats.   There's only about 6-8 kettles, so there can be a wait even when you sit. It's about a ten minute cooking time, so it's not that bad. I was pleased by this visit, despite the long waiting time. Might as well have a drink while you wait in line. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu 2
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu 1
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen oysters

toVlWRYY-70UbJHO7eU-jg.text: Amazing! Amazing! Amazing! Thanks to the help of Yelp I was able to find a great place to eat for the first time in my travels to Las Vegas.   Clams on the half shell took me back to my New York City days. Walking down to the Fulton Fish Market where the local kids from the Lower Eastside worked after school. These clams came all the way from Florida and every bit worth the money. To taste the ocean from one morsel of mollusk. Wow!  The House Gumbo with extra okra and level 4 of heat was more than enough for this Paratrooper to handle.   My wife ordered the BBQ/Spicy Shrimp- so much flavor banging on some big SQWIMPS! Lol   Love the way and technique the chef had going in the kitchen. It was like a food orchestra with 5 gallon steam kettles.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My girl spending time with me. I love me some Southern Girl.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Be prepared to wait in line for an hour. I had great company and I met a brother (Veteran) and believer in Christ standing in line.

gCNzAE3XWEcYocppiG9q_Q.text: If you want to experience a True flavor party in your mouth then try the Oyster Bar in the Palace Station. I normally always stay on the strip but was recommended to go to this off the strip local favorite. The hotel itself was nice but nothing to rival the beautiful strip hotels. I give it 3/5. We walked back to the bar and I was surprised it was an actual bar. It seats only 18-20 at a time. We waited 45 minutes with others to finally be seated. While waiting I asked several patrons and found that the Pan Roast and Gumbo were the fan favorites. Once seated we waited another 30-40 minutes for our meal. The deco is minimal and the service is a 7/10. Although they were very nice it was a bar and not fine dining after all. But this is were things got interesting, I ordered the crab, shrimp and lobster Pan Roast add sausage. It arrived and it was steaming hot, creamy and delicious. The large chucks of shrimp, lobster and crab were shocking.  The rich creamy, tomato sauce provides a stew like base to suspend the chunks of seafood. I had mine served over rice. It was delicious and very filling. I recommend getting one and sharing it with a friend or taking it home for lunch the next day. So here's the take....if you want a delicious meal and don't mind eating at a bar with fair service then this place is for you. As a foodie I'd rather have mediocre service and decor but delicious food than the other way around. I highly recommend this place and plan to stay by on every trip to Vegas. It's that good!  I new favorite!

u37_SbZZPPcnaaqbX7AHsA.text: I had to wait in line for an hour!! But the wait was so worth it!! I ordered a dozen of fresh oysters ($21.99) and Bouillabaisse ($25.99). The oysters were so fresh  oysters and large in size. The bouillabaisse was filled with  shrimp, crab, and lobster under a juicy tomato soup base broth. It was a bit on the expensive side for a meal, but the quality is 5 stars. I will definitely come back in the future and I recommend this place to all seafood lovers!!! By the way, service was excellent.

DcC7xORYs_UhF_VLDPdVhg.text: Loved it!!!  Would go again!  I had the Combo Pan Roast!  It was delicious!  It just melts in your mouth...my son had the Mac n cheese and he sure loved it!  I didn't get to take a pic of the Combo Pan Roast cause I was too excited to eat it!  Server was awesome too!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Zealand Mussels!  Delicious!

6dtzJF_ts-uPCOxXP0XFqg.text: This place is great! Open 24/7.. No reservations are needed. Customer service is good. Your food is made at the bar and they're quick about it. The house gumbo is amazing!!! It has four different types of meats; sausage, shrimp, lobster, and crab. There are different levels of spice 1-10, one being not spicy and ten being spiciest. I got a level 5 and it was perfect. Overall this place was exceptional. Can't wait to try the pan roasted lobster ;)

P-WbTc84TvQoLg95XxPqfA.text: Station, are by far my favorite casino's.   So, I've never been to a place like this because I'm an old man. I usually just do the buffet when I come. This time, I was invited here with my friends to do hood rat stuff. We met at the oyster bar, and luckily I was late running on Black people's time because the wait was about and hour and a half. Mind you, people have to stand there and wait. Once seated we ordered a few entries and a few beers (I'm the sober one)My salad and soup came before everyone else's dish. I was half way done before their food came. Taste was weird because they add horseradish to the salad, but I still ate it. The vibe was cool, basically in a smokey casino full of drunk people...we live in Vegas, so you gotta be use to that by now. May return one day, who knows.
