xvoFmcToHkzwDV8okajT-Q.text: It's very understandable why there is always long wait after my first visit. They are literally for bar seating which only have 18 seats. I have waited for about 100 minutes for two seats. My husband and I ordered half dozen of oyster, an New England clam chowder and a kettle seafood pot soup. The oyster came right after because they prepare it in front of us but the clam chowder took about 20 minutes to come. Meanwhile, they cook the seafood pot in front of the customers, they have six cooking pots and each pot cook for one order. It took two round for our order to be cooked. This is why it takes time to prepare, cooking and serve foods. The quality of the foods are decent but I don't think it's worth to wait for that long. It's unique to try for once but I would go for other options if you have in mind. Waitresses are very friendly. Prices are fair. I would recommend people to try for their first time.

RHECy5c6wbbGI1BC6kQBSA.text: Waited 90 minutes to be seated. Totally worth it!! Food did not disappoint. Staff was friendly even though they were working their tails off. Gumbo and Bouillabaisse-Roast were so, so good.

IJrdDRUxG3kYe42SqijrOw.text: Very limited seating with endless long wait for a over rated food, if you have nothing to do, then wait on line. Otherwise, don't waste your time here. The food in Palazzo and other places are way better than here. Disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s_v55YTdZzzMvVUYbtNnGA.text: Went there with a lady friend of mine, around 3:30 in the morning- had to just wait a little in line- but so worth it- great staff and even greater food- well worth the time and money. I will be going back.

HYetTwZNKhVx4qcTw5xMNQ.text: Be warned, the wait is real. Hidden deep inside the Palace Station, The Oyster Bar is only able to sit around 16 patrons at a time. You're looking at around an hour of meal time when you factor in ordering, apps, food prep, and eating itself. This can create an outrageous wait time, especially during peak hours. For reference, we waited 1.5 hours when there was a big party in front of us. It didn't help that the host, annoyingly, let this certain party add around 6 more of their late friends to the group. AND if you decide to go as a group, note that you most likely won't be seated together.   We ordered a dozen oysters along with our Pan Roast with white rice to share between two. At $20, the oysters were a great way to start off the meal. Fresh and thankfully missing any pungent seafood smell, this held us over as we gazed upon the chef working his magic. Though we shared the Pan Roast, our server offered us an additional side of rice at no charge. Much to our surprise, the portion size for our Pan Roast was more than enough for two. The smooth tomato stew littered with a melody of seafood staples, shrimp, crab, and lobster, was a thing of dreams. You instantly get hit with its rich creamy tomato base with fresh aromatic herbs and cajun flavors. The seafood is also discernible unlike most other kettle bars we've been too. It had me wanting to scrooge mcduck dive into the bowl. No joke.  They stay True to their spice levels as a 7 out of 10 was enough to get me the sniffles.  For a small establishment, they only have 3 workers tending to the restaurants needed. One cook, one kettle chef, and one server/host. Turnover is a bit slow due to the nature of the meal but they're quite quick to bus the station for the next station. Overall, Oyster Bar is by far the best Kettle Bar around. It's a shame we don't anything this great back in Cali. And did I mention its open 24/7...that's simply amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the bar
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen Oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast

-dA0HenSAgYWGOWeQKkEpQ.text: I've had some really amazing etouffee before, so today I decided to order it. Turned out to be extremely salty I couldn't eat it. They were nice enough to offer me a cup of chowder and waived my dish from the check.   The pan roast and chowder were both great and loaded with seafood, but etouffee was a nightmare.

sCqczndc_f1VAQRHO1exmA.text: The oyster bar is one of the few places I am willing to wait 2 hours standing the entire time just to eat! The reviews are not lying, yes it is that good, yes the lines are long, and yes people will wait for it! I have waited for a spot at that bar top always more than an hour but never over three. So plan accordingly. Bring a friend and rotate line holders, they DO NOT seat if your party is incomplete. And you guessed it, if you order to go you still gotta wait and to be seated for that order!  If you make your way down here try the pan roasts, don't opt in from a clam chowder, or gumbo, you're here for the real deal. PS add in the sausage! Be careful with the spice level, I am a weenie, and a three is great for me, my man chooses a 5 and that is plenty for him! Oysters are a must, and just sit back and watch the chef make your meal in front of you! (One of the best parts in my opinion.) I have been to the other oyster bars, (south point & sunset ) they say its the same...but its nothing like the original, we recently came here last week and its always good, the servers are quick, and the chef who is always working after midnight is a stud! He always makes people laugh, even when he is swamped, you couldn't even tell if he was busy!

dF33k8HBw7792r4jOj2S4g.text: Still top 5 places to eat when visiting Vegas! Lines are long on the weekends so be prepared to wait a few hours. Bouillabaisse and Pan roast are a must... accompanied by some raw clams! Yeeeeee

5eUbslfP259aRRE_AzRDnQ.text: Wow! This place is amazing. The food was fantastic. I heard about the long lines here, so I decided to come here around 3am Sunday night. I still waited in line for about 15 minutes, but I noticed around 4am there were a few empty seats at the bar and no line.  Apps: Steamed Little Neck Clams - they were served in a garlic butter sauce and they were delicious.  Steamed New Zealand Mussels - mussels were fresh tasting and very plump. Great garlic sauce. Excellent dish!!!!  Dozen Raw Oysters - very fresh and huge. Excellent oysters!!!  Bouillabaisse - I ordered it spicy (5). It was amazing. The broth was so good and the seafood was very fresh tasting. They gave me a side of jasmine rice to mix with it. I will definitely be ordering this again.  Combo Pan Roast - this was also excellent, but I personally don't care for the creamy tomato sauce. If you like this type of sauce though, I am sure you will love it.  I understand why everyone says to come here now. This place is amazing and I absolutely recommend that you try it.  The Shock Top on tap was pretty good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zytNklMBw5zFuWdzHE9O_g.text: Located inside Palace Station Hotel & Casino, Oyster Bar is a great place to get a bite to eat especially after a long night of clubbing, drinking, or gambling. If I didn't need to wait in line for  an hour and half each time I went, I would love this place even more.   There are no reservations and the lines can get long after midnight, but if you are willing to wait your patience will be rewards. And if you are there from 1 am-9 am their happy hour special is half a dozen oysters for $10. These oysters are not tiny ones that I typically get from shops in San Francisco; these are meaty, delicious and have no sand.   But if you are not a raw oyster person, you cannot go wrong ordering the very popular Combo Pan Roast. It is cooked right in front of you and arrives pipping hot and creamy. The portion size is really enough for two people when you include the rice and bread or just one very hungry person.  Other delicious dishes are the Alaskan Chowder, New England style, Etouffee, and Seafood Jambalaya. But if it's your first time, order the oysters and Pan Roast and come back the next night, like I did to try everything else.  What I recommend:  -- Combo Pan Roast -- New England Alaskan Chowder

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OZzUEBDmUU25nn9aos_C8w.text: DISCLOSURE: There can be a long wait so be sure that you are not starving.    I heard great things about this place and YAY, I finally got a chance to try it out.  Came here on a Sunday morning and thank God the wait was only 30 minutes for 4 people.  We were second in line and all the seats were taken.  (We waited until we could all sit together)   I've heard that the line can get long and the wait can be over an hour.    Food:  Palace Pan Roast: Shrimp, Crab, Chicken and Andouille Sausage Etouffee: Traditional Cajun Stew prepared with Shrimp, Crab and Lobster  Both dishes were delicious and made before your eyes.    Service:  Although they were accommodating, the cook/chef was a tad bit obnoxious or to me rude.  I know he was joking around with the staff and other patrons but I personally did not like his responses and attitude.  Lastly, I noticed that he only changed his gloves once while we sat there.  He cut vegetables, opened oysters, washed the pots turning on the water etc. and bussing.  Kind of gross but hey I guess it added flavor while he sprinkled garnishes on my Pan Roast.    Overall, I will still return to this establishment because the food is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i2jzzAb5_lGAjDvgTQJNbw.text: Many of the Station Hotel Casino's have the Oyster Bar. I have been to Palace Station, Texas Staion, Sunset Station, and Santa Fe Station. All are on par except Sunset Station which charges more, provides less (quantity), and has the worst bread. Palace Station only has 18 eats so the wait is a bit longer (but is the only Oyster Bar of the group that is 24/7). For me, it is worth the 10 minute drive to go to Texas or Santa Fe Stations for no wait.  The food, the Pan Roasts are off the charts amazing! If you have not tried you are missing a great meal. Fresh Seafood sauteed with Brandy, Cream and Tomato. Served with Steamed Rice.   Delicious!

tCnJxKHW5-htEnWGhmJ8uQ.text: Came on a week night (i think Tuesday) and only waited about 15 minutes.  Shared a pan roast with the wife. And 1/2 dozen oysters.  the oysters are huge.  pan roast was so so good.  forgot what spicy level but if was perfect.  still had leftovers between the two of us.

rDLPHIb50cLox5bQVrZCBg.text: The hype is real. Oyster Bar is undoubtedly the best pan roast this side of the US. There are a number of reasons why you wouldn't want to eat at Oyster Bar.  1.  There are only a handful of seats. You know what that means. Expect to wait. Which brings me to #2. 2.  The wait is on average 1.5 hours. I considered myself lucky with only having to wait 1 hour to be seated. However, it may take as long as a half hour to actually get your food. 3.  The line pours into the casino. No, you cannot leave and expect to get your original spot in line. Don't be surprised if your back door is facing someone sitting at a slot machine, with cigarette smoke fanning towards your face.  Knowing all of this, people are still willing to wait and I now understand why.  Combo Pan Roast -- I watched Bob prepare my pan roast with so much ease it was like 2nd nature to him. He threw in generous scoops of shrimp, crab and lobster. Just that alone impressed the heck out of me. The local spots in my area are pretty chintzy with the seafood portions, and those spots are priced higher than Oyster Bar! The bisque alone had so much depth to the flavor and it had the perfect, creamy consistency. I ordered a level 7 spicy which was probably too daring of me because it was pretty darn spicy. Nevertheless, I still enjoyed my meal.   Not only do you need to go to Oyster Bar but you will want to hope to God Bob is the chef on duty because he is honestly the better chef compared to the other chef I saw.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

baG0RiLCHtWddcPcjxggbg.text: PAN ROAST COMBO WAS SO DELICIOUS! My go to spot whenever in vegas.   Tip: if you get there around lunch time be prepared to wait, we waited for about 2hours -__- but it was worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OWezz8PovpWb19_A0IfTpg.text: By far the best oyster bar in Vegas!  Raw oysters, raw clams, and pan roast are money.  No need to order anything else!

SDE5iENF3A280ctXgzcRqg.text: We visited this place last year and yes I would still recommend it after a year. It wasn't a real restaurant instead it's like a food section serving people in the casino....but!!!! Food are amazing and wayyyyyyy better than those highly recommended restaurants on the strips we ordered four, five different dishes and THEY ARE ALL GOOOOOOOD!!! Chowder, oyster, pan fried!!!! Love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sFlALH3NKvx1v_A52MkJlQ.text: A line of 15 people does not look like it would take 2 hours to get through BUT it really does. The biggest gamble I took on this trip was coming here at 8 PM on my Saturday night.  Waiting Tips:  1. There is a bar in the casino with very reasonable prices, pour it up. 2. Gamble  Location  The Palace Station is an old casino hotel that is off strip, decently maintained but a bit clustered. The Oyster Bar is in the middle of all that but when you're seated and eating you become oblivious to it.   Service  The service was okay. The servers are not the best at making recommendations, it's like they expect you to know the menu. But the cooks had the right attitude, Professional and hilarious.  Food  Cold Seafood Combination: Fresh. If you know my reviews you know I'm a talker but fresh is all I have to say here. (Be careful with their dipping sauce, tangy and very spicy) 4.5/5  Shrimp Scampi (white sauce): It's a linguini stew with shrimp. The linguini was softer than average but still within a standard deviation of average. The shrimp was as fresh as it was in the combination platter minus the "cold." The sauce was basic but added a gentle soft buttery taste to the linguini. 3.75/5  Shrimp and Lobster Fra Diablo: Sauteed shrimp and lobster..TASTY sauteed shrimp and lobster. The spiciness in the sauce added major flavor to this and made it better than the shrimp scampi. 4.25/5  BEWARE  Eating raw foods can be harsh on the stomach, so be wise about eating here, it wouldn't be fun to let one little oyster ruin your chances at getting "lucky."  Worth the Wait?  It is but not late night, you'll end up spending half your night here. A 430/530 arrival time would be ideal. The food is fresh and one of the best seafood offerings that you'll find in the 702.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fk-nlmvdNFd6Lr6g5jv4EA.text: This is a great place to eat at Palace Station. I recommend getting the "Bouill Roast," a not-so-secret menu item that is half-bouillabaisse and half-pan roast. There are chunks of crab, shrimp, lobster, clams, and mussels in a milky tomato stew. So good.  The worst part about The Oyster Bar is easily the wait. The bar only seats approximately sixteen people and diners seem to take FOREVER to finish their food. Be prepared to stand anywhere between one to three hours in line, depending on the time of day. I'd recommend coming early or not at all.

B-ylpdKoedStpBI_v_9nHA.text: Best I have had in Las Vegas  Lived in New Orleans LA  This was awesome!! Oysters and house special  Always a line worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yes the Oysters were tasty  Recommend to our friends
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fEF9unJJle0P9laZLprgVw.text: They're  not really competent running this place. We've been big fans of a similar style restaurant in California named Ritters, so we decided to try this spot.   The line is extraordinarily long, due to it not being an actual restaurant, but a counter with about 16-18 seats, that's all. They seat in order, strictly, so we waited for a long time, and in front of us was a group of 7 and another of 4. When the group of 7 was finally seated, they allowed them to sneak in 2 more people, effectively giving away my 2 seats. When we ordered, they gave our order to another couple who arrived and were seated after us, claiming it was identical order. The 2 couples in line behind us were served and paid their check before we even finished. They gave us a 20% discount, but too much damage had been done. Would never return - this is no 2 hour wait sort of place.

Sy_UvY9eotkvlirjRnZN7g.text: The food is great! I am taking one star off for the wait... 2 hours in line and about an hour for food, but I think it was longer because there was a larger take out order of 8 items and a party of 6 as well.   Chris the server was great! Quick with cleaning the areas up and getting our orders taken care of. He was very encouraging with Roberto the Chef. Roberto was fabulous juggling all those orders! Especially with a huge take out order + all the people sitting and waiting for their food. It's crazy to watch one man cook for that long and for that many people. Talk about fast pace work environment.  I was with my Maid of Honor! ;) Good thing it was just the two of us. - Dozen Oysters - huge oysters, server can schuck them too, so they may get served a little earlier - Combo Pan Roast - MUST GET THIS. I WILL COME BACK FOR THIS. Delicious and flavorful - House Gumbo - I will pass on this because everything else was much yummier ;) - Shrimp and Lobster Fra Diablo - DELICIOUS will probably get this one too!  Just have to find a quiet time where there isn't a crazy line.   NOTE:  - No one under 21 allowed at the Bar  - To order take-out you need to stand in that same line - Ordering take-out you are only allowed two items per person

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast --- this is all you need!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. YUMMM! Our meal minus oysters

leqGQ8698LjFWWcqIUEp2g.text: More of a 3.5 star. The wait was ridiculously long. Thought coming on a Sunday around 12:30am wouldn't be as bad but had around a two hr wait. The line was always about 15 people deep. It's first come first serve so the group of 6 will be sat before a group of 3 even though there are 3 seats open at that time. From 1am-9am 1/2 dozen oysters are $10 but $19.99 for a dozen regular priced. They definitely do not skimp on the size. The oysters were shucked at the bar and come out fresh and plump. Don't eat too much bread and save your stomach for the pan roast since it's a huge portion. It comes out piping hot and is seriously delicious but not sure I could wait two hours for it again. The staff said they're the slowest around 7am so swing by early morning instead of late night.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen raw oysters, house gumbo, and combo pan roast

gXZwFjTg6qEQ4NhtUaQzyA.text: The only reason for the 4 stars is due to the long wait. We must have waited in line for about 2 hours before being seated, then probably another hour for our food before we could eat.  With that said, the food was worth the wait. While standing in line the guy in front of us, who is a regular recommend the Pan Roast combo. After looking at the menu, I decided to go with his recommendation. I'm glad I did, as it was a winner.  After seeing how it is made right in front of us I understand why it had so much flavor. So many ingredients went into making this super tasty dish.  Would I stand in that line again? For me personally, probably not multiple times on one trip to Vegas, but I definitely would stand in the line again, maybe once a trip to Vegas. It was totally worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast combo, it&#39;s absolutely delicious!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onolicious!

sMq9qMfp-PxlIJDZjo0ydA.text: EASILY one of my favorite places to eat in Las Vegas. Oyster Bar is super small and located in Palace Station. It's literally just a little "bar" where we eat. FYI: The wait can take up to 2-3 hours. (Minus one star for the wait) But seriously, if people are going to complain about the wait, then don't eat here. You already know that you're gonna be waiting 1-2 hours + soooo don't complain. IT'S TOTALLY WORTH THE WAIT.  My friend and I ordered a dozen oysters and the pan roast. The oysters are freshly chucked right in front of you. Seriously my favorite place to get oysters. Can't get any better than here. And the pan roast, LET ME TELL YOU. Its soooo rich and thick, but SOOO delicious and filling. You have the option of either having rice on the side or pasta. I usually get rice on the side, but the most recent time I went, I got pasta and wow!! What a game changer. I love pasta with the pan roast!!  I've had pan roast else where.. But it doesn't compare to here. Seriously, no comparison. (boosted up the stars again because it's just too good!!)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. THE FAMOUS PAN ROAST *___*
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A dozen oysters freshly chucked in front of you

QFQuqi_8E2Ujw5VdjrDLTQ.text: Fantastic dinner at the Oyster bar we had a dozen oysters, steamers,house gumbo and cioppino. My only complaint would be the size of the clams they were tiny but very flavorful. Everything was yummy and worth the 55 minute wait.

s7PqbsO-Oeh2gnB9uTBUgg.text: My husband absolutely HATES lines, he hates them.  We were maybe 7 or 8 deep and we wanted for almost TWO HOURS.  Bless his heart, he knew I really wanted to try it here so he sucked it up and kept me company without much fuss.  Soon as we sat down, we ordered the oysters and the pan roasts.  The minute the pan roast hit his palate, he forgot about the wait.  That's something.

aaVi5Pz2SctM0LdWc0mhGg.text: This place has hundreds of reviews so I can't imagine what I have to say that is different, so I will just say this: the wait time to get a seat is ridiculous. I was thinking to myself that this food better be phenomenal in order to justify the wait. And you know what? It was. I got the jumbo pan roast (shrimp, crab, lobster), and the wife got the crab pan roast. Both were extraordinary. So, check out this place, but be ready to stand in line a long time. In the end the wait is well worth the patience. I would return in a heartbeat.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside the action

Aw5LQxahnzyFXMKE3txmXA.text: Gumbo or jambalaya? This is the only spot in Vegas you should go to!! They are not playing here! Now they always have a line. Always!!! Last time I went, we waited over a hour for a seat but the food is so worth it! Service I top notch and the food will make you comeback everytime!

odh8OR4HW-6HJpPz9RU3vw.text: I want to start out by saying that I really wanted to give this place five stars, unfortunately my experience with their "fresh oysters" is stopping me from doing that.   I waited in line for about an hour, and started off my meal with fresh oysters. They were abnormally huge and bulging, which led me to believe that they were frozen at some point. I hoped they would taste okay, but I could only bring myself to eat one. I was a bit grossed out by the texture. The couple next to me also experienced something similar.  Moving on...   I ordered the pan roast, and added sausage to my order. Have to say this dish was absolutely amazing. It made the whole "hour in line" thing worth it. I didn't even care about the oysters at that point. Give it a try! I'm definitely going back, minus oysters this time.

k_5MBJOkOaHHSlmABQYwlQ.text: The food here is amazing. I got the gumbo and loved it. Service could be better, the waitress and chef felt pretty cold.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wJm0rmTAAt4i2svLzOE4OQ.text: So far not loving it. 10:40pm and the wait has been 45 mins so far (standing, served no drinks). Doesn't seem like anybody is managing this place. Hope the food is better than the pre-meal experience.  :-(   Later that evening....  Food was great...but took about 20-25 minutes to come. Every seat was full (15) the entire time I was there. Chef was great too...working and networking. Had Oysters on the half shell and the house Gumbo. Both really good but the entree portions are big, you could share one.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Picture of bar from line.

RgX9UKph2SRb_MiZlAvxnA.text: Went here for a late dinner last night (around 12:30am, weeknight). One of the best meals I've ever had, worth the hour wait. We ordered a dozen oysters, the combo pan roast, Alaskan chowder, and Cioppino. Everything was incredibly good, but the pan roast was my favorite. The chef cooks everything in front of you, which is nice because we can see how fresh the ingredients are. Will absolutely come back again and recommend it.

DJzaSufa3L3uBPYkfYZR5A.text: What more is there to say that everyone else hasn't? I have wanted to come here for years, finally did by booking a weekend at Palace Station with my mom (boy does the casino blow, but that's another review).  We didn't have to wait at all on a Friday, got there around 6pm.   Got a half a dozen raw oysters and clams each, sweet waitress gave it to us for the price of a dozen oysters to save money.  Bottle of white wine was under $30.  I got the gumbo, mom got the crab pan roast. I had serious food envy...we both got it at a 5/10. Sat next to a kid and his mom that lived in town and he got a 10! Boy was it fun to watch him eat that slowly.   Total meal...less than $100, in Vegas that's a steal.  We went back the next day to split a house pan roast, got a 6/10...depending on who cooks it for you the heat level can vary with the numbers. If you are unsure just get a lower number, you can always spice it up. We also got a crab cake...there are happy hour prices, it was yum.  I might be back for lunch next month when I am in Vegas again...yeah it's that good.

BX88oBo6Rva1jaB__gUZWg.text: This place was amazing! It's off the strip, but definitely worth a cab ride to. We ordered: -bowl of clam chowder -jumbo bacon wrapped shrimp - combo pan roast with rice  For two people, this was wayyyy too  much food. But everything was delicious! Our bill  came out to under $50, which I have to say is good for a seafood meal. The wait was long, but worth it.

pwzE3NX7A5eEGUH6UxYLFQ.text: My food (Combo Pan Roast with added clams) was 5 stars.  My super patient and friendly waitress, Brenda, who made sure my selection was gluten-free was also 5 stars.  Being captive to cigarette smoke while waiting in line and eating was not 5 stars.  We waited for about an hour to 90 minutes at 10pm on a Thursday.  Our chef wasn't talkative, but it was fun watching him work.  There is nothing more to say that hundreds of people haven't already said better.

Yv1UhRjZxg7KfjeBooemBA.text: This is always a "must" on any trip to Vegas. We've even been known to go straight from the airport. The wait can, admittedly, be long, but is SOOO worth it. You can't go wrong with the pan roast, as spicy as you want it. And it's a floor show, too, watching the chefs work their magic! Salivating just writing this review... Sigh. Go. Seriously.

Hy9rF9xuRZdZDMtke7dEhA.text: Left after waiting for over two hours (just two people) in a smoke filled casino. We found the service to be extremely slow with no just reason. It is a bar with approximately 12 seats and there were about 5 people working.  Not worth the time and if you are staying at the strip, it is not worth the travel there either.

4n9N9X1fVhIIVeYhApe6tw.text: First time here amazing food by far, I had the pan roast combo with spicy 3, everything was fresh made  in front of you. A great place to stop if you are ever in Vegas and love seafood. Cooks and staff are very hospitable and friendly. Worth the wait in line

fCJrJwYAgoZczPJcGwsVSA.text: When I'm in Las Vegas this on stop I don't miss! I love their food it is the best Cajun and creole food. I always eat the house gumbo. If you don't mind waiting for a seat you will not regret the wait. It is well worth it. Love this Place!

q-pyNfA6Cgbn3iaH3LNqfw.text: The Oyster Bar is one of my favorite places. I am eaten there many times and it is always good.

eMYZHl1TNsyHu-xO993RUQ.text: Been coming here for years and Ive waited an avg of 2 hours each time. 6 at the most.  Now I want to give a horrible review and talk this place down and make you go to the one at Harrahs so that less people come but that's not going to happen.   Well, been here many times and never reviewed because I really want this place to be a secret lol  yeah right.....so popular.   Anyway, I wanted to Thank Christina and Nora for their wonderful service.  They work so hard and always have a smile.  And for those who give them a hard time....im sure its because you're tired of waiting and it might be your first time.  Please be patient...this place can be off the hook...they have a good system.    Christina and Nora have developed a way to get everyone taken care of in the most efficient manner. Sooooo you may see several chairs empty and you wonder why .....just trust them....they will seat you when its most effective.  They run a rotation and it may seem like you are not be attended to but its not...just wait and enjoy.   So, when you see that Christina or Nora working....have faith....they are great and amazing.   The cooks....i met a few ...never got names but....Thank you for the hard work and prep'in the food to perfection each time.  You are great at your craft.   Thanks again girls for taking care of us.   -  Bangkok Couple

WxtI0QJtqZD8Y-EI-kLTUA.text: The best oyster bar in Vegas. I've eaten here a handful of times and have never been disappointed. I always get the combination pan roast and it is delicious. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. If you're not familiar with a pan roast, its kind of like a seafood stew in a buttery tomato sauce. I had never heard of a pan roast until I tried it here, and let me just say I was hooked from the first bite!  The only downfall is that this place is tiny, the bar seats 18 only, and that means there are super long waits! On my last visit, we waited about 45 minutes for a party of 2 which isn't so bad, but sucks if you're hungry ;)   Let me just say that the wait is worth it. I would wait hours just to eat here, it is that good. Do yourself a favor and try this place! 5 stars for sure!

NPRniAMOPB8Y0PGwlgzVYw.text: Arrived at 11:30am and still had to wait a few minutes as all the seats at the bar was full. It was totally worth it! We had the New England clam chowder,  New Zealand mussels and the house pan roast. Everything we had was amazing and worth the price.  Chef Ricardo was really nice and gave us a few suggestions for the nexr time. A bowl of clam chowder,  one order of the mussels,  2 orders of house pan roast and 2 sierra mists = $84.27. Worth every penny.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s literally a bar - not a lot of seats but worth the wait. Chef Ricardo was awesome!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Zealand mussels - sooo good!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House pan roast

ouOhCz0Zca9E5qljyDu3DA.text: We were here for our annual golf week with the guys and we went here right after golf the first and second day.  For some of us, this is a new experience, others we know Bob and Maggie pretty well.  We are there Wed/Thurs/Fri at around 3 pm.   Usually, there is a wait to get one of the twenty seats on this Oyster bar.  The wait can get up to an hour or more.  Most of the time we get seats next to each other.  Sometimes not.   But it doesn't matter since it is a small bar where you can hear everyone's conversation.  And that's the fun of this place.  Everyone gets to talk to each other on where you are from to our poor golf game.    Maggie will take your order and Bob will cook it.  Be nice or they will ignore you, or give you crap.  Either way be nice.  The cooking station is right in front of you.  The gumbo and pan roast are the staples of this bar.  First timers should go for the pan roast with a high of 5 on the heat scale.  They will ask what heat you want mild ( 1 ) to hot ( 10 ).  Don't be a fool and go for 10.  It will be more than you want.  8 is as high as real people go.  Lower than 5, Bob will give you the "wimp" look.  The station can cook up to six at a time, so do the math.  Twenty seats, six at a time.  This is why you order oysters on the half or other fillers.  Oysters on the half are shucked right there.  Be nice again.  Bob does the shucking.  They also have clam steamers, mussels, and shrimp.  There' s wine and beer on tap.   The grand total will be less than you think.  A dozen oysters at $19, Pan roast at $20, drinks at $3.50.  It will be one of the best and one of the cheapest meal you had in Vegas.  Specials from 1am to 9am, oysters are $8.99 a dozen and 16oz Buds are $2  They are open 24 hours.  So get there

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast lobster
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golf week with the guys every year, we are here

YCSrnMe-R6sYiIzuhHJEyA.text: On my last trip to Las Vegas, I wanted to come here. The Oyster Bar is inside the Palace Station. There are only 18 seats and depending on the time of the day, you can be waiting for few minutes or all the way up to hours. On our first day (Friday), we came here around 5pm and waited less than 30 minutes. Not bad. There were four of us and we ordered two dozen oysters, two combo pan roast, and two shrimp scampi. The shrimp scampi was just okay. Nothing to write home about. Oysters were fresh and delicious but I have eaten better oysters in the past. But what we all raved about was the PAN ROAST. Boy was it yummy! I got spicy level 2 and my friend got spicy level 4.   In the end, both were spicy and we actually couldn't tell if 2 was as hot as 4 or not. Anyway NO big deal. We love spicy, just as long as it isn't taking over the entire mouth.   On Sunday morning, we still couldn't get over the delicious Pan Roast and decided to go again. Of course, sin city has no church goers, it was packed with a line. We waited 2 hours from 11-1pm and finally got seated. It was worth it. But not sure if it was the line or if we were hungrier on a Friday afternoon but Friday's Pan Roast tasted a bit better.  PS the staff there are super chill and cool. They are nice if you are nice to them. But they will be rude to the ones that are snobby, douchey, and rude. So don't matter if you are rich or poor. Be nice to the servers and the cooks and they will be nice to you as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Sr09u174L3zZht9ZtFdj8A.text: Went on a Monday morning around 2am, waited in line for 3 hours and left the place and 6am ! The wait is very long.. Many people got irritated and just annoyed on how the place is run. There is literally 15 seats, one chef and one server/bus boy/host. If they had more staff, this wouldn't been an issue but local guests told us that Oyster Bar has been doing this since they've open. As far as the food, it's good. We ordered the oysters, crab & shrimp roast, and clam chowder. Everything was fresh and the portions was big. As far as the service, there was none. The waiter has no time to check up on the bar because he's too busy taking orders and prepping the clean dishes and such. Overall would I come back if I was in Vegas ? No. The wait wasn't worth it, Orange  County's Kettle Bar in Anaheim will always be my favorite.

v9WZyvj5fuSB2LL9d029Mg.text: Amazing Food. Worth the line. You'd never imagine this place is as good as it is.  The chef JJ is a master of multitasking and he has a great quirky personality. All the food is cooked to order in front of your face at the bar. Ask for the lava sauce if your feeling bold. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vDJ5UxOqRin_uFbGjRTDlg.text: Lucky for us the wait was only 20 minutes. Everyone and their mom recommends this place. They gave our oysters to the wrong people, so we didnt get ours till after our main dish came out. Then we tried to eat them and they weren't even shucked correctly, they muscle was still stuck to the shell. I also ordered the Palace Pan Roast which was very good, but kind of too rich for my taste. I would go back, but only if there wasn't a line.

_8gb0Osj9CdDbKrxvUAytw.text: Thank you Patty and Maxxy!  Our new favorite place in Vegas!  Very fun, very different and a great place to people watch.    I have never seen Pan Roast in the South so that was new to me.  Clams on the 1/2 shell were dime size but delish.  I asked for a few oysters to make up the diff, and not a second of hesitation before "sure!"    It seemed expensive for a Pan Roast or Gumbo, but one order is easily enough for two people, if you get a salad and some oysters or clams.    We really liked the House Gumbo!    Thanks again for this find!

Qua6AiWnJ3LglDrz3YFxIQ.text: We went around 10:30pm so it was not full , we only waited for 10 minutes.  I shared with my husband the steamed clams with a wine and butter broth (super delish) and also a combo pan roast.  The combo pan roast was excellent the seafood was fresh we had ours spicy level 6 (perfect number its spicy but its not overpowering).  Overall everything was good and fresh and they cook everything in front of you so you see everything thats going on with your food.

XjhDXi1pL6IdK7mwkE9pJw.text: They get three stars now. They changed chefs. I used to brag about this place and anytime family or friends visit I made sure I took them to the bar. I went about a week ago and there was a new cook. The gumbo was still good but ....not as good.

u9-rHNb0bS0cwkiuL1Uwtg.text: Heaven!!! The pan roast is nothing I have ever tasted before.  So delicious.  Waited about an hour to try this place.  There are probably about 15 seats or so.  Expect a long wait but it is worth it.  Best oysters I have ever had.  They were plump and delicious.  This is a place we will be going to when we are Vegas.

TNPq_4jLVH13Q4-OQxiheQ.text: Wow great food.  Long line and wait but worth it....

g4skcGUqW-UT0mF2OsRSSA.text: Chef and waiter are super nice. Got there at 12:30am on a Sunday evening. No wait. Ordered dozen clams, clam chowder and crab pan roast. Shared with my other half. Clam chowder delicious. Little neck clams were good. Kind of on the salty side though. Ordered pan roast with spicy rating 7. Enough spice to give it a kick. Overall a good meal. Will return to try the moonlight special next time.

nYBAEJZZMlT5Venxwg29sA.text: Yes..... this is truly Las Vegas best kept SECRET. Same as Area 51.....   well I travel some what and my first and last stop is ALWAYS the Palace Station, not to gamble but to eat.  I have pretty much had all their dishes, started with the GUMBO but now I only order Combo Pan Roast.  Doesn't matter what your into..... oysters on the half shell steam clams steam mussels  Don't be afraid to ask for substitutions or additions to your dish they will treat you like a king, you queen what ever you prefer. Just to make things right!  WOW, you just cant beat this place, nothing comes close. I have been to Reno "Nugget" claims to be the best........ NOT!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Been to NY sorry not the best either. Does not even come close... Been to the Atlantis in Reno they need help!  Funny the chef came up to me and ask me how was my dinner... sorry but i had to brag about the pan roast at the Palace.... told him it still need help in order to compete.  anyways moving on here. I tell and bring as many people as I can, over a time period of 8 years I still enjoy this place, I just home they dint tear it down and put a big fancy bar and loose the fine people that work there.  FYI.... don't bother asking for the recipe I have been there when people ask and have even offered $10k for it. it is not for sale, keep coming back folks.  yes the lines are long and i have been waiting in them as long as 1.5 hours but it is all worth the wait.  their are only about 12 seats but it is a privilege to eat there every time.  enjoy to the fullest.

Jvqrbcyht-xHEOjxzTI-xw.text: This is one of "must stops" every time I'm in LV.  It's the best gumbo I've had.  The portions are huge (don't eat any bread before your meal arrives...trust me!).  You need to be sure to avoid peak times as there's only about a dozen seats.  They've gone to 24 hrs/day now, which is great, but definitely go off meal hours.

7ppHNj8y9Vn5ohsaYy1d5g.text: yummy! and filling! combo pan roast was all that everyone hypes about. seafood jambalaya was sooo flavorful and delicious. house gumbo was salty but overall tasty. Had the 1/2 oysters--Oysters themselves were good but pieces of the shell was in some of it...overall, would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. house gumbo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. seafood jambalaya

5myGIINpcCufDeZQ_wzoxw.text: I loved the pan roast.  It took about 45 minutes to be seated but it was worth the wait.

EuiPMFFqQihstc04LC0Jeg.text: I have been coming here since I've turned 21, and it's amazing! I order the pan roast combo and usually split it with my hunsband. (bummer that they started the $5 split fee) but still worth it! Order the crab cakes ( not on the menu) they are spectacular, all crab meat light breading with lemon butter sauce and capers topped with fried potato strings. I have eaten at this bar at least 25 times and always get the pan roast but finally decided to try the shrimp scampi because it always smelled so delicious however, I wasn't too impressed with the flavor. I'll def stick to the pan roast. I have been to sunset oyster bar, south point, and green valley ranch, none even compare to palace station. It's worth the wait and drive!

RWAQrUdWy7BtSifDwEArNA.text: We love this restaurant which is inside the Palace Station Casino. There are long waits, so try to go at a non-mealtime. We ate there on March 11, 2012 and now they are open 24/7! They were very accommodating with seating our group of 7.

aKuyLAV3HGiwdgOHvf5HcA.text: Best oyster bar I've ever been too, there was a wait even at 11 pm but so worth it.

6Bnqz48Xd2KdbAwWgC4BAQ.text: This place was amazing! Although the wait is long and there always seems to be a line, it was worth the wait!  We got the combo pan roast and it was delicious!  A spice level of 5 had a kick and was good with the rice.  It was still tolerable for me and I can only take a little spice.  The flavor was amazing!  I don't like tomato soup or cheesy soups and was afraid I wouldn't like it, but it was just creamy enough to not be overwhelming and it wasn't overly tomato-ish.  The lobster meat was very tender and usually lobster is too tough for me.  The shrimp was ok.  The crab meat was good.  One bowl is definitely good to share for two and you will both be licking the bowl clean!  The jambalaya looked good too!  I would love to try that next time.  The only downfall, besides the wait, is the oysters.  For a place called the oyster bar, the oyster was just ok.  Their large oysters from Louisiana.  It was slightly salty for me and wasn't anything special.  Service was great too!  The waiter was really friendly and helped us decide what to get and I was glad to have listened to his recommendation.  I would love to come back if I ever get a chance to have a car again while in Vegas.

NgNp-Ab1gmg6PdftuwImyA.text: 4am...drunk..hungry...waiting in a line with only a few people ahead of you yet you still have to wait over an hour to get a seat while watching other drunk people eat slowly is such torture... but the gumbo is SO WORTH IT. so full of amazing flavor and fresh seafood and you get to pick your own spiciness level from 1-10. the servers/oyster shuckers are also super nice

gudWr8QaUvTpFRxt4vrHwg.text: As hole in the walls goes...this ain't no surprise to locals and many out-of-towners. The key buy here is to sit outside in the relatively smokey casino portion (under the hoods and next to the member rewards card center) and NOT (I repeat NOT) to sit inside the Broiler restaurant.   Why not you ask?  2 words: STEAM POTS  Add to that the guys who cook up their crazy concoctions - JJ and Greg - as well as the cool under pressure server Dolores (aka Dolly) and you won't be disappointed. It's like having your favorite sports' dream team serving you up some serious good eats. And...unlike many LV shows, you won't have to pay a pretty penny for these guys to entertain you. And that's kind of what this is....steam pot seafood dishes (pan roast, bouillabaisse, cioppino, gumbo, etc) made fresh to order EVERY order with a show to boot. Think of this as Benihana with steam pots. And just like when you were a kid and the tepanyakia chefs would entertain with their knives and histrionics....well, you get that here with ribs and jabs to customers sitting at the "bar".  Just a quick note: do not confuse this place with the other Station casino copies - e.g., Tidelands Oyster bar elsewhere. This place is all about the chefs (JJ and Greg)...those other places make the same dishes...but the skill and adaptability to changing orders on the fly is not there. Plus some of these places don't use steam pots. They cook it on a stove top. Boo!   What's so awesome about the steam pots then?  For starters, the steam pots NEVER overcook your precious cargo load of seafood these guys put into your dish. Seriously, everytime I've ordered something here, I've been amazed at 1) the quality of seafood, 2) the portions of seafood and 3) how perfectly tender and succulent the seafood is cooked each time. The other thing is just watching these guys cook up their creations using the pots....it's SO cool!   We usually order the combo pan roast which runs you a hefty $20....but if you consider the fact that you get huge portions of shrimp, lobster and big pieces of lump crab...PLUS you could easily feed 3 people with the servings you get. Well, it's not a bad deal right? What's also best is just being able to specify your specific heat level in ANY dish. They will accommodate you. I've requested 4 fresh habaneros in my pan roast before...but the usual scale of 1 - 10 applies for those not accustomed to the H-bomb, as I refer to it.  If a tomato cream-based pan roast doesn't suit you, they have several other dishes that are made exclusively in their steam pots like seafood bouillabaisse (w/ crab legs, mussels, clams, shrimp), gumbo (e.g., crab only, shrimp only, combo), pasta dishes (vongole, shrimp, etc.), as well as an Alaskan chowder, jambalaya and red beans and rice. I've never tried there namesake (oysters) here, but I've heard good things...I'm just a bit of an oyster snob so if I don't know the source of them (Kumomotos, Blue Points, etc), I usually shy away from eating them. But then again, why bother? B/c all you need to know is that they have STEAM POTS FTMFW!!!!  One final word of advice, it packs up in a line here around dinner time (waits can be as long as an hour or more depending on party size - only ~18  seats at the bar). Since everything is first come first serve, don't expect any favoritism or joking around with skipping the line. Dolly, JJ and Greg are serious when it comes to that line. Think "soup nazi". If you're short on time, go between the lunch hour and dinner time (1 - 5pm) for almost immediate service. Also, if you're a frequent gambler or you get mailings from the Station casino rewards programs...you can score some free eats (e.g., $45 coupons). If not, go sign up at the booth next door and you'll see what I mean (hopefully you can use it on your next visit). Also, if you're shy about eating a whole $20 bowl of food...just say you're sharing one of their creations. They're totally okay with that. And yes, beer and wine can be ordered here. Last visit, they got rid of Gordon Biersch in favor of Kona Longboard - awesome. Finally, can't find the place? Look for the line of Asians here. Seriously...we know good seafood. 'nuff said.  Despite the OJ debacle of Palace Station, Oyster Bar should not be overlooked on your next off-strip visit to LV. Makes me wonder..."what if OJ ate here?" Ask Dolly...she'll know.

woG5bB8gCRBM0ce_oY8Iiw.text: I had this yesterday right after I checked out.  Arrived a little before 12PM.  I thought I was going to a restaurant and was a little dissapointed because I wanted to be alone and not bugged because of my hangover.  It actually was a bar as if you were going to grab a drink.  Anyways, arrived there and got seated right away, fortunately. This place is amazing..that's all I have to say.  I'm on a venture right now to find this somewhere in the Los Angeles/Orange County area.  I recommend going there early because by the time I was done with my meal, there was a long long line with people looking very miserable.  Anyways, go early and you have to order the Pacific Pan Roast, the one that is at the top of the pan roast menu.  This is right up there with my cravings for either Boiling Crab (crawfish) or Indian Food (chicken tika masala).  So much flavor.  I most definitely will go back here, every time I'm in Vegas.  Now where can I go to find this in Los Angeles? hmm... :/  I am at work now..yelping while i should actually be working on this very gloomy Monday back from Vegas. sigh..

3W9FYftWFvIBykZO18ZYMQ.text: So amazing!!... Only bar seating, service was great even though they forgot the salad we ordered but thankfully they did because Combo pan roast was more than enough for the bf and I we also got a bottle of wine which price was very reasonable plus Free birthday cake doesn't hurt either! Love love love must come again!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omg amazing!

qzrqpcPLJCgnvTL8P6HWYA.text: 1st off, the service is excellent. We had Bob and Chris today, and they are both fantastic servers. My water glass was never empty. Ordered the pan roast (lobster, clam, and crab) with an extra side of rice, and a dozen oysters. Everything was so tasty! Worth the 30 min wait in line. Loved the warm little sourdough bread that they give you as an appetizer, as well. Definitely will be back over and over again!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A dozen delicious oysters, served with wedges of Lemon, horseradish and cocktail sauce
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast with lobster, clams, and crab, with an extra side of rice

kf01Qprqsqhkn3zxFkdaSw.text: So when I saw the reviews for Oyster Bar at Palace Station on yelp I was a little surprised to see how good they were. I wondered if it could possibly be as good as people say it is, considering the location. It is. My wife and I waited in line for over an hour and a half, as it's a small oyster bar with about 20 seats. It's first come first serve. But the food is amazing. It was worth the wait.

OGOs9aHZ0QS36JhlaatITw.text: This is actually the last of steam kettle cuisine that I've tried. Being from LA I've tried the Boiler, Ritters, and the Kettle Bar.  I actually tried this place because in all three of the other places, this is what people compare it to! Honestly, it's worth it. It's worth it because it's Vegas and it's literally almost the same price as all the other places, except they give you wayyyy more seafood!!! I think back home all the places were like 22$, Oyster Bar was like 25$ except it's a way bigger portion, they give you a variety of sauces, and SOURDOUGH bread!!!! It's so good lol. It's creamier than the other places I've tried so I'm guessing it's more fattening too ):  I also probably liked it more than other people since I came like at 1AM and only had to wait like 10 minutes..it says it's only for people 21+, but I'm not sure if they actually care? I mean you don't have to drink there?? Not sure lol.

C--AKYrQ7BS3Wn6SeDCB_w.text: Bomb seafood ....oysters are bomb but so is the gumbo...I've basically tried almost everything on the menu and I've never disappointed

Qa3xtCYv7zNU8LxOdhQ2Dg.text: This is one of my FAVORITE favorite places in Vegas. FAVORITE. You won't be sorry for coming here. It's worth the cab ride from the Strip and the long line 24/7 should tell you something.   The line can be at least an hour, so make sure you account for that. It's best to come here with a group. Some group members can gamble or go to the casino bar for rounds of drinks while the others hold down your spot, then switch. That's kind of lonely to do with just a couple. What's cool about this place is that when you're next in line, they'll keep the order of the line and not pull smaller parties from behind you because there are less seats available. They'll ask people to move down the bar so that your party can fit.   Good beer selection (Shock Top and Widmer included) and also a full bar offered.   Service is phenomenal.  What to order here are the pan roasts. The Palace Pan Roast has crab, shrimp and sausage, and the Combo Pan Roast has crab, shrimp, and lobster. It's a delicious, creamy, tomato-y, spicy, rich stew with VERY generous seafood and rice on the side. Choose your own level of spice from 1-10. When my leftovers came out of the microwave today, I almost had to change my pants. A friend ordered the Alaskan Chowder, which had fresh clams in the shell on top and generous seafood. One of the best clam chowders I've ever had.   Oyster shooters (tequila or vodka) are 3 for $10, and between 4 and 10 is happy hour, with discounted bacon-wrapped shrimp in an incredible sauce (and the shrimp are HUGE), crab cakes, fried calamari, oysters rockefeller, and a few more items. We ordered most of the menu since.... why not?   I can't wait to come here any try other items... if I can bring myself to stray from the pan roast. I love this place so much.

4arRWsuVhhfQcm8rTDxEjQ.text: Awhile some of my friends kept talking about how good Oyster Bar was, so I decided to go to Harrah's to check it out. I was confused by their recommendations because the menu there was mediocre. At least the oysters were delicious. It turns out I was going to the WRONG one! My girlfriend and I were so excited to check this place out that we decided to leave the club early to eat here. This place is called Oyster Bar for a reason. It's only a bar consisting of 14-18 chairs, so you can imagine that standing in line can take a long time. It took about 1 hour for us to get seated when there were only about 4 groups ahead of us. Food: 1) Oysters of the day is a great appetizer. They were very fresh and large. I've actually haven't seen oysters this big. yelp.com/biz_photos/oyst... 2) Pan Roast Level 8 Spicy had a decent kick, but not enough to satisfy my spicy Asian taste buds. I think I'll go for level 10 next time. The tomato cream sauce was so creamy and savory that I couldn't put my spoon down. The portions here were so large that I had to take it to go despite my large appetite. yelp.com/biz_photos/oyst... 3) Gumbo - out of the few times I've tried gumbo, the gumbo here would have to be the best out of those experiences. The red brick roux was by far the best. yelp.com/biz_photos/oyst...

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gumbo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half Dozen oysters of the day

L2CO3JySJqHywjq23vRKog.text: We went there on Sunday evening around 6pm, and the line was way too long, so we came back on Monday morning around 10am and there was no line! We had a dozen oysters, bouillabaisse, spice level 3 gumbo and mild pan roast. All had different soup and they were all so good. It is too bad this place is so far from us ( we live in LA), but we always look forward to coming here when we are in Vegas. We've been coming here almost 10 years, and only locals knew about this place back them. Now, we have to wait in the long line, but it definitely worth it. Try to be here before 10am on weekdays to avoid the long wait!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EMnCXX-xhr5k4YSneSBYLQ.text: I travel from LA to Vegas just to eat here. Enough said.  Tips for ordering: Alaskan clam chowder, and the pan roast w/ a bowl of white rice. Yum yum yum!

YgxOvC60gAib5UvQZYJ6aA.text: Foods good, but there's only like 10 chairs total at the bar, making the wait in line hours long to be seated. There's other oyster bars just as good with lines not nearly as long in Vegas, so would recommend hitting those up instead if you'd rather spend your time more wisely.

X0_agFNWex1KlFw3SCKtkQ.text: Yes you need to come here!!! There's a wait, the line doesn't look long but the wait is anywhere from 30-60 mins could be longer so come with foodie buddies or bring your phone!  No rest for the wicked open 24/7...It's well worth the wait once your butt is resting.  I got the combo pan lobster shrimp crab roast with a side of pasta OML where has this place been all of my life?  The lobster is cooked to perfection super tender and delicate big pieces make sure you order an extra lobster tail.  The shrimp is delicious too you can't go wrong.  The portions are huge so split with at least 1 buddie and they charge $5 for a split but it's a lot of yummy food.  Unless you're a big big eater it's wise to split or take it home and don't share :P have round 2 bwahaha.  I had half a dozen oysters and they shuck oysters in front of you soooo good.   It's extremely busy and they always have so many take out orders.   There is free complimentary bread comes warm but nothing to boast about.  Nonetheless, the pan roast the pan roast the pan roast :) foodgasm foodporn nom nom!  Why are you still reading this post ... Go ;)

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shucking fresh oysters and plating shrimp cocktail on the spot

2nvTsvlmPgc-4yyNf0SbIA.text: After being told by numerous people to check this place out, my boyfriend and I decided to give it a go.   We went on a Monday around lunch time, and there was a line. Took maybe 15-20 min of waiting (not bad).   This place is really small. No tables. Just a bar with about 10-15 spots.   The waitress that helped us that day was so nice and funny!   **another thing, you have to be over 21 to even eat here (so incase you have kids or under 21).  We both got the pan roast with lobster, crab, and shrimp.   I got my heat 5 and my boyfriend got his heat 2. They were both so delicious! I really wish I could have finished the whole thing but it really fills you up! They offer a take out container also.   This is my new go to spot in Vegas. I don't care how long the wait is! It's awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast with lobster, shrimp &amp; crab.

qPYyeGY0kgd39yRbPnRmWA.text: Hands down THE BEST clam chowder I've had, ever.  And the combo pan roast with shrimp crab and lobster is A-mazing! Flavorful, spicy (to your taste), packed with fresh delicious seafood, big portions and cooked to order in front of you in a steamer. Plus the wait staffs playful, dry sense of humor is worth the price of admission.  Dolores and Ricardo are the best! I wish I could give it 6 stars because the entire experience is amazing!  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast and Cup of Clam Chowder

81m7MckVEtuGgQ4uneKPEg.text: Amazing place for clam chowder! A must try! Order the New England clam chowder Alaskan style! It's clam chowder with shrimp, crab and lobster too!! AMAZING

Lm1F5WB-UiWMtkqmUWe2ag.text: Everything about this place is worth the hype we had the combo pan roast and chowder New England style. It was phenomenal and the wait was worth it.

EJg4hR54G46AcOznde3hyw.text: The next time you find yourself in Vegas, be sure to stop by the Oyster Bar at Palace Station Casino. It is home to one of the most amazing seafood dishes I've ever had!  The Oyster Bar is literally a bar inside the casino, which means there is very limited seating (I think another reviewer said there are 18 seats). I arrived with a party of four people at 11:00 AM, and it took around an hour and fifteen minutes for us to be seated. The smell of the cooking pan roast wafted over to the line while we were waiting, it was tantalizing and almost cruel. By the time my party was seated we were ready to eat!  We started off the meal with a dozen raw oysters and raw clams. If I were to eat here again,  I would skip these next time. The oysters and clams were nothing special. As an avid fan of raw mollusks, I prefer a smaller oyster and clam because they have a sweeter and more seafood-y taste. The ones served here were fairly large, didn't have much flavor, and were not that memorable. PASS on the oyster and clams.   The True star of this place is the PAN ROAST. It is as amazing as everyone on here say it is. I am salivating just thinking about it as I type out this review right now. In summary, the pan roast is very generous portion of seafood heaven. It's creamy, savory, and chock full of seafood. You can choose how spicy you want it on a scale of 0-10. I was tempted to order a 8 or 9 (I love spicy food), but the chef warned me they really crank up the heat here. He was right - I opted for a 7, and there was actually a good amount of spice in there. I don't think I could have tasted my food if I ordered an 8. This  dish is also very big, and can be split among two people  We also ordered the deablo, which was very delicious. I would recommend getting this if you're looking to order something else besides the pan roast. It is a pasta dish that resembles cioppino, and is served with heaping portions of shrimp and lobster. You can also choose how spicy you want it on a scale of 0-10.  The entrees here start at around $20, which is fairly pricey - but hey, it's good seafood. It's definitely worth the trip off strip, the 1+ hour wait, and the money.  I would highly recommend this place to my fellow Yelpers!

h3iDQLfenHhxkGbTaEqqrA.text: Seafood here is so amazing!!!! It's really fresh and yummy. I think the reviews say it all. Cannot wait for the next trip to Las Vegas. Nom nom nom

RImBcz_4mXCsF9rTTyyXlA.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the oyster bar, fresh seafood, good service, and reasonable prices. I highly recommend the combo pan steam dish. Succulent shrimp, crab and lobster with a creamy rich sauce really made us content!

hOhJIj29YSGwaD7EFBMDhA.text: Best meal in all of Vegas. I have a spoiled palette and the combo pan roast was my favorite meal! Creamy tomato base with generous seafood over steamed rice. Yum!!!!

i4904FRG-9R-pPDiCpj5Sg.text: Coolest place in Vegas, it literarily fits 18 people. They have a constant line (I wish I could tell you the line goes fast) IT DOES NOT! BUT WELLLLLLL worth it. Best Oysters and the most amazing Palace pan roast

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace Pan Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen Oysters

FU1abxltkTwXO8QDmiRPgA.text: I have been eating here for over 30 yrs. we went for Christmas Eve and it was worse then awful. We set in booth by the bar and there was such a fowl stench of bad fish, it was horrible. Service was horrible as well. We won't return. Not just because of bad service but the foul smell and food wasn't even close to average.

MCr0qRzyHHad1hxPsgOwFw.text: The BEST! From the Pan Roast to the Jambalaya to the fresh cold seafood you can't beat this. They are now open 24 hours and if you get there and there is a line, you absolutely MUST wait, thinking no way? Trust me it is worth it, whether you are waiting for 15 minutes to 2 hours, you will be glad you waited. This is as good as it gets. We have coming here for many years and always make it a point to eat here. Even pack Tupperware to bring the pan roast home! Caesar Salad is great, oysters are amazing, JJ has been cooking here for years and Dolores?Such a kick, she doesn't miss a thing! Put this on your list and try it, you will not regret a moment.

_c-Y12vALeVdRIkxbRx0Sw.text: This is such a unique eatery, I'm surprised it's in Vegas.  It takes a while for the cook to make your food and there are only 16 seats bar style at the counter.  Although the ambiance is meh (in the middle of the casino floor of a meh casino), the food and personalities of the cook and server totally make up for it.  We've been here multiple times, I think we've had all the cooks and servers who work here and there isn't a bad one.  The best thing on the menu is hands down the combo pan roast.  The combination of ingredients give the base so much depth.  I'm addicted to all things spicy and a spice level of 6 is good enough for me (but maybe it seems more spicy because the pan roast comes to me piping hot and I just want to scarf it down!)  We also get the oysters from time to time.  I've def had better, but these are not bad for the price and they are giganormous!   We always try to come at really random times to avoid lines (10:00 Sunday mornings is our secret).  If not, get ready to stand in line.

9Cqp4TTXzr19ZwHxQotfoQ.text: I didn't know what a pan roast was when I walked in but after my first spoonful I was converted. I was thinking of getting a gumbo because I knew what to expect but I'm glad I didn't. The pan roast had crab, shrimp & lobster. It's was creamy, tangy and full of Umami. Spice level was at 7 just as I requested. What made the difference Sherry that was added to finish the dish. They should change their name to the Pan Roast and Gumbo Bar.

bfFbfobqopM-z7K-MNu0LA.text: Long wait was worse than I expected. I visited there afternoon.The servers and chefs don't care the wait. They don't care about turning the tables(stools) quickly, thus you have to wait a lot. I was not happy at all because of the rude expression of the chef and  it took us over 15 mins to get our check and another 15 mins to finish to pay for it. I used to be a server and know why they do that. There are only 15 or 16 spots. However, the food was good. I could tell their seafood was fresh. Should I choose taste or behavior?

LuZy0Lx3wGv7HtKFUjoYxA.text: We had a late dinner and really enjoyed their oyster.

r7uH3XyTGD7o_fUr48i4cw.text: Nice little oyster bar with a good food selection.  It is a bit pricey but the staff here is always nice.  Most of them joke around with the patrons and seem to enjoy working there. I would suggest trying the New England Clam chowder.

kny9Aa4i0JVHBSyAMBt94Q.text: Omg the pan roast is AMAZING! I shouldve came here when I wasnt so intoxicated so I can taste everything fully!! and take pictures! I just remember the oysters were super fresh, the clam chowder was AMAZING! and the pan roast was... DEEELISSHHHHH. My group of maybe 10 people came at around 4am after the club & before our flight back home and boy, I am totally coming back!

s4a2p82XBcTtr-dx0WlwuA.text: The Combo Pan Roast is delicious!  So is there clam chowder and oysters!  The Chef is hilarious... he's got such a rough around the edge attitude...  something like a Peter Luger, so do be put off right away.  He's a great guy.  Also the server is this sweet woman that makes up for his roughness.  Awesome Oyster Bar team!

zOWTA8B68UG5I4Tp9YNHKg.text: Went here for dinner on a Thursday night. Waited about 20 minutes and it was worth the wait!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I had the shrimp gumbo, and other people in my party ordered the seafood gumbo and the pan roast. Absolutely amazing!  First, the bowl of gumbo was about $17, but the bowl was HUGE! I could barely eat half of it, but felt guilty leaving any behind! They ask you how spicy you want it (1-10). I ordered a 7 and it was hot enough to give a kick, but not burn my tongue. The shrimp was fresh, large and the food was cooked right in front of us which was fun! My boyfriend usually HATES seafood and he could not stop eating his mixed seafood gumbo.   Although this place is off the strip  a bit at the Palace Station, it's worth the ride over. The atmosphere was incredible. Service is at a bar with about 20 seats and the cooks and owner are there chatting with you and are super friendly. It's a great place to meet the people sitting next to you and have some AWESOME food. Portions are ginormous so I easily could have split my bowl of gumbo. For the next 5 days of my vacation, I kept on craving this place! Can't wait to go back! Delicious!

9bqPGefgHKcB-9oyA7FYNA.text: So disappointed!!! I came here in 2006 and had arguably one of the best seafood meals in my life. Everything was so good! Sad to say, I went back in 2012 and had the worst meal I've ever had in Vegas, and that's saying a lot because I've eaten in a lot of shady places. Worst martini ever! Seriously it tasted like the pool. My beer was equally disgusting. Someone needs to tell the waitress the cleanser they use on the glasses is way too strong. Got roasted corn clam chowder and would have guessed it was canned corn if it weren't for the boatloads of silk in it! Not to mention it was probably made the week previous. Oysters were small and chewy, To top it all off, the signature grill dish came with the spicy tomato diablo sauce instead of the brandy cream sauce. Don't get me wrong, I like spicy food but if I order something I expect to get what I paid for. It's probably better that i didn't eat it because the cook behind the line was unsanitary as hell. DUDE, WASH YOUR F'ing HANDS WHEN YOU TOUCH YOUR FACE!! HAVE YOU HEARD THE TERM "DOUBLE DIPPING"? When I told the waitress of the mistake she first tried to convince me that I was wrong, I was not, then took  the sanitizing liquid tasting anchor steam beer off the check. Like that makes it better. Luckily, at least the $100+ we spent didn't get us sick. I will never stay at the Sun Coast inn because this food was so bad. FOR SHAME!!!!!!!

kGFAB5E4Wwek-37dsWD-PQ.text: Best Kept Las Vegas Secret: Palace Station's Oyster Bar House Pan Roast.  Delicious!  There's a similar spot in Chino Hills, CA now! THE BOILER, it's just as great minus the 4 hour drive to Vegas.  Same Kettle Style with Authentic Cajun/Creole Flavors.

Kh3HpDGZQAwBB-OZam5ulg.text: Oh my goodness...i had a dozen of clams and half a dozen of oysters on the half shell. Oysters were very fresh and yummy. The clams were the medium size cherry stone clams. They were very fresh and sweet. I also had a couple bites of my BF's gumbo. The gumbo was a little salty for my taste but the flavor was good. I will definitely come back in the future when I get a chance.

N66lF4aQ35pZx2tUs7553g.text: Yum! We had fresh oysters as an appetizer--they were superb! The palace station pan roast was sooo good; the sausages they put in it were delectable. Only bad thing is the loong wait. I would wait a max of 1 hour for this, can't do any longer. You end up dying from smelling all the good food they cook.

G9edOmg-pehPOaXu3Ol6uQ.text: I always come here for the oysters and the Combo Pan Roast. Very good! Expect to wait long if you're with a large group.

K7_5naoV3xMufhP8VrqS1Q.text: I'll keep it short and simple...this place is amazing and I am not a big fan of seafood.  My friends couldn't stop talking about this place so even though I was skeptical, I decided to try it out.  I ordered the combo roast with an extra scoop of rice (spiciness of 7/10).  The portion sizes are easily sharable but once I tried a spoonful of my combo roast, there was to be no sharing.  The people working there were very friendly which made it an even better experience.  As far as I know, whenever I go to Vegas, this is a must have.

KQnoecCnRZR9w2FIMxlKHQ.text: Line sucks and can be long even late at night, but the pan roast is worth it.

AVxqz5w4yq5GwwkK2I1h0w.text: Thanks to you guys I can't eat clam chowder anywhere else!!! I LOVE LOVE LOVE your Alaskan Chowder! I stop in everytime I'm in Vegas!!!!

WcOaVn8nT7JdePk8FUvbHQ.text: We waited in line for 45 minutes at The Oyster Bar in the Palace Station Casino.  Incredible!  The casino has an outdated ventilation system, so if you can't take the smoke, you will not be able to come here.  Also: there are only 17 seats (at a counter) and no reservations are taken.  This means that you will wait unless you are very lucky.  Do not come with a big party -- not feasible.  The food is pretty great: we had oysters and a Pan Roast (all sorts of seafood prepared in a delicious, creamy tomoato sauce).  It's fun to watch the chef prepare the meals right in front of you.  The only other employee is the waitress and these two work their tails off when there's a line.  Although the food was pretty great, I don't know that I'd return because I don't like to wait in line and the smoke was pretty awful.  My clothes smelled afterward.

vSv-LcQF_NTT-d-F5rLHmA.text: I love this place but will only eat when Bob is there, he's the BEST!!!! Food is delicious and worth the short wait. The food is prepared right in front of you, its awesome! There's no other like it in town!

EPKWYwCzHD05htabhDzWUw.text: Vegas' best kept secret! Pan roast amazing!! Great clam steamers. And in the evenings they have the best crabcakes too! Don't miss out on this place.

N-GsnBeJltHH9gIoGrNEhw.text: Of all the Oyster Bar's in Vegas, this is the one that has the best food.  It's 24/7 but the lines can be a 1 hour or more wait.  It's 100% counter seating only.  So I suggest you either go in off times or don't go hungry due to the wait.  If you don't remember which Oyster Bar is the best, just ask for the one at the hotel that OJ Simpson got arrested at.  Never get a level 10 spicyness.

cecmraFo_QSVP-HQNIpGxA.text: In town with friends and hungover. One buddy says that we have to try this place. So we go for it.  It is inside of a semi-depresing casino. Just a handful of stools and a line. We waited 2.5 hours to sit down. I considered breaking up the friendship at that moment, because I was starving, but there was nothing else around. I threw some money into some slots and we waited out turn while making some friends in line. We were probably #10 ten in line when we arrived... yeah. Some people just hang out regardless of the drooling masses eyeing their bar stools.   The food... so it's soup. And it is very good. And the chef is very friendly. The rest of the staff was a little absent in their service, which in part explains the huge delays. I was hangry and order a dozen oysters to start. Let me preface by stating that I love oysters and eat them often. I have never had oysters like these. Imagine a large human tongue... yeah, like that. Not sweet, but if you;re the type who likes to cover your delicious oysters in topping to cover their natural flavor then you might love them. I did not.  If you have a friend like mine who drags you here, order the combo pan roast and enjoy a few beers. You will leave full and moderately happy.

mQz12-25DynpAfd62a2y5Q.text: This Oyster Bar is located in Harrahs in Las Vegas After a long day of eating nothing my husband and I picked the Ouster Bar . Staff really very friendly . Took no time to wait on us . Great server the first night Managers are all on the ball. Bread before dinner . I had fish and chips with fries my husband ordered crab cakes Awesome they were . We went back the next night and I had Lobster rolls with fries and my husband ordered a sea bass with rice and asparagus . Both were delicious Ly waited on us . Very pleasant man Tea is quite high $5 a glass . Will refill and let you take with you after meal. They have about 5 managers working to make sure all is going smoothly . We loved this bar .

f9GP9w97TMaKp0TZwVaFeQ.text: Our wait time: 1hr 20 min in line. 20 minutes after sitting.   Our order:  combo pan roast: awesome seafood combo that had an amazing flavor.  dozen oysters: (midnight special is 1/2 dozen for $10 and starts at 1am). Very surprised how large the oysters were. They were very good though. Not fishy at all. No options on the type of oyster.  Etouffee: Cajun stew with shrimp, crab, and lobster. Huge chunks of everything! Excellent.   We ordered both at spicy level 7. We were so hungry that we didn't realize that it wasn't spicy at all until the end of our meal when our neighbors asked us how the level 7 was. We said it wasn't spicy at all and they let us try theirs at level 6. It tasted so much better with the extra kick. We were all full by that time though and it was 4am so didn't fuss. Good regardless. If you can suck up the wait, it's a pretty decent seafood bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters. Midnight special after 1am. 6 for $10!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Etouffee. Amazing with large chunks of crab, lobster and shrimp.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast. Smooth and tasty.

mI8vSu2poiS4KAeIEBTmBg.text: Again, perfection.  This is really the best restaurant in Las Vegas...if not the country!...if you love the freshest most expertly cooked seafood you will ever eat.  How they can do it in landlocked Vegas is still a mystery....cook lobster better than in new England..batter and fry oysters better than in New Orleans !   They must have the most expert and dilligent seafood buyer with the highest standards of quality and freshness always.  Plus they serve it immediately post cooking...so pan to table time just seconds vs. minutes.  Now that we are home...on a new mission to perfect my vinagrette...theirs was so unbelievably perfect...not too sweet not too tart.   It's almost like they found a more perfect lemon variety.

NULtOJdmlmTperFr7weqpA.text: Not worth the wait!! 2 hours standing in line! WTF? Total marketing scheme, they starve you for 2 hours so that you are so hungry that even if they serve you crap, it will taste amazing!   Came here on a weekday and the line was 2 hours long! There's only 18 seats and the service is crazy slow. 2 hour wait is no exaggeration!! Food is pretty mediocre and totally not worth the 2 hour wait. A lot of people take their sweet time once they sit down and we saw several groups of people chatting and lolligagging after they finished their meal!   The food is ok priced for Vegas but you can get way better food elsewhere without having to wait.   Do NOT recommend! Total waste of time and money! Complete tourist trap and completely over hyped!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_91UF8LNlt0ypIMT_W7WIA.text: Service: 0/5  So.... There are SIXTEEN seats at this bar. It is literally a BAR. That's it. One bar. With 16 seats. Just wanted to make that clear. The line is not long but you wait FOREVER. They must be short staffed because the bus boy was also the cook (so of course he took forever to clear plates and set up for new guests).
