There were plenty of times where 2-4 seats were open but the people in front of us could not sit down yet because the spots needed to be cleared. There were probably 8 people in front of us and we waited for TWO HOURS. Excuse my French but f&%k that!!! Never again!!!!!!!!!!! Once we were seated, it took about 15-20 minutes for our food to be ready so by that time, we were desperately drinking our water and ate our oysters way too fast.  Food: 2.5/5 The oysters were very good. Even though they looked like they had been given steroids to grow as big as they were, they were delicious. The gumbo, on the other hand, was awful. I barely finished mine. I wish the oysters could make up for the gumbo but both dishes were sooooo expensive. So nope, they did not make up for the gumbo being gross.  Overall experience: 1.5 (giving them two because I feel bad kind of....) I will never go to this place again. I live near San Francisco so I will never take my SF oysters for granted again. LOL.

wgrZYIb2A83aoimORJ-Qyw.text: I've been going here for years, so when we write there's a wait -  there is a wait - the line moves slow. If it's by the player's card registration, expect an hour even though it seems like you are almost at the front of the line. Use Google to see their crowd estimator. My longest wait was 2 hours starting at 3AM Saturday night (everyone is out from clubbing). My shortest was no wait at 9:15AM on Sunday.  As for the food, everything is really good, but I'd skip some of the pan roasts as a bit too creamy. Do not skip out on the the Gold Band raw oysters they are the most meaty, and cleanest raw oysters I have ever eaten. Happen hour for those ends at 9AM. If you haven't already, get a players' card, Station Casinos Boarding Pass, and add the points from your meal to that to go up a level.

sPYOkOMUSawprZDsF4Vlkg.text: I love this place. It doesn't help that we are 10 mins away from it haha.   Fresh seafood. The service is amazing. They have the best clam chowder!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y_aytpuAvgDcZi-j-9z48Q.text: The pan roast and clam chowder were delicious, but not so amazing that I would wait in their line again. It's worth trying once if you're a seafood/chowder lover. We came on a Monday afternoon around 11:30am, and it was already a 45 minute wait with about 10 people in front of us. Oyster Bar is located in the Palace Station Casino off the strip, so you'll have to taxi or Uber to get here. I would recommend trying to come super early or super late at night (they're open 24/7) to avoid the line. They only have about 15-20 seats in a counter style set up. We ended up trying: -Combo Pan Roast (Creamy Tomato Stew Finished w/Brandy, Served w/Rice, w/Shrimp, Crab, Lobster, $23.99, yelp.com/user_local_phot...): This was my favorite dish out of the ones we tried. I liked the flavor of the stew, but it was definitely tasted very rich. I wish I ordered it spicier (we got a 4 out of 10 and it did nothing for me). Overall, this was a solid dish and great for eating with rice. They don't skimp on the seafood at all- recommended! -House Gumbo (Shrimp, Crab, Lobster, $23.99, yelp.com/user_local_phot...): I am not a gumbo fan so didn't like this version. It was decently flavorful, and they also give you a giant bowl. Worth trying if you're into gumbo. -New England Clam Chowder (Bowl, $8.99, yelp.com/user_local_phot...): Yum, delicious! The clam chowder was nice and creamy, and full of clams with less potatoes, which is my preference. A must try for any clam chowder lover! -Oysters on the Half Shell ($17.99/Dozen, yelp.com/user_local_phot...): Yikes, these oysters are GIGANTIC! They were very fresh, but don't have much brine/flavor to them, and there is a lot of meat. I like oysters, but I don't think I could eat more than 5 of these. However, after having these once, I wouldn't order them again. Service was ok, but it's very low maintenance since they take your order from the other side of the bar. The food takes at least 10 minutes to prepare, but you get everything piping hot.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters on the Half Shell ($17.99/Dozen)
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New England Clam Chowder (Bowl, $8.99)
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast (Creamy Tomato Stew Finished w/Brandy, Served w/Rice, w/Shrimp, Crab, Lobster, $23.99)

A9xvjy9e5ODGX1yUV60dSA.text: I think the 1634 reviews says it all, but just in case you need me to reiterate or provide an updated review of an experience--it is still as good as they say. The wait is still 1-2 hours depending on the time you go. The chef will even tell you that it's usually about a 2 hour wait and if you didn't wait that long, he might make you stand to the side to wait till your 2 hour is up (so don't let him know!--jk!) There's no going wrong with any of the Pan Roasts.   Go there. Eat. Make friends with neighbors. Laugh.   The only thing I feel needs to be highlighted as new news--order pasta to add into your Pan Roast.

9cp_mpXfD8ArmDwCwY_Wfw.text: I have been living in Vegas since 2005 and finally tried this place out. I am so late. This place is been the best oyster bar in town! There is something about their oyster that makes it different from the others. It tastes fresh and clean. Keep in mind, I didn't even like oysters when I came here. I came here for the talk about their pan roast. We'll talk about that next. But my boyfriend got the oysters and made me try it again. I fell in love with how chewy and fresh it tasted topped with tabasco, lemon and soy sauce. Lorddddd! I became an oyster fan. Should i say oyster bar fan?! You can order the half dozen oysters for 12.99 i believe? Then pass midnight it drops down to 10! Asides from their oysters, you MUST MUST MUST try their pan roast! I got the Everything Pan Roast and I had to order one to go. It was perfect. The taste, the texture and the amount of meat. It comes with white rice, which is a plus for me! You can order it spicy or not spicy at all.

_zadln9AFEBTgEQr7g35Jw.text: We came here on a Sunday night around 11:30.  I was starving and was SHOCKED when I saw that there was a line!  I was like, "wtfreak!!  don't people sleep?!?"  Then I remembered I was in Vegas.  Sigh.  While standing in line, everyone in front and back of us were complaining about the wait, but kept blabbering about how good the food was.  FINALLY, about an hour and a half later, we were given the thumbs up sign by the staff to seat ourselves at the bar.  Sitting never felt so good!  Engulfed the roll and water they set in front of me and I ordered the Combo Pan Roast while the hubs got the House Gumbo.    I enjoy cooking and watching the chef prepare the food was like a live showing of "Iron Chef America" or something.  It was exciting and I loved it!  The chef was really friendly and funny.  He was interactive with the diners and was the star of the show.  Duh.  The hubs was amazed at how he could cook seven dishes at once, knowing exactly when to add in the next meat or spice.    The food!  Combo Pan Roast was so rich and flavorful.  They don't skimp on the meat and seafood!  So much shrimp and sausage.  I couldn't tell the difference between the crab and lobster in the dish though.  The hubs enjoyed the gumbo.  I tried some but prefer the pan roast for sure.    We had a lot of leftovers and kept it cold over ice in the sink at our hotel.  Classy.  The servings are humungo!  Definitely more than enough to share between two people.  $5 to share an entree.  Would I come back and wait again?  If you asked me that night after eating, I probably would have said no. After the loooong drive home, I heated up the leftovers and the pan roast was amazeballs.  Yes, I probably would wait again if I had to.  But I'm willing to come here at 9 AM in hopes of getting a seat right away and stuffing my face for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MGcoHOinFOKDGgQN-LryXQ.text: You might have to wait in line to be seated but it's definitely worth the wait. Good food and awesome service from Heather, Joanna, and the legendary cook -- Bob. Food portions are big and I brought home my leftovers for another meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan chowder
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood jambalaya
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We ordered the cold seafood combo as an appetizer. They were out of shrimp and gave us extra clams and oysters.

aJaGgwJckB0sL7_6HXIxZA.text: Always a long line-because it's some of the best, hands down no frills DELICIOUS seafood joints in Vegas. Seriously. This place is ALWAYS busy, mostly because there are only about 15 spots to sit at, but just get in line and wait for it. Seriously. It's THAT good. Plus, you can always get cheap drinks at the casino bar while you wait so win-win.   The New England chowder is AMAZING, put some Tabasco in it and soak up your bread in every bite.   For the star of the show, the COMBO PAN ROAST, AKA heaven in a bowl. It is a creamy, tomato-y, crab/shrimp,lobstery bowl of deliciousness. Get it. Trust me, just get it. And split it. It's HUGE.   The cooks are right there making everything in front of you so you can start drooling right away. It's a fun environment and you can always strike up a convo with the cooks or other guests and have a great time! I always tip them well as they are kicking ass and taking names ALLLLL day long!!

jRntJ2H6kTi333r3z03LUg.text: The Oyster Bar at Palace Station is the best place in Vegas to go if  you want great Oysters and other Seafood.  There is always a wait, but it is well worth it.  Whenever I visit Vegas, normally 3-4 times a year I always make time to come to the Oyster bar at least once a visit if not more.  Delicious!!!  I always start off with a dozen Oysters on the half shell with plenty of raw horse radish, then go into the main course of Bouillabaisse, in my opinion, the best thing in the menu next to their fresh Oysters.  I have tried many dishes here, all of which have been great, but the Bouillabaisse is now my dish of choice.  They load it up with giant shrimp, lobster, clams, mussels, crab legs and white fish with celery, all in an mouth watering broth, not too thick, just right.  Served with a bowl of rice and unlimited dinner rolls.   Mmmm, thinking about it makes me want to visit again soon.  The Palace Station Casino itself has recently remodeled and everything is new and it is a lot nicer that it was before, it was run down an old before, but they put some of my money back into the joint and it is so much cleaner and nicer.  A big, big plus as well is that it is a lot less smoky in the casino since the remodel, I think they upgraded their venting system as well.  Great job Palace Station.  This would have gotten 5 stars, but the wait can be quite long, which brings it down a notch.l  Enjoy.

xse2MfSNHXlQDJQ3kPw4Ag.text: Honestly, I have no idea how this place has so many good reviews. I was so excited to try this place based on the amount of positive reviews this place has but my excitement quickly disappeared. Me and my husband decided to randomly stop by since we were in the area, thankfully we didn't make a night of it like we had intended to or else we would have been even more disappointing. The oysters are extremely low quality and were poorly shucked. I've eaten better oysters at a buffet than what I was served here. Luckily the shrimp cocktail was decent otherwise I would have left at that moment. Besides the food being prepared right in front of you, there is really nothing special about this place other than being conveniently placed at the hotel.

usDUzAi4f-On5IbQOGmx8Q.text: I can't believe I haven't written a review for this place yet! Me and my bf travel to Vegas once a year and this is always our go to spot. We plan out a day specifically for this place! We each order the combo pan roast. I love spicy food, but usually get the level 5 spice as it doesn't overpower the amazing taste.   There can be crazy lines at times, so try to go early, before the lunch rush..   Parking to the hotel is also really convenient and also free!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast with jasmine rice on the side

DgGjkZ27bBHyY5NoqM4I7g.text: I love this place like Kanye loves Kanye! Everything I put in my mouth here was excellent! The oysters were huge, meaty and freshly delicious! The pan roast was Amazing! I usually can't do creamy sauces but this one didn't upset my stomach at all! You can easily share this dish but they'll charge you an extra $5 to do it. I recommend not sharing and hoarding your leftovers like I did.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the biggest meatiest oysters that I&#39;ve ever eaten in life!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster shooter

K7Uv7WyStq-fyCha3Iwz8Q.text: I waited longer than 2 hours to get seats for a party of 5 here. I did it all by myself while members of my party were gambling away. No regrets! Absolutely none! Was it painful? Extremely masochistic! But, my patience and total devotion were utterly and generously rewarded with the nirvana-inducing oysters and incredibly satisfying, soul touching soups.  I'll be here -- without hesitation -- each and every time I'm in Vegas!   (5 stars for the food; zero stars for the wait, of course)

q9OGG0tHxOyiGj_HHJHW8g.text: This is the nicest delicious friendly people I ate with. It took like 30 minutes to eat but it's was worth the wait.

5vTjtZBODHrSQEMp_vTsFw.text: The line is ridiculous for this place why not add a couple high tops so more people can dine at a time. There is only 15 stools here & its first come first serve. We really wanted to try this place but waiting over an hour and watching ppl eat from Start to finish is just horrible. The food itself was very good. The lobster & shrimp pam roast was really good, oysters were fatty & fresh but I like the clams over the oysters. Clams were really good! My husband doesn't want to come back because of the wait but would come back after hours after midnight when there's no line.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bURDiE5dwv2ODSyZYeuSCQ.text: Worth the wait!an hour on a Sunday is not too long. The menu is smaller.than the other bars in town but I feel it keeps the quality high , dont you? we both had the pan roast combined with lobster, shrimp and crab. It comes with soft dinner rolls to nibble on throughout the meal or dip in . The employees are very good about serving timely and making.conversation although busy and checking on you frequentlyI will return, and suggest you check it out.early but expect a wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7Mc4d12Cv3b_4ctpoZbyKA.text: This is one of my absolute favorite places on earth.  My buddies introduced me to this place a few years ago and I have been here for every Vegas trip since.  If you like seafood, pan roast, gumbo.... this place is for you.   The food is made with fresh ingredients and the service is second to none.   The wait is about an hour, but it's worth it!

_9TTVUqUzouVV_WohQKiwA.text: Note to self. I prefer Combo pan roast. Seafood jambalya good but rather get pan roast.  Spicy 6 is a good spice level. Wouldn't get higher probably prefer a bit lower.   Oysters are pretty yum.  Saturday Arrived 5:15pm. Seated at 6. Food at 6:30.

loIyJjNr7J4tSWBNzEMbCA.text: Simply put, I enjoyed everything I had. It's always a wonder what a restaurant's oysters are gonna be like, and theirs were more on the large side; they were still good, though. Both my buddy and I really enjoyed our main dishes, though.

wM1gQklEoBCjz8WEc0Hetg.text: Sometimes you aren't willing or able to eat an entire huge delicious Pan Roast, so you try Cajun BBQ Shrimp and continue to live happily. They were big and it was great! Glad I tried! And we arrived around noon to find NO wait!

Nw6Y1upYmR0M1G-Y6A8GAg.text: This place is worth the wait. Waited in line for a little over an hour (not too bad). But once my husband and I were seated we received great service from Johanna. She's super friendly and very attentive to our needs.   The food is amazing we ordered house gumbo and it had so much lobster pieces and the shrimp omg so good!  This is a must try place when coming out to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VjU_RGSO6j4GKZ2vA7vX-g.text: I came here with my friends after a long day at red rocks. We got in line at around 5pm, and were seated around 6:30. Even though the line doesn't look like alot of people it takes each group at least 30 min to get seated + eat.   So I am glad we went a bit earlier, that way we were starving by the time we got seated.   My friend always comes here whenever she comes to Vegas, so I was so glad to finally be able to come and try this place.   I ordered the pan roast level 10 spicy + habaneros, and we also split two dozen oysters.  They also serve a warm sourdough bun with the meal, our food came out in about 15 min which wasn't that long because everything is made fresh.   The oysters here are the big fleshy ones that aren't creamy, I probably wouldn't get them again since my tastes have changed now, I prefer small creamy oysters as opposed to large tasteless ones.   The pan roast here is delicious!! So creamy, tomato-y , fatty, and spicy!! The level 10 spicy with habaneros is very manageable and not that spicy at all, I could still taste all the yummminess in the pan roast!  I would definitely come here again, but I would probably come really late at night instead around 3-5 am.   Prices are a bit high, but they have massive serving sizes.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gumboooo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters

ot9ATbh3nuF78ipp4ajBSA.text: Horey crap this place just made me explode!! My tastebuds that is! ;) man oh man this place just went down in my books of good eating. This is THE place!   This fine place is a bar type restaurant hence the name, oyster bar. I thought it was a restaurant type setting but I was wrong. There isn't a lot of seating so There's always a LONG line for it but believe me. It's worth it!!!   The food:   LOBSTER PAN ROAST 10/10!! - SO amazing I can't even explain it. So creamy, flavorful, explosion. Lobster cooked perfectly. Tender, buttery and plentiful :O NOODLES cooked to perfection!!! O god.. I can taste it now!!   OYSTERS: fresh, succulent. Delicious!   Service: friendly service from the guys behind the bar. Thank you!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A Dozen oysters please! :)
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster pan roast with noodles.. to die for!!!

Y4Fu3K1IkzH3S5N0CDsHOg.text: Expect to wait no less than an hour no matter what time of day, but it is so worth it! The pan roasts are to die for! The only place in Vegas where you can get it this good!   Always a great meal, and always worth the wait!

2baXOdLYJvGVu7qgHQd-XQ.text: Love the combo house pan roast.. the thickness of the soup is great. Very tasty. We came around 2 pm and waited 1 hour in line. But hey no complain!!! Food are great!!! One of our fave in Vegas

imx3_5wcAGsk52bt_68_7w.text: A Louisiana style seafood bar inside the palace Station Hotel. Probably some of the best seafood in Las Vegas.  I've only checked in two or three time but I've eaten here probably 20 times over the last 20 years and while there is always a line, and this is one of only 2 or three restaurants I'll wait more that 10 minutes for I have never been disappointed.  It's also kind of cool watching your meal prepared right in front of you.

cwYnttYZ1tZYxscZMsW_bA.text: We had 1/2 dozen oysters and they were incredibly delicious, creamy and gigantic! Hubby and I had Combo Pan Roast. I got number 3 and he got number 7 for spicy. I was already cruing with 3! It was creamy, hearty, delicious and full of sea food in it!  Bob and Brenda were super nice. Im not giving 5 stars only because of the wait to get a sit at the bar... 1:30h! But I have to admit it was worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 dozen oysters

Matuxc2L2KuiD5GNp-sRMA.text: Your gonna wait in a line, your gonna take turns if you have somebody waiting with you and your gonna gamble some money while waiting! But in all honesty it's 100% worth the wait for the food, because you'll be eating something so different then the usuals, you must order a combo panroast #7 or if you like a little more heat go for the #8 instead, I'm giving it a 5 star rating because the food is amazing here and for the fact that I don't have any other delicious seafood panroasts to compare it too!

6-smHHzflu5UgS37nsqWYA.text: This might possibly be the best food in Vegas. Go early if you don't might eating Pan Roast for breakfast otherwise it's an hour wait.

0TZtyhF7Z-FdnLhbUNjCGQ.text: You have to start your first meal in Vegas with a bang and this is the spot. Even though the line is long ASF, it's like any oyster bar. It is definitely worth the wait. Over here I go their signature dish here, " the palace pan roast". It was most flavorful and highly recommended! Picture of the dish and chef Eze

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_0PmhnqKblkujPkCtgqVyQ.text: Very good seafood in Vegas. Pleasant is the atmosphere. The prices are  acceptable. I like the large juicy oysters and hearty bouill-roast.

ka4-AelV_3hZgE1WMSaEsQ.text: Ohh how I wish I lived in Vegas. With the endless variety of foods this city offers, it's a foodie paradise.   Now this place definitely has me craving more. It was 4am on a Tuesday morning when I paid this establishment a visit...and there were still people! Now don't let the talk about the wait deter you, just find the right times to go. With the limited seating offered, you'll be waiting for a while at peak times.   I got the pan roast, which was a hearty and satisfying meal. The pairing with rice and bread made this dish a perfect dish to have late after a night out. Throw in the kind spirited workers there talking and laughing with your group and you have a perfect night. I can't stress how wonderful the workers there are, offering us extra bowls of rice, extra bread, and great recommendations on their dishes.   If I were you, don't pass up the opportunity to give this place a shot. With the different types of food offered, you have plenty of reason to come back :)

L_2aRJcKskFSZ8nkBVjprg.text: Second best gumbo I've ever had outside New Orleans itself. Made fresh right in front of you. Small seating but worth the wait

yPDLTLOogp8jzEmm4Xk6wQ.text: Service was eh. Sucks to say, I'm not much of a seafood person.  Unfortunately for me... That's all this place was. I went with a few of my friends here.  My friend misinformed me and told me there was some other items other than seafood, buuut NOPE. The only other food that wasn't seafood was bread. Luckily, I'm OK with eating some fish, so I got the Parmesan Crusted Halibut, but it honestly wasn't that great to me. I'm sure if I was into oysters, it would've been delicious. My friends raved about the clam chowder from there too.  Speaking for my other friends that love to eat seafood, they loved the oysters. My friend loves this restaurant by the way. The dishes are expensive of course, but what do you expect from Las Vegas. The Calamari was mostly just batter, which was disappointing for my friends. I kind of wanted to try the Lobster Ravioli since it seemed doable for me, but I took a chance with the halibut.  The sauce was called a "florentine" sauce or something. Not really my cup of tea, but I didn't have much to choose from.  Don't listen to your friends and believe them when they say there's more than just seafood if you're not that into that.... Just go to the burger place right next door to Oyster Bar.

mdHtpskiZs9DL78a2opIHQ.text: Avoid the long lines. Go at 8:30am.  I was the only one at the bar. Tried 6 oysters & 6 clams which were good. Tried the Combo seafood pan roast & it was AMAZING. I'll definitely be back every time I'm in Vegas.  I wanted to try the Alaskan chowder as well but wouldn't have been able to take down another bowl. Very friendly service as well.  My new breakfast joint.

w2wbohTtq68458QA9FsqdA.text: Gave this place a 2nd chance.  This time everything was amazing!  Had the jambalaya and the Bouibabaise with a half dozen gold band oysters and was licking my lips!!!  I only gave it a 4 star due to the long wait - while many chairs open up.  I believe it is because they were short-handed.  Seemed to only have 2 people working.  I'll be back here again!

001K6T1kmMcgyabARPTdNw.text: Some things are just worth waiting for.    On a recent quick trip to Vegas with the bff we decided that we needed oysters.   We asked around and everyone kept saying Oyster Bar.   We Googled and yelped and quickly arranged a cab to see if it met expectations.   We got there at 4:30 on a Friday.   We waited in line about an hour to be seated.   Perhaps hotel management could make this part a little less miserable?  My back aches when I stand too long and I'm not even that old.   C'est la vie,  we knew we would be waiting,  I just wish the wait was a little easier on the back.   We were seated and the entire staff was friendly and helpful.   A roll appeared and I swear it was the best roll ever.   Or it could have been the wait.   We ordered a dozen oysters,  a few oyster shots and the palace pan roasted.   The oysters and shots came out quickly and we devoured them even quicker.   The selection of hot sauce was excellent and the oysters were fresh and plump.  The shots were Ok,  I've had better but I've also had much worse.   3 for $10 was fair.   We ordered the pan roasted and split it.   They don't charge a split plate fee if you order $15 in appetizers so we were good.   Split plate fees bug me as a rule so that made me happy.   The pan roasted itself was creamy and rich.   It was amazing but there's no way either of us could have finished the bowl by ourself.     Ricardo was funny and fun to watch.   He made it look so easy and he kept us laughing.   I appreciated his multi-tasking skills,  he worked quickly and efficiently.   Keep in mind that there are only 18 seats.   We had a few very nice people sitting there who were kind enough to move stools to allow others to sit,  but that was on their own accord.   It's quite a wait but totally worth it.

hXICyOs6qug2hwuOTQ-cMQ.text: Really worth the wait! I'm glad I wasn't hungry when we got in line. I suggest not deciding to come here when you're really hungry or the wait will just make you angry.

bHdYUCcgWSABYeGgG1-dNA.text: The Crab Pan Roast is DELICIOUS!  Large clumps of crab meat in a bowl of creamy goodness!  It's so tasty!  After devouring this, all you want to do is go to sleep.  This will definitely put you into food coma.  The oysters and clams on the half shell are great too!  A must visit when you're in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab pan roast

kYBgt4Qo40DxqfnlmH7-ew.text: I got as close as I could get to Cajun cooking in Las Vegas. Chef Hollomon brought spicy and savory to the table and made the end of this epic night more incredible. We had 1/2 dozen raw oysters, which was better than anything I'd ever had. Then we shared the combo pan roast, which had shrimp, crab and lobster, and bouillabaisse, which was the perfect marriage of seafood all in one pot. I HIGHLY recommend this place for anyone who loves Cajun style cooking. On a sidenote, you can gauge the spice on a scale from1 to 10, depending on your preference. Enjoy this diamond in the ruff!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half dozen oysters.

yDJfnt9psILhaC1U20zlsg.text: Very late late dinner or very early early breakfast.... 2 hours of waiting, worth it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very late late dinner or very early early breakfast.... 2 hours of waiting, worth it!!!

OraeR4IscFVAucLboqGt6g.text: What can I say, this place still rocks! Had lunch here on Monday and what was supposed to be a "snack" ended up being a full blown meal! Started off with oysters and clams on the half shell, and ordered a combo pan roast with a spicy level of 10. Yes 10, the heat is so unbelievably good! Some of the patrons seated next to me were dying with a heat level of 6, so people were looking at me like I was nuts.  Ricardo and Dolores are awesome! Great sense of humor and both on top of their game!

og-5TNaqSMqjRB42e9jRKQ.text: Outstanding as always.   There's always a line here,  and it's  obvious why once you get your meal. I've been coming here for 20 years.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TjW0CS2zcDIz7YECGL8mWA.text: I don't even need to explain how good this place is. But I'll just say what I always order. Pan roast combination with a side of rice. Spice level 3.  if you go higher then a 5 you're crazy lol. Jk. And the oysters are always bomb. Happy eating

UTvEJ6qVehU2nuDoDB5LHQ.text: What can I say that hasn't been said yet!?!?!!? Came here around 4 with 5 gfs thinking we were coming at an 'off' time... yeah, we were wrong.  Still waiting an hr and 15 mins to get seated.    FYI- they don't skip people in line if ONE seat opens up and there's a group of 4 next in line.  So don't get upset if you say random seats empty... they're clearing it out for the next GROUP or PERSON in line.   At first we were like... WHYYYY are there open seats.. but then we realized.    We told the person that we would take seats of two or three or five-whichever opened up first!    The pan roast is AMAZING.  Level 8... I wish I got level 10 but we were sharing.  Ordered the rice on the side so that way all the sauce wouldn't seep into the rice right away- PLUS you can take leftovers to go!    The chef and employees are all amazing and super nice!  Can't wait to come back. This definitely will be a must every time I'm in Vegas from here on out.    Actually, my gfs and I are already planning to do a pan roast party at home, SOON!

sHPSXamhGmgx0F6su87PUg.text: This place is so good and like everyone says it is worth the wait.  It is only bar top seating with 18 seats i think. So the wait can be anywhere from 20 minutes to 2 hours.   I usually always get the combo pan roast. Its like a bisque with seafood and spicy.Comes with rice so that helps with the spice. I have once tried the bouillabaisse  and it was also tasty the broth was lighter compared to the pan roast. I have also had the clam chowder which is also good. We always get a dozen of their oyster, I mean what can you say about oyster other than delicious.

ghYjR9ivxDWe_w4oxs2vKA.text: Best oysters and seafood roast I've had in a long time! I went first time with my girlfriend after reviewing on Yelp, then I have been back every time I am in Vegas regardless of the wait time. Yes, you have to wait a long time due to the limited seating, but the wait is well worth it! Don't let the size and casino atmosphere fool you, this place offers the best seafood I have had in las Vegas for the price!!

KteCkPlXLgRCyxUyY5TDhA.text: I had to stop by here because my coworker wouldn't stop talking about how good this place is.  Came here around 1am and I couldn't believe I had to wait 40 minutes just to seat down.... I really hate waiting in a restaurant but I decided to anyway.  After seating down, they took the drink order and the food order because I knew what I wanted.  After another 20 minutes later the food finally came out.  The pan roast had a very rich flavor.  It is good as other reviewers said but I'm not sure if I will wait 1 hour to get my food at the restaurant.  If you have time, make sure to visit here.  If you are in a rush, find a different restaurant.

KKHI-MvGujFZfB11pCddvQ.text: My second  time at Oyster Bar and it was amazing.  I came with a party of five the first time and we ordered the seafood jambalaya,  combo pan roast and oysters. Everything was very flavorful and the oysters were delicious!!!  The only real drawback was the wait.   Expect to wait for an hour to two sometimes but you can't really blame this on them when  the food is so good. It's off the strip inside Palace station so you're going to have to take a taxi if you are staying on the strip.  The waitress and the chef Bob are very attentive.  They interact with the customers and are very fun to talk to. Definitely a must go to place if you like oysters and pan roast!!

wVHtbEz2K-rmJc04GEALQg.text: OMG seriously you have to come here. My hubby and I got the pan roast w/ crab, lobster, and shrimp so DELISH. I will come back all the way from SF just to come and eat here again.

yZ5CdMHBg8zD3UOGdWJ4Pg.text: Love this place. Always a must when I come to Las Vegas.  Dozen raw oysters are shucked in front of you and the pan roast/soups too! Oysters taste very fresh and decent size (not too tiny or meaty for me). The combo pan roast is a must-try! Nice and creamy/saucy goodness with rice and seafood is heaven! The etouffee was also delicious. You can choose your level of spiciness from 1-10. I enjoy spice just a tad and a 4 was quite spicy. Still enjoyable though. Portions are quite large. 12 oysters and a pan-roast combo with rice easily fills 2 people up with moderate appetite. Unless you want left-overs, order your own.  The service is always great the past 5-6 times I've came here.  Wait time can be a bummer of minimum 30-60 mins. But this place is open 24-hours so maybe try going during off-peak meal hours.  There are no more than 20 seats and it is sitting directly within the casino slots.I don't know other chefs that work the front counter, but Bob is a pretty funny guy.

W8h9-oZ0rTo4NUN_YpunVg.text: This place is a hidden gem inside the palace station casino. Best pan roast I ever had, spice to your liking! Just a long wait to be seated that's why Im rating it a 4 star but the food is amazing, definitely worth the wait. Try to go off peak hours for a shorter wait time and you will not be disappointed! I will be back when I come back to Vegas.

9f8Dj3YuLjLKxYNS7kZ4QQ.text: Gave up after a 45 min wait on a Monday night at 7:30.  Probably had another hour in line.   Not sure anything is worth that.

42Exhc1aXXk65hzzpLqoKw.text: I am not a seafood lover but my BF is so I was a bit worried about eating here, I was pleased to see that they offered Ceaser Salad and it was delicious, I would go back again for the salad.

qbLxAbN6dVJpyi01hVKcCg.text: The Oyster Bar is the best food I had while in Vegas.  I had the palace pan roast and it was uh-maz-ing! I don't really know what a pan roast is, but I've been calling it a gumstewp (gumbo-stew-soup). And this gumstewp is a giant bowl of pure omg deliciousness. While it's enough to share for two ($5 share charge), it's sooo good, you might want a bowl to yourself.  Have patience! There is limited bar seating and food is made to order. You will wait a longgggg time. You will wait to sit. You will wait to order. You will wait to eat. And you will be very happy to lick your bowl clean after all the waiting.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. palace pan roast

dYPahu9NyzkDL3GRevX4EQ.text: 24/7 oyster bar and fresh seafood? Count me in!   Red clam chowder is a must.   Shrimp and lobster fra diablo is to die for.   It was worth the wait.   Be prepared to wait in a long line and don't play the machines close to the line because they are tight!   You've been warned ;)

TPG3HVWJpJwcJEp2171aPA.text: If you like food from Louisiana like gumbo, jambalaya, etouffee, seafood and fresh oysters you'll love this place! I was introduced to this spot at 6am after a night out in Vegas and man it was worth the wait. It's seats only a few at a bar in the old Palace Station Casino but man the gumbo is ridiculous!   Oysters shucked right in-front of you, gumbo's made per order right in-front of you and two of the coolest guys ever doing all the work.  Totally worth checking this place out, oh and yeah its open all day and all night!   Cheers!

mXU-KIdq4ZOqoKjaJG1Eag.text: Bomb...fire...amazing...most delicious food ever. I get the Pan roast and its the best. This location is the best! I personally feel like anyone that gives less than 5 stars is just ignorant lol. Yes the line always sucks...but when you see your fresh food being made, its worth it.

8Uu5v5aJTNZ2AkZDmK5xIw.text: My most favorite places to dine while in Vegas.   Recently became 24 HRS!!!  The PAN ROAST combo (shrimp, crabs, lobster) is a must have! The orange creamy soup is pretty flavored and salty (extra salty because of the seafood) so it's best to scoop a spoon full on top of your rice, like curry, and eat it that way. Or eat it with bread. Gumbo is ok, I don't like that too much. Oysters are always fresh and delish. The shooters are even better.   The wait is long. Sometimes over an hour long. But it's worth the wait. Trust. Set up is a bar, about 14 stools. Waiting for your food takes a while too since there is only one server and one cook. Sometimes the cook is the one doing all the work. So be patient.   Service is great here. Cooks are always interactive and fun. Our cook gave our party of 7 oyster shooters because it was my cousin's birthday on the house. Awesome service!  Enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZWMN_m9dfTr-JF-rwac_lw.text: Long line waiting is for sure. Omg we had been waiting for 2hours before we were seated. The limited of the seats made everyone standing in the line waiting. But it was worth of waiting because their combo style Jambalaya soup with a lot of seafood. The oysters was ok, not very impressed because they are too big and no sweetness from it.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too big oysters with little taste
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo with crab meat, jombo shrimp and big lobster meat

x1ElgxQUe1d7So-0fI84Zg.text: We were not able to try the food. They should not advertise open 24/7 when in fact they CLOSE 1 day out of the month for a deep cleaning..! Definitely disappointed and we are flying out in the morning. Bad luck us.. We were here Tues, March 21st, which seems like a random day.

Bs0aJMnT9AYX_NE4jXXFvQ.text: Everything about this place is awesome.........except the wait. On a Saturday 3am, we wouldn't be seated until 5am. Supposedly, we were grouped up into the "clubbers" crowd, hence the prolonged wait. It's a small bar that can fit about 15 people or so. Everything is cooked to order which adds about 30 more minutes to the process on top of your eating time. If you see that line like 5 or 7 people long, expect that to be about an hour wait. For us well, let's say we had 4 people in front of us, but as we got closer more and more came from the woodwork....2 hour wait. 1 hour eat time...you are in for a commitment here.  -=-Jambalaya-=- I got this here at 10/10 spicy. EL FUEGO. EL Perfecto. Although, most others that tried this plate couldn't handle the heat. They don't mess around here. The portions are huge. It's ideal to share, but you'll get hit with a sharing charge if you do so. Order another smaller entree like oysters, then share a big plate. You'll be all set.  -=-Pan Roast-=- All the seasonings for all the entrees are pretty much the same thing: your Louisiana style cajun. This pan roast was new vocabulary to me, but I was convinced to at least try this. Now, I won't stray again. Your pan roast is everything that your jambalaya is....with the added benefit of a creaminess that I can probably only attribute to either oyster sauce or wine, something to give the soup a creamier taste. White rice is served on the side. Mix together and you'll be full in about half a bowl.

QYFuFKDuz6w-yDuJaOEvFA.text: mmmm. Pan Roast - seafood for me. Rice on the side! :) I get it as a "5" right in the middle of the spice level.   Try the oyster shooter w/ bloody mary mix. I dare you. mmm. so yummy. And wash it down with some beer. C'mon it's a 21 + place anyways. Enjoy the food.  The thing is everyone does things differently here. If you watch the chefs - some are taking his sweet a$$ed time (however, I heard his food tastes the best) and some would just burn yours (like mine, but still was delish!)  I'm not sure if it's because they don't have enough room and stuff - or what. We were about 10 ppl behind, but yet still took us about 2.5 hours before getting seated. Doesn't matter what time you show up, because there is always someone in line and  waiting and have been waiting. We got there around 12:30 am, didn't sit down and order until 4am. However, as usual, the food was way worth it.

k3V2S8_IXHCuOAyZ5fbfXw.text: Best place to eat in Vegas. I enjoy a lobster pan roast with sausage every time I'm in town, which is like 3-5x a year. Always worth the wait!

_bW9Vc8NTJMCULek4AoQ-w.text: There are several other "Oyster Bar's" in Las Vegas but this is the best this side of New Orleans. Open 24/7 for a reason. Definitely a Bucket List restaurant. This time, I had the gulf oysters and seafood jambalaya, but you cannot miss with anything on the menu.

-anrTIG6yNZ3umAZ2gqxeQ.text: Not worth the wait. I heard great reviews from several people. The food was good but nothing to write home about. My husband had the gumbo and I had the combo pan roast. There are so many options in Vegas we won't be back.

4ISmNQ6qDJHLQq9G8snSXg.text: love the food . we hit this place every time we go to vegas. unfortunately one of the chef's the older white dude bob has a crappy attitude . i've  been served by him twice and he has the same nasty disposition each time just a rude guy he should cook in the back and leave the hospitality for those with better attitudes. plus he's  pretty hard to look at on top of his stank attitude. the black chef Mr. Brown is much more personable.

3roJjr-lrC-k_1DHscfVQw.text: I got here at 4:40 am and it's now 5:44am and I still haven't received the pan roast that i ordered. It was a black bald  chef with  an earring, I think it's due to the fact that I came in the night before and it was literally the same service and I told him that the service was horrible. This is my first time seeing him and I've been here a lot, the Asian chef is way better with better customer service and way more advance with speed... So disappointing. I got up and left!

V9nanRqdOw-Hdrcbyioavw.text: HYPE does exist. I have never had oyster bar before but I had similar food to the oyster bar. I had the pan roast in three different places in socal, I've try ritters, the boiler, the kettle bar, and now FINALLY the oyster bar. The OG to the pan roast! I can finally say the oyster bar does beat them all in taste.... but they are VERY VERY similar. Oyster bar is very generous with their seafood though.   Wait time? Puck no... never again hahaha. I'm sticking with the pan roast around my area in SoCal. Anyways we were probably the 3rd group in line.. and the wait was almost 2 HOURS. I over heard some guest saying that they're going to take their  sweet time eating so we can wait longer and the chef agreed to that... like who the ... does that?! LOL. This is literally why I minus a star.. it could have been a five star. But anyways, don't think if you're on the top of the line you're going to be seated quickly because you might not. The guy behind us was waiting by himself, then he goes PLUS 8..... like he had an whole group wondering off somewhere... I'm pretty sure the people behind him was pretty pissed off. I'm glad we were in front of him... but yeah if you don't want a wait or a short wait come at 5AM-9AM! ( It opens 24 HOURS ) Some couple was trying to pay us $20 to cut the line too.. hahaha, uhm no LOL.   Now for the food.. AMAZING! One dish can feed up to ( 1 - 2  people ) But if you're waiting that long why not order one each. If you don't finish take it togo!   Shared the Combo pan roast, Cioppino, and Alaskan Chowder.   $5.00 SHARING fee. Ugh, it's so amazing though... why you got to play us like that. Combo Pan Roast- The sauce and they spiciness is good, you get to pick an spice level of 1 - 10. We got 8 and it wasn't even that spicy LOL but to me I can handle a good enough spice. I would say 3 - 5  MILD,  6 - 8 is Medium, 9-10 HOT. Cioppino - Fish stew with seafood, if you like something soupy and light get this. I thought it was okay... at first we wanted to try the shrimp and lobster far dialo but the chef HIGHLY recommended the Cioppino..I don't think I would order this again. Alaskan Chowder- YES AND YES, please do order this. Best chowder ever...so much seafood and fresh clams! Overall the Combo Pan Roast is THE BEST!! never ever disappoint, if it's your first time get the combo pan roast!! Second will be Alaskan chowder!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast, cioppino and alaskan chowder!

TYOnmOwnwOvneGSAefutPA.text: What!!!... First timer here and I'm an instant fan. Yes, you'll have to wait unless you get lucky and seats open up when you arrive. But it's worth the wait! You have 24hr in a day to try it.   Really cool, hole-in-the-wall kinda place. Right in the middle of a low-mid range hotel/casino way off the strip, the Palace Station.   The food was excellent. As my first time here, my family recommended the Combo Pan Roast w/ shrimp, crab and lobster. I ordered mine with medium (#5) spiciness and included a scoop of white rice on top (you can ask for it on the side if you like). Also had shrimp cocktail and the dozen oysters in the half shell. Both were really tasty. The clam linguini my sis got looked amazing as well. Will have to try that one time. My friend got the manhattan clam chowder and mentioned that it was ok and a little salty for his taste.   They also offer clams on the half shell, gumbo, jambalaya, clam chowder and more! Drool. Check out the specials on beer and drinks. An oyster shooter menu looked too good.   Service was friendly and attentive. The chef had the process down. It was entertaining watching him work as he prepared the meals in front of you. They also didn't rush you through your meal, as seeing there are only 18 seats. I don't recommend large parties, as it may be tough to get everyone seated at one time.  I'm eager to go back and try more dishes. If you like seafood, this is a must-go-to.

UaccYX3HBJdjfLmoI6lrOQ.text: There's a few locations around Vegas, but this is the only one I'll come to!  There's no table's and the bar only sits about 12 or so.  If you come in late night around 10pm-12am there's not much of a wait, maybe just a few minutes.  However if you come in mid day to 8pm except at least an hour wait or so to get seated.  But hey it's busy for a reason!  I love oysters before my meal so it's  important to me that they are always fresh, which they are! All the while you meal is prepared right in front of you.  The best plate I would say for me and my friends is the Pan Roast. There's no way to describe it other than just amazing!!!  Adding sausage makes it just that much better. =)   I've also had the Gumbo and Jumbalaya and they're  arguably just as good, especially if you like more of a creamy texture.    Vegas experience I think every local has to try at least once!!

gDHi8iKgHhl72T4pcxFFpg.text: So so good!!!  Every time I venture out to the good 'ol sin city, I always make sure I get my Oyster Bar fix before I head back home.  This place is super super small, sitting only about 18 or so people in a bar seating restaurant. When I first came here, it was some time ago during dinner and I remember the line was stretching out towards the slot machines. I waited for maybe a good 30-40 minutes realizing we haven't moved an inch!! We decided to eat elsewhere and come back when it wasn't so busy. The second time I came during lunch on a weekday. Thank God there were only a couple of people waiting and we were able to get seated quick.   If you do go during weekends during rush hours, be prepared to wait...FOR HOURS!! Go on a weekday or odd hours since this place is 24 hours!  So far, I've only tried their combo pan past and palace pan roast. But, I think that's pretty much the only thing you should order!! The pan roasts are sooo good! The bf ordered a jambalaya one time but throughout the night kept taking bites of my pan roast that he decided to just stick with pan roast from there on after.  The best deal is to just share a pan roast for $5 extra so that way you can order other appetizers when you come. (:  I'm not much of a raw oyster person but the oysters here are no joke FATTT! Those suckers are so freaking huge I was shocked at the person next to me being able to eat a whole dozen by himself. If you like oysters, I guarantee you'll enjoy the oysters here at Oyster Bar.   Overall, I really enjoying eating at the Oyster Bar.  Not only is the food super good but I really like the small intimate setting.  I have so far met 3 out of the 5 chefs that are regulars here and I enjoy conversing with them while I eat my pan roast.  Depending on the chef that is working, be careful at how spicy you make your pan roast.  I ordered a 7 with one chef my last pan roast and it was perfect.  And then I ordered a 7 with a different chef and it was SPICY. It was my first meal of the day and I felt like there was a hole burning through my stomach!   The hotel on the other hand is not as great. Very sad and depressing.  I had a couple of randos come up to me while waiting in line and talk to me about Jesus. Interesting. But I feel the setting just makes Oyster Bar that much more special.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super tiny kitchen.

t2-C4ynfTmtuwhknB7uNjg.text: A must stop place whenever in Vegas.  Tried a few things but the gumbo is the only way to go with since good fresh oysters.  Busy or not this pace has top notch service.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JiF2rhp-M7LCgQtbgoBGnw.text: I had a pan roast combination and my fiance had a clam chowder. It was ok to have one time in a life time for a meal after waited more than 2hrs but not too often. However, service was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Only seats are available what you are looking at on photo..

nX9Uv8vIc0HH9lViezEl8A.text: Went to the Oyster bar on a Tuesday about 6pm. waited in line for about a 1/2 hour. The seating is very limited. about 15 chairs at the Oyster Bar. I assume they constantly have a line and you can easily wait up to an hour, in line. The night we went , they had 1 cook and 1 cashier. We ordered a drink and fresh oysters to start. The Oysters were pretty good and the beer was cold and the bread was warm. About 30 minutes later our food came. My lobster roast had plenty of lobster and it had a good flavor, The other dish had way to much chicken and not enough seafood, it was average. Normally I would have given them a three, but the cook and the cashier were really busting their ass to get the food out, shuck oysters, serve drinks, clean the bar, do refills and seat people. And they were doing it with a smile. The supervisor  came around several times and say them in the weeds and kept going.[What a twit]. I think if they had another worker, everything would be excellent and they wouldn't have to rush everything and constantly run their ass off non stop. So many of the casinos are really cutting back and its really killing the place. If my employees get slammed, I am right in the middle of it busting my tail with them. Not standing back like some managers and ignoring the problem.

NRmGQTexU3-UHh3G-sM4fw.text: From the Wynn, we ask cab to take us to the best seafood in town.  So, westbound on Sahara we go..not knowing wth to expect..two minutes later, we see the Spearmint Rhino drawing near on the horizon...definitely smelled like seafood..and looked like an abalone was wedged in between everyone's legs.  Actually, a friend of ours (thanks Fred) recommended this place to us for literally years so we finally decided to experience it for ourselves.  Upon arrival, we find bar seating only, which is limited to roughly 20 stools.  I heard/read at peak points during the day the wait is about an hour but the 2 consecutive nights we came, 5am and 6am respectively, there was no wait at all.    Great time to end the night or start the day.  Open 24 hours.  They also take phone orders.  Both mornings fellow yelper and pal Chris K treated the boys to the combo roast (lobster, crab, shrimp) at spice level 8/10.  The dish is a tomato based bisque/puree and for my palate wasn't spicy enough but heavenly nonetheless.  One combo roast is definitely enough for two, so order accordingly.  It takes about 10-15 minutes for the dish to arrive but time flew as we watched Ricardo the filipino prepare it before our very eyes.  Ricardo and an elderly caucasian gentlemen, who resembles Syracuse's Jim Boeheim, are probably the coolest cats in town.   Be especially vigilant while Ricardo generously pours what he calls "heavy cream."  For all I know, it is liquefied crack (coined by Brian J).  Portions are generous and accompanied by (unlimited?) steamed white rice and warm sourdough rolls.  I will never go to another buffet in Vegas ever again, I'd rather eat here 3x...a day.

JX1j1UE7fNHwXJlhCRSkaw.text: This place is a hidden gem! !! You have t get the pan roast it's the best!  It is why I come back to this place every time I feel like some seafood. Portions are huge too!  You can't go wrong here. Sometimes one of the  chefs might be a little tipsy,  but he still know what he's doing ! Trust me it's worth it!

z21KJhBjealf-SfidOC2Cg.text: Read about this oyster bar from yelp and decided to give it a try. We arrived there at about 11:30am on Sunday and the line didnt look too bad...probably about 2 groups of people in front of us (like 7-8 people). We ended up waiting for an hour before we were seated. Once we were seated, the chef served us some rolls and the server took our order pretty quickly.   We ordered the combo pan roast and alaskan chowder. It's pretty cool to watch the chef, Bob cook right in front of us. I can't believe he's the only one cooking for all 20 people. He has been working non-stop during his shift. I didn't even see him taking any breaks at all. He cooks, cleans, buses tables, shucks oysters/clams. He does everything! He's simply amazing! Not to mention the food he made were absolutely delicious. Definitely worth the wait and will go back again. Two thumbs up.

NEfUAd5ZisZFd1yHfxgx_Q.text: Eww. What am I doing inside the Palace Station outta all places in Vegas??   Trying to eat some of the BESTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTT PAN ROASTTTTTTTT and GUMBOOOO EVERRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR!!!! ever ever ever.  It's so good, I can't think of one complaint or one thing they could do to make it better...  oh I know what they could do.... find a way to seat more people!!! It's right next to the casino, so at least you can gamble while watching the line go down. ;)

0Tq31_JtoU-UBcdItXJuLw.text: Yes, its only a bar with maybe 20bar stools.  We waited for 1.5hrs in the afternoon and decided to leave.  We came back at 10pm after an aweful dinner at Bouchon and waited maybe 20mins.  Food: You have a selection of heat level of 1-10 for entrees.  I would recommend that you get under 5 especially if you get the gumbo.  The heat overpowers a lot of the dish and you wouldn't want an accident at the club or on the can LOL 1. Oysters (1 dozen) - Very very fresh 2. House Gumbo - Heat level 7.  The flavor was awesome but since it was soupy.  The heat intensifies after each spoon.  I would probably get a 1 or 2 next time.  Wish it came with more rice. 3. Palace Pan Roast - Heat level 5.  The most popular dish was also the best dish.  The shellfish, crab, shrimp, sausage + ingredients tasted like the sea.  Hearty, creamy, almost soulful but the heat overpowers everything.  I too would get this again but in 2-3. 4. Linguine alla Vongole - Heat level 7.  The linguine was cooked perfectly.  The calms and sauce was a good balance but the heat again awakened my senses.  I would imagine this dish being light at a 2-3 in heat level. 5. Bread - nothing special but free 6. Shocktop Beer - light beer with a hint of orange.  Great for the summers.  Nice cold beer to cool down with all that heat.    If your a beer drinker and plan on coming back, I would highly recommend that you buy the 24oz glass.  Bring back the glass and you only pay 1/2 on refills.  If you haven't tried the beers, the waiter will gladly let you sample and small glass for free.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. gumbo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine alla Vongole
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace Pan Roast

c9UBabY_YHiOqYjFyChgdA.text: Since I gave review to The Broiler and Ritter's, it's only fair to give a review of the original place The Oyster Bar inside Palace Station Hotel at Las Vegas, NV.  I have to give this place a 5 stars... It's up in Vegas and the food is really exceptional. It's always pack but if you go off normal eating hours, the wait won't be too bad. The staff is friendly but the place is too small. It can't sit that many people because they can't provide the room. So do not go with a big party. That explains why you have to wait.  If you are in Las Vegas this place is a must try.

tgubxSkXJJ7hc7yebQIAkQ.text: Decent oysters. Had the combo Pan Roast at level 10 spice.  Tasted pretty good with a nice kick. The wait is a pain and my return to eat here would be based on how long the line is.

AoAgDJWg3QY75gor2SAG1w.text: Enjoyed there food and service to the fullest. I would recommend this restraunt to all. I give them a 5.

lDa0AY_Dt1vmWgO_l_zIDg.text: Sometimes in life we do things just to say we did it. I guess one such event would be the oyster bar "experience" in Palace station. I can now be inducted into its int'l brotherhood of diners therebecause of the : --2 hour wait in line , like cattle --pervasive stale smoke stench(nicotine not bbq applwood) infusing every nook and crannie of the casino --only to be serviced by smart ass wait staff and management who think your a ball bearing on the assembly line the food was actually fairly good, even though i was tossing and turning all night from the heavy spices. I might go back only during non-busy hours when that hotel fixes the air filtration suystem, and limits the low lifes comin and goin, but wait. TIV this is Vegas and none of the above aint nevah gonna happen Overrate, seriously,. Save your coins and do seafood at the Rio, or Orleans

GKfy4C1bObb_3dJnL9HGsA.text: before you read on, BE PREPARED TO WAIT 1-2 hours to be seated! 18 seats around a bar, 1 server, 1 cook, 1 bus boy No Kids allowed Open 24 hours They tell me it's busy all day long except 7-730AM :)  Our first time at oyster bar - 90 minute wait for 2 of us - Amazing food - LOVE the pan roast and clam chowder. Gumbo was good but salty.  We got spice level of 5 /10 and was "mild" for my taste. - Great service - Cooked in front of you  We will be back if we have the time to wait that long again!

2LElAnvFM1WHDMkzncHBVQ.text: The constant truth here is you will be in line to get food. It's 24 hours so I'd laugh my ass off if 3 in the morning there is a line for a Combo Pan Roast which is what I had for my main course. I ate oysters as well since I love good oysters. It's the taste of the ocean and the slippery, spicy lemony flavor that you don't normally get. For a brief moment I feel like I'm on a tropical island.  The bowl is deep and the soup is full of flavor. Every spoonful has that slow roasted, seafood flavor that can satisfy your taste buds. I enjoyed it so much that I didn't slow down and burned the roof of my mouth.   I like that it's Vegas, 24 hours, drink and/or smoke while waiting in line. I'm not a smoker but I won't begrudge you if you light up.   The chef and waitress' are really hard workers because they were describing how the day goes. It can be really busy or just consistent but rarely empty. I would eat here for breakfast if you really hate the lines. I'm ASSUMING it's pretty slow in the mornings.

7WV_Pv8Mx1pZSkIgQ3KqFg.text: I went there with my friends, and we had a totally unexpected seafood-surf! We were among those who are quite skeptical of good ratings on any websites, but we were totally impressed by the place. The Jambalaya I ordered was absolutely awesome, and even much better than what I had in Spain. Helpings of the dishes were generous. The price was quite reasonable, even for a visitor.

H81DQx2ImMOeuNtmTfnw2g.text: yummmy pan roast ... right balance of seafood w tomato based creaminess... portions are perfect... oysters n fresh clams delicious ....oyster shooters were amazing ... waited 1.5hours on a Saturday around 5p

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ohh so good oysters!!! clean n chilled
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The start of our delightful experience... watching our pan roasts in the making w fresh seafood
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. oyster shooters w vodka ...perfectly chilled

yyFMEaUDQ2GA1jqbRzaQPA.text: Loved this place! Only 20 seats or so in a bar-type set up, so definitely not ideal for a big group. Best for a couple. At times you have to wait 1+ hours but it's worth it.  The hot roasts we so good and easily shared between 2 or as great leftovers.  Rich and filling. So much flavor, can't wait to go back!  Didn't try the oysters though, doh!

GBBr5Q7GQ9tGHA_1Vcx9Rw.text: Love it!! Went there for the first time in Dec 2013 with a friend and was told the wait will be long because it is just a "bar", which it really is just a bar.  We went on a weekday (wednesday night) and waited at least 30 minutes to be seated.  Don't let appearances fool you because the food is amazing!  I had the pan roast and it was delicious.  Generous serving for the price.  Well worth the wait.  Will come back and eat again.  Not a place for big parties because seating is very limited, I believe only 24 bar seats.  But you must try at least once and you will be hooked.

xxl15lQnpsU-9_Im6PF3rA.text: Food was straight up 5   star - Wife got the Pan Roast & I got the boulibase.... Some of the most amazing stuff I have ever ate.   Got there at 9:30 on a monday night ..... Waited forever to be seated then waited forever for food... I get it.. This is part of experience. The whole process took over 3 hours..... They could do a few things to speed that up... They make a lot of money from this bar... So they don't change a thing

gc_vlbEDMKnrIOHcbOQE6Q.text: This place is hands down some of the best food i have ever eaten, the 2 hour wait was WORTH IT, the shrimp and lobster fra diavolo over linguini is the best fra diavolo ive ever had in my whole god damn life, the staff are amazing as well, i will be coming back here and recommending this gem to every person on the fuckin planet.

eQhzwkaixPhrpbkwWX76-Q.text: To die for!!!!!   While my mom and I were dining at the delicious TC's Rib Crib we started talking to a couple and their friend sitting next to us about great places to eat in Vegas and they all agreed that the "Oyster Bar" @ Palace Station was the next best place to try in Vegas.  We stood on line for 45 minutes but it was so worth the wait. We ordered oysters first then shared the gumbo in which you can add as much heat to it as you can stand and it was loaded w/crab, shrimps and lobster. You can any of the seafood items your selected dish. I also love that they cook it right there before you.   New Orleans WATCH out.... The portions are healthy, so you can share.  We both decided it would be the 1st place we're eating at  the next time we're in Vegas and we wouldn't share either. LOL

9DgDTWpoZtoi07gesnrUYA.text: I really want to give the Oyster Bar a Bad Review. We have been coming here for many years now and the lines and wait keeps getting longer and longer. Waited in line 2 hours last night, longest ever.  Was think a couple of really bad reviews would shorten that line up pretty quick. But I cannot tell a lie. This place is GREAT. Every time we are in town we head straight to this place from the airport. Even though we are NOT LOCALS, the cooks and waitresses recognize us. Normally we order raw oysters and raw clams to start. Then order the House Gumbo. If we come more than once during our stay, we branch out to other items on the menu. Normally order a 7 on the gumbo. I think that Bob is the one with the heavy hand with the spice, so be careful. His 7 is more like an 8 or even 9. I think if you order a 7 on the pan roast it's not as spicy because of the cream.  If you are in the Palace Station give it a try. But please be kind to the rest of us and know what you want when you sit down and eat quickly. I've had a lot of great conversations with people in line, but would gladly give them up in favor of shorter lines.

6r5Z5B_efelIlktWjtBRGA.text: Absolutely LOVE THIS PLACE!! Shrimp scampi &  clams on ice are my go to. Service was awesome! Can't wait to come back.

wAdSXIoHXL3dxXee2rdLOw.text: I came here for my second time and I am such a huge fan. The gumbo, pan roast and new england clam chowder are all winners.   Tip #1: Come during off hours or you'll be waiting a long time. Tip #2: Don't order your entrees too hot; my opinion is that the spicyness detracts from the taste of the dishes.

qIkmN7hMaUmqHdH7yLgRzg.text: Fresh Oysters from 1AM to - 9AM.  Comes with a spicy cocktail sauce which was amazing.   Palace Pan Roast - first time trying it and loved it! went back for more the next day!   YUMM!!!

bGd1Dk19NMM9c4Smo5XQlA.text: What a unique place! Every review you've read so far is accurate. We got there at about 11:20 on a Saturday, only 3 people waiting on line ahead of us, we sat about 20 minutes later, and by that time the line had about a dozen people waiting.  Watching the food be made right in front of you is entertaining. The cook (Bob) and the waitress (Jill) were working hard and were both very nice.  Food was FANTASTIC. - By the time we were done, (12:40ish), line was pretty long.

jo_aC3zXPQZu4BwmkhStgg.text: Came here for my birthday at 5 am and there was no lines. I was craving spicy seafood and man the Combo Pan Roast was delicious ! We ordered spicy level 5 and it sure had a good kick to it. We also ordered the half a dozen oysters. Our server Jill and chef Holloman were wonderful! They need a raise :) I would definitely come back again due to the mouthwatering food and excellent service.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half a dozen oysters

8YP8D_eqcztRKn34CaJN2A.text: Waited almost 2 hours for this meal. Worth every minute. My girlfriend & I ordered the combo pan roast. We were NOT disappointed it was delicious. Best meal I've had in Las Vegas so far. Will come here again, they're opened 24 hours. Recommended!!!!

Mak1b1dwT9jar8UJ4H307A.text: Able to get a seat just before lunch time. Wow, service was good and entertaining.  Manhattan clam chowder was great. The linguine with clams in red sauce huge and sssooo good. Couldn't eat the whole bowl. At least another meal. Could have another type of bread, not sourdough. Now I know why the line is always so long for a seat. Go during off hours. It is a 24/7 bar and no kids allowed.

MDfhcJykzegz9tRHqwrI-g.text: No more buffets! Before leaving Vegas the bf and I had dinner here before hitting the road. When we arrived at 730 we waited for about 15 minutes before 2 seats were available. We ordered the pan roast with a half dozen oysters. Mmmmmm. We ate some bread while we watched as our food was being prepared. The oysters arrived and I was ready to dig into my share. I ate 4 of them! The pan roast arrived and it smelled good. We got a level 5 on the spiciness. It was just perfect. Not too spicy. We didn't finish our pan roast. Toooooooo full. The staff here is always friendly and attentive to the customers.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast

LTqWwqWUOw8mVSrk7RwVmQ.text: The wait is definitely long but it is worth it.   At first, I was a bit skeptical about the highly-raved soup my cousin was telling me about. From the looks of it, it was so simple and it seemed like it required no skill. However, once I tasted it, OH MAN, it was delicious! I had the combination tomatoe soup. It was really good and quite pricey, but that was okay. I shared my soup with two others, so it did not cost me too much. I also got the oysters. I don't know if it's me and my dislike for eating oysters, I just thought the oysters were unimpressive.   Quite honestly, I want to return to Vegas strictly for the soup :) This time, maybe I should buy some and bring it back and I might even try other things :}

s1C9fTvp18pWqELf9dRjlQ.text: Excellent! Best clam chowder I've ever had. The wait was long and there's no where to sit, just have to stand for hours to eat. The food was amazing though! Would highly recommend.

aRaxQ8IXsRbJtJpt5MHxZg.text: We live in Las Vegas and have been coming to Oyster bar for over 20 years. Less and less over the last 3 years. What is the reason? Bad management!! Do not get me wrong, the food is good and because it attracts many clients the management does not care about customer experience. Instead of providing would be diners with a place to sit down and wait or giving customers pagers to let them know the seats are available, the management makes people stand in line often for more than 45 minutes. This is the reason we just stopped going there. I stopped by today at 4 P.M. hoping there would not be a line since it is too early for dinner. Sure enough as I arrived there were only a couple of ladies waiting. There were 4 or 5 seats available at the oyster bar but the employees did not bother to acknowledge the customers and clean those spots so the clients could sit down. I stood there for about 10 minutes before I asked an employee why the seats were not being available for the people standing and waiting. He did not give a *hit as I could tell. A few minutes passed and I asked to speak to a manager. Meanwhile the 2 ladies who were ahead of me finally had enough and just left the queue. When the manager showed up and I told him what was wrong with the operation he proceeded to tell me that most time customers wait in line for an hour and a half... Is this how you address concerns ? If I was your boss you'd be fired. Bad service reflects first and foremost on management. Employees will do as they are directed and taught to do. So 2 thumbs up for the chef and 2 thumbs down for the rest of the operation. I will rather go to the Shack on W. Flamingo and be treated with respect and lower prices.

jWXYKqZr8rsba_7rNfaqUw.text: Been going here for ten years, and for a reason. The quality of the food and the "wtf it's in the middle of the casino, but it's still totally fun" atmosphere cannot be beat. The pan roasts are to die for! If you're looking for an amazing seafood "bar", this is the place.

AHZkAcaJ7NBkS0_Cq3wfbA.text: SO bomb!  Combo Pan Roast FTW!!  Went here at like 3 AM after a whole day of partying, taking a nap, and not eating in between.  It was like a gift from the Gods to soothe my empty stomach.    The cook was really friendly, too.    Who would've thought Palace Station had it like that?  Boomshakala!

4_5Aw1cugTsLpfYZ7ZFgyw.text: This magical heaven is hidden inside the Palace Station Casino.   I came here with some friends a few month back. It was about 6am and we still had to wait about 30-40 minutes before we began seating. Serious?! YES, it's THAT GOOD!! Not only that, the bar sits only about 15-20 people, maybe not even that much. It is definitely worth the wait in my opinion!  I ordered the palace pan roast the first time. Hands down that meal is to die for!!! I wanted to lick the bowl clean! It is seafood filled in a yummmmy yummmy delicious soupy gooodness!!!! It has shrimp, crab, chicken and andouille sausages!! I like to order my pan roast with the rice on side as it helps to keep the rice from getting too soggy. You can watch the cooks prep your food and you see everything that goes into it. My stomach growls as I wait and when I get my order I am so giddy and ready to eat!  I also tried the oysters on the half shell. You can sit and watch them as they shuck the oysters. You know it's going to be yummy!! The jambalaya was yummy also. Also, order yourself a bowl of the clam chowder!!! It's just some of the best I've had - so creamy!!  Give yourself a chance to experience some of this delicious goodness!! You will want to come back again and again!

GbO1O_1mTJXgvmvSyMBz8Q.text: Ive been coming here for a few years And always enjoyed the food. Lately they seem to be a little arrogant with actions such as a five dollar share fee and also how they take their sweet time cleaning spots even though they can see people have been waiting over and hour to sit down.   I took two korean business partners there this weekthat were here for business. We waited an hour and a half at 7 pm on a thursday night. They were getting antsy but i kept telling them it was worth the wait.   Upon sitting down one of the giys ordered three ouster shooters. As he drank his first one he pulled a three quarter inch piece of jagged glass out of his mouth. We reported it and the waitress confirmed there was some broken glass in by the glasses. The waitress very curtly said "are you ok? We can call an ambulance and have you checked bu a paramedic, thats what we are offering you"   It just seemed very insensitive. They comped only his meal and we had to waste a bunch of time with security filling out a report.  All in all i was very embarrased by the experience and will never go bck, despite the fact that i love the pan roast.

fuAgzF__9T2x1wCoR1WXxw.text: Amazing food!! Friendly service but have to go for meals between off hours. Anticipate to wait an hour + if come during meal times.  Palace pan roast - A++ Etouffee - A Shrimp & Lobster la diabla - B+  Bloody Mary Shooters - A  Also walk to the bar next door to pick up drinks. More variety and cheaper too.

VbVieW29gXLigAtJKTi-mw.text: The best place to eat in Vegas is in the most dingy nasty hotel/casino.    If you're a newbie then follow these instructions:  1.  There will likely be a long wait unless you're there between 3am and 10am.  Regardless of the length of the line and how disgusting the surrounding casino smells you must wait it out; it'll be worth it!  2.  Order the Pan Roast Combo.  It is a food experience that will resonate in your food eating memories for a long time.  The waitress said something about trying it Scampi Style next time we're there.  I'm still not sure what it is, but you may want to inquire if you're interested.   3.  Eat, enjoy, and pay  No matter how busy this place gets, the employees always seem to appear positive and they're on top of their game.  Effective Service with a smile.

sumx5-3AABiZAmjzz-IPgA.text: Delicious fresh seafood cooked and served right in front of you, the wait is horrendous, but if you're patient, you will be rewarded with one of the best meals you'll ever have. Everything we ordered was terrific, especially the pan roast, cannot miss this awesome dish. The raw cherrystone clams were to die for, so briny and sweet. Service was top notch with Steve & E.Z. they are what makes this place so great.

wq2gb8KyO1siiiD3vj3CyQ.text: delicious pan roast - get the combo shrimp, lobster & crab

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SDk9Y1LfK6n12Ktpn08nog.text: If you can go when Bob and Dolores (probably bucthered the spelling there) are working, do it.  Bob is a fantastic chef and Dolores is a speedy and friendly worker.    It's all about the combo roast with the shrimp, crab, and lobster.  I've been going here for years now.  The quality hasn't changed, but the lines have gotten bigger.    Expect to stand in line during the lunch/dinner rush for up to 2 hours.   Well worth the wait if you can hang.  Just get some drinks at the Irish bar across the way and play some of the penny slots that are next to the line.

wNFDXqDyX2qgyl_3c416KQ.text: Loved the cozy booths in the restaurant. Service was quick & friendly. Our food was pretty good & had huge portions. Oysters were also pretty good & tasted fresh.

aEOd9EoYMvUXV2MbNNJCoQ.text: MMMMMMMMMM  just got back from a Girls Vegas Weekend and visited here for lunch on Sunday.  THEY ARE NOW OPEN 24 HOURS!!!!!!!!!!  OOOOOOOMMMMMGGGG!!!!!!!!!!  I have never tried the clams on a half shell before, but OMG!  they were so delish and fresh and sweet!!!  MMMMMMMMM  Must come back very very soon!!!

bkhouafQVO8AvRk20rrqDg.text: I looove this place! Thankfully, I have never had to wait for more than 20 minutes, although the wait is so worth it.  I have tried pretty much everything except their pastas. The oysters, clam chowder, pan roast, jambalaya, cioppino, gumbo, everything is really good. Each time we come here we end up ordering too much food, really one pan roast is enough for two people. But no, we like to polish off a dozen oysters on the half shell, share a bowl of chowder and then each order an entree. Egad.   I will say this, it is kind of expensive. The portions are huge but as I said before, we cannot control ourselves and end up ordering too much food and the bill turns out to be bloody expensive. But it's so good!

CnuHtCtirdwhKxT-Hg7g9w.text: This is the restaurant I been craving for an year and can not wait to come back to have it again! I would totally give a 5 stars but the wait is so painful, I will have to take a start off. Even though we gamble by the line, no cocktail services were serving us drinks my I went to twice and first time was 3am in morning on Saturday, we waited for 2 hours and 2nd time we were here in thanksgiving evening around 7pm? We waited until 2 hours again... Well all you gotta do is keep drinking and gambling . Until is the time for you to have the best pot roast ever!!!!!! And oysters are so fresh !!!! Omg... Everything are so good there ! Dont be afraid to try anything on the menu . I can't wait to back there again..... Well not the waiting in the line part ...

7c1uqGyMBP96OPsYGx2AZQ.text: I went here with some friends for my bday a few days ago and it was amazing!!  I got the lobster and shrimp diablo pasta thingy (can't remember the name lol).
