It was so &*%ing spicy but sooo delicious.  We got a dozen oysters which were so fresh and HUGE.  They also have 50 oz beers :3  This place is open 24/7, but be warned that there are not many seats.  It is the size of a small bar.  So I'd recommend coming here on the off-hours.....

U8i6XLWVg-TNSzmSkJAu4A.text: I didn't believe it when I heard that this place was simply one bar and no other seating. I stepped in line (which really is just...a makeshift line in the middle of the casino floor) and...waited. It was a bit late, so there wasn't that much of a line and we ended up only waiting for about 30 minutes. We struck up conversation with the couple in front of us, who also happened to be from California. We got seated and perused the menu. Small menu, so we made our choices pretty quickly.  1) I will say that the service is a bit on the slower side. One server and two cooks. 2) The food was awesome. You'd never think it, but the food is in total contrast to the looks of the place. 3) Even though the service was a bit slow, we had a fun time joking around with the staff. The banter between us made up for the slow service and made the night that much more enjoyable.  The food was great. We pretty much licked everything clean. There was one thing that was even more amazing, though...So we look across the bar, and there was this girl that just could not stop eating. She was at her seat with her boyfriend from the time we took our spot in line until after we had finished up and left. From my estimation, she probably ate about $120 worth of food and beer all by herself. The funniest part is that her boyfriend only had one dish, some oysters and a soda. My girlfriend and I were so amazed that this was the only thing we could talk about the whole cab ride back to the hotel. The look on the boyfriend's face plus his body language when he received the bill was priceless!

p6PYUuTQcFiKoyg5Gg_ACg.text: Enjoy a 50 oz beer while you watch these artist go to work. Dolores our server was very pleasant and our chef Holloman prepared an excellent meal. Everything is done fresh right in front of you. It's just a 12 personish bar so of you get there at the wrong time there is a wait. But it's well worth it. Roast pan combo was great. Cream tomato sauce with shrimp crab lobster and some type of heaven I guess.  Oh yah Rice!  Very hearty so I'm not used to so much but I powered through and got the whole thing down.  Level 10 spice for me no prob. I gotta go back!

lWLHOQh0XzVuD79ClueBrg.text: The pan roast had me dreaming about it all night and day so I decided to reverse engineer it and I've gone it!! You don't get the experience of sitting at the Oyster Bar but will definitely get you through until your next visit. Or if you're just tired of that line (2 1/2 hours last time but still totally worth it in the end). This recipe is for cooks who know how to follow my not perfectly exact recipe (sorry!).   Pan roast recipe  2 table shallots 2 table green onions 4 garlic cloves 1 tomato Brandy to deglaze 1 tea thyme 1 tea paprika 1/2 tea old bay 1/2 tea butter 1/4 tea salt Pepper and white 2 tea Worcestershire 2 tea Tabasco 2 tea cocktail sauce 1/2 cup heavy cream 1 bottle clam juice 1/2 Onion 1 celery stalk  Sauteed garlic, onions and shallots w olive oil, deglaze with butter.   Add dry seasonings and tomato w Worcestershire, Tabasco, salt, pepper. Deglazing w clam juice (reserve some for later).   Simmer, add brandy and blend until smooth.   Stir in heavy cream. Set aside  Sauteed celery and onions w olive oil. Add in shrimp and whatever seafood you want, deglaze w clam juice until cooked. Top off the brandy (2 teas per serving). Stir in bisque mixture, Serrano chili and chili flakes, tiny sprinkle of lemon juice. Bring To boil. Serve with parsley sprinkled on top like they do at the real deal.   Makes 2 servings. Serve with jasmine rice

Q0UvJhNzCT54oSMLzdwR9g.text: Run! Don't walk and definitely stand in line till you get a seat. This bar will not disappoint. What an experience to watch your creole food being prepared and other patrons dishes being served next to you. The blend of different aromas makes you anticipate the arrival of your own dish even more.   I ordered the shrimp gumbo with a heat level of 5 stars. Amazing! It was loaded with shrimp and every bite was a symphony of flavors.  Get off the strip and head to Palace Station. You will be glad you did.

8dge1ZOl3ErVO9W8ighYIg.text: My girlfriend and I come here every time when we are in Vegas. Be prepare for the long wait but worth it! Love their famous combo pan roast at level 6 of spice. House gumbos is also one of our favorite and a must try their fresh and succulent cherry stone clams on half shells...

P1G9qBefp1FIdFVDoWv-hg.text: What an experience!! First of all this is something you must experience when in vegas if you are an oyster lover!! This bar is open 24/7 and located inside the Palace Station casino! There is only seating for about 14 people at a time so if you want to be seated you must wait in line from 20 mins to past an hr. There is only 1 chef and he makes everything in front of you. The menu is pretty extended. My favorite was the combo pan roast. I also tried the barbecued shrimp and of course the oysters! Definitely coming back when in vegas next time. There is no excuse not to go its 24/7

gndfRc2KK4XrH1KJTuM3OQ.text: Not much to say about a place with over 500 4.5+ reviews except WOW !  Here is something I cringe to say and really isn't in my vocabulary; "It's worth the wait".  We started with Oyster shooters.  They went down quickly while we watched the chef prepare our chowder and gumbo.  My Alaskan New England seafood chowder ($17.99) was full of large shrimp, lobster, and plentiful flaked snow crab along with heavy cream as a thickener rather than potatoes.  This simply could not have been better.  My wife had the Combo Pan Roast ($21.99) chocked full of shrimp, crab, and lobster in a creamed tomato base with brandy and a portion of rice.  Hard to believe but it had more seafood than she could eat!  Both items we had are meal sized.  Food is cooked right at the counter using small portion sized steam jacketed kettles.  It's a gentle way to cook and very appropriate for the best quality seafood.  The cooking method makes for slow deliberate service but the time spent zooms by watching the cooking and with banter from the chef , server and customers.  This was one of the best meals we've ever eaten.  They have 15 to 20 counter seats only (this is not fine dining, just fine eating) and are open 24 hours a day.  Just another reason you gotta love Vegas.

HvpJPsh_yGktJ3T3FIAoCw.text: Was invited here by a buddy of mine during my recent 6 day stay in Vegas for a tournament at Desert Sportsman., When he mentioned oysters,  I thought, ......well, I'm not a big Oyster eater, but I'm hungry.   Fortunately, we visited this place on a Tuesday afternoon and sat down right away..  I hear that the lines are long and since it is a limited seating bar, people wait over an hour to get a seat.  Chef, tells us that due to huge interest , it is now open 24/7  When we got to the bar, he suggested two choices. Combo Roast or Alaskan Chowder.  I went for the Combo roast., 5 on the spicy meter. , I first admired the chef creating the meal using the unique kitchen tools.  All the soups are heated by steam device  right in front of you.  Quick service  After a a few spoonfuls, OMG this is awesome.  Shared some with a friend who had the Alaskan chowder,  I needed it  back!  Very savory, dish, perfect spice, Scoop of steam rice in the soup  was just what I needed,  Tender Crab, Shrimp and lobster filled every spoonful.  I watched other patrons ask for their left overs to go.  I couldn't stop!  I found myself smiling as I devoured this delectable dish.    I didn't get any oysters or house favorites, no room for that!  If you  like Creole style food, you MUST try this place next time you are in Vegas.  Now I know why my buddy visited this bar 4 times during a week-long stay in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9rttYBr7IUxhOjLS2fEWAQ.text: 90 min wait time at least and combo pan roast is good but the combo gumbo way too salty

dy7L4sB6_YUA3CR6kK_BXQ.text: Came here multiple times with my bf at night after 9pm, always need to wait for 2-3hrs. I guess for their quality of food, its worth the wait. The servers services were great and friendly. BUT! Here is the big but! The chief before talks wayyyyy too much! I believe his name is Eeve? I dont mind him talking but please dont stop your hand! He kept talking to this one specific customer about his WHOLE life and did not even greet me nor other customers. Besides that, when my food was ready, he poured it out and just stood there to talk to the customer for abt 5mins instead serving them over to me. This isnt the first time experiencing it, there was also another time when I was in line and he just wont stop talking. He stopped what he was doing and stood there to talk nonstop. Like hello! Theres a long line and a lot of people were waiting, that talking need to quit unless you can talk and keep your hand moving!

B_4poSp92XWPZD6nA2azeA.text: I know why you wait in line. I thought, like everyone else does, that they should give us a pager while we wait and then just gamble away. Ok here's my theory why they make us wait. Waiting creates memories, friendships with strangers and best of all hunger. We have met the same stranger here twice in line and it was out of this world. The people that come here are so outgoing I love this place. Why wait, because you will be happy.

IV44WaZMrYhk4pbgZc0L1w.text: The food here is great, but the overall experience/value isn't in line with the cost or the wait.   I had the New England Clam Chowder and the Combo Pan Roast after waiting approximately 45 minutes. Both soups were hearty and full of flavor and sea food.   Located in the heart of the Palace Station Casino, the Oyster Bar feels extremely out of place, adjacent to slot machines, the bingo counter and smoking tourists. Worst of all is the line situation--hungry people are basically staring at the diners eating at the bar. Seeing as there are only about 25 seats and the cooks stagger seating in such a way that you're likely to wait 45 minutes-3 hours to sit down. This means that before you eat, it's likely that you'll be intently watching those presently eating, urging them to  eat faster. And once you sit down, you know the people behind you are thinking the same thing about you. The entirety of the dining experience was enough to prevent me from returning, but the food was quite tasty.

pBwKIomGjbDTYH-APez1kA.text: Extremely short short review, but probably the best review from me...  Oyster Bar...  Here is what you MUST ORDER!  --Combo Pan Roast! --Alaskan Chowder!  That's it!!!  I need to say no more.......  Small eatery with only about 18 seats... all things are cook to order in front of you... so expect a wait!  However, THE WAIT WILL BE WORTH IT!!!  Expensive?  Slightly... was it delicious?  You beyond betcha!  Would I come back?  I'm planning my next trip around Oyster Bar!~~~

zgEx4davJ65G-Pzgm8LROQ.text: Food was absolutely delicious! We tried the oyster on shell, crab cocktail, lobster pan roast, seafood jambalaya, and clam linguini. Every dish impressed us and worth spending! I personally would recommend a spicy level not over 4. Otherwise it may overpower the very rich and complex flavor of each sauce. Must try their pan roast; the sauce mixing with jambalaya is a killer! I still give it a 5-star even when our waiting time was 90 minutes. This place opens 24 hours but with only 18 seats and takes no reservation, so be prepared to wait in line for over an hour!

cZXRlgdCg_8e19wJTl3byA.text: I would have given a five star rating as my husband and I absolutely love this place, however, we went last night and it was just a lame experience. The chef had just gotten there. We've never had that chef before. The service was so unbelievably slow last night. Usually they are moving super quick and the seats are cleared and the next set of people are in them in no time. Half the bar was empty at one point and they hadn't even cleaned one of those seats. They asked us what we wanted to drink and I ordered a Sierra Mist, my husband ordered a beer. He finished his beer before the food was done so he asked for water and asked them to refill my Sierra Mist and they refilled it with water. The chef served our food and after pouring it into the bowls he cleaned the excess drops off the rim of the bowl, but then pushed my bowl towards me and it spilled over the side. The pan roast which is usually REALLY delicious was off last night and then just before we left the chef dropped the rice bucket back into its container and splashed my husband and I with water, he didn't even apologize or anything and just kept on with what he was doing. The waiter or whatever he is saw me wiping myself off with a napkin and asked what happened and when my husband told him the chef dropped the rice in there, then the chef apologized. The customer next to me had a shocked look on his face. The experience was definitely garbage. I'm truly glad it wasn't the first experience or we'd never go back. But, if you are looking for an exceptionally delicious seafood dish, this is the place to go. Maybe call in and find out if Ricardo is working first. He's really good and keeps you laughing. Sadly, our favorite chef is no linger there.

AFI4q89R488Rsb-2FCvisg.text: When I visit Vegas I always try to eat here at least twice before I leave back to LA.  My favorite is the combination pan roast! Just writing this review is making me crave it! lol

qIaWdkKSgQ4FXdHqYzjfdg.text: i luv oysters, theyre salty like me

EPkcyPh2F7Igm8Fp_0re8Q.text: The Combination Pan Roast was AMAZING!! It has shrimp, lobster and crab mixed in it and one scoop of rice! It tapped on every one of my taste buds and was seasoned to perfection!! You are able to choose your level of spice preferred (I chose 7...shouldve done 10).   We waited 1 1/2 hrs at about 12pm on New Years Day and it was well worth the wait!! Bob is hilarious and truly lives what he does! This will be my first stop when I return!!

p9SQrWorxm6_K7qAw_o_gw.text: I haven't been involved with drugs or anything like that but if this is the feeling of addiction, then this place must be my crack.  I have lived in Vegas for 7 years now and didn't understand the interest for this place and finally tried it about 3 months ago. I have been to all the buffets on the Strip ( I mean EVERY) and most restaurants that offer good food. My oh my, I have been hooked since going here and forgot all about the other places I usually go to. I tried to go now weekly around midnight ( that's right, no lines, hehe) if I can and already ordered almost everything on the menu. All time fave must be the Combo Pan Roast and Seafood Jambalaya. The Pan Roast has that creamy and very tasty soup and with the seafood that's mixed in it, it literally feels like food heaven. Seafood Jambalaya is presented well and is a winner itself. You can never go wrong with anything that you'll order.   Since it's an 18-seater bar, be ready to wait during regular business hours. If you rate this place other than 4 or 5 stars, there must be something wrong with your taste buds or expectations.

nN41lG0vEjYL41AyTm00lg.text: Shrimp cocktail: Awesome! The shrimp were huge, clean, the perfect temperature, and not fishy at all. YUM!  Combo pan roast: Even more awesome! Delicious flavor and very fresh. Generous portion too!  Waited standing for about a half hour but it was totally worth it to experience this place. My husband and I will not go back to Vegas without eating here. The staff were very nice and you get to watch your food being made. It's a hidden gem.

dtevjkPZHLddthVlAtPqnA.text: House pan roast was pretty damn good, but the seating and cleanup is in turtle speed.  Waitress disappears and leaves the last parties dishes sitting there for about 15 min while we stand in line starving...who manages this place? Nothing bad can be said about the chef cuz he is working his ass off.  30 min wait is cool but I wouldn't do an hr.

LNd5ZPpKXZ4OOZxdqbuagw.text: I made it a priority to come here after reading the glowing reviews on yelp. Did Oyster Bar live up to the hype... Hells yeah!!  My guy and I started off with a dozen oysters which were pretty small but ok. I then ordered the combo pan roast... AWESOME!! It was a creamy tomato based seafood stew with lobster, crab and shrimp. It's served in a huge bowl with a scoop of rice. The flavor was rich and full of ocean goodness. I seriously had a 'wtf' moment and declared Palace Station as one of my must go places when I come to Vegas.  You get to pick your spice level from 1 to 10. I got a 7 which was great for me but be warned they don't mess around. My bf's etouffee was an 8 and it left my mouth pretty hot for awhile.  If you don't want to wait in line come here during the week at a weird time. We went on a Wed at 3 and sat down right away. Bob the chef told me there is an hour and a half wait on weekends.  Bottom line: If you are looking for a delicious and original seafood sensation... Oyster Bar is for you!!

_0dgNh68Gha8rfvfiwT9Dg.text: I love this place and whenever I am in Vegas I make sure I stop by this Oyster Bar for House Gumbo and Bouillabaisse.   They have hands down one of the best I've ever tasted.  I just came back from New Orleans and I still think this place is as good if not better!    It's a hidden gem of Las Vegas.  The wait  is worth it.  Usually if you go in the evening (any day of the week) it's at least a 45 minute wait.  The wait helps you work up a good darn appetite.  There are two chefs and my favorite chef is JJ and he's usually working in the evening.   Things to try:  -Steam Little Neck Clams in butter garlic sauce -Bouillabaisse -House Gumbo -Ettouffe -Oysters ( There's a better place to get oysters, but it's not bad here either.   Remember to ask for rice on the side if you don't want them to mix it in your bouillabaisse or your gumbo.    They ask you how spicy you want your Bouillabaisse and Gumbo.  If you get both make sure your Gumbo is a tad spicer than the Bouillabaise.    Now sit back and enjoy the sounds of slot machines and the taste of Nawlins in Vegas!

Ad-0S9AAzF3dpctjGk7YcQ.text: This place is so good, I had to drive 250 miles each way (twice!!!!) while I was pregnant just to get some.    I am not even a lover of creole food, but I LOVE shrimp, and so I typically get a shrimp cocktail and the shrimp scampi (with rice instead of pasta).  It's sort of a garlicy, lemony, white winey bowl of soupy goodness!    It's not the same if you try and save it and take it home, so my husband and I typically go to Vegas on Saturday morning, eat at the Oyster bar for lunch, dinner, and then lunch the next day before we hit the road.    It may sound crazy, but we have tried to find ANYTHING even comparable in Southern California, and can't!  Not even close.    I'm a great cook, and even I can't reverse engineer what I've had there.    I want more!  It's been a few months, and I think I'm going to have to go this weekend.  I guess the baby is going to spend the night with Grandma!

XfHA-lM9hwafcKtxPXtLXw.text: (4.5 / 5) Stars.  Much thanks to fellow Yelpers.  This place is awesome. We ordered the Combo pan roast (A MUST), and the palace seafood jambalaya. The smell and watching them make the dishes are an appetizer themselves. We sat there drooling as the interesting heating bowls cooked our food.   The Pan Roast was definitely the winner between the two dishes. It was chockful of shrimp, lobster, and crab pieces. The gravy was similar to a very velvety, almost buttery smooth concoction of tomato cream soup. The jambalaya was good as well but it doesn't hold up in a match against the Roast. Our only complaint is the single scoop of rice you get with it. They charge 2.50 for extra rice. We're asian, and we love our rice!   Definitely hitting this place again when I head back to Vegas. Highly recommended for their Roast.

RYQdrqH7M2GUNWawhEG1FQ.text: i waited 2 hours in line  yes excellent like every one say pan roast combo the bomb chef and waiter excellent  long wait  but worth it

V3JUgiHB2enhCQdcINJ7_A.text: You know how you can tell if a Vegas casino is ghetto? There are a couple of tell tale signs. First, when you step in, do you feel like you've just stepped into a Reno casino?  That's a dead giveaway. Second, the sports book still uses a white board to display all of its bets. Really? I mean in this day and age of LCDs and what not, your tool of choice is a dry erase and a white board? Finally, look at the table minimums, if they offer any table games at $5 stakes or less, it's probably a ghetto casino. Palace Station fits the bill on all 3 counts. Despite all this, we decided to check out an eatery within the casino called the Oyster Bar.  There are a couple of things you need to know about the Oyster Bar before you go. First, they take no reservations, it's first come first served. Which wouldn't be a problem normally, but this place is literally a bar. It's a counter surrounding the kitchen area and there are 18 seats. Yes, that's a one and an eight. So right away you know you're going to be standing in line because turnaround is a little slow. And really, don't try to get seated if you have more than 4 people in your party because they have to leave those seats open to make space for 4 and that will just piss the people off in line. Second, don't try to do the Asian thing of ordering it to go, they don't serve to go orders. Finally, you are only allowed to order 1 entree per person, so like Indiana Jones in the Last Crusade, you must choose wisely.  We had 5 people in our group so we had to break up into a 2 and a 3 so that one group could watch the baby while the other ate. I ended up with the baby daddy and we were going to eat second after the other group. So there I am waiting in line for a good hour and a half to eat, staring suspiciously at anyone who approaches the counter to see if they are trying to do a seat swap or not. The Oyster Bar is right in the middle of the casino with slot machines like 5 feet away. So of course I had to play some $1 Wheel of Fortune slots. Thanks to the wait, baby daddy and I dropped $24 each in the slots and didn't win jack. At this point, I'm thinking this better be the best food I ever eat.  Finally we get seated and look over the menu. They have a varied selection of seafood specialties such as pan roasts, ciopinnos, gumbo, jambalaya, bouillsbaisse, and an etouffee. They also had both kinds of clam chowder and some shellfish selections. I start of with 3 Bloody Mary oyster shooters (got mine with Absolut, but you can also select Jose as your shot of choice). The shooters were delicious, oysters were huge and juicy, not gritty and not too milky. Good start to the meal. I decided on the Combo Pan Roast (Crab, Shrimp, and Lobster). You get to choose how spicy you want it cooked on a scale of 1-10 (they also had habanero, which presumably is about a 15, but I politely declined). I ordered a 10 and when the woman next to me asked the chef, Megan, how hot a 10 was, Megan grabbed 2 fistfuls of red hot chili flakes and threw them in. Then she threw in another pinch for good measure, to the horrified look of the lady next to me. The seafood was all fresh, the flavors infused into the shrimp and crab and lobster from having been simmered for a long time. The heat was good, not overbearing as to mask the flavor of the pan roast, but enough so that I left sweaty and snorting fire.  Minus 1/2 star for making me wait an hour and a half. Minus 1/2 star for making me lose $24 at the $1 Wheel of Fortune slots.

5lmi2novu6YedTg97XJZEg.text: I am a regular at this Place.... My favorite chef is JJ,, makes a great bowl of gumbo, very personable as is the rest of the staff.... Hands down the best Oyster Bar I have been to in Las Vegas...   Get there early, cause it usually is full... I definitely recommend this place for a nice hearty meal, fairly priced.

YODSNLpF-Llh2JbjSnY4Sw.text: After reading all the reviews we decided to head over to the oyster bar to try the combo pan roast.  We got there before lunch and were quickly seated at the twelve person bar.  I ordered the combo pan roast, it really is a bisque with cream, brandy and fish stock.  It had lobster, crab and shrimp.  All the seafood was de-shelled.  Being a big bowl of bisque, the pan roast is really rich.  With the accompanying rice, it really adds up to be a substantial meal.  My friend chose  the Bouillabaisse over the Cioppino, the difference being the former had some lobster in addition to mussels, clams and fish that the Cioppino has,  The fish stock in the Bouillasbaisse was very good and the seafood was plentiful.   My other friend had the gumbo, the colour was a dark brown.  While the seafood and the okra was fine in the dish,  The taste was little unsual and not to our liking.  Our recommendation go or the bouillabaisse if you want something lighter with clean flavours, or go with the pan roast for something richer.  Avoid the gumbo.

FdRZKeN1eeaObJgzrm0tKQ.text: the place: set up is bar sitting. about 12-15 seats. only has 6 pots going at once. what that means is that there's gonna be some wait. I went there around 330am and waited about an hour or so in line and another hour until I actually took my first bite. is it worth the wait? sure why not? cuz I don't think your E going to get a dish like this anywhere else in Vegas. it was more of an experience for me than anything else, but the food was great too.   the food: it's all about the combo pan roast. crazy tomato based soup with crab, lobster, and shrimp. it's goodness in a bowl. I highly recommend that to anyone that comes here. My friend had the gumbo.... It wasn't as good as the pan roast. I got it at level 10 spicy. it definitely had a kick and while it didn't drown out the flavor I needed a glass of water after every bite. next time I'm going to get it at around level 5. although I do lot eat oysters, people that had them said they were the best and freshest they've ever had.   only downside is the wait because it can take a whole depending on your timing. there were people ahead of me that were waiting for 2 hours. overall I recommend this place.

XYDUmWa5QUT28NDP6-CfyA.text: The pan roast was out of this world good.  The gumbo was some of the best i have ever tasted.  Food is prepared in front of you.  You can order your own level of heat.  The downside is no reservations and generally a long wait since the bar seats 18.We got lucky, only a 25 minute wait late at night. The bar is located in an older hotel off the strip, but you need to go there and eat some great food at very reasonable prices for what you get.

QSIES3T9GwRCm5u5Zhy3FA.text: This place is UBER good! I ordered the CRAB PAN ROAST (#7 spicy). It was VERY TASTY! I tried it with the rice AND pasta. I liked it better with the rice. Only bummer about this place was that no kids are allowed. Will definitely be back when I go to Vegas.... This is a must try!

HBVw5f1w6jjPtK_79U7nKw.text: I have lived in Las Vegas for 23 years and went to the Oyster Bar for the first time yesterday.......amazing! The wait was about 30 minutes but worth it. It won't be 23 years before my next visit.....not even 23 days! GO!!!!

Gj_uCngz77bymgPfyfxWrg.text: Mmmm. Tasty place - thanks Yelp for the recommendation. The Oyster Bar  is inside the casino & has limited counter seating. Fantastic place to try New Orleans style seafood.  Pros - Combo Pan Roast (lobster, shrimp, crab) - great soupy mix fantastic with the rice. Jambalaya was very good as well - large chunks of lobster. If I had to choose the winner - the pan roast is the best. - Casino clams very tasty (baked clam with cheese & bread crumbs) - Salads looked great - wish I had more room. - Great service - Casino Parking  Cons - Limited counter seating - come early to beat the crowds - Smallish steamed clams (I'd get another pan roast instead)  Return Visit - Yes, actually ate here twice during my stay.

4XBNE8JO0SWjlVeSoI6ReA.text: I love this restaurant, but the waiting is insane. We waited in line for 2hrs. Just as we thought we were to be seated soon, a group of 8 people cut in the line in front of us, claiming that they had their friend waiting in line for them. Ok so a group of 9 people sent a single person waiting in line, making the line look shorter so a lot of innocent customer would wait in line for 2hr only to be bumped. Well done.

Scy9lIr7BAU3o2GsF-QvGg.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in all of Las Vegas!   My usual -  Half dozen oysters, and a combo pan roast (spicy # 6)  There is only counter seating at the Oyster and it is located on the casino floor next to the Broiler.   More than likely you'll roll up to a line, but don't bail! It's so worth the wait, and the wait can be real long! There are no reservations to be made, and there are maybe a total of 12-15 seats at the counter. Since it's now open 24-7 you can often time it right and not wait that long.   The food is always dead on, and so comforting. Big chucks of seafood and a scoop of rice in a tomato based giant bowl of goodness.   Dining at the Oyster Bar is always fun. JJ one of the cooks, has been there forever. They make your food, and shuck the oysters right in front of you. As an added bonus, there's always some interesting, & crazy casino folk @ Palace Station to people watch while your enjoying your pan roast of choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast!

7nG7vK3uvYaFhRjI0NnvmQ.text: Seriously Am I missing something here?   After reading these incredible reviews we came here at 3am, waited about 30 minutes in line even at that time. We overheard the customers in front saying they had waited 2 hours in line before.   So you think hearing that you are in for a transcending, mind blowing almost hallucinating experience from the pleasure of what you are eagerly awaiting for right?   Nope. The oysters were orange in color, suspicious flavor and one of them was bubbling. The worst oysters I ever had. We felt queasy after.   We also watched the cook use frozen seafood to make all the other dishes as we sat around the bar.

EAJgEEJwVufChp8_o68CYA.text: Luckily showed up at the right time and didn't have to wait!  Sat down had a few beers and watched as they made our food, which was delicious. I'll be coming here again soon.

Et-9GJp8b2v7MHFRF7rdtg.text: FYI, get the pan roast at less mild to medium spice. I tried it very mild due to sharing it with a friend that doesn't care for spicy. But wow, the flavor was totally different. I'm definitely not going to knock down a star for that. I wish the lines weren't so long! I've stopped by 3-4 times now, and each time the wait looks to be 45+ minutes, so i had to pass :(  But i can't wait to eat it again!

LfhidOM7bBTP5Yh-Xm7jIw.text: OMG! I went to this place to take a quick bite of oysters and I stayed here for a few hours! The food is delicious! My stomach was the happiest stomach on Earth! Loved this place!

NBeoVMJbFta2FK-_0FJ7hQ.text: My husband and I have been here before and LOVED the food. One star warranted because   1. The line is ridiculous. Even with 4 people in front of you, be prepared to wait over an hour & 2. No one under 21 can eat here! WTF... Okay what? Like WHAT?  This trip my husband, 13 year old daughter and I came ALL THE WAY OFF STRIP for this place... WAITED in line for about 40 minutes, which hadn't moved in the 40 minutes we were standing there, when someone came and told us we'd have to leave because you have to be 21 to eat there. YES. You read that correctly.   Never going back WITH or WITHOUT my kids. Ever.

VhUYyK3H5GqqXIsUT82WeA.text: Combo pan roasted (10/10) - comes with a ton of seafood.  i love spicy food, so i ordered a 6 of 10 spicey kick.  Ricardo (the Filipino chef) is great. Super entertaining and very attentive. Our group enjoyed him very much! Salamat!  Clams (7/10) - first time having raw clams, and I did not enjoy them.  Too much of an "Ocean" taste for me.  Oysters (8/10) - really good oysters.    linguini with class and white sauce (9/10) - so much flayvah and so much meat! A+

SnLWuWIB_24h4mFT5325eA.text: I would have to say one of the best oyster bars of all times. Have gotten better quality seafood here than in the south and nw. Always fun to watch them cook your combo pan roast in front of you.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big azz oysters and combo pan roast. My favs

HiV2CFFbQKh73f1y3T_pOg.text: Expect to wait for at least two hours even if it looks like you have 3-4 people in front of you there's probably 15 others waiting to be seated. The half dozen of oysters I ordered were really good. They were fresh and really big. The combo plate I ordered wasn't really anything special. I ordered the combo pan roast and it was good, but it wasn't the most amazing thing I've ever eaten. I was mainly happy about my oysters and the staff was nice and attentive.

ww-0aWSNNz3qQcHtqqAv4A.text: The high Yelp rating and the Cajun theme was good enough for me to want to try.  Then there was a line.  Only about 20 folks in it.  Didn't seem like a bad thing, until you realize there is only 20 seats.  No tables, just a bar.  We were warned that our wait would be over an hour.  That was enough for me to change my mind.  But the folks in front of us told us that it was worth the wait.  So we waited.  And we waited.  The line really didn't seem to move at all.  After a god long time, we finally got the front position and still had to wait another 15 minutes.  This place better be good.  OMG, it was.  Wait.  I'm not kidding, Wait.  It was super amazing  I have eaten in a lot of great places in Vegas.  A lot.  This may be on the top of my list.  I was truly blown out by the flavors.  We all ordered different dishes, so it gave me the ability to sample most of them.  They all were equally great.  I can't wait to return, even if I have to wait an hour and half again.

41o2ODvCmixsSu_WFeqJYg.text: I finally had the chance to try this oyster bar and it was AMAZING.. 5 stars amazing!!  located at the Palace Station (about a $10 cab ride from the hotels on the strip)  We went on a Tuesday around 4pm so there was no line (the workers said the line is usually really long)  half dozen oysters ($12) - 5 stars. came with cocktail sauce and horseradish. must get!  cup of clam chowder ($5) - 4 1/2 stars. really tasty and the clams were fresh.  Pan roast with crab, shrimp and lobster ($20) - 5 stars. MUST GET. comes with rice but my boyfriend asked if we could get half noodles half rice.  - I prefer the rice with it more but it was nice to taste both and he didnt charge us  My boyfriend and I split all of these items and left full. This place is by far one of my favorite places to eat in las vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast combo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half dozen oysters but we got 7!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7UQSLdu2c2sS0AbKbBoH4w.text: The Oyster Bar gave me the best meal in Vegas by far. Don't go to the Feast Buffet when the Oyster Bar is near the corner. Try their Pan Roast Combo! It has Shrimp, Crab and Lobster in a delicious soup! Finishing the Pan Roast makes me want to eat it more and I can still taste its goodness after hours.   Pro: They have delicious Combo Pan Roast. Get it.  Con: I'm kicking myself for not going there the first 3 days I was at Palace Station. The wait is long. The line formed at 10:20am on Sunday for me.   Good tip: Get there before 10:20am or else you will wait long in line!  For anyone who loves the Oyster Bar but went back home to SoCal, Ritter's Steam Kettle Cooking has their food too!

Rip-_HHD5o4n3kxbYVbbKg.text: We made it finally! Waited for about an hour which was understandable due to the high volume of people and servers slow to bus seats. yelp.com/biz_photos/awI4... We immediately order the Crab Cakes after hearing another patron complimenting them; I have to say they were delicious! Fresh Crab Cake in a bitter sauce diminished our hunger and made us forget about the long wait. Definitely a must order if you visit this Oyster Bar. If you don't like bitter tasting sauce, I would suggest ordering the Crab Cakes without sauce. I thought the sauce complimented them very well and enjoyed every bite. yelp.com/biz_photos/awI4... Our other two items Oysters and Gumbo which are a "no brainer" for my wife and I since it's what we order every visit. Now, we've been here about three or four times but haven't visited in a couple years. First up, a Dozen Oysters. Oysters were very fresh and well chilled and went perfectly with the condiments provided. Our only big complaint was the oysters were pretty tiny. You probably can't tell by looking at the picture, but the meat just wasn't there and it's not something you can really complain about. So pretty disappointed with the Oysters. yelp.com/biz_photos/awI4... Next up, House Special Gumbo which comes with lobster, shrimp, sausage and crab. Spicy level 7 (out of 10). Gumbo was pretty tasty, fish was delicious as was the sausage. However, my wife and I noticed that previous visits in the past they used to give us whole pieces of cut sausage. Now, they cut the sausage into four 1/4 pieces giving you less sausage. Not a huge deal but it could make one wonder what other ingredients (seafood) they dialed back in your gumbo. yelp.com/biz_photos/awI4... In the past I would give this place 4-5 stars easily but due to my dishes coming up a little short with a hefty price tag gives it only a satisfactory. Which is a shame because my wife and I would talk about this oyster bar every visit to sin city. Now we have a "eh" attitude and will probably look for a different oyster bar to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Special Gumbo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Cakes
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food cooked right in front of you

vSlQPnTw4VOsBD0TeIbRyQ.text: Definitely can't go wrong with a visit to the oyster bar! I would have to agree that the oysters are nothing to run home and tell about but they are decent! You would think that they would have above par oysters being that the restaurant name is themed around that particular item! The infamous pan roast happened to be one of the items I ordered and it was exactly what I anticipated  it to be! VERY GOOD! Filling and rather tasteful :-) I got a medium but i think I'll do more spicy the next time! Clam chowder is a hit! I wish it would've been hotter though! The location inside the Texas is much less busy!

6_psU6zzJ0Z9G7itWD0mOA.text: Good food & great service. Went to Oyster Bar weekend Night, food was really good and excellent service.  5 star! !! Really fresh oysters! They're medium sized, while I've always preferred small ones,Bread and butter, yum! Nice, crusty and wheat bread with room temp butter, yes I was drooling. Love the seafood here, fresh and tasty.

upjZdzdEVEVYXpCaOJT8fg.text: So lets just start off by warning people about the wait for this place but oh boy it is definitely worth it! The oysters are a great size and very fresh! And the combo pan roast man oh man!!!!! It is absolutely the best thing everrrrrr! I have to stop by palace station every single time i go to vegas because it is to die for! Everyone must try this!

fFut2uUitQUjwHulTHnAoQ.text: I came here last night after hearing such awesome things about the oyster bar. Even though there was a long wait we didn't mind, Our experience was ruined due to one of the servers who was extremely rude to us and gave us horrible service, her name was Melita. With that being said thank god for D.Brown he was very friendly and helpful and his food was incredible, if it wasn't for him I would have given this place one star.

PfkBvYqjQYIIXx_uOtMzGw.text: Oh my goodness, I don't think I can stop talking about this place. It is AMAZING.   Food: They have a variety of different seafood options. Don't be a chump by getting their chowder, get the pan roast. Any option of the pan roast is amazing. They give you plenty of seafood, although the Asian in me thinks they could've given us one extra scoop of rice for free. The soup is absolutely amazing & flavorful. The seafood is incredibly fresh & everything about it just was so hearty. Talk about the perfect hangover cure. Portions are huge!!  Prices: It's pretty expensive, but it's worth it! $20 for the combo pan roast that comes with a scoop of rice & bread.  Service: Not too bad, can't really complain.  Environment: Palace Station is such a sad little casino. There were more people at the Oyster Bar at 4 AM than in the entire casino floor. I hope they don't run out of business anytime soon, because this place is delicious.  I didn't give it 5 stars only because watching them clean up the soup was disturbing & unsanitary...although I'm sure it's fine, it's just unappetizing to watch. Absolutely recommend this place. It's amazing.

EgZzW-nyywFaY4Dll5vfEQ.text: The food is five star over the top good. It is worth every minute in line that you wait, to me it is the best place in town for sea food such as the Pan Roast and the Etouffee. The only word of caution is that I would watch out with the spice level, I have only seen one person ever order the 10 and she was quite drunk. You must be 21 to go here so let that be warned. Someone recently mentioned that the portions were smaller but they are still big enough to have left overs every time.

BtkzvfG5bUVw0DcgVsJDWw.text: The Oyster Bar is located off the strip in the Palace Station Hotel. This is more of a local casino. The bar specialty is seafood. There are several metal bowl behind the bar that you can watch you dish being made. The seafood platter is like a creamy seafood stew with lobster, shrimp and crab. I had the jambalaya which was good and had so much crab meat that I thought it was chicken. I would also recommend the raw oysters and gumbo. This place reminds me a bit of New Orleans.

iTAZmDUOPBwrkMHwnPrIYg.text: My girlfriend had to drag me there Because I did not want to go to the palace station for seafood. Boy did I eat my words... It was awesome the food was amazing and cooked fresh to order. Not only was the food great but so was the service big thumbs up to Steve and Ricardo.

FgxLmnyK9Rsmrftp0AIHZg.text: We came here on a weeknight at around 9:30 pm.  Even then there was still a line, though not a really long one.  It took around 1.5 hour before we actually got our food, including the waiting in line.  It was worth it.  We got the gumbo and the palace pan roast.  Flavors were extremely deep and rich.  Portions were large.  If we lived in the area, we would have definitely taken our left overs home with a nice scoop of rice.  Service was wonderful.  I don't know if I would wait 2-3 hours just to be seated when there really is a long line, but would definitely come and try more dishes when we visit in the future.  We had a couple that sat next to us and they had eaten there everyday during the 4 days they were there, and they said nothing they tried was less than spectacular.  Pretty impressive that this place draws so many people back over and over again.

fCUHwdADczmqtLX6kUAMpg.text: Wow - This place is AWESOME!!! The combo pan roast is hands down the best tasting dish I have ever eaten. No kidding. We have been coming back to this restaurant for several years now, and I am never disappointed. It is worth the wait, believe me. The portions are very large, and the chef cooks the food right in front of you, which is fun to watch. While we are waiting in line, we chat with others who also say they come back to this place every time they can. I wish more than anything I could make this at home, but there is something about the secret sauce and the method of cooking (steam filled pipes) that does it right. I HIGHLY recommend this place - even if you don't gamble or stay here; it is worth the trip. Delicious!!!!!!

YHBPV6_NsVvNoUlOuzR3FA.text: I usually don't write reviews.... But when I do it's only for the best places. This is one of those places. Seafood lovers can rejoice when they taste the combo pan roast. The clam chowder is only matched by the chowder found on pier 39 in SF.  The meal I shared with my gf was as follows: 1/2 dozen oysters(Fresh and big), 3 bloody Mary oyster shooters, bowl of clam chowder(order the bowl it's 3 times the size of a cup), combo roast(lobster, crab, & shrimp and they loaded it up!), linguini & clams(plenty of clams and cooked just right). For the two entries the level 7 spiciness was just right if you like a little kick. Service was great, and I heard the wait can suck(we lucked out today)

yDXorJbUJVqsBxWlfyeDUQ.text: How does a place go from a high as a hidden gem to a low as a place you don't want to visit anymore all in the same day? I realize I don't write reviews on yelp but do value people's opinions and thus I feel this has to be written. I came to oyster bar for a late lunch after a morning of going around sema show and had a great eating experience and thought, wow a hidden gem off the strip inside palace station. I decided to come back for dinner which turned out to be a disaster. After waiting a hour in a half, I finally was seated but somehow they let a guy cut because he was a party of one. Now, customers are suppose to wait in line and it should not be the customers to voice concerns as this should be common business policy to let people cut in line. So because this guy made a scene, he was able to sit and choose to order three dozen oysters and three dozen clams and since there was only one person to shuck (sp?) the shells, everyone's order got held up. Now, to some, that might be okay but then when they forget to put my order of oysters in and don't put the stream rice on the side of my combo pan roast because they were worried about servicing the guy that cut in line, then there is a problem. This experience is definition of how people who complain and make a scene get their way at the expense of those people who follow the rules. OK, my rant is done.

b0Wf0pNbREEIq3awwQ_ReA.text: We would probablu never come to this place or Palace Station except for the reviews on Yelp.  What a great find!  Gumbo served in a huge bowl.  Chef gave us a taste of the Palace Pan Roast - will definitely order that next trip.  The Irish Pub around the corner is a great place to hang out, play video poker and watch the game, too.  Only 20 or so spots at the bar and must wait in line.  Try to get a seat away from the steamed clams pot though...

JPMYh_tn3W-l3Zlfv-cSOw.text: I give it 4.5 stars, almost a 5. The only knock is the wait and no reservations. This place is highly coveted, so the wait can be long. The food is still top knotch, it's in the conversation for the best cajun style food in Vegas.

NKbggOF83bYLRPChYH4Gxw.text: My wife and I love the PALACE PAN ROAST!!!!!! Don't think and just go to this place. The wait may be long (anytime 24 hrs around) but it will be well well well worth it.

nbV8SGCVkm6oUynX9idfjg.text: The food is def worth going to Palace Station for BUT be prepared for the long wait.  Labor Day weekend was at least 3 hours... they only have 18 seats around a bar, which is also the kitchen.  Start waiting in line for dinner right after lunch.  Combo Roast and Oysters are sooo yummy.

6gzcoRZY9x-Qi5K3Q40zKA.text: All I have to say is that me and my friends make a special trip to the Palace Casino to eat here.   Beware.  There usually a line for this as it's a oyster bar, and not a restaurant...  and guess what... there are way too many slot machines within reach.

YI6vVdVye8wLVXtg3LboCg.text: We arrived around 7:30pm on a Wednesday night.  There was a 30 minute wait.  This place is tiny.  I'd say maybe 20 ppl can eat at a time.  We ordered the Combo Pan Roast which we both thought was ok.  We also shared the Alaskan Chowder at the recommendation of another diner.  That was exceptional.  Each person gets one piece of bread which was fine.  Service was decent.

8I-TVFqZs6NwmWMfeayeGA.text: This is a must stop whenever you're staying or traveling through LV.  The last time I dropped in the wait was 45 minutes which is a drag, but it is always worth it.  It only seats about 15-20 people around a bar like set-up with the chef cooking it in front of you.  Don't eat the bread they give you right away, because you'll need the room in your stomach for the huge serving they give you.  I love the gumbo here and usually love things pretty spicy, but I'm good with the 6-7 range on their -10 scale.  I don't like Palace Station, but because it's smaller, parking and getting to the Oyster Bar is a lot easier than in a larger casino.  My mouth is salivating just thinking about being there.

QJvIvABfxYWFP1bthJDVAg.text: This place is probably the best hidden gem in Las Vegas...although I don't know how much more hidden it is as I had to wait almost 2 hours on a Thursday night the last time I went.  The gumbo is amazing and has all different levels of spice.  They can really make it hot like fire if you like it that way.  The oysters are prolly the best in Vegas...super fresh!

z_g-YgJh92dpsSCbBW22Cg.text: the best I have had !  Definitely making this stop every trip to Vegas , be prepared to wait but extremely worth it .

BArxpBRkoYaguColSl_4jQ.text: After reading all the reviews, I was sure this was a place I will love and return over and over again.  Our party of 4 ordered the recommended combo pan roast, just imagine, we we're all starving and really enjoying the aroma of the cooked food.  Initially, the heavy cream didn't bother me, but being a True seafoodie and asian, it eventually felt too heavy for my taste.  This dish, also was mostly just soup and really lacked any decent crab meat, lobster meat, the only thing I could get a good bite on was the shrimp, which was only mediocre for vegas standard. This was pretty much a disappointment for everyone in my party.The atmosphere of the Palace Station didn't help either, I left the casino with smoke aroma in my hair throughout my day in vegas.  Overall, its much too pricey. But if you insist on going despite my review, at least make sure to share this order with someone and order a separate extra bowl of rice.  There is way too much soup and heavy cream.

gMcho3XsBmhmAwQeSHkQdQ.text: after a long day of gambling and drinking, a house gumbo with a pepsi makes me forget that i lost all my money playing penny slots.  look past the off the strip hotel, everyone is over the age 45 and the sound of keno in the background and you'll get a down to earth restaurant that serves quality southern style food.  pan roast, gumbo, jumbolia, you cant go wrong.  everything is cooked in front of you in a steel pot where its simmer to perfection.

mu_vUqr_r7NiWHNzO4shMg.text: was here on business and noticed an ongoing line to be seated at the bar. I had the opportunity to dine there tonight and was not disappointed. I had the seafood pan roast spiced at #7. It was excellent. Recommend highly.

D6D7X8fhKIDqOBty2HCf2A.text: Simply a WOW! Casual and great food. Sit at the "Bar" and enjoy. Not dressy or pretentious but great seafood. I had a Vodka Martini straight up and crab legs and thought I was in heaven. FUN FUN FUN.

ZQKvTFZIKnSttLLjRPd8pQ.text: After reading all of the good reviews I decided to make this my first meal on a recent trip to Vegas.  Luckily we went at about 2:00pm on a weekday so there were plenty of open seats at the bar.  I can see how there can be a waiting line because there are more seats at the bar than there are steam kettles to prepare the food.   My friend and I shared one bowl of the combo pan roast (which came with a scoop of white rice) and ordered an extra scoop of rice ($2.50 I believe) -- I shoulda asked if they had brown rice.  The food filled both of us up and was tasty but a little bit overcooked for my preference (nod to trini I.'s review).  The crab meat had distintergrated into the soup and the shrimps were the only proteins still recognizable -- I like my soups chunky.   I think their cooking method is interesting and would go back to watch, but the food was just OK not great.  I think this place would be better if they applied this cooking technique to other chunkier dishes like stews, pastas, and chilis.

YiTC_usilhM9rb0661dikQ.text: The food was absolutely delicious but waiting time could be less. Because there's always some selfish assholes not willing to leave the seat after finishing their food. They just keep talking and talking about their meaningless life to their selfish friend. And it takes the waiters 10minutes to clean a table!!?? Come on guys

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jJopvgM_X4kDX2JGs2_xCQ.text: The absolute best restaurant you can eat at in Vegas past midnight. I've been 3 times at around 4 AM and 2/3 times had no line vs the one time that had a 45 min wait. The roasts and jambalayas are delicious and meaty. Try the dirty clam chowder, the tomato sauce really combines well with the cream in the chowder.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If this is your chef, expect an amazing meal. He is the god of seafood stews.

P_0UWZLmbVL4F4d_zK2Tug.text: Useful Tip:24 Hours  Nearly one hour and fifteen minutes in a long short line my favorite unfiltered dame and I devoured two seafood pan roast and shrimp cocktail.   Spice level seven the reddish orange roux was seasoned to perfection. The pan roast has tons of bold Cajun flavors accompanied by huge chunks of shrimp lobster and crab! The portions are generous therefore most will have leftovers!!   If you can manage the unpredictable wait do yourself a favor a check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $7 Riesling &amp; Cabernet $10
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Cocktail $12.99
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast $24.99 (Shrimp, Lobster, Crab) Spice Level 7

mcbKE81sljX6xX8vXXf4dg.text: Amazing! You absolutely must try the pan roast! It's really delicious, but a close second is the "dirty chowder, half white clam chowder and half red chowder. So so good! The line is long and slow but we always seem to strike up a conversation with the people next to us, which helps to pass the time (at least an hour and a half, sometimes up to three hours).....when you have that first bite of pan roast..... it is all worth it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Dirty Chowder&#34; half white chowder and half red.... AMAZING!!!

ykpvId-LDRZNI-GvWisFcg.text: I'm honestly shocked at how people in line complain about the wait in line. I've eaten here several times, spanning as far back as in the late 90's and have always gotten great food, great service, and YES, there's a wait due to the limited seating area. That's to be expected!!  My last visit here was during CES. I think anyone who lives in Vegas or has been in Vegas knows that CES week can be absolute hell in terms of the amount of people that are in town and how crowded restaurants can be. That being said, at 7PM on the first night of CES, our wait time was only 45 minutes. Anyone who has been to Oyster Bar enough times, knows that's nothing!!! I've been here during a regular weekday and have waited up to 2 hours. And still, there were two guys who were being obnoxiously rude, yelling out to patrons eating to "hurry up! there are hungry people waiting" and making rude comments about how slow the service was. *NOTE* DON'T BE THOSE PEOPLE!!! If you can't wait a minimum of an hour to be seated for food, don't waste your time standing in line and complaining the whole time. Go eat elsewhere!  Now with that out of the way, there isn't anything on the menu that isn't good. Raw oysters are always good, the clam chowder is a must for me (though I still need to try the Alaskan chowder). My husband always gets the Pan Roast (spice level at just 1) and I will sometimes get the shrimp scampi. We both love our dishes, although I will say that on my last visit, chef was a little heavy handed with the rosemary/thyme and it completely drowned out the flavors of my scampi.   Portions are HUGE and we never finish all our food...but it's so good we also never want to share.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam chowder
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam chowder
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast

vR_YmJA32NC33Xd3kqNVvg.text: I drove about 240 miles to give this place a try.  I was so excited.  Had some reservatuons in regards to the size of my party.  There were 5 adults and 2 toddlers.  Thankfully I saw the sign that you can't sit at their 18 seat bar if your not over 21.  So I decided to go there and order several dishes to go so that my family and I can enjoy them somewhere more kid friendly.  So when I got there around 4pm on a monday there were about 7 people in front of us which translated to about an hour wait time.  I was so excited.  Dissecting their menus, researching their reviews for weeks!!!  Seeing that you can only order to go once you were seated.   So I ordered several dishes including their jambalaya, linguini,  oysters, clams, pan roast and other dishes excited to finally try them.  And was saddened to find out that many of their dishes (including jambalaya, oysters, pan roast, and clams) could not be ordered to go!!!! I was flabbergasted!!!!  I wished they would've specified as to which dishes could be taken to go and which could not.  That would've saved me so much time and heartache. Granted the people working behind the bar were kind and said they would keep me in the front of the line if my other party arrived.   But what was I gonna do with the 2 kids.  By then there were a good 25 people in line!!! I am so disappointed to not be able to try this place.  Just keep in mind!!!  Many of their dishes cannot be taken to go!!!!  I might try again in the future since this place is world famous.  But as of today my rating has to be a 1/5 since they never specified on their menu or their posters that these dishes cannot be taken out

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poster saying you can only order to go when seated.   Not True at all!!!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. THE Oyster Bar!!!

JMCczarIs0pNgvZCEH3mPA.text: Waited 2 hours on a Saturday night but it was worth it. The pan roast was really good. It was my first time trying the oyster shooter... Interesting...I'd try it again.

6tdj27qeGYOrjwIs5SibIA.text: You have not had seafood until you've had seafood like this. I ordered the bouillabaisse and I was heaven. Crab, shrimp, lobster, and oyster in what dish?!?!? It was a bit spicy but it was soooo good. The only drawback is the 45 minute wait. The busy hours are between 3 a.m. to 6 a.m.  The service is very casual, they talk to you like they know you and I like that.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Bouillabaisse is delicious!!!

Emyl0voUF5kMLylEoU-hVg.text: My goodness this place is delicious! Whatever sauce they use as the base of their soups are so tasty and I'm always excited to come here. The biggest downside is their service is quite laughable because they couldn't care less how fast or slow they turn over their chairs, and of course it doesn't help that they can only seat like 12 people at their bar. It can be quite frustrating waiting in line and seeing the chef jist waiting until a large order comes in to be more efficient in cooking, regardless of whom is already waiting and ordered.  Pro tip: don't come here of you're already starving, because you might not survive the wait! Send a guy to come early and save a spot for the group

YMfdTNO5ZmmGAGyiPhSc_g.text: Had the gumbo. It was okay.  Stick to the pan roast! Also the server was awesome. Just had to wait very long and ordered the wrong thing

Udc18Ru9-754sPoGsw5l6g.text: Very disappointed. We have waited for an hour to get seated at 4 am. Cocktail shrimp and pan roast are okay. Oyster is fresh but it doesn't taste like oyster at all. It's totally not worth to wait a long line for having these.

bZKigeiNzTZ5rZJo74lOnA.text: Seating situation is a nightmare! I was here a year ago and it appeared they had figured out the seating thing, waited in line for 20 minuets. Now it's back to being a nightmare. Waited over 2 hours, empty seats just waiting. What a sh*t show!.

CQHZ6bfJLg7TbVeoi8xv_Q.text: Pricey for regulars, but first time goers on a trip or here for the first time through the word on the street, it's pretty great.  Vegans stay away, it's only pescatarian friendly.   This place is always a great spot.  I understand its seafood and in a casino restaurant, but it's a bit pricey.  All oyster bars are.  However, this is forsure the best oyster bar in any casino in town.    Ricardo and Melita, dish out great service.  Quick attentive, witty, kind, and efficient.  They need to recognize with a promotion or give raises and extra days off to them.  I think all the dishes are great, but the thing is, after coming here for years, it does go stale.  If they can add a new item that's just as well cooked, or if possible, make the existing dishes even better.  That'd be sweet.  Portions are great, most people wont finish an entree.    If you're antsy or want to kill time between meals or waiting in line while someone holds it for ya in your party, there are a lot of machines nearby.  Thursday til Sunday on the weekends late night til like 3am will be fricken busy, at times you're waiting for 1 hr plus!  I think overall, if the business stays unchanged it will he fine and continue to stay for many years with happy patrons.  But picky folks, locals here for many years, or health conscious folk that dont go for seafood wont like it.

agkfE_78NcX7HBnllx-O7A.text: Don't want to wait? Too bad. You'll miss an opportunity to try their amazing pan roast and oysters. If that's ok for you to pass on, go ahead. For me, it was the best oysters I've ever had. Most memorable to me thus far. I'm from Chicago and when you're in Midwest, oysters aren't most fresh. They're also tiny. But these at the Oyster Bar? O m g! I'd fly back just for those oysters! We initially ordered just one dozen for my husband and myself. I typically eat 1 or 2 and tell him I'm done. This time? Nope. I wanted a dozen of my own so I've ordered another round of dozen oysters. My husband says, "I've never seen you eat oysters like that before." And he's right. I don't. Why? Not because I don't necessarily like them; apparently it's because I haven't had good ones!!!!   An entire dish of pan roast was a little too much for me. Too much, as in the size. I could never imagine myself eating the entire thing while dining there. After reading pro tips on Yelp, I ordered white rice on the side, which was a smart choice. I loved the crab meat the most in my combination pan roast. The shrimp were too small; lobster-- I don't know. i don't know why I didn't like them, but I've picked them out and gave it all to my husband. I did take my leftover as take out and had it later which was still good.   I timelapsed the entire cooking process that was in front of me. It honestly didn't seem like the chef was doing much. He was such an expert and I'm sure he does this hundreds of times in a day, so he just dropped off some ingredients. Then drop off some more. Stir it a little, and it was done! I saw the color or the sauce go from really light orange to light red, from their pan roasting procedure. I need one of those at home. Ok, maybe not. I also need their chef, and their secret ingredients & sauce. Then, maybe, I can handle their pan roast instrument at home. :)   I waited about an hour on a Tuesday 6pm. Was it worth the wait? Absolutely. Would I do it again? No doubt! Next time, I'm going to make sure I arrive starving so that I will eat even more, maybe 2 dozens of oysters. Service wasn't the best- don't take it personally if they're not nice to you. They're constantly busy with lines of people waiting all the time. They're working hard on meeting your needs.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu March 2018
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Combo Pan Roast w/sausage March 2018
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Combo Pan Roast March 2018

wgWrVbkYReJ0vSTCrsUIJg.text: FINALLY.  After all these years I finally ventured here to try their coveted Pan Roast.  We came here on a Friday night, after midnight (so I guess Saturday morning?)  There were around 13 people ahead in line already...which actually became about 18 because folks join in later.  So with that, the wait ended up being 2 hours.  We were seated around 2am.  I ordered the bouill-roast after reading some reviews.  It was stock full of seafood!  So much.  My husband and friend each got the combo pan roast.  Everything was freaking delicious. We had Ricardo on this night.  Dope dude.  Pats fan.  Since it was between 1am-9am, half a dozen oysters were $10 so I got that to share and it was fresh.    It was so good, my husband and I returned here on Sunday at 10:45am.  Once again, around 13-15 in line ahead which ended being closer to 20.  But we came right when a batch of diners were almost done so this time the wait was only...1hr45mins.  My husband and I both opted for the same dishes.  But this time we got it at a spicy level 7 (versus 6 my first time around).  Our chef was Bob (Patriots hater).  Not sure if it's just plain spicier or bob is more heavy handed but it certainly had a more major kick than the other night.  Nevertheless, still delicious.  The servers here are extremely nice and courteous and they work very hard to have parties seated together if possible. They manage to work a group of seven patrons after me!  Only six things can be cooked at the same time though, mind you so if you're in a big party, you won't be all fed the same time.  Now that we've finally dined here we know what all the fuss is about.  As my husband said when we left, "I think this place just became a go-to spot for us."  He's right.

_MMZ1HScZRoCvyn2EjCjKQ.text: Worth the wait... Trust. I wish I could try the whole menu. Pan Roast combo was awesome enough to keep me coming back. Im glad im moving to vegas to try all the good foods. Now im going to be running my Hawaii peeps back and forth to Palace Station for some pan roast!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pan roast combo... Bruh

p1RuxW-IFvN4QHoIZrShwA.text: Ummm tbh, this seafood spot is a fun-ish to check out and try, but the quality of the seafood is meh (shrimp was overcooked in the stew and the oysters by the shell was pretty fishy).   Wait-time: Roughly 40mins on a Monday night around 7pm. Not bad, considering the wait times everyone else has been posting about, but was it worth it? Nah.   Line: a bit confusing bc there's some construction happening on the right hand side of their bar...so the line swings to the left now. Tons of ppl missed the line and tried to jump into open seats when they were walking by. Repeatedly. A bit awk once you're sat and the workers have to keep telling ppl to wait in the line.   Service: standard. Nothing specular or particularly bad.   Food: Shared a dozen raw oysters and another dozen raw clams. The mere size of the oysters were impressive, but had me a bit worried about how fishy they'd taste. And they were pretty fishy...   As for the clams, it was fresher, sweeter and had more of a bite to them than the oysters. My personal preference btw the two. And for the main, had the seafood stew. Flavors were on point, but seriously, all the seafood was over cooked!! Whyyy. Esp the shrimp. Pretty disappointing. Btw, this dish was massive. Everyone looked like they were ordering their own, but no one was finishing it. Totally shareable portions.   Overall, it was decent. I'm shocked that everyone has been giving such high reviews. I'm glad I tried it, but I wouldn't come back. And I certainly wouldn't wait for it over an hour! 3 stars

78pHoBIJ5A076rwh7Zc_Fg.text: Ok I wanted to give this place five stars, but I gave it four for one reason.....seating. This place is fantastic and we hit it at I guess a great time because we didn't have a forever long wait, but as I was reading you will typically be on a wait here. The problem is there are only about twenty seats! Plus they didn't make people skinny up when they left spaces and weren't really in a hurry to seat people. That could have been more efficient. The casino had two large spaces that was empty. One was where a new restaurant is coming in and then the High Roller room had been cleared out. Why not make more cooking stations and add some additional seating?? I'm sure more people would come out to eat at the Oyster Bar and then stay to gamble if they weren't worried about an easy hour long wait. I would not wait that long, but only because there are so many great places in Vegas to eat, not because the food wasn't worth it. For our late night dinner had oysters, the caesar salad and the Combo Pan Roast that we easily shared. The oysters were not great and way too expensive for the quality. The salad was really good and HUGE! Then came the Pan Roast and it did not let down. I would totally order that again except that I want to try the Boulli-Roast next time! The seafood in it looked fantastic and oh DO NOT forget the hot sauce!! They call it Lava Sauce and we didn't learn about it until it was too late. It looked like something they made there and I would have bought a bottle of it if they had sold it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The cooking station. I kept looking for more seating, but the bar is it!

Wrx7NfJKOFW0hDmU98B96w.text: There's a line for a reason.  I don't remember the portions being such a gut buster.  If you're a Las Vegas local, order your own and get some fresh seafood as an appetizer.  If you're staying in a local hotel and don't have a fridge, share! One person should hold your place in line while the others gamble.  It's smack dab in the middle of smoke-filled casino so you'll reek of cigarettes by the end of the meal.  Even with that caveat, WORTH IT.

vojgJFkSia2J4jR-FJ5JOw.text: Love the food! I got liguine and clams with added shrimp. Delicious the combo pan roast was heavenly!! After the long wait, staff was effiencent, pleasant, work hard! Definitely will recommend!

nIyAvfcdMes0OB2pbA9KfQ.text: Last night me and my wife went for dinner food was great but we did not finish eating and went to bathroom and vomit because I was a big roach in my side of the table told the cook but they did nothing I won't be coming back in here I got no refund or nothing

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

McltPxVc1u8u2cCU9tyyBA.text: This place is amazing.  Bob is so awesome!   It's one of our stops when we go to Vegas.  Combo pan roast. I'm craving this right now.  Drinks are yummy.

cqyEwC6MtURWnkm7E70Ixw.text: Being drunk and hungry, boyfriend and I needed food asap. It's nice that this place is 24/7. From the morning we checked out, there was already a line forming so we thought we'd skip and wait until midnight-ish. After drinking and gambling, we come back at midnight to check on the line. HOLY POO! There's still a line forming. Whatever, I'll wait if it's this good. I think there was a line partly because there's only like 12 seats around the bar/kitchen. With 1 server and 1 cook. So picture it.   I think we waited for almost 1 1/2 hour until we finally got seated. For this wait, heck yeah we are gonna indulge ourselves! Given its name, "Oyster Bar" we just had to have oysters. And then their infamous Pan Roast. He also ordered the cioppino, too.   Oysters: Below average. Didn't seem fresh and very fishy taste. Good thing we only ordered half a dozen.   Pan Roast: Solid 4 stars. I've only had Pan Roast at another place back at the Anaheim Packing District and that was bomb. This one was excellent, too. But the overpowering sauce made it very hard to eat the whole thing. They give you one scoop of rice, but please do get more rice because you'll need it!   Cioppino: Average. Nothing really stood out. It was pretty spicy, so watch out you non-spicy eaters.   Both the Pan Roast and Cioppino came with lots of seafood. Worth your buck.   Cool concept and pretty nice experience as you get to sit and watch your food be prepared in front of you. Price is normal and not overpriced. Be patient because there WILL be a wait at anytime of the day.   Tip: Come here and just get the Pan Roast, skip everything else :)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KvoIU6Ga2y_CPFIQwgSXUQ.text: Oyster bar is bomb, I love it, make sure you take time to visit here, come here early enough because the lines can get long, only because they are do good

8L_avJVkPqQO09wZl_zfCw.text: The food here is phenomenal, I had their Pan Roast combo which included shrimp, lobster, and crab. Each bite had a little of everything and comes with rice. When coming here be prepared to wait since it only seats 12 people or so. The 3 times I came waited about 45-50 minutes twice and lucked out once when I came in the middle of the morning. Ive also had the oysters here during its happy hour. Overall the food is of the highest flavor and quality. They make the food right in front of you so the anticipation for food adds to how delicious it will taste when it is finally served to you. Also its an extra $5 to share a bowl! Open 24 hours! It is also a bar so just be aware not to bring kids.

GinSis6OGl0mvaC5YKot0A.text: I NEED to come here everytime I visit Las Vegas. Although the wait is always long, you can keep yourself busy talking with your friends or looking over the menu. I have always picked combination pan roast but my last visit I picked bouillabaise. I still prefer pan roast but it can be filling. I can't bring myself to take leftovers. I'm afraid it'll taste different when I warm it up at home. You can pick your spice level. I chose 3 this past visit and it was spicy for me. You gotta give the cook and staff credit for always working so hard. The cook always seems upbeat even though it seems like non stop hard work and cooking. I always look forward going to Vegas and stopping here before we leave.

NvmuKolAYxrNKWVdEyVeFQ.text: Finally got a seat at the Oyster Bar.  Always busy. But the food is always good. Crab Pan Roast can't be beat.  Also got the Cioppino and it was great too.

cjfCSqGEHAwHDug56H_wJw.text: Food was great and worth going off strip for. Only knocking a star off because of the wait.  Like many others said, the wait was not the greatest. I got there at 7:10 on a Tuesday night and there was a line of 8 in front of me and I had to wait a hour roughly.  Thankfully, I was by myself so got to skip a few others when there was one seat open.   Food - I got the combo pan roast at level 5 spice.  I didn't taste the spiciness at all so I think people that regularly eat spicy stuff can go higher.  Food was amazing. I just wish I had more rice and bread to soak it up with...haha  Service - waitstaff was very friendly and have nothing but good things to say.

i3qdGwMVLmj1CMkkd3YtKQ.text: Best to go at 2am because there's a shorter line but totally worth the wait! Their pan roast is too good

5wbvNMf-MyGyzlfZS8pGWA.text: My girlfriend and her co-workers enjoy going out to eat after work, so they decided on the Oyster Bar for the night. They've all raved about the place, so I figured I'd give it a try.   We ordered the: Maryland Crab Cakes- basically, it was shredded cold crab meat on a bed of greens. No spices or seasonings. Definitely not what I expected nor worth the price.  Alaskan Chowder- absolutely delicious! Creamy, succulent, and spiced with the richest flavors a chowder deserves. The beautiful touch of a few mussels as a topping were aesthetically appealing as well in taste.   Pan Roast Combo- what most people recommend. Warning: when ordering, make sure you clearly specify "COMBO." I ordered "COMBO," but received a "GUMBO." The chef quickly corrected the meal.  Overall, very delectable food and I am looking forward to many more nights at the Oyster Bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast Combo - most recommended dish I&#39;ve received.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maryland Crab Cakes - basically, cold shredded crab meat on a bed of greens. Not worth the price.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan Chowder - best item! Highly recommend!

l5DxULPwZzdcA4HjGHdBoA.text: Sensational food! Excellent service always!!! Folks it doesn't matter if you have to wait 10 mins or 2 hours. This is a must try every vegas stop! If you like Gumbo treat yourself to the oyster bar. I've been there several times & had the pleasure of three different chefs. Every one amazing but unique in their own way. This is a big treat for yourself if you have the pleasure of eating the food
