I commend the chef for all his hard work, cooking all those dishes at once, non stop, and still able to keep the quality of the dishes top notch. He's truly a master of his craft. I definitely recommend this to be a place to try at least once, but even just talking about it now makes me crave for some pan roast!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters!

TBaQdgU6gZS5Pm3KgAWBHQ.text: This was a great place for great food, but only come if you have a lot of time because the wait is long.  Expect one to two hours wait-time because there is only 10 seats.  Food was better than expected.

k3eIQRPO_Hlp1uNBUjszeg.text: Great seafood and semi-hidden at the Palace.  I'm a medium oyster fan, but they had some of the freshest for the middle of the dessert, and get a large variety so you can 'oyster taste' and really see the unique flavors of each type.  Oyster shooters are also a must.

YRUeW-DGj4eb_keOB-Ll8g.text: Oh yes. First time here with relatives who have been here many time. Giant portions. Easy to share for a couple. Everything gets cooked in front of you. Long time to wait to be seated - but it worth it to wait. Will come again.

jH1EE0fDRmZjGOIDNEq-7w.text: I've been going here for years trying to keep this gem a secret but just too many people know about this place now. The place seats about 15 ppl around one bar area SO the lines are horrendous, easily 1-2 hour wait times...unless you're a strategist like me. I've never waited longer than 30 minutes. I HAVE missed a flight just so I could eat a bowl here. True story, just that darn good! No regrets!  Everything is great. My fav are the Palace and Combo Pan Roasts. Oysters are good but a pan roast is more than enough food already. I only order Oysters in groups so we can share. A pan roast is huge and can easily be shared.  Definite stop in Vegas!!!

3PuiXamvKDAoGUdQUmAPoA.text: I'm giving it 4 stars because the wait was long. It's a tiny place totally a bar.   But the FOOD is AWESOME. The Oysters are very delicious and Fresh. You can tell its fresh and its hella big. I'm so proud of myself I ain't all dozen of it.   The Pan Combo is very delicious. Made it right in front of you. Very delicious. You can choose the level spicy you want from level 1-10. I pick 5. Love the heat of it. Great place to hang out. Just be willing to wait because everything is FRESH.   I would go back when it's non peak season. Check out pics. Aloha.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaska Chowder  also delicious. My cousin ain&#39;t that.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh Oysters. Very delicious.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast Combo. Very delicious

dDGFo3y60JnwBXrxG6Ariw.text: wait more than an hour. even take out need sit first. They are not allowed order oyster for togo, but shrimp is ok. We have to finish the oyster on the table for 10min.  however,  their house special is good and with rice. Like the chief!

FFsHRmt2sPuSJ0UR0_XhLQ.text: I will start off with the bad, you wait in a long line for 1 to 2 hours and there are not a lot of seats  with I would say around 20 people.  However, this place is at Palace Station and you would not expect much. But they have a awesome system of 10 pots going at once and the cleaning is fast too with soup and very very hot water.  I ordered boulibase and took 20 minutes to cook. They are not stingy with the seafood as we got a lot of crab, fish, scallops, etc.  The raw oysters were quite amazing and the clams too. Recommend getting both as well.  Understaffed long wait, but definitely worth it.

eE9PxCkIWYEU6ResLpt6Cg.text: Jan 19 2016    just came from the oyster bar  at palace station  on a scale of one to ten  service was a minus 10  condesending  arrogant  n useless   after waiting about a hour to get a seat Once I sat down it took another hour to get my order   like they are doing me a favor   during that time sitting waiting not one person came to ask if  I wanted water  beer  a bj  etc   it s like  ok  u here now wait    seriously  never goin back    hey I get it  ya, got good grub  but WTF Suggestion to owners   Have a hostess or whatever  tell the people waiting in line   it will be years till ya get in   so while  you wait   wanna a drink   ?  and once you get to sit   we, offer nothing  till we feel like talking with you dont waste your time   cause they will waste yours Adios

qmeClxc2u4hcymKc4L5MVA.text: Food is a 7 service is a 1.  I didn't mind the wait to sit but the service once you sit down is something to be desired. They are rude and it seems like you're doing them a favor by paying your money to eat there.  A friendly face would entice me more to come there again.  I will tell all of my friends to pass on this location and perhaps give Sunset Station or Texas Station a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace Station Oyster Bar

ZHQ9g1_-Ov7QAlYWZFtAuA.text: Really good just wish it wasn't located inside smokey casinos

347y2L9S94H6MiN3GPUWNw.text: Finally tried the combo pan roast level 5; alaskan clam chowder  Waiting time: i guess I was one of the lucky few or maybe the time that I came in was not busy but i didn't have to wait for any line. I was seated right away.  OMG the soup was so delish. I can finally understood why one would wait for an hour or two just to eat here. IT IS THAT GOOD!!!! 1st the portions of seafood, they do not shy away of giving you huge portions. From very large shrimps to every spoonful bite of REAL crab meat and REAL lobster meat. May I add, I had about 7 pieces of huge shrimps on my soup.  its a really must go when you visit vegas. the prices are just right for the amount of seafood you get in your soup. also the chefs really interacts with you which is a plus.  have gone here 3x already and will keep coming back for more. :))

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s a must try Alaskan Clam chowder.  Every bite  is pure  heaven. Seafood feisty your my mouth!!!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood jambalaya
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast...

XkOFrSNabl8UV9Ff-ivz8g.text: I would have given a five but if you don't come at the right time you won't get a seat for about an hour and a half. But other wise 2 thumbs up for the pan roast

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iEngxJ1JOM4TtEPHMGvi_Q.text: Best oyster bar in Las Vegas! Oysters are super fresh and of course my favorite, the pan roast. Honestly any way you get it is going to be good. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. We are locals and eat here at least once a week. Also love the Alaskan chowder omg so good!!!!

n1XwKDwIwy787l2TPvMfAg.text: It's such a honor to yelp right after my yelp elite friend @Bridget P! =D  My friend was RAVING, hands down R-A-V-I-N-G about this place so we just HAD to eat here while we were in town. Let's just say the expectations were sky-high at this moment.   Right after we parked, we briskly strolled over to the bar joint. There were about 8-9 people in front of us and equated to 45 mins of waiting time from when we were seated. And consider this waiting time being lucky folks.   If southern gumbo seafood cuisine excited on the west coast, Oyster Bar has the recipe down pat, I pinky promise!!   Pros: +stomach was happy and generous portion, had enough for leftover +excellent staff and waiters (waitresses) and chefs +was social and met some locals by striking up conversations in line waiting +the hype was real and exceeded my expectations +extended hours to 24 hours  Cons: -extreme wait...ing...in ...line... -limited seating  -the smoke and alcohol can make you dizzy (Yes, located inside a casino!)  I was recommended the combo pan roast as a newbie and didn't disappoint!! 2 thumbs up! Watch out, Oyster Bar, I will be singing your high praises until my dying breath!! ^.^ Also, how could I forget to add the fresh dozen oysters!!! I saw them peel over the oyster shelf in front of my own eyes! AHHH...dreaming about it again now...

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouillabaisse for the win!!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination pan roast with white rice
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh oysters, totally melts in your mouth!!

67tyvo5v1CVavV9C24gE8g.text: I've been here a few times and it's usually a very long wait, today it wasn't so bad. When you get there, you'll understand why. Not only is the food outstanding, along with being very reasonable the place is tiny and everything is made to order.   It's simply put, the best place to eat in Vegas. The only negative is the ambiance, which is pretty Casino! If you can overlook that, you can enjoy a pretty special foodie experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast.... Amazing!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Busy in the oyster bar!

A9zgWiiNol41i0lsguAx4g.text: Everything you heard and believed about this gem in the Palace is completely True!! You will stand in a long line. You will wish evil things upon those eating ahead of you. You will question the choices in your life. You will doubt the food being good enough and friend...You. Are. Wrong. The oysters and clams are fresh and delightful. The shrimp are huge, succulent, and cooked to perfection. Do not get me started on the pan roast! The pan roast did not disappoint!! Saucy and chocked full of seafood it was everything that folks said it would be. We got it at a 7 spicy level and the spice was spot on! Chef Eze is a magician and Steve & Johana were fantastic taking care of us.   Note: Folks under 21 cannot sit at the bar and eat...and the bar is all that they have.

nzN1mxWVI_W6QRaGKw0NcQ.text: oh my god does it get any  better than this? The combination pan roast is something you CANNOT miss when visiting vegas. We specifically come to the Palace Station just to eat here. The line is ALWAYS long no matter what time you visit so be prepared to wait 1-3 hours. Also just a little tip palace station has awesome craps to play while yours friends wait in line.

hST6cq6jbVE5jtIjUNxKsw.text: First time trying Pan Roast, first time loving it. My friends and I waited in line for over an hour to sit down and about an hour for our food. While waiting we indulged in some oyster shots and conversation with the chef, and then finally! The pan roast was served! Creamy, flavorful and enormous portion. I ordered Combination Pan Roast with shrimp, crab, and lobster. I don't know why I waited sooo long to try it! oh I know why, the never ending wait. I don't know if Pan Roast is worth 2+ hour wait, but I'm definitely a fan!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster shots - vodka and tequila
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our oyster shots being prepared

rnEu4kmDnTQFiVIpLlVREA.text: Oysters are a bit overrated. I prefer smaller oysters over larger slimier oysters. Not my favorite oyster spot but the gumbo was excellent! The wait was not so excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters are huge which is not my preference. Was hoping they had The small sweet oysters from WA or Canada

P5K7LAzBuboFWqVmc36Y0g.text: This is inside the Palace Station Casino. We were 8th in line and waited about 50 min for a spot. Bare in mind there are only about 18 seats at this bar, and depending on when you come, the time can really vary. The service was friendly and attentive. They brought us a very tasty hot sourdough roll first (Great!) I got 1/2 dozen of the Gold Band Oysters (Great!) and the Combo Pan Roast (Shrimp, Crab and Lobster)(Great!)

g3HKlhz0y5ih2mZbFhQ_7w.text: The Oyster Bar located at Palace Station Casino has but 18 seats, first come first served, is open 24 hours a day, and doesn't take external phone calls.  Let's see if going early helps.  Initially I was aiming for a 9am breakfast.  I know, seafood for breakfast???  Yeah, but it was the only time I had a car, and I'm not into standing in line for food.  But I woke up early and ended up rolling on in shortly after 8am to an absolutely empty bar.  Winner winner chicken dinner!  I had a terrific meal of Alaskan chowder $18.95 and a terrific time due to the staff behind the counter.  Maybe I made my way through half the humongous bowlful?  But I took the rest back with me.  Personally, I enjoyed the Oldies music playing in the background.  For fillers, they offered me a sourdough bun and a bowlful of wrapped oyster crackers.  When there's a wait, even for take-out you'd have to wait in line!  Patrons must be age 18+ because they are considered a bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster Bar 2/2015
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster Bar 2/2015
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster Bar 2/2015

GQ6AvtqZw5WhFka9DR_MFA.text: Would have to give the combo pan roast 5 stars, but overall wait time and service 3 and a half stars. We waited a hr for two people which could of been about 30-40 min wait. We saw people leaving and it took about 5-10 mins before they cleared the tables. One chef that cooks and two waitresses that clean, bartends, shuck oyster isn't enough staff, but they don't have much space. It is the best pan roast I've eaten so I will still be coming every time I'm in vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half dozen oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast spicy level 8

OQ3VBpeQNW3lVDBU_SAPhQ.text: You'll read reviews of this place, be intrigued by the overflowing of positive reviews it garners, and will venture off the Strip to visit the Palace Station hotel in search of this restaurant. When you arrive, you'll be surprised at how unassuming it is, quietly blending into the sea of slot machines. However, if you're lucky enough to go at an hour where the line doesn't give away its location, the aroma surely will.  Get the Combo Pan Roast, and ask for it with a spice level of 4 if you're unsure of how spicy you can handle it. Everything you've read so far is True - this place is worth coming to at ungodly hours, off the tourist-engulfed paths of the Strip, and you'll have absolutely no regrets.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. rapturous Combo Pan Roast

CELGUjihYJXUEDT5x6AlHQ.text: I contemplated leaving this review because I love this spot but I am so bothered that I had to. I'm a proud regular who's been coming here for way over a decade.  Every time out of town friends visit, this is my "go to" restaurant.  I really love this place.  I know there is always a long wait so that's not the problem.  The problem was that I didn't enjoy my meal by any stretch.  The pan roast which is the only main dish I always get was terrible.  There was crab shell in every other bite I took, literally every other bite and at times every bite.  I had to stop midway because it was that annoying and painful.   Of course I expect to come across some crab shells but when it takes over the meal, it's no longer enjoyable.  It was so overwhelming that I took them off the napkin to photograph it so you can get an idea of how many times I had to clear shells from my mouth (such a poor experience) In addition to the debris, the steamed rice was so undercooked and grainy that they crunched between my teeth, I could barely tell if I was chewing on shell or rice.  To add assault to injury, the spice level was much higher than what was requested and to top it off, Heavy Handed Harry went crazy with the sage.  I'm sad to say that the sage was so overpowering that I could barely taste the seafood.  The combination of debris, crunchy rice, far too much sage, and the heat made this experience such a poor one that I can't see myself showing this place off to friends anymore (not knowing what they'll get)  I'm wondering if they've gotten so busy that they're too rushed (hence the undercooked rice) or if the chef just had a bad day.  Either way I must say that this was an experience I won't soon forget.  So disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wSnf9j7XL1yEIY-_3toa_Q.text: I went 7 in the morning with my mom. (No wait)Try the Oysters which I have never tried before... They oysters were so good!!! Great place with awesome food! The clam chowder will make you hurt yourself!

Z-i8BK7SgcrNcZQgVef5CA.text: Patience is a necessity when making a visit to oyster bar.  There are only 18 seats, 6 pots, one cook, and one server. We got there at 2:30 am on Wednesday and there were about 4 other people in front of us.  After about 30 minutes my party was able to sit and ordered oysters and the pan roast.  Oysters are very fresh and shucked right in front of you.  The oysters are very plump and are served with cocktail and horseradish.  After we were finished with our oysters we noticed that a couple parties ahead of us still had not received their entrees.  We found out each pan roast takes about 20 minutes to make and since there are only 6 pots it may take a while.  This was my first experience with pan roast and i thought it was pretty good.  You get a pretty big bowl with lots of seafood.  Oyster bar is located inside Palace Station (away from the strip) and you must be at least 21 years old to sit.  I would hate to experience the wait during peak hours so try to stop by on the weekday in the early morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast

Yn--gczxR8uHEPUlbV8Plw.text: Wow, bend me over and please me again! I am in LOVE with Oyster bar! The combo pan roast I decided on had shrimp, crab, sausage and chicken in it. This pan roast was full of ingredients, they don't skimp and it is rich and creamy.This was my first visit and I am thankful to my good friend who invited me to such an Awesome dinner treat. This is a fun spot because you are front row to all of the cooking magic in view of your meal being cooked. The Jumbo shrimp cocktail was yummy as well! We waited almost two hours in line for the coveted spots to eat at this Oyster bar. It sucked standing in line for so long but with good conversation it helped to pass the time. I will be back, you can't find a pan roast with this much orgasmic flavor anywhere in town. I am a fan and am disappointed with myself for not trying it sooner!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sqJMenY0EOyV_Q7BVBw30w.text: With all the fancy buffets and all you can eat sushi and world famous chefs in vegas, believe it or not, this place was my favorite meal of this trip.  I'm not sure if i was just over the busy flashy lights and glitz and glamor of the strip but it was just nice to have a simple, delicious, down to earth meal that didn't try to seduce you with a famous Chef name or fancy plating.  I ordered the etouffee ($21.99) and also had a taste of the house gumbo ($23.99) and the combo pan roast ($23.99) all came with shrimp, crab and lobster.  The shrimps where whole pieces they were nice size, the crab was jumbo lump and was shredded and mixed throughout, it added a lot of body to each dish, the lobster was just tiny pieces and personally i think i could do without it.  My favorite was the gumbo or the etouffee, they had a bolder flavor than the pan roast which was more creamy.  I could see why they said that their pan roast is the most popular dish, i just prefer a more savory flavor over creamy.  The pan roast was so creamy, it almost reminded me of a rich bisque.  Each dish is made to order in its own individual kettle, you can also choose your own level of heat, i ordered my Etouffee a level 5, the gumbo a 4 and the pan roast a 6.  I liked the spice level on the etouffee and the pan roast but wished the gumbo was hotter, but it wasn't my dish so no complaints.  I usually don't care for Cajun food, its very rare that i find a place that i like, i think its because its made fresh and the shrimp is cooked fresh, where as normally everything is stewed for a long time and the shrimp is overdone and rubbery.  But this one blew me away so much that i also ordered a gumbo to go and had it for breakfast then next day.  It's a small bar in the middle of Palace Station, which is more of a locals casino.  With only 17 seats even a seemingly short line was over an hour half, but well worth it.  Its open 24 hours so maybe you'd have a better shot during odd hours.  Service was excellent!  I mean they are right there across you behind the counter, and they make everything to order.  Note:  1.  Kids are not allowed sorry. 2.  They do take out, but you still have to stand in the same line to order.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu 2
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu 1
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Individual kettles that each meal is cooked in

k-zScnI_KrGqiKRQdnZiHA.text: After hearing about this place from friends and fellow Yelpers, I had to check it out for myself. Oyster Bar is located inside the Palace Station casino and seats only 18 people. There was about 6 people waiting in line ahead of us at around 3am, and we were seated a little over an hour after arriving. The chefs were friendly and worked as fast as they could, but food took about 20-30 minutes to be served. I decided on a half dozen oysters ($10 between 1-9am) and the highly raved about Combo Pan Roast ($23.99).   The oysters were freshly shucked and some of the best I've ever had. I can't compare my pan roast to other places since I've never had it before, but it's a really thick stew made out of brandy, tomato and cream. The Combo Pan Roast was full of large pieces of crab, lobster and shrimp and had the perfect amount of spice for my taste at a level 8. It was super rich, creamy, and absolutely delicious. The serving was enough for two people, so I had plenty to take home with me. I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast level 8
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half dozen oysters $10 from 1-9am
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I251oTsdN0jYDrme3OXidQ.text: The place to go for delicious seafood. Affordable prices and large portions. You may have to wait a little in line, but it's definitely worth it!

BteFeWOdVvPVOfthXbiLYQ.text: Make sure to go to this one and not the other ones. The one at palace station is the best!!   Came here with a few friends on a weekday. Luckily enough the line was. Not uber long and there were only about 7 people, two groups in front of us. We waited about an hour since there is only about 10 seats.   Service: 5 stars- the cooks and the servers are hilarious. They move very quickly and are very very efficient.   Food: 5 stars- what makes this place stand out amongst the other oyster bars is their fresh seafood and how much they give you. They don't skimp with your ingredients. I ordered the crab pan roast and this crab pan roast in comparison to places like hard rock simply has so much more crab.   Definitely coming here again!!

-HZXItfAJOFU_FHw0OgnTg.text: All I want to say about this place is...WOW! My husband and I go to Vegas very often and love to try new places to eat each time we are out there. He wanted to eat oysters, so while looking on Yelp, this was the first to pop up.  I read the reviews prior to going and saw all these reviews about the combo seafood pan roast, the wait, and the oysters during their happy hour time.  This place is a bar, with limited seating. However is open 24/7. We arrived at midnight and didn't get seated til about 1a. I almost fell asleep in line, so my husband and I decided to take turns gambling while the other stood in line.   He ordered 2 dozen oysters just for himself along with calm chowder and wow..we were very impressed! Oysters were a decent size and was nicely priced because it was their happy hour pricing. I think $9.99 for a dozen? The clam chowder was full of seafood and flavor.   I ordered the combo seafood pan roast at a 6 spice level (I am Laotian and can eat very spicy and thought 6 was just right, even had a kick), I was going to go for 10, so glad I didn't. You can get the scoop of rice in the pan roast, but I decided to get it on the side.   It's such a great experience because the cooks are pretty attentive and they cook it right in front of you! It really looks like a bowl of orange/red nothing, but man, oh man, wait til you take your first bite. I was amazed, my eyes lit up lol. It was so worth the wait! I couldn't finish it all, so they packed it to go for us and was still good to eat the next day when you warm it up. But I will warn you, the crushed peppers in the soup sits in there overtime, it tasted a lot spicier the next morning.  Definitely making a stop to come back the next time we are in Vegas. So glad it's open all day/night!

JQOcyJRE_EOWRJ3tXd1ONw.text: Showed up around 11pm on a Friday and was still 1.5 hour wait.  My irritation with the wait was comparable to waiting in line for a ride at Disneyland during the summer.  No lie, was totally worth it!  They prepare the food in some pots right in front of you and they do not skimp on the amount of crab or shrimp they put in your dish.  I had the etouffe while my wife had the pan roast-both were outstanding.  Wife ordered oysters and convinced me to try one, was disgusting, but I never liked oysters.  However she said it was some high quality oysters, to me, it tasted like ocean.  If you're really hungry you might want to factor in at least an hour wait or bring some almonds or something.  Bottom line, place is worth the wait!

opFVp5OWKw4VPJ5R3F7hjQ.text: We waited an hour and 15 minutes and fans were right, it's definitely worth the wait. The seafood was like butter in your mouth as in it was so tender and juicy and melts in your mouth. It was so savory we ate it all, we were amazed! Will definitely be back!

Z20KSRuZl4qNf8PoaPbAtA.text: Worth the wait even late. Oyster bar palace station has arguably one of the best.. well um, oyster bar in town.  You really do have to come later to enjoy this place though, the wait gets crazy. There's only a couple seats situated at the seemingly awkwardly placed bar in the casino but once they sit you down you're always immediately greeted with a consistently friendly host no matter how busy they are.  So far I've tried the bouillabaisse ($23) and the combination pan roast. Both were packed with flavor, the boulliabaisse with a more liquidy broth and the pan roast had a thicker sauce.   Personally I say get the combo pan roast, the bowl is pretty large enough to make 2 meals out of or you can share with a friend so it's worth its value. Pick your spiciness wisely too, for myself a 6/10 is both comfortable and tasteful enough that it doesn't ruin the flavor of your bowl (pan roast & toilet).  The oysters are also pretty decent. Although they aren't the most fresh ones I've ever had, they are passible if you're craving a good dozen. But really the pan roasts and bowls are where it's at.  Stop by around 3am when the lines start to die down and when you're done, make sure you pick yourself up a quick $2 dollar margarita on the way out of the casino to seal the deal!

xFzOsMmUt7uYuOrO_NUWXw.text: I went there on a Thursday evening.  The wait was a bit over 1 hour, which was not too bad considering what others' review.  I had their pan roast combo.  I selected a spice level of 8, which I think might be a bit too much.  It was still good but it masked some of the flavor of the broth.  I would suggest getting a 7 or less to really taste the broth.

n8Vf9MJH3I9YwoIqhLiSWw.text: This is going to be my most bipolar review to date.  Let me start by saying that any place that can start me off with oysters on a half shell, and a couple beers from the jump gains my seal of approval. The oysters were very fresh! They definitely weren't slimy or smell like they've been in a bus tub full of melted ice all day. For an entree, my girlfriend and I both decided to go with the Lobster Pan-Roast. I am convinced that they give you a whole lobster in the pan roast, maybe even two--so if its portions that you're looking for, expect a lot of lobster. The sauce was amazing too, I asked for my heat to be at a 7 out of 10, but it tasted more like a 8.5 out of 10. I kind of want to come back to see what 10 feels like. Overall, the food is absolutely amazing, and the staff seemed very happy to be there.  Here's the bad. Like, really bad. So bad in fact that I will only come if I'm close and if I'm craving lobster. The seating system here is SHIT. Absolute shit. Yes, I understand that theres about 20 seats, (19 to be exact when my girlfriend and I ate there), and I understand that when the bar gets full, that means they're at capacity. My girlfriend and I got in line with 8 people waiting in line. With 19 seats, and 8 people in line, we figured we couldn't wait more than an hour. Not bad. We have waited an hour to be seated on multiple occasions. Here's the part that pissed me off. One of those people in the line of 8 was holding a spot for a party of 10, and another one individual held a spot for a party of 8. That's fucking bullshit! If were using a line system, the entire party needs to physically be there, or should give the rest of the line some kind of discretion. It took us 2 hours and 15 minutes to wait. They need to make a sign up list, or at least have a host. Its a popular restaurant for Christ sake! Get a host! Or have a server have a check list and check it whenever they seat you!  Overall, the food was fire. Absolutely amazing! Was it worth the 2 hours and 15 minutes? Hell no. Get a better seating system!!!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pan Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half dozen oysters

hYyBhLaGZ8ozCz1YaEgRNA.text: An hour and a half wait is typical at this awesome joint. My husband loves the pan roast and I like the dirty chowder. We also share a half dozen oysters which almost seems like a requirement if you're there.  The service is always awesome!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F-iu2nZXtZlBhymO6m10Yw.text: Everytime we are in Vegas we visit this place.  We went twice this time.   I had the lobster rolls with rice.  The rolls the lobster is on was toasted and soooo gooood!  The lobster is fresh and great quality.  Service at the  bar is ALWAYS GREAT!  My husband always has the peel and eat shrimp dinner.  We cannot stress how good this place is!

nXYpnWLfpaIryk00aGE8JA.text: Horrible service. After waiting in line for 45 muns to be seated, Nora the waitress decided to serve everyone at the bar but us. We had to demand a menu from someone in the back. We had to wave our hands and demand to order because Nora kept walking by us and serving the people to the left of us and to the right of us, completely ignoring us the whole time we were there. We talked to Patrick the manager but he only made excuses for her. We wrote a report and will follow up with corporate on Monday. We want our money back. It was absolutely horrible.

Qmoyqu4cJK8Ziz-HNk6WfA.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE the Oyster Bar! I live in Hawaii and have made this my usual stop whenever I'm in town. I crave the Louisiana Style cuisine served here and get so excited whenever I think about it!   Located in the Palace Station Hotel and Casino, the Oyster Bar is very popular and often has a line to get in. Don't be discouraged; the line moves. The wait is worth it!  We went for lunch at 1:30 pm. There were about ten people in line but we were seated 45 minutes later. The restaurant has about 18 seats that face the kitchen, where you can observe the chef work his magic. Watching him multitask, cooking everyone's dishes individually while restocking and prepping is amazing to see.    Anyway, the menu was straightforward. We ordered:   ***1/2 Dozen Raw Clams ($11.99) - Served on a bed of ice. FRESH!! We watched the waitress crack them open. Raw clams and raw oysters are my favorite!  ***House Gumbo ($23.99) - Served with Shrimp, Crab and Lobster. All gumbos come with andouille sausage and okra but we added more crab ($5.99) and okra ($2.99). Served with a scoop of rice on the side, this dish is heavenly! I savored every bite. This is my favorite.   ***Combo Pan Roast ($23.99) - Served with Shrimp, Crab and Lobster. This was recommended by the waitress because she said this was very popular. I compared the sauce to a tomato bisque. It was okay. I preferred the house gumbo soup by far.   The Oyster Bar can spice things up for you if you want. Their levels: 1-3 Amateur; 4-7 We Are Impressed; 8-10 We Dare You. Lol. Needless to say, I ordered my dish at level 1.   FYI, we ordered to-go orders of the House Gumbo and brought them home to Hawaii with us. (For those wondering, my Aunty who lives there froze them for us and we checked it in our baggage). It was just as good and such a wonderful treat!  Thank you to the staff at the Oyster Bar for always making our experience so wonderful. We will continue to return every time we are in Las Vegas......

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spice levels!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Gumbo. Yum!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

Lnl9DKWF1zpoTbvKx03P9w.text: Super bad customer service!!! When we can be sit on the table, the waiter come to check our ID and told us that my little brother is under age so he can't be sit. We are waiting for a long time! Why don't you say anything before??? And there is NO sign to tell the customer that you have be over 21 !!! Totally super bad experience there!!! And the waiter's attitude is very bad!!!  Also the friend who recommend this place to me is under 21 ! He said he can be sit before ! Why this happed?! Are this place treat customer differently???

5xqxZTGtu8IDIjLal1LNDg.text: So were in Vegas and haven't slept yet and it's like 6 or 7 in the morning and I'm craving raw oysters for some reason. Searched up oysters and seen this was 24 hours and less then 10 mins away. Drove there and sat down in a bar like area as they greeted us. what my boyfriend ordered was some kind of pan seafood combo and it's a favorite. He got his at a 4 spice level (pussy)... jk. His was more of a creamy tomatoe texture and he got it with pasta noodles instead. I like how they cook everything in front of us. I got my half dozen oysters on ice with the fixings and it tasted soooo good. Just satisfied my cravings. I also ordered what the dude suggested for me was a favorite. I forgot the name of it but it's something like bouillon with a bunch of seafood in it, I mean I think it had lobster if I'm not mistaken it looked like the tail but cut three ways. It had huge pieces of shrimp, crab legs and mussels. It was very very delicious and I had it with a side of rice and spice level 10. I said if u can do 12 that's perfect but he asked am i sure and said i was crazy lmao! I get that a lot and I get it cus they don't want us customers dying off they food. But I assured him I could take it! He said ok ima just do a 9 for u cus I want u to be able to taste it since it's your first time. Threw me off cus I wanted what I  wanted but I get it and it was fine cus I do want to taste. They made that to go and even let me taste some in a bowl with rice jus so I don't go saying they made it too spicy which it wasn't. It was perfect!.. left off satisfied and full! Will be stopping by again whenever we take another trip to Vegas!

Y17Hnp396zoRLwnJVKlkfg.text: I cannot express how delicious this place is. But beware, that line can fool ya. You may be second or third in line, but you could easily wait 1hour. There have been times where I have waited 3 hours at 3am. For starters, I really enjoy their Manhattan clam chowder. It's more of a tomato base soup rather then cream like New England. Then I usually go for the combo pan roast with extra lobster. Shrimp , crab , and lobster with a side of rice. Can you really go wrong? The chefs are usually interactive and friendly. The waitress/assistant is always on top of refills and anything else you may need. The prices are really fair for what you get. Also be aware that you will have little to no reception while inside the palace station. Bring a friend and chow down.   The chefs are going to hate me for this but if you enjoy a little spice in your life . Kindly ask them to make some lava sauce for you. It'll change your life!

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This chef was pretty cool. Thanks again for yet another great experience.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast with shrimp, crab and double the amount of lobster. With lava sauce on top!

cUWSGKQJN8apHfRmqcHTFQ.text: Possibly the most overrated place in vegas. Chowder is garbage. Cannot understand the line or good reviews

Xk1tS3pBQVDMK1rtg3yVEw.text: We would fly from LA to Vegas whenever we can just to eat at this place. That's how good this place is. We are never disappointed with the service and the food. Our favorite is the Combo Pan Roast. We've seen people try to use fake IDs just to sit at this bar to eat and drink. That's hilarious but you can imagine how good this place is.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace Pan Roast. There can be no other version better than this.

EduUtZdrMBJTBXFvuG74sA.text: Hot Soup! Hot Soup! I didn't realize Vegas was as cold as Tahoe (on a good day) around this time of year so when my friend suggested soup for dinner, I was all in.  We walked into the casino and headed towards the restaurant and there was already a line!  It was a Monday night and I wasn't expecting much people but it's Vegas, people are up at wee hours doing god knows what, like eat.  We waited for about an hour which goes by pretty quick when you're walking around while your friend waits in line or when you're making small talk with the lady in front of you.     1/2 dozen Oysters - These were the biggest, juiciest looking oysters I have ever put my lips on.  Slurp slurp!  Big and fresh, just how I like my....oysters. Combo Pan Roast (crab, lobster, shrimp) - it was like a hybrid between a bisque and chowder.  Very rich, full of flavor, and they don't skimp on the meats.  Everything was fresh, the soup was good alone or with the scoop of rice/sourdough roll.  Great service, good food

n3OUrFPEnnuNblnmqDM1Ig.text: Ate here late last night/early morning. Oysters were amazing. Shooters were great as was the service. Would highly recommend for anyone loving fresh delicious seafood. Fantastic

CzvtpGlcyaYwoOirMbzOxQ.text: Always a must go when we are in town! We love eating here. The Palace Oyster Bar can't be beat!

kBdmiNphW8wXoL8352FUUg.text: Look you have to go in to it knowing you will be in line for an hour minimum.  But the reward is great seafood.  Manhattan clam chowder was almost a meal in itself. Oysters were flavorful, but pretty basic. Pan roasts and gumbo were fantastic.  Lots of seafood in the dish; lots of flavor.  Service is actually quite nice and unrushed (which is fine once you are seated but can be tough when in line.)  Only suggestion is an extra busser to help clean up and move things along.

IrOx4EaxMf4PphHXMxi9qg.text: After 6 years as LV locals we finally made it to  The Oyster Bar in Palace Station. WOW-What a concept. We waited inline for a seat to open up, this is the norm from what I hear. The food is worth the wait though. Shrimp cocktail- lovely large shrimp with spicy cocktail sauce- yum.  Lump crab cocktail equally yummy. The house gumbo is excellent ( a Louisiana native rating) and the pan roast was delish! Well worth a try! Steve our waiter was friendly, great attitude and service!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

83vQm8eRpk18BT5vjflnng.text: You may have to wait a little but this is probably the best start of a good night if you like an assortment of seafood. Competitive pricing, lots to choose from and the atmosphere is awesome. Friendly staff, good company around you and it's bar style eating like you've never tasted before!

6KJQMK5f4tCCUNMJUInR2A.text: Waited 20 minutes before being acknowledged at table.  Never was checked on once by waiter.  Manager checked on us while eating our food.  Food was great.  More severs need to be on, if they can't handle their sections.  Both my guest and I are in the industry, and we're highly disappointed on the price we paid and the service that was not given.  We arrived at 5:30 left by 7:00.  We would have ordered more drinks but left for better service.

-S5i2ck7_LWWW3aGZDxnmg.text: Food here is too good! Had raw oysters, the Pan Roast, and the Alaskan Chowder.. all were superb dishes!! Got to go here every Vegas trip!

SjDwILY_cB5-HUylhBNLFg.text: A hidden gem. I'm not the type to limit myself to options, but if I had to pick just a few restaurants to eat at for the rest of my life, this place would easily make top 5. I freaking LOVE this place! The portions are large and very shareable, and the food is consistently flavorful and fresh. The staff is super attentive and friendly too--mind you this is just a 24 hour booth thing in a randomish casino off The Strip!  Everything is good, but my routine usually includes a bowl of New England clam chowder, an order of (any) pan roast and a dozen oysters.  I always get an order of each of these dishes and split it with a friend.  This is usually plenty of food, and our meals for 2 are about $50 total.   The wait time varies, depending on when you come. I always come between 9pm-1am, and the wait is usually about an hour.  I once stayed in Vegas for 2 weeks, and after the 5th day, The Strip began to slowly lose its luster.  However, unless the quality of food changes, my love for this place will never dwindle away.  P.S. This is my first 5 star review ever. ;)

W-IzlVBgaCpwpZQcBI25Fw.text: Waited over an hour standing with people cutting in line. Do not go here unless you have three hours to kill. The place only holds only 18 people. This is just a bar table. It was my girlfriends birthday so we left.

d504Sm_Ltx4izegr3pJPzg.text: When we arrived on a Tuesday evening at around 8PM, there were only 5 other people waiting in line, but it took forever for the bar stools to turnover so we ended up waiting almost an hour for a seat and then another 30 minutes for our meal to be prepared.  The usual cook took a break just as we sat down and the back-up needed to check the menu posted on the wall to determine what ingredients were to be used.  We each ordered bouillabaisse which comes with rice and bread that we barely touched.  Once again this was the best we have found in Las Vegas; literally loaded with seafood though the promised cod was MIA and the crab legs very small.  However, the meal just was not worth the extraordinary wait.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5HHBsUcZJGY-pwCLbER1nA.text: Bunch of whiners complaining about the line. This is THE best restaurant in Las Vegas. Vegas. One of the most popular cities on the planet. When you finally sit down, milk it. You earned that seat. There is gonna be a wait. So shut up and deal. Get the combo pan roast spicy 7 and a dozen oysters. Add okra to that pan roast. Sit back and enjoy. The cooks are too busy to talk so bring someone to get wasted with. I bring a six pack to the line that way you party the whole time.   I can not say anything about the food that hasn't already been said. Words can't describe it. I've had fresh seafood right by both oceans and this spot in the desert still takes the cake. It's like a little baby mermaid angel gave you a spoonful of underwater heaven. Worth every minute.

tzNBo0Zypnuurg862CgkLQ.text: i had no expectations for this little stop in the corner of the Palace station casino.  Boy was i in for a treat!  The gumbo here matches anything i've had at numerous french quarter restaurants in New Orleans.  Its simply supurb!!  I got level 7 spice and that was fantastic.  Full of flavor with every bite.  Simply put, i could not have gotten more if i was trying.  My ONLY complaint is the place is simply TOO small...i can see lines reaching 20 deep at times.  i full restaurant would do fantastic business.  i expect to be a repeat customer here!

2viU5PYCvjyRWZfSqYzH_w.text: I've read so many good reviews about this place, even a yelp friend (who is very cute) said this place was the bomb. So I tried it...I can't believe the hype. I waited almost two hours to eat here, but to my surprise the combo pan roast didn't live up to expectations. What it basically is a mix of seafood with creamy tomato soup. And what pissed me off was the seafood was so small in portion with the soup. Furthermore, the bowl of seafood tomato soup cost $22! Such a ripoff. Never again.

_0JGLYYwMtvk_P84r4CXZA.text: My favorite oyster bar. The Pan Roast is a must try! Ahhhh everything is so tasty! I go to Vegas just for this! It is definitely worth the long wait.

gGhZhhVuaSqqbge4ESR3kA.text: I absolutely LOVE this place. I dont really care that I have to wait an hour, because the food is so delicious. Whenever I go, there's this Asian man with glasses who is cooking - he is seriously so funny, makes fun of you, and makes it really enjoyable to be sitting/waiting for food. The oysters are always so fat and juicy and I always have to get a dozen. I also always get the combination pan roast. The portions are huge, so you should either share a plate or take it to go - I suggest you take it to go so you can indulge yourself later. Make sure to come with an empty stomach! You will not be disappointed.

muLgLUndLp1NWyC4jNzSOA.text: this is first time for me at oyster bar and i had wait in the lines around45minuites.the food was awesome espeacially the chef his name is Ricado and the server name Steve. they both were so busy but never see moody mode on them. excellent service. great value great service. i will be back again. love this place

8TEim0L6FtZPoGPmoPRfLg.text: THE HOLY GRAIL OF HEARTY SEAFOOD AND STEWS. I loved this little place. I must go again before I leave Vegas!   Arrived at the Palace Casino after a couple of hours of walking with rumbling tummies through the strip. We knew we were going to eat here so we tried to save our appetites. Not recommended next time since we did not know how long we'd be in line. Once we got in line around 5 pm on Wednesday I saw we had 8 people in front of us (4 couples). The little old group of senior citizens behind my friend and I had the 99 cent margarita slushies offered by the casino so while I held the line my friend went off in search of two. He came back with them and they were super sweet and cold but yummy refreshment and not strong at all. The line moved along and 45 minutes later we and the two couples before us were seated (6 people) in a row down at the front of the bar.   Our efficient servers took our drink orders and our drinks and bread buns along with butter were brought out promptly. Couldn't tell if the bread was just funny tasting or sour dough but that's not the point since I was there for the star of the menu! My friend ordered the house gumbo and I ordered the combination pan roast by yelp's recommendation and NEVER LOOKED BACK. Took another 45 mins to an hour or so for everyone's food to come out and by this time my friend was ravenous but once the first couple's entrees were ready so was ours so no complaints on time and kudos to the awesome chef Ez (Ez? EZ? Idk) on his time management. The man deserves a pay raise.  Let me just say that you can taste the love in this soup so much you feel like getting married. You feel like carrying it away from the table, bowl and all, and booking a hotel suite upstairs. You feel like no matter how long they tell you to wait for your pan roast, the wait will be worth it. It's that good. My friend's gumbo I thought couldn't possibly beat my pan roast but lo and behold idk how they did it but they managed to make more than one star soup selection on the menu equally competitive as the other. Actually, by the other reviewers pretty much the whole menu can compete with each other, it all just depends on your taste. I love gumbo and also the pan roast. The options seem endless now, it might just tear me apart to order something other than the pan roast. I may have to not so subtly direct everyone I bring here to order something else under the pretense that we will "share" *wink wink*.   Then, as if she sensed my conflicting emotions within Rayma our server asked if we had ever tried their chowder. She responded to our no with a little soup bowl of their New England style clam chowder for us to share. I could've cried, it was pretty great too! Nearly wanted to order a bowl of it to go but the portion they gave me of pan roast was so huge I decided next time. By the time we finished our meal it was nearing 9 pm and we were not so pleasantly full, with huge smiles as we chatted with the friendly couples next to us. We got our bills and tipped extra for the awesome service and great food. Our leftovers (half his gumbo, 2/3 my pan roast) was enough for three hungry people to share, which we did once we got home (kind of regretting it now). Since I was the least food comatose I had driven. Ahh, if the valet could've only drove us home it would have been heaven. Overall, a successful and great experience. I am going back again every single time I stop in Vegas.

Lf-Fs6Q-fCrEXg2wh98EhA.text: Wow, I now understand what the hype is about. We went at 9am and were seated right away. We had the combo pan roast which was absolutely amazing! It was so full of flavor with a nice balance of creamy and savory. The oysters were super fresh, shucked to order. The cioppino was not my fav, but the hubby enjoyed it. Pan roast and oysyers is a must! The best part though were the chefs/servers. They were hilarious and gave us a free gumbo taster.

sBU-ZHbaPH-XFXcaBkv4uw.text: Absolutely love this place ..even though I live in Phoenix I would definitely drive all way to Vegas just to eat here

BRKRtzzzeC3SyOfv97hfeg.text: First thing, it's worth the wait to get excellent fresh seafood at about 1/2 the price of most places.  I went with a colleague from England and although we waited at least 45 min. to get seated at the bar, which seats maybe 16-18, when we got our beers and were anticipating the meal, we were like "that wait was nothing, man!".  Started with a dozen huge gulf oysters on the half shell and they were great!  I had the Bouillabaisse which was a little different to what I'm used to (the broth was a little thicker with more tomato base, and served with rice rather than crusty bread); however it was fabulous indeed, loaded with clams, mussels, big shrimp, pieces of king crab leg, and sea scallops.  Yeah it was good!    My associate had a lobster pan roast, and though I'm not familiar with that, he said it was great as well.  He's not your usual Brit because he grew up in France and loves his seafood too.  It's a good show as well because the chef prepares everything in front of you in these contraptions that are hooked up to some kind of steam system.  Very clever and it works, the chef keeping up a rapid-fire commentary the whole time.  A good show with great seafood at good price, what could be better.  I probably won't be back in LV anytime soon, which is too bad because I'd like to try the gumbo, chowder, and many of the other items on the menu.  Free parking in the casino garage as well.  It's a little off the strip but worth a try for sure.  One more thing, it's right on the casino floor and open 24 hrs so if/when I go back to LV, I'm staying there!

8ZRBWuS7oCbpAFGQPHpi7A.text: So this place located inside Palace Station is so fuckin amazing! I love seafood and Ricardo and the other lady there are jokesters so if you can't take a joke or get offended easily don't eat there...  My girls and I went there one night to try to get dinner and the line was long.. It would be over an hr wait so we came back the next morning/afternoon.  Luckily no line!! We ordered oysters and clams so start.  I ordered the lobster pan roast and it was great. This place is open 24 hrs. Def a spot to come back to.  Very similar yet different from the boiler in chino hills.

uvy8yTnsgd4e6wQrtj2xEA.text: Wow! Who knew that of all places, that Las Vegas would be one of the spots to have one of the best seafood places to actually grab some fresh, quality food at decent prices?  This bar seems to fill up early, so try to get here as early as possible unless you don't mind waiting in line for your chance to sample some of what they have to offer.  It's located in Palace Station and even with the simple atmosphere, serves some of the most mouth watering food I've ever had in Las Vegas.  We started off we a dozen oysters (not sure what kind) on a half shell. The flesh was nicely sweet, with a hint of brine, it was perfect paired with the lemon and tabasco. *drool  I also had a bowl of the New England clam chowder which wasn't full of salt (where most places fail miserably with the sodium levels). The milk and potatoes, nicely complimented the sweet, slightly briney chucks (not tiny morsels) of clam meat. *double drool  My friends and I decided to grab a couple bowls of their Etouffee, Combo Roast, and Bouillabaisse.  The Etouffee consisted of nicely sized pieces of fresh shrimp, crab, and lobsters in a somewhat spicy (had a nice, slight kick) stew. I thought it was Gumbo, but it wasn't. Fail me. The seafood tasted really fresh and the stew was nice and hearty. I even poured some of it on top of my rice that they offer with the dishes. *triple drool  The Combo Roast reminded me of a lightly sweet lobster bisque that also had shrimp and crab in it. There wasn't pieces of the sexy shellfish, but more like a light bisque base soup. It was flavored really nicely and I just wish it had pieces of the shellfish (pieces) inside of being blended into the soup.  The Bouillabaisse was slightly like the combo roast above, without it being a bisque of sorts, with pieces of the seafood for you to see. It was more of a seafood stew with lots of morsels of crab, cod, prawns, lobster, mussels, and clams. The seafood wasn't scarce and neither was the flavor. *Quadruple drool  Just writing out this review makes me want to go back and hopefully we do! This is a great "out of the box/strip" place to go to for fabulous seafood and the waitress' and chef are really friendly and engage in conversation with all the patrons.   If you're in the mood for really great seafood, come here and avoid the "seafood restaurant" across the street.

SwYaeSiom1fe2wfPitOKGA.text: This place is a hidden gem referred to by a friend.  It's a small counter in the middle of the casino that sits about 15 people.  Rolled up with 4 friends for late night grub...late night as in 6am, and the Chef Ricardo recommended the Combo Roast.  Let me tell you, this is one of the best things I've ever tasted.  Forget the fact that it's $20, they hook it up!  It comes in a large bowl with all you want jasmine rice and bread.  It's filled with shrimp, lobster and crab and Ricardo makes it right in front of you.  You can choose the spice level 1-10, 8 should be good enough for those who like just a hint of spice.  The cream they mix in at the end is the secret ingredient - it's a mixture of different seafood broths and a heavy cream.  To me it's the definition of "umami."  If you want something great to eat and don't mind cabbing it over to Palace Station (located on west side of strip, north of Rio), this is the place TO GO!  Ricardo is a good guy - he's make good conversation, tells jokes, talks about his experiences, and genuinely enjoys your company.  Tell him it's your first time and he'll hook you up.  This place was so good we ended up going the next day at 6am again to have the exact same thing.

N8hWDPbzj1rW31cGwj4Jxg.text: Came here to enjoy the delicious Pan Roast Combo and let me tell you it's a wait but the food is so worth it .. Very nice staff as well .. Ever in town you have to stop by the palace station  you will leave with take out and Very Happy .....

4BKxyZROK6Q34hA-AfX0ng.text: Wow. An amazing place. One of the best places if you want some serious grub! This oyster bar is right in the middle of the Palace Station casino. The whole place is just a bar where you sit. There are no tables, just stools.  I had the Linguine and Clams White Sauce. Talk about over load on the clams. They are not skimpy on this. The taste was delicious. I even tried the Bloody Mary Oyster shooters - these do have alcohol so watch out!  The one thing is that you will most likely wait in a line. But you can go over the menu and play some slots while you're waiting. But trust me it is worth the wait.  Not super cheap but it's priced right for what you get. I would come back here for sure!   This is my first time here but I was talking to a guy that goes there often and he was saying that you can't go wrong with pretty much anything that you order. I believe him.  Bring your appetite and prepared to be impressed.

fz_xp1IlhCXSgSs3Kd9qfg.text: This is the only line I will wait for food anywhere. Whenever we go to Vegas this is the first place we go. Only reason to stay at Palace is the oyster bar.  We loose more money there than anywhere else in Vegas but keep going back for this oyster bar. The ciopino is great at a 8. I have had it all. Best cooks, Bob and Ricardo. Flavor is unique to each entree. Seafood is fresh and I don't eat seafood anywhere because I grew up on fresh seafood. Even without the heat the food is good.  For the whiners, please stay out of the line.

kT4gevmERiGaWY3CicM2Cg.text: Still an hour wait on a Saturday at 10 pm and yes, it was worth the wait.  Love the pan roast combo with shrimp, crab, and lobster at spicy level 7 and raw oysters.  Skip the clam chowder (nothing special).  The pricing is very reasonable at $19.99 for pan roast combo and $16.99 for dozen oysters.  I can't wait to eat that creamy tomato seafood stew with rice and oysters again!

1mlbt00B-f9B-YhK4UPLmg.text: Never disappoints. I usually go before 11am on weekdays and usually there's no line. As many other reviews have mentioned, the lines can be quite long during any other time. Takes about 20 minutes to get your dish after ordering. My favorite is the combo pan roast. They don't kid around with the spiciness so don't go crazy... You'll feel the heat! Good fresh oysters and try their clam chowder too. Haven't had anything bad here.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast. Spicy!

kOK37fnG0_xGc1ufW3uBSQ.text: Very rude attitude! Will tip you one cent for the server, 9:49  shift server, total sucks! Butter has already milt! food is expensive and does not worth it. Very salty, very! It's like u are eating salt...... Chef! What u thinking? Server Chris? Can u cheer up a little ? No one here wants to see ur unhappy face!

MNspFrWHLIhbp78qb2f2Uw.text: Yeah. This place is redonk.  The Pan Roast is as good as everyone says. We went with the combo (crab, shrimp, lobster) for $19.99 as opposed to the Palace Station special (crab, shrimp, chicken, andouille) for $22.99. Next time, I definitely wanna try that gumbo. The dude makes the stuff right in front of you and the gumbo looked ulous-redonk also.  I'd give five stars, but their line system is a little messed up. It seems as though your entire party doesn't have to be present when you're seated. For example, two of your four-person-party can sit and eat and then the other two can return and they can take your place and eat. I guess it makes sense for the casino--allow the guests to roam around and drop cheese into the poker machines--but it's a little frustrating when you've been waiting for about an hour.  That's another thing. Is it one-hour-wait good? I'm on the fence. Maybe 8pm on a Friday night wasn't the best time to go. I'll keep this place in my back pocket for 2am hunger pangs.

yput1mwVfVzxbMHrNzpkHQ.text: When i tasted the combo pan roast, I died and came back. The hour and 30 minutes we waited for 2, was worth it. The shrimp gumbo was also amazing

p_ZfjdMvCN0IO5E_HyGKIg.text: after a long night, we headed over to the oyster bar close to 2am.  it was full, and there was a wait.  an hour + wait.    after hearing and reading all the great things, we toughed it out, in club attire, and 5 inch heels.  it was TOTALLY worth it.  we ordered the pan roast level 5.  i would definitely go a bit higher next time, but at a level 5 it was a comfortable spicy.  man, so GOOD.  lots of seafood and very rich in taste.  mix the rice in, and you've got heaven (:  the gumbo was also good, but definitely didn't measure up to the roast.  definitely one of the best gumbo's i've had though!  friend also ordered the bouillabaisse level 7.  definitely spicy, definitely delicious.  it has crab, mussels, clams, among other seafood items, with a more watery base.  who would think such a gem would exist inside the palace station.  can not wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. gumbo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pan roast

5R8SWfdD96OafAct6cfzCw.text: Best times to go here without waiting forever is between 1am-6am on weekdays. The Alaskan chowder is by far my favorite but everything else on the menu is awesome too. They don't have a phone, no reservations..super old school but that's part of the experience!

YzcXvhcCtnNRW_jane6OIQ.text: 1 1/2 hour wait but soo worth it.   This isn't my first time here and I can't believe this is my first review.   I've been coming for more than 9 years now and I always get the same experience. ...wow... just wow. The last time I went here was to take my sister from out of state to try it. .. well,  a year later,  she comes back into town and requests we go here.   Advice:  maximum 3 people in your party or you'll wait a while.   It's 21 and over because it's a bar setting but it is 24 hrs. Pan roast is what they are known for.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Lyaaal3_I7yJbEaSlTREZQ.text: -Be prepared to wait!!!! It doesn't matter if there are only four people in front of you. If the bar is full, you are likely going to wait at least 45 min before you sit. After that, it will take at least another 40 min before you get your order. Even knowing all of this, I still give this place five stars because it was WORTH the wait!! I will probably do this whole thing again very soon because it was that good. And the people waiting in line with you for an hour don't budge and look on because they agree that it is THAT good. -The Manhattan Clam Chowder is a must! It's cooked to order and you can taste it! I liked the Pan roast I ordered, but oh my goodness my friends bouillabaisse looked ridiculously mouth watering too.

TkdPXjWNNMBdS9WisNzGng.text: Go at off peak hours or else be prepared to wait...and wait...and sometimes give up waiting and go somewhere else. But if you're lucky enough to snag one of the 15 seats at the counter, you won't be disappointed.   Pan roast is the most popular item, it's rich and creamy base of either seafood or sausage or a combo of all. I would recommend just seafood or add sausage, the have the Palace Pan Roast which comes with chicken but that adds nothing to the dish. They do give you very large meaty shrimps if you order the ones that comes with it. The side of rice they give you is the perfect vessal to soak up all the yummy goodness.   The oysters are reasonably priced, very meaty. The horseradish sauce has a nice kick.  Chowders are also very good, tons of seafood and clams.  I like the ciopino too, again tons of seafood and large juicy shrimp.  This is 4 not 5 stars because depending on whose cooking, sometimes the dishes aren't as good. My last visit here I think they were switching shifts and the new guy started our 5 dishes, then ran around looking for something, left our food to cook/burn on the cookers and left and the other guy had to quickly finish it off. They tasted OK but I know it could have been better if our chef had cooked our food correctly. And for the ladies, make sure you bring a jacket because the location is right under an air vent and it's always freezing at the bar.

W7CDGyEFVOQPXnn7Aro8lA.text: I've been wanting to try this place for the longest time but I've heard stories about the wait, which is the reason why I haven't tried it sooner. I'm not exactly a patient person, haha. We went to Vegas with my friends who come here every single time and they claimed the wait was worth it so we gave it a try. We got there around 5 PM. Don't be fooled by the look of the line! I thought it was short but we ended up waiting 2.5 hours for four seats. It's LITERALLY a bar with about 15 seats total. It took an additional 40 minutes to get our food cause there are only 6 pots (the food is cooked right in front of you). Was it worth it? Hmmm..... debatable...   My boyfriend and I shared a dozen oysters ($19.99) and the combo pan roast ($23.99). The oysters were only ok, forgot to ask them where they're from. The pan roast was the highlight. It was SOOO creamy and delicious. Honestly I would LOVE to eat it again, I just don't know if I would wait that long. One of the dealers told my boyfriend the wait is usually like this, except on weekdays which you'd only have to wait about 20 minutes. We're never here on weekdays!!! The service was pretty good once we were seated. However, they were sort of slow on clearing the tables. This couple that we met was on a time crunch. They waited same amount of time as us, and they were next in line but the servers did not clear up the spot for them to sit! They ended up having to leave. I felt so bad! 2.5 hours wasted! So I would only recommend going here if you have absolutely no plans. The friends we made in line made the wait much more bearable.

pRssqOq-ayHcAPLAUgh8CQ.text: Friendly staff that likes to establish one on one communication with their customers. Food was great, but the number one killer is the wait in line. Don't come here with kids or just for Oysters. I waited 1hr and 14 mins and there were only 10 people in front of me. I would be a regular if I lived near bye. But I wouldn't come here again because I'm just a visitor and I can find better ways to spend an hour than in line.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A nice balance of sweet and spiciness(level 10). The sea food was abundant.

Ts9yndAsb3g-fnM066_Chw.text: This is definitely a good place to eat if you are a fan of creamy, seafoody based soups, chowders and gumbo. However the menu isn't too extensive so if you are a picky eater, it's probably best you move on and eat at a different spot.  As the 1000 other reviewers mentioned, the limited seating+popularity of this place = long lines at all hours of the day. We went early (Vegas early) on a Sunday morning and the wait wasn't too bad, but there was still a wait.  Our chef was super friendly and amazing at multitasking. Between socializing with  customers and cooking the pan roasts and chowders, he was shucking oysters and cleaning pots... He asked me if it was my first time and I told him I had been to the Chino location before but not the Vegas one and he said that the Chino location and the Santa Ana locations were actually unaffiliated with the Oyster Bar. Those were started by a former chef of the Vegas location... In comparison to the unaffiliated "Boiler" in Chino, the taste and the price of the pan roast are pretty similar.  The biggest difference is the Boiler has a much larger menu.  I got the house special pan roast but next time I will order the crab pan roast. The house special had way too many shrimp (I think there were 8 or 9), a few overcooked lobster pieces that was a bit rubbery and not enough crab. I usually order a 6 or 7 spice level but this time I opted for a 2 because I wanted to try some of the many complimentary hot sauces....However I tried some of my fiance's very hot and spicy gumbo (he got an 8) and after singeing my tastebuds, I decided to try non spicy food for a change. The pan roast is so creamy and salty, it tastes just fine on its own.  Service is good considering there is only one server and one busser, but this place could really benefit from an expansion.

O1KgQn_Zxi2w1QK0E-ZS4Q.text: Come heavily armed with patience.   2:30AM: tired, drunk, obnoxious, and hungry people standing around does not make for a pleasant 2 hour wait. There was only 1 cook and 1 waiter/busser/food runner working their asses off, and 1 other person not doing much other than clearing out buckets of dirty plates, attempt to shuck clams, failing, and then getting the cook to do it for him. It is only possible for 6 orders to be cooking at once, and each pot takes around 45 minutes to cook. Almost 3 hours have passed (T_T). At this point, we're just so tired and worn out that nearly nothing would be worth this long of a wait.   To cap it off, while we were waiting for our orders to finish cooking, they reloaded their pots of gumbo base and pan roast base out front for everyone's viewing pleasure. Not quite something I wanted to see! The gumbo looked like minced up dog food and the pan roast looked like someone's vomit.   Stick with the Combination Pan Roast. Imagine a seafood-loaded tomato soup with rice. The Etouffee was excessively salty and nearly inedible.  All in all, Oyster Bar was not worth venturing off the strip for. However, if you do  decide to go, I recommend going at the beginning of your Vegas trip, when you may have more patience to wait for things.

ZGKuLM8VZ5OV8IUAoGPDAw.text: Some of the best food I have EVER eaten.   The "bar" is in the middle of palace station, has a little over a dozen seats, and there is always a line. They are extremely efficient and if the patrons are eating quickly, we usually get in pretty fast.    It is the definition of a hidden gem.   If I don't organize this I'll go on raving for centuries so I'll make a list of awesome:  1) There's a particular guy that works here, he's the only server/host/food runner. That man, is Steve. He seats all the guests, he takes all the orders, he brings you the food, and he is simply, amazing. He must see thousands of people a week, but he recognizes us when we come in and is as attentive as the amount of business will allow, which is impressive. He is a large part of why we come here.   2) The food is absolutely amazing. I've had the Clam Chowder, I think New England (?) but I usually stick to a pan roast with an extra scoop of rice. It's amazing. I can't go on enough about it. I literally dream about it. I'm salivating as I write this.   3) Despite the fact that its in my least favorite casino and I will normally do anything to avoid it (the casino), I will still come in here, and wait up to 30 minutes standing, in cigarette soaked air, simply because I love this place so much.   10 stars!

O1iTeLmQLHzMBEkDMfkbHQ.text: So good, so worth standing there for over 1 hour to have 1am dinner. The BEST pan roast ever!!! Not to mention the super fresh, sweet, giant, fresh-cut oyster (I ate the whole plate of 6).  This place is ALWAYS PACKED- I was told by the oyster-master that the only time you might get seating without the wait is mid-week 10am, LOL, I guess raw oyster is not the favorite breakfast.  I would go back to Vegas just for this!!!

LAGyJ6EAgIU9YZcf4x05IQ.text: Can I just say this place was awful and please nobody go when Im in Vegas so I can skip the long agonizing line? I waited nearly two hours my first time and I was back within 48 hrs for more. The soup here is the bomb dot com!!! Hands down the best gumbo Ive ever tasted and in truth, Im not even a gumbo chick. The pan roast was amazing and I ate till my stomach hurt (ahhh...hurt so good). It sucks that I am in Texas and cant enjoy the food any hour of the day. Cant wait to go back to Vegas; not for the gambling, not for the shopping, not for the shows, but for a bowl of delicious soupy goodness.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast. I hate till my stomach hurt
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen raw clams...heavenly

wqjwfd9x2pkzbYrRQKKenA.text: Love this place! ALWAYS REPEAT : ALWAYS GET THE PAN ROAST!  Best meal I've ever had! Oysters are amazing but despite who's behind the counter cooking up those delicious meals it's always been a treat. Can't stress the pan roast being the best in the business hands down! It's one of Las Vegas best secret oyster bars! Although it can't be much of a secret when the usual wait time is about an hour or plus! Despite it being open 24/7 palace station has a gem and must eat and visit! Never had pan roast this heavenly! Think I'm kidding just give it a try!  you won't be disappointed!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the most amazing meals you&#39;ll ever have :)

245CdDDUH2l_TT0Wp5UqPw.text: We will not be coming here again.  This is the first time we came with kids.  A one year old and three year old.  We were just going to order to go.  We were waiting in line and a rude casino representative came up to us and said we either both had to step out of line or one of us has to walk around with both kids.  That kids aren't allowed at the oyster bar.  I told her we were only going to order to go, she said nope sorry, you have to keep moving, that's the rule.  It's the way she said it too, she enjoyed implementing a rule on us.    This is a stupid rule, but even if it was a rule, this is one you could just look the other way.  We have two kids, each of one is holding one, we are only ordering to go.  I was so upset.  My wife wanted to go, but I knew she really wanted it.  So I decided to take both kids back to the car and get the stroller, and stroll them around.  The lil one ends up doing number two that overflowed.  It was a nightmare changing diapers and handling both at the same time.  I will not be back.  With a lil research, I found out there is another same exact restaurant inside South Point, and many other similar type of pan roast around the same area.  We have kids now, I wont be back to a place that is so NOT Kid Friendly.  There is better ways to handle the situation.  One, look the other way, not a big deal at all.  Two, Ask to take our order and come back in 45 minutes.  Or come back in 45 minutes to place order.  You could be more accommodating, no so mean and rude.   The casino representative was an older black lady working at the rewards center at 5PM on Tuesday, April 22nd.  Nothing against black people, just describing so the management could figure out who was working at that time.

AaSWelXPkzRyl-8LZsAZWQ.text: The absolute best & authentic New Orleans dishes. I always order the house pan roast every time I'm in Vegas or passing through Vegas I stop here to eat. I've been wanting to try there oysters, maybe next time. I get so full off the house pan I probably couldn't fit oysters in my tummy. I hate the fact that it's such a small place, therefore seating is very limited. I've waited, standing up for 2 hours to eat here the last time. There's no seats to seat and wait around in. It's a line through the casino, you have to stand in and wait. Since it's a bar, there's no children allowed. I've seen a lady be turned away after waiting over 1 hour because she had her baby with her. They would make so much more money if they had more seats. People end up walking away because there either too hungry or can't stand anymore. I'm a die hard fan of the pan roast so walking away isn't an option for me :)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Pan Roast

RJseVivgtDKtJCRDNQxOkw.text: The 45-minute wait for THE Oyster Bar is definitely worth it! We ordered a dozen Oysters to start, then the Palace Pan Roast and House Gumbo for entrees. Everything was amazing!  Figured we could keep going and make our epic wait in line worth the trip, and ordered *another* appetizer (half dozen clams + half dozen mussels... the best I've had); by this time we had put ourselves in the most massive food coma, LOL. Everything is made in front of you and prepared to perfection! This is the ultimate foodie experience in Vegas, especially if you love seafood.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace Pan Roast. #y0mz
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels and clams for days.

B6xA2qv7xaPZMBh8v-icVw.text: The boyfriend loves this place and we like to make a trip to the Oyster Bar inside the Palace Station. The first time we didn't have to wait very long, but the second time we waited over an hour to get seated and then another hour to get our food. Both times that we've dined here, the food has been amazing and by far the best places to get a seafood "stew" type dish (yelp.com/biz_photos/awI4...). The highlight of dining at the Oyster Bar is their open kitchen, you get to see the chef prepare your food as you enjoy drinks and complimentary bread. They only have 6 pots going at one time and the design of the pots are tilt-able for easy cleaning and serving. Many people designate a person or two to wait in line while others in your party gamble! A good way to earn those points to comp your meal! =D

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pPNF5hHw5IUxibFEvzaP6A.text: Heard so many great things about this place. Finally decide to go last night and boy oh boy. Food was great. Maleeta and Blake were absolutely amazing. Why four stars? The manager. Back story we made friends with some other ppl in line. We all wanted to sit together and enjoy and still chat. Welp I guess the manager was annoyed and thought he was making us pay but adding gratuity. So I watched him tell maleeta to add it in a matter of fact way. Sir, I am a hospitality professional. That was rude af. Take your sour puss attitude to the kitchen like everyone else does. It might be because your bald and wear glasses or your pissed you work grave. Either way get over it. You shouldnt try to ruin someone's experience cuz you want to be pissy. Your welcome.

169X-J4jTUGweAzutWsSdA.text: Man, this is a good place to get some high quality food for a reasonable price. I always hear about the dreaded wait times for this place. I came early in the morning so I was just able to sit anywhere and got served instantly.  This was my second time coming here, so I kind of knew the menu. I got the shrimp cocktail and combo panroast.  While the shrimp was alright, I'll be going without it during subsequent visits here. They had decent flavor and texture, but for the amount and quality that I got, I could have saved a couple of bucks.  Now, for the show-stopper.
