This was the first time I got the legendary pan roast, and it lived up to the hype. Tender pieces of crab, shrimp, and lobster practically swimming throughout the bowl. There was a lot of seafood in that dish and every bite I ate, literally to the last spoonfull, had a combination of seafood in it. The sauce was on point with so much creamy flavor. I could taste the little bits of vegetables throughout. I wasn't expecting it to be as good as it was.  I'm going to have to practice some discipline by not coming here multiple times in a week. But I do look forward to getting some more of that awesome pan roast.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp cocktail with extra horseradish.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo panroast that has shrimp, crab, and lobster.

ZOTKbpZQ8t6r5vEOXkpEFg.text: I'm an oyster eating fool. I don't know what took me so long to get over here, when Arvin T came up with the brilliant idea of stopping in after the Zarkana event, I think I was more excited for dinner than I was the show!   We show up around 9pm on a Saturday night and there were only a few people ahead of us in line. With only 20 seats at the bar, you're left staring in envy at the people shoveling spoons of goodness in there mouths. You get excited when someone is handed there check, oh good, they're leaving, we are next!   We are seated and are anxious to order, both of us were so hungry, we contemplated finishing the stew the guy next to us left (just kidding, well maybe) we are given a sourdough roll and some butter, oyster crackers and water. I need food, not fillers.   We start out with a Caesar Salad (this was really, really good by the way) and an order of Fresh Lump Crab app. We were like scavengers trying to find the last pieces of meat on the plate, it was so good! We then had an order of oysters of the half shell, that night it happened to be Gold Band Oysters from Louisiana. They were enormous, and I wasn't a fan. They were served with cocktail sauce and a dollop of horseradish. I'm generally a lover of smaller oysters like Kusshi and Kumamoto or Fanny Bay, I'm not holding this against them, just wasn't a fan of the taste of these oysters.   The finale....the Combo Pan Roast. Served with a side of rice, this was the table favorite. Chunks of crab meat and huge pieces of shrimp throughout the stew. The flavor was unreal. This has been haunting me for two days now.   We were already planning our meal for when we return. I want to come back for the Bouillabaisse or the Cioppino. Arvin has his pick of the Gumbo. Hopefully they'll have some better oysters.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The anticipation is killing me

sb35-WzaCIvEOpSkQqrJDg.text: Absolutely delicious and definitely worth the wait. Oysters were plump, fresh and oh so sweet. We had the pan roast which was hearty and full of flavor. Get a 7 on the spice level for a good kick. It's a little off the strip but it's a must for seafood lovers

EIgILFl21O_0Cj8R0_kKtg.text: The closest to Louisiana you can get here in Vegas! But be very prepared to wait in line for an hour or two in busy nights, they can o let seat 16 at a time. Unless if you want to come at 3am since they're now open 24hrs.  You have to go with the combo pan roast with extra seafood. It's the original favorite here. 1-10 spice choice. Go with 4 to 5 if you want to taste your seafood instead of the heat.  The oysters can be pretty big and fresh anytime, go figure, it has no after taste. I've had the oyster shots and they're good too. The jambalaya is just so so. Your best choice is the pan roast combo here.  Depending on the chef you could be waiting for hours or not. People will wait in line and I guess that's why they're confident to take their time too other than they know they deliver what you crave for when it comes to Cajun/creole food.

ogtgzKqUinqTmCf0FA60Og.text: I've been going to this place for a few years now and it still does not fail. I typically order the clams and linguini in white wine sauce but decided to try something different.   I waited for TWO HOURS. Be prepared to be really hungry. I would recommend a snack and not go super hungry because you will hate it. The wait is the only downer. I gambled for a bit and switched off with my friends in line. They have less than 20 seats and 8 kettles to cook with. Eah can dish takes about 20 mins or so to prepare.  I ordered the Etouffee (Cajun stew with seafood), half dozen oyster, Combo pan roast, boulliabaise, and crab Caesar salad. Crab salad had huge lumps of crab claws on top of the sauced up Caesar salad. If you don't like your salad drenched, ask for it on the side. I have to say - Etouffee had a better flavor than the pan roast. But don't get me wrong because the pan roast was just as good. Pan roast had more of a creamy base to it and seemed more heavy than the Etouffee. The boulliabaise was alright. It is a French stew with mussels, lobster, crab, shrimp, cod. That dish wasn't my favorite.  I would recommend either Pan roast or the Ettoufee if you never ate here before. If you are in love with oyster - order the half dozen. They get it delivered deom Louisana.  Shout out to EZE. He was our chef and entertained us all the way. Strike up a conversation with him and don't be shy. It makes waiting for the food less worse.

1EHxZw_KIRGUzREe3fM2FQ.text: We went at 1:40 am and waited about 40 minutes. It's a tiny bar that seats 18 people. From 1-9am, they have moonlight specials: 1/2 dozen oysters for $10, $3 draft, $5 wine.   They are a well oiled machine. Every transition is seamless. Watching the chef cook in the steam kettle was a show.   We ordered oysters, combo pan roast, and New England clam chowder. The oysters were very fresh; the house made cocktail sauce was phenomenal. The pan roast was delicious. I didn't like the chowder nearly as much as my boyfriend. It was a little runny. Great experience overall.

PFk-JsD8tgyf2K9pLFI5HA.text: Really, really good food. The oysters are so fresh, the rest of the food was so yummy. Corey cooked the food right in front of us. I was happy with the clam chowder, had a lot of clams! We left stuffed. The only drawback is that it is small and we had to wait for seats as they are only at the counter. We will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters are so fresh!

bmjMGqFPMO8iqzeM3bJC6A.text: This small place is take place in the Palace Station Casino. There are maybe about 20 seats. I heard people said there will be 3-4 hours wait. I went there on Tuesday around 4:30ish. It took us about 30 mins to wait in line and another 15-20 to wait for the foods. But it was worth it. We went with a group of 4 people, 3 people ordered Pan Roast Combo, and I ordered Boulliabiase spicy 10 out of 10. It came with rice on the side or you can tell them to put it on the food. Their happy hours is from 1am to 9am. The service was great. I'll order Pan roast combo if I go there again next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now I know why the line is always long.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast combo spicy 10 out of 10
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouillabaisse spicy 10 out of 10.

ngV_IGcR8e1QoasElAGzyw.text: I've been wanting to try this place since I moved to Vegas and tonight was the perfect night!   I had the oysters and linguini white clam sauce. Oh my god-both were unreal!!!  I guess I've never had a real oyster or clam because this was just ridiculous!   I went on a Tuesday and the wait wasn't bad at all! Order the white clam sauce! Sooooooooo good and so full!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White clam sauce
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster

jmRQOb5cnfKmW99InNZPjQ.text: The location is literally a bar top with first come first serve service. Hardly no wait when we arrived. The oysters were great and the food is cooked right in front of you. Needless to say, the aromas drew us in to the Pan Roast combo. This was the best choice we could've made! They give you a huge bowl that two people with smaller appetites can share however that is not our case! The combo includes shrimp, lobster, and lump crab in a tomato bisque. We chose spice level 5 and was perfect! We will definitely be back when we visit Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VI1jUi4lXz_aRYjE4aOBqg.text: Oh man, I love this place! Oyster bar is located in palace station hotel. Go at really odd times as there could potentially be a 2-3 hour wait. They only have 16 seats so I definitely recommend going after clubbing or super duper early in the morning.  The pan roast was soooo amazing. Very creamy and filling. This order plus 2 scoops of rice can definitely serve 2 people. This is a must order!  I would recommend skipping on the oysters. While they were good, I would save room for the pan roast and the shrimp and lobster fra Diablo.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and lobster fra diablo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast

7utrnB0KsX0kJ7ZxF7FGGQ.text: Be prepared to wait! At least an hour if not more no matter when you come! Come early and trade off standing in line with a friend! The pan roast I'd the best! I always share one with someone. It's too much  for one person. The staff and chef 's are always friendly. I guess that makes sense because the food is cooked right in front of the guests. Always worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Gumbo

ZO-59cXrPr0n3jlbLLVYig.text: A little hidden gem inside Palace Station. Not many seats so the wait is generally 45 mins or longer depending on the day and time.   I had their Palace Station Pan Roast with extra lobster.. OMG! Well worth the wait, and my usual check in when I go to Vegas. A must visit!   Friendly staff and the Asian and White Chef are truly Masters of their art.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace Station Pan Roast with extra lobster and rice :D***

YStUe2_4SJN2LsORyh9sOg.text: I normally don't like writing reviews for places that obviously don't need another one when it has 4.5 out of ~1500 reviews, but this tiny bar is truly special. Even when the wait is on average 1.5-2 hours, no matter when you come. My tip is eat a snack while you stand in line, and take turns w/ your friends. Oyster Bar made me appreciate and fall in love w/ oysters. It took me 24 long years to acquire the taste for them. But this hidden (or maybe not no hidden bar now) did the trick. The MOST AMAZINGLY FRESH oysters....add a hint of horseradish, cocktail sauce, and lemon juice... Wabam! You have the most  mouthwatering, orgasmic blend of gooeyness. I know that doesn't sound nearly as pleasant as it tastes. The combo pan roast and linguini and clams are to die for. Everything else like the gumbos, chowders, and pan roasts are good, but these are by far the standouts. This little bar is the only reason the Palace Station hotel attracts people younger than 60.  Warning: Don't come when you're famished. Be prepared to always wait in line since there's only about 16 chairs. But you will enjoy one of the most delightful seafood meals ever.

xA5K_nZZZUOkYZoaZgQT2w.text: Don't let anyone else fool you, this is the BEST oyster bar in Vegas!  Food: 5 stars. I don't know what they do differently to their pan roast but it has the best flavor compared to all the other oyster bars in Vegas. I prefer the crab pan roast, but the combo is delicious too. I have only gotten the pan roast here, so can't really write much about the other things they offer, except the oysters. The oysters here are good too.   The wait for this location sucks though! So be sure to be prepared to wait at least an hour unless you get lucky. The seating is really limited since it's only bar seating.. I don't know why they don't expand a little bit more, but then if they did, maybe it might not be as good anymore. Regardless, if you have the time to wait, it's definitely worth it!

Kh8RuCnk09xXvF7U4fHrLA.text: Just another 5 star review for the most unique seafood restaurant in town. Best times to go are around 6-10am. If not, you'll be waiting and you'll possibly be waiting a long time.   If you opt not to get the pan roast, try the Alaskan Chowder. This is so amazing and heats up way better for leftovers than the pan roast (rice gets too sticky)

hhao7DRdVg-yNiKqW58g4w.text: Oyster Bar provides an incredibly delicious seafood!!! Out of all of the other station casinos I've tried this one wins by a landslide. The quality, freshness and various blends of spices all comes together.  The pan roast is the crown jewel. It's like heaven in a bowl!!! It's basically a lobster bisque type of seafood chowder, with a scoop of white rice. Thick, rich, and served piping hot,  The reason why I gave this place 4 stars instead of 5 is the wait time is 60 to 90 minutes. I was lucky to have only waited 20 minutes on Thursday night going by myself.  I know that's not going to happen all the time, so I consider myself very fortunate.  If this is going to be your first time, I couldn't encourage it more it's worth it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half Dozen Oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast

eXDidgU6Z04nxz5e945TXA.text: This place is a hidden gem!  Someone in our group of 6 brought us here.  She comes every time she's in Vegas and waited in line while the rest of us gambled.  The wait was 1 hour at about 8:30 on a Monday night.    The reviews are correct that the food is great!  I had shrimp scampi which was fantastic.  Some people in our group got the pan roast and some got gumbo.  Oh and a clam chowder and shrimp salad was also ordered in our group.  No one left upset.  I feel like anything you order there will be good.  Just pack your patience for the wait.  It's worth it!

fIIsnzb5cTrR124BSAOfyg.text: Food is great!! Worth the hour plus wait... it's NOT handicap Accessible which is NOT good for our disabled patrons.. Nice friendly service.. THIS IS A MUST WHEN IN LAS Vegas!

FO3XTi99MKInZj630upGXw.text: Not worth it..too much wait time for really simple dish of oysters. 3 hours wait time is ridiculous

nBEBsQ1GnvSj_Exa6cNxKQ.text: Oyster Bar is located at the Palace Station, which is kind of in the middle of nowhere. I only mention this because if you're taking paid transport there, it sucks when there's more than 12 people in line because that could mean a 1.5-3 hr wait. The place is a bar counter with less than 20 seats, and it has 1 chef, 1 guy who acts as host/waiter/bus boy and 1 person who manages the back. Needless to say, they move fast, but food moves slow.   In the end, food is good. I ordered the oysters, clams, combo pan roast and an etouffee... And beer. All was decent to good, but for me the pan roast was too rich/heavy. Because the portions are so big, it's all a bit much.   Long wait. Solid food. Cool guys working in the back. More than reasonable prices. I'll try the linguine or something a little lighter next time.   Robert(o), Chris and Rafael were all on point... Busy guys!

YY0jMPp1ygMbVNt1UGJ27g.text: If I could put no stars I would. Dan is racist. The rudest guy. If you have a bad day, don't take it out on your customers!!!! Blonde lady too. I don't know who these people think they are. You are no better than anyone.

Raq7TxHev9n9X5C-D5AsJA.text: We heard about the famous oyster bar from a friend of ours. We had to try it since we have had the pan roast from the Kettle Bar at the Anaheim Packing House and it haunts my dreams. So since we were in Vegas for the weekend, we had to give it a try!  We went at like 9am to hopefully avoid the crazy lines. We succeeded in our quest! We walked right up to the bar and had a seat. We ordered the combo pan roast ($23.99 - shrimp, crab, and lobster) at a level 3 spiciness (out of 10) and a bowl of the New England clam chowder.  The clam chowder came out first, and Sumana S. told me that it was the best clam chowder she has had. She knows her food so I trusted her. It totally delivered. The clam chowder was nice and creamy and it had a TON of clams in it. The clams were nice and tender. And unlike almost every other clam chowder I've had, the potatoes were not the star of the show. The clams are! As they should be!  The pan roast was super yummy delicious. It was really fun to watch them make it right in front of us. The level 3 was perfect. We're not super spicy people, but we like a tiny bit if heat. However, since I know the amazingness which is the Kettle Bar Pan Roast, I had to make a comparison. The Kettle Bar's version is the tiniest bit better. It's flavor is a little more complex and they have more stuff in theirs (pieces of fish, scallops, and chicken).   However, with that being said, I would come back to the Oyster Bar for breakfast everyday the next time I'm in Vegas!

Ss6itovk0bcH9CNe-hGuDg.text: We loved it!!  I've been reading about it for years and we were finally able to try it this weekend and absolutely loved it!!  We tried the lobster pan roast, my daughter the Alaskan chowder and i had the Bouillabaisse which was spectacular with medium spice level!!  The wait is pretty rough as you watch other folks enjoying their meals but once bits your turn it's well worth the wait.  I would order all three if I were to visit again but next time the Bouillabaisse would be my first choice.

oyuzLAlbFslqbxZ_Rd43xw.text: this place is super super excellent to come eat at. if you enjoy oysters you will definitely like it here. I got the shrimp pan roast and it is fenaminal. the server said it's their number 1 top seller. I can see why yelp gave them the award.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Open 24 hours
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Open 24 hours
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popular spot and open 24 hours

BxIeCc4bm3wYSLls9jishw.text: I have never heard of pan roast before but it is delicious. We came here on a Monday and waited about 20 minutes. I ordered the lobster pan roast. The soup was very creamy and had a very generous amount of lobster. The lobster was cooked perfectly and was not rubbery. Portion sizes are generous and I was full up until dinner.

74yMm7khnU5Ubwy4R-nstg.text: The gumbo and pan roast here are seriously good. If you're wondering what pan roast is, it's like a creamy tomato stew filled with seafood. Not what comes to mind when I say pan roast, huh? And everyone knows what gumbo is, a thick stew filled with spices and okra and sausage and seafood (not creamy and tomatoey at all).  I loved the gumbo. We got the combo seafood and there was crab pieces floating around, shrimp, sausage and lobster. Sooo savory and delicious over rice.   If you prefer sweeter and creamier flavors, the pan roast is for you. Like a delicious seafood tomato soup. I still liked it but it was a bit too sweet for me to have an entire bowl of. Also served with a bowl of rice.   The seafood was cooked perfectly (lobster was so tender!) and the portions are hugeee, which is good because they were like $22 each. 3 of us shared the gumbo and pan roast and we couldn't even finish. Definitely want to come back again.

0Td_ZDhXouFDyo32L_Zwow.text: Last time I was there won playing video poker. I decided to celebrate and no better place than The Oyster Bar I ordered the Cioppiono and 2 dozen oysters, with a couple of shooters. and a few beers. It cost me $100 with a tip. The staff at the Oyster Bar so nice made sure I was okay. Will go back if I hit another video poker jackpot.

oUHXdzmI6fpI0cGQm3Ee7g.text: This place easily holds the honor of one of the best meals I have ever had. The wait in line is worth it. If you don't want to wait, then don't! But don't bitch about it later. I have no advice as to what time to get there is better as they are open 24 hrs. Go grab a $5 Bloody Mary (or two!) at the Irish Pub a few steps away and enjoy the wait! We got there on Saturday at 11 am. There were 8 people ahead of us and we waited 30-40 minutes till we got seated. We shared a cup (which is more like a bowl) of the New England Clam Chowder. Delicious! I always get the combo pan roast which comes with giant shrimp, lobster, and crab in a tomato based cream sauce that is cooked right in front of you. Hopefully you are lucky enough to get Chef Bob as he is definitely the man. Watching him work is nothing but a beautiful symphony of organization and sheer talent. His dry sense of humor will have you laughing. We were treated to some vodka oyster shooters by the guy ahead of us in line. They were amazing, just like the pan roast which is so flavorful and delicious you will want it for your last meal. Get there now and thank me later.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast with giant shrimp, lobster and crab. Best. Meal. Ever.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vodka shooters with the largest oysters I have ever had!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Cup&#34; more like a bowl of New England Clam Chowder. Yum!

8Q4ctuPDdvKGkIOgNJlIkA.text: I used to come here all the time for the gumbo but because of a combination of having kids (not kid-friendly) and hearing rumors that it wasn't aa good anymore, I stayed away.  Well recently a friend who is a huge jambalaya connoisseur had a birthday, so what is a nice girl like me to do? Naturally I turned to my handy-dandy Yelp app, poured through various  reviews of  restaurants serving up this dish, made my choice, decided to give it another try and took him out to lunch at the Oyster bar! His jambalaya was a very good but the main event was definitely the shrimp pan roast!  I  ordered the pan roast at the recommendation of the woman behind the counter. Thankfully, I only looked at the stars when making my decision to eat here (yes, normally I like to read the reviews first ) had I read the reviews first I might not have walked in the door as I did not have three hours to wait in line. Karma and good timing were our side today as we walked right in and we're promptly seated. In the words of Arnold Schwarzenegger in Terminator... "I'll be back!"

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood jambalaya, I scored on the muscles and clams as my friend isn&#39;t a fan, woot  woot!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp pan roast, I could only eat half. It was pure deliciousness!

7au7VVXkxsbp_xLxyv2CJg.text: This place beats all other pan roasts by a landslide!!   - You must order the combo pan roast ($23.99) - it's a great deal! Comes with abundant crab, shrimp, and lobster. It's super creamy, savory, and overall dee-lish. MMmmMmm - I'm craving another bowl now..  - The combo appetizer ($19.99) comes with cocktail jumbo shrimp (3), raw oysters (3), and raw clams (3). The shrimp has a special flavor to it, I think a little nutmeg? Try it out! Also, lots of different hot sauce bottles to sample with your seafood.  - Complimentary bread and butter upon seating.   - Because of the limited seating (about 20 stools only), each chair is ultra-valuable. I've waited up to 1.5 hours before to get seated. Again, super worth it. You can order a $0.99 margarita at the nearby casino stand while you wait.   Enjoy all! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination seafood appetizer ($19.99) - oysters, clams, shrimp cocktail
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination pan roast ($23.99) - crab, shrimp, lobster

4xSxPQ9DOvzVOa_nQ4uztw.text: OMG...what can I possibly say that the previous 2,000 reviews have not covered. Simply stop by, the hype was real, the most wonderful and delicious food I have ever tried in my life.  The Good: The food without a doubt, didn't hear a single complaint from other customers. I ordered the combo pan roast...oh Lord, what an amazing dish...the best food I ever tried in my life. The service was really good too. The Chef (Jared) was simply outstanding with all customers.  The Bad: What else?? the wait of course, but based on other reviews, my 55 minute wait wasn't bad at all considering it was a Saturday at 12:30pm. Also, this place deserves more than 16 chairs without a doubt.  Final assessment: Outstanding food, great service and location. A jewel no doubt. I'll be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Jared
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Jared and his gifted hands
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Magic kitchen

jEG-F1lhll2Af3xYT3YQFA.text: Came here on a Sunday Night not knowing what to expect. My boyfriend was raving about this place and wanted to take me here for dinner. Beware that the restaurant can only seat 16 people and it might take you a while before you get seated. We ended up waiting about 2 hours to get seated at the bar and almost another hour for the food to be prepared/cooked. So if you plan on coming here, be prepared to endure a long wait or come at an odd hour to avoid a long line!  We ordered the Raw Oysters, Combo Pan Roast with Lobster, Crab, & Shrimp, and the Seafood Gumbo. The Raw Oysters were delicious and tasted really fresh. I would say they're pretty comparable to the oysters in Seattle. It tasted fabulous with the fresh lemon juice & marina sauce.   The Pan Roast was also DELICIOUS and the best I have yet. I liked that the broth was really creamy but didn't have an overpowering taste of seafood. The sauce was so addicting and I just couldn't get enough. Good thing the portions here are huge! They were also really generous with their seafood portions and the lobster was cooked beautifully!  As for the Gumbo, I will have to pass next time. The gumbo was just way too salty and I ended up getting tired of it after a few bites. I didn't bother getting my order to go because I knew I wasn't going to be able to enjoy it later.   Overall the food was good but I wouldn't say it's worth waiting 2-3 hours in line for. I would recommend trying out this place if you're able to go at an odd time. If you're trying to go during peak time then good luck and be sure to wear some comfy shoes!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast with lobster, crab, and shrimp. Amazing and so flavorful!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gumbo with shrimp, crab, and lobster. A bit too salty for my liking unfortunately :(
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh oysters. Yummy!

YQepPU5dXV9SgeLa7OUrOw.text: I'm not sure why this place is called the oyster bar because the oysters are definitely not the highlight at this restaurant. They serve one type, which were bland and just ok.  My advice ... Skip the oysters and save your appetite for the soups.  Because their soups are SO SO good! I understand why people will wait -sometimes up to 3 hours - for their favorite dish.    I had the combo pan roast, which consisted of lots of crab meat, shrimp, and large chunks of lobster. The soup base was one of the best tomato bisque soups I've had. It's served with a scoop of rice and sourdough bread.  I had a spicy level 5 which was perfect.   I tasted the gumbo, which hubby ordered.  Different flavor profile from mine, but packed with a lot of strong flavors. He ate it all up and said he would order it again.  My friend had the  bouillabaisse, which I loved, except she ordered a spicy level 8 which I couldn't handle. She even regretted it too, saying the temperature heat and spicy heat was more than she is typically use to.  My advice for this place: (1) come at least 2 hours before prime lunch or dinner times start. Your wait might only be an hour - an hour and one half (I arrived at10:30am, and was seated at 11:45am); (2) try not to come with a large group (4-5 max) because with only a few seats at the bar, it will take a while for a large group to be seated; (3) be careful not to order your soups with more than a level 5 spice (they use red cracked pepper and habeneros as their spices), and (4) don't waste your time or money on their oysters.  Overall great food and service. I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast (crab, shrimp, &amp; lobster). Very filling! And delicious!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen oysters.

wGQLSfB9f8lBZhwL9ez1fg.text: Much like Lianna N., my BFF, I too would have given Oyster Bar a 3.5 the night we ate it, maybe a 3 because we waited for 2.5 hours and I stood there in my heels seething at the people taking over an hour to eat. But here I am 5 days later and OMG I want it again.  I'm not sure what it is, maybe its the fact that I waited so long and the idea of waiting so long again makes it that much more elusive (and the fact that its in Vegas and I live far away), or maybe its because I am no longer exhausted, but it makes me want to go back to vegas so I can appreciate it more.    I got the combo pan roast and the seafood portions in it were very generous. None of those tiny bay shrimps and mini lobster morsels that are the size of your finger nail that come in lobster bisque. These were large shrimps, and larger pieces of lobster. But the real star, was the crab.  Shockingly, the fact that the seafood sits boiling and bubbling for 15+ minutes does not make it tough and rubbery.  The lobster remained soft and the crab was even softer.  I got it with a spicy level 4, but I think i could do the 5.  It was creamy, slightly spicy, and pretty flavorful.   5 days later I think I am willing to wait the 2.5 hours again, just not when its 2 in the morning and I'm starting to hang.

BnIeRjO0lRDlUqOT_68L-Q.text: What the oyster!  The name of this place is actually misleading because personally I did not enjoy the raw oysters much and did not see that many people ordering it, but the crazy good food here MORE than made up for the lackluster oysters!  I've had pan roast before but was honestly was never a fan. When my Las Vegas date suggested this place, I kind of made a scrunchy face but said yes and boy am I glad I did!    Two words can sum up this review:  PAN ROAST.   Get the pan roast. I got a level 6 spicy which was perfect.  It was creamy, flavorful and packed full of rich seafood ingredients. It was so heavy and delicious that I had to sleep sitting up for the remainder of the night. We also tried half dozen raw oysters which were not horrible but not great, so I suggest just skipping it, and also the cioppino which wasn't memorable either. The seafood in the cioppino was definitely fresh but overall, it was bit heavy on the tomato base for my liking.   One thing I liked was that they cooked the food right in front of you so you could see all of the hard work, sweat, love, and seafood that goes into your food.   Beware of the wait though.  We took a cab to Palace Station around 11:30pm and waited for about two hours to be seated. It's a small place, bar seating in the middle of the casino and accommodates only 18 lucky folks at a time... which means you have to put in your time and wait. By the time we finished, it was 3am and I was delirious but deliriously stuffed with pan roast.   Conclusion:  Totally worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beers on tap
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pots waiting to be cooked!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After waiting for two hours this little piece of bread tastes divine.

B76mhA9YHlfjKuHRJ6DM2A.text: I've been wanting to try Oyster Bar for Forever! It's Tuesday at 4p there were 6 people in front of me and I probably waited 10 minutes. Once we were seated we ordered drinks. They served used bread with butter. We ordered a dozen of oysters for $20! The oysters took about 40 minutes to come out, they were good and I liked their cocktail sauce. After the oysters we waited a very long time for our pan roast shrimp, and combo. The pan roasts come with a scoop of rice which was delicious, I got my heat level at 4 which was perfect. The food was good, the wait was ridiculous once we were seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M4r3biHQMAIVTITI_mZBrA.text: Holy crap this restaurant has blessed my soul. Disclaimer: I have a long review coming up so if the first sentence wasn't enough to convince you to try this place out, here's some more reasons.   Service: My first impression of this place was horrible. When we got to the bar and saw that there was only countertop seating with 15 seats, we asked the chef, Ricardo, what we could do because my dad is in a wheelchair. The bar was full and he was busy so his attitude came off a bit arrogant and careless. However, he and the waitress opened up the restaurant right behind the bar for us to sit at within 5 minutes. It was honestly the sweetest thing and nice to have an empty restaurant to ourselves. Then, he even came by to suggest us different items and let us sample the different soups! The service here is top notch.   Oysters: I love oysters. I've had them at buffets, at nice restaurants, and in different states but I've never seen such fat and fresh oysters! We ordered 3 dozen and they consistently stayed that way! Not a single bad, small, or old oyster. Soo worth the money, so delicious, and so satisfying.   Soups: We tried the Manhattan, the New Zealand, and the special mix of the 2, the dirty New Jersey (lol, that's what the chef named it). They were all delicious!! Everyone at the table loved each one. Also, I highly, highly recommend the combo pan roast. I overlooked it on the menu but after the chef brought out a sample, I regretted not ordering it. I loved that all the soups were so light and not thick at all.   Mussels: The mussels were not as great as the oysters/soups and were pretty standard but worth the price if you love mussels!  Shrimp & Clam Linguine: The portion is pretty big and it was a great selection.   Bread: The complimentary bread sucked and was hard as Legos but I didn't give a rat's ass about it because all the other food was so great.   This place is not located in a hotel on the strip but it's only like a 12 minute drive! Also, don't expect the hotel to be modern chic or anything upscale. But again, who cares when the food and service is great. The bar itself is trendy and looks super classy.   This place definitely lives up to the hype.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N9RAr2-575SANO40fezPmA.text: 5 tips... 1. Long Line - be prepared to wait 2. Get the Pan Roast. I like spicy (jalapenos and habaneros) so 7-8 would be ideal. 3. Get the Jumbo Lump Crab Cocktail - so good. 4. Their horseradish and cocktail sauce is freaking amazing! 5. Cheap and BOMB Fanny Bay oysters. Dozen for $16.99!!!!!

rTMy0yG6A_ZYCtY7J0D6sg.text: The wait may be long, but the pan roasts are the best in the city.  You won't regret standing in line for one.

4gSkGaK1xW6xzxDV1wRH5Q.text: The wait is long. Walter White aka Heisenberg works here during night shifts. Don't make him mad.

D08RoD2fKWbAIeInwiqaJQ.text: Went again, and took my parents.  The way they typically do Vegas is buffet, buffet, buffet - to get the most bang for your buck of course!  I was preparing myself for the grumbling and the lecture about how I'm not getting my money's worth, but they LOVED IT!

RKwes7CPzYWQzAEOkKH1aw.text: Between my mom and I, we killed 2 dozen of oysters off the bat. Yummy fresh oysters prepared right in front of our eyes at the bar. I got the combo pan roast and mom got the boulabaisse (sp) Both were good. My pan roast was a little salty though for my taste and I love salty food. I would have liked a little more seafood in it though. I found a couple pieces of lobster and shrimp here and there. There was no wait. We got here at 5 pm on a Thursday to a half full bar. The chef and waitress were very nice. The chef was very talkative and liked interacting with patrons which in my book is a plus. Loved the food but maybe with a little less salt. Def will return. Oh and side note, the smoke is overwhelming and why in world do people smoke while seated next to a non smoker. It's gross and were having dinner Geez!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boulabaisse
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo seafood pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy

Zwxu_TKQKmZrregwhjfPZw.text: This place is stand out! One of the highlights of my weekend. Worth the short drive off the strip. Compliments to Ricardo, the chef on duty last night. We will be back.

7Rrct9txGjSROlq2GBFcLw.text: This is such a hidden gem inside Palace Station.  Overall a terrific experience once you get past the smoke filled casino.  There is also a great oyster bar in Sunset Station which is much bigger and nicer in a great casino...but, it is hard to beat the original even with their long lines!

Vf65f_CJ5T5xAdTlllraWQ.text: Wow! So damn good! The wait time can be a little long but it is so worth every second! Ordered the Combo Pan Roast, Dozen Oysters and a Hanger 24 IPA! Best Pan Roast I have ever had! The Quality was superb and beats any Stations casinos Pan Roasts

AyhZb7P7vTgOQjQnGdnrOA.text: I love oysters and when I seen the almost 5 stars it was a must try. We came on a Tuesday around 4 pm and got 2 seats right away. We sat for at least 10 minutes before getting service...they could have at least acknowledged us! We ordered raw oysters which were good, the pan roast and gumbo. Gumbo was awful and unbearably salty!!!!! Pretty much unedible. The pan roast was just ok....I don't get how this place has such great reviews????

QIB2AkJC5ZekE3oYbq_wPQ.text: This has to be one of the most memorable meals you'll experience in Sin City. Putting ambiance aside, you'll have to look beyond the grungy carpet, stale smoke smell and outdated design of the Palace Station and it'll be well worth it. Avoid peak dinner hours (7-8:30pm) or be prepared to wait in line. We waited 1.5 hrs and another 20 mins while our gumbo and pan roast dishes were made. Note that there are only 18 bar stools and an average diner will take 30-40 mins. to eat plus the time you'll wait in line. It is definitely worth the wait though and a great experience watching the chef work making the specialties! Dishes are huge and sharing is permitted but worth the $5 split fee.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Gumbo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace Pan Roast... yum!

yZ1sOEwZG3H0txxkKxv0Ew.text: This place is what got me to love southern food!  I think it is where I fell in love with raw oysters too!  Beware though, their servings are BIG.  I'm glad they opened another restaurant closer to home, even though it's still a 30+ mile drive, in Chino Hills.    Big word of advice: arrive early or when it's not dinner time.  Their line gets long, and yes, people still wait even if it's over an hour long wait.

ONO6-H0dZrpIBO7AzEKmmw.text: Can't go wrong it's 24 hours they serve great tap beer. They steam all there good it's amazing gumbo and the location is in the center of the casino this place is amazing I recomened trying there gumbo and Definitly having there shrimp oyester Alfredo fettuccini good food mucus drinks.

u2eMHFHFWu19KxXg90pGaw.text: AHHH I'm so sad I couldn't eat at this place one more time before we left!!! Pan Roast was SOOOOOOOOOOOOOO good. We were so full yet finished EVERYTHING including dozens of oysters. Okay- Oysters were NOT like the best I've ever had, but PAN ROAST was. Thankfully, we waited about 10 mins before we got seated. We ate at so many places during this trip. Literally more than 15+ restaurants, and we enjoyed this place the best!! Go get it noww!!

8U1FjgGxdPIZEj3REXWC4g.text: When coming here, you definitely have to look past the older hotel, dirty carpet and literally, the smoke-filled room. We came here because my supervisor recommended it.  And I'm glad we did.  It is such a small bar with long wait times. Fortunately, we lucked out- the group in front of us couldn't wait any longer and left.  So we waited about 5 minutes and we were seated.  The pan roast combo is what we decided to order and share - there's an additional charge for that by the way.  But we didn't mind.  While waiting, we had oyster shooters in vodka and tequila.  It was fresh, flavorful and quite refreshing.  We watched the chef make the dish - there was so much  ingredients and it looked so laborious. You see him adding and mixing and seasoning several steel pots- which probably contains different types of pan roasts. Only when we started eating did we realize that each ingredient he added at just the right time created such a complex and tasty broth - if you can call it that, to our dish.  It was so finger-lickin' good that my friend was tempted to lick the bowl.  I only wish there was more seafood and more broth - well, I really should have ordered my own.  It is a definite must-try.

oZgxLV3MQPrEzr9jlyJY7Q.text: The only Luck I had on this past Vegas trip was finding a seat quickly and without waiting in a huge long line. Ice cold beers and incredible clam chowder, oysters and lobster roast. The Oyster house in Studio city could learn a thing or 2 from this place.  See you next trip.

WzSH9eC_-S6K0qofKhZFHw.text: Still amazing. We make it a point to stop by this place for our 'combo pan roast' fix whenever we're in town. What is not to love about generous portions of seafood succulently cooked in a creamy sauce of tomato paste, sherry, heavy cream and other spices? Not to mention the hilariously entertaining staff and the friendliness of the other patrons you'll be seated elbow-to-elbow with. Definitely an off-strip Vegas experience you need to see for yourself.

QGWGHekx6VsBdzzSXRjX7w.text: *warning, bring non-gambling friends here so they can wait in line for you while you gamble* CHUNKS and chunks of crab meat.  The crab pan roast is less "briney" and seafoody than the combos.  The only downside to this place is the constant wait.  Came here at 330am and there was a line of 12 in front of us.   The oysters are good too, sat next to one of the chefs and mid-shuck he threw out over half of them because they didn't meet his standards.   I go here every time I visit Vegas.  There's one that opened in Chino that is nowhere near as good.   BONUS-afterwards you can join the old ladies at bingo!

byP9BJiycLmbdz9lc0_TUw.text: yummo!!! The pan roast and the raw clams are a must! ;) This would probably be my last meal on earth. FYI....my bf and this lady who sat next to me both ordered the gumbo...they both weren't too please.

mcg0AZ-TBmiRxJp3oIlizA.text: Arrived here at zero dark thirty and waited in line for about 40 minutes.  I ordered a half dozen oysters, and the Combo Pan Roast .  The oysters were fresh, plump, and delicious.  The Pan Roast was decadent and very good.  I'll be back.

KPZnu4S7LqmWc8Axpo_UFg.text: Five Stars for the food and service, One star for the super long wait to be seated. Granted its a tiny place, Probably has like 12 seats total. Usual wait is over an hour and thats at 2am in the morning.

93E8q8Qmp5inGSmPJHK4_Q.text: Been going there since they opened Greg and Victor made the place it will never be as good as it once was but it's still pretty dam good

i6OR5qPNQLNJyruKwQfExg.text: Amazing pan roast. The best ever. Damn I didn't mind the hours of waiting in line. It's so delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast Combo. Fuel injected flavor madness

3xOYzBOp79Lu37zkWdf7og.text: This was actually my first food stop once arriving in Vegas at 2am. I am so glad it was!  My friends and I got here around 2:30am and there was still about a 30-45 min wait. I guess after seeing the wait times during the day, an after midnight meal actually seems like a pretty good idea :P   We ordered the lobster pan roast, Alaskan white clam chowder, and clam linguini. They were all delicious, but I do have to say the pan roast was my favorite. Every dish is flavorful and very generous with the proportions of seafood they have! You pick your level of spice, and since I usually go with mild I went with a 3 which was perfect for me. My friend chose 5 for his Alaskan chowder, and you can definitely already taste the kick!   I love how we are able to see everything being prepped, and the staff is so friendly and personable. I never thought of myself as one to like oysters, until the chef gave me one to try and I couldn't believe how delicious it was!  Definitely a delicious way to start this Vegas trip. Would definitely recommend :)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam chowder

QO5CSAOrfkOGh4D9wJ8N3w.text: My friend who previously lived in Vegas and has an office across the street from the Palace Station Hotel Casino highly recommended this spot. She even came to pick me up from my hotel to bring me to dine here. I was a little hesitant because the hotel was on the older side and the inside wasn't much to look at but trust me, you need to come here!!  The restaurant isn't large and is only counter seating. It's limited on seats and usually there is a line. People around me told me that they have waited up to a little more than 3 hours before just to dine here. Luckily we came on a weekday and the wait was a little more than an hour. You receive great service from everyone here and they strive to give you an amazing meal. It's also fun watching them prepare your order in front of you.  We ordered a dozen Oysters on Half Shell, half a dozen Clams in Half Shell, Combo Pan Roast with extra Clams (spice level 10), House Gumbo with extra Lobster (spice level 10) and white rice for everyone. Everything was delicious!! Spice level was just ok so they made us their special Lava Sauce. It added flavor and a little more kick to their dishes. I washed down the meal with a Voodoo Mary. It was very tasty and came with a giant shrimp!   Everything is good here and I cannot wait to come back. Must try spot in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clams in Half Shell
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters on Half Shell
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast with extra Clams (spice level 10)

v4uj48rQs97cNDJbRfsPmA.text: You will wait about an hour here so don't come here hungry.  They are open 24 hours so come in the wee hours of the morning and you can avoid the wait.    There are 20 seats available and whether you order to go or not you still have to wait in line.  I tried the Palace Pan Roast spice level 6 and Combo Pan Roast spice level 7.  Level 6 spice was good for me, 7 it was manageable.  The Combo was really good and contains all seafood.  The Combo has some meat in it also really good.  The soup base is more tomato and not too creamy.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Located inside Palace Station.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu.

YG-WGOu_HOszMqdSzRWrhA.text: PAN ROAST! PAN ROAST! PAN ROAST!  A friend took us here at 2am (because Vegas never sleeps) for some Pan Roast and we waited maybe 30 minutes tops for the 5 of us to get seated. While we waited, we played some slots. So the wait wasn't that bad, and it was definitely worth it.  Located in the middle of the casino floor at the Palace Station, it's actually set up like a bar. You watch the chef multitask between 6 pots to create his delicious concoctions and his assistants help take your order, buss eating areas, and keep the water coming.  They have 5 different kinds of Pan Roast - shrimp, lobster, crab, combo, and the "Palace". It's ONLY a $3 difference to get shrimp, lobster, AND crab in your Pan Roast. So unless you have an allergy or you hate any of those ingredients, I would recommend either the combo or the "Palace". The "Palace" is basically the combo with added sausage - but same price as the combo. You also need to pick a spicy level that you're comfortable with from 1-10 - they're not kidding about their spice after level 7.  It's served HOT with a helping of rice. You probably won't be able to finish the entire thing unless you're STARVING. But they'll pack it up nice and tight for you to take home when you don't finish it. And it's still amazing the day after out of the microwave. Amazing...  I've never had anything like it, and it might become a regular stop every time I go to Vegas. I just wish they had something like this in SF...

NCCFEWpYILqetpfb4JU8LA.text: Well, it seems I had a different experience than most of the reviewers.   Service: superb, quick, friendly without being chatty.   Drinks: very weak, waste of money.   Oysters: terrible. I was born and raised on Long Island, now live in Florida, was with a woman born in New Orleans and raised on the gulf. While neither of us proclaim to be experts, we've both certainly eaten tons of oysters. The blue points we were served appeared to have been soaked in fresh water. Fine for clams but a disaster for oysters. All the brine was gone, nice fresh oysters tasted of absolutely nothing. Plus the muscle wasn't cut all the way through and no oysters forks were provided. These people know utterly nothing about oysters. Another total waste of money.   "Maryland" crab cakes: Nothing what-so-ever to do with Maryland crab cakes. These are southern style, 90% filler with a few bits of shredded crab. Under cooked and limpy. These people know utterly nothing about crab cakes as well. Another total waste of money.   Shrimp tacos: Do it. Nice flavors, cooked right.   From our experience, the Oyster Bar appears to be a decent Mexican restaurant but a terrible seafood restaurant.

lzAYQTxqyNCB-V-TvbcBFQ.text: Best of the best place ever! I looked forward coming to this place every-time I am in Vegas. They have the best seafood ever. My favorite is the bouillabaisse is just has the perfect soothing for the soul. Only down to this place literally is their wait time.

4gN9IcJHNzMrkfYFEkmpqQ.text: Omg!!! I have been sleeping on this place. Tucked away in Palace station is this place that is literally a bar so be ready to wait a little while because there isn't much seating. We got lucky that there wasn't much of a line but we may have waited about 40 minutes with only 4 people in front of us. But let me tell you! It is so worth the wait! I was hesitant to go because I don't eat seafood but they had chicken gumbo that was beyond delicious! And the portion size is humongous! 3 people can easily share one bowl of gumbo. You also choose your spice level. I did a seven and for someone who likes it really hot, this was REALLY hot! But the flavor was amazing! Next time I'll do a level 4 or 5. The sourdough roll just tops off the experience. I will be back real soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K6uBN0lKoggD0Ja9WZjvKg.text: This is a 24 hour hole in the wall seafood bar located in the Palace Station Casino, though all Station Casinos have one. I was told this one is the best!  This is a small bar with less than 20 seats. They do not take reservations, so you stand in line and when enough seats open up your party can sit down. The chef and bartenders do monitor the line.   There were four people in my party and we all ordered the combination pan roast. When I heard "pan roast" I was not really expecting a soup like entree. It's very similar to a gumbo, but creamy and had lobster, crab and shrimp. White rice served on the side. It was absolutely delicious! The bowl was so big that I couldn't finish it.   Bob, the chef who has worked there for around 20 years prepares everything to order and will ask your spice preference from 1-10. 5 is a good medium!  They offer other selections such as pasta, traditional gumbo and of course oysters.   Because of the limited seating, it gets very busy and can have a long line. We arrived at 10:00AM hoping to avoid a line, no such luck. We still waited about 30 minutes. They say their only slow time is from 2AM-10AM so plan accordingly.   Check out Oyster Bar at Palace Station next time you are in Las Vegas!   Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster Bar menu
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster Bar
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination Pan Roast

mDDgxkBlt6EuHHRgGZlBog.text: The Palace Station Oyster Bar....it's the best...consistent, top quality seafood made to order...right in front of you! My favorite is the House Gumbo...not for the bland, vegan crowd. An in you face,  seafood merger of a velvety dark rue, shrimp, crab, lobster and the  THREE KEY INGREDIENTS....sausage and okra and DRY SPICES.... that produce a flavor that is not found anywhere in the USA. Caution...if you are not a seasoned spice lover, order your gumbo 5 or below. If you are into real HEAT... order 7-10. It's open 7 days...24 hours...Wednesday thru Sunday expect a wait between 10 AM - 1 AM ...1-3 people give you the best chance to be promptly seated. NO MINORS...NO RESERVATIONS. You will be sitting at a 16 seat bar....it's a unique experience, and well worth  it !!!   PS ... The beautiful raw oysters, served on ice with  cocktail sauce and horseradish...don't take a back seat to anyone's!

NJKL2InEX403BBnsqgVaEw.text: Wow!! A long wait, but well worth it!! Alaskan clam chowder and seafood jumbalaya ...so good! Our third attempt to eat here but the lines are always so long...today, we waited it out, about 45 minutes and then another 30 minutes during preparation ...but well worth the wait! It's 24 hours, so maybe will return another time in the wee hours of the night!

omM742-HTlPEIk_ERxEiFw.text: "The strongest of all warriors are these two- Time and Patience." - Leo Tolstoy, War and Peace  To wait in line for Oyster Bar definitely requires a few hours of time and an abundance of patience, but the reward is unreal. My group of six arrived at 5:30 on a Sunday since one of us had been here before and assured us that the food was to die for. We spent an hour in line before being seated in two groups of three at the bar. While we waited we were a little irritated by the cigarette smoke in the casino but found that this line of people were some of the most friendly and veteran that Las Vegas had to offer. Many of the other guests in line had been coming to Oyster Bar for years and were still coming back, so I knew that there must be light at the end of this tunnel!   After being seated, we were given great service by the waitress who was very attentive and made sure we always had full water cups. My friends and I ordered the combo pan roast and I opted for a level 2 spiciness because I'm a wimp. In hindsight, I probably could've gone up to a 4 for a little bit of a kick because at a 2 I didn't notice any heat. The food is made in front of you in a row of kettles and it's neat watching the chef orchestrate the various orders and keep the line moving at a good pace. When our plates finally came out, about an hour after we were seated, it was love at first slurp! There were plenty of chunks of lobster and shrimp and the creamy tomato base has so much flavor. The bowl was huge and I tried my hardest to eat as much as I could of the liquid goodness, but I was left with more than half of my order which I happily packed to go.   In all, I'm so happy to have discovered this place and will definitely be back the next time I'm in Vegas. The time from arrival to departure with my leftovers was 2.5 hours, which seems to be on the faster side than other reviewers but I believe that it's completely worth the wait. So tough it out and with a little patience and you shall be rewarded!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watching our food being prepared
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast, so good!

MZwWsoo9u07jyCLRTxlMgA.text: My wife and I waited 3 hours for this sh*t, and was it the worth the three hour wait?! Hell nah, but it's just one of those places that you gotta knock-off on your list of Vegas eats.   Don't get me wrong, it was good. Their signature pan roast was solid, and it had generous amounts of shrimp, lobster, and crab. It tasted like a more "tomato-y" version of a Tikka Masala. The soup itself is pretty heavy. At times, it feels like you're souping on straight up butter. Expect to KTFO after eating this. The combination gumbo was the highlight for me and just a very well rounded dish. The okra added an element of earthiness to it, and the Andouille sausage enhanced the heat and flavor. It also had plenty of seafood in it. We also tried raw clams on the shell for the first time (besides having it as Mirugai sushi before). However, I had to dose it in cocktail sauce, horseradish, and Tabasco, because it was way too fishy for my enjoyment.   Overall, it was good, but it's crazy that people wait in line for hours for this stuff. I guess that makes us crazy, but I don't think we will put ourselves through getting roasted by that line again for that pan roast. If we're ever up and awake at 2 am on a Tuesday, maybe then we'll decide to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raw clams
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Generous on the seafood
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination gumbo

8Bt6IWemDg_A4Q8PW8mc5w.text: We started waiting at 1pm and took us about 1 hour to get seated.  We observed that there were a couple of people who didn't have to wait at around 2:30 pm.   Just stick to the pan roast. You can just other more rice for $2 per bowl if you want to split . It's difficult to eat the pan roast without cutting it with rice.  Servers are experienced and friendly.

gfulrTKCy49vLsP1XLI8tw.text: We waited 1 hour and 40 minutes on a Sunday around 10pm.   Ordered a Caesar salad to start and then a crab and shrimp roast with noodles and a pan roast combo with rice. Everything was amazing!  Someone told us to share when coming here because portions were huge... didn't believe them and ordered our own anyways. Portions are definitely large and shareable!  This place is soooo worth the wait! Can't stress that enough. We will definitely be back next time we're in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OBzcXvQuW4W_SI6cYaVKvg.text: When in Vegas make sure you visit The Oyster Bar! Hubby's and my trip was all plan because we really wanted to go to Gordon Ramsey's restaurant, but next trip The Oyster Bar will be included as part of it since we found this gem.  We were in Vegas for 3 days and for two of our dinners you could find us at The Oyster Bar. You have read about the line and yes it is real! Our first night going there we waited in line for one hour and the second time we waited for two hours. The bar sits about 20-25 people I believe. It does take same time because every single dish is made to order by their amazing Chef's who are talented and are their own characters. If you get the chance make sure you do say "hi" and talk to the Chef.   What we order: - Pan Roast - Bouillabaisse - Alaskan Clam Chowder  Pan Roast is AMAZING! It's creamy and every single spoon is full of flavor and crab! For spice level we got a 3, which is not that spicy at all, but I eat spicy food all the time. Chef Eze noticed that I can handled spicy so he went ahead and gave me a side of their Lava sauce which is really good and spicy.   Bouillabaisse is, also, really good. Lots of seafood and veggies. Would I get it again? Yes, I would but it would not be my first choice!  Alaskan Clam Chowder!!! Yummsss! This is the best clam chowder hubby and I have ever had. He said that he even liked it more than the Pan Roast.   All in all, if you are going to Vegas the same way you have to visit the strip, it's the same way you HAVE TO visit The Oyster Bar. Just make sure you plan accordingly for the 1-2 hour wait in a standing line and you're good. There is machines around so if you go with someone take turns and go play.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouillabaisse (Spice Level 3)
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam Chowder
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast (Spice Level 3)

SumOvDJIZf8zXqEC_7uIqQ.text: Such a good seafood spot. Not sure it's worth the Huge Lines. Like 3 hrs long. Food is a 5 but the wait time is a 1 star.

-Nh9gqD-rAGOXtxvr9xKDQ.text: Although Palace Station is a little bit far from the strip, several friends had raved about The Oyster Bar inside the casino. With 2,000+ yelp reviews we just had to check it out. Even at 4am the bar was packed with hungry patrons, and the whole casino floor filled with the smell of gumbo and jambalaya. We ordered the mixed pan roast and loved every bite of it! At $24 a bowl I'd say it's the best bang for your buck as long as you like a variety of seafood. We also ordered the fresh oysters on a half shell, which they have shipped in from Louisiana! They were very fresh and delicious. I will definitely be coming back here the next time I'm in town!  -1 star because the guy working there was rude to our friend, and gave us an extra bowl of rice and CHARGED us $4 for it, even though we didn't order it!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The crab pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

De8uacU_3q3m7-MMbCA1aQ.text: Oyster bar is famous and because of how popular it is, be prepared to wait. We came at the worst time possible, on a Saturday night around 730. It's open 24 hr so plan accordingly and don't make my mistake.   After a pain staking 3 hours in a smokey hotel casino, we got seated at the 18 seat oyster bar. At this point, I was hangry, sleepy and pretty over it. But as I sat there, stuffing my face with bread and butter and drinking my ice cold Pepsi, the smell of the food lifted my spirits.   We started with oysters, which were a pretty good size. I watched as the chef stirred my pan roast and chowder and started drooling. My bf and I ordered the combo pan roast and the Alaskan chowder dirty style. First bite of steaming hot chowder and all my frustrations washed away. It was f**king amazing!!   The chowder was filled with seafood and two pieces of beautifully cooked lobster. Dirty style is the way to goo!! The combo pan roast was delicious!! We savored each bite, while dipping our bread and finished the entire bowl.   A lot of people took theirs to go, because honestly it's a large portion, but we didn't have a microwave in our room so we finished it.   Yes, the wait is long but was it worth it? Hell to the f**cking yeassss

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty chowder
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 dozen oysters

NazXfiZXtzvrsf2mQ_J4yQ.text: I was introduced to this place a year ago and wow. After trying this everywhere else in SoCal...I'll have to say that they have the best pan roast and bouillabaisse I've ever had. (Also another thing to note is that I'm not a huge fan of oysters but they have a pretty nice deal for oysters so you should most definitely check them out if you love oysters I guess.)  I just haven't had a place in SoCal that compares to this place. I've searched and they don't have the flavors that compare to Las Vegas. There were places that came pretty close but it's just never good enough. This is located in Palace Station and it's open late. I was surprised to see that there was a line just for this place. (It's located inside the casino.) There isn't a lot of seating but I feel that's what makes this place so desirable. The wait is worth it. I would say there's about roughly 15 chairs? They have just stools and you sit around the chefs like you're at a bar. You can watch them prepare your food so that's always entertaining.  Overall it was a great experience. I enjoy this place a lot and I'm glad I was introduced.  TL;DR Pan roast was my favorite. Bouillabaisse is good. Great oyster deals.

vl6IczE7q_8Hw8ByoXjomQ.text: The best oyster bar in Las Vegas hands down.  Everything on the menu is delicious but the pan roast is my favorite. The only downfall is the wait. I'd say the average wait time is about an hour.  Other than that, no complaints

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouillabaisse
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh oysters

Ab21vBFi4fQ5LeRuAjHx6A.text: My wife and I waited about two hours to get seats at The Oyster Bar after hearing such high praises about the food. We had Oysters and the Combo Pan Roast. The oysters were good: large and meaty and paired well with the bar's cocktail and horseradish sauce. The Combo Pan Roast is the bar's specialty; this is a rich creamy flavorful stew filled with fresh and tender shrimp, crab, and lobster. The optional spiciness of the stew makes the dish even better. Overall, good food but I probably wouldn't wait 2 hours for a seat.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast (Shrimp, Crab, and Lobster)

DqWq2-V8gDq6zGcMp6dl2w.text: Want the best clam chowder and pot roast in Vegas??! Then, look no further! This place has about 10 seats inside the casino so we had to wait about an hour to be seated, but it's worth the wait! They use kettlepots to cook all their dishes, right in front of you. Fresh seafood, happy staff, beer and great service. This is a must stop for me on my way back home from Sin City. Go eat here and thank me later!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam chowder $24.99

zkH4ylIyunyTtHWSQB8x9A.text: I cannot get enough of this place!! I come here every month and recommend ALL of my family and friends. Today was Nora, Heather, Eze and Ramon, I have to say as a local Nevadain, as silly as it may sound there has never been a time where we came and didn't know someone in line for the 2hr wait whether it be from CA or NV... The Oyster Bar on Sahara, Most definitely is the best!! We have what 4 in Nevada? But none compare to this location! Please come and see only The Best with Nora, Heather and Eze!! The best service in Nevada for goodSea Food!

yC947Hf0ZoAPp3M5bVByzQ.text: I was taking my seafood-loving family to Vegas for the first time, and The Oyster Bar was on the list. The verdict? The food and service were good, but the wait was horrible.   We got in line around 10:30 or so on a Tuesday morning. The reality didn't sink in for me from reading the reviews until I got there. There are ONLY around 20 seats at the bar. That means two families of four (8), two groups of 3 friends (6), and 3 couples (6) would make up a full bar. Plus, people are not there to eat and go; they enjoy food and that takes time. There were around 3 groups ahead of us, but it took over 1.5-2 hours for us to finally sit down at the bar.  Tip: If the line goes past the first slot machine around the corner, you're waiting 2 hours or more. TIP: Do not come here hungry.  - Oysters on the Half Shell - 4/5 - This was good. However, after waiting for so long, I just wanted warm food at this point, so it didn't hit the spot for me.  - Bouillabaisse - 5/5 - This seafood stew was a favorite. The flavor was just right and the stew was perfect over rice. There were big pieces of shrimp, crab, lobster, cod, mussels, and clams to enjoy.  - Cajun Bbq Peel & Eat Shrimp - 5/5 - Definitely get this if you're here. The shrimps were big and tasty. The sauce that it comes with is amazing with rice.   Overall, the food was good, but it's not worth the wait. I could have spent that time showing my family around Vegas instead. There are many other restaurants where you can get comparable food with a shorter wait time.  Edit: It would be great if they can open a restaurant! More people would love to enjoy their food and the wait would hopefully be shortened.

QGpfmHKKv4OEyJCEkwI9kg.text: Delicious! A friend recommended this place to us and said it was the best gumbo and they did not disappoint. The place is located inside Palace Station Hotel and it's literally a bar with about 15 seats at the most? The cook the food right in front of you and the service is fast and friendly. We had the oysters and gumbo. The oysters were the best I've ever had and tasted super fresh. The gumbo was amazing. It's big enough for two to eat and was filled with tons of seafood.  We were lucky enough to not have to wait long but when we left there was about 10 people in line. I recommend going during non busy hours. Definitely a must try!

1KVlhEEnLt4q2hZsnFvIiw.text: I weigh my five stars heavily. And this is one of the few that I think that fully deserves it. From everything including service, food, and atmosphere, I have no doubt in my mind it is a place that I will remember and revisit whenever I can.  The day I went was in New Year's Eve, about two hours before the ball dropped, so there wasn't much of a line. I've heard an excess of 2.5 hours worth of wait was normal, but we waited at most an hour and fifteen minutes. Time also flew by in the presence of great company.  Now on to the food. Like with most southern cuisines, bread and butter as an appetizer was complimentary. It had a sourdough-like flavor to it, which wouldn't have been my first choice of favorite breads, but I can tell it was well made.   My party started with two oysters a person. It was one of the most neutral variants I've tasted in oysters. No metallic or brined taste. Just plump and fresh, served with a generous helping of horseradish, cocktail sauce, and lemons. If so desired, Tabasco and other spices are available.  Next, we had the littleneck clams, steamed in a wonderful buttery white wine sauce, and lightly aromatized with herbal flavors, which really brought the starter off to another level. Save some bread and dip it in there if you're getting this dish.   And for the main course: the bouill-roast. With most roasts or stews, flavors are usually dominated by the spices and the weight of the soup. However, for Oyster Bar's take on the dish, each ingredient can be differentiated easily. On the nose, it had an overwhelming sweet seafood flavor, so good that I didn't want to forget it. The crab had a fresh floral sweet flavor, one that honestly I do not think can be easily surpassed. Each protein was perfectly timed in the roast. The lobster, shrimp, crab, and fish had perfect mouth feel - soft enough where it was easy to eat, and hard enough that you can appreciate each nerve ending on all your teeth that contact the food. Where ribs are judged by how well they fall off the bone, this dish was like everything just fell off the shell.   Serious perfection. If you're ever in the area, you have to try it. Even if it was a three hour wait for me, I would say it would be worth it, and I would maybe only say that for a handful of the hundreds of places I've tried around the world.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouill-Roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Littleneck clams
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen Louisiana gulf oysters

kdecYoTrpToCsqa4tt0TJg.text: Even though we have multiple restaurants in Orange County similar to The Oyster Bar, I wanted to check out the original place that started the hype over pan roast.  I arrived at 11:30AM on a Monday morning and waited about 5 minutes to be seated. Ordered the house pan roast with a dozen oysters. The pan roast was delicious, but I wish I had opted to add sausage since the lobster got a little overwhelming for me. The oysters were fresh and huge, but lacked flavor so I would recommend trying half a dozen first to see if you like it.   Overall good place to eat, but I wouldn't wait any more than 20 minutes.

DFo5iWcVd_PmGd6s3sQ7ew.text: For an "oyster bar" they only have 1 selection of oysters at a time. Not really what you expect when you see "oyster bar." Other than that definitely get the pan roast! They definitely give you a lot of meat. You will not be disappointed. Try and go during off hours because you will be waiting. There is very limited seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters

88CRzx9zGfAPtz5690Xorw.text: All you need to know is that we ate here TWICE in the 4 days we were in Vegas.  With all the options to choose from, why would we repeat a restaurant?  Because It's that good.   Things you should know: there's always a wait. Doesn't matter if it's 5am or 11pm or anything in between.  If you happen to roll in as a single, you might get lucky, but we waited about 1 hour and 10 min.    We've been here 3 times before, and I've only ever ordered 1 thing. If it ain't broke, let's not fix it, so I order the same thing again. Bouill-Roast.  It's a mix between a bouillabaisse and a pan roast. It has almost every seafood you can think of--lobster, shrimp, mussels, clams, and fish. It's a great item to get if you don't know what you want because it has so many different types of seafood. I'll even add some sausage to kick it up another notch.   For my 2nd time here I changed it up and got some oysters to start and a pan roast with just lobster (and  added sausage again).   This place is open 24 hours and located inside the Palace Station casino, which is also awesome.   If you try this place and don't like it, you probably did a something wrong.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IfAgMS2w7c0YJq-0Xgcv5A.text: Came here for oysters and the oysters were pretty bad. I felt like they washed the oysters in tap water before serving them or something because the oysters have no natural taste to them. They tasted like tap water.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mQGOfbWSRRn1M5IUQROYtQ.text: Stayed in the Palace Station for EDC and had to make a stop at the legendary Oyster Bar. Stood in line in the casino a whole hour and a half to try this place. Worth it? Maybe, maybe not. The oyster bar is an actual a bar with bar seating, not a restaurant. That's why there's always a long line because you're just waiting for someone to give up their seat. I felt like this place was a little understaffed and they could've used one more person.  I ordered the half dozen gold band oysters and the combo pan roast. I was told by our server that the oysters came from Louisiana. They were pretty huge and meaty, but I thought they tasted really fishy and weren't the best (and I've tried many). I shared the pan roast with my friend and it was enough to feed 2 petite girls. We ordered level 5 spicy (scale of 1-10) and the heat was right in the middle. This comes with a small bowl of rice and it was very flavorful and filling, but I thought it was a bit watery and not as creamy as I would've liked. I overheard someone next to us order another bowl of rice for $2.99. They are going to charge that much for an extra bowl of rice?! Get out of here, rice doesn't cost much. Besides all that I had mentioned, the staff was very friendly and service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Level 5 combo pan roast served with a a bowl of rice
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 dozen giant gold band Louisiana oysters

BqKY-fPWQhpFqra-OJyprg.text: I don't know how many times I've heard from friends or friends of friends about this place and I've never tried it out. As many times as I've been to Vegas. So glad we did!   Wait time: Although the wait was approximately 1 hour 20 minutes (we got in line at the ATM machine for those that want a marker of where we started), it was worth the wait. Even my mom, who hates to wait, was impressed by the food and said the wait was worth it. Wait depends on the sizes of the parties. You can't tell because most people leave to gamble while one person in the party waits in line. They will take you by the order you are in line. Even for take out, you must stand in line. Even if there's a couple empty seats, they try to wait it out for the next party to be able to fit.   Combo pan roast: Definitely recommended! Thick creamy soup type dish with shrimp, real crab meat, and lobster similar to etouffee. Eat it with rice. If you saved your bread roll (hard to save when you're hungry and been waiting for a while), you can eat with this soup. Spiciness can range from 1 to 10. We got 5 and 7. Major difference in spiciness. 7 was pretty spicy and I can take the heat. 5 was very mild for me. My husband got a 5 and took some from my bowl because the spicy flavor made it tastier. Bowls come big. Share if you're not that hungry or don't eat much.   Oysters: Fresh and big! So delicious! We got half a dozen but I wanted more.   Oyster shooter with vodka: Whoa! When in Vegas... this was serious alcohol. I couldn't take it in one shot because they filled a large shot glass. I would try it with tequila next time.   Customer service: Everyone was so polite and helpful! They are busy, but they're willing to help when you ask. The main chef is busy but was willing to photo bomb a couple taking pics. Ha!

ZE4Bl_F5vlOP8n_btCz6RQ.text: Talking 'bout flavortown! This is it! Got the lobster pan roast level 8 and it was perfect heat. Oysters were huge, nothing like I've ever had before. Fresh and juicy. With a dab of lemon and pepper. That's how you get down baby!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pan Roast

oMtzJIvpuG6nBnuUzS1GjA.text: Amazing food and super nice and attentive staff.  You will have to stand in line and wait a little. But I assure you it is worth the wait.

A_2neOrJbiMPuwDzmHfYDw.text: The three times I've been here, I didn't have to wait long.  THANK GOODNESS.  I think the longest I've waited was 40 mins.    Food is excellent!  Their pan roast is top notch.  I've tried the combo and all crab meat.  I love that you can set how spicy you want it.  At first my husband I split one but the next couple of times we ended up ordering our own and saving the rest for later. I think the portion is pretty large.  Maybe others might not feel the same.
