Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. shooters

aqTAvtKcVQ5CcoOQa5p77Q.text: Food is 5-stars. As has been mentioned myriad times, seating is limited, lines can be long, but it is totally worth it.   My wife and I split the lump crab cocktail and the Palace Pan Roast and loved it. Just fantastic flavors, lots of proteins, and the pan roast is more than enough for two.  We left at 2am midweek and there was still a line!

ERNWQmIYhEXdVPXdm9BU2A.text: 5pm, 4am, 6am, 12pm,.. No matter what time you go there will be a wait. Extremely limited seating. First time I had it, it honestly was not that great. However the next couple of times, I'm definitely hooked on the pan roast. Another dish I recommend is the linguine with clams. It's light yet flavorful. Portions are pretty large so you can share among a few people.

l9jn1_u_Ow2B_6H9FHaXSQ.text: The wait is the only bad part.  It's literally a 12-14 person seating area.  The food was really delicious.  Oysters were fresh!  We had about two dozen.  Got the Combo Pan- Roast, and you get to pick your level of spice 1-10 (I chose 6 for a little zing but still not that brave).  The Combo Pan Roast was pretty good with rice but better with the linguini pasta.

h6gvHyd4K0ozOa3ENtADjw.text: Pan Roast combo 5/5  Oysters on half shell 5/5 Price is on the higher side but you pay for what you get.  Wait time is long but worth the wait. Don't come here if you're starving. Expect to wait minimum of 1 - 2 hours.  Overall, must try if you never had before.

KAteBWBxrHWI6rtF0iKylw.text: **Disclaimer: I don't eat seafood so my review is based on the non-seafood items**  Prepare to spend a good chunk of your life waiting to be seated here. I didn't mind too much as I had friends waiting in line as I played Wheel of Fortune. This place really is a "bar" so there are only about 20-25 seats, thus the wait.   Everything is made to order right in front of you. My personal favorite is the pan roast which is tomato and cream based. You choose the level of spiciness from 1-10. They throw in habanero peppers if you order a 9 or 10. I had a taste of my friend's New England clam chowder (chowder part only) and it was pretty tasty.  Aside from the occasional ridiculous wait time, this place is definitely worth trying at least once.

1QYqeEBJupXmjZFF1IdZMQ.text: I would give this place a 4.5 stars if they have good oyster since this place is an oysters bar. However we ordered a dozen of oysters ,after first taste, I regret that I did order that much. The oysters are NOT tasty at all, no favor that I had to add a lot of sauces into it and still don't taste good. I love oysters and had try many places and this is one of the worst oysters I ever have. I don't think this is ocean oysters. We also ordered the steam muscle and the sea food compo are very delicious. Definitely will not order oysters here again.

qfkJn1YQDjMkVqvOKW0p1A.text: First of all let me tell you all..... I rarely like to spend money on myself eating out. RARELY  But, I saw the reviews and I was already staying here at The Palace Station... So Why Not?!?  ALWAYS a line. The night before, I got back at 2:30am and I was like, 'What are these people waiting for?!?'...... It was Tuesday BTW  One Yelp review wrote PAN ROAST in Caps like 72 times so I pretty much had my mind made up.  Only 6 people in front of me..... 1 Hour Wait... I NEVER wait... but I had some drink and I was good and the two couples in front of me chatted it up, which added to the experience.  We are all waiting, and one of the bfs isn't impressed and the other couple, it's their first time. So a lot of bantering and foreplay for lack of a better word. Anticipation, works better I guess. lol   Listen, I've been to Vegas at least a dozen times. I've always wanted to find a goto place. I've always wanted to say, 'I've got to go here before I leave!!!'....  Well. This is it.  Let me ask you... Pan Roast. What does that sound like? It sounds like someone trying to make a pot roast in a pan... :D  And maybe that's part of the draw. Because what I had, the pan roast with all seafood, was anything but a 'pan roast'...  It looked like a soup. It played the part of a gumbo. It was Cambpell's in a bowl...  But...  Have you ever seen a car on the road and think... how is it running?!?  Seen a guy and think, how does he have that girl?!?  Talked to someone really stupid and think, how did they make it this far in life?!?  That's what happens when you try the 'Pan Roast'.   You assume (Spoiler Alert WAY Late) it's going to be a soupy, seafood, gumbo, but it's something WAY more,  It's a blend. A blend that says, 'Will you marry me?'   And after a couple of bites, you're like 'Hell Yeah!'  'Pre-Nup?', 'Where do I sign???'  Seriously.  Next time in Vegas, I'll be looking for the one that got away.   The infamous 'Pan Roast' beauty I only met at The Oyster Bar. Sorry slots. strip clubs, ubers, and gambling... I have more important things to spend money on. heartemojihere  Hashtag True Love

-2nVRJzlc91BheC7wUAd_A.text: The worst service I ever had with my girlfriend They squirted water on me twice at first I let it slide then the second time was most definitely for sure on purpose I asked the guy about it he said it was for show. They embarrassed me and my friend mostly my friend we were two young looking women just trying to have a good time while they were looking at us looking bomb af.  The worst service congrats  Very critical people thanks a lot Wtf was your guys problem why the fuck were you hating wtf was up w that you have no reason to treat people in that way

Q05NQMIobRk7qmB77sstZw.text: Came Here in the early morning hours on 1/23/19 we arrived around 2am and it was very busy, As you walk up they have everything on the bar so you can watch them cook your food, the menu is very simple, everything from oysters to salad to pasta. I ordered a Caesar salad and the shrimp scampi with white sauce and it was absolutely amazing, the waitress was very nice and made sure we were well taken care of. The food and service was amazing I would definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ENqHJCLRgFiq8qOt_QEHtg.text: Still my number 1 stop in Vegas.  Tonight was different through. Sat next to some people that heard about this place in China and came here. I helped them order what's best on the menu then another person (also from China) came and asked me if they can take raw oysters Togo.  The answer is no - not in Vegas -- can't take raw food Togo.   They asked me to call another store and see if other store would sell it.   A rude guy ( think he is the know it all ) decided to say something rude to the us.  Can't believe how people lack matters these days.   The Ora of the story is "everyone shall respect each other's time when it come to "The Oyster Bar," it's not a place where you can rush people, clients or staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rude Guy at the bar

3j8qXL7_f0DYE-yKJI8f0w.text: It's not worth the wait. Oyster bar is kind of a misnomer since they only have one type of oyster on the menu. The pan roast is great but it's really not worth an hour. There's great food in china town that won't force you to stand in line for a few hours without so much as a drink service from the cocktail waitress or the courtesy to join 2019 and let you hold your place in line with yelp. But really the most frustrating thing is the groups of 5 or 6 people that show up and make every solo person and couple wait frustratingly long amounts of time so that all those seats next to each other can be available. Vegas is a 24 hr town, there are other options at 3am. And there's absolutely no reason to go here during normal dining hours instead of some of the seafood places on the strip.

JPHhacvtrJlnbUJXPUN-tA.text: Even if I lived In Vegas I could eat here every night. Seating is VERY limited. But I will for sure tell u the wait is WORTH IT!!!!But there are days when u could even get lucky and not have to wait that long.Everything is prepared right in front of u so u know everything is all made fresh to order. If there is ever any place I refer my friends to go and try I ALWAYS tell them PALACE STATION OYSTER BAR IS A MUST!!!! And let me tell u the smart ones who listened are also in love with this place now. Awesome customer service as well!!!!! Chiefs are hilarious too

D1Fj_JtIkSaWlrwX7otgMA.text: We had a dozen of oysters. They were bug and SO fresh. I typically cannot have bug oysters but they were literally melting in my mouth. The oysters that they had that way were great batch. So if yours wasn't that great, sorry! Try going during off hours like around 2pm that when the line dies down. Also you must get their pan roast. It's a lot so my BF and I ordered a dozen of oyster and one panroast. That was enough for us. Great for hangovers! Haha

zvh1PdH9RgpgTRVgF0vrqA.text: Clam chowder is so good. Good up there with Dukes Chowder house. WARNING: lines can be long and a wait will prob be most likely as their seating is limited. The shrimp cocktail is so meaty. We also tried the ouster shooters i feel like isnt that great compared to Elliots oyster house. Overall good experience.  Located inside the Palace Station.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GthYSg_SI17_8bIjTPcijA.text: Worth the wait !!!! WOWWWWWW . Waited 1.5 hours at 1:30am on Monday night . So glad we didn't regret it . Anyways , I don't like my food TOO spicy , but I got a level 2 of the pan roast - not spicy at all . Level 5 is perfect !  The bbq shrimp has the BEST broth and flavor - even better than the combo pan roast - it's VERY GOOD ! Order it "soupy" = extra broth  Totally underrated . It's absolutely amazing .  The combo pan roast is a tomato cream base - so if that's not your thing , don't bother because you can definitely taste the tomato .  Without enough spice it favors a rich bisque .   There is a cook there "mr brown" - everyone says he's the best at cooking and seasoning .  Go , enjoy the experience . It's great

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. so damn good. ORDER IT &#34;SOUPY&#34; for more broth! Otherwise you&#39;ll hardly get any-  Cajun Bbq Peel &amp; Eat Shrimp

izLBwvFlpg4W8p8HrRfxFg.text: STAFF WAS EXTREMELY RUDE! Never eating here again!!!!!!!!  I was excited to try this place especially since there were sooooo many good reviews. My girl friend and I came from out of town and we waited 2 hours in line to eat here. It was about 1 am when we got seated. I told her it would be worth it.  I don't know if staff was in a horrible mood or maybe they were discriminating us for being young but they treated us with horrible customer service. We were the only two young girls in the restaurant. Everyone else seating next to us were an older crowd.  The lady the waitress Embarrassed me in front of all the customers sitting next to me with rude comments and harassing me and laughing making me feel like I wasn't good enough to eat at that restaurant. I eventually ordered clam chowder and a half dozen oysters and lastly an entree but they were cooking other customers who ordered after us before ours. You can clearly see who orders and see the cook make the food in front of you.   Before we even finished our clam chowder the second waitress with the glasses didn't ask if we were finished she just took our plate didn't make eye contact or ask anything if we needed anything else or if we would like to finish it. It was pretty rude since there was still half a bowl full left but We didn't mind because we had an entree coming up.   We were waiting 30 minutes for the rest of our food and during that time the cook TWICE sprayed water with the sink onto my friend getting all her clothes face and food wet (our bread that we were snacking on) We didn't complain the first time we simply moved our seats to the left and thought it was on accident but the second time we told him the issue of him wetting us again and he replied "it's for the show" everyone was laughing again. We were in shock with that reply and very embarrassed. UNACCEPTABLE. RUDE.   We left and gave ZERO tip. Horrible customer service. I've never had horrible customer service like this ever to write a review on yelp. I'm still unhappy being treated this way. The food may have been great but all the staff were rude and this is truly unacceptable behavior. Me and my friend are two young girls trying to eat and have a good time in Vegas and they ruined our experience here. This issue definitely needs to be brought up and some sort of training about customer service needs to be placed.  I would give 1 star but the clam chowder (from what I was able to eat) was pretty good. They ruined our appetite and didn't even consider eating the entree.

_oGzuNlf8GZLfNdlB-WLzQ.text: This place was fire yeah the wait sucked but I have waited longer for rollercoaster rides. I don't mind waiting for good food and the food was great. I had half dozen of Oyster those were probably some of the freshest oysters I ever had. Then I had the BBQ Shrimp Nawlin Style amazing the broth was something else take your bread and dip it in the broth Sheesh something else I tell you it was delicious. I ended my meal with the Combination Pan Roast and it was so delicious one of the best things I've ever ate.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Oyster Bar view from the line...
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half Dozen Oysters...
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Shrimp with Rice. I had my rice on the side...

gzehijDvVvl1wF-i3uoI9Q.text: Let me just start with, the 2 hour wait is worth it!!!   I tried the following (ordered from most favorite):  Dirty Alaskan Clam Chowder $24.99 - THE BEST CLAM CHOWDER I EVER HAD IN MY LIFE.  Worth every penny!  It was filled with seafood. It was very very satisfying.  I'm ready for more.  This was my first time coming here so I wasn't sure how their spicy level works.  I got level 4 supposedly it's a medium but I thought it was pretty mild.  Definitely can handle a higher level.    Lobster Pan Roast $24.99 - This was pretty good as well.  There were big pieces of lobsters.  My sister got a level 8.  At first, it wasn't spicy and then after, it had a nice kick to it.    Oysters (price varies) - We order two dozen.  Came out to be about $50.  I didn't taste as fresh and good as I thought it was going to be but it was decent.    I'm ready to go back to Vegas for some more clam chowder!

0KWXiBU_vZS8dR-qi4kmYA.text: Went there the night before at 6 and the wait was about 1.5 hours...decided to visit again in the morning and it turned out to be a good decision. Took advantage of the $1 a piece oyster like everyone else did, and ordered the house pan roast with rice. IT was fresh and thick with decent amount of seafood. This has become my go to place for future Vegas visits! The small bar (yes, it's technically a bar, not a restaurant) has only 20 seats but it allows customers and chef/waiter to interact intimately. I enjoy watching the food being cooked in front of me in the six pans and 2 steamers.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A dozen half shell oysters
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast with rice

JfMeS86NWMfHPgN0hudKhQ.text: Staying in the hotel, we passed by this place a few times on the casino floor wondering why this little 10 seat spot had such a long line.  We soon discovered why: it is absolutely delicious! The oysters are huge and have the cleanest taste of any place I've ever visited, edging out my favorite place in Myrtle Beach. On top of that they are $1 per in the mornings, which would make you say "who eats oysters in the morning?". I can gladly raise both my hands to this.  The pan roasts are the go-to here, and I would suggest getting extra items if you can, with emphasis on the shrimp and maybe crab (if they have the legs and not just the meat). The oyster shooters are an option too and they are straight to the point. They have a spice level but it's scaled depending on who's cooking, not by a measurement.  It never gets out of hand that you can't eat anything though, so if you like spice don't be scared!  Anticipate a wait if you come outside of late night/breakfast hours.  Worth every penny!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fydbLcbjbZJ3NTG8IlmQTA.text: The Combo Pan Roast here is to die for! Hubby & I come here almost every time we're in Sin City. The long wait is definitely well worth it for your hungry bellies. Their flavors are just a big 'ol party in your mouth. Can't wait to get there tonight and dive in!  Keep in mind, you need to be 21+ to eat here. It is an actual bar.

-dhds3s14OzaXKdLiWjMMw.text: Prices are quite on the higher end and most dishes are cream based. This looks like a regular mall food court place until you taste their food! It is quite good albeit very rich. Serving is definitely generous. On the not so ok aspect, seating is very limited and you have to wait an hour or so to order. Since it has seating only for a dozen people, you feel rushed and stressed and those waiting are just right behind you!  Its definitely one of those food stops you must try at least once to say you've been there and tried it- bring crackers though cuz it will be quite a while before you dine (regardless of what time you arrive, there will always be a line).

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JhxdtqAyEflyLX_6mwT_kg.text: I have PTSD from this place. PTSD from waiting 2-3 hours. Yes, I ACTUALLY stayed and waited that long for my first time at 10pm. Yes, there was a line at 10pm That was probably 4 years ago. Since then, I've learned my lesson. Don't go at prime hours like dinner time on a Saturday. Go during Monday mornings, after a drunken night at 5am, etc etc. Or send your bf to get you take out while you lay in bed. Don't let that little line fool you. They move awfully slow because there's only 15 seats and they make the panroasts fresh, right in front of your eyes.   Now, was this possible 2-3 hour wait worth it? hellllllllllllyaaaaaaa. Would I wait again? no because now I know better! Ok, i love this place I really do. Getting on to the food. This is a place where I send everyone to go when you come to town asking for good eats. This place is a gd institution. Of course, get the panroast. My friend who is a particularly picky/anti seafood eater actually liked the combo panroast. Portion is large and easily enough for 2 small people or a pig (like me). I've tried panroast at different places in vegas and in cali and it's just never as good as palace station. Oysters are fresh and big. It's good but not the best. I wouldn't wait in line for the oysters.  Anyways, believe the hype and get ready w a drink in hand while waiting.

hJqxj-W1DiuDZA1tlB7F2Q.text: Dude. First time here and this was one of the best meals I have ever had in my life. The pan roast is out of this world. I do NOT give out 5 star reviews easily. Something really has to blow me away to give a fiver out. From the moment we sat down, the bartender/cook/waiter guy was awesome and super friendly and the meal to follow this interaction was beautiful.  I got the pan roast at a 7 heat and it was like heaven. There is a rich, full, passionate flavor here that you just don't come across very often. I mean every bite was a journey into the uncharted depths of flavor town. I've had pan roasts before a few times in my life and this felt like a completely different meal.   The wife had the chicken gumbo and it felt like we were right back in New Orleans. A solid 4/5 there.  Shrimp cocktail was amazingly fresh and delicious also.   Beer was ice cold, food was dumb good, service was awesome.   The ONLY downside may be the wait, but whatever, it was worth it. Play some slots and have a cocktail while you wait and thank me later.   This is a definite stop when I come to Vegas from now on.   Keep up the great work guys

dVD7DlxL4ah7vVE_IAHeaw.text: Came here for dinner around 6:30-7 pm and got seated around 9 pm. I would have been so disappointed if we waited this long in line and the food didn't turn out good. Good thing that wasn't the case! My friend and I ordered their famous combo Panroast, a Caesar Salad, and a clam chowder to share.  I didn't really care for their Caesar salad, it could have been better. However, the combo pan roast was delicious! I would come back here again, but I wouldn't wait any longer than an hour for it.

b4qvhPNFQv43i_sc3U9xjw.text: The wait was about 35 minutes. My first experience I can say  was alright ... I had the combo bowl which included a slight portion of lobster (2 small pieces ) for @$26. I will not order that in the future... I did try the Boston clam chowder and had 6 oysters that were delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TKsa8WC5XLIc6zp6KccCAA.text: Every Time I come there is a wait or at least 30 min, is expected to wait to be seated. Our server was a bit rude especially the part what they ask how spicy fr 1-10 she gave us a snark response about how spicy 4 is, which is between 3 and 5. If you don't like spicy get zero. If you like spicy but not burning my mouth spicy get it at a 2 maybe at 3. The clam chowder wasn't anything to rave about but it was good. The chef knows his craft, the food was presented beautifully. I would definitely recommend just don't try to order too spicy because you will find it inedible.

deT3wYgRYuI1YNLnlI0pHQ.text: The Oyster Bar was delicious. First off let me say that the wait for this delishishness is usually per the locals 1.5-2 hours. We scored and got a seat in about 40 minutes. It was worth the wait.  We got the pan roast. Can I say amazing!!! Seafood was fresh and there was plenty of it.  We will be back again.

Q_OgCXPdJXwHXjL1t9nQEQ.text: Believe the hype! It's real!  Yes the place only has like 13 seats, and yes your wait may be over an hour, but do it! You won't be sorry. My god, the pan roasts are mouthwatering good. I've gone twice and both times my group and I had to stand in line for a long time, but we left full and very happy.  The boulli-roast and the pan roasts are very good. I do like the boulli-roast better than the pan roast, but not by much. Creamy seafood goodness! I'm drooling just thinking about it.   The staff there are so friendly and funny. They chat with you and joke with you while you enjoy your meal.   These people know their seafood. You won't regret spending all that time staring at the slot machines in line.   Tip #1: Share if you have a small appetite. The bowls are HUGE! and you will probably take home the rest.   Tip #2 Don't waste your time on appetizers. Your entree will be big enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouill-roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast

jNj6VF24N3tUKhlf9nkTmA.text: Oyster bar is amazing if you don't mind waiting an hour or more to get seated. Every time we come here there's a wait. I truly hope they change the rules and restrict large parties to sit together. Four or five should be tops. I mean come on! You're sitting at a bar how far away can you be from your friends or family members.  -__-   Anyways, food is great. I always get the Pan roast w/ extra green onion, rice on the side, spicy level 7. Be careful it's spicy.  Boyfriend loves the Bulabaise with okra, spicy level 7.   Love this place but not the wait, that is the reason why I cannot give them 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast and Bouillabaisse.

mh9_GIft6PWCRIV-smFJzQ.text: Wow!  Great food,  great service,  open late night!   Just came after clubbing at Omnia and was looking forward to some good grub , and minimal wait at 4:30am  Complimentary bread -soft,  fresh,  absorbed the butter well  Happy hour oysters -available from 1am to 9am, $10 for 6 -big, fresh and tasty . I'm not even a raw oyster fan but these were delicious! Ate note than I expected to.  The combo horseradish and cocktail sauce  and lemon complimented the oysters perfectly  Pan roast combination -freshly made and individualized upon your order in front of you.   It was loaded with crab , lobster and shrimp.  The creamy tomato base went so well with the white rice,  it was the prefect starch to bring out the flavor of the broth.   This was definitely the star of the show . I highly recommend this dish and would definitely come back here again one day!   Service was very friendly and the atmosphere was intimate due to limited bar style seating and seeing the cook  Definitely worth a try during non-peak hours and I plan to return one day

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination pan roast,  rice was on the side,  delicious!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour oysters,  huge!

kfaAQuxZjL-1QoPCEwIfmw.text: They have the best soup I've tasted before,  definitely I'll be back soon. I recommended this place.

5FybNz5xOLkuBoiMe4ZOBA.text: Best place to eat in Vegas.  Who would think Vegas would have awesome Gumbo and I'm from Louisiana top notch.  Even the other dishes.  Be prepared to wait only a bar but amazing

JQ-hjNS8Z-EMnhc0OrqSnA.text: Soooooo....that was REdiculous!  Best meal I've had since I've moved back to Las Vegas.  Eze (eazy-e) is an awesome chef and we were lucky he was there cook for us!  And he's funny as hell, too.  Roommates brought me here and I'm glad they did.  The oysters were Blue Points and tasted day-boat fresh!  Cocktail and horsey sauce were on point, too.  Wish they had a champagne mignonette tho.  The jambalaya was fire!   And I'm really happy I got the add-on Okra with it.  All-in-all, awesome experience.  Gonna try the pan roast next time.

iLf-EfdCczZkfKexa81oTA.text: Extremely bad waiter Albert, super rude. I ask 4 lobster pan roast to go and he told me no with a attitude, told me bob had to ok it, but he was sure that bob would not ok it. I told him to ask anyways. I  been here many many times and ordered to go never had a problem. I understand they can have their rules but the way he delivered it was not acceptable.  He came back later told me it was ok, but he was just doing me a favor. Took my order and got my first order wrong, insisted that I told him the wrong thing. I told him lobster pan roast and he put lobster gumbo. He then yelled at me and said it was not his fault if it came out wrong. At that point I told him to stop!  I'm paying 30 each, u are not doing me a favor. I don't understand why he had a right to make me feel like I'm at a welfare line. Not coming back ever!

n7lltfJT61Lgfp3FVD686w.text: Okay, so I waited almost two hours to eat here. And I will loyally do it again every time I come to Vegas for the rest of my life. I had the seafood stock pot with rice and it was so good. The leftovers heat up really well too. Next time I'll get the same but add extra crab. I can't wait...

yUCDsDRVOCO1avzc-T2Ewg.text: I'm giving this place a 3 star because we came here for the oysters but it needed up to be the worst item on the menu!   Save your money on the raw OYSTERS . It was one of the worst We've ever had... even the oyster shooters were not good because the oysters used were so bad. My friends saw my IG a story and told me "oops, forgot to tell you their oysters are horrible".   However, everything else was great. We got the seafood stew. It was really good and portions very generous.  Still disappointed because this place is called The Oyster Bar and the oysters were so bad.

f5gfVdi-Npxr0jyicj4QXQ.text: Oyster Bar is located inside the Palace Station casino in Las Vegas.  It is not on the strip so don't go looking for it on the strip!  Oyster Bar has limited seating which means that the line to get a seat at the bar can range anywhere from 15 minutes to over an hour.  My bf and I had to wait over an hour and a half to get seated.  Don't worry though, the wait is worth it.  Remember, this is still considered a bar where they serve alcohol so you must be at least 21 years of age to sit down at the bar.  This is not a child friendly place so don't bring your kids and make them wait in line for over an hour just to find out that they can't sit at the bar.  There is also a big sign at the front of the line stating this.  It can get frustrating standing in line when there are people in front of you who act as a place holder in line for their uncles, aunts, mom, dad, siblings, half siblings, nieces, nephews, grandma, grandpa, and etc.  So don't start counting people who are in front of you to try and determine how much longer you have to wait in line because people and their long lost family members are miraculously united when they reach the front of the line to be seated.  *eye roll*  I'm sorry, but if you leave the line, you should lose your spot and have to go to the back of the line!  Oyster Bar needs a better system in place so this doesn't continue to happen.  It would also be nice if they placed your name on a wait list and they text you when seats are ready.  That way, no one is standing in line for hours!    Once my bf and I were seated, we were given bread  & butter, waters, and menus.  We ordered half dozen oysters, the combo pan roast and the bouill-roast.  We normally order a whole dozen oysters ($19.99), but I'm so glad we only ordered half a dozen ($11.99) because the oysters here are humongous!  They come on ice with lemon wedges, cocktail sauce, and horseradish.  They tasted pretty fresh for being an oyster bar located in the dessert.  FYI, no one got sick.    As for the combo pan roast ($23.99), it is a creamy tomato stew cooked with shrimp, crab, lobster, and a hint of Brandy.  It is served with white rice.  When you order, you can select how spicy you want your pan roast to be.  I selected 6 on the spicy meter and the pan roast was more on the mild side so if you want something truly spicy, go above 6!  The combo pan roast was delicious, and I would definitely come back and order it again, but I do have to admit that it is not my #1 favorite pan roast of all time.  Ocean Trail in Arizona is still the best pan roast I've ever had.  This combo pan roast is definitely #2 though.  I wished they put more seafood into the pan roast like other places do, but overall, I would definitely recommend this dish.  The bouill-roast ($23.99) used to be a secret menu item but is now on the menu due to popular demand.  The bouill-roast is a hybrid between a bouillabaisse and a pan roast.  However, the texture of the stew was a little more on the watery side and tasted less "tomatoey" compared to the pan roast.  The seafood in this dish included crab, shrimp, mussels,  lobster, clams, cod, and a side of white rice.  The bouill-roast is just as delicious and is a great option if you can't decide between a pan roast or a bouillabaisse.  The service was great!  The staff were friendly and did their best to clean the bar area and seat people as soon as possible.  The Chef did make an effort to check up on you to make sure that everything tasted good.  The prices of the dishes were fair and comparable to other oyster bars.  I know that the long wait in line is annoying as hell, but there is a good reason for the long line.  That long wait is due to the amazing food!  The food is worth the wait.  Please have some patience and don't be like me getting all mad and wanting to go ghetto on people cutting in line.  I totally blame it on me being hangry.

yvJEyKUMKQI5JhnSecxorg.text: Oyster Bar is STILL one of my favorite spots in Vegas and I've made it tradition now to stop by during each visit to Vegas.   This time around I decided to order something different than the Pan Roast and Gumbo that I usually order and settled with the Bouill Roast. The Bouill Roast is a secret menu item which is a combination of Bouillabaisse and Pan Roast. It was perfection at a spicy level of 2! I can't believe I've never discovered this before! It's not as creamy as the Pan Roast but still maintains a great tomato flavor without the heavy cream. It's loaded with crab, lobster, shrimp, mussels, and clams. The wait isn't any better than any other time so expect to wait upwards of an hour before you get your food.

-s6JU1fL1V3b7Fv_UZ88qQ.text: Finally made it.  I let my friend take the lead to order our lunch.  Deliciously well chosen.  Clam  chowder was great, the consistency was different almost gelatin like. Pan roast combo over white rice...omg, do great.  Get ready to be full. I want to go back to try the other menu items

l5AOpLNR7DLaS65qol0ZDg.text: Let me set the scene- 8 tispy/drunk women, blissed out from the Backstreet Boy Concert, and HUNGRY. 2:30 AM. A line that looks like a 2 hour wait (12 stools total at this Osyter Bar, 12 people in front of us- and honestly that number keeps changing as people filter in an out to gamble and drink while they wait).  I hate to proclaim this, but despite the wait- this Divey Palace Station meal is a Vegas must try.   My friends had been here many times and I had not, but they insisted despite my begrudged hangry attitude that I HAD TO TRY the Pan Roast, a Osyter Bar version of creamy tomato creole style etouffee with meats and seafood- topped with rice. At this point I was so hungry I would have been happy with a hot dog I found on the ground. I wasn't in the mood for that type cajun/creole of food at the time but went along. By the time we made it to the front of the line (2 hours)- I was fuel tank empty, my feet hurt from the heels and standing, and wasn't speaking to anyone. Also my eyelids felt like they were metal shutters that just wanted to see the hotel bed. I clamored up onto the stool, watched chef Ricardo made us 6 heaping bowls of Pan Roast in various flavors (each bowl takes about 15 mins to make, they do it in front of you MORE WAITING), and then.......... I took my first bite.  Well, it was good. Pretty good actually- but not mind blowing. Spicy level 4 suited me ( meduim spice lover), and it was blisteringly hot. The more I ate, the better I felt, and the more I liked it, but it was a big bowl and I was reallllly tired so I only made a small dent. I ended up taking 3/4 of the food home ($30 pan roast why not?) even though I figured it was get thrown in the trash the next morning when we went to brunch somewhere else.  This is when the funny thing happened. Had I wrote that review that night, Osyter Bar was 3.5 star experience for me. The next morning, I had a few bites of the left overs and it was a 4. Three days later, back home from vacation, I crave it. No joke! I want to fly back there to eat it again. RIGHT NOW.  So, Osyter bar, you got me- a soild 5 and bewilderment from me, but 5 you get.  So that is my story. Maybe there's crack in there, or maybe it a tough sell that grows on you over time. All I know is, you all need to try it. Next time I go, it's sneakers, folding chair, and sweatpants.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pan roast with chicken and sausage

BMovcbNOg6p1kv6zj_rpGQ.text: What can I say ? I Lovvvvvvve the oyster bar. There are a few around town but None are comparable to the palace station location!   Are you ready to wait ? I'm not talking 20-30 minutes. On average the wait is at least an hour. I like to show up at 10:45am on weekdays. (Your welcome)   I love the Pan Roast Combo- it comes with lobster,crab,shrimp & white rice. I like to order it at level 4/5 spicy.  Something about the creamy broth of this soup is out of this word. I generally get a half dozen oysters as well. If you love Seafood you will love this place. I try to come here a couple times a year. Honestly I go all the time just to check the line.    They do not do Phone or To go orders. You must be seated and you also must be 21 years of age !   If you have time to patiently wait I would recommend trying it just for the experience.

Os0cEkCORT6IVtVMay7y_A.text: My girlfriends and I came here around 2pm and the wait was about 45 minutes to an hour. This restaurant only consists of a bar with around 18 seats so you can see why there is quite an intense wait around here. There were 3 parties in front of us and we had an issue with a lady who cut the line right in front of us and was served. When we brought it up, the manager quickly came out, apologized and offered a round of free drinks and a generous 20% off the tab.  They provide complimentary dinner rolls with butter. I tried a sip of the shandy and consumed the shipwreck which tasted like strawberry ginger beer and lime juice. It was pretty good. My friend opted for a shrimp cocktail starter instead of a drink and it came with 5 jumbo shrimp with cocktail and horseradish sauce.  Between three girls, we shared the linguine and clam and the combo pot roast that came with rice at spicy level 3 (the spicy meter goes from 1-10). The linguine was more liquidy than I expected - more like a stew and a little too salty. The pot roast was delicious and creamy - I can definitely see why it's a crowd favorite.  All in all, the service is well attentive and it's a decent place to try at least once for the pot roast but there's only so long you can wait around for this place - try odd eating hours or their happy hours between 1-9am for a possibly shorter wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. * Complimentary bread dipped in combo pot roast.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. * Delicious, creamy combo pot roast.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. * Dug-in linguine and clam.

8KRXWPDn2tAAuDQ5usZuUQ.text: The only reason I'd give a 4 star is the super longgggg wait. It's not because there's a ton of people in line, but it's because there's only like 12 or 15 seats available at the oysters bar. But it is really worth it as soon as you take the first bite. The chef (I think he's Filipino) is awesome! Super generous and friendly.   I was starving.. my bf and I ordered two dishes: one palace station pan roast and the other clam linguine. Wow their clam linguine is seriously the best I've had. Tons and tons of clams in the dish.. he was definitely generous and was not shady with it!! And of course, the pan roast is always good!!  Can't wait to go back to Vegas.

4ODjFLEZKqBnE1ixvcxtEw.text: I love this place. Every time I visit Vegas, I almost always have to eat here. Sometimes even twice within one Vegas trip.  There are only 18-20 seats at the bar. You cannot order to-go unless you've been seated first. I asked them when theyre least busiest, they said 6-8:30 am. I usually end up here about 3 or 4 am and the wait is still 30 minutes to an hour long to be seated; then you have to wait for them to take your order and prepare the food. It's definitely worth the wait because everything smells and tastes amazing!  What I've eaten here: Oysters: 5/5 very fresh! Half dozen oysters for $10 on moonlight special from 1 am - 9 am. Combo Pan Roast $23.99: 5/5 tomato stew w/ shrimp, crab, lobster. Pick the spiciness level; I usually get a 4. You can hardly taste the tomato base; my mom doesn't like tomato base stuff but truly enjoyed this pan roast. It's difficult for 1 person to finish one of these and I think they charge about $6 for sharing. However, if you order something $10 or more for the second person, you can avoid the charge. Bouill-roast $23.99: 4/5 seafood stew w/ clams, mussels, shrimp. I prefer the pan roast! Clam Chowder; cup $5.99; bowl $8.99: 5/5 hands down the best clam chowder I've ever had! Every bite had clams in it. Not too much potatoes.  They peel and devein the shrimp, shuck the oysters. Only one guy cooking at the bar. Sitting at the bar is great because you can see the hard work that goes into cooking these pan roasts and other dishes. Don't try to sit at the bar if the seat is empty and the bar hasn't been wiped down. The employees will yell at you.  When you're ready to take leftovers home, they'll put it in a styrofoam container for you and then Saran Wrap it. I managed to bring the pan roast home twice; successfully passed TSA without them opening it up. I wish i could have taken the clam chowder home but I worry that would've been confiscated.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Succulent oysters from the gulf, I believe.

S7Ip2S_zTn4_-D4WkNcaDQ.text: Fabulous !! Totally worth the wait.  .the freshest, best smelling and tasting NOLA food outside of NOLA  Second visit in 2 days!!

lTRCfbLcpuvkM6GAZLpxtQ.text: Before you start crying & whining about waiting 45mins to an hour.. We waited 2hrs and 30mins to eat here.  It was my friends idea to come here since I've never been. Looking back at it, it was worth it. You gotta be In good company though. We got there around 12ish and didn't sit till almost 2:30 meaning people in the back of the line probably weren't gonna eat till 5am.. that blows my mind thank God I had a lot of time to spare. It's just a counter, maybe sits 15 people from what I remember but the workers are fast. You can't realy rush to eat bc your whole mouth will burn right off but man that line never went down. I think her name was Heather? she was a doll and she was so quick to answer everything with a smile. They make the food right in front of you and everyone is so friendly.  I decided on the Pan Roast Combo level6. I was feeling it the next morning for sure. I would definitely make it a point to come back on my next trip.

VPDph2ykIoGEZ1fAunrUsg.text: THANK YOU JESUS!!!  This has got to be the BEST place to go for hearty delicious slap your mama soup! (of course you really wouldn't slap your mama!) Lol   We get there and notice there's hardly a line after reading reviews of the line being long all the time. It's no wonder because the last person in line let us know they were the last ones they were taking because they were closing for their general cleaning they have once a month.  We were so bummed until an employee came out to let us know they were closed but we managed to get in because we let them know we were leaving the next day. So they gave my significant other the duty of letting others know that tried to stand in line after us they were closing for 6 hours...boy there were a lot of unhappy people! Yippee..... We were so grateful and excited to eat! Lol  The first thing I notice is they have Anchor Steam on tap...my fave San Francisco beer...I was on that! I also ordered a vodka shot...yummy! That just made everything better! He ordered the shrimp cocktail which were huge pieces and came on a bed of lettuce and cocktail sauce and horseradish. I had to have the gumbo because the last time I had home made gumbo was when my aunt Geline made some a long while back. I'm so happy I did because I ordered the HOUSE GUMBO and was in heaven after my first spoon! OMG there's no words to describe how delicious it was...you just have to try it yourself! My other half ordered the Combo Pan Roast and added lobster. He looked like he was in heaven as well after his first taste.  The customer service was outstanding! Thanks Jill for being so awesome with us. This girl deserves a raise...her work ethics and customer service is outstanding!  We were lucky enough to have soup this night and will definitely be back regardless of the line we have to wait in. It'll definitely be worth the wait! I wish I had some gumbo right now!!!

ZBHbKM9KuC5atlTXTOfVMQ.text: The food is really amazing!!! But the wait is stupid. Prepare to wait 3+ hours from standing in line until food is served. Not even joking.  They need to move into a larger space and open up more seating.

0OchCQEVdKJMSZJhQ05wkQ.text: We arrived around 150am.  Seated by 230 and got our food around 330am. Yea dont be that hungry.  Saw a lot of hangry faces.  We got the house pan roast, house gumbo, and cioppino.    The house pan roast was bland. Ive had pan roast from Reno (home of pan roast) and it wasnt even close. This pan roast was like a seafood tikka masala.  Buttery, sweet, thick. Not much other flavor though.  Except for that one shrimp that was half gone. Thats awesome.  The cioppino is no better than the tourist crap at Fishermans Wharf (San Francisco).  The Gumbo was waaaay to salty.  The oysters were big and meaty.  A bit earthy tasting.  Not my cup of tea.  The oyster origins are not stated, they told me they were from Louisiana.    The server (yes one guy!) was fast and friendly.  Hats off to this guying for dealing with the late night shit show that is this place .  He was literally feeding the animals.  The one cook is busy cooking 6 meals at a time. Thats right.  He can only cook 6 pots at any given time.  So be patient.    Overal I'd say that this place is NOT worth the wait.  We were seriosuly dissappointed after so many "elites" said this place was a must try.  Those ELITES  must try to eat better.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 330am and there is still an hour wait long line.  Of the line is to the machines its an hour.

DMQbcCI6V3XQMWk7NEbE9g.text: The best seafood ever!!!!! The wait is long 1 hr but you must give it a try..... don't walk away because of the wait. Trust me you won't regret. I got the combo pan roast it was so good. Chef Bob makes everyone happy he might looks grumpy because he work there for long hours plus non stop cooking so give him a break! Just shut up and enjoy the food. I love everyone who works there, the ladies are so nice

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EXshH53O2XHGK2Cap0lAiw.text: OMG stop what you're doing and try this place out.....now!!!  Well actually, maybe not, there's a huge line and you'll most likely be waiting for two hours.    It's literally a bar, and they only seat 18, so be prepared to do your due diligence and stand in line.  Or you can have an awesome friend stand in line for the group while you grab a drink, play some slots or blackjack until you're seated.  TRUST ME, it's worth the wait!!!  And that's coming from someone who NEVER waits in line for food.    You really don't come here for the oysters, you come here for the combo pan roast.  Don't get me wrong, the dozen oysters we ordered were fresh and on point (from Louisiana I think...), but there's plenty of other places to get fresh oysters.  I wasn't too crazy about the mussels but it was worth a try.  The chef cooks directly in front of where you're seated, so you get a bird's eye view of the action.  I noticed many of the guests are regulars, so they must know how amazing the food is here.  The combo pan roast...bomb diggity!  I only got it level 6 spiciness (probably could have gone with a level 8), but WOW, I was blown away!!  Creamy, spicy, tons of flavor mixed with shrimp, crab, and lobster!  The portions are huge, and I promise you will be extremely satisfied afterwards.  It's a shame they have such a small seating area and they don't take orders to go; if you are ordering to go, you have to stand in line anyways, so I guess it makes sense.  But goodness, expand this place would ya!!  Whenever I'm in Vegas again, this will definitely be on my top places to visit.  Good thing they're open 24/7!

Fc6jx12icOa25olbxJx5rQ.text: This place is amazing!!!!! Wish we had something like this in Hawaii! Heard that this place has a really long wait but we got lucky after waiting for about 10 mins before being seated (we went on a Thursday a little before noon) but a line began to form once we were seated. The chefs were really entertaining. It was a fun experience and to see how they prepared our food was a plus! The pan roast and oysters were so delicious! Definitely on our to-do list when visiting again!

l65esh9d22HLtYot1DdwBw.text: Located inside palace station. You would not expect to find a gem there! The pan roast was AMAZING. We ordered a dozen oysters, $10 during the late night special. I believe that starts at 10. The chefs cook up the food right in the front and the seating half circles around them.  There is an extra charge to share an entree, $5 but it comes with an extra rice. Very limited on seating and always a wait. We also ordered the gumbo, that I wasn't too appealed by when compared to the combo pan roast.

axfYhffVtkZu9TX9gqFoMw.text: When in Vegas, make a stop here for some GREAT Seafood. Oyster Bar has to be one of the best in town. It is most definitely a Louisiana cuisine with fresh food. Expect to wait anywhere from 30mintues to 2 hours. The line can be deceiving and waiters don't always pick up on the fact that guest are done eating :) Other than that, take a swing by and check this place out! No one under 21 is allowed.

Ji3_5_JzCsRLsU7r_0zmww.text: Tony L. and I were 3 people away and waited around 40 minutes on a Monday morning. Was it worth the wait? Yeaaaaaaaah!  According to Ricardo (chef), the combo pan roast, gumbo and bouillabaisse are their top three orders. We opted for the combo pan roast and bouillabaisse on our first visit. The portions are generous and well worth the ~$25!   The combo pan roast is so tasty! Flavorful, rich, creamy lobster based stew with lots of shrimp, crab and lobster meat. I can eat a tub of rice with this sauce. I never had a bouillabaisse before so I have nothing to compare to. But I am sure theirs is definitely one of the best.   Friendly service! I highly recommend giving this place a try despite the somewhat long wait. Good food deserves a little wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bouillabaisse and combo pan roast

gR_QFqyBDGp394INzbGc1Q.text: This place was very cool! Good atmosphere and very beautiful interior! Standard service, helpful and friendly! Food was good! Good place!

NCXclMyKX2Ew3ObGvbJOlA.text: Best oyster bar in Vegas!!! 10/10! There's always a line but it's worth the wait for sure.

7ibrgn8FT1J7HfNw6ygOZA.text: 4/5 stars only because the wait was super long. I came here on a Friday night, party of 2 at 10:15 and we were not seated until midnight. Yes, it really IS a bar meaning that there are only 18 seats so be courteous to other customers and once you're done pleaseeee leave! My bf grabbed his bread and ate it while we were walking around the casino because he didn't want others to wait.   They start you off with a sour dough roll and some butter. Feel free to ask for more if you want.   The portions are very big, prices range from $19-24 for a bowl but its worth the price. I ordered the Alaskan clam chowder which came with chunks of lobster, 3-4 jumbo shrimp and a bunch of crab. It was SOOO GOOD. The clam chowder wasn't watered down like other places that I've been to. It was very creamy. I only finished about 1/3 of the bowl, literally every bite I took had lobster chunks. It was great.   My bf ordered the gumbo and he enjoyed it, saying it was the best he's had. His only regret was that he got it mild and should have gotten a spice level of at least 5-6.  Service was ok. I wish they had a better system then just having customers stand in a line for hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $13 for half dozen
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JJFS18CvTybwk5l-iX03ug.text: If you like seafood then come here! Just need to wait in line to have a seat, as it's a bar the seats are limited, the chef cooks your food in front of you. So filling and such a satisfying meal.

CKhU9_fOPZwR7mPlPIjudQ.text: Oyster bar shits on Ritters in Orange County, California for sure!!!   Pan roast: love love the spice ingredients they used. I got the seafood pan roast, level 8 spicy! I'm very big on Texture and this was not too thick and the correct consistency! If your pan roast is as thick as my rice then no! I added extra habanero for extra spicy because i love my food spicy!   Diablo with linguine: delicious. I togo the rest and finished it.   Alaskan clam chowder: omfg so so good. Best clam chowder hands down! Not even San Francisco can make clam chowder as good!!  Gold Band Oysters- thick meat and super fresh. Boiling crab uses the same except they have fresh ones out more often.   Would I come back? Umm yes!!!!

KcjQoJJYFKeoic0yvP9mfg.text: This is another place that has been on my list for waaaay too long and I'm only finally getting around to it. Don't worry, I'm totally kicking myself.   Ugh, why is it so freaking good?! I HATE waiting in line. It's such a colossal waste of time. That's why I'm all about optimizing on "slow" times. Of course, it's unpredictable, but I've witnessed NO LINE (I couldn't believe it either) and during my last visit, our wait was just 45 minutes. It would have been 25 minutes, but a small oversight on the part of the server increased our wait. Also, it's obviously easier with smaller parties. Stick to a party of two or dining solo. There are just 18 seats and turnaround is approximately an hour. BTW, you still need to wait in line to order takeout.  Lump Crab Cocktail ($15.99): You don't often find crab cocktails like you would shrimp cocktails, so we wanted to change it up. The lump crab is delicious and is accompanied with lemon wedges, cocktail sauce, and horseradish. Everything is fantastic together.  Palace Pan Roast ($23.99): Shrimp, Crab, Chicken, and Andouille Sausage. All their Pan Roasts feature fresh seafood sauteed with Brandy, Cream, and Tomato and served with steamed rice. Yowzers!! This dish is incredibly flavorful and rightfully popular. You'll wonder where it's been all your life. You'll daydream about running through fields hand-in-hand. The Combo Pan Roast is definitely appealing with shrimp, crab, and lobster, but I love the addition of chicken and Andouille sausage. The only crustacean missing is lobster or you could always add lobster for $7.99 and have it all! The pan roast is really rich and rather heavy, but you won't regret a single bite. The portion is generous, so you'll likely have leftovers or could share (keep in mind they charge $5-6 for shared plates).  Bouillabaisse ($23.99): Classic French Stew with Onions, Celery, Shrimp, Crab, Lobster, Cod, Mussels, and Clams. All your sea friends came to play in this light, fragrant broth. This is wonderful choice if you're looking for a lighter dish.  There is a choice of heat level (1-10) on all the dishes. Since the pan roasts have a lot of cream, it absorbs the heat really well. I ordered my pan roast with Level 3 and the heat barely registered. I know it's all relative, but I'm somewhat sensitive to spiciness, so this was rather mellow. I believe they use chili pepper flakes for heat, so you should be able to add more if you order conservatively.  Although very busy, service was great. Our server was anticipatory with our beverages which I appreciated very much. The chefs have been here for almost as long as the Oyster Bar has been open (they just made 20 years!), so they are masters at making these amazing seafood creations. It's such a great atmosphere with wonderful food. I'm itching to return!

kYAmr0IePGY76-HmSRHjPw.text: This is my favorite gumbo place in Las Vargas, came here 6:30 am today , 1st on the line and waited 15 mins. Me and hubby came last year and waited 2 hr for dinner at night time. Waitress Jill is very friendly and told us before we came and the past hrs people had to wait for 2.5 hr before they can be seated. Food took 10 mins to come after ordering 2 seafood combo gumbo, lobster, carb and shrimp!  super yummy and it has okra in it and come with a white rice. Cannot be happier.

A line of people waiting didn't stop employees having plenty time to talk, laugh and have a good time ! Top it all of they are out of lobster !

fIcl8twHzOnUYlvYtT4QbA.text: Ummm the horrible wait.... 3 hr for lunch!! Wait was 2h. Do not come for meals if you got a life

BlzYEgUadLCTdIV5NAVqxw.text: ohh man what can I say about this spot; fresh oysters on ice and the amazing pan roast!. Ordered 6 on the heat scale which was pretty spicy but I think next time 7 would be perfect. We came here around 1am not to bad of a wait but surprisingly enough by 2am it was packed! The two chefs here are very friendly and try their best to get the food out quickly but since every dish is actually made to order fresh it may seem awhile to the impatient few. Two thumbs up

V1Qn4yanJz_vdS3ZfE1nbg.text: Definitely do family style to try more, although it is a bit hard  to share more than 2 or 3 people since it's "bar seating."  Since the food is pretty salty and rich, the scoop of rice is a necessary add-on.    We went around 4 PM, so there wasn't really a long wait..about 20 minutes or so.    Appetizers:  *Raw Oysters (4 stars):  Fresh & juicy *Steamed clams in garlic/butter broth (4 stars):  Simple, yet delicious.  We dipped the bread in the broth afterwards   Main entrees: *Pan roast (4.5 stars): This is the MUST TRY of the menu.  It's so flavorful and creamy.  We ordered ours at a spicy level of 4.  Enough spice for a kick, but not to the point where it burns uncomfortably.     *Etouffle (3.5 stars): This dish was good, but it wasn't the favorite for our group.  Since the flavor is lighter than the pan roast, it didn't compare after trying the pan roast first.

q-6zqmfkRIyrGlKd25sbmw.text: Every time I come to Vegas, this place is a mandatory stop.. just be prepared to wait a minimum 1hr! (Seated closer to 1.5-2hrs). Try to keep number to eaters to max 4 (maybe 5, but that's pushing it)  So if you can convince your complaining hungover friends that the dozen oysters are amazing and the clams are fresh (acquired taste with the clams)..Oh I can't forget to add the pan roast!

u4beVhqLWOPICtecKIGB7Q.text: What a knockout of a place!! I took my Mom here for here 60th Bday and we were blown away by the food and service. We started with a dozen oysters on the half shell. Made on the spot and arranged in a beautiful way it was tasty and then some. I went with a bowl of New England style clam chowder. I almost fell over it so rich and creamy. The clams were in every bite. We both lucked out as we had no wait and I have seen some long lines for this place. Will be back without a doubt.

BbE7UTjlrXxV0G7HpMR8NQ.text: long wait! be prepared! the place is tiny and only seats abt 12 people or so.  we had dolores as our waitress and there was one chef on site with glasses.  we ordered the palace pan roast spicy level 7, and the bouillabaisse spicy level 5. a dozen oysters.  oysters - shucked in front of us, they dont go the extra step to clean the oyster for you if they see shells. i had to pick the pieces out myself before eating them for at least 6. i hate sandy oysters.  they actually got our order mixed up with another one. they gave us the bouillabaisse soup correctly but im not sure if it was suppose to be the other girls. as it wasnt spicy it was still tasty.  they gave us gumbo which was also someone elses order and i accidently tasted it before i knew since i dont eat gumbo and wasnt sure if its what i ordered. i was just excited to try it.   dolores realized the mistake and had the chef make our palace pan roast for us. and also re did the other girls order for her. she wasnt a happy camper. but neither was us because the palace pan roast only came out with shrimp and chicken. missing ingredients such as lobster and sasusage (i think) we let her know again and she said the chef will re-do it but at this point the meal was just taking too long so we said its okay. she made some adjustments on our bill and we were happy with that.  the food is very good though! it would have been a better experience if it wasnt for the mix up. no biggie, busy rush hour- one chef. these things happen. i would still come back again.

o8cJ2m4Mfpb-zlOE1QyUvw.text: chef Bob and Master of all Margie do up a great feast.  I would describe the delight of all the dishes and the amazing flavors but this place is my personal secret.   Couldn't be more happy with it.

jKHSiLS7Hh-6F5yZ7DZFxA.text: I read the review and came here a few years back when we had an all girls vegas trip. It was supser gooooood. I came here again with my bf last year and it was still super delish! I usually come around 1030 in the morning or 3pm to avoid the crazy long line. The chef is pretty funny and have to try the linguini :D

RyckD5UvY8dILQnwpVxiGg.text: I love this spot but I really wish they would look into getting a larger resturant within the casino. The Pan Roast is the best I ever had but the wait makes you want to go else where.

bfkHcu2_rkRttQmIm5ZYYg.text: We went there at 11pm and stood in line for a good 1.5 hours to be seated. We got the chowder, raw oysters, and of course the pan roast with seafood. So good! I'd previously had similar food at Ritter's in SoCal that I really liked, but this was even better! Plus, they had large chunks of shrimp and sausage. I would skip the oyster though, because it wasn't cleaned very well like at other restaurants and I had a bunch of sand/grit in my mouth. Next time, I would bring a little fold-able chair to sit and wait!

Oz1Ie96m75riEyWCANEL4Q.text: I love the concept of sitting at the bar, watching the chef whip up jambalaya, mussels in a wine sauce or chowder.  The portions are huge. I feel like I'm almost sitting some place on the East Coast.  We ordered a huge bowl of chowder that came with crab and prawns. It was too salty for my taste.  Unfortunately, after we were doing eating, I only felt regret.

hq62ONxIAy5Omnw4VoWKCQ.text: Food is great, long lines seem unnecessary since there's so little seating but the food is great. Recommend going at off peak hours. The combo pan roast is definitely the way to go.

VDZkMk6Ulbn2hG-BX3y69A.text: Good food, but not worth the price or the wait. If they would seat people in the restaurant behind the bar it would be cool. I don't like sitting on top of people either. 20$ for a dozen oysters not a deal in Vegas.

jXgZQLzPfqs5sQ-d0NJpOQ.text: Food: 5+ Ambiance: 3 Service: 3  Food: The place that introduced me to pan roast.  Really the best ive tried since.  Raw Oysters are average, but what can you expect in the middle of the desert. Recommendation: House Pan Roast  Ambiance:  Your right in the casino and the place is literally a bar.  There are only about 12 seats so get there early cause your going to have to wait.    Service: Solid, only one waiter and one cook usually.  They are working hard.

z0sv9JnqmTDiHNsBvVNr-w.text: Everyone should go here for their Palace Pan Roast. The best in town! I've waited 2 hours to be seated and another hour for my Pan Roast. There is always a line and that should tell you something. The Palace Pan Roast is so good that you won't ever try another menu item. Well, maybe you will but not anytime soon. The staff is very friendly, the only downfall is that service is slow but that is due to them always having three people on duty.  When you are in Vegas you have to stop by for their Roast.

0dMGDIiyjbIjAoa0e_yjMA.text: Allan, E.Z., and Steve are all awesome at their job as the food was delicious and the service was great. They made it feel homey as if we were eating at a good friends dinner table.

IjhcCMbUL40Cpi7MlL-W4g.text: This is my first positive Yelp review for a restaurant that you should grab a bite before going to, it is that slow and it is that good.  I took off the one star because it is only the second best Oyster Bar I've experienced (the other was in New Orleans and was washed away by Katrina), and it is not uncommon to have to wait for well over an hour to get a seat.  I've hear of another place over here on the west side that might give Oyster Bar some competition.  Stay tuned for more...

LvIuqzGCk4oq1h0yibrY3w.text: As usual, Great food , but, the service AND the wait(even though half the bar is empty) has become unacceptably bad!There's Absolutely no reason to make customers wait in line for an extra 22mins when 6 chairs are empty, and that's AFTER having already waited 38 minutes !!! I WILL BE AVOIDING THIS PLACE AND RECOMMENDING THE SAME TO MY FRIENDS UNTILL MANAGEMENT AMELIORATES THE SERVICE AND WAIT TIMES!!

l1rs1eVFq2URZPMYEwBeKA.text: first things first, the food is EXCELLENT!  the pan roasts are a must try and the chowders are full of seafood, this vegas jewel is my kinda place!    *tip: when the waitress asks what spice level u want for ur pan roast, say spicey!  even if u can't handle that much spice, like myself, its sooo much better with that kick.  mild just lacks character and that extra oomph, it also turns out to be too salty  NOW...on to the other stuff...  there are a few things u have to understand before u go to the oyster BAR.  1. they are True to their name, its a BAR!!! there are no tables, its not a restaurant, they are a BAR literally with about 15 seats.  one chef cooking right in front of u and one waitress.  so if u have been fully warned, don't be upset if u have to wait.   2. be nice to the waitress, she's the gatekeeper.  3. the line is a standing line, do not cut, and don't have one person stand in line for ur party of 8, ppl will be very upset with u & its just bad etiquette.  know all this info and be prepared to accept it before u go, otherwise just don't bother.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chef at work
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chowder
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. combo pan roast

BJU-gjjN1dvIVoX-tuF9fw.text: My review is not based solely from the food but the whole experience of the restaurant, starting from the wait. This restaurant, although I don't know if a place this small should even be called a restaurant, has a LONG WAIT. By long I mean a few hours maybe. Do not be deceived by the seemingly short line. Since there are only a handful seats, it takes forever for your turn to come around.  While waiting, you are going to suffer from the smoke and dirty carpets. I felt almost itchy and disgusted waiting in line since the restaurant is placed right in the middle of a casino floor. There isn't even a proper door or sectional to divide the restaurant from the casino. I started having headache from breathing in the pungent air for such a long time.  As for the food, yes they are good because there is a ton of seafood in there. But I didn't feel like it was special to the extent that you would wait hours for this in such a terrible environment. The portions are huge, so definitely share it with someone. There is no way you could even finish half of the food by yourself.  The service of the restaurant is pretty bad. There is a "chef" who cooks and there is a server/chef who does everything from cleaning the tables, cooking the food at times, serving the drinks and food, bringing you the check. So evidently, this person is super busy. You have to wait for him to come close to you to ask for more drink or even your check. Also, while we were eating the chef got frustrated and said things to the "server". This just made everything super uncomfortable for me because it is a complete open kitchen.   Vegas has so many great restaurants. DO NOT COME HERE AFTER LOOKING AT THE REVIEWS. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME DURING YOUR TRIP.  Maybe, if you have a ton of time and want to have a lot of seafood for the cheap price and live in Vegas or something, then I guess this restaurant could be good for you.   I WOULD NEVER RETURN HERE EVER AGAIN.  DISGUSTING AIR CONDITIONS.

AwkDA7I028kxDE2X51Xn1Q.text: came at 1am on a fri night and there was no wait. damn that pan roast is good, wished they gave more rice though. when I finished the rice there was still a lot of the pan roast left, was thinkin bout telling them to put it in a cup with a straw so I can finished the rest, its that good.  kinda high priced, but worth it if the wait is an hour or less. the clams were good too.

5_v-aNRmFc-W_hHgWDxbLQ.text: Definitely worth the wait if you are willing to stand in a line for 2 hours. Go line up if you aren't hungry, because you will be by the time you get to the counter.   The oysters get a 2 rating for me. They do not clean the oysters besides a quick rinse. Good oyster bars typically scrub their shells before serving it to patrons, but this one did not. I received very gritty and dirty half shells. They also do not tell you where heir oysters hail from. Only get oysters here if you want some large and meaty and don't care about the nuances of oyster flavors.   Definitely stick with the gumbo or pan roast. The flavors are well developed. Each dish is cooked to order. You know the chef is serious when each ingredient is timed so that nothing is overdone. Plan to share if you don't have a big appetite.

fRUMgiY-dGBNd1QHbQh_Vw.text: This is probably the only place that has thee best clam chowder! It's soooo Yummy! The BEST. Test the same every time. So for the food it gets 5 stars !!  Now All-And-all! Last night I definitely had my worst experience after coming several times b4.  I give it 3 stars cause the wait is always too long! And takes about another 20-30 mins b4 you get your order, depending on how long you take to decide what you want so could take longer. And they are in no rush to make it move faster not by even taking Togo orders of clam chowder that's always already made! Pissed me off once I seen them go in the pot full of already made clam chowder after asking for Togo and waiting another 20 mins just to get it.  I went to gamble a little to give up my seat to the next feet hurting woman that stood in line for hours as well. Came back to get my meal.. just to get home and find out I got cheated on my clam chowder. Last time I came they filled my cup up! Which I only got the $3.99 cup- This time it was half full and I paid for the $8.99 bowl! So I guess it depends on who serves you. Cause why give me a big ass cup half full. I rather eat there then get it Togo cause my hubby cup was more then what I started with for his leftovers when we 1st tried it. Either the guy was upset I decided to take it Togo he didn't even offer me water which others were seated after me got  yeah didn't get his name but I remember what he looks like an ill update this later. Other then him the other staff is great! Two thumbs up.

lniGJob3AJszknH4a1NxYg.text: CRAB PAN ROAST Extra garlic spicy 8. First time here I waited three hours in line to eat. It is so worth it. Hands down my favorite dish. Favorite place to eat in vegas.

PJm-OpJzANsqZPz7FY2csQ.text: Came here for a late night and it was great . Pan roast and extra rice please , waited for about 1 hour but that's average here . Small table seats maybe 12 , but well worth it . It's about 5 minutes away from the strip . The clam chowder here is also great . :) will be coming back here if we are in the area .

S-YwSUwswsce5y1mXq7x-g.text: I read here a lot of good reviews, then I went there to check. First time I saw a long line and I was pretty hungry, then I gave up and ate chinese food near there. Today we went and still a long line, but we took. Believe me: worth every minute we spent waiting!!! Its so delicious! I had some fresh oysters, red wine and Alaskan Chowder! He had the Pan Roaster.OMG! We'll be back tomorrow for sure!!! We loved it!!!! I recommend that for sure! So good food!   Now, I understand why always a long line! =-)

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OZw8ww190P8PlO6IcjvldA.text: Everyone said it was worth the wait...so I waited....and waited....and waited....  We waited nearly 2 hours on a Monday night at 5:15 pm.  Finished eating at 9 pm.  That's nearly 4 hours folks.  The couple in front of me joked that we could have flown to NYC in that time and had a round of oysters in the same amount of time.  I swear when the waitress told us to sit down I felt like we had won the Olympics. -1 star.    We each had a dozen oysters, and our waitress didn't shuck them completely, so the oyster was still attached by that membrane thingie.  This made slurping impossible, so we had to use the little fork to pry 24 oysters out of its shell.  - 1 star.    Then we had to wait for the pan roast to be completed.  The chef was not exactly speedy gonzalez.  Granted he only had 6 steamers to work with, but when we realized half the people weren't eating we sank into deeper depression.  Yes the pan roast was delicious.  But it wasn't knock me over delicious.  I think we were so green by that time, nothing could be THAT delicious.    If there was less of a wait, and if this restaurant was more centrally located, I might consider going back.  But since this place is an actual out of the way destination, and that the wait time is always bad no matter what time of day, I can't say that I will be back anytime soon.

oUaJDuBw01KRgw7hI1qxCA.text: Saw very good reviews on yelp about this place so i had to try it. My BF and I are oyster lovers and he loves clam chowder.   The tempers were right it was a long wait. We waited for about an hours and fourth five mins. Sheesh. But it was worth it.   Ordered a dozen oysters. They were fresh. The man cracked it open in front of us. I ordered the pan roast #8 spicy which consist of lobster, crab, shrimp with a scoop of white rice. My BF ordered the Alaskan clam chowder #8 spicy which consist of clams, lobster, and shrimp. We love spices so #8 was perfect for us. The texture and taste were on the spot.   I recommend going with only up to 4 people to try this place unless you want to wait for a very long time. Or get seated at different times. It will alway be busy so no point on leaving and coming back.

b7IFo1m7XCnkqRJcWIMAjA.text: This is for Oyster Bar at Palace Station Casino (not Harrah's Oyster Bar). Derek is one of the fastest Chefs I have seen in operation. Nice for us to watch the actual cleaning of the Oysters and Seafood and cooking in front of us. We were lucky it wasn't swamped when we went at 1:45 AM due to travel scheduling and Waitress Jill was very fast as well, not much wait to be seated. The Lobster Dish takes a bit longer than expected, as the Dozen Oysters Platter, Crab Appetizer and New England Clam Chowder are delicious but much faster.  But this food is fresh, the company and ambiance close and they answered every single question about the menu and preparation as well as possible with a full bar. Interesting locale, excellent food, and quality service. Try this place ! You might become a huge fan !! Huge Thanks for quelling our appetites on a late Tuesday night, from Tamara & Patrick

xCzJ4GTIFJYqpx182itBBg.text: After reading all the reviews I finally decided to try this place out and I'm glad I did.  The place is open 24 hours, but there's always a line I'm told.  For the duration I was there, there was always a group waiting.  I got there at 8pm and had to wait about an 45 min, but the line had down by 9pm.  The biggest problem is that there are only 17 seats, which are stools that circles around the bar.  The food is amazing and fun to watch, they are made in these stainless steel steamers that look like something from a steam punk engine and are located in the center of the bar.  I got the House Pan Roast spicy level 7 with extra lobster.  The lobster though was rubbery and tasted just like shrimp.  Next time I'd get extra crab.  At any rate, it was delicious and totally worth the wait.  The soup was thick and flavorful, like a really rich spicy gumbo that went well with rice.  I'd also like to try noodles next time too. I would totally go here if they had one in LA.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast combo finished product. So good!

hxXXzOG2VfF2VvUe6H1q1Q.text: The food is a 10 on a scale of 1-5. But because this place is so scrumptious it's always busy. Even on a Tuesday evening at 1:30am.  The chef was pretty awesome too and had personality that kept me staying patient.  Optimistically speaking- food was delicious after 1.35 hrs of waiting!!!
