upv4OdBh0XYeoHm0lAQE_w.text: I've been waiting to come here for years. Finally got the chance to try it. It lives up to the hype. Margaret and Devon? we're amazing. Fast, efficient, welcoming...they had quite a shift with the back bar having draining problems but they handled everything in stride. Hats of to them and thanks for making our first visit so fun, memorable and appetizing. Cajon Shrimp, Caesar salad, Gumbo were all worth coming back for...bravo!

7nctgKgGD7XREVgYIOXHRg.text: Walked inside Palace Station and did not expect to find a restaurant that merely consists of a bar situated right outside the casino floor.  Being such small establishment with seating less than 20 people at a time, I can definitely see why everyone whines about the long wait.  Fortunately, we opted for a nontraditional breakfast which turned out to be a great idea as the place was completely empty around 7am.  They do offer a daily Moonlight Special from 1am to 9am with $2.00 16oz Bud Light drafts, $5.00 wines and $8.99 1/2 dozen oysters so I wouldn't be surprise if there happened to be a line that early in the morning.  One thing I don't understand is why not expand into a bigger location considering how big their clientele is.  At least this way, they can focus on customer service and preserve such exceptional food quality.  Speaking of food, everything we had was quite tasty!!  I ended up ordering the etouffee while she had the palace pan roast.  Obviously, seafood isn't fresh off the boat that morning but at least they actually cook it in front of their guests so you know what they serve hasn't been simmering in their kitchen for days.  My dish had great Cajun flavors synonymous with a typical etouffee from NoLa.  I like how the seafood was perfectly cooked and not rubbery at all.  They also didn't skimp out on ingredients, especially lobsters, so paying $22 for a bowl of soup was totally worth it!!  Overall, Oyster Bar is a must for visitors and locals alike.  Check this place out during off peak hours (early mornings/late nights) to avoid waiting for a long time just to get seated!!  Since they're open 24/7 this would actually be a great ending to a long night of debauchery especially with the Happy Hour being so late.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Étouffée

e2eXu2rkKDIz8Zn4wyKHvQ.text: Combo pan roast is a must have. Spice level 6-7 was good for me. Maybe the best dish in all of vegas

V3f3jg0BMvZfPG6dcN5cKQ.text: Came back for another fix 3 days later before leaving Vegas and chef Ricardo was still cooking up a storm. We came around 11am on a Monday and waited about 30 min.  Had to get the Combo Pan Roast again- this time with a 6 on the spicy scale and for me it was the perfect kick without being uncomfortable. Just as good as the first time- amazing!  We also tried the Alaskan Claim Chowder and it is one loaded chowder! Plenty of clams, shrimp, lobster mixed in with the creamy, comforting, flavorful soup. This actually goes really well with the pan roast because it is a milky type of creaminess, while the pan roast has more of a tomatoey flavor.   Can't wait for the next time!

zSTrwwyd-potjQuUQY4GrA.text: I was at Station Casino's for work and decided to try the Oyster Bar. I always thought Pan Roast was like a piece of ham roasted in an oven... but I guess I was wrong.   After a 30 minute wait, I finally sat down and ordered the Pan Roast. It was hands down the most amazing thing I've ever put in my mouth (pause). I didn't care that it costs around 20 bucks. It was well worth the money. So glad I got to spend my money on this masterpiece and not waste it on penny slots!

FDac7nemApGRkfFGo6Sm0w.text: I'm here Thursday at 11:00am! No waiting for 2! And the line didn't start even when we finish at 12:00. So I'll say line is not that crazy depends on season and days tho!  Any way, Alaska clam chowder and combo pan roaster are so so so good!!!!

yP6ajyX9gATgiIIu3Cdqgg.text: It's day 3 of EDC.  I feel defeated.  The only thing that I want is something warm and comforting and lo and behold, I stumble across this Yelp listing.  A beacon of light in my post-EDC haze.  The reviews all warn a 2-3hour wait, but boyfriend and I were optimistic (how?).  It's not going to happen to us, we're going to get there and we're going to EAT.  So we pumped ourselves up to put on actual clothes and trekked our way off the strip and back into the 1980's.  The Palace Station is definitely not the place to be seen, but it houses this magnificent gem.  You find it by looking for the massive line of hungry, salivating people.   When all of the seats are taken, it really does take the predicted two hours before you'll get served, so prepare to wait.  We did.  But it was OH. SO. WORTH. IT.  Get the pan roast.    This was one of the best things I've ever eaten.    If you're here with a friend, don't even think about trying anything else.  Just get two orders of pan roast.  You'll end up fighting over it.  And definitely get one to go too so you can take it home and eat it when you're hung over.  Imagine the creamiest tomato soup with all of your favorite seafood served over rice and that's what the pan roast is.  The ultimate comfort food, upgraded.  My mouth is watering.    And if you're reading this as you're waiting in line... DON'T GIVE UP, YOU ARE SO CLOSE!  And if you are my friend or even an acquaintance who has my phone number, please get me an order of pan roast and I will venmo you when you get back to the 'dale.

JXalwQnjCYHUOF7gxG5NcA.text: We had a wonderful experience at Oyster Bar today! I was so pleasantly surprised by everything, especially since this was an unplanned visit. I'd been wanting to try this place for awhile, and today wound up being that day, all because we were trying to avoid the traffic on the 15 FWY. We were cruising down Martin Luther Blvd. debating what to grab for dinner, when right there before our eyes was the glittering Palace Station lights. On a whim we remembered Oyster Bar and decided to drop by.   Apparently the wait for this place is insane, but we waited a whopping 5 minutes! I'm not really sure how that happened. Maybe Tuesday 5 PM is the trick? The only real waiting was for the food, but it was well worth it. We ordered the Bouillabaisse. If you're unapologetically American and can't speak French, join the club. It's pronounced something like "Bull Yeah Baes." The guys working the counter are super nice so they won't care, but just in case you want to look like you eat French cuisine on the daily. :P So the Bouillabaisse was delicious. Lots of different seafoods (lobster, crab, clam, etc.) in a rich delicious broth with rice on the side. We also ordered the Lobster Pan Roast, another scrumdidlyumpitious creamy stew with huge chunks of lobster swimming. We subbed the rice for noodles. Oh my gosh, I loved it more. But I love pasta. Both dishes were rich and complex. I love getting foods like this - something I can't ever make to such perfection at home.   While it takes awhile for the food to arrive, we had a lot of fun watching the Chef work his magic. He had such a flair for cooking, it was like watching an artist create masterpieces before our eyes. I enjoyed watching him sprinkling dashes of this and that into the simmering hot pots, flipping the stews into fresh bowls, whisking seafood left and right. Made me even happier when I realized 2 of the pots were ours.   Overall it was a great experience. We were lucky we didn't have to wait long. I'm not even sure we would've come here if we had known beforehand that the waits here are long. But now we know, and we would still come back, because the food and service are that good!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TC08UWEbAjqiOEMPs-W-0g.text: Wow! Combo pan roast, Level 8 was SPICY but so GOOOD. Don't be scared of the chef, he wears a hat that says, LOVE LOCALS, cuz he hates tourists. He snaps at you but its just a facade, he is actually a really nice man who pretends like he dont take shit from customers!  If you love Oysters as much as I do, order yourself a dozen here. They are sooooooo plump and fresh and each oyster is served with its own lemon wedge (whaaaaaat?)  I have a friend from Texas who is a Vegas regular. Her husband has been coming to Vegas since he was 13 years old and every year since he turned 21, he comes to Vegas for his birthday. They always make it a point to stop by the Oyster Bar at the Palace Station for the infamous Pan Roast. The Oyster Bar has become a Vegas tradition for me as well and is truly a hidden Las Vegas gem that I hope will continue for many years to come.

PPNqmutMs3rjSiqz8rek4g.text: I love oyster bar!!! What's a Vegas trip without stopping by oyster bar?!! I always call in advance before leaving the hotel because I don't want to wait 2-3 hours for oysters. The wait time is always long and it takes forever! They have a late night special if you go super late around 2 am. Oh yeah they're open 24 hours now! There's less of a wait around 2am since everyone's probably busy at all the night clubs. I came super early one morning and there was no wait at all since everyone is probably sleeping, gambling or hung over. I usually order pan roast and a dozen oysters. They're oysters are so meaty and they're delicious! I always crave for some. I usually get a lot of spice in their pan roast and rice on the side. If you share your portions, they charge you $5 for a split charge which is pretty high

VYbgquyoXae3rQILoV1feA.text: Eff yea! Delicious effing food made by an effin amazing 2 or 3 person team of a chef, a server, and a dishwasher. They are all effing nice and hard working mothereffers. They're effing sarcastically funny too. Don't be surprised with the long effing wait. But it's effing worth it.

Hit9HEwhYwTHeD3ifke_ow.text: We stayed in Vegas over the weekend for a wedding at the Palace Station. The hotel caters to locals so it's not flashy. But the real draw is the Oyster Bar. I've had some of the best New England Clam Chowder EVER. My husband had the Manhattan Clam Chowder and he loved it. They served it piping hot and the only downside is just one piece of bread. We had the coffee gelato for dessert and it was perfect!   I recommend you hurry and try to get a seat at the bar as it fills up very quickly!

f9qVCx27vr2bd59RGsxzqQ.text: Get there at 12:30 for a half hour wait and the early morning specials, 8.99 half dozen oysters and 2 dollar bud light drafts... The palace pan roast, the combo pan roast, and the seafood jambalaya are amazing picks...

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steve...
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half dozen on the half...
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood jambalaya!

CV_BPIsYiBSQ505oQvOkaw.text: OMG!!!!!   I love the pan roast.   Long line but so worth the wait.  The flavor is just like authentic Southern Louisiana cooking.

ueC6NVMuY4VXBlNyuaMTzA.text: love love love this place! a must go when i can make a trip to las vegas!  the hour wait each time is well worth it! i like to get the shrimp cocktail appetizer and the palace pan roast with crab, shrimp, chicken, and sausage. such an amazing meal!  this place IS in the middle of a casino and it does only sit about 18 people. you will probably wait around an hour (i hear it's even longer during meal times, but less than an hour in the morning).

01eEpmYt0sAZ-dT32pYE0w.text: We walked pass by and saw that there was a long line so decided to come back at a later time. Good thing we did!  So it's 5am and you're craving for Oysters, so where do you go? OF course you go to the "OYSTER BAR"!!!  There was no wait so we just walked up to the bar. Ricardo was our chef/cook and buddy for the morning. He gave us a suggestion and we ordered Seafood Pan Roast (along the line of a Bisque but thicker with Crab, Lobster and Shrimp). We also ordered a dozen Oysters, Clams and Mussels and every single bite was the bomb.   We've had Oysters before and hate it when parts of the shell gets onto the Oyster! But the ones at the Oyster Bar was just so fresh so clean! Ricardo was quick to open the shell and serve us. With a squeeze of lemon and shot of Tobasco it goes down so smooth and it'll leave you wanting more. If we didn't order other stuff we probably would have ordered another dozen.  The clams/mussels cooked in it's own juices was GR8! You can't go wrong with this order at all! Jeff wanted to just drink it's juice, that's how much he liked it.  As for the Pan Roast, it's #1 and we heard a few people say the same thing. Good thing we ordered it. You get a good amount of seafood, which you being cooked right in front of you. Not like in restaurants where they cook it in the back and all it contains is lots of soup base with very little seafood meat. We were full with just the oysters and order of clams & mussels, but couldn't put down the spoon because it was DEELLLIIICCCIIIOOOUUUSSSSS! It didn't look like we touched the bowl because we had to take home the rest of the portion.  Service is friendly and great! You'll end up chit chatting with other customers and the Chef. Food is great! Everything is great. Lets just say If you were having a bad day or lost $$ from the casino this will cheer you right up! Okay you will probably still be bummed u lost money but not while you're eating.  Oh and the Oyster Shooter is also a must try. We will definitely come back again and bring our friends.   It may be a long wait since seats are limited to maybe less than 20 (literally a strip of bar), but it'll be worth it.

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bouillabaisse
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OFF da HOOK Seafood Combo Pan Roast and The Best Oysters in LV!!

Jf6sZb34P7g-V03cObdUSw.text: I love the fresh oysters and awesome service here! Though it's really small, it's definitely worth the wait! I'm gonna be visiting this place each and every time I'm in Las Vegas from now on!!  FYI: The Oyster bar is only serving their food at the bar. There is a restaurant right next to it, but it is a completely different business! So make sure you don't walk inside and get seated!

QgUC1wqF2ySySvxcfXNVig.text: Enjoyed all the seafood this place had to offer ! Me & my family will be back here in September on our next vacation. Fresh & very good!

n6fjmlJCMGxm-n6-jeiYBw.text: Pan roast combo. Omfg. U have to try it  Friendly service.  We ordered 1 claim chowder bowl, 1/2 dozen of oysters and 1 pan roast combo. Surprisingly they didn't charge us $5 sharing fee (like they charge others ?_?)   Love it

wR9jIBKAH6WJDdYY0aDItg.text: Chef Dreyer is a treat!!  Food is amazing can't believe that in the 12 years I've lived out here that this is my first time.  Rachelle our server was amazing as well. Great service great food I will be back next week.  The gumbo was best I had.  My wife's Pan roast I will be back for

d6pJWH1afUL5yuv0WrYc4A.text: Love the food here. Oysters are huge. Only 18 seats so workers seem stressed out, Long waits in line. Service isnt #1 here. I waited forever for them to pick up my check. Waited for them to get my order. My second time back,  I waited 1.5 hrs only to be told they ran out of oysters.  But I tried the Bollabasse (spelling) and it was AWESOME.  So its worth the hassle if you have the time.

uOQD9xRNlTtchdw2xUayiA.text: It's past the game tables and in the middle of the casino. FYI.  The staff and chef are all very funny and sarcastic. I came, I sat and I ate. There was a lot of food. I mean alot!.  My buddy, let's call him Bob, ordered too much and tried to get some boxes togo after like 10 mins of eating. The chef told him, "C'mon really? Man Up!" and he subsequently ate some more. Didn't quite manned up but did try to eat some more. At the end he got his box to take togo.   Some of the customers asked the chef, "Where does the Oysters come from?" His reply, "From the cooler."  Yeah, it's as good as it gets here!  Service is slow, but technically each seat gets you an hour of service! Like you can't leave even if you wanted to! They'd get you your check like later much later after you asked for it.

AToddqrRyLT0Zwex31yo8w.text: Best seafood in vegas. Don't let the crappy hotel derail you. The oyster bar is hands down the best. It's always busy so expect a wait. Really late night or early morning is the only time you won't find a line. It's worth the wait. I always get the Combo pan roast, spicy, level 7, extra rice. Heaven

r0Ah8JkzSKouM7t7s0zI4w.text: Wow. This soup is AMAZING. Ordered the pan roast combo and boullibase and half dozen of the clams..  WOW. The pan roast is creamy, flavored right, and the seafood was so fresh and tasty. I'm hungry again thinking about it. The only thing that sucks about this place is the wait. There are only 18 seats at the bar but it is definitely worth the wait!  The oysters are fresh!  Please please please get the pan roast combo.

qdGgI0fLHWLLSOLlb6X36w.text: this used to be one of favorite restaurants, but I hadn't gone for like 3 years and went last week and the gumbo is not the same!   this place was what sparked my love for gumbo and southern foods in general, but they lost a bit of their former touch.   the gumbo was overly salty, but at the same time, lacked flavor. it was full of seafood, but had no real seafood flavor.   I will be dreaming of their gumbo no longer, but I still have hopes for their pan roast. I will return at least once more before I give up on them forever.

BXzouoYPZyTUhVLo8_IDuQ.text: Went back here this weekend during our August b'day babies trip!  Had the boulliabaise (sp?) spicy level 8 with linguini & combo pan roast spicy level 8.  Both were so delicious!  We tried to order the baked oyster rockefeller but were informed that it's only available after the back kitchen opens up at 4 p.m.  Next time!  Did a little gambling of paigow at the tables before heading back to LA - massive traffic on the 15S - crawling crawling - but Oyster Bar kept us filled & happy for the 6-1/2 hours of hellish driving!  Thank you OB!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster Rockfellar...only available after 4 pm when the back kitchen opens
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood jambalaya w/ linguini level 7 spicy

GF0lDW2Ye0OGiXy568kjiA.text: Very small place. Came here for midnight snack, so we fit our party of 9 with no wait. This place is opened 24 hours and is so freaking good.  Can't eat seafood? It's ok. They wiill cater the gumbo to meat only.  Sad that they ran out of oysters though.  Clam Chowder was the best I had, but wish it wasn't so thick.  Seafood Gumbo was amazing. Spicyness level 1 to 10. We got 8 and it was a very good amount of heat, but I can taste the seafood.  The seafood pasta was so delish too.   It's in a hotel off the strip that no one goes too and looks so old, but everyone comes here for Oyster Bar. AMAZING!!!

p9DNw-sdtPevI9AAcukzbQ.text: This was our favorite place in Las Vegas! Get the pan roast, you won't leave hungry or disapointed.

q9s9y_7c6S27DE78Qv6KEQ.text: TIP:  perfect for couples because you can share the pan roast, gumbo, etc. since one bowl is big enough for 2 people.  Just get extra bread or rice to soak up the amazing broth.  There's no restaurant name, it's literally called "oyster bar" with less than 20 seats serving up tomato based broth with shellfish (shrimp, lobster, crab).  the pan roast, gumbo, and jambalaya totally steal the oyster's thunder here because it's pretty much what everyone orders.  Broth texture is creamy but not thick nor watery.  We had a 6 (1 thru 10) spicyness level and it wasn't spicy at all, so feel free to bump it up to a 9 or 10 if you want more chili pepper in there.

qepLKpaaSm9ULMfVFxtdnQ.text: AH mazing! Combo pan roast, to die for. In a town of great food, this little 20-25 seat bar is well worth the wait. Thanks for the great food and entertainment executive chef Chris and the girl who is on top of it all, Christyna.

wgNVDg-kAlK4kd1epxNZ6w.text: A friend recommend this place and let me tell you this place is freaking amazing!  Tried some clam chowder had amazing flavour to it. I had the shrimp pan roast. Omg nothing compares to it. Every time I come to Vegas I most definitely will  come here. We came on a Sunday at 9am no line.

M6_k-z5pnH3Cf7KNdHnXkQ.text: Food is always delicious! The line is sometimes very long, but if you have the time it's worth the wait! We have have almost every item on the menu! We always start off with a dozen raw oysters, yummy! Pan roasts, Gumbo, Cioppino, bouillabaisse, linguini with shrimp scampi, New England clam chowder, shrimp cocktail, many more delicious dishes to choose from!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast. Shrimp, lobster and  crab ..
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters!

aUOyySFbxTXLPAHqcxmP1A.text: We waited over 2 hours to get a seat, waited additional 30-40 minutes to get our  bouillabaisse and when we finally received it, it was well worth the wait and smell of the old casino.    The bouillabaisse that everyone raved about, yes folks, it was fantastic. Portions were so huge that I couldn't finish it (shocking!), the flavor and freshness of the seafood was a good combination of spicy (level 6) and savory.    Definately a place to check out if you're hungover and wanting something other than the usual buffets.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bouillabaisse - worth the wait

whaXfQO0mBZvtjay4w5CcA.text: Place is good. Worth the $$$ but I don't think it is worth the 2 1/2 hour wait at 2 am in the morning.  I tried everything. The oyster, pan roast, gumbo, and etoufee.  I loved the gumbo. Taste authentic like gumbo served in New Orleans.  You got to try this place once at least. But there will be no repeat with the long wait for me.

250DnBIFbo-X_fdk1jT_4w.text: Help me out, somebody.  I don't get why folks rave about the food at this place.  It smells great when you walk by the place, but the taste of the actual food doesn't do justice to the aroma.  I've eaten here twice and I'm not impressed.  This most recent time, I had the Bouillabaisse.  The sauce, other than being spicy had very little taste at all.  I'll same the same for the seafood in the bouillabaisse.  The shrimp was tough and overdone and tasted very little of that "seafood" taste that you expect from a seafood dish.  For those of you who truly enjoy this fare, I wish you bon appetit, but, for me, it's not worth the price or the wait...

HbNfq5CTl_Nt5RD0feFEgw.text: Yes, the wait is so annoyingly long. But as soon as it becomes my turn and ordered, the frown face turns upside down. It's so worth waiting for. There are a few places open in LA area. I believe the same/similar recipe as this place. The cooking method is the same. I don't know if it's the memory or atmosphere/location, they don't taste the same as the Oyster Bar in Palace Station in Las Vegas, NV.  My always go to is Cold Seafood Combo (appetizer) and Bouillabaisse with spicy level 5 and rice on the side. I've brought most of my friends here and now this place became their must-go restaurant whenever they go to Vegas.

xh4_gpRGeYos7_FCDEj2Ow.text: I love to try new food when I am at Vegas. I did some research on Yelp and found Oyster Bar. The dinning experience here completed my awesome Vegas vacation.  The wait was about an hour during lunch time, which is not bad. They only had about 16 bar spaces so I don't recommend coming here with a large party. They only have one chef and one server for the entire bar. So the waiting time for the food might be long. We waited about 15 mins for our food.   We ordered:  1 dozen oysters (not the best that I've had but decent).  Shrimp & Lobster Fra Diablo (Sauteed shrimp and lobster in a spicy tomato sauce with linguine) = Amazingly good. There are about 8 or 9 jumbo shrimps and two large pieces of lobster. We ordered mild but I think it would be better to go for medium.  Of course we had to try the famous Pan Roast (fresh seafood sauteed with brandy, cream and tomato served with rice). We had the combo (shrimp, crab and lobster). This is a must try.. it was soooooo good. The portions are pretty big (it could be shared among 2 ppl) but they charge you $5 extra for sharing. Even though there's only 2 of us, we managed to finish all 3 items.... ;)  Can't wait to go back again the next time we visit Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo Pan Roast (Shrimp, Crab &amp; Lobster)
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Lobster Diablo

Sba05mb67fa703gA5mbjXg.text: I went here with my bro. The chowder is outstanding. Just a cup is fine for me but next time I'd go for the alaskan chowder.    My bro and I thought we could handle a pan roast on our own but we no can handle since we chomped on a whole bunch of chowder prior.  In pan roast combo they put tons of seafood. A lump of crab, scallops, lobster tails, and more.  It creates such a rich broth that it's hard to eat it all.  Upside? We got seated right away since we ate at an off hour.    Lastly, I gotta comment. One customer didn't know what an oyster looked like. Also he was confused about what a scallop looked like in it's shell.  As well as mussels. I will just throw this out there.....understand the food that you eat.  Check out a market or a grocery store.  Food will taste much better and you'll appreciate it even more when you know where it comes from! :-) Da guy thought "This food is exotic and only in Vegas".....my fellow customer.....the food at the oyster bar could be found in many places in the world! I am glad the chef kindly educated him about the different seafood.  Check it out.  Go for the chowder!

YD3gBLSt-J01A9oF4F03cg.text: Sooo amazing! The food was heavenly and generous! The only down side was the very long wait but it's completely worth it in the end. The price is very fair for what you are getting. I mean I think I counted 14 shrimps! I'm coming back everytime I come back to visit Las Vegas! I would give it a 4.5 star but I can only do a 4.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh and heavenly!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soo good, the four hour wait was worth it!

wypXTq_0uncIoNA8_OaP7Q.text: Pan roast is the best way to go, good service Jill was great and I will return just because of that no wait from 430 to 10 am I loved it

WoAMZQMZ_PFLJS1-1mmItg.text: I was invited to the Oyster Bar in August of 1999... I have been eating there ever since. Many trips and 17 years later, I have always had a great dining experience and the food is absolutely amazing. I love the Combo Roast and Bulliabase with a side of pasta. The chefs and bar backs are warm, polite and aim to please. All of the dishes are fantastic. I highly recommend this place, obviously!  The only draw back, there is usually a line to get in. No problem, grab a drink and relax in the line.

NG3Rl4ITYVh_iuh7hMjtbg.text: This place is one of my favorite go to spots for dinner. It's 24 hours so I try to go after dinner hours (9pm or later) so there's a minimum wait in line.  The combo pan roast and cioppino are two of my favorites. Definitely the way to go. Can't wait to eat there again soon.

MqE6FA-KcFDHtLWvrgE0xQ.text: THEE struggle is definitely ricky-ricky-REAL ya'll. Luckily your boy ain't no punk. I got this fam! (that's gonna be my new saying for this year...randomly inserted "I got this fam!"'s haha)  So after a 10 hour drive taking us from Vegas to Hoover Dam to Grand Canyon and back, I was beat. We got to our rental and your boy took some medicine and ko'ed. This was approximately 8pm. I never sleep at 8pm. Anyway, I woke up this morning at 3am fully rested and what does any normal guy do at 3am? Crave for a Pan Roast from Oyster Bar of course!   While searching for must eats in Las Vegas, Yelp brought me to the Oyster bar, which is an 18 seat bar in an older, off the strip casino. I would have never thought that one of the best things I've ever tasted, like ever, would come from a place like this. Think of the scene in Goodfellas when Ray Liotta and Joe Pesci are joking around - smoky, dark, and old...that's Palace Station. But Oyster Bar is that diamond in the rough.  I got lucky in that from the reviews I've been reading, even at 5am the wait is like 2 hours. I got there around 3:30am and "only" had to wait 30 minutes.  We got seats next to a couple visiting from Germany (Danke!) and a local couple who told us how to order and what to get. The local couple told us to try the Oysters on a half shell and the shrimp etoufee, but if we were to only get one thing - get the Pan Roast. You can get it with just shrimp or just lobster or just crab or you can be a G like me and get the Combo which is all of that, AND add andoullie sausage for $5. The chef will ask you how hot you like it, being a newb I didn't want the heat to ruin it for me so I got it at a 3, which after eating it, I can tell you now is basically no heat. The proteins are put in a pot and chef adds what looks like tomato soup, cream, and spices, and adds a scoop of white rice and voila - BEST THING EVER AT 3AM. Has to be in the top 7 things I've ever eaten in my life.  Don't hesitate. It is really THAT GOOD. I'm going to rename the Pan Roast - Crack Soup. Get you some Crack Soup.   HBD to me. Yau Mo Gau Cho!

Id27Z5ZEe95-y1IOGuTNMw.text: Came here last night with my gf and let me tell you, the wait is excruciating. They need to expand a bit and have more tables because they tend to have a long wait time due to the fact of the seating, or maybe a limit at the table because they were people just chilling after they were done Eating taking selfies smh. Wait time was 2 1/2 hours!!   We ordered the house gumbo cause we saw on yelp people suggested that and the pan roast combo. We also ordered a dozen of oysters. Oysters wasn't all that great it tasted gross. I've tasted better oysters at other places that are much more fresher and sweet tasting. The house gumbo came out good but I wouldn't go back and wait for that long just for that. Customer service was great I have no negative comment about our server. I'd give better ratings if there service was a lot faster by adding more chairs and tables.

QSmu6ylgI2NBfUZBY66hlg.text: I LOVE THE OYSTER BAR! I don't mind the line -- it's expected with only having 15 seats & all the praise for the food being so dead on. It's definitely worth the wait. The staff at any shift -day, swing or graveyard- are consistent with each other -- all so personable and giving fast service. I love that we could watch the chef make the food right in front of you and/or socialize with the neighboring couples/groups, making the atmosphere so casual. I especially recommend the pan roast. While people I've taken with me here have preferred the Combo pan roast (shrimp, lobster and crab) or the palace pan roast (sausage, lobster, shrimp,  crab and chicken) , I feel like all the meats, etc. are too much so I settle for the crab pan roast! Make sure to come HUNGRY!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ricardo, my favorite chef
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Gumbo $23.99

buTCElfv84Sv3XqAqu_iVQ.text: This place has really good food and some of the best oysters I've ever had but the only reason I give this place three stars is because the way they prepare the food looks really unsanitary. It's like there isn't any soap here at oyster bar and not too many things get washed or cleaned. You'll probably cringe when you see the dirtiness of the kitchen and the work areas, but if you're able to ignore that, then you'll love this place.   When ever I'm here, I usually share the Palace Station pan roast and a dozen oysters.

QrHANVNxgRF_ENFYItBwhA.text: If you love seafood such as clam chowder gumbo jambalaya oysters this is the place to go. I have yet to find a place that has a better New England clam chowder then the Oyster Bar at Palace station or even a better gumbo. The lines are always long if you go here on a weekend or late night or around lunch time even but if you find a time to get there before the lines get long I definitely would tell you to go there and get some good food. I love the fact that they cook the food in front of you using steam which is pretty neat and you get that smell and it just mad and makes you go crazy. Since I'm a local I usually like to go there to order my food to go and bring it home and it still tastes just as amazing in a to go container as it does sitting there eating meat at the bar the casino itself out you know not too big of a fan of but that bar is thebomb.com. They can be a little pricey if you aren't ready to spend about $15 per person but to me it's worth it every dollar and most times you have enough to take home so if you go there make sure you're either very hungry or have somewhere to store the rest of your food because you're going to be mad if you can't eat it all and don't have anywhere to put the leftovers cuz you're going to want on the next day it's just that good.

LvZmdsMwqQRJ-xCD3mOmMQ.text: Palace pan roast + Half a dozen oysters after 1am.   So worth the wait !

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cN8QEt9khnXPGzCi-6f7Hg.text: OMG!!! No matter what people! You have to come here every time you visit Las Vegas! Yes, it might be located at Palace Station, but do not judge where the location is, the food here is mouth watering! Open 24/7! Can't go wrong with that! Seating is very LIMITED! The line and wait time can be pretty crazy, but if you are really a huge fan of tasting new places this is the place to go!   What I ordered was the lobster pan roast with pasta and lobster gumbo with rice. The lobster was FRESH and thick! The pan roast was like tasting tomato soup with a kick in it! WARNING: There is cream in the pan roast for the lactose people...(I asked for a 7 for spice level, but the cook told me to go a little under so I went with 6. I am thankful that I did that! Lol! Drank like 4 glasses of water and tried to eat bread to balance it out!) The gumbo was light and delightful! You can't go wrong with these two!  The service here is wonderful! Five stars! If they had ten stars, I would definitely give it to them! The cook that we had was named Bob and the server was named Delora. The cook was very sweet and friendly! He liked to joke around and made everyone feel welcomed and at home! The server was great! I asked for more bread and she gave me like five of them instead of one and we were just joking around the whole time! I felt like we known these people for a long time, even though, it was my first time trying it!  I WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO EVERYONE! =)  P.S. The sister chain, which is located in Chino Hills, The Broiler, is by far an imitation of this place! Since The Oyster Bar is the original location!   Also, I think this place is only 21 years and older, because they cook with alcohol. =/

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread

vOa0akNcb-NV_gwwmslbCg.text: First off be prepared to wait at least an hour. BUT...it's worth it in the end. Great seafood and large portions. The staff is friendly and joke with the patrons while preparing the food in front of you. Go for the extra spice is you can handle it. Will definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Etouffee

Q1KGud699LnXjY5BJ3C9LA.text: The wait for this place is ABSOLUTELY worth it. Just as the name states, this is a bar. It only seats about 15 people at a time, and since all of the food is cooked to order, the wait can be lenghty. The shortest I have ever waited has been 30 minutes, and that was on a Monday morning at 430 am!   The house gumbo is the best here! It has okra and they make it as spicy as you can handle it. Seriously spicy! Prices are a bit in the high side, but the food is absolutely worth it and it is VEGAS!   Only reason why it's not 5 stars is because of the wait. I know it's not something that can always be controlled, but maybe it's time for an expansion?

JcvH5E3CpnqNkDeOoLRIBQ.text: OMG! Delicious!!! We waited about an hour but trust me it was worth it!! I had the combo pan roast and it was to die for!! Can't wait to come back soon!!

7wNC7eQNbzspj2Yp8NvhhQ.text: Look, I really don't want to let everyone know about this awesome oyster bar but I guess I will.  Oysters on the half shell are awesome, the seafood bisque or the gumbo is to die for!  This is one of those hidden gems in Vegas.  older Casino that is very bussy and your way will probably be about 30 to 40 minutes but it's worth it

Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast shrimp and lobster

bgcsm4wy1-JQPp86PNPBCg.text: 5 stars. 5 stars. 5 stars. Robert is the man. Best chef in town. Serves an never ending line of customers with a smile. Combo pan roast was the best in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo pan roast

P1OQCj9Fl-zTJFLYN_iHsA.text: It was Sunday, 330am, and no line.  How lucky were we?!  Where else but Vegas where you can get this kind of meal at this time of the day!  My boyfriend and I shared the 1/2 dozen oysters, new england clam chowder, and the bouillabase.  I know they are famous for their pan roast - but my boyfriend and I favor more of a broth like broth vs creamy.  OMG everything was so amazing!  I was afraid of how large the oysters were because normally the ones I've had tasted off, but these were SO SWEET.  The new england clam chowder was of course very creamy and comforting.  And lastly, the Bouillabase was mouthwatering delicious!  The broth was so flavorful and there were so many chunks of seafood - fish, crab, scallop, and shrimp!  If I ever get the chance to come back again at an off time - I will DEFINITELY be back!

m_boQSz24YgXdnQJ9FqfBQ.text: Oyster bar is in a small area. It seats about 20 people, which explains the long wait. We went with a group of 5 people and the wait was about 40-50 minutes. We ended up splitting to 2 and 3 seats so that we could get seated quicker. There is one chef who does all the cooking and one server as well.   honestly, the food was amazing!! Pan roast, shrimp/crab cocktail, and their secret menu dish. I got the spicy level 7 for the secret menu. It came with seafood and was more of a soup base. Pan roast is more creamy. They both come with rice. They are sooooooo good!!! For the shrimp crab cocktail, they mixed it together in a shredded way. You must try that as well :)  Oh yeah, their bloody mary is delicious too! Try the drink and you can see how they make it..:)

_jZAMHD_0FlQInqb9ZHSUw.text: Worth every minute of wait! We were visiting Vegas and after seeing the yelp reviews, we knew we couldn't pass up not trying this place out. As some have pointed, the place only sits 15 people. It gets tricky when there are large parties in front of you (4+ or more) because when seats open up, they don't seat smaller parties and they will essentially wait until more seats open up to seat the people in front. Hence, this adds up to the wait. We waited for 1 hr and 30 minutes during early lunch time.  Now for the food!! We started with the 1/2 dozen oysters and man were they fresh! The sizes of the oysters were bigger than I anticipated but we are definitely complaining.   I got the combo pan roast and my SO got the bouill-roast. If you like richer sauce get the pan roast and for a lighter version get the bouill-roast. The combo pan roast was creamy and they do not shy away from the seafood portion. Every scoop was accompanied by shrimp, crab and lobster. No searching for what you ordered in the bowl!   If you have the time and patience to wait in line, I say go for it. Skip the line by going during early hours or late at night, they are open 24 hours! Highly recommend and we will definitely be coming back again!

7CGyw-7picjCqtMDEYmyeA.text: Excellent service and fresh seafood. You have to brave a line that can last up to 2.5 hours during dinner time, but if you are able to be patient, then you will be rewarded with some of the most delicious pan roast filled with delicious lobster and crab. The creamy, tomato base with just the right amount of spice (you choose your own level) pairs perfectly with the fresh seafood that is cooked perfectly and is tender and absorbs all the flavors of the delicious base.  Like others have suggested, try the lobster pan roast and add crab (or double lobster) to get the most bang for your buck (unless you really love shrimp, then just get the combo), get the rice on the side, and tons of rolls to soak up the deliciousness!  Enjoy! And charge that phone before you go!

ji1e5dm_Q2nRekHRtTjeLA.text: Yes, long wait on a saturday at 5 pm in line til 630pm when we were seated. By then, we already knew the menu and ordered right away and we got our 2 main course meals at 7 pm. Finished eating at 730 pm. The Bouillabaisse, spicy level 4 was mild and was not as creamy like the pan roast, but still excellent. The Seafood Jambalaya, spicy level 4 was mild  and different than New Orleans style. It had more of a tomato sauce base to it which I do not like. I like it more with a Gumbo base to it. It was still a great time watching the cook EZE entertain us with his cooking of the foods from the bar chairs. Once in a great while I would wait for this kind of food as I can go to the other station casinos and get similar foods with no wait. After 10 pm I saw the line die down to 2 people in line.

1m_CImjwOIawUkWw0Tjd6g.text: Be prepared to wait, regardless of the time! I came at an off time was lucky to only wait 45 minutes. The service here is great! They run things very smoothly, the reason it's such a long wait is because of the lack of seating. You are eating at a bar/kitchen counter.  I order the combo pan roast and it was delicious! 10/10 would recommend. The price is around $25, and it is worth every penny! The seafood is fresh, plump, and flavorful. The amount of seafood you get is more than enough. I almost didn't finish my Pan roast, but I didn't want to reheat seafood so I decided to reward my taste buds and finish the plate!  Only downside is the wait.

0n8XYeTaS5Dd3I1vC00vLw.text: What do you do when you visit an establishment 3 times in one weekend???!!!! You scream scream scream!!   You have won me over completely!! I'm not easily impressed at all ( whoopsies) and have had way more than my share of seafood. Afterall, I pride myself on having that 80% seafood diet life long. The other 20 is noodles, coffee and meat. Totally a fair share!  The wait~ it gets longer and longer as the it get deeper into the weekend. My first visit was the shortest wait and my second was the longest! My third was the middle since we came in between meals!! Didn't tell my girlfriends how long the wait was but they forgave me once they had the food :D  Yes it's that good.   What's good?? Everything! I love their oysters! Clams on half shells is definitely my favorite. They are so big here!!   Gumbo: this is what I came for! All 3 times: it was magic!!! Oh so magic!!   And that Lava sauce.   I got my food with 10 stars spice. Wasn't hot enough so I chatted up with the friendly chef Roberto! He decided to make me this 10 habaneros and serranos concoction! All simmered down!! And oh so tasty!!!   Needless to say: my every visits after involved 10 stars spice for everything plus a few lava bowls!! Like literally had lava bowl challenge. So much so that they now gave me a nickname: Miss Lava!! Got little hearts with Lava written all over on my orderssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssss! How cute is that!  People get very antsy and demanding from the wait. Even quite rude. My rule is never to be rude to people that serve me or do things for me. I mean come on!!! They are trying way too hard to give you an epic meal!! Why you gotta be so rude?!!   As I waited patiently for my dozen clams, oysters, oysters shooters in patron ( this was a ok), I chatted up with another chef! Or talk for a good 2 hours rather! Ramonnnnn: you are the best, sir!! Thanks for making my meals the best food experiences!! Your gumbo is pretty epic too!  I got to try the house clam chowder! Moscow mules! And pastaaaaaaaaaa! I really wanted that pasta while I struggle to finish 1/3 of my amazing gumbo. The chef totally hooked me up :) Never had such an entertaining or fun meal! Did I mention how crazy busy they were. Kindness totally gets me. And everyone here was beyond kind. Thanks Crystina and Ramon! And Ezeeeeeeeeee! Oh yea Christopher too! You guys rock my socks! And our tastebuds! We were focused more on getting food from here than partying throughout our vegas trip! Just magic!!! Mucha gracias, Ramon!

h6YBJLfNqf3lfwrpylBYzA.text: I finally made it to the famous, or should I say infamous, Oyster Bar at the Palace Station.   I should state ahead of time that I pretty much avoided this place for two main reasons. One, I hate standing in line for food, and two, I was almost certain that there was no way this place could live up to all the hype.   When I arrived the line wasn't too bad and we were seated in about 30 minutes. I suppose 6pm on a Tuesday evening turned out to be a decent time to arrive. I ordered the combo pan roast, bouillabaisse and 6 oysters. I also ordered a beer for good measure.   The food arrived and I was in heaven. Each bite was perfection and I was already plotting a return visit two bites in.

ugeTriHv8OluWxN55eYwAw.text: Oyster bar is actually really good. The wait was quite long, about 34-45 minutes for me.   Both the oysters and the clams are huge and fresh.  I tried the fresh clams for the first time and although they are definitely not my favorite taste wise, I could at least appreciate the freshness.   The pan roast was delicious I loved the overall flavor. It is heavy on the butter which is kind of cheating in my opinion since everything tastes better with butter.

Z8m-O_7q8GCMUU4bj9lqxA.text: Still the original, still phenomenal and still the absolute BEST at making the most amazing pan roast ever.  Bob, the man who has 17 years under his belt at whipping up dishes so mouth-watering that you curse every place that tries to copy it and fails miserably. I'm calling you out Oyster Bar SKC in SD! With your measly 3 shrimp and thin broth. No bueno dude. Speaking of which, our waitress told us they were affiliated with Oyster Bar in Las Vegas' Palace Station which is not True. Both Bob and Margie confirmed that they work for the hotel and that there is absolutely no affiliation whatsoever. And it shows!! I told Bob he needs to train the "chefs" at SKC and he laughed loudly. I love the sassy banter as always and you can tell lots of heart goes into his cooking.   We also found out that one of their former counterparts opened up shop in Los Angeles, under the name Ritter's. We are planning to visit only so we can wear our "Oyster Bar Palace Station" shirts and check out his restaurant, lol. There is no bad blood between them though so we promised to send our love from Bob and Margie to Mr. Ritter himself if we have the great pleasure of meeting him. :)  What we had: our usual Pan Roast Combo which is chock-full of lobster, crab and shrimp, served in a brandy cream tomato sauce that is so delicious that we took the leftovers, froze them, and re-heated them with cocktail shrimp when we got home. LOL! Not the same but we just couldn't bear to waste it.   The best time, for us at least, to go without waiting an hour plus is between 6AM and 11AM. Yes, that early...hope you like a big breakfast in your belly. Go anytime aside from these hours and can guarantee you will be waiting forever; it is that good. Parking is plentiful during that time too. Bonus!  Get your pan roast fix today! 5 glorious stars x 10.

MOluzF8BTH5Zt4W67pbGig.text: Can't wait to go back here next week. There are copy cat places that try to duplicate but they always fall way short. So glad they are open 24/7 now! I'm planning to order my usual, the lobster pan roast with sausage and rice, spice level 8. Yummy yum!

9iFV6UmVa7ZzTY42H81Nxg.text: I've heard so much about oyster bar, and many friends have said it has the best pan roast ever. I'm here to report that everything you may have heard is True (including the infamous wait times unfortunately, haha).  The palace pan roast is the best pan roast/gumbo/seafood stew/soup I've ever had. It beats any bouillabaisse, chowder, or other seafood soup I've ever had. Hands down, far and away, there is no comparison.  The flavor permeates your mouth. You will want to continue eating far past the point of being full. I had to walk away from my seat (literally) - that was the only way to stop eating it. It was warm, hearty, complex, delicate, and just simply perfection in a bowl. The Oyster Bar has captured lightning in a bottle. All of the ingredients come together to form a masterpiece. The brandy, cream, and tomato must go through a magical steam cooking process, because the result is accomplished, mesmerizing, and impeccable. It truly is something you must try for yourself in order to experience the phenomenon. . As I was chowing down, I must've eaten five or six shrimp. As I enjoyed each tender, succulent, meaty piece, I stopped to count how many were left. There were six more! I lost track, but there had to have been at least eleven decent sized shrimp in the pan roast. There was an abundance of sausage as well, which was very delicious and hearty. The crab was a little harder to find, but there was plenty of chicken.  I ordered spice level 3 (on a level of 1-10, with 10 being the most spicy). I'm the type of person that usually doesn't eat spicy food. I will eat spicy Korean soft tofu soup, for example, because it's much better that way. If you're a seasoned spice eater, you will want to get 6 or 7 at least, if not higher. The level 3 provided a slight kick for me, and wasn't too spicy.  Oyster Bar is inside the Palace Station Casino in Las Vegas.  Line information:  I asked the employees several questions regarding the line and here's what I can report to you. You are allowed to have one person stand in line for a larger group, as long as the entire party is present when you're called. I waited in line so my four friends could gamble (one joined me halfway through the wait). When we got close to the front, I called the rest of them to come over. We went at about 11:30pm on a Wednesday night, and got seated around 12:30am. I would say the slower times are morning and afternoon. This place is open 24 hours a day, and it seems to be busier at night time.  I will make it a point to come here every time I go to Vegas. I want to try the gumbo, etouffee, and bouillabaisse. The problem is that the pan roast was so great that I might not want to deviate from it. I would travel to Vegas solely for the intent and purpose of eating here! I'll be back as soon as I can. In the meantime, I'll have to search southern California for comparable pan roasts.

0C0VZ_HF0EDxi7OQNcVe3Q.text: This updated review has been sitting in my drafts forever. If it wasn't for fellow Yelper Dave F., suggesting I give this place a try I would've never known that this place existed. So thank you Dave!   I've been back a few times since my first review. Each time I was not disappointed. The wait is long but oh well, sometimes in life wonderful things are worth waiting for.  On my recent trip to Vegas we arrived about 930pm, there were about 7 people in line. After surveying the situation, my very analytical friend stated he estimated the wait to be about 45 mins and wasn't too happy nor were my other 2 friends. I told them it was worth it and convinced them to give it a try. Little did we know the people ahead of us actually had more people in their party and our wait was about an hour.  The lone cook was the same one who made our meal previously but after we ordered he went off duty and Holloman took over. He is so passionate about his food btw. My friend was the only one who didn't order the combo and ordered the Shrimp & Lobster Fra Di Ablo instead. Holloman explained to him what he was going to put in it: basil, tomatoes and then told him he was going to make him a sexy dish. Ok, I was a little jealous.  My other friend who ordered what I ordered, set the spice level at 5 since I ordered it at 4. Telling me he was "the man" so I changed my order to a 6 telling him I was "the man", lol. Instead of going to a 7, he copied me. Neither of us were adventurous enough to try a 7.   My friend's pasta was very good so good that we decided to half and share our meal but I got so caught up in mine that I ate almost everything before either of us remembered to share. Oh well next time.   I can't say enough about Holloman. He genuinely looked like he has a passion for cooking. His enthusiasm was pleasant to watch. When he would put the shrimp or lobster in our pan roast he looked at it carefully and chucked the ones he didn't like. Despite being very busy he still was personable and engaging with the people on the counter. When he made something other than pan roast he'd go to the person who ordered it and tell them what he was going to put in it. Thought that was a nice touch.  He was making a shrimp scampi according to how a customer wanted it as indicated on the ticket. When he was done he shook his head and said he wasn't happy with it but the waiter told him that's how the customer wanted it. That customer happened to be sitting next to me. She's from Hawaii btw and now lives in Vegas, yea I talk to anyone lol. Anywho, Holloman asked her if he could make some changes and told her what he was going to do. She said sure and when he placed her dish in front of her, I wished she was my friend so I could share. She thoroughly enjoyed it and told him so.   So yes, even if you read reviews on here talking about long waits or that it's not that great, oh well, maybe they had an off day. I can tell you that each and every time I've been there, the food has always been very good and I've never left disappointed. The portions are quite generous so I suggest sharing. I couldn't finish all of mine but did eat all the seafood.   Oh and my friends who complained about the wait and threatened me that it better be worth it, did admit that it was worth it. So there you have it. Don't be put off by wait times. I suggest going when Holloman is there. He works from about 1030pm.

Additionally, they didn't have the courtesy to tell me they were out of their small clams for their linguine and clam dish. 7UxoMuZYrEJ1SRSRe6u9Dg.text: Oyster Bar at Palace Station is the OG of the pan roast. I've always had to wait, but I have to say the wait is worth it! Like the name says, it's a bar so seating is limited, maybe around 20 seats. The service was great here the last time I came.  You get to watch the chef cook with the steam kettles which is cool. We ordered oysters and the pan roast with level 8 spicy. The oysters always taste fresh and the house pan roast is the best from all the other places I've tried it. It's a tomato base soup like dish with shrimp, lobster, and crab with a scoop of rice. I think level 8 spiciness is perfect.   Always a trip to go here but definitely worth it!

wVKSpkqDEF76yfHghojn7Q.text: Okay let me start by saying I eat pan roast about 5 times a month where I live in orange county. It is one of my fav foods especially how special they make my order.   Found out this place is the original and the place i go is a knock off from this place with the old cook from oyster bar as well.  The wait was about 15min and I guess I got very lucky got seated ordered a few appetizers and they were just okay nothing special at all.  Then the great pan roast arrivced with my noodles and rice on the side the way I like it spice level 10 asked for some cheese and... omg literally best thing I've ever had. I don't know how I'm going to go back to my regular spot.   I will always come to this location anytime I visit Vegas. Oyster bar you are truly a masterpiece in taste. This was the highlight of my Vegas trip of course me losing a few hundred does make it help.

M-FNkiKEOmsKmM5rLzx8Zw.text: Pan roasts and seafood chowder are worth the wait. We waited in line for 2 hours. Suggestion for Palace Station... Would have been nice to sign up and receive a text when ready to be seated. That could have been 2 hours spent on a slot machine.

wzWWTRSJTafOIHtj39ngpg.text: After the second visit, it's not really worth the 45 minutes wait in line.  I guess we were spoiled because we were so lucky the last time.  I could be on the poker table taking money from drunken tourists or crazy Europeans trying to bluff me every hand instead.  Highly recommend that you come off hours, and if you see more than 6 people in front of you, expect to wait for 30 minutes plus.
