3M6pTcOg8H5Pjqz35rqULw.text: Love the seafood pan roast, big portion best to share,  fresh oyster is a hit or miss....special request for the lava sauce

ViYw2fhsWORFBFGYrMH_8w.text: From the service to the food, everything was outstanding! It's really cool watching the chef prepare your order in front of you. For our appetizer, we got half a dozen of both the raw oysters and clams. It was amazing and really cool watching them shuck in front of you. I ordered the combo pan roast and my bf had the lobster roast. We don't like our food spicy so we got the level 3 spice. It was perfect if not one of the best meals I've ever had. If I was on death row and I had to choose what my last meal was, this would be it. Definitely worth the wait.

WFMAwu0sajX-PVK7so2CHA.text: Heard about this through a friend and it was really delicious. This was my first time here and it definitely won't be the last.   Nestled in Palace Station casino, this place is really a great find, and a hidden gem but blown up through yelp. Seafood here is divine. Must be 21+ to eat here  Pan roast: this was really flavorful and the rice added just the right balance. Beware, the portions are bigger than you think they are. This was so good, but I could only eat about 3/4 before feeling completely stuffed. Also a good tip, we ordered an 8 spicy and boy was this spicy. Eyes were watering. I normally have a good tolerance but I would probably only recommend going with an 6 next time.  Clam chowder: really delicious and flavorful. Perfect balance of creamy and sweet with the clams. Plentiful amount of clams.  Alaskan chowder: literally a bigger bowl of clam chowder with the same base, but more clams. This was good, but I'll probably get a clam chowder next time.    Linguini diavola: while this was also amazing, it was outshined by the other dishes. I would say it's not at flavorful as the other dishes, so probably won't get this next time.  Overall, this was such a great experience. I will be dragging my friends and family members here for more! Regarding wait times, we arrived at around 9am, and got lucky, there was no wait on this Saturday, Christmas Eve. I feel like as long as you get there between 4am-9am, you don't have to wait too long. There are only 18 seats, so best to get there early.  Hope you enjoy! My family sure did

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast , with crab and lobster. The real MVP!!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan clam chowder, loveee
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguini, aka seafood heaven

wUySudErb9xKPdtcsJg21Q.text: Amazing!!! All I can say is it was worth the wait - I didn't know what the hype was all about. I stood in line anyway since a friend recommended it to me. Sheesh the flavor was all there, 11pm at night standing in line for a crab pan roast. Call me crazy but I did and stood there waiting alone. The service is even good considering the amount of people they probably run into throughout the day with exhaustion from waiting in line for so long. I enjoyed every bit of my pan roast including the oysters fresh and juicy.

Nb90UI0FgKz97YofY3WldQ.text: came here after the nightclub and waited for about 1.5 hours! the bar seats about 18 people, one chef, and one helper. there's late night specials from 1AM to 9AM!  the food was worth the long ass wait! we had the pan roast and it was the best I've ever had. we ordered half a dozen oysters for $10 and it was the freshest, most plump oysters ever!   would definitely wait for hours again!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. diablo
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. palace pan roast
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. half dozen oysters

VuA2gScSTJ0oZjd1n1MlQQ.text: At a first look, you're thinking why is there always people waiting in line, why only a small bar, is it even good? My mother invited us out a small group of 3 to eat at this place. At first, I didn't really want to wait the line or wasn't that interested; so she call me when it was closer to the front of the line. We waited a total of 45mins, which wasn't that bad considering we were talking. The waitress explained to us the the top 3 soups. I ended choosing the combo pan that had shrimp, crab, and lobster with a tomato creamy based soup! I must say it was DELICIOUS and definitely worth the wait. The chef EZE was super nice and friendly, personally tipped him myself. I would definitely make a stop the oyster bar every time I visit Las Vegas.

ifTp4IlFbEGe_oIq1W0AnA.text: So this is the original Pan Roast .... delicious!  Better than the one I had in Orange County.  Much better balance flavor wise, the other one in OC was too heavy w/the tomato taste.  I also got to try the Cioppino which is their seafood stew w/chunks of crab, shrimp, clams etc  This place was great, tip, go here at 3am in the morning .. at least you won't have to wait long.

l1LdF-9NmEwaS3GQ3YMFxg.text: After reading all of the glowing reviews, we finally made our way to the Oyster Bar and we were not disappointed!  For starters, we ordered a dozen fresh oysters on the half-shell.  Although the oysters were large, they did not have the briny taste that I look for.  I asked the waitress where they procure their oysters and she said Louisiana.  Maybe I'm used to oysters from the East coast.  For entrees, we ordered the Combo Pan Roast and the Lobster Gumbo.  The pan roast was creamy and filled with shrimp, crab and lobster and the Level 5 spiciness was just right.  The lobster gumbo was full of chunks of tender lobster and it was delicious!  And, contrary to popular belief, there IS an optimal time to come to the Oyster Bar.  We came at 9:30 am on a Tuesday and did not have to wait at all.  Then, at 10 am, we were the only two customers there.  I've attached a photo that shows all of the empty seats just waiting for customers!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empty seats at 10 am on a Tuesday.

wGEqovBvP9HTnRKVuq83XA.text: I don't care that I've been standing in line for over an hour now.... I ate here last night and it's AMAZING!!!!! The only thing comparable is my wife's cooking!!! Order their Combo Pan Roast... it's the BEST!!!! The staff is nice too. Be prepared to wait for a couple hours... the bar top only holds about 16 people at a time! I'm going to eat here every night I'm in Vegas lol

-x_SvPafH3WJjXfGO3_C8w.text: After a long night of drinking, we were determined to indulge at the Oyster Bar before calling it a night - or morning I should say. Upon arrival at 4am, the bar was jam packed and we were behind another party of 2. The wait was about 10 minutes and once sat, the server Steve gave us a minute to look over the menu and being first timers I was definitely trying to order anything and everything.   We ordered: 1. Combo Pan Roast 2. 2 dozen oysters  3. A seafood jambalaya 4. Alaskan Clam Chowder  Everything here gets cooked in front of you and the chef is a master at his craft! He was SO good at making the dishes and shucking oysters simultaneously - I was super amazed. Our food came out piping hot and although everything was delicious, the Alaskan clam chowder was the winner for me. The crab meat came in chunks and it was probably the best thing that I've ever eaten. Wasn't too salty - just PERFECT! The oysters were super plumpy and I thought ordering 2 dozen for a party of 3 was way too much. It was crazy to see people still waiting in like at 5am to eat at this place but it's SO worth it. Just a heads up though, the plates are huge and are definitely shareable. I felt as though I ate a whole cow and barely made a dent in the seafood jambalaya.   All in all, the Alaskan chowder is a must but be prepared to wait to eat here. I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our leftover jambalaya - the portions are huge!

zoBHYv-mhOg4K3eYXj5xpQ.text: This review is NOT about the restaurant experience, but what surrounds it.   IF YOU ARE A NON SMOKER WHO HATES CIG SMOKE, YOU WILL NOT EVEN MAKE IT TO THE PLACE....much less wait hours to belly up to a very small bar in the middle of an old smoky casino!  It was what my husband wanted for his birthday dinner but we were hit in the face with a cloud of smoke as soon as we walked in dressed up.  Ughhh...   Please open another on the strip or at least someplace with smoke eaters that work.

VULlWXRYqFbMoWq1-mRECg.text: Love this place!  Oysters are fresh, but ask the cook to give you the small ones, since they tend to have large oysters that can be overwhelming.    Order the pan roast combo if you are first timer, its the best for trying shrimp, lobster and crab pieces in a curry like sauce with asian white rice.  Clam chowder was great and try the beer (ask of for the take home size glass)  Arrive very early since the wait can easily be for a few hours.  We even were early at 5pm but it still was a hour wait but still well worth it.  Also kids are not allowed so that could be a good or bad thing.

KVmHZLawftgQPppMSrRENQ.text: Wasted 1 hour waiting in line, they need to expand this operation, 1 cook and 1 waitress is unacceptable.  If there was another Casino serving the same thing, I would be outa here.    TOO SLOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!    Other Casino Heads reading this, please don't copy their business model.....  Also, if you order TO GO, you have to wait in line,,,, how stupid is that......

lnHAmiywv2s4y3li42Hk8g.text: No Vegas trip is complete without a stop at this tiny oyster bar.  Come at 2am. The wait is much more bearable.  Order the House Pan Roast. A 10 spice level is cake for those who eat spicy. Served with chicken, sausage, shrimp, and delicious crab in a creamy spicy broth. Enjoy with rice or pasta, so freakin amaze-balls!  Oysters on the half are on midnight happy hour special at that time. Fresh and hits the spot!  One star off because the wait is no bueno. But they always have great friendly service and the food is consistently great.

yg2Z0Xy9ZwPLTBDbWImnpA.text: Looking for a GREAT clam-chowder in Las Vegas ?? Thou shall look no more... Try the Alaskan Crab chowder - it's cooked right in front of you, it's big , it's hot, and takes a long time for you to stay in line to get it. The chefs are professional cooks, and ALL ingredients are fresh 100%......  Update  7-16-15  Lines are now EXTRA long. Takes hours to get to it, but since we like it we will stay in line ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Line .....
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamy Alaskan Chowder with lobster mmmm
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot clam chowder Alaskan Style

iYiL2JPLY5xZBrXR--wpfQ.text: OMFG this place is AMAZING.  We had to wait in a line for like 60 minutes, but totally was worth the wait.  We had two items: Palace Pan Roast with lobster, Shrimp, Crab, Chicken, and Andouille Sausage - spicy level 5. Alaskan Chowder, New England Style with Shrimp, Crab and Lobster. And Oysters with Horseradish and Cocktail Sauce. So delicious!  The local vibe here is also great. The guy next to me was Vegas native and spent his entire life of 40 years here, enjoyed the convo over the great food. Fabulous experience indeed!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters with Horseradish and Cocktail Sauce
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Alaskan Chowder, New England Style with Shrimp, Crab and Lobster.
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace Pan Roast with lobster, Shrimp, Crab, Chicken, and Andouille Sausage - spicy level 5

Nc2RoJfeeO9x0TeSARbNBA.text: The oysters were okay. Not bad. But is it weird to complain about their shape? I'm no oyster connoisseur but I've had my fair share. These had some odd shapes. Shapes that were a bit hard to eat. Like mutated large ones that were hard to take down. This sounds weird...  Am I being an oyster snob? Maybe. Probably. And they were kinda small. Were they good? Yeah... but they weren't the best I've had either.   If you're looking for the bar, it's gonna be in the middle of the casino to the left as you walk in from the Strip. Nice thing is you can take a break from "all that money you're winning" to down some oysters. That I'm okay with!

ByRrHG-p0yRj_d6CVdOgeA.text: worth the wait, freaking delicious!  gumbo without spicy is the best + big fat sweet oysters. just wait, dont complain, and enjoy!!!!!!

vrfjhgr0Bk9FRAtGKxEzqw.text: -Panroast -Get the Panroast -Oysters are cheap and beefy -Did I mention panroast? -Go at odd hours to beat the line, it's a 16ish seat bar and you wait in line for spots to open up. God forbid you go in a party of 4 waiting for 4 spots to open up. You'll have to split up you poor souls -My girlfriend says the panroast is basically creamy tomato based sauce with spices. She is no longer my girlfriend. -Wait staff and cooks are sassy. Makes for good times.  Come here if you want: a big helping of Vegas' take on cajun goodness, industrial seafood, or THE PANROAST!  Do not come here if: you hate lines, need super fresh ocean water dripping seafood, can't take some sassy sass

ATodyF0I8NOBs7_8LiGpAg.text: I LOVE this place and I actually LOVE Palace Station. It's a fun, off the beaten path for out of towners kind of place. We waiting in line, only to get up to the bar and not get the pan roast. Ha! we had the cold seafood tower, which was the special and it was so delicious and refreshing. It's definitely worth waiting in line for the experience. Or, better yet, go in the middle of the night. Can't wait to try the pan roast.

2631zeRR335akJIQcynzjw.text: Came to this place three times for this, epic fail... Supposedly you need to wait in line during off business hours! However my motto is to never stand in line to spend your own money lol. Luckily I have a very inquisitive friend who went up to someone and asked to pay for their meal to order take out! We got Pan roast! Still waited 45 min to receive order, lol but in the end it was awesome milky buttery spicy seafood goodness! Would I stand in line again probably not, but I would bribe someone! Just be ready for a long wait...

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan roast

Y-65hVUsK2RgDMUA1jfT1w.text: Going to Vegas anytime soon? Well they say you should check out the buffets but I say come check out the Oyster Bar at the Palace Station Hotel.  The food here will not disappoint.  If you're looking for something to eat and you have no idea what to eat, come and check out the pan roast they have to offer.  The food is cooked in a kettle and they do it right in front of you. I shared a shrimp pan roast and it was more than enough for 2 people to finish.  The pan roast was quite tasty and fulfilled my appetite.  The food was quite balanced but the wait to get seated was long.  But if you don't want to wait in line and check this place out, it is open 24 hours a day. So if you're done dancing and gambling and you need a break and eat something in the early morning, check this place out for good ole comfort food!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KpL38xkZCa59u6zjanZA9A.text: I went here for lunch and there was hardly a line. My friend and I ordered the oyster on the shell, a bowl of the New England clam chowder and the combo pan roast with a level three on spiciness First off they will ask if you are sharing plates and you gotta be honest. They ask so they can charge you an extra five dollars but the plates were so big it actually saves you money to share rather than order another entree  The clam chowder was amazing and not salty. The oyster fresh and didn't have that fishy aftertaste. The pan roast was amazing and just the right amount of spice Definitely coming back when I am in town!!!

vna6HZNsLIfpdjhtBPoLmw.text: This place was one of my first book marks I ever made when I first started yelpin, 5 years later and now as a gold elite, I finally have the chance to give this place a shot! Open 24 hours is a little bar that seats about 14 people inside of the Palace station Hotel.  I came here at 1AM after the life is beautiful music festival and we waited a good hour before we were seated. I pretty much just sat on the ground and chilled on my phone until our time was up. When we got there, we ordered a dozen oysters (happy hour, $20 for a dozen huge oysters) and the house pan roast with an extra scoop of rice. Unfortunately, it took 30 minutes for the food to be made because there is literally 2 people working. It was cool watching it but at 2AM, I was just starting to fall asleep.  The food was so amazing! The oysters were huge and really fresh. The chef shucks the oysters right in front of you and you can still taste the ocean in each slurp. Yum! Some of the best oysters I've had for the price. As for the pan roast, it was perfect for 2 people. A perfect blend of tomato and spices. It was seafood heaven in a bowl!  Overall, was the one hour and half worth it? Heck yes! This place is freaking amazing and some of the best food in Vegas and that is saying somehting!

TV05f5TT1O3TUXOzb2ZG7g.text: Very good food but zero star for management. A great business with rubbish management will eventually make this goes to dirt. One tip hungry server took 15 seats non stop and long line average 30 people in line day and night. When people get up and dirty seat remain dirty for another 15 mins to seat another guest there. You just cannot handle it, schedule more staff please, labor isn't that expensive for an extra busser at minimum pay. No service whatsoever, you order drink, got your drink, got your bill, sign and that's it. Palace station will always on the bottom of the food chain, because they can't even manage an oyster bar, how can they manage a hotel, and a casino. Note to owner, sell it if someone willing to buy, before you in debt from this property.

kw36_Kakbtr_cWGC1xARqQ.text: The best thing I've had in my life!! Husband and I both agree! Long wait but worth it!

jx1oeOZyzBcaj0cwm0DcSg.text: O-M-G!!! If I could add another five stars, I would. This place is amazing! I was in Vegas for three days and ended up eating here all three days.  I looked up sea food on yelp, and people seemed to like it, so I decided to give it a try. The wait is longggg after 5pm, but let me tell you- it's worth it. There is a good reason people wait patiently in line for up to hour and a half. I loved the oysters, the clam-chowder, and the pot roast!  Next time I'm in Vegas I will definitely be back. This might be the reason I come back.  Btw, Sanda and Sergio are great! Thanks guys, I will be back.

sJUxdSkJ4cCrW-bkT7SvKg.text: My son wanted oysters at 11am, no wait time,  but since he is not 21and was unable to sit at the bar, the waiter took us to the restaurant next door and served us dozen oysters which were fresh and amazing. The Station Place is another story.

L0sa9zZVMn582M1iWLRCKA.text: I find this place really difficult to review because my food was easily a 4 but my experience was more like a 2. So we'll take the average and go with a 3, and we'll let future visits decide my final rating!  There WILL be a future visit, because the food was really good. I had a combo roast with shrimp, crab and lobster, basically all floating in a delicious, creamy sauce reminiscent of lobster bisque. It was very yummy and filling and EXACTLY what I'd hoped for.  It's a tiny place, with just a few seats around a bar where all of the food is cooked fresh, right in front of you. Let me tell you, it was oh so satisfying when, after an hours' wait, we finally got to take our seats around those bubbling cauldrons of delicious seafoody goodness!  It's slow, but the cook and the servers work really hard to get the food to you as fast as possible, and our waitress was awesomely attentive, considering how busy she was. However... the guy cooking messed up and skipped us twice, serving people who sat down over 20 and 30 minutes later than us. We were there for nearly 3 hours in all and It kinda sucked.  The staff were apologetic when we all figured out what was going on, but the whole thing just felt so disorganized. Waiting in line, when seats open up, they don't really let smaller parties fill in the gaps. There was an end seat on either side of the bar remaining empty almost all night- that bugged the crap out of me, as with a little maneuvering around, another couple could have sat down and let the line move faster, too.  BUT these inconveniences are not a deal-breaker; I'll be back for more delicious shrimp someday soon. And hey, I won $10 at a slot machine while waiting in line, so you can use the time to score a discount on dinner if you are so inclined, haha.

wv1WoPYbhsIs2rFdum-BkQ.text: And this was the beginning of the Creole steamer cuisine addiction for me and my love. After numerous recommendations from Vegas-holics, we decided to try this place. I was very skeptical... "How could a seafood soup-y thingie be so wonderful? What's with all the hype?" Little did I know, this one trip would change our culinary lives... First of all, I wanted to leave after standing a half hour in line in the middle of Palace Station to sit around a counter... After we were sat, and got our sourdough rolls, my tune changed entirely! We ordered the House Pan Roast, a bowl of Clam Chowder, and some Oyster Shooters. All three were absolutely amazing! The flavor of the seafood soup-y thingie AKA House Pan Roast was unlike any other dish I had tasted before. The clam chowder was thick, full of flavor, and delicious! The oysters were so fresh... Half of the fun here is watch the servers cook with the steamers and prepare the oyster shooters. They were really friendly and fun, and made the night so enjoyable! Although we love the Vegas Oyster Bar, we now frequent The Boiler (yelp.com/biz/the-boiler-...) in our area, which is run by Chef Ritter who started the Vegas location. No more waiting awkwardly in a casino, smelling cigarette smoke - this location is much bigger, with the same amazing of food, if not more (although I do miss those amazing sourdough rolls from the Vegas location... and oyster shooters)!

0I9DEtZW6FvX7CP-IeAodQ.text: Heartily Delicious! Had a dozen of oysters and a dozen of clams as we patiently waited for our house pan roast and house gumbo.  The meal was very satisfying.

3Al8mQo0jVSkatfG_MsCPQ.text: The Original Oyster Bar in Las Vegas is Now Open 24 hrs!!!! A Little Pricey, but Everything is Made Fresh in Front of You!!! Love Their Louisiana Food, Especially the Gumbo!!! A Word to the Wise... When they ask you how spicy you want it, go 5 or less or they will put crushed red pepper in your dish which we do not use in Cajun Food in Louisiana!!!! They Have Graveyard Specials on Beer, Bloody Mary's & Raw Oysters!!!! Bar-Like Atmosphere without all tha Drama!!! Haha!!! Tha Cooks are not only Great, but Funny as Well!!! Free Entertainment Every Night!!!! Of Course Palace Station Was an Original Las Vegas Local's Casino that I Remember!!!

QgmuBINC2-zrNnjJFEdXDw.text: My sister and brother in law took my boyfriend and I here recently while on a trip to Vegas.  At first I was not so excited about this place by the location and looks of it.  it's first come first serve and we waited about 40 minutes since they only have about 10 seats.  IT WAS WORTH THE WAIT!!!  This place is amazing!!  The cooks are friendly and fun and the food and flavors are just superb!!!!  We had oysters that were fresh and delicious and we had the seafood pan roast (my boyfriend and I shared and was more than enough but I could eat a whole one) and it was to die for.  We loved this place so much that we went back the second night again.  This time we had the gumbo and it was just as delicious.  I wish there was one of these here in LA...now I will be craving it, which means I will just have to go back to Vegas for it.  INCREDIBLE!!!!!!

sC7HL-yg1hSx5qzzGVUqqA.text: The only reason I don't give 5 stars is the waiting time.  Be ready to stand in line for around an hour and then wait like 1/2 an hour more to get your food.  Everything I've tried here is amazing.  If you love Seafood, hearty meal, food with personality, this is the right place.  One of my favorite restaurants in town.  Excellent food, great customer service, good price....just the wait! - worth it at the end!

75loZZs5mP9yE0uQFizBqg.text: You have to try it !! This place is f-ing amazing. I had the shrimp etouffee and it blew me away. I have been trying to find a place like this in California for months and nothing comes close. There are good ones but this place is bananas. Prepare yourself there maybe a long line. But once you get there it is great. Everything is so tasty that you will wish you lived in Vegas to go back and try the whole menu. This place or location is not fancy but the food speaks for itself. Can't wait to go back and try more.    NOTE : You can only be served at the Bar, not the restaurant inside !!!!

VO0W0dUaPqZWILW6kcE-ag.text: I have been coming here for ten years and it has never been a disappointment. The bread is the best in Vegas. I can eat the Crab Cocktail everyday. Great clam chowder and fantastic seafood stew. Very reasonably priced. Highly recommend this place.

Oa6ZzaYrHEUV4mkRQEtufA.text: I LOVE this place.  Hollaman is an amazing cook with real passion and the seafood is always fresh. I've never had a bad experience here and they have great midnight specials.  *it's usually better to try on a weeknight early. The weekends can be up to a 2 hour wait

7Q4TVVb98PVoyfQEviWoJQ.text: We ate here on July 18, 2015 at 10:00pm. We waited over an 1 1/2 to be seated which is expected.  Once we were next to be seated the waitress took their sweet time clearing seats. The line is super long & it is only 18 seats available.  The two waitress's were joking around and playing.  It took them 20 min to clear 2 seats for my husband and I and everyone else who were seated before us only waited a few min.  We feel as though this was intentional because I over heard a male employee telling her we were complaining about the wait for our table to be cleaned.  After seating she asked if we were ready before giving us a menu & when we answered no I heard Christina say to the male employee well what are they complaining about because they aren't even ready.  I feel it was unprofessional and not appropriate at all.  I will never eat here again because I rather go somewhere my money is appreciated & deserved.

8e2ajnPDxVR5ydphgxHGxw.text: I'm a big fan of this place.  It's open 24 hours!  The staff is great and good for them they are always busy.  The wait can be quite long though, but its worth it.  It seems like I always wait an average of 20-30 minutes.  The waitress, Sandra is such a sweetheart too.    My favorite there is the combo roast, my second favorite is the mussels.  However you really can't go wrong- everything on the menu is absolutely tasty.    *Tip: If you are like me and enjoy spicy foods, however like to taste your food instead of have your tongue burn a "good burn" (lol) it's probably best to order the spiciness 5/6 (scale is typical 1-10; 10 being spiciest of course).  Enjoy!

cyGneJAn7iK6PQords0FQw.text: the oyster bar is the greatest thing in the world.   no matter how long the wait, you wait for that alaskan clam chowder.

s5qifboxkDs-sjbIA4oY9Q.text: Be prepared for a wait but this is one of the few places I'm willing to waste an hour or more of my life for great food.  If you're not sure what to get, start with the pan roast.  My favorite is the clam linguine with white sauce.  Be sure to order a dozen oysters.  The clams are a bit tough and chewy.

uqsWlJ2RXIRZAzFrnsQM9g.text: By far my favorite place to eat in Las Vegas! When you first get to the Oyster Bar, you'll probably have to suffer through an hour long wait, which will be spent trying to see how much food the lucky bastards already seated have left in their bowl and then giving them the stare of death. But trust that your patience will be rewarded!  A must order for me is the Pan Roast with lobster. Its a rich creamy tomato based dish, full of flavor from the chefs secret mix of seasonings and served as spicy as you can handle. One dish should satisfy a grown mans hunger or you can split it with a significant other with a lesser appetite. I would order a clam chowder for good measure.  I'm actually drafting this review while in line to pass the time and avoid giving out too many dirty looks. Do yourself a favor and stop by Palace Station on your next Vegas trip! Keep your party to 4 or less since seating is very limited.

RIRtGnzIiTl_3gAw9A8Zxg.text: I went on a Wednesday night around 11:30 pm. It was about a 30min wait and well worth it. I had the combo pan roast and added andouille sausage ($4.99) . It was delicious! When it comes to quality and quantity this oyster bar meets both . I had plenty of shrimp, lobster, and sausage. I was certainly surprised and impressed at the amount of lobster and big chunks that was in my dish all for a total amount of $28.98. Money well spent. This plays has the

PhK5weFf-XVuqZYkK5Vc1Q.text: Amazing, delicious,....omg, best seafood I've ever had! Combo pan roast is the best! Chef Eze is amazing!

XM6FbTrzGVqFXs6oWtt00A.text: A gem you wouldn't expect to find in an old, dingy casino slightly off strip.  The Oyster Bar has a True following--and if you attempt to eat here, be prepared for a bit of wait.  The counter doesn't serve more than 20 (at most!) at a time--but I assure you--it's worth the wait.    Regardless of what you order--their dishes are cooked to order directly in front of you--and you will have to do everything in your power to not drool all over your setting.  Each dish is loaded with tons of seafood.  Combine with with the butter, spices, and base they let cook in front of you--and your poor stomach will sit in gluttonous anticipation for the next 20 minutes.    I've been here twice--each time ordering the Etouffee. It's amazing!  It's a wonderful creole/french soup that's wonderfully spiced and loaded with seafood.  It's the less creamy version of the Oyster Bar's Pan Roast.  I happen to enjoy the soup more because it's less rich than the Pan Roast--but I've had the Pan Roast--and it's certainly nothing to scoff at.  It's amazing!  Just a tad too rich for me.  You can spice up your dishes the way you like.  I like my spice and generally order a 7.  Spicy, but still enjoyable.  I've tasted an 8...and while delicious...definitely left me gulping down a lot more water than I wanted.    I've seen orders of the shrimp scampi and the linguine a la vongole--and i can tell you that even in my bloated state, wanted to order them. They look crazy good.    Oh--and before I forget...these bowls are huge!  Please share.  If you can finish it on your own--you're a champ.

JwWrLA91QLKlXypNKOtYqA.text: The oysters are fresh and the combo pan roast was fantastic. We walked right up and sat down at the bar. We came on the right night.

vO7IX0GyAu01F3HyYdTbNg.text: Pan Roast! Oh Wow! I had never heard of a pan roast until I had it here and it was delicious.   I came to eat here at around 3 am on a saturday night and the line was so long. We waited about an hour but that is pretty much standard for this place, sometimes even longer. There aren't that many seats but the wait is totally worth it.   I ordered a spicy shrimp pasta and my friend got the Pan Roast and a bloody mary. The pasta was pretty yummy but that pan roast just outshines everything on the menu. This has since become a favorite place of mine.

A32yeNuJ-z8lQG2toyloXg.text: I can't add much to all these other 5 star reviews provide, except to day they ate all correct.  I've had both chowders, the pan roast, and bouillabaisse & all are superb.

HK979Z59Z32PkMb_ivf_AQ.text: Oyster Bar is amazing.  Its located inside Palace Station, which is an older casino/hotel just a little off the strip.  We came here on a Wednesday afternoon so there was no wait, but it quickly filled up.  Its worth the wait, if you do come during a rush.  We started with 1/2 dozen oysters.  They're fresh and delicious.  We then shared a Pan Roast.  Its big enough to share between 2 people.  We also asked for an extra side of rice, which they gave to us kindly.  The Pan Roast is amazing.  You have a choice between shrimp, crab meat, or a combination.    Everything is cooked in front of you.  You can choose your spice level, too.  I really like the staff.  Its a small bar, so there's one waitress/server and one cook.  Check it out on your next visit to Vegas!  I know I'll be there every Vegas trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan Roast - amazing!
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster Bar staff - super friendly &amp; excellent service
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster Bar - this is how they cook your meal

_jxS76Pv81V2mQdispupQA.text: The food is worth the wait, we would literally wait an hour plus just to get a seat. I take every visitor from out of town here and this is a spot where we go to drink and eat their rocker fellers which they don't have anymore. The chefs and waitresses are always funny even when they are super slammed. It's entertaining and walking through the casino - even the dealers smile and say hi. I just love this place, always great energy and  always win when I gamble there haha. Enjoy all the good eats!

QLbXU5d4FD517-rbangluQ.text: Combo pan roast.  You need nothing more you need nothing less.  Definitely worth every penny.

7GCtiYhD6PQ6liJW6kxP1w.text: Waited in line last night for 2 hours, well worth the wait, I had the pan roast level 5, boyfriend had palace pan roast, new england clam chowder, and my son had palace pan roast level 7.....we were supper stuffed....always great food and service.....

Xdj-AKNdEeoEVoTAs3682A.text: OMG Ricardo is the man!!!!!!!!!!!  After Sergio left, and numerous failed return visits hoping for a new chef, Ricardo is truly a breath of fresh air.  Yes, their food is legendary, but who's cooking has a lot to do with how much you'll enjoy your experience -- not to mention how long you'll be waiting in that line!  Ricardo is simply amazing.  He can clear out a line 20 people deep in an hour.  And once you've seated and ordered, you won't wait longer than 15 minutes.  Not like you'll be rushing to get out of there when he's cooking.  He is a joy to be around.  Hilarious, entertaining, efficient, and great at what he does.  It's also a pleasure to see someone who is enthusiastic, truly enjoys their job and cares that you have an equally enjoyable experience.  The other cooks (Bob and others not worth remembering) are terrible.  The same line of 20 people, expect to wait about 2-3 hours if you're lucky.  The food sucks, inconsistent (see my prior reviews), and watching them work is like pulling teeth.  Actually, I think pulling teeth would be better.

lDBtw1MvJN1V6PSoTbTgHQ.text: Worth the wait! Food is just sooooo good! Everything on the menu is bomb. I love the jambalaya and my all time fav is the pan roast!!

bK8WgWq6nhOdJEoHz8e04Q.text: Here for edc. Waited in line for about an hour. The people who got seated after us got their appetizers and entree before we did. WTF. Super annoyed. Didn't even try the food yet but I must say. Service is bullshit.

IffZH_anh8NQXrw4plu3jw.text: Best gumbo I've ever had!! I tried oysters here for the first time; the texture wasn't for me but the rest of my group seemed to love it. The wait time can be a bit long due to the limited seating, but it's definitely worth the wait. :)

dIpwXXS3HHHEirFGr-Jrpg.text: Older lady refused to serve us and limited our order to 2 even though we have clearly 4 people.

LbLpCb9CIoVvHrfXtYK1aQ.text: My group decided to go to Vegas a day early so we chose to stay at Palace Station because my sister wanted to introduce us to the Oyster Bar.  We arrived in Vegas around 3am and were starving by then because we skipped dinner so we would be able to eat.  We were able to snag up 4 seats right away.  At 3am, there were still people eating!  Because of the limited seating (about 15 seats) I hear the wait can be 30 min to an hour long during lunch time and peak hours.  I'm glad they are open 24 hours and we were able to avoid the crowd.  Food: Clam Chowder - Full of fresh seafood, great comfort food House Pan Roast - Amazing flavors I have never tried before.  Must have  Tip:  Portions are huge.  Share the meal but don't ask them to split it for you (there's an extra charge for splitting fee)

S5j1xRmtkOLbuPjbwfQAgA.text: This is a hidden gem in Las Vegas. The bar is right in the middle of the casino at Palace Station. I was expecting an actual restaurant, not a bar with 20 chairs. There was a long line to wait to sit down so I figured it was definitely worth the wait. Luckily, I was with other people so I played Roulette while we waited to be seated. Once seated, they take your orders very calmly. They do not rush you considering there is a line of people waiting to eat. The food is cooked in steam pots instead of a gas burner.    I ordered the oyster bloody mary shooters and the Pan roast at level 7 hot..  This place is soo good I would recommend it to anyone...

mzvdDeGihNucv9BRwRFecA.text: Oyster Bar.  Wow, this one is a hard one to rate.  Let me tell you why.   Food here is pretty damn good, I must say.  I had their Combo Gumbo, and what's there not to like?  Fresh ingredients, savory, and it's cooked to order right in front of you (BTW, ours was prepared by JJ--awesome Chef).  I'd pass on the Jambalaya.  Way too tomato-based for my liking.  If you're not looking for something very acidic this is definitely not for you.  The oysters were decent.   Here's where it gets tricky:   You're going to end up waiting for a long time.  And it's not a typical wait.  No, it's the annoying, "I get to see everyone eat, and there are open seats in between them, and why the F*CK can't I sit there???" kind of wait.  Fine, you're patient, you say?  Well I hope you like the waitress, Delores.  Nice girl and all, but I cannot stand her dry, dry humor.  Seriously, people wait an average of over an hour, the last thing you want to do is joke and say you won't give them their food, "sorry, we sold out," or saying, "oh, he wants the check, I'm just going to ignore them".  (Yes, she seriously says that stuff out loud and ignores you).  Stand-Up Comedian, you are not, Delores.  And some of your audience with hungry stomachs do not appreciate it.   I absolutely loves the Chefs and their food, but Delores' service alone makes me not want to come back.

AbR_4ih1qC4poFxb64pQQQ.text: This place is great.  The seafood is fresh and the atmosphere is worth the visit.

vAmUy0jhSUgVoXH6HgZFqg.text: I've eaten here many a times on my visits to Vegas. They're known for their Pan Roast, but personally, I prefer their Alaskan Chowder.  That's their best dish.  The chef is very generous with the seafood and the serving is big enough that there will be leftovers for tomorrow, unless you're a big eater like me, of course.  I also like their 3 for $10 bloody Mary oyster shooters.    The place consists of about a dozen seats and they don't take reservations or names, so you'll have to wait in line, yes, a line like the kind we have to stand in at the awful DMV. But it's worth the wait.  Now, if you want to avoid long lines, I recommend going during their off hours which is around 11 am during the weekends.  I usually go during that time and there hasn't been much of a line.    To sum up, be sure to stop by The Palace Station and make your way to the Oyster Bar for some deeelicious chowder!  Buen provecho!

h8ioHRFgPXxUlMycN5TVTA.text: This place is small, a bar in a casino, but so worth the wait! It's opened 24 hours & seafood is so unbelievably fresh. If you want something light, go for the oysters...they are huge! If you want something hearty, you must try the pan roast combo...simply mouthwatering! Seafood heaven at a reasonable price!

photos.caption: Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Oyster Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half dozen oysters, Bloody Mary oyster shooters (3 for $10), and pan roast combo (w/ crab, lobster, shrimp)

7d-YJ69KEh4yhXh0WakY7w.text: My first impression was, "Last meal before departing Vegas. We need something hearty that'll hit the spot."  There are several Oyster Bars located in various hotels throughout Las Vegas, but the boyfriend and I decided to try our luck at the Harrah's location after playing on his lucky machine for the weekend. We sat down as a friendly chef approached us with the menu and brought us some flat breads. I couldn't stop munching on the sesame ones.  We ordered the Bourbon Street Jambalaya with Shrimp. It was enough to split and very hearty. If you want one last filling meal before you leave Vegas, you need to try the jambalaya. The shrimp was seasoned well and the entire dish was the definition of rich and flavorful. The sauce was zesty and had andouille and tasso ham which made it even more flavorful.  We met a nice old lady who sat next to us and she offered to share her fried oysters. They were crispy and juicy and I'd definitely get that when I go back. It seemed like she was a regular there, but when we were about to pay for our bill the chef told us that she took the tab. So sweet of her, and it made our trip that much more memorable. The best way to end my 21st birthday memorable!  The lasting impression? "One of the most delicious ways to serve up seafood...spiced and fried!"

wX-0X6lHqZjA4rH1EzzY_g.text: My brother's friend insisted that we come to eat here, which I was excited about. Although, I wasn't too happy about the 1 1/2 hour wait time and that my 13 year old nephew couldn't eat with us. I was expecting a big restaurant. When we finally got seated, the oysters were ABOVE AND BEYOND DELICIOUS as well as the rest of our food. The bowl was too big to finish so we had to bring it back to the hotel. Our server, Christopher and our cook, Robert were AWESOME!!!! They also made us laugh while we ate, which was great entertainment. Thanks guys!!! We will be back again.

C4sMiM05BdTIr-6eyguRZQ.text: This place is always busy and always has a line. The food is fresh and made in front of you. Im suprised this place has not expanded to add more seating like the sunset location.
